item.title: Open Source Software Engineer - Pivotal at Pivotal (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Pivotal is looking for a few great engineers to join our GemFire/Apache Geode engineering team. Apache Geode (currently in incubation) is a distributed, in-memory, and transactional datastore designed to provide very high throughput with predictable latency. GemFire is built on Apache Geode and is deployed throughout the world by demanding customers serving mission-critical applications in financial, telecommunications, retail, and transportation industries.


You


You have a passion for large distributed systems to manage data on a massive scale. You love building highly concurrent systems that are also fault tolerant and extremely reliable. You follow current trends in topics such as stream processing and in-memory computing. You’d really like to believe there’s a way to defy the CAP theorem and get consistency, availability, and partition tolerance all in the same system (even if no one else has managed to do that yet). Above all, you love shipping software as a member of a collaborative team.


Us


At Pivotal, our mission is to enable customers to build a new class of applications, leveraging big and fast data, and do all of this with the power of cloud-independence. Pivotal’s offering includes the Big Data Suite, the most complete approach to enterprise data lakes and advanced analytics; Pivotal Cloud Foundry, the industry leading Platform as a Service product; and world leading ultra-agile application development through Pivotal Labs. Open source is an important part of our strategy. Many of our products are already open source; those that are not will be soon. 


The Big Data Suite includes HAWQ, our SQL on Hadoop solution; Greenplum Database (GPDB), our massively parallel data warehouse; GemFire, our distributed in-memory key-value store; and MADlib, our machine learning solution.


The GemFire/Apache Geode engineering team at Pivotal tackles challenges that come with massively parallel distributed systems operating at extreme scale to achieve incredibly low latency transactions. We delve into areas like stream processing, query optimization, parallel function execution, scalable distributed data structures, fault-tolerance paradigms, and peer-to-peer messaging. Here at Pivotal you'll be working on hard problems with a collaborative team, accelerating your growth as an engineer.


Where


GemFire engineering is located in our light-filled spacious office in Beaverton, OR.To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks/drinks are of course available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded engineers who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers.

Forensisch software engineer


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving


Ben jij een ervaren software-engineer met interesse in low-level datastructuren?


Je werkt bij de groep Software Engineering van het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) aan onze data-analyseapplicaties en libraries.


Als forensisch software-engineer duik je diep in de low-level datastructuren en algoritmiek. Je gaat werken aan complexe applicaties die binnen en buiten het NFI worden gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering. Ook draag je bij aan de verbetering van het vakgebied software-engineering en denk je mee over een efficiënte inrichting van het ontwikkelproces. Hierbij zorg je dat de forensische kennis zo goed mogelijk wordt geborgd.

item.title: Software Support Lead - Get shit done have fun doing it! at BitTitan (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
We are currently seeking a Software Support Lead for our award winning Kirkland, WA office!


Responsibilities:



  • Provide email-only support

  • Answer questions regarding product capabilities

  • Recommend migration steps depending on the situation

  • Identify and resolve authentication issues

  • Analyze and diagnose migration performance issues

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Ticketing Data at Flixster (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
For this position, we’re looking for a senior software engineer that will drive the expansion of our movie ticketing platform. Your work will power online ticket sales for major theater chains. Every ticket sale will happen via the components that you’ll build and operate. It takes a steady approach, a high standard for quality and reliability, and the willingness and ability to own a high volume, high visibility workflow.


Responsibilities



  • You own the data integration with our movie theater partners (APIs, data storage, throughput, performance, etc). Movie-goers around the country are depending on you!

  • You build it, you run it. You design and implement the operational capabilities to keep things humming (trending, alerting, admin tools for the content management team, etc.)

  • You champion high quality and best engineering practices

item.title: Director of Engineering at Sonian, Inc. (Dedham, MA)
item.description:
Sonian is looking to hire an experienced cloud technologist as the Director of Engineering. In this role you will lead a team of experienced developers to deliver exciting new capabilities to our customers. Sonian is introducing 2 new products and launching a new brand this year. If you are an innovative and driven software professional passionate about shipping cloud technology – join our team!


What You’ll Do



  • Lead a team of developers in delivering new products and technology

  • Run at scale, deploying core technologies and new products for thousands of customers

  • Drive continuous and rapid delivery of software

  • Liaise with senior management and internal teams to ensure requirements are realized and delivered in a timely fashion

  • Make important architecture and technology stack decisions

  • Hire, retain, and mentor top talent

  • Problem solve and drive operational improvements to optimize software delivery

item.title: Full-stack Engineer at MentAd (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
• Be an integral member of our top notch engineering team 

  • Continually build MentAd's platform to make the future of marketing both easier and much much smarter 

  • Advance the product and company by writing excellent code

  • Come up with additional features, ways to improve and optimize the platform, and ways to make other people's work easier and smarter 

  • Constantly continue learning and improving your skills

item.title: Software Engineer in Test (Python) at DataRobot (Boston, MA) (allows remote)
item.description: This position’s responsibilities include designing and implementing automated tests and championing techniques to increase code testability and other ways to increase product quality.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist at Clutch Holdings LLC (Ambler, PA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Clutch is looking for an exceptional data scientist to synthesize and leverage our rich dataset of consumer and multi-channel transaction data to help our brands achieve their aggressive marketing goals.


This is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team of creative and passionate individuals determined to change and innovate how data is used to influence customer outcomes. We are focused on the company’s product strategy, and work on high-impact projects, utilizing a mix of open source and in-house tools and techniques to deliver insights.


We’re a lean, flat, and experimental team combining science and engineering to identify and inject high-value insights into our client brands' marketing strategies. The team works in quick iterations, using the techniques and algorithms best suited for solving the challenging problems of industries like high-fashion retail, QSR, Automotive, Pharmaceutical, and many other verticals.


What you’ll be doing:


You will advocate, evangelize, and build data-fueled products that help our brands maximize their customer strategies. You’ll dig in and become an expert on our datasets. You will provide insight into leading analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become part of our core deliverables.


You will work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas. You will lead applied analytics initiatives that are leveraged across the breadth of our solutions. You will research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes.


As our data scientist, you will provide expertise on mathematical concepts for the broader technical and business team(s), and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire breadth of our organization.

item.title: Technical Data Analyst at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX is data driven. We are passionate about using platform data to examine the quality of our product and to continually improve on it. We are seeking a Technical Data Analyst to join our engineering team. This role will be a focused on both internal processes and external output. 


We are seeking a Technical Data Analyst who is passionate about working with and analyzing big data to drive insights across complex questions in order to drive enhanced customer experience with data-driven decisions. Technical aptitude and programming skills are of high value in this role. The role requires testing and interactively improving on system output with the primary goal of providing a world class customer experience.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Appian Corporation (Reston, VA)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer working on the Appian platform, your mission will be to ensure Appian is always fast, scalable and up to whatever tasks our customers configure it to do. You will be solving problems of scale and flexibility that most engineers never see, building a product capable of serving our customers in ways you never imagined. Your scope extends from the high-performance data layer to the cross-platform user interface. This position requires the mental agility to jump from the deep code-level view of Appian, to the designer’s view, to the end user’s view, and back again. Learn how to write software that runs software, and enhance Appian's cross-platform functional programming language.

You will design and develop systems that let our customers build amazing enterprise apps for mobile and the web without writing a line of code. The design decisions and judgement calls you make will impact millions of Appian users worldwide. You will be looked upon as an expert and advocate to fellow engineers on making design and reliability trade-offs in running large-scale services and engineering complex systems that fail gracefully and transparently to users.

As a successful candidate for this role you will have strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, fluency in coding and systems design, solid communication skills and a desire to tackle the complex problems of software design and delivery which are uniquely Appian’s.

item.title: Senior Software Developer C++ - Equity Products at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The Bloomberg Equity product is used by over 100,000 financial professionals worldwide to make decisions and increase alpha. Our next-generation Equity analytics unlock market data and give our clients unprecedented advantages. Today's Equity product spans a wide gamut of functionality, from fundamentals to estimates, company analysis to peer valuation, idea generation to portfolio construction, and exchange-level tools to macro regional/industrial analysis.

Equity R&D in our New York office is seeking driven and dedicated developers to join our fast-paced team. We develop rich user interfaces as well as powerful backend servers in C++. Developers contribute to all phases of software engineering ranging from requirements through release. Candidates should exhibit strategic thinking, an aggressive drive, and an aptitude for engineering quality software.

item.title: Hadoop System Engineer at Cognitive Medical Systems (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Position Summary:


We are looking for a Hadoop System Engineer to design, implement and maintain a large data solution for our health care project needs using Amazon’s cloud.


Responsibilities:



  • Work with project team to design Hadoop database to support large health care data sets

  • Develop capacity planning and analysis for Hadoop infrastructures/clusters

  • Implement solution using Amazon’s cloud environment

  • Provide metrics and data modelling support

  • Support an atmosphere of cross-functional teamwork within the organizations agile project lifecycle

  • Participates in product roadmap discussions and identify key areas for improvements in the product, and incorporate these goals into ongoing & future development initiatives

  • Recommends solutions by defining physical structure and functional capabilities, database security, data back-up, and recovery specifications

item.title: Python Developer at Trimble Navigation (Westminster, CO)
item.description:
About Trimble Data


Trimble Data develops scalable, cloud-based geospatial systems. Our goal is to make geospatial processing simpler and faster for consumers by interfacing many varied geospatial applications into a cohesive whole.


Our primary system is the Trimble Data Marketplace, a storefront for geospatial data. The Marketplace enables customers to find, customize, and download data quickly and easily.



Python Developer


We are seeking a self-motivated and enthusiastic software engineer to join the Trimble Data Cloud Processing Development team. Python developers are responsible for developing and maintaining highly scalable geospatial processing systems that will handle petabytes of data.


As a member of the Trimble Data Cloud Processing Development team you will use a wide variety of technologies, such as Python, FME, and AWS to solve problems and have the opportunity to explore and use emerging technologies.


We are looking for intelligent, innovative, and driven developers. We will consider applicants with limited experience in the technologies listed below, however you must have strong Python skills.


Key Responsibilities




  • Software engineering with a healthy dose of performance engineering and DevOps.




  • Use Linux and Windows system administration knowledge to set up and maintain working cloud distributed systems.




  • Use BASH, BATCH, Python, C, C++ and other specialty languages to develop and maintain backend systems for Trimble Data.




  • Use AWS to manage and grow our cloud strategy.




  • Work within your team and with other teams to ensure the overall vision of the project is being fulfilled.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Windsor Circle, Inc (Durham, NC)
item.description: Responsible for architecting and building the interconnect to many SaaS data stores in the e-commerce marketplace using SOAP and REST based APIs.  Responsible for the primary design and frameworks used for transforming, storing, and extracting data from our centralized database hub for marketing purposes.  Assist in designing and building the Company’s own RESTful API supporting JSON and XML data exchange for integration with our front end UI. Code reviews, guidance to other engineers.

item.title: Software Engineer, Performance Data Analytics at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description: The primary goal of the Software Engineer of Performance Data Analytics will be to use SolarCity’s extensive data resources to develop methods and techniques to better integrate widespread solar deployments with the grid.  SolarCity believes that better predictability and optimization of distributed energy systems will provide significant value to grid operators and energy market participants.  The Data Engineer will be responsible for engineering tools for that prediction and optimization.

item.title: Technology Lead - Big Data at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
Peoplefluent RMS 5
























The online travel market never stands still. The opportunity is huge and the competition is fierce. At Hotels.com, we're in the thick of it. We live and breathe travel. Our technology team is insanely passionate about using the best technology and processes to give our customers the best possible experience when finding hotels for their business or leisure travel needs. We want them to feel the same passion for travel that we do.


The Hotels.com team at Expedia Inc. is looking for an experienced, highly motivated, self-directed Software Technology Lead to join the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) team.  In this role you will be responsible for the delivery of solutions on top of the big data platforms such as Hadoop & Teradata and will play a key role in a technology pivot, driving design & architecture solutions. This entails working with the delivery team and business partners to flesh out requirements, complete solution design, development and ultimate delivery to the end consumers.  We are also constantly looking for ways to improve our development methodologies and welcome fresh ideas and approaches.


Why build your career at Hotels.com?



  • You'll get to work with some spectacular people both from the technology team and wider business

  • You will get to work with massive data sets numbering literally billions of items and approaching a petabyte in total size and Opportunities to learn and apply the latest big data technologies on a fast growing Hadoop & Teradata platform.

  • We work hard to create a supportive, collaborative, and fulfilling place where you can progress your career

  • We have many of the best bits of a start-up but with the resources of the world's biggest travel company

  • We love open source and actively participate in the open source community

  • We do hackathons where you can branch out of your usual area to contribute something different and innovative

  • We host and speak at meet ups

  • We want everyone on our team to have the tools and resources to succeed in their career

  • We get to do all of this in a lovely, comfortable office in a nice, central part of London


Role Purpose


Provides technical leadership to our Data Engineering team, including design, development, troubleshooting, and debugging big data solutions & programs for enhancements and new products. 





Job Description


General Responsibilities:



  • Implementing high quality big data solutions, including design, development, and deployment of new business functionality for various facets of Hadoop / Java and wider Enterprise Data Warehouse ecosystem.

  • Drive evolution of standards & design patterns with industry best practices and new technology to enhance productivity, quality, and system performance.

  • Drive program & system architecture discussions to identify a suitable quality solution to the business requirement.

  • Work closely with product management to flesh out business requirements and articulate project technical requirements and deliver on requirements in an agile manner.

  • Deploy and maintain applications in production environments.

  • Communicate and document solutions and design decisions.

  • Ensure that features deployed have technical integrity and stability.

  • Improve platform by leveraging existing technology, building new technology, and/or helping evaluate 3rd party solutions.

item.title: Tech Lead - Data Science Team (m/f) at TrustYou GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Software engineers at TrustYou constantly have to solve complex and interesting problems. We build products that ultimately benefit the travelers and we use user interface design, big data, machine learning, natural language processing and distributed computing to do so. TrustYou is looking for those rare, talented engineers who are not only excellent at their craft, but can also excite and lead fellow developers, and drive a product from its initial conception to successful completion.


Tech Leads at TrustYou hold full responsibility for an entire product or suite of features. They are expected to gather and prioritize requirements, think up features that are useful and fun to use, and drive the implementation from specification to QA, leading a team of smart engineers.


Our data scientists are expected to have knowledge in machine learning and natural language processing, and, most importantly, know how to apply it to create precise and useful products.


Theoretical knowledge isn’t everything - good skills in visualization and communication are key for data scientists. The most interesting analysis may be useless if you can’t convince anyone of your results!


TrustYou lives and breathes the world wide web, and you should share our passion for it. It shouldn’t be a problem for you to slap together a REST server to feed data into a visualization written in JavaScript.


Responsibilities



  • Ship products that clients love to use!

  • Take responsibility for planning, execution and success of complex projects

  • Manage and develop a team of data and software engineers.

  • Roll up your sleeves and code to get your project done.


Minimum qualifications



  • Degree in Computer Science, or closely related degree.

  • 6 years+ experience.

  • Knowledge of machine learning and/or natural language processing.

  • Experience with distributed systems.

  • Working knowledge of relational databases.

  • Excellent algorithms knowledge.

  • Fluent in English.


Preferred qualifications



  • Experience with Apache Hadoop, and other technologies from Hadoop ecosystem.

  • Experience implementing RESTful servers. We accept your background in a variety of languages (JavaScript, Python, Ruby, Java, etc.), but we only use JavaScript (NodeJS) or Python (Twisted, Tornado) and we will help you learn these technologies.

  • Good HTML, CSS & JavaScript knowledge.

  • NoSQL, especially distributed databases.

  • 2 years+ experience in hands-on technical leadership and people management.


Who we are


TrustYou is the standard for reputation in the travel industry. We search and analyze literally ALL hotel reviews on the web, and generate a summary for each hotel on the planet - what did guests like and dislike about this hotel? Try it out yourself by searching any hotel on our website or our mobile app!


Our data is powering over 100 hotel search engines around the globe. Additionally, we have built a social media monitoring and survey product for hoteliers, TrustYou Reputation Management. What are my guests complaining about? TrustYou is used by more than 10,000 hotels to answer that question and improve their services.


TrustYou is a startup with engineering excellence in its DNA. Our employees are experts in big data, machine learning, natural language processing, interactive JavaScript applications and web technologies. Our tech stack is varied and modern.


We work hard, but value a great working environment just as much. We offer perks and a comfortable office for creative work. Xbox breaks and office beers on Friday nights are part of our culture. Our visits to Oktoberfest and our developer getaway trips are legendary.


Job details


Team or role: Software Engineering


Job type: Full-time


Job location(s): Munich, Germany


How to get this job


We’d love to see a note about yourself along with your resume.


Write us at jobs@trustyou.com

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Core Systems at Spatially (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Description




  • Work as an integral member of highly motivated Product, Engineering, & Data Scientist teams to build plus manage scalable & Performance oriented software systems for an innovative Spatial Analytics Startup

  • Take part in establishing and driving best practices and engineering practices geared towards shipping products

  • Design, implement, and maintain software systems & infrastructure

  • Refactor and improve maintainability of the codebase.

  • Solve complex scalability, platform, and integration problems.

  • Learn new paradigms, languages, and libraries as you work.

  • Building, Managing, & Maintaining multiple application environments, including production

  • Manage systems and work in all aspects of the agile driven software development lifecycle



Qualifications




  • Strong communication & Collaboration Skills

  • Experience in Fast Paced Startup environments

  • Positive Attitude with proven delivery experience

  • Strong knowledge of OOP concepts, Functional & Reactive programming paradigms, design patterns, data structures & Algorithms

  • Strong passion to learn new technologies & methodologies

  • BS or MS computer science/related subject matter preferred or equivalent experience

  • 4+ years experience building & Shipping web scale and distributed systems

  • Strong knowledge in designing across all layers of complex software systems

  • 2+ Years experience with GO

  • 6+ Years building production systems and writing efficient code in multiple programing languages such as Java, Scala, GO, Python, Javascript, C++/C

  • 4+ Years experience with SOA/WOA based systems with strong understanding of HTTP, REST and like protocols, micro-services and system integration

  • Experience working in Polyglot code bases & systems

  • Knowledge of Scaling & distribution patterns

  • Experience & knowledge of concepts such-as Concurrency and Parallel paradigms, Asynchronous patterns, Threading & Processes, distributed components & systems

  • Experience with RDBMS systems such-as Sql Server, Oracle, Mysql, Postgres

  • Experience with SQL development experiences with solid T-SQL/SQL skills and proven SQL optimization skills.

  • Experience with NoSql/Big Data Technologies and Querying methods including Hadoop/Mapreduce systems, Apache Stack, Column Family, Key-Value, Document, and Graph data systems

  • Good Data Modeling experience

  • Experience with Search systems such-as Solr/Elasticsearch a plus

  • Experience building on top of or integrating with Analytics & machine-learning platforms is a plus

  • Experience with Node, and Front-end technologies such-as React/Angular, HTML & CSS is a plus

  • Experience in Financial, Retail, Spatial Analytics, Mapping, Location Based Services & GIS and like data and/or industries a Strong Plus



This position will be filled in either Seattle, WA or Miami, FL

item.title: Data Analyst at BAE Systems (Portsmouth, UK)
item.description:
Would you like to be a part of the nation’s most complex and high profile marine projects? We currently have vacancies for Data Analysts to work across a number of Fleet Services projects, where you will be given unique exposure to programmes such as the Type 45 destroyers, the Type 26 frigates, and the Queen Elizabeth aircraft carriers.


As a Data Analyst, you will be analysing business data and investigating interesting insights and correlations. You will work to help us improve our diagnostic and prognostics capability for a range of equipment and services, through analysing this data.


This role will offer excellent opportunities to grow and develop a new team within the business, with the potential for excellent career progression. You will also have the chance to become one of the only defence industry experts, through developing specialist knowledge within a specific area of the business.


Your main responsibilities as a Data Analyst will involve: 


Analysing data from within the business, from vibration sensitivity on ships to HR and finance information


Using data to create predictions and turn this into business insight


Research and implement new tools and new data


Writing reports and presenting information


Creating insights, theoretical testing and metrics

item.title: Data Engineer - Python, PostgreSQL and Redis at Lyst (London, UK)
item.description:
Lyst are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Analytics team and work on the huge data projects that are integral to Lyst’s day to day operations.


Data lies at the heart of everything we do here at Lyst, from understanding our users better to making mission critical decisions, we always look at the data first.


We record nearly 100 million rows of data a day just from user interactions. To support this volume, we have built our own analytics architecture, predominantly in Python and leveraging the convenience of many cloud services like AWS Redshift, Lambda, CloudFront, S3, etc.


With this sea of data growing everyday, you will work hand in hand with our analysts and data product managers to ensure that our analytics data pipeline is clean, efficient and scalable as the business and traffic increases. From building bespoke BI tools, ensuring analytics engineering requests are responded to in a quick manner to architecting new solutions. You will work on things such as:



  • Improving our analytics data architecture, ensuring scalability and resiliency

  • Streamline the anomaly detection process across all our data, and build tools and processes around it to speed up the required actions to solve any anomaly

  • Improving our internal BI tool, Looker, and tools surrounding it to ensure Analysts are able to provide amazing insight to the business.

  • Understanding the query requirements from our data analysts and optimising our database (table) design to make them faster and more efficient.

  • Fixing the interesting problems we face in the best way possible; we are not constricted to tool sets and languages. If you find a solution to a problem that will work better, we use your idea. Best idea wins.

  • Creating a development platform, tools and pipeline that is effective and easy to iterate with.

  • Building your own brand and skills. Lyst is a company that will encourage and support you to get involved in the wider community. Events like FOSDEM, PyCon, JS London are regular occurrences on our calendar.

  • Creating better solutions for everything we do, from our culture to the code. This is your company, own it.



WHAT WE USE


Python, JavaScript, Django, PostgreSQL, Redis, AWS, Objective-C, Elasticsearch, Docker, Ember.js, RedShift, Pandas, IPython Notebook



As you can see we are really excited about the data we have here hopefully you will be too. We expect you to have already had some exposure to working in a commercial environment as an data Engineer. You will have the ability to not only work as a hands on member of the team but also the


We like to build things that solve problems, you will not be constrained by process - we work in small product teams that take a lean approach to building things. We believe that there is no silver bullet to fix the problems and challenges we face: instead we encourage consistent iteration to ensure we are always solving problems. We care deeply about collaboration, feedback and trust; all of our engineers take ownership of committing their own code and ensuring that everything is bug free and reliable.


If the above resonates and you would like to strongly influence the direction of our products and our culture, work with amazing people and hang out with Albert and Bruce, the office dogs. Artisan beers. Good Coffee. Great people.


If you would like to apply please do so right away, if you would like a bit more info feel free to get in touch with Tris on jobs@lyst.com.

item.title: Senior Big Data Software Engineer- $90K at Crossover (Lahore, Pakistan) (allows remote)
item.description:
Are you a Senior Software Engineer that has spent several years working with Big Data technologies? Have you created streaming analytics algorithms to process terabytes of real-time data and deployed Hadoop or Cassandra clusters over dozens of VMs? Have you been part of an organization driven by a DevOps culture, where the engineer has end to end responsibility for the product, from development to operating it in production? Are you willing to join a team of elite engineers working on a fast growing analytics business? Then this role is for you!



Job Description



The Software and DevOps engineer will help build the analytics platform for Bazaarvoice data that will power our client-facing reporting, product performance reporting, and financial reporting. You will also help us operationalize our Hadoop clusters, Kafka and Storm services, high volume event collectors, and build out improvements to our custom analytics job portal in support of Map/Reduce and Spark jobs. The Analytics Platform is used to aggregate data sets to build out known new product offerings related to analytics and media as well as a number of pilot initiatives based on this data. You will need to understand the business cases of the various products and build a common platform and set of services that help all of our products move fast and iterate quickly. You will help us pick and choose the right technologies for this platform.



Key Responsibilities



In your first 90 days you can expect the following:




  • An overview of our Big Data platform code base and development model




  • A tour of the products and technologies leveraging the Big Data Analytics Platform




  • 4 days of Cloudera training to provide a quick ramp up of the technologies involved




  • By the end of the 90 days, you will be able to complete basic enhancements to code supporting large-scale analytics using Map/Reduce as well as contribute to the operational maintenance of a high volume event collection pipeline.




Within the first year you will:




  • Own design, implementation, and support of major components of platform development. This includes working with the various stakeholders for the platform team to understand their requirements and delivery high leverage capabilities.



  • Have a complete grasp of the technology stack, and help guide where we go next.

item.title: Senior Software Developer for Visual Interface Technology at Banc3 (Princeton, NJ)
item.description: BANC3 has an opportunity that is available for immediate hire involving Optics/Visual Interface Technology with a soldier worn head mounted displayproviding an intuitive ‘heads-up’ visualization of tactically-relevant geo-registered icons through augmented reality and/or situational awareness system linked to an Android device. It is a government funded project that we will start execution on shortly. Our team will consist of the several experts in various tasks in all aspects of the project like wireless networking of soldier weapon sights, android devices and heads-up-displays (HUD)/ Head mounted displays (HMD).

item.title: Ruby Web Developer at Trimble Navigation (Westminster, CO)
item.description:
About Trimble Data


Trimble Data develops scalable, cloud-based geospatial systems. Our goal is to make geospatial processing simpler and faster for consumers by interfacing many varied geospatial applications into a cohesive whole.


Our primary system is the Trimble Data Marketplace, a storefront for geospatial data. The Marketplace enables customers to find, customize, and download data quickly and easily.



Ruby Web Developer


We are seeking a self-motivated, creative, and enthusiastic full stack developer to join the Trimble Data Web Development team. As a full-stack developer, you will maintain and design applications from top to bottom and work with everything from front-end HTML, CSS and JS to server-side databases, search indexes, and web servers as well as AWS cloud operations.


As a member of the Trimble Data Web Development team you will leverage new technologies, services and best practices to build the best solutions. You will have the opportunity to develop innovative solutions to new problems and will work with a wide variety of technologies to assist in the design of our API-driven front end UI as well as the backend API itself, all within scalable cloud infrastructure. Developers deal with a wide variety of tasks. A typical week may include coding, architecting, debugging, working with databases, and learning new technologies.


Key Responsibilities




  • Software engineering with a healthy dose of performance engineering and DevOps.




  • Develop, design, and support web app (SaaS), with focus on performance and scalability.




  • Maintain existing systems, while investigating and prototyping new technologies.




  • Build user interfaces to make large sets of data and processing operations available to end users.




  • Design APIs and work with consumers to support automated processing goals.




Work within your team and with other teams to ensure the overall vision of the project is being fulfilled.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer- Security Platform Owner at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
The Security Intelligence team, part of Information Security at Amazon, owns the monitoring of and response to malicious activity on the Amazon network. We collect data from all parts of Amazon's massive, worldwide service-oriented architecture.



We are seeking Software Engineers to join a team in Information Security dedicated to enabling our organization to perform its most critical functions at Amazon’s scale. Our challenges are broad and deep -- we need to build flexible, secure, scalable, high-performance and robust software and services. We have all of the challenges you’d expect such as high scale, big data, and a need to never go down. In addition to these challenges we also have the security aspect. We protect customer data from adversaries that want it.



At Amazon, we obsess over our customers, and ensuring our customers’ trust is our first priority. To earn that trust in an environment as vast and varied as Amazon’s and an online world where threats grow ever more sophisticated requires building a world-class security team to tackle never-before-seen challenges at dizzying scales. You will not just be using cutting-edge technologies here in Amazon; you will be inventing them.

You have strong verbal and written communication skills, are self-driven and deliver high quality results in a fast-paced environment. You have strong computer science credentials, are passionate about Internet technology, are customer-obsessed and have a track record of building quality services. You know how to build and you dive deep into back-end services. You excel when working on complex and diverse systems. You can succinctly and accurately report your findings. Most importantly, you have a passion for learning and continuous improvement.


  • MINIMUM 8 years' Software Development experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Proficiency in at least one modern programming language such as Python, Java, or Scala

  • Experienced in big data technologies and/or distributed computing systems

  • Self-directed, ability to multi-task, sharp analytical abilities, excellent communication skills, capable of working effectively in a dynamic environment

  • Proven design skills and able to find creative scalable solutions to difficult problems

  • Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, internet security fundamentals and designing for performance, scalability and availability




  • Masters in Computer Science or Computer Engineering

  • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software systems

  • Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices

  • Experience mentoring junior software engineers to improve their skills

  • Demonstration of project ownership including requirements, design, implementation, testing, and operational support

  • Experience with stream, batch and/or graph processing platform (e.g. Spark)

  • Experience with security technologies or products

  • Experience working in an agile environment

item.title: Platform Engineer at Umbel (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Umbel is a high-energy, high-tech startup in Austin, Texas that is passionate about helping businesses build thriving, sustainable models powered by their ability to deeply understand and demonstrate the value of their audience.


We are seeking a Platform Engineer that loves to build incredible things. This position will work closely with all members of the product, development and engineering teams in a collaborative environment, which is diverse and open-minded. A successful candidate will obsess over high performance web development and database optimization, as well as feel comfortable in the cloud and know the latest techniques for developing and scaling web applications and distributed systems.


Responsibilities:



  • Write fantastic server-side code for web applications and distributed systems

  • Develop prototypes quickly and scale them

  • Live in the cloud and love it

  • Push back, think creatively, and have fun forming products


What you'll get out of it: 



  • 100% employer paid benefits (medical, dental, vision, etc.)

  • A supportive, challenging and fun team environment

  • Awesome office location in downtown Austin

  • The ability to grow your career and skill set

  • Competitive compensation including cash and stock options

  • A company that is young, agile and responsive to great ideas

item.title: Client Facing Python Developer at Continuum Analytics (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are looking for accomplished scientists and engineers interested in a customer-facing software consultancy that could lead to full time placement with a customer at the conclusion of a project.  Many of these roles allow for involvement with our core technologies as needed by the customer.  The more experienced candidate will have a strong technical background with 4+ years Python and C/C++ development experience and 2+ years experience with NumPy or the equivalent.


Depending on your skills, you will work on one of our core products or technologies, including our next-generation data management products which will push Python and its vectorized enhancements such as NumPy into general use in big data analytics. For the right person(s) with strong technical and customer-facing skills but less prior exposure to Python, C/C++, NumPy, and related, we may offer concentrated training and mentoring to fully prepare you for this role. 


Bonus skills & experience: Distributed databases, parallel computation, KDB+, GPU, UI, Gemstone, OLAP/MDX, LLVM.

item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer at Altamira (McLean, VA)
item.description: The selected candidate will provide software engineering support on a web-based administrative support portal.  The application consists of a suite of integrated tools that provides support personnel with key data points by reaching out to a variety of enterprise data sources and consolidating the data into a unified view.  Candidate will be responsible for maintaining the current set of tools which will allow for increased familiarity with the application.  Over time, the selected candidate will be responsible for developing new applications, utilizing enterprise web-services, and building new reports.  The successful candidate will be a member of a dynamic team that is responsible for a rich web application.  The selected candidate must have the ability to work in a mixed technical environment and maintain productivity when switching between multiple tools/applications and technologies.  The candidate must work well in a team environment and have the desire to develop software in an agile fashion.

item.title: Software Architect - 803 at Cambridge Consultants (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
Have you delivered Software as a Service that truly scaled and experienced first-hand the challenges of rolling out new services? Would you like to do it again, working with “Big Data” and the “Internet of Things” to shape a new initiative within a true world class leader?


Cambridge Consultants is a fantastic place to work and is home to some of the most talented engineers and scientists active in connected devices and data analytics across a wide range of sectors.


Main purpose of the job


To be the lead software and technical architect for cloud based platforms that connect devices and deliver digital services, with particular focus on secure and scalable systems that deliver flexible Software as a Service business models.


Work within multi-disciplinary teams of highly talented people from around the globe that drive changes in technology to deliver novel solutions to the everyday needs of individuals and corporations alike.


About Digital Services


Digital Services is an exciting area within Cambridge Consultants; one that builds on the extensive range of work by the company in connected devices, data analytics and integrated systems across many sectors and with clients from around the world. Working closely with other groups in Cambridge Consultants we seek to deliver exciting new services in medical, consumer and industrial sectors as well as to drive forward the servitization of the company’s own IP.


We combine excellent technical and commercial skills with robust service design and evaluation methods and a broad base of industry experience to form a powerful development team. Our work ranges from undertaking complete service platform development and operations from concept, pilots and commercial launch, through to providing consulting services for our clients on their technology, product offering and future strategy.


Specific responsibilities


Develop solutions for connected devices where scalable, flexible and secure software platforms, service availability and security of personal data are vital.


Technically guide multi-disciplinary project teams of Engineers, Consultants and Designers to realise your design.


To liaise with clients to understand their technical needs and use your strong technical expertise to prepare proposals which capture and structure these requirements clearly.


Apply your knowledge of the state-of-the-art software tools and techniques to ensure standards-compliant design that takes advantage of the latest thinking in database systems, open innovation and federated identity management.


Use your development experience to drive a robust and agile approach to software development, testing, documentation and deployment of live commercial services.

item.title: Tradebook Low-Latency And Algorithmic Trading - Senior C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker, a US ECN, and a technology provider ofcross-asset electronic trading platform, supporting Equities/Futures/Options/FX trading.

Tradebook is building the next generation, ultra-low latency trading platform, which supports multi asset trading, exchange routing and order matching. With high capacity and sub-microsecond latency, the new system will be the foundation for Tradebook's future and propel it into more markets and grab new opportunities.

Our focus is on developing low latency & real-time black box trading systems, algorithmic trading systems, providing connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions.

R&D Tradebook is looking for a motivated and talented C++ developer to join this effort. You will be working a small group of technologists passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology and delivering innovative product solutions. The role involves implementing a high performance technology stack from ground up, designing efficient data structures and services for business functionality, and building a highly available system with throughput of millions of messages per second. Candidates should exhibit an aggressive drive, bias towards action, and a proven aptitude for engineering quality software solutions.

This candidate will also work closely with Sales, Products and Trading Desk from idea generation to implementing and delivering cutting-edge technologies and trading solutions to the market.

Tradebook is seeking developers with project experience in creating systems for:
- Algorithmic Trading
- Black Box Trading
- Market Making
- Risk Management
- Quantitative Analysis
- Event Based Trading
- Solutions for Hedge Funds
- Solutions for Proprietary Trading firms (Prop shops)
- High frequency trading applications
- Low latency trading applications

item.title: Cloud Architect m/f at Cloudreach GmbH (München, Germany)

How will you spend your time at Cloudreach?


You will be working in the following areas (and more!):

  • Green field development of Amazon Web Services infrastructure (EC2, RDS, EMR, etc), e.g. looking at an existing service or data centre and then architecting a more effective solution in AWS. You might work on a major eCommerce platform, a MySQL database migration, a Big Data project, or building a scalable mobile backend

item.title: Software Engineer (Java) at EMBL-EBI (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking to recruit an experienced Software Engineer to work on the OpenMinTeD H2020 project, to create an e-infrastructure that fosters and facilitates the use of text and data mining technologies in scientific publications. You will join the Cheminformatics and Metabolism team at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) located at the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.

You will work with the OpenMinTeD consortium on the BioMedical use case for this consortium. You will also develop the curation tool for the ChEBI database at EBI and integrate the solutions produced by the OpenMinTeD consortium. Towards this end, you need to have excellent software engineering capabilities and be able to understand and implement software according to user requirements.

The EBI is part of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) and it is a world-leading bioinformatics centre providing biological data to the scientific community with expertise in data storage, analysis and representation. EMBL-EBI provides freely available data from life science experiments, performs basic research in computational biology and offers an extensive user training programme, supporting researchers in academic and industry.

As much as the previous is key, a strong mind and work ethic are the most important factors. At Logentries we value intellectual curiosity, a passion for technology, initiative, and a good sense of humor.


Logentries requires a Software Engineer to work on their core platform and satellite projects in Dublin, Ireland. We will provide you with a world-class mentoring program where you will learn from a team of seriously talented software developers. You might not have a Java or Javascript background, but if you’re a disciplined software engineer who is excited to learn and use new technologies and methods then Logentries Software Engineer role is for you.




Responsibilities

  • Follow the team’s agile practices to create world-class software

item.title: Data Processing Engineer at Criteo (Paris, France)
item.description:
Your Mission:


Build the appropriate infrastructure to store more than tens of TB of additional data every day, and offer both batch and nearline processing capabilities, at a rate of 300,000 messages per second per datacenter, across six datacenters.


Fully automate the administration of thousands of servers with a fully open source approach using Chef.


Datacenter as a computer: efficient usage of all hardware with a common storage and computation platform using Yarn / Mesos.


High stakes, high rewards: 1% increase in performance may yield millions for the company.


Develop open source projects. Because we are working at the forefront of technology, we are dealing with problems that few have faced. We’re big users of open source, and we’d like to give back to the community.

You will collaborate with other engineers and work on a variety of large scale systems including our Mapreduce cluster and global realtime bidding system.


Responsibilities

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority/Female/Disability/Vet

item.title: Sales and Support Engineer at Factual (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Factual is looking for a scrappy engineer to help our customers’ engineering teams understand, integrate with, deploy, debug, and troubleshoot our software and APIs.  You have been the problem solver of last resort, capable of diagnosing and resolving issues in production environments, and finding and implementing workarounds when necessary. item.title: Software Engineer, Data at HookLogic, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Job Description



HookLogic Engineers develop proprietary software platforms used by the world’s largest e-commerce retailers. Our engineering team consists of talented, team-oriented individuals who are empowered to take advantage of the latest cloud and distributed technologies to deliver reliable, high-throughput applications. Our core languages are Java and C# and we commonly utilize technologies and platforms such as RESTful services, jQuery, SQL Server, Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, and AWS Services such as Kinesis, DynamoDB, Redshift, Lamda, and SQS. 


As a Data Engineer, you’ll employ your skills on a daily basis to design and build data processing and storage applications to handle millions of transactions per day. You will analyze business requirements and consult with the broader team to ensure successful processing, storage and reporting of our Big Data. You’ll have a wide variety of languages and technologies at your disposal that you can use to solve problems. Your work will directly shape and create our data architecture to ultimately deliver systems that stand up to unpredictable environments at massive scale.

item.title: VP of Engineering at Crisis Text Line (New York, NY)
item.description:
Overview: Crisis Text Line is a data and tech driven not-for-profit. We've built our own online platform for engaging with people in crisis (think: suicide, self-harm, domestic violence, etc) over SMS using standard, open web technologies.


How we work:



  • Fail intelligently. We're always do our absolute best work, but we're ready to fail at any moment so we build with redundancy and fault-tolerance.

  • Pick the right tool. Technology is a means, not an end. We try to see where the bleeding edge is, but live in the realm of reality and practicality.

  • Hack this site. Seriously. We're the type of people who think hackthissite.org is one of the coolest places on the internet, so everything we build has an eye to keeping things safe.

  • Access control. Alice and Bob are our best friends, but we know that Alice and Bob are inherently untrustworthy. We write your code to make sure Alice and Bob can’t conspire against us or our users.

  • Speed. People expect a response to a text message in under 14 minutes. We’re shooting for no more than 5. That means the platform needs to run fast, and crisis counselors need to be able to use it efficiently and effectively.

  • Testing. Testing isn’t just clicking buttons. Testing means optimizing user experience and listening to your users rather than your gut. And of course, running automated tests too. You would never deploy untested code into production. Duh.

  • Cloud. We think scale. The cloud isn’t a solution, it’s an assumption.


Our team:



  • Custom, home-grown Symfony2 app for SMS-web interaction

  • Drupal 7 installation for managing remote volunteers

  • Slack chat bots because `@robot animate me <kittens>` is important

  • 1 CTO, 3 engineers, and we're hiring at least 3 more engineers in the coming months

item.title: Lead/Senior Software Engineer - Data Infrastructure Engineering at Udemy (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Lets Go.

Lets go inspire 100 million people learn anything they can imagine. Lets go inspire 100,000 instructors to share their knowledge with the world. Lets go help 10,000 businesses to change the way their employees learn.

Learn. Empathize. Take Ownership. nnovate. Show Passion.

Get Stuff Done. Open Up.

ABOUT UDEMY

Udemy is an online marketplace where anyone in the world can take or teach a course on virtually anything, whenever and wherever they want. Our mission is to empower on-demand learning thats accessible to all by offering instruction in a way thats affordable, simple, and flexible, so individuals can fulfill their limitless potential on their own terms.

Our more than 7 million students can gain skills to launch a new career, advance in their current field, or try something new for their own personal development by choosing from more than 30,000 courses in 80+ languages. Our instructors are passionate experts who want to share their knowledge with a broad audience. Udemy also works with companies to help them develop more effective and engaging skills-based training for their employees.

Founded in 2010, Udemy is privately owned and funded by Stripes Group, Norwest Venture Partners, Insight Venture Partners, Lightbank, MHS Capital, Learn Capital, and 500 Startups, among others. Udemy is headquartered in San Franciscos SOMA neighborhood and has offices in Dublin, Ireland, and Ankara, Turkey. Compensation includes full time salary, equity compensation plan, and competitive benefits (including healthcare, commuter benefits and an unlimited vacation policy).  

Job Description:

  • Build robust and scalable data infrastructure (both offline and real-time) to support needs from different teams around the company.

  • Manage the data infrastructure and do necessary capacity planning.

  • May get involved in various projects/tasks as needed. This may involve some project planning, resource planning, and deployment planning in additional to his/her current software engineering responsibilities

  • May require mentoring  junior engineers to become proficient developers using best software development practices and processes

  • Lead by example and contribute to a team culture that values quality, robustness, and scalability while fostering initiatives and innovation.

  • Continue to research and evaluate new technologies (such as Spark) that may improve performance and elegance of our data infrastructure.

  • We practice agile development methodologies with two week sprints.

Technologies currently in use or will be in use:

  • Hadoop, Hive, Pig

  • AWS, Elastic MapReduce, Redshift, Kinesis, S3

  • Cassandra, HBase

  • Spark

  • Kafka, Storm

  • Python, Django (experience with Python/Django a big plus)

  • Github

  • MySQL, PostgreSQL

Qualifications:

  • Shown success as an individual contributor. Have consistently demonstrated ability and commitment to deliver major initiatives from beginning to full deployment in a timely manner.

  • Embrace good development practices including design specification, coding standards, unit testing, and code reviews.

  • Exhibited passion for delivering high quality products that meet business requirements

  • Demonstrated knowledge of well known software technologies and services and curiosity to continue to evaluate new technologies to strengthen our platform.

  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively within a team and with cross-functional technical and business teams.

  • Demonstrated ability to solve time-critical problems

  • Have contributed to the development of others through code reviews, tech talks, or personal coaching.

  • Willingness to "go the extra mile" when needed.

Udemy in the News:

TechCrunch: Udemy Raises Another $65 Million To Help Anyone Learn Anything

Wall Street Journal: Udemy Raises $65 Million to Become Netflix for Education

Bloomberg: Why LinkedIn Is Tapping Into Online Education

Forbes: Closing The Skills Gap: How Udemy Is Helping Anyone Learn Anything

SFGate: Company culture, collaboration is focus at Udemy

item.title: Java Backend Developer (m/f) at Visual Meta GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)

item.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer- Building a new cutting edge platform!!!!! at Zipcar (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Zipcar, the world’s largest car-sharing company, is looking to add new senior talent to our Engineering team.


Today, Zipcar provides hundreds of thousands of people with a viable alternative to traditional car ownership, saving them money, time and headaches. Around the world—from coast to coast, across Canada, the UK, and college campuses in between—people are making the decision to live car free and enjoying the convenience and environmental benefits of having “wheels when you want them”.



We’re working to transform Zipcar from its ‘startup roots’ into ‘a world-class engineering organization’. The new platform we’re building is going to take Zipcar all over the world. We’re building a global platform to take car-sharing everywhere.


From an organizational standpoint, we’re going ‘deep into Agile’. We’ve launched a bunch of Agile teams and they are essentially self-directed. We’re pushing technical decision making and freedom to choose approaches down to the team level. We’re empowering engineers and teams to make decisions. Even our Leadership Team (including the President) does a ‘daily standup’.


The technology choices we’re standardizing on are:



  • Native Mobile applications on Android and iOS. Our goal is to launch new functionality on ‘mobile first’ wherever it makes sense.

  • Big Data technologies like Hadoop, Cassandra, Apache Spark, Clojure, Haskel, machine learning, etc are going to be core to what we do.

  • All back-end services are going to be written in Ruby, Scala or Java. Mobile apps are all native.



Responsibilities:



  • Senior member of an agile team focused on delivering components of the next generation Zipcar technology platform.

  • Work to achieve engineering quality standards that our members will love and that you and your team will be proud of.

  • Responsible for the delivery a series of small, discrete applications leveraging Ruby, Java and/or Scala in a fast-paced, team-focused environment

  • Lead the development of applications leveraging traditional and non-traditional data stores, such as Hadoop, Cassandra and others.


Requirements:



  • The desire to work as part of an agile team

  • 5+ years of experience in Scala/Play, Java, or Ruby development for the web

  • Must have experience using non-traditional data stores such as Hadoop, Cassandra or MongoDB.

  • The skill and desire to create well-tested software using current tools.

  • Experience with SOA, microservice and/or RESTful design patterns

  • Experience with applications having 100s to 1000s or more concurrent users.

  • Experience building web applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript


The Ideal Candidate Has:



  • A solid understanding of Kanban, Scrum and other agile concepts

  • Experience with multiple programming languages, with at least one being JVM-based, such as Java, JRuby or Scala.

  • An understanding of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery

  • Experience in deploying applications using tools such as AWS, Docker, or Cloud Foundry

  • Experience using JavaScript frameworks such as Backbone, Ember or Angular

  • Experience using data with predictive and other analytic approaches

  • Experience deploying and tuning large-scale applications built on top of the JVM

  • Exposure to mobile development on iOS or Android

  • Experience interfacing with telematics infrastructure and geospatial data

  • A commitment to Zipcar’s ideals of sustainable resource sharing and urban mobility


As a member of the Zipcar Team you will receive:



  • Competitive Compensation

  • Competitive Benefits Package

  • Free Membership

  • Discounts on services, products and much more


While we appreciate every applicant’s interest, only those under consideration will be contacted. We regret that phone calls will not be accepted.


Zipcar is an EEO Employer - Minorities / Females / Protected Veterans / Disabled


To all recruitment agencies: Zipcar does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Zipcar employees or any other company location. Zipcar is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

item.title: System Engineer, Platform & Big Data Services at Peak Games (Istanbul, Turkey)
item.description:
System Engineer, Platform & Big Data Services


Peak Games' Technical Operations team (TechOps) is responsible for building, scaling and maintaining highly available systems, and is also the first line of defense against all outages. TechOps detects and solves the issues in a proactive manner. Because of being a service department, TechOps engineers have limitless exposure to all technologies used in the infrastructure of all games, including numerous bleeding edge technologies. We are looking for system engineers that want to automate just about everything you can think of and build a development and deployment pipeline and set of tools that can effectively deliver our games and services. Our team is responsible for automating the entire stack of high performance, large scale, geographically dispersed resources throughout its life-cycle. We have an app stack that will challenge you and diversify your skills. Ideal candidates will have experience of AWS and/or other cloud tech. You will be building our infrastructure in AWS, EC2 or our own private hardware and software resources. You will work side by side with our engineering teams and architects to design and implement a scalable and robust cloud delivery infrastructure.


Major Responsibilities/Activities



  • Work closely with the engineering teams to design, deliver and manage our services with high uptime

  • Participate in failure, load and performance tests to ensure applications are production ready

  • Ensure security of the production infrastructure, systems and applications

  • Engage in the development of continuous integration strategy. Define, develop and maintain CI processes and systems

  • Automate, implement, administer, and maintain our databases, local and cloud-based servers including provisioning, backups and restores, upgrades, and monitoring

item.title: Business Intelligence Software Engineer at Best Friends Animal Society (Kanab, UT) (allows remote)
item.description:
Come work in a warm and relaxed environment among the red rocks of Southern Utah!  We are adding to our amazing IT team and have 2 openings for Business Intelligence Software Engineers. 


Position Summary: The Business Intelligence (BI) Software Engineer’s role is to strategically design and implement BI software and systems, including integration with databases and data warehouses. This includes selecting, blueprinting, gathering requirements, designing, and rolling out BI solutions to end users. The Business Intelligence Software Engineer is also responsible for ensuring high levels of BI availability through support functions and in-depth testing.  The BI Software Engineer  will be responsible for setting the technical direction of BI projects within the framework of Enterprise Data Architecture.  The BI Software Engineer will also provide mentoring and guidance in best practices to other members of the Enterprise Data team.


Responsibilities:


Strategy and Planning (10%)



  • Assess and cultivate long-term strategic goals for BI development in conjunction with end users, managers, clients, and other stakeholders.


Acquisition and Deployment (10%)



  • Conduct research and make recommendations on BI products, services, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts. 

  • Evaluate and select database/data warehouse components, including hardware, relational database management systems, ETL software, metadata management tools, and database design solutions.


Operational Leadership (30%) 



  • Direct, organize, and lead projects in the implementation and use of new BI software tools and systems. 

  • Lead the integration efforts for merging BI platforms with enterprise systems and applications. 

  • Work with project managers to ensure that data entry, retrieval, change, and delete functions meet business requirements for project completion. 

  • Conduct job duties and responsibilities according to the organization’s business systems development methodology and/or its Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology. 

  • Monitor alerts and troubleshoot BI tools, systems, and software; performance-tune these applications as necessary. 

  • Act as evangelist for BI benefits across the organization; promote BI usage to relevant departments.

  • Mentor and/or provide leadership to junior members of the team.


Engineering (40%) 



  • Design, code, test, and document all new or modified BI systems, applications, and programs. 

  • Develop the semantic layer, metadata, reports, and report definitions.  Develop graphs, dashboards, and portal interfaces.

  • Design databases, data models, data marts, and data warehouses. 

  • Analyze user requirements and, based upon findings, design functional solutions. 

  • Design and deliver end-user training and training materials; provide technical support as necessary.

  • Build specifications for BI front-end applications based upon user requirements. 

  • Produce ETL design guidelines to ensure a manageable ETL infrastructure for the BI system.  


Information Security (10%) 



  • Develop, test, and implement best practices within the BI ecosystem to ensure sensitive information is protected and only available to those with a need and the appropriate approved access to view the information.

item.title: Software Test Engineer at Masimo (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
Job Summary


Seasoned Development Test Engineer with experience in Automation development and Testing.  This engineer will not only execute, report, and maintain existing automation test procedures but also participate in development of new automation testing systems and procedures.   


Duties & Responsibilities



  • The test engineer must be able to properly judge test outcomes to determine pass/fail status, clearly document findings in Test Reports and document bugs discovered during testing.

  • Analyze large amounts of data acquired during automation test using tools such as Mathcad and Matlab.

  • Will also execute manual test cases needing no automation.

item.title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer at Ivenix (Amesbury, MA)
item.description:
About You


You want to put your fingerprint on something that will help bring medical care to the state of the art. You consider software craftsmanship an absolute necessity for a highly productive team. You use system-based thinking and thrive as a member of an agile, cross functional team. You know how to manage multiple tasks concurrently and correctly prioritize them. You are able to collaborate across hardware and software engineering aspects of system development to achieve great results. You also have the experience and knowledge we are looking for:



  • You are skilled in the development of embedded software on bare-metal chipsets

  • You have a deep understanding of the Linux operating system and have written drivers to control hardware

  • You have a strong understanding of the unique software development challenges associated with a  resource-limited, battery-operated, network accessible embedded device

  • You have 8+ years of embedded software engineering experience along with a degree in math, electrical engineering, or computer science

  • Experience with Agile Software Development practices is a plus

  • Experience in the medical device industry is a plus


The Position



  • Design and implement medical applications running on an ARM Cortex A9, STM32 and MSP430 chipset

  • Design and develop software that interfaces with hardware devices

  • Read electronic schematic designs, component data sheets, and derive requirements for embedded software

  • Review and engage in the development of software specifications compliant with our established quality system and design controls

item.title: MongoDB Engineer at Rally Software (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Rally is seeking an experienced, self-motivated, and passionate MongoDB Engineer to join our team. As a MongoDB Engineer, you’ll be largely responsible for providing operational database services to the organization. This position includes production as well as development DBA tasks, as such it will require a commitment on your part as well as ours.


About the Team


Here at Rally we try to do things a little differently. Whether it's re-imagining how SaaS is implemented and scaled, blameless postmortems, pushing to production on your very first day, we don't subscribe to the mantra of "Because we've always done it that way".


We believe that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things. We also believe in the right tool for the job, not language-as-religion.


About the Job


As a database and data store administrator, you will be part of a team of highly-skilled engineers that manage all production, test and ancillary data environments.  While there are a number of different systems, Rally is consolidating to MongoDB and Oracle as the primary data systems.  This position will be focused on MongoDB first, and Oracle second, and will be expected to cross-train the other DBAs on MongoDB best practices, management and implementation.  The position requires on-call availability to support our 24x7x365 SaaS operations.  


Responsibilities:




  • Monitoring and administering data systems security in AWS and colo environments.




  • Analyzing data stored in the databases and data stores and making recommendations relating to performance and efficiency of that data storage.




  • Helping application programmers to efficiently utilize the data assets by assisting in database schema design and recommending the best design for scalability and performance.




  • Proactively monitor systems for optimum performance and capacity constraints.




  • Establishing standards and best practices for database backup and recovery.




  • 2+ years of production Oracle DBA experience.




  • 3+ years of production MongoDB management experience.




  • Experience with Oracle RDBMS running on Linux.




  • Experience managing, implementing, monitoring and scaling MongoDB in AWS




  • Strong experience supporting mission critical data infrastructure




  • Some experience and knowledge of an Oracle 11g database for an OLTP application in areas such as best practices, scalability, performance, and reliability.




  • Experience with Oracle and/or MongoDB performance tuning.




  • Experience with Oracle standby databases. Active Data Guard experience a plus.




  • Skilled in scripting and automating repetitive administrative tasks.




  • Experience with backup, recovery, and DR best practices.




About You


You enjoy the challenges and opportunities that come from managing data stores in a large-scale SaaS application environment.  You have a love for automation, predictive analysis, capacity planning and thrive on continuous improvement. You have a strong customer-oriented attitude and collaborate frequently with development teams and the rest of Infrastructure Engineering to solve problems, make recommendations, and help Rally excel.  You’re active in the open source community, understand the power of community and openly share your expertise.  You have experience creating, running and scaling data stores and databases in high-availability environments.


You will be successful in this role if you:




  • Are detail oriented and understand the need for precision working with data infrastructure




  • Have worked extensively with MongoDB and ideally Oracle, or are willing to aggressively ramp up on which of those two you are least familiar with




  • Have strong database and data store administration skills and seek out opportunities to improve and automate everything




  • Enjoy fast-paced, CI/CD environments with lots of collaboration




  • Understand big data at scale




  • Have a passion for learning




  • Understand AWS and deploying data stores to cloud environments as well as Oracle on old skool bare metal




Rally’s global headquarters is in Boulder, Colorado, with 10 additional offices spanning 4 continents. At Rally we believe that we can’t inspire innovation in our customers if we’re not innovative ourselves. We empower our teams by offering them flexibility, autonomy, and a culture founded upon open communication and collaboration. Recently awarded Best for the World: Worker Impact award for the third year in a row by B Labs, Named #8 on the “Best Medium-Sized Workplaces” by Fortune Magazine, a “Best Company to Work For in Colorado” and ranked in the “Top 100 Best Places to Work” in the nation from Outside Magazine, Rally offers a highly collaborative culture and work-life balance that attracts and retains top talent.


Rally is an Equal Opportunity Employer! 


Rally Software Development Corp., a wholly owned subsidiary of CA, Inc.

item.title: Principal Software Engineer, Big Data at Avigilon (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
Avigilon’s business intelligence group is seeking an experienced software developer to participate in the development of a platform to process data from thousands of security cameras and devices remotely with technologies relating to data mining and visualization, embedded systems, distributed systems, and integration with mobile applications.



The candidate must have experience in the following areas:



  • Architecture of cutting-edge cloud platform of services and APIs

  • Interfacing third-party services for machine learning, video and data analysis, and data visualization

  • Design of RESTful APIs with low-latency/real-time requirements

  • Data warehousing
