Our office is currently located on Middlesex Turnpike, Billerica but relocating to Assembly Row, Somerville in November.

item.title: C++ Developer for Low Latency Trading at Arbillon Capital AG (Wollerau, Switzerland)
item.description: Arbillon Capital AG (www.arbillon.com) is looking to add a software engineer to its low latency algorithmic trading group. The candidate will focus on further development, maintenance and improving the real-time performance of the trading system across software, network and hardware components.

item.title: Software Engineer at MillimanMAX (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
The Milliman predictive analytics group in Cambridge, MA is looking for software engineers to help bridge research and practice, towards changing the way the insurance industry does business. Yeah, we really do think we’re going to change the way this whole industry works. Although Milliman is primarily an Actuarial Science firm, that is not what we do. We’re a small team of motivated experts building a new product-oriented practice for tackling statistical problems in the insurance sector. We work with large, real-world datasets and advanced techniques spanning optimization, statistics, and machine learning. We are looking for exceptional and innovative individuals to help in building out tools/automation to support Milliman's Predictive Modeling Practice. This is a unique opportunity to take on a role that will allow end to end development and autonomy. You will be working closely with a strong team of researchers and engineers; your work will have immediate and tangible impact both internally, and within our clients’ operations. 


Responsibilities


Your primary function is to have your work support end-to-end work flow for high-volume customer data through the predictive modeling engines and back to the customer with full service BI/analytics using event-driven automation as well as designing and coding tools utilized in the extraction, refining, and data presentation arenas.



  • Implement, optimize, generalize and productionalize models and research emerging from the research team

  • Integrate predictive models into database-backed environments, real-time query APIs, and existing modeling pipelines

  • Think about high-level architecture, scalability, abstraction, modularity, and generalizability across clients and use-cases

  • Lead significant strategic projects focused on enhancements to core tooling and automation.

  • Design and develop custom exploratory tools for strange new data worlds.

  • Design and develop automation to harden the end-to-end data handling.

  • Help design and develop data analytics platforms for supporting customer access through interactive visualization

  • Design and develop tools for processing and correlating seemingly disjoint customer data

  • Design and develop tools for multiple database engines: both extraction and posting

  • Gently chastise the data-scientists for not writing better code - then show them how

item.title: Technical Lead for the next great mobile-first platform at MoLabs (New York, NY)
item.description: MoLabs is focused on building the next great mobile-first platform. To get there, we are assembling a world-class product and engineering team. MoLabs' software engineers develop the scalable, mobile-first technologies that change how users consume, explore and interact with information and the world. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing and UI design. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack. As a Technical Lead, you will lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You have deep expertise in building performant, scalable systems in C++, Java, Go or Python. Your design intuition should lean towards elegance and simplicity, and you should have experience with highly-scaled serving systems.

item.title: Senior Software Development Eng- Consumer Shopping Engagement at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
The Community Shopping team is looking for a creative, deeply technical and hands-on candidate to take community shopping experiences and the underlying technology to the next level. This is a strategic role in an organization and includes ownership of iconic Amazon products including customer reviews and Wish List. As a senior technical individual contributor you will join the ranks of Amazon’s most senior Technical Community You’ll help establish technical standards and drive Community Shopping’s overall technical architecture and engineering practices. You’ll work on our hardest problems, building high quality, architecturally sound systems that are aligned with our business needs. You will help us apply machine learning to many aspects of our business. You will help our teams develop a data services so that many internal technology teams can utilize the treasure trove of information provided by customers in reviews etc.



The ideal candidate is a pragmatic visionary who can translate business needs into workable technology solutions. You will drive decisions on which technologies teams should adopt and when/how to build architectural frameworks leveraged by multiple teams.

 

Basic Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related technical field

• MINIMUM 8+ years of relevant, broad engineering experience

• Experience leading the delivery of customer facing services and large-scale distributed systems

• Experience leading the delivery of APIs and SDKs



Preferred Qualifications

· Master’s degree or PhD in computer science or related technical field

· Experience leading development life cycle process and best practices

· Experience mentoring/training the engineering community on complex technical issues





Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but are necessary for Amazon impact include:

Obsessed about doing the right thing for the customer

Analytical thinking and ability to translate data into business ideas

Ownership, drive, and bias for action

Using good judgment, has had to make strategic decisions with limited information.

Relentless pursuit of elevating progress

Strong written and oral communication skills

Ability to dive deep, peeling back the onion to understand root cause and implications

item.title: Sr. .Net Software Engineer at CDK Global (Hoffman Estates, IL)
item.description:
ADP Dealer Services is now CDK Global.

Stability meets Agility.  CDK is one of the largest technology providers to the automotive industry, with more than 26,000 dealer sites in over 100 countries and nearly 9,000 employees worldwide. From data scientists to sales and operations experts, we’re hiring to support your growth and ours. GreenLight Your Career

CDK Global is looking for passionate, skilled software engineers to join a great team building a new product suite to change the car buying process for both dealers and consumers. Work on an advanced distributed system leveraging technologies such as AngularJS, .NET WebAPI, NServiceBus, RabbitMQ, RavenDB, and SQLFire. Our newly renovated workplace is a creative and collaborative environment supporting an agile methodology.  The CDK Global Engineering team is a group of fun, pragmatic, full stack engineers with multi-language coding skills focused on engineering excellence and continuous improvement.  As a software engineer with CDK Global you will:



  • Performs a developer role in building enterprise software solutions encompassing: services and service layer, service integration to UI and data, UI components;

  • Delivers world class, high quality design and code using MS .NET including MVC, Entity framework. Uses agile methodologies including TDD, CI, Refactoring and Code Reviews;

  • Works with the Product Owners and other team members to complement and complete the development process.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise, mobile and desktop, external and internal, user-driven and automated, and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


More specifically, we are building apps on both Android and iOS, a customer-facing web application, a robust web services API, machine learning-driven analytics, and large-scale data processing. Although you will be focused on the back end system, you must be hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member. You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary as we are growing very quickly but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will be crucial to designing and implementing a scalable system from schema through software through operational tools. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our engineering culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.



This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Linux Engineer; DevOps at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
1010data has created the fastest database in the world via an easy-to-use, spreadsheet-like interface to make big data discovery easy across retail, consumer packaged goods, financial services, healthcare and telecom.


We are Seeking a Dev Ops, Linux Engineer skilled with handling large production environments to expand, automate and maintain our Linux fleet. 


With more than 20 trillion rows of data currently under management, 1010data is designed to scale to the largest volumes of granular data, the most disparate and varied data sets, and the biggest user populations. All while delivering lightning-quick system performance. 


If you have a passion for high performance computing you will be instrumental in building tools to manage a highly scalable, 24/7 available platform for data analysis. 



With a focus on scripting, process re-engineering and continuous integration; you blend the skills of an analyst with the technical chops of an engineer to architect solutions on issues that affect the entire company.


If you value the power of driving strategic vendor decisions and are confident in embracing new technologies to tackle our high volume, scalable problems we would like to speak with you! 


Responsibilities:



  • Scaling, managing and automating our Linux fleet as 1010data grows. 

  • Automate the management of cloud computing infrastructure

  • Build out HA/DR computing solutions

  • Ensure the overall health and performance of production environment

  • Proactively identify trends, determine root causes, and initiate appropriate action to resolve issues. 

  • Investigate and resolve hardware and software issues

  • Responsible for production systems sometimes after hours or weekends.

item.title: Head of Engineering (Ruby/Rails) at Guide Financial (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
If you are Ruby/Rails rockstar, committed to changing the world, are excited by audacious technical challenges, have experience leading a high performing team, and also love rolling up your sleeves and directly contributing to software development (about 50% of the time) – this is your dream job. 


This is a critical position for us (we consider it our "third co-founder"), and will impact all aspects of our company. Ruby on Rails expertise is a requirement, as is prior experience managing a team.


Read more about Guide Financial here.


Responsibilities



  • Hire and manage an engineering team to build world-class software products that are well-designed, thoroughly tested, and highly scalable

  • Serve as a inspiring technology leader to develop, mentor, retain and grow a high performing team

  • Provide significant and ongoing individual software contributions as part of the development roadmap

  • Develop and collaborate on key architectural decisions and design considerations, within Guide Financial and across John Hancock Labs

  • Drive successful project execution on schedule and within budget

  • Ensure software engineering best practices are utilized and continuously monitored and improved

  • Work closely with other stakeholders (including design, data science, business strategy and operations, and others) to develop and deliver a product requirements

  • Continuously monitor and upgrade software to maintain industry-leading security and compliance requirements

item.title: Backend Developer C++ (m/w) at CeleraOne GmbH (Berlin, Germany)

  • Write multi-threaded C++ code using latest technologies (C++11, Boost, ZeroMQ, Intel TBB)

item.title: Back End Engineer at Skyscanner (Miami, FL)
item.description:
Skyscanner obtains data from multiple web scrapers, API feeds and external data sources to power its front end website, mobile applications and B2B partners. You will work in an energetic and intelligent team of developers to expand our world-class coverage of flight data and prices.


Our Backend Engineers are the backbone of our business. They build the engines that power Skyscanner and platforms that can cope with the millions of user visits every day.


As the primary technical point of contact for an important part of our system, the Partner Engineering team pride themselves on understanding and successfully delivering the business requirements of all departments.


What are some of the core responsibilities?



  • Ensuring that flight prices in Skyscanner products are accurate and up-to-date.

  • Creating seamless redirects to third party websites.

  • Assisting with the maintenance of existing scrapers and data sources

  • Increasing our global coverage of flight and price data, with focus on your local area.

  • Liaising with 3rd parties (travel agents and airlines) over new integrations and maintenance.

  • Working with test team to validate the quality of solutions.

  • Updating existing integrations to expose new data and support new product features.

item.title: Front End JavaScript Engineer for Connected Buildings Movement at Lucid (Oakland, CA)
item.description:
As part of the JavaScript engineering team you will work on our core platform, BuildingOS. You will write software that changes how people interact with commercial buildings, brings legacy building technology online, and enables the deployment of the next generation of building IoT devices. You will work closely with a world-class Product Design team to solve hard user interface problems, and you will contribute to the open source libraries and tools that we are using to solve those problems.


We are looking for an experienced engineer who writes simple, composable, and reusable UI code. You'll work on the new UI that we're building in React and Flux, and you'll help migrate our legacy Backbone and jQuery apps to the new framework. We love clear, elegant code, and we value tooling and testing that helps us to move fast and experiment with new ideas.


This position is full-time and based in our office in downtown Oakland, CA.


Responsibilities



  • Work with Product Designers to build analytics, data visualization, and mapping applications

  • Build efficient and reusable front-end components

  • Identify and address performance bottlenecks

  • Participate in design and code reviews

  • Communicate and advocate for best practices for front-end engineering

item.title: C# Software Developer at Volant Trading (New York, NY)
item.description: We are looking for a talented and motivated software engineer to join our development team. The candidate would focus mainly on the front end of our real time trading system in C# and may also work in C++ on the server side, which assembles and distributes data to the front end. This job is technically demanding due to the huge amount of data that needs to be processed in real time.

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer at AudienceScience (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
AudienceScience is seeking a Senior Software Development Engineer to join our team. As the Senior Software Development Engineer, you will work on an agile team in the big data arena, building the infrastructure to support AudienceScience® Helios, a global media buying platform using real-time bidding and behavioral targeting technologies. We currently handle upwards of 9 billion requests per day, aggregating all of this data on our Hadoop clusters. Distributed systems experience a big plus and Hadoop experience an even bigger plus.

  • Work with development leadership and product management to evaluate new product and feature requests and recommend solutions.

  • Provide mentorship to other developers.

  • Stay current on state of the art technologies, and make recommendations for how these may be used to improve our systems.

  • Play key role in recruiting and evaluating candidates for open positions.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Datto Inc (Norwalk, CT)
item.description: Datto is currently looking for passionate engineers to forge software for our internal and distributed systems and eager to implement new solutions.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Test at Kyruus, Inc. (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Position Summary:


We are looking for a passionate engineer to raise the bar on accelerating delivery and improving quality at Kyruus.  As a software engineer in the test organization, your responsibilities will be to create frameworks, tools, and applications that will drive the engineering organization to understand the current level of quality of our products, and identify where to invest in the creation of more tests. Simply put, your job is to enable product development by helping developers help themselves.

  • Build metrics to track and assess the quality of our releases

  • Create tools that will continue to allow the engineering team to scale while quickly delivering high quality software

  • Assess product quality through management and aggregation of information from test automation frameworks

  • Present quality metrics to enhance our overall process, advise the engineering leadership team on resource allocation and improvement strategies
