item.title: Senior Cloud Architect at Rubicon Labs, Inc. (Austin, TX)
item.description:
A critical component of the Rubicon cloud and Internet of Things (IoT) security platforms is a scalable trust infrastructure. This candidate will be responsible for driving innovation in design and development of a distributed cryptographic trust brokering service. This service will integrate with a custom Rubicon secure execution environment and must be architected with the following in mind: reliability, low-latency, redundancy, security, and as needed administrative functionality. Rapid prototyping will be done with cloud software emulation followed by customization for Rubicon trust server hardware that forms the foundation of server and device security.



The candidate will be a key contributor of the engineering team delivering our first generation enterprise security solution for Rubicon Labs. Duties will include:



  • Translating technical requirements to engineering tasks

  • Estimating level of effort for engineering tasks

  • Participating with the engineering team to drive architectural design

  • Collaborate with product and business development teams to define customer solutions

  • Prioritizing engineering tasks based on business objectives and customer needs

  • Implementing and unit testing new or modified system modules and/or features

  • Producing technical documentation

  • Acting as a mentor to junior members of the engineering team

  • Proactively keeping current with relevant technical trends, techniques, tools and systems

item.title: Director of Engineering, Programmatic TV at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Director of Engineering to lead a team to build the strategic programmatic TV products for TubeMogul.  Responsibilities include leading the team to make the right design decisions for front-end user interface, microservices, real-time bidding and partner integrations. 

The ideal candidate is highly organized, action-oriented, and accomplished in the development and deployment of "Web scale" systems.  You have a pragmatic, results-oriented approach to application architecture and are excited to work on a Javascript and Java application stack.

In this role, you will be expected to acquire a deep technical understanding of the product; plan, manage, and execute a development roadmap; as well as provide mentorship to the engineers on the team.  Ideally, you are familiar with the technologies we are using but you must possess a true passion for technology that is readily apparent in your past experience and/or personal projects. This position will report to the VP of Engineering.


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate closely with product management, operations, business and the executive teams to drive the execution of the product roadmap

  • Lead a team of talented engineers to build out products on the Programmatic TV roadmap

  • Drive architectural & design decisions for the full-stack product 

  • Track and manage key engineering metrics such as team velocity, quality and team morale 

  • Mentor & develop future technical and management leaders on the team

  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team

item.title: Engineering Manager - Technical leader for a Music Software Company at BMAT Music Innovation (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
BMAT is an innovative and fast growing software company with a team of young and international tech/music lovers located in the sunny Barcelona.


We are looking for an Engineering Manager who has the mission of leading outstanding technical teams like R&D, IT, Software Development, among others, to guarantee the quality in our product development and services for the music industry. You will report to the Board and works closely with other functional leaders in the company, being responsible for the translation of the company strategy to the technical team, managing them with a hands-on behavior to achieve the objectives in the expected timing and quality. You will be the responsible for all of the company’s product development activities and the satisfaction of the team members.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities



  • Develop strategic planning, direction and control of product development activities.

  • Provide technical direction and guidance, as well as hands-on project management, for all product development.

  • Ensure the optimal application of technology and engineering resources to meet product development and/or customer requirements

  • Detects conflicts and risks, find solutions and report them.

  • Ensure that the product is fully and correctly defined and documented.

  • Hire, coach and direct team members to acquire necessary resources to meet scheduled commitments.

  • Represent the company managing the customers during the process of product development and maintenance.

item.title: Senior Front-End Engineer at Synthace Ltd. (London, UK)
item.description:
Synthace Ltd. are looking for a talented and experienced front end engineer to spearhead development of the AnthaOS user interface.


Antha is a high level language transforming biological engineering by turning laboratory protocols into executable code defining physical operations such as liquid handling alongside logical operations and data processing. AnthaOS defines the execution environment for Antha processes and defines a number of front-end components for users to manage jobs, track stocks and examine data in addition to custom interfaces for more specialised purposes.


Day-to-day, you’ll be working with a tight-knit, multidisciplinary development team on an exciting project with plenty of technical challenge to get your teeth into. Technically, you’ll be delivering a web-based front end in Google Polymer across both mobile and desktop platforms, handling backend communications via SocketIO and RESTful services. Personally, you will be as meticulous in your attention to detail as you are uncompromising in your commitment to maintaining first class development practices and making user experience the first priority, values you will actively encourage in others.

item.title: Support Engineer, Contract at AudienceScience (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
You are a talented future Support Engineer for the ad technology leader AudienceScience.  You solve global campaign issues and you are a “force multiplier” for customer facing teams. You work alongside Campaign Managers, Data Analyst, Development Engineers, Infrastructure Engineers and you are key in delivering a state of the art media buying platform using real-time bidding and behavioral targeting technologies leveraged upon the latest open source technologies.  We are a big data company managing upwards of 25 billion transactions per day. The data is aggregated within large scale, Hadoop clusters providing world class service delivery.You want an opportunity that provides an opportunity to deliver innovative problem solving skills within a fast-paced, high growth and emerging digital ad arena with a tremendous opportunity to lead industry transformation. You know that moving from a manual and unclear digital media environment to a smart, technology-driven and transparent ad system is the future, and you want to join the paradigm shift.


DURATION: approximately 6 months


RESPONSIBILITIES:


* Work with customers to troubleshoot and resolve complex product issues


* Interface with our campaign management, tier one support, engineering teams and external vendors to resolve problems


* Identify and provide requirements for automation or other tools


* Document best practices for troubleshooting issues 


* Act as subject matter expert on how our products and systems work

item.title: Dev Ops Engineer at Datto Inc (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Datto® is the leading provider of comprehensive data backup, recovery and business continuity solutions with over five million end points protected and approximately 3,500 active revenue generating partners worldwide and growing. With its Total Data Protection Platform Datto’s mission is to protect business data everywhere it resides, whether on premise, in virtualized environments, in the cloud, and software-as-a-service (SaaS) applications including Salesforce, Google Apps, and more. Datto stores in its purpose built cloud over 140 petabytes of data worldwide for businesses ranging from Fortune 500 enterprises to small businesses.


  Datto’s core technologies such as instant virtualization, Screenshot Backup Verification™, Inverse Chain Technology™, Backup Insights™, and end-to-end encryption are the cornerstones of its innovative solutions. Industry firsts also include 24/7/365 in-house tech support, white glove customer success support, and time-based cloud retention, that empowers its partners with predictable cloud billing. The Datto product line consists of the Datto SIRIS Family, Datto ALTO Family, Datto NAS and Datto Backupify.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at Falcon Social (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Falcon Social is a Software-as-a-Service provider in the Social Media Management space. We provide a unified approach for marketers, customer service specialists and hr personnel of big international brands to manage their social media presence. That means plenty of challenging engineering tasks, complex UIs to simplify and data, loads of data.


We are looking for senior members for our engineering team. You are joining an ambitious team of experts who keep pushing the limit in product delivery and experiment furiously while striving for technical excellence.


We are agile, organized ourselves into cross-functional, autonomous teams, focusing on one product with a clear mission. We intend to be flat, with everyone equal and with each member's role respected. Day-to-day you will work together with people of different trades: frontend, backend engineers, ui/ux designers, cloud operation engineers, and product owners.


We are a maturing startup with an engineering headcount of 20. We are not small anymore, and still growing rapidly. Working at a startup is the most rewarding choice that one can make, but it requires a certain personality as well. That being said, we value open people who take initiative more than lone rockstars.


Falcon Social’s frontend is a single page web application built with AngularJs, Bower, Grunt, D3.js on top of a REST flavored HTTP+JSON api served by a lightweight Java8 backend running on DropWizard, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, AWS, Apache Spark and Python.


This job requires extensive Java programming language experience and also the knowledge of how modern Java is done. We favor lightweight frameworks like DropWizard, we value a good domain model (DDD), we think in single responsibility (micro)services, we prefer good refactoring skills, pragmatism and craftsmanship.

item.title: Senior Big Data / Cloud Architect - Bloomberg Vault at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg is looking for a Senior Software Developer for our cloud-based real-time content filtering and monitoring platform for e-mail, instant messaging, voice and social media data. The service is part of Bloomberg Vault.

Bloomberg Vault is a startup in Bloomberg Enterprise group developing a cloud-based compliance archiving service, eDiscovery tools and real-time compliance monitoring infrastructure. Our software, which is hosted in Bloomberg's private cloud, has gained rapid market adoption with over 700 enterprises and archives over 60 billion messages.

With the explosive growth of social media and web collaboration data real-time content filtering and monitoring is a crucial requirement for business of any size to stay compliant with regulations. Our infrastructure process over 200 million messages a day checking content and interaction patterns and providing analytics and event-driven reporting.

We are looking for experienced software developers who are or want to become experts in areas such as geo-distribution, real-time processing, service hosting, message orchestration, high-available, fault-tolerant and low latency computation.

Candidates must be able to work independently to find a path to success by researching and recommending alternatives when faced with challenging situations. Candidates should have a passion for technology and a flexible, creative approach to problem solving. They should be able to take ownership of business requirements and devise and develop solutions that meet customer needs. Time to market is critical.

item.title: Software Engineer - C#, VB.Net, ASP.Net, Sharepoint at King & Spalding LLP (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Responsible for working on complex software engagements and systems integration projects from a development standpoint. Serves as a lead on medium-sized projects dealing with data warehousing, data migration and architecting middleware to facilitate the exchange of data between enterprise applications. This person will help architect technical solutions and then handle the coding and implementation of the software engineering phase of the project. This person will work closely with Project Managers, Analysts, Usability Designers and the rest of the Software Engineering group. They may be called upon periodically to meet with end users to assist in architecting solutions with the Analysts. This position works closely with Usability Designers and other Software Engineers to create web based application interfaces for various firm databases and products.

Qualifications:



  • Extensive knowledge and experience with a wide variety of Microsoft development tools and languages including C# and ASP.Net within the .NET Framework, SQL Server and Active Directory.

  • Extensive experience working with basic web scripting such as HTML, JavaScript, CSS and other interfacing technologies needed to support substantial web-based software applications.

  • Thorough understanding of software development processes and best practices.

  • Ability to handle high-stress situations and deal successfully with conflict.

  • Excellent analytical and communication skills (written and verbal) and the ability to relate technical information to a non-technical audience.

  • Excellent work ethics and the ability to work as a part of a team to accomplish assigned tasks and responsibilities.

  • Ability to manage multiple assignments and varying priorities.

  • Very organized, responsible, goal oriented with attention to detail.

item.title: Software Engineer at Raise.com (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Job Description:


Raise is looking for its next generation of technical leaders.  As part of a cross-functional agile team, you strive to build user-focused solutions with technical superiority.  You balance usability needs with the functional and performance requirements befitting our global marketplace.  You share the knowledge gained through your career through mentoring, code reviews, and frequent pairing sessions.


As part of a small, fast growing team, there is immense growth potential both from an engineering as well as a business standpoint. If you're a smart, hardworking problem solver who enjoys working with autonomy, but understands how to take complete ownership of a project while meeting deadlines, this is the perfect role for you.


___


Raise Engineering:


Our software engineers are solving problems at scale for our online, gift card marketplace. Our user base and e-commerce transactions are growing exponentially. The challenges of keeping our services running 24x7, and adding new features to accelerate our business, all while moving incrementally to a continuous-deployment, microservice architecture are all awesome problems to solve. An understanding and commitment to our team approach to software development is of primary importance. Teams build software here. Besides obvious technical strengths, we look for passion for well-crafted software, professionalism, drive to learn new technologies, the joy of building solutions for our business and users, and the desire to cultivate a challenging, innovative, and supportive engineering culture.


Engineering teams at Raise have a great deal of autonomy and independence, with real ownership of the products and features they build. This role requires a unique balance of software-development skill and product sense — so the ideal candidate will have experience building substantial customer-facing products or services.


Impact- Raise is an engineering culture at its core. Our goal is to create an optimal environment where engineers regularly see and feel the difference they make.


Elegance - We care about code. Every engineer, from leadership to individual contributor, code on a daily basis.


Tackling Challenges - We don’t believe in being fast followers. Instead we’re focused on creating amazing experiences for customers while solving problems they knew existed.


Professional Growth - Each engineer has an individual career plan carved out for them upon joining Raise. Whether you want to be an individual contributor or have aspirations for leadership, we’ll work to help you realize your career goals.


Smart Team - Great people want to work around great people. We understand that, so we’ve created a thorough and systematic hiring process to ensure we only hire top quality engineers.


Disruptive Goals - Raise engineers think BIG. We never settle for mediocrity and are excited about our future.

item.title: Network Engineer at Best Friends Animal Society (Kanab, UT)
item.description:
Be more than an IT wizard! Be someone who saves the lives of animals. Best Friends Animal Society is looking for a Network Engineer.  We are working to end the killing of more than 9,000 dogs and cats who lose their lives in animal shelters daily, just for not having safe places to call home. It’s an enormous endeavor, and we need the support of a strong IT department. Come be a part of it, and never see a cubicle again. Here, IT works among the gorgeous red rock canyons of southern Utah in a warm and relaxed environment. And when you take a break, you can come pet some of the 1,700 animals who call Best Friends Animal Sanctuary their “home-between-home” on any given day.  You can spend your weekends hiking at Zion’s National Park! It’s a location you have to see to believe. And a career that will really make a difference in the lives of animals.  


Position Summary: Responsible for engineering, architecture and the daily management of Network Infrastructure, including Branch office, VPN and Data Center connectivity. Responsible for all upgrades and design engineering of complex network infrastructure, including LAN/WAN, Fiber Optic, Ethernet and Wireless infrastructures and network security. Network engineer works on projects as assigned, to integrate new systems into, as well as update, design and enhance, the existing network infrastructure.


Your main responsibilities will be working on Network Engineering, Voice Engineering/Architecture,  Fiber Optic/Data Infrastructure Engineering, System Engineering and Project Management.  


For a full description of responsiblities, please check out the posting on our Careers site.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Machine Learning Team at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Lead Software Engineer to join our machine learning team to help define our next-generation, optimization platform working closely with Data Scientists. 

We’re looking for highly-motivated individuals with the right skills to help us in developing systems that will have a direct influence on the success of the company. Candidates must have solid experience working on large-scale, distributed systems. This will be an opportunity to take a lead on several core projects with considerations on key architectural and design decisions. 

Join us as we pursue the goal of facilitating the merger of television and on-line media into a consistent experience accessible across any connected device including desktop, tablets, mobile devices and more.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead software development projects enhancing our distributed optimization service and data lake, the core of TubeMogul’s technology platform

  • Work with Data Scientists to implement optimizations to increase campaign effectiveness

  • Collaborate on key architectural decisions and design considerations

  • Monitor and plan out core infrastructure enhancements (a.k.a. stay ahead of possible scalability bottlenecks)

  • Troubleshoot and resolve system problems and customer issues under very tight service level agreement.

  • Mentor junior developers (i.e. demonstrate good coding practices and helping them architect code smartly)

  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team

item.title: Software Engineer Team Lead - Hadoop at trivago GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizon and develop new things to impress our 80 million users per month!

Due to trivago’s rapid international growth we are now creating an exciting new position for a skilled developer and expert on systems level to lead, inspire and grow our Hadoop development team. In this role you’ll have the overview of our big data architecture and implement your own ideas to strategically drive our Hadoop cluster to the next level. We want someone not only to use but to build a complex Hadoop cluster and data pipeline infrastructure. If you are passionate about using technology in creative ways and enjoy playing with big data then we want to hear from you!


Your tasks:



  • As an expert in your field, you will design, implement and maintain data integration and data warehouse based solutions using Hadoop.

  • Translate business requirements into technical implementations based on systems‘ capabilities.

  • Ensure the solutions being defined are reusable and follow standard design patterns and architecture principles of Hadoop.

  • Coach and mentor a growing team in an Apache Hadoop environment. On this note you will support the recruitment process of further team members and liaise with HR to devise innovative approaches to finding the next Hadoop prodigy.

  • Collaborate with and provide technical consultation to other Software Development, Operations, Product and Business Intelligence teams to define deliverables and plans.

  • We promote thinking outside the box so we encourage you to initiate, promote and allocate the resources for technological innovations.

item.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Application Developer at Weather Telematics Inc. (Ottawa, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Position Summary


Weather Telematics is pursuing candidates that are looking to get in on the ground floor of a fast paced innovative startup, poised for growth.  The company recently moved into is new open concept R&D headquarters located in the character rich Hintonburg neighbourhood of Ottawa.  The company is currently raising financing and is hiring self motivated individuals that thrive in a flexible and agile corporate culture, where their ideas are heard and aligned with the corporate culture and objectives.


The Senior Application Developer is a critical member of our product infrastructure development team.  They work closely with the COO, CTO, and other developers in a scrum/agile project approach.  They are fully involved in the discovery and development stages of a distributed internet of things (IoT) framework (backend and frontend) based on an AKKA/Scala (backend) and the Ruby on Rails web framework (frontend).  The backend of the platform will involve the development of data aggregation socket services and an extensive API (potentially built on Rails).  Portions of the project will involve engaging with Machine Learning researchers to develop a set of web visualizations based on underlying data analytics developed on a Ruby on Rails platform.


Responsibilities will include maintaining existing projects and developing new applications, managing projects, delegating work, and providing assistance to junior developers.

item.title: Software Engineer - Web and Mobile Technologies at Advanced Systems Concepts, Inc. (Morristown, NJ)
item.description:
Advanced Systems Concepts, Inc. (ASCI) is a Systems Software engineering company located in Morristown, NJ. We create software products of our own design and have done so for more than 30 years!  As we continue to grow, ASCI is looking for individuals who also enjoy the Software Engineering process using Agile/SCRUM methodologies, and who are looking to use the latest software technologies and tools to advance our company goals as well as their own understanding of software systems. A passion for Software Engineering along with the ability and desire to learn are key.


Responsibilities:



  • You will be part of a Scrum Development team working on Web and Mobile products.

  • As part of that team, you will be working on both Server and Client side aspects of the product.

  • You will be working on the latest software technologies that are used to build leading edge software products.

  • Candidates must be able to work independently as well as within a group. Attention to detail, positive attitude, the ability to learn and be challenged and pride in quality and timeliness are all attributes the successful candidate will have.

item.title: Forensisch software engineer big data at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Forensisch software engineer big data


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving



Ben jij een ervaren Java-ontwikkelaar?



Binnen het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) werkt een team gedreven softwareontwikkelaars aan vooruitstrevende forensische software. Je draagt in hoge mate bij aan de doorontwikkeling van het forensisch big data-platform Hansken.



Hansken wordt binnen en buiten het NFI gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering van ernstige misdrijven als kindermisbruik, moord, grootschalige fraude en andere delicten met grote maatschappelijke impact. Het platform draait op een gedistribueerde omgeving en verwerkt vele terabytes aan data per uur. Het analyseren van deze data kan miljoenen relevante sporen opleveren. Denk aan e-mails, chatberichten, GPS-coördinaten en dergelijke.



Door nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen blijft het een uitdaging om steeds nieuwe typen forensische sporen doorzoekbaar te maken of slimme analyses toe te voegen, zoals entiteitextractie voor herkenning van kentekens, IBAN-nummers of adressen. Naast het dienen van een belangrijk maatschappelijk belang is Hansken ook een technisch zeer uitdagend project waar je telkens met nieuwe technieken in aanraking komt. Bij dit R&D-project wordt gewerkt volgens een agile ontwikkelproces, met moderne ontwikkeltools die goed op elkaar aansluiten.



Als forensisch software engineer big data ontwikkel je samen met een team van ongeveer 8 collega’s het platform Hansken verder om onder meer de performance, schaalbaarheid en functionaliteit te verbeteren. Aan het systeem worden hoge eisen aan de kwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid gesteld. Daarom ben je kritisch over het functioneren ervan, durf je vragen te stellen en sta je open voor feedback. Naast je werk aan het systeem denk je mee over het continu verbeteren van het ontwikkelproces, waarbij de forensische kennis zo goed mogelijk geborgd wordt.

item.title: Senior tester forensische big data at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Senior tester forensische big data


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving



Ben jij een ervaren tester met kennis van big dataoplossingen?



Je bewaakt bij de groep Software Engineering van het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) de kwaliteit van het forensisch big data platform Hansken. Hiervoor ontwikkel je testen en voert ze uit.



Hansken wordt binnen en buiten het NFI gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering van ernstige misdrijven als kindermisbruik, moord, grootschalige fraude en andere delicten met grote maatschappelijke impact. Het platform draait op een gedistribueerde omgeving en verwerkt vele terabytes aan data per uur. Het analyseren van deze data kan miljoenen relevante sporen opleveren. Denk aan e-mails, chatberichten, GPS-coördinaten en dergelijke.



Door nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen blijft het een uitdaging om steeds nieuwe typen forensische sporen doorzoekbaar te maken of slimme analyses toe te voegen, zoals entiteitextractie voor herkenning van kentekens, IBAN-nummers of adressen. Als senior tester forensische big data geef jij invulling aan al het benodigde testwerk, waarbij je de functionaliteit van Hansken en de forensische integriteit van de resultaten waarborgt.



Bij Hansken wordt gewerkt volgens een agile ontwikkelproces, met moderne ontwikkeltools die goed op elkaar aansluiten. Hierbij geef jij op testgebied concrete invulling aan de sprintplanning. Je denkt daarbij fundamenteel na over het testen van deze complexe software en volgt de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op testgebied. Je zoekt de ontwikkelaars op om in een vroeg stadium testplannen te ontwikkelen en verwerkt deze tot uitvoerbare tests. Daarnaast zet jij het proces op voor het uitvoeren van acceptatietests, coördineer je de testactiviteiten en voert deze ook zelf uit. Je rapporteert de testresultaten aan het team en benadrukt pijnpunten.



Om Hansken continu te kunnen blijven verbeteren, zorg jij er met de ontwikkelaars voor dat testplannen worden omgezet in geautomatiseerde tests. Voor het geautomatiseerd testen van onze applicaties gebruiken wij op dit moment het test framework JBehave in combinatie met de Selenium web driver. Deze tests maken onderdeel uit van een continuous delivery proces, waarbij we vanuit onze issue tracker met 1 druk op de knop Hansken kunnen bouwen, testen en uitrollen.

item.title: Senior Data Engineer at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to help build and maintain the high-performance, high-volume services that receive, process, and store the tidal wave of incoming real-time data from thousands of customers and enables our entire line of products.

Researching storage solutions, developing low-latency fault-tolerant architectures, and implementing state-of-the-art distributed query algorithms is our bread-and-butter. We also dabble in the dark arts of high-throughput data pipelines and streaming data processing.


We’re interested in having a diverse team with a broad set of skills and viewpoints. If this seems like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you qualify, apply anyway!

item.title: Web Developer - Full Stack at HERE a Nokia Company (Berkeley, CA)
item.description:
Senior Web Developer/Tools Engineer



HERE Reality Lens Introduction:


Nokia HERE is a global leader in the mapping and location intelligence business. HERE Reality Lens utilizes advanced reality capture technologies to collect, process, and publish petabytes of street-level, aerial, and indoor spatial data to customers in over 72 countries around the world. These software and data services, the sixth largest on AWS, allow users to visualize high-resolution 3D panoramic and oblique imagery while interactively measuring, mapping, and modeling.


We use a lightweight agile process aimed at customer-driven milestones and give our engineers freedom in how they approach technical challenges. Engineering teams are supported with a highly automated continuous integration and deployment infrastructure.


Senior Web Developer / Tools Engineer:


As Senior Web Developer / Tools Engineer, you would help Reality Lens execute on our product vision, create great products, and make a great working environment. Your day will consist of tasks like researching, designing, implementing, and testing software. You should be a quick learner and communicate well. You're a team player who loves to both code and mentor others.


Ideal candidates will have developed and delivered scalable, robust API-driven services and data pipelines.



Responsibilities:



  • Create Canvas/WebGL and DOM-based solutions integrating 2D maps, 3D imagery and point clouds (aka “Smart Cities”).

  • Design and implement web-based tools for managing live operations and other shared platform services using a Node.js technology stack.

  • Integrate software with HERE platforms, processes, pipelines, and products.

  • Choose and implement analysis and design patterns and algorithms that enable systems or features to meet business and technical requirements.

  • Design data models for SQL and NoSQL databases and caches. (MySQL, MongoDB, Redis).

item.title: Software Developer - Data and Intelligence at Optiver US LLC (Chicago, IL)
item.description: Our data and intelligence developers create software which drives Optiver's strategic planning. We face a variety of problems with high degrees of difficulty focused primarily on data: processing and storing information coming in at extremely high bandwidth, cleaning and organizing data from vastly disparate sources in a query-able fashion, and building flexible tools which allow employees in every role to make sense of this mountain of information. If you love dealing with massive amounts of data and want to build the software which drives the strategic decisions which have allowed Optiver to be a pillar of the options market for nearly thirty years, we have a spot for you.

item.title: Sr. Development Engineer at AudienceScience (Pune, India)
item.description:
AudienceScience is seeking a talented Sr. Development Engineer to join our team. You’ll be responsible for the development of products and tools for the AudienceScience® Helios, a global media buying platform using real-time bidding and behavioral targeting technologies. We currently handle upwards of 9 billion requests per day, aggregating all of this data on our Hadoop clusters. Distributed systems experience a big plus.


 RESPONSIBILITIES:


* Work with Chief Architect to design and build scalable, efficient, distributed systems to meet business objectives following best practices for quality, testability and operability.


* Perform code reviews.


* Provide third-tier support for production systems.


* Work with development leadership and product management to evaluate new product and feature requests and recommend solutions.


* Provide mentorship to other developers.


* Stay current on state of the art technologies, and make recommendations for how these may be used to improve our systems.


* Play key role in recruiting and evaluating candidates for open positions.

item.title: Senior Java Server Engineer at Intensity (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Senior Java Server Engineer – Pioneering Business Forecasts and Data Visualizations


Specific responsibilities and duties for the Senior Java Server Engineer include:



  • Participate in design and development of enterprise-class cloud-hosted web applications

  • Design and implement robust, secure RESTful APIs for interactive analytical systems

  • Write high quality, well-tested code

  • Contribute to all phases of software engineering from requirements definition to production releases

  • Collaborate with product managers, UI designers, and front-end developers to define functional requirements and translate them into technical requirements

  • Rapidly solve problems and fix bugs

  • Work with technology partners and vendors as required

item.title: Data Visualization Application Developer at Esri (Redlands, CA)
item.description:
Are you excited by the potential to develop web, mobile, and tablet apps that thousands of people will use to tell their own stories? Do you love incorporating data visualization and geospatial concepts into what you do? We’re seeking a talented and ambitious developer to perform creative, groundbreaking work on a small, highly collaborative team of creative and motivated professionals.



Story Maps are open-source apps that combine interactive maps with multimedia content and innovative user experiences to tell informative and inspiring geography-based stories.



Responsibilities:



  • Develop and prototype responsive web applications and UI modules in JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS

  • Conceptualize and prototype innovative ways to combine maps, charts, timelines, and info-graphics into user-friendly storytelling applications

  • Work closely with software developers, product engineers, UX/UI designers, and story tellers in a highly interactive and creative environment

  • Solve technical challenges efficiently and effectively

  • Identify and leverage the latest technology and methodology

  • Document functionalities, processes, and best practices to support the growing community of story map authors

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at TGS Management Company (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
Software engineers play a vital role in the success of our business and form a core part of the organization. We tend to look for talented generalists who are capable of working in a variety of areas, some of which include large scale distributed systems, high-performance multi-threaded trading platforms, and data feed platforms. Successful candidates will have the flexibility and skills to contribute in one or more of the following domains:



  • Development and maintenance of large, complex software and hardware systems, including identification of bottlenecks and optimization of performance.

  • Development and design of monitoring tools, including user interfaces, to analyze data from all aspects of our existing system.

  • Parsing, processing, and analyzing large financial data sets.

item.title: Software Developer, SaaS at OSIsoft (San Leandro, CA)
item.description:
As a SaaS Developer, you will focus on creating highly-scalable, multi-tenant solutions with continuous integration and delivery. You should have an appreciation for distributed computing patterns and practices and how they can be leveraged to create robust solutions which can scale elastically with demand. You should be comfortable with the extreme agile methodologies required to evolve a modern SaaS solution.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:


Responsible for producing software programs including, but not limited to:



  • Architecting and designing software programs. 

  • Developing and coding software.

  • Mentoring team members.

  • Product design and implementation presentations to team members and management.

  • Technical support of products including direct customer support and escalated issues.

  • Product behavior and implementation documentation, including design whitepapers and end user documentation.

  • Technical advancement via self-motivated research, formal training and course work, and technical conferences.

item.title: PHP Developer at Toptal (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a PHP Developer motivated about developing web solutions ranging from managing back-end services to handling interchange of data between the server and front-end. Your primary focus will be the development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will work both on projects requiring you to directly handle UI and on projects in which a co-worker will handle most of the UI.


By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.


This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.


Responsibilities



  • Integrate user-facing elements developed by front-end developers.

  • Handle server/front-end data interchange and work on front-end as needed.

  • Build efficient, testable, and reusable PHP modules.

  • Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges.

  • Ensure high performance and optimize speed in the back-end.

  • Integrate data storage solutions, including work with databases, key-value stores, blob stores, etc.

  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Web Front End at Avigilon (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
Avigilon’s business intelligence group is seeking an experienced front-end software developer to participate in the development of responsive user interface presenting users with real-time notifications and advanced data visualizations.



The candidate must have experience in the following areas:



  • Implementing a production user interface based on wireframes and storyboards

  • Producing robust, intuitive and responsive data visualizations

  • Interfacing third-party services for reporting, notifications, and data visualization

  • Collaboration with product teams and UX designers


Our office is currently located on Middlesex Turnpike, Billerica but relocating to Assembly Row, Somerville in November.

item.title: Cloud Engineer- Python, Scala, Distributed Systems for Hot Open Source Company at Elastic (Mountain View, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Elastic is building out our Found Team focusing on Elasticsearch as a Service.  This is a great opportunity to help lead our Cloud efforts and make an immediate impact to our strategy and implementation. Note this role is remote Or can be at our offices in Mt View CA, Phoenix AZ, Berlin, London or Sydney


Our cloud product allows users to create new clusters or expand existing ones easily This  product would be built on technologies such as  OpenStack, AWS, Docker, and others to enable the Operations Teams to easily create and manage multiple Elasticsearch clusters.


Job Duties and Requirements



  • This person will develop software for our distributed systems and ES as a Service offerings.

  • This person will be familiar with failures and complications related to a cloud offering.

  • Help build the Found offering and work closely with the Found Product and Engineering Team.

  • Assist in designing a scalable cloud offering working across multiple clusters.

item.title: Senior Web Services Engineer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

What does it take to bring up-to-the-minute news and video to 40+ million unique users per month? Bloomberg R&D's Web Shared Services team is responsible for doing that and more by engineering the world-class services infrastructure powering Bloomberg.com, News & Multimedia mobile apps, and other Bloomberg products.

Becoming the world's most influential news organization comes with unique challenges. Our team...
- Operates in a highly transparent ecosystem of advanced technical teams.
- Works in a close partnership with the industry's best product managers.
- Provides Web services which respond to more than a quarter of a billion requests daily.
- Presents product teams with a consistent API spanning numerous internal data sources and organizations.
- Integrates personalization tools to surface the most relevant information at the right time.
- Helps millions of users keep watch over their portfolios on the go.
- Keeps the world informed with smart push notifications and relevant alerts.

We focus specifically on...
- Performance and scalability of services and underlying data stores.
- Proactive, actionable monitoring and automated alerting.
- Service availability during deployments, maintenance and outages.
- Best practices in areas such as API design, data governance and component reusability.

item.title: Senior Java Developer at XSB, Inc. (Setauket- East Setauket, NY)
item.description:
The Senior Java Developer position will be critical to XSB's growth.  We are looking for applicants who have experience with industry best practices in software engineering and who have familiarity with working  through  the  design,  development,  release  cycle,  and  delivering  software  product  to  market.  A strong candidate will have expertise in software design, back-end programming, documentation and testing, and technical management.


Job Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Oversee and participate in the development, release, and maintenance of software applications; ensure that all code is clean, maintainable, extensible and well tested

  • Support continuous improvements to our development processes

  • Evaluate and identify appropriate technology platforms (including web application frameworks and the deployment stack) for delivering the company’s products and services

  • Evolve  existing  software  system  applications  and  architecture  in  various  areas  as  needed; ensure that systems are robust to high usage and resilient to failures

  • Work together with Senior Management to plan and execute projects by establishing realistic estimates for timelines and budgets and ensuring that projects remain on target to meet deadlines

  • Coach and motivate team members to achieve optimum performance levels and career development

  • Teach, learn and innovate

item.title: Python Software Engineer at CodiLime Sp. z o.o. (Warszawa, Polska)
item.description:
CodiLime realizes projects for clients from all over the world, e.g. California, Japan, Israel, Malta and Scandinavia, rendering services to such companies as NTT, AT&T, Hitachi High Technologies, Juniper Networks, GigaSpaces, Mirantis.We work with cutting edge IT technologies in the following areas: Machine Learning & BigData, Cloud Computing, Software Defined Network. We code in Python, Java, Scala i C++, and use various tools, technologies and frameworks, including Celery, Hadoop, Spark, Flask, AngularJS. We work in accordance with Agile methodologies and Clean Code practices using tools such as JIRA, Jenkins or Gerrit.


Examples of projects under realization:


1. Together with our client’s team we take part in developing an open source system for management of complex cloud applications. Our task is to develop parts of the system responsible for monitoring virtual machines as well as processes taking place there and to produce an appropriate reaction of the system to the noticed problems. Additionally, we also work on integrating the system with other open source systems, such as Docker, SaltStack, JBoss, etc. Technologies: Python, Celery, Riemann, RabbitMQ, Cloud (OpenStack, AWS),Vagrant.


2. We create a system that predicts failures of medical devices. This is a two-phase project. At the first stage an IT system is designed for uploading measurement data from the devices, dividing calculations into a set of tasks, running them in parallel and presenting the results. The second phase includes time series (sensor data) analytics and estimating the risk of failure of given device. Technologies: Python, Celery, RabbitMQ, Azure.

item.title: Software Engineer - Build To Scale at Reveal Mobile (Raleigh, NC)
item.description:
Reveal Mobile builds cutting-edge mobile analytics products, and we need talented engineers who thrive in a fast-paced startup environment. New hires work alongside our top-notch engineers and product team to design, implement, and deliver our highly ambitious products. We don’t hire using a checklist (5 years of that, 3 years of this, etc.). It’s all about your passion and dedication to the craft of software. 


Your Responsibilities:



  • Build innovative, scalable application systems. Scalable is the keyword in that sentence. Our product touches millions of mobile devices every month.

  • Write maintainable code, working in a professional software engineering environment (source control, shortened release cycles, continuous integration and deployment, etc.).

  • Welcome change and complexity. We are on the leading, sometimes bleeding, edge of mobile development. That requires us to learn quickly and adapt fast. We are looking for folks to lead that charge, not just keep up with it.

item.title: Database Engineer - PostgreSQL at Amplify Technologies (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Amplify are looking for an experienced Database Engineer to ensure the data integrity of our rapidly evolving, open-source, Web-based marketing product.


Our ideal candidate is skilled in logical and physical database design for web-based transactional environments, the creation of SQL and stored procedures and expert in data quality and data cleansing processes.


This role will collaborate directly with the product manager and development team to identify and understand source data systems, as well as provide input for enhancements for standardization and consistency across the application. This position presents an opportunity to test and shape your professional potential - you’ll have significant impact on the products you develop and influence on the direction of the company. At Amplify your technical ability and creativity will be allowed to shine.


Our company culture is entrepreneurial and practical; our working style agile and collaborative. It’s an environment that demands a personality that can take initiative and lead and rewards a good team player. If you’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty you’ll fit right in. Code Divas need not apply.

item.title: Algorithmic Software Engineer (junior/senior) (Berlin, Dublin) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY



As a Zalando Algorithms Software Engineer, you will design and build the personalization, recommendation and optimization engines driving customer experiences enjoyed by millions of people. Whether junior- or senior-level, you will have the freedom to challenge our status-quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will be able to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand - while receiving meaningful support at every step.



WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  



  • A degree in mathematics, physics, statistics or computer science

  • At least one year of professional experience programming in Java, Scala, or Python

  • Solid knowledge of algorithms and data structures

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills and a demonstrated ability to find creative solutions to technical algorithmic problems

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures, distributed systems and RESTful APIs

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services

  • English language fluency


Additional preferred skills



  • Knowledge of applied machine learning / data mining techniques

  • Knowledge of graph theory, combinatorics and optimization methods

  • Experience with building and / or running large-scale applications

  • Experience with building applications using large data sets

  • Knowledge of R or other machine learning tools (Mahout, Spark, etc.)



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Research, design and implement algorithms to improve our recommendation, personalization and optimization engines

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability

  • Communicate effectively with our engineering, data science and algorithmic research teams and use agile processes

  • Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment



WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US



  • One-month mentoring program

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to networking with industry leaders

  • Community: hack week’s, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • Zalando shopping discount and commute discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals



ABOUT ZALANDO


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.



WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Elena Ognyanova at jobs@zalando.de.

item.title: Sr. JavaScript Framework Developer - JS/UI at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

This is a key position in our UI Infrastructure Core Tech team responsible for driving next-gen Bloomberg development platforms enterprise-wide.

In this role you will be a key member of the team developing the JavaScript platform that provides the building blocks, framework, and infrastructure used by the firm's 3000+ R&D employees to build high-quality, high-performance applications used both internally and externally. The successful candidate will have experience implementing performant JavaScript applications with an emphasis on optimization, API design, and architecture. This is an opportunity to directly affect the daily lives of internal developers using a modern stack of JavaScript technologies to enable highly interactive desktop applications. Emphasis will be placed on developing well-tested and structured code, and the ability to work in a highly collaborative and fast moving environment.

item.title: Senior Software Developer - JavaScript at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

We are looking for experienced JavaScript developers to join Bloomberg's Execution Management System (EMS) team. You will be a part of a team building the next-generation of world's most popular EMS, which connects traders from around the globe to the most far reaching broker community. Our system provides class leading data visualizations, trading tools, and user interfaces to allow traders to focus on execution quality and market moving events. You'll have the chance to re-imagine, develop, and deploy a product that is relied upon by thousands of traders every single day.

item.title: Research Engineer at Ditto Technologies (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
You...



  • Love building cutting-edge technology

  • Believe that forming premature theories upon insufficient data is a vice

  • Describe yourself as a self-starter, proactive, positive, creative, and flexible

  • Write clean and easy to read code

  • Are excited to work with a small and talented team of researchers and engineers

  • Are willing to commute to DITTO's office at 19 S Park St San Francisco, CA (blocks from the Caltrain)



Responsibilities



  • Be a part of research team and report directly to DITTO’s CSO, Dmitry Kornilov

  • Work on computer vision-based recommendation engine

  • Improve and advance company’s core technology — 3D virtual try-on for eyewear

  • Apply latest state-of-the-art deep learning techniques to improve facial features detection



Perks



  • You’ll be employee #14 or 15 at this location with real equity

  • Vacation, take it when you need it, no defined schedule

  • You pick your setup (computer/monitor/etc)

  • Endless snacks and drinks

  • Cookouts in South Park every third week when we finish a Milestone

item.title: Creative developer (frontend, personalization, profit) at Scarab Research (Budapest, Hungary)
item.description:
We need your help in putting a friendly face on our stone-cold machine learning technologies!


Join us in designing and building the next generation of personalized user interfaces. Innovate on how we present personalized content to end-users and how clients interact with a complex machine learning system.


Why Scarab Research?


Scarab is part of the fresh and upcoming technology startup scene and community of Budapest. We can offer you the ideal combination: a startup with traction and a stable financial background.


High impact, high growth – our recommendations reach millions of visitors every day. Our user-base is expanding rapidly internationally.


Great team – work with a small, cross-functional team of highly skilled engineers (ex-Google, ex-Toshiba R&D).


Lean startup – we apply agile principles both in business and in software development.

item.title: Account Executive at Rocana (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
This position is responsible for selling Rocana solutions to enterprise customers. This is an exciting opportunity to bring disruptive technology to market for a well-funded, high growth technology company. 


Responsibilities:



  • Manage and grow revenue and market share at designated accounts to maximize customer satisfaction and achieve company's strategic objectives.

  • Develop and maintain client relationships to ultimately drive revenue growth.

  • Develop and execute account strategy by collaborating with account team to deliver stronger more relevant value propositions.

  • Focus on customer satisfaction, understand the customer's business and workflow, develop proper contact network within accounts.

  • Support execution of strategy at the account level.

  • Work with and bring in experts/specialists where required, have oversight of all account activities.

  • Responsible for forecasting, keeping management in touch with accounts in a timely fashion, gathering intelligence on competitor activity, and providing feedback to marketing.

  • Track customer activity with internal systems in order to execute on account strategy and identify additional opportunities.

item.title: C/C++ Software Engineer at Intel Corporation (Shannon, Ireland)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer / Technical Lead, you will work with Intel Shannon DCG/NPG Software development team to deliver leading edge enterprise and communications platforms that will enable tomorrow’s Data Centre infrastructure and accelerate cloud computing adoption from high-end co-processors for supercomputers to low-energy systems, as well as solutions for big data and intelligent devices.


You will be based in Shannon, Co. Clare as a member of a talented team of software engineers with a broad range of experience. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with multi-site projects working on cutting edge hardware. You will enjoy a world class work environment and you will be empowered to full fill your greatest ambitions.

item.title: Senior Frontend Engineer at Falcon Social (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Falcon Social is a Software-as-a-Service provider in the Social Media Management space. We provide a unified approach for marketers, customer service specialists and hr personnel of big international brands to manage their social media presence. That means plenty of challenging engineering tasks, complex UIs to simplify and data, loads of data.


We are looking for senior members for our engineering team. You are joining an ambitious team of experts who keep pushing the limit in product delivery and experiment furiously, while striving for technical excellence.


We are agile, organized ourselves into cross-functional, autonomous teams, focusing on one product with a clear mission. We intend to be flat, with everyone equal and with each member's role respected. Day-to-day you will work together with people of different trades: frontend, backend engineers, ui/ux designers, cloud operation engineers, and product owners.


We are a maturing startup with an engineering headcount of 20. We are not small anymore, and still growing rapidly. Working at a startup is the most rewarding choice what one can make, but it requires a certain personality as well. That being said, we value open people who take initiative more than lone rockstars.


Falcon Social’s frontend is a single page web application built with AngularJs, Require.js, Bower, Grunt, D3.js on top of a REST flavored HTTP+JSON api served by a lighthweight Java8 backend running on DropWizzard, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, AWS, Apache Spark and Python.


Extensive experience with a modern MVC Javascript framework (Ember, Angular, Knockout) is a must for this position.

item.title: Affect Social Change as a Senior DevOps Engineer with Blackbaud at Blackbaud (Charleston, SC)
item.description:
As our Software Engineer in DevOps you will work as a member of the technology team to create, manage, and monitor our application infrastructure, release pipeline, and continuous deployments that enable nonprofits world-wide to execute on their mission. You will work with other engineering and operations team members to develop, maintain, and optimize multiple levels of infrastructure, lead conversations around application implementation, and help make engineering pipedreams possible. In this role you will help build an agile operations model to support Blackbaud’s entire product line while maintaining the high level of reliable services our clients need. This is a highly visible and challenging opportunity that will bring you to the next step in your career.


Responsibilities:



  • Design, build and maintain as release pipeline and pipeline process to help engineering teams guarantee successful production deployments

  • Ensure application performance in production to scale, provide infrastructure and architecture guidance to engineering teams, and trending monitoring to find and address issues before clients even know they exist.

  • Update the data center infrastructure through automation for scaling the services and reducing costs in both private and public cloud environments.

  • Ensure the SLA for Blackbaud services with a high-availability system design and production-monitoring plan.

  • Ensure the security and integrity of Blackbaud’s cloud services

  • Plan, implement, and test disaster recovery plans for all SaaS products

item.title: Jr. Network Engineer at Augmedix (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: A successful Network Engineer will have a proven record of engineering and implementation of network infrastructure, a strong sense of commitment, is highly business-oriented and skilled at delivering robust system solutions. You will collaborate with peers to deliver consistent world class network services for Augmedix and our customers. You will contribute to the global system architecture by ensuring a consistent standardization of the systems. This is a cross functional opportunity and will involve both networking and systems engineering. You will report to the Head of Network Engineering and act in the capacity of technical lead to other technical support staff.

item.title: Sr. Network Engineer at Augmedix (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: The Senior Network Engineer will be responsible for the architecture, implementation, and scale of the production & corporate network. At Augmedix, we use cutting-edge technology to give nimble business owners a competitive advantage in their customer interactions. We work on a broad range of business initiatives and objectives by leveraging a wide set of technologies and tools. Our network topology is designed using OSPF, BGP, and EIGRP routing protocols. Our customer’s infrastructure operates Cisco Nexus, Catalyst, Cisco wireless concentrators and ISR platform devices. We continue to introduce Cisco Meraki AP’s to our smaller customers and are currently working on a WAN Optimization project.

item.title: Principal Technical Program Manager, Alexa at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Interested in Amazon Echo and Alexa? We’ve already added dozens of new capabilities to Alexa since launch, including Pandora, Google Calendar, Audible, sports scores and schedules, and more. But it’s still day 1 - you can be part of the team that makes Alexa smarter by creating new skills and capabilities.



You will have an enormous opportunity to impact the customer experience, design, architecture, and implementation of cutting edge products that will be used every day by people you know. No matter what the role, we’re looking for people who are passionate about innovating on behalf of customers, demonstrate a high degree of product ownership, and want to have fun while they make history.



The Principal Technical Program Manager role requires working with product management to define strategy and requirements, and leading cross functional development teams from design through delivery, and managing all related timelines. This position involves regular communication with senior management on status, risks and change control. Cross-team coordination, project management and executive presentation skills are essential.



The ideal candidate is a creative, demonstrated leader/manager with superior analytical abilities. This opportunity requires excellent technical, problem-solving, and communication skills. The candidate is not just a policy maker/spokesperson but drives to get things done. At the core of the position is delivery.



We are looking for a strongly technical, customer-focused Principal Technical Program Manager with skills that span research science, software engineering, product management and sheer vision. In this role you will:



- Own and manage customer directions in speech interfaces, defining the vision for the voice experience and unfailingly delivering in the customer’s interest;

- Use your depth in spoken language understanding technologies to drive investments in accuracy and end-to-end voice experience quality;

- Drive solutions from the data - dive deep into experience data to identify problems and push for solutions, writing your own analytic scripts and tools where necessary;

- Find the opportunities for multiplying innovation across different customers, ploughing individual technology advances into the core science and platforms;

- Drive consistent results and customer impact across the scientific and engineering teams.


  • Product development experience (including C++, Java, XML, messaging protocols, and Web Services)

  • Experience building processes, project management, and release schedules

  • 8+ years of relevant work experience in internet-related program and/or technical product management in a software applications environment

  • Bachelors degree in computer science, engineering or a related technical discipline




  • Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

  • Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, evaluate alternatives and develop processes and tools as needed to support the organization.

  • Experience developing in a Linux environment and in utilizing virtual machines

  • Knowledge of industry standard test automation tools and experience in developing product test harnesses and instrumenting products to gather test results

  • Experience with test driven development and establishing unit test infrastructures

  • Experience automating the validating of modern user interfaces and messaging infrastructures

  • Experience with evaluating and integrating open source and in house developed toolsets

  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to generate and communicate meaningful development metrics

  • Expert in software quality and testing methodologies

  • Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, dynamic work environment

  • Experienced in interacting and coordinating test activities amongst multiple teams

  • Experience with Web Services is a plus


Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority/Female/Disability/Vet

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer at Chatham Financial (Kennett Square, PA)
item.description:
This position is part of our models team, which is responsible for developing robust and scalable services to enable cutting-edge financial applications. Our models are implemented in a micro service architecture designed to support a variety of internal and external user applications. We are looking for developers who are interested in both software engineering and computation, with skills and experience including:



  • Object-oriented design patterns; languages including C#, C++ or Java; web frameworks like Microsoft MVC and angular.js; and relational and NoSQL databases.

  • Quantitative and modeling skills with an ability to learn techniques in numerical optimization, data mining, simulation, or model calibration.

  • Comfort with full stack software development, including computationally intense back-end development and service design, data storage and access models, enterprise level messaging patterns, and modern web development frameworks.

  • Proclivity towards refactoring and continuously improving OO code through agile development methods.

  • Testing skills including use of inversion of control, mocks, and stubs in unit testing and BDD testing frameworks like specflow and cucumber.


Additionally engineers on the models team work directly with operational teams, other software engineering and design teams, and our quant team comprised of Mathematics and Physics Ph.D.’s. Members of this team gain knowledge of our business and the mathematical models used in modern finance, and have the ability to deliver robust and scalable software meeting the needs of a variety of business users. The team has a strong core of existing developers who can help new members gain this knowledge.


Although not required, a typical successful candidate may have been involved in



  • Mathematical/quantitative competitions.

  • Open source development projects.

  • Advanced degrees in mathematics, computer science, engineering, or sciences.

  • R&D experience at the collegiate or professional level.


Our technology stack is constantly evolving but currently includes .Net, ServiceStack, RabbitMQ, SQL-Server, ASP .Net MVC, angular.js, Memcached, Redis, various Amazon web services, unmanaged C code, Nvidia Cuda, and Python. We also use developer tools like Team City, Subversion, Specflow, Graylog, and Visual Studio. We have specialized design, database administration, devops, and IT infrastructure teams to allow software engineers to focus on software engineering.


Finally, we work in a rapidly-changing, high-performance environment that relies on excellent communication and collaboration, so we look for people that are energized by being part of great teams, and looking to challenge themselves to learn new technologies and apply them to our technology stack. Most new employees say that Chatham is both the most challenging and most rewarding place at which they have ever worked. If this applies to you, we’d be interested to hear from you.

item.title: Sr Site Reliability Engineer at OpenX (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
Would you like to work on one of the world’s hottest advertising technology platforms? Do you revel in the challenge of managing web-scale services and their underlying infrastructure, including thousands of globally distributed servers? Do you enjoy combining your software engineering, networking, and systems administration experience and expertise to build highly available, reliable, secure, and performant services? Are you passionate about DevOps?


OpenX, a leading provider of digital and mobile advertising technology, seeks a Sr Site Reliability Engineer to join our Application Engineering team responsible for the operability and support of OpenX systems and services. OpenX serves hundreds of thousands of requests per second from thousands of servers across a worldwide datacenter footprint.


You will take a proactive approach to maintain and improve service uptime and you will scale our systems for continued rapid growth. You will take part in the design of our services and be an active participant in the software development lifecycle, partnering with software engineers and product to deliver a world-class service. Additionally, you will handle planned or unplanned maintenance events and will execute a consistent software release process.


You ideally have experience with large-scale management of thousands of physical servers. You have excellent communication skills that enable you to collaborate with varying disciplines, both technical and non-technical. You are a self-starter, able to self-manage with minimal supervision, and have demonstrated the ability to lead groups to the right decision.


Developing for and supporting our infrastructure presents many interesting technical challenges. We especially desire candidates with a passion for open-source software and an interest in the latest system architecture trends, for example: OpenStack, Docker, CoreOS, Dais, Flynn, or other container-based or PaaS solutions.

item.title: Lead Application Developer (Java) at ADP (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
With ADP building a start up culture in Pasadena we are able to accelerate new products focused on Customer Driven Design, Data Visualization, Social, Mobile and Digital Payments. In Pasadena we are building a culture driven by "LeanStartup" principles with co-located teams, empowered to make decisions and fail fast along the way. Our goal for the Pasadena Innovation Labs is to have small teams with development, design and product focused on BIG customers problems with simple elegant solutions our customers will LOVE.


We are seeking diverse Java Engineering talent with different experiences, backgrounds, education, creative expertise, technical acumen, etc. that will offer new perspectives and challenge convention as we focus on the future of ADP for years to come.


The Lead Software Engineer will work in a team of Java engineers to create scalable and robust SmartCompliance backend applications and services. We are using the Java with Spring framework building RESTful webservices and other application services. This is the perfect time for an enthusiastic engineer to add your knowledge of API's, RESTful webservices and various technologies to the team so that we can deliver a superior user experience to ADP SmartCompliance users!


We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Join a team of talented software engineers, plan, execute and deliver top quality software deliverables on-time.

  • Act as a primary, dedicated technology interface owning the technical responsibility for architecture, analysis, design, development, and implementation of responsive user interface. 

  • Work closely with product to define and implement and improve user experience.

  • Overall, you will be responsible for day-to-day task management and sprint planning, working closely with product and stakeholders, participating in design sessions, leading and mentoring engineers to ensure that they follow best practices and guidelines, performing heads-down development, working on technical integrations with frontend UIs and other Backend APIs, and working with QA to assure top quality deliverables on-time.

item.title: Senior Front-End Developer at Rapid7 (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Job Overview


Be part of the security software revolution with Rapid7. Join the Threat Exposure Management team in Austin, Texas and work on strategic, highly-visible products and features utilizing cutting edge technologies. We seek self-organized, highly motivated team members whose focus is to "make it happen." 


The ideal candidate is a passionate problem solver who is willing to learn new skills and new technologies. Experience with front end development, agile development, and the security industry are strong pluses. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of the next generation of security solutions and is open to enthusiastic and talented front end developers.


Job Responsibilities



  • Incrementally deliver features taking them from user requirements to product release with feedback from Product Owners, Architects, Quality Engineering and Release Engineering.

  • Contribute as a team member on a cross-functional scrum team in charge of delivering new features on a bi-weekly basis.

  • Participate with scrum team to plan and commit to iterations of feature development.

  • Drive towards delivery of those commitments throughout the iteration and raise risks early.

  • Actively engage in overall quality engineering through the implementation of tests at the unit (TDD) and feature (BDD) levels.

  • Demonstrate eagerness to learn new technologies and explore new problem domains.

item.title: wanted: Android Engineer hacker / bandmate at The Hackerati (New York, NY)
item.description:
What We Do


Technology Consultancy


The Hackerati is a high-end, boutique consulting firm delivering Engineering as a Service to diverse clients, from Fortune 250s to startups.


Why You Should Join Us


We're not afraid to be our wild selves.


We’re different. With mottos like be fearless and weird is good, our unique perspectives on life and technology make us great people to learn from and work/party with. We sponsor lunches and happy hours, band practice, electronics like Glass/Oculus/Myo, and we’ve presented at the UN—twice. We rock that familial vibe, and you should join us if you enjoy a blurred line between work and play.


What To Expect


Deliver the industry's most challenging projects.


Hackerati consultants are like The Wolf from Pulp Fiction: we solve problems. Hard ones. To do so, we deploy teams of Hackerati to work onsite with clients around NYC, and also build products in-house, both for ourselves and clients. A typical project lasts between 6 and 9 months—Thus there is constant diversity of work.

item.title: Software Engineer (Computational Geometry) at Plethora (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Computational Geometry Engineer for CAD
You’ll be helping us build our add-ins for CAD applications that provide helpful real-time manufacturability feedback, pricing and ordering.
Responsibilities



  • Work on our CAD add-in team implementing algorithms for geometric analysis, feature detection, and design rule checks for various manufacturing processes such as CNC machining.

  • Analyze production data to improve algorithms for error detection, part costing, etc.

item.title: Android Engineer at Ambassador (Detroit, MI)
item.description:
Ambassador is looking for talented Android engineers who are interested in solving complex problems and shipping beautiful products as part of an ambitious, world-class engineering team. Ambassador engineers demand quality and efficiency and love taking on responsibility and freedom to make large impacts.


WHAT YOU'LL DO



  • Design and build advanced apps and features from the ground up for the Android platform

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship extraordinary products

  • Practice disciplined software engineering (automated testing, code reviews, and clean, pragmatic code)
