  • Be flexible, grow, and learn fast in a fun yet professional startup environment

item.title: Devops Engineer at Rally Health, Inc. (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
DevOps Engineers at Rally Health work incredibly close with our engineering and product teams to help design, implement, and scale our predominantly Scala and MongoDB based architecture. We are obsessively focused on maintaining high availability for all of the services we manage, while also implementing the infrastructure solutions that our product teams need in order to succeed.


If you have implemented and supported a cutting edge public cloud environment on top of: AWS, MongoDB, CDN, ELB; deployed and managed environment using Chef; and have excellent analytical skills, and a taste for good engineering. WE WANT YOU!  


You will have opportunities to combine your technical ability, strategic thinking and detail-oriented execution in a fast-paced, dynamic, entrepreneurial environment at Rally Health. Your work will contribute to the design and management of serious infrastructure that is servicing large amounts of data and traffic, work with an outstanding engineering team, and employ state-of-the-art tools and techniques.


Responsibilities: 





  • Build and maintain a highly fault tolerant infrastructure on public cloud

  • Build and document cutting-edge automation tools to improve capacity and velocity for software engineers and production operations

  • Collaborate with our development team to implement and evolve solutions for a wide array of challenging projects

  • Improve provisioning, automation, configuration, integration, deployment and release processes

  • Mentor, train and develop team members for career progression and learning

  • Participate in 7x24 on-call rotation

item.title: Technical Product Manager at Author it (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Author-it has been an industry-leading provider of content authoring tools for more than 16 years. With our focus on SaaS solutions for the Life Sciences content lifecycle, we’re growing by leaps and bounds. But we also know we can do more, better. This is where you come in.



We’re looking for a smart, detail-oriented, and technical Product or Program Manager who will contribute to the next stage of evolving Author-it products and services. You’ll work on projects that span the Product Management and Engineering organizations, including front-end development, platform/API development, and QA, with vendor management opportunities for outsource projects.



As a Technical Product manager, you’ll work closely with functional leads to dive deep and solve both customer pain points and complex SaaS challenges (performance, scale, extensibility, security, and more). Our customer-centric philosophy extends across everything we do, whether you’re defining new UI with the UX Designer or optimizing our web services API with the Software Architect.



There’s interesting and exciting work ahead, and you can be a part of it.



Key responsibilities



  • Collect, assess, and prioritize customer requirements for future versions of Author-it products and services.

  • Collaborate with platform/API developers and infrastructure engineers to ensure the security, scalability, and extensibility of the Author-it Cloud service.

  • Collaborate with other PM team members to define the user experience for Author-it products and services.

  • Define the business and functional requirements for enhancements to Author-it products and services (Alternatively, write the user stories or scenarios.)

  • Create specifications and other planning artifacts for product enhancements and new features.

  • Work with developers and infrastructure engineers to ensure the security, scalability, and extensibility of all solutions proposed in specifications you create.

  • Collaborate with Scrum Masters and Technical Project Managers on project management tasks related to Engineering efforts, including both in-house development and outsourced (vendor) projects.

  • Work with the Interaction Designer to validate user experience designs through both ad hoc and formal usability testing, such as “card sort” affinity exercises and A/B testing.

  • Identify sources of user/customer data, such as usage metrics and community feedback, and then analyze the data with team members to provide recommendations for improvement to new or existing product behaviors.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Datto Inc (Boston, MA)
item.description: Overview: Datto is seeking an experienced software engineer with strong leadership and mentoring skills who desires “hands on” development as an ongoing part of their role. The role requires an engineer well-grounded in software-engineering fundamentals, experienced in Agile development, and able to make practical business tradeoffs to deliver maintainable, well-constructed and crazy-useful software for our end-users. About the Company: We are the fastest growing technology company in Connecticut, with an established development office in Boston (formerly Backupify). We specialize in backup and disaster recovery solutions, and we are the leader in our space. Our offerings include backups of cloud applications and this role is focused on continued development of those cloud-to-cloud backup products. Datto is trusted by thousands of organizations and millions of end-users to securely and reliably backup their business data. With over 100 petabytes of data under management and a fast-growing customer base, we continually challenge ourselves and our architecture to reach new levels of scalability. With our agile methodologies, small-team organization, fast-paced development and innovation-focused values we offer the benefits of a startup culture within a profitable company of 400+ employees. About the Role: Day to day work includes coding from the position of team lead, participating and leading design and code reviews, and actively mentoring more junior team members in both software-design and implementation. You’ll participate in architectural direction and have the opportunity to own and lead the design and implementation of new features and improvements. We’re continually re-evaluating our architectural needs, so an experienced engineer is needed to help make informed decisions about new technologies that can scale and how to transition legacy systems.

item.title: Software Programmer at Data Processors (Southbank, Australia)
item.description:
Due to expansion we are seeking direct applications from talented and passionate software programmers to join our Estimation and Evaluation team. The successful candidate will be joining an existing team of highly qualified and professional developers with a broad and proficient range of skills.

The types of systems that the successful candidate will support and test can broadly be defined within the family of algorithmic trading systems but don't let that scare you! Specific skills in finance and related algorithms are not required and domain specific information will be conveyed as part of on the job learning. Indeed, most of the work does not require specific knowledge but rather the willingness to learn and perseverance to ensure completion. Of key importance is the desire and willingness to solve problems of importance to business outcomes. Working well within a team is essential as is a dedicated and professional outlook on software development processes.

You will mainly be focused on the testing and support of general purpose software and systems to allow expert analysts to process online (live) and offline (historical) data. Online systems perform domain specific data transformations, algorithm application and validation of input and output data along with the hard performance constraint of a real-time system. Offline systems focus on algorithm evaluation (using distributed computation) and associated research and development (performed in collaboration with or by expert analysts).

Candidates with a Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering or Information/Computer Science will need to demonstrate experience in/with:



  • Software development environments using Agile methodologies

  • Unit testing frameworks such as JUnit, DUnit and/or PyUnit.

  • Build systems such as Jenkins and/or Bamboo.

  • One or more programming/scripting languages (Python, C#, C++/C, Java).

  • Defect Tracking and Source Control tools (eg. Jira, Subversion and Git).



You will need the following attributes:



  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical colleagues.

  • A strong proven focus on outcomes and deliverables..

  • The ability to think independently, act quickly and refocus following change.

  • A strong and proven desire to learn more effective and efficient ways of working.

  • Commitment to projects including extended post-implementation.

  • Self-motivated, pro-active and strong organisational skills.



The following competencies and experience would be considered valuable:



  • Delphi.

  • 2+ years experience in Quality Assurance/Testing or related experience .

  • Distributed computing/multi-threaded programming.

  • Statistical/numerical analysis.

  • Proficiency with XML/JSON data structures and constructs.

  • Hands-on testing experience with Windows, UNIX and/or Linux operations system.

  • SQL and PL/SQL.

  • TCP/IP and web technologies.


Ideally, we are seeking applications from candidates who are located in Australia and who already have the right to live and work here indefinitely and without any restrictions. However, if you hold the right to work in Australia unrestricted and indefinitely, but are not currently located here, but plan to be within the next month please apply.

Please do not hesitate and apply via the URL below.

Recruitment Process:

Please note due to the volume of applications received in response to our job adverts, applicants who have not applied via the URL will be automatically rejected. Those who have been short listed will be contacted with 72 hours of receipt of their application by a member of our HR team to schedule telephone interviews.

Following the initial telephone interview successful candidates will be required to attend a face to face interview which will include sitting a technical test specifically designed to test candidate ability for this position. The panel will consist of the Team Manager, Direct Manager and a Representative from the HR Team.

http://apply.dataprocessors.com.au

Please note all APPLICANTS MUST APPLY via the URL above and quote job reference PO65. Those who do not will be automatically rejected.

We look forward to receiving your application.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at CreativeLive, Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
CreativeLive is looking for talented senior engineers to join our growing technical team in our San Francisco or Seattle office. You will be forging a new frontier in learning applications, leveraging and contributing to open source technology.


Our platform is built on Node.js and Angular.js, and the ideal candidate will be excited about applying their strong coding and architecture skills to an end-to-end JavaScript stack. 


Along with your fellow engineers, you'll be working with design and product to continuously improve the CreativeLive site and internal tools by:



  • iterating on prototypes

  • architecting modules and applications

  • refactoring existing parts of the site

  • extending our content management system

  • implementing data visualization dashboards

  • interfacing with (and creating) web services 

  • improving the scalability and fault tolerance of our distributed systems

  • actively contributing to refining our Agile development processes

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Web at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Full stack engineers at Twilio are responsible for creating compelling web experiences for all Twilio product-lines, from SMS to IP Communications. The unified Account Portal we’re responsible for supports 500,000+ developers building communications apps on Twilio.


About the job: 


Full stack web developers own everything from the “first run” experience of customers just starting with Twilio to powerful debugging and monitoring tools critical to our largest customers operating at scale. Developers love Twilio because our “developer experience” makes it incredibly easy to build and scale on the most powerful communications API on the planet - full stack web engineering at Twilio is all about building that developer experience.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain the backbone of our web framework to support all product lines across Twilio.

  • Own your production infrastructure end-to-end. You’ll deploy your own code multiple times a week.

  • Work directly with product management to define, architect, and build new customer-facing features. At Twilio, product roadmaps are a team sport.

  • Write quality, maintainable code with extensive test coverage in a fast-paced professional software engineering environment.

  • Influence cross team initiatives and mentor junior engineers.

item.title: Senior Front End Engineer, Ad Reporting at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Advertising Reporting Team is responsible for building industry-leading reporting solutions for Quantcast’s advertising clients, providing rich insights into their advertising campaigns and audience.


We are looking for a senior/principal front-end engineer who has deep familiarity and experience with front-end technologies. He/she will be leading the development of brand new, innovative reporting features to deliver a rich and intuitive user experience for our large and rapidly growing advertising client base.


As a senior engineer, he/she will also set the technical direction and extend best practices within the team. We currently use Java, Play framework, JavaScript, AngularJS, d3, and are open to new technologies.


Responsibilities



  • Define, code, test, and deploy new features to our reporting suite with an emphasis on extensibility and performance.

  • Utilize latest HTML5, CSS, and JS techniques to produce highly-performant, informative, and beautiful user experiences for clients.

  • Work cross-functionally with UX, Product, and other Engineering teams. Contribute to the product definition, UI, and system design processes.

  • Evaluate feasibilities and effectively manage project scope and time.

  • Continually evaluate and instill best practices into the development process, including automated testing, code organization and style, and front-end application architecture.

item.title: Cloud Operations Engineer at StorageCraft Technology Corporation (Draper, UT)
item.description:
Role and Responsibilities


The Cloud Operations Engineer will be responsible for running, maintaining and operating our cloud hardware and services; using the software deployed by our development team.  In this role, you will work on a range of in-house projects.  This job provides a degree of freedom that you will not find in larger companies.  If you are looking for a job that makes use of your critical thinking and creativity, then this is it. 


You will work within a small, friendly software engineering team and work on a number of critical products and projects.  Ideally you are detail-oriented, self-motivated, a problem solver and work well in a fast moving, dynamic work environment. 


Qualifications Requirements



  • Proven experience with processes related to Linux in a cloud environment

  • Solid understanding of programming with Python, Bash, Perl or other languages

  • Solid understanding of CEPH, OpenStack, and SaltStack

  • Good working knowledge with writing scripts in any language

  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple deadlines and priorities

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, particularly in documenting and teaching operational cloud processes

  • Ability to work on critical and abstract tasks with minimal supervision

  • Comfortable using and learning new technologies and products.    


Knowledge of any of the following is an advantage:



  • Apache

  • CEPH

  • OpenStack

  • Networking experience

  • Python

  • Nagios

  • System Administration

  • Rabbit MQ experience or equivalent distributed message queue

  • Amazon Web Services


Education



  • B.S. Degree:  Information Systems or related field and/or 5+ years' experience as a Systems Administrator.


Additional Notes


This is a FT, long-term position reporting to the Engineering Director. Hours of work will be primarily 8:30am to 5:00pm during the week, but able to be on call 24/7. 


EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability

item.title: MySQL DBA at MLB Advanced Media (New York, NY)
item.description:
MLB Advanced Media (MLBAM), the interactive and mobile company of Major League Baseball, is the developer of several award-winning products, apps and services. Some of these include: MLB Gameday, MLB.TV, Fantasy Baseball, Beat the Streak, and the #1 sports app and a Hall of Fame inductee for iPhone, iPad and Macworld – MLB At Bat! We are also an industry leader in the development and distribution of live streaming video events over multiple platforms.


We are seeking a MySQL DBA (Mid-Senior Level) in our New York City office.


At MLBAM, you will get to have your hands on the pulse of a platform that is providing the best live streaming experience in the world. You will be able to work with a large environment where ideas are always welcome and will have the opportunity to work where the future of media delivery is being forged.


Responsibilities:



  • Perform on-site, day-to-day production MySQL database administration tasks in a Linux environment, including maintenance, troubleshooting, tuning, optimization, installation, upgrades, backup/recovery, and data migration across multiple data centers and multiple database server architectures/systems.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve production database issues

  • Maintain database design/release documentation

  • Work closely with Engineering and DBA Team to design and implement optimal solutions.

  • Consistently meet deadlines and schedules by working closely with Engineering/Infrastructure team

Our Offerings

The role will see the successful candidate taking responsibility for the development of new features across our suite of products. item.title: (Associate) Developer for Healthcare at SAP SE (Potsdam, Germany)
item.description: In this role you will work on various development projects in the healthcare area at the SAP Innovation Center. Co-Innovation and user-centered design are among the core development principles at the SAP Innovation Center, so you will work with expert designers to provide a great user experience and interact directly with users and other stakeholders to iterate on your solutions.

item.title: Software Engineer, Generalist at Connectifier, Inc. (Costa Mesa, CA)
item.description:
Build the next generation employment platforms, and help great companies find great people.


Connectifier is changing the way recruiting is done today. Our engineering team from Google, Microsoft Research, Berkeley National Lab, Carnegie Mellon, and Stanford is building large scale data analysis software that processes professional profiles from all around the web. By analyzing code repos, blogs, and social profiles we're helping recruiters and hiring managers connect more efficiently with the candidates best for their openings.


We are deployed at 25% of the Fortune-100, and our revenue is growing extremely fast. At Connectifier you'll get to work with top growing companies and fantastic brand names and deliver a best in class product.


Example projects


Build a predictive AI model of employee success based on a dataset of millions of people


Build infrastructure for running distributed, restartable tasks on a cluster of machines


Requirements


Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or commensurate work experience


Software engineering work or internship experience


Preferred experience


Application of algorithmic knowledge and intuition to solve complex problems


Experience building software with a statically-typed backend language (Java preferred. C, C++, Scala, etc. are all sufficient)


Knowledge of machine learning, aritifcial intelligence, big data and web technologies are a plus


How to apply and what to expect


Click the apply button below.


Be prepared to answer technical questions and write code to solve very challenging problems during the initial phone interview, a 5 hour on-site (or video chat) interview and on-site coding project.

item.title: Analytics Platform Engineer at MuleSoft (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
MuleSoft changes the way the world stays connected through data.  Our award winning engineering team develops integration solutions for fellow engineers around the globe and we’re looking to grow!  Our newest engineers will shape our world-class analytics platform, participate in architectural discussions, and choose development technologies.


MuleSoft has a growing portfolio of highly distributed and reliable connectivity products and our analytics engineers will build a platform which allows end users to analyze and share massive amounts of transactional data. This position also offers daily exposure to influencers within the API, Cloud and Integration markets.

Position details:


Our analytics software engineer will pioneer a big-data analytics platform which provides the back-bone for how we collect, analyze and share transactional data and metrics from tens of thousands of integration and API machines distributed in the cloud. This real-time analytics product will be used for cloud reporting and optimizing the behavior of our customer’s systems at runtime.  You’ll work on a customer facing solution which sits at the center of various distributed architecture stacks across the Fortune 500.The product spans the entire Anypoint platform and your end users will be our customer’s developers, analysts and the C-Suite.


The analytics function of our Anypoint platform is still in architectural phase.  You will participate in architectural discussions, shape the platform, choose technologies, and have a direct impact on the newest part of our product line.

item.title: Senior Big Data Architect at Warner Music Group (New York, NY)
item.description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment looking to join the Big Data solutions team at Warner Music Group. 


Are you a passionate Big Data Architect looking for a new challenge? You get excited defining and leading engineering efforts for product vision, requirements and execution of customer driven innovation. You have a passion for coaching and mentoring teams. You take action on creative solutions and ideas. You thrive in a team environment, knowing that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. You look at problems from different angles and seek out fresh perspectives. Warner Music Group wants to speak with you about how we can transform the music industry together!!!


Your Role and Responsibilities:



  • A self-starter who is a technology as well as a people person. Should be able to work in different abstractions from the lowest i.e. code and to the highest i.e. architecting and designing systems. Also be able to work with different teams and people to understand and facilitate the deliverables in a timely fashion.

  • Design and build scalable infrastructure and platform to collect and process very large amounts of data (structured and unstructured), including streaming real-time data.

  • Architect the data pipeline to meet the needs of a technology centric company.

  • Hands-on development as well as mentoring of a team of Data Platform Engineers.

  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand, document and prioritize key technology decisions, processes and business needs for data and intelligence. This will require an extensive technical background and experience with working on big data in a highly distributed environment.

  • Work with business analysts and business stakeholders to help define technology needs for the logging, processing, storage and presentation of data in a manner that delivers business value.

  • Liaise with other development and reporting teams through the implementation process of new reporting systems.

  • Create, define and deliver new processes that will enable better development efficiencies.

  • Own a road map to automate and key reports in a consistent and scalable fashion.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at CrowdFlower (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
About Us:


CrowdFlower is changing the way work gets done, and we want you to help us make it happen.


We’re building a platform that makes it easy for data scientists to enrich their data by distributing work to an on-demand workforce located around the world. In addition to being an integral player in the red hot data science, machine learning and big data fields, we also provide critically needed work and income to millions of micro-tasking workers around the world. Everything our engineers do has real and tangible impact, everyday.


We need smart, innovative people to help us build scalable, resilient and responsive systems, working with our exceptional team in San Francisco’s Mission District. You can look forward to working with a dynamic, growing company in a casual and fun environment with an opportunity to make an impact at all levels of the business.


Learn more about our engineering culture at http://www.crowdflower.com/careers/engineering.


The Job:


When we say Full Stack Engineer, we're looking for someone that is comfortable building custom UI/UX as well as defining API endpoints for the UI to communicate with. In terms of MVC, the position looks like: 5% M, 75% V, and 20% C. The primary tools you'll employ are Rails and jQuery. You like to work with different technologies and are passionate about constantly learning new things. You take pride in designing elegant, simple solutions to challenging problems, creating quality software components and promoting best practices for agile software development. You will help us ensure we continue to evolve and keep our edge as a world­-class development team. 


Responsibilities:



  • Distilling complex requirements into simple interfaces.

  • Defining the future of CrowdFlower's platform.

  • Building new products that use the core CrowdFlower platform.

  • Improve the interface that tens of thousands of CrowdFlower contributors and clients use everyday.

  • Take pride and ownership in your work and encourage others to do the same

  • Promote best practices for writing maintainable, well­-tested code


Must Haves:



  • 3+ yrs experience on at least one significant production-level web app in Rails.

  • Experience in multiple programming languages (we primarily use Ruby and JavaScript).

  • A solid command of JavaScript. When something breaks, you either know exactly why it broke, or can find out easily.

  • The ability to design new interfaces - thinking up a creative solution and being able to implement it effectively.


Experience with these would be definite assets:



  • Client-side MVC - React and/or Backbone

  • Jasmine/TDD experience

  • An opinion about Web Components/ES6

  • Git skills and GitHub repos full of cool stuff you've hacked on

  • A great design aesthetic

  • PostgreSql, JQuery, Redis

  • AWS, Jira, Confluence.

item.title: Web Application / Software Engineer at TrustYou GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Software engineers at TrustYou constantly have to solve complex and interesting problems. We build products that ultimately benefit the travelers and we use user interface design, big data, machine learning, natural language processing and distributed computing to do so. TrustYou is looking for those rare, talented engineers who are comfortable getting out of their comfort zone, who never stop learning, who love responsibilities and want to drive a product from its initial conception to successful completion.


Software Engineers at TrustYou work in a team with other smart engineers and are responsible for an entire product or suite of features. They are expected to understand customer requirements, think up features that are useful and fun to use, and help to drive the implementation from specification to QA.


Our web applications are built with a modern stack of technologies and tools. Our Engineers are expected to to build large, modular and fast cross-browser JavaScript applications.


Responsibilities



  • Ship products that clients love to use!

  • Take responsibility for planning, execution and success of complex projects.

  • Team play together with other smart data and software engineers.

  • Roll up your sleeves and code to get your project done.


Minimum qualifications



  • Degree in Computer Science, or closely related degree

  • 2 years+ experience implementing beautiful and scalable web applications

  • Expert HTML, CSS & JavaScript knowledge

  • Experience implementing RESTful servers. We accept your background in a variety of languages (JavaScript, Python, Ruby, Java, etc.), but we only use JavaScript (NodeJS) or Python (Twisted, Tornado) and we will help you learn these technologies.

  • Working knowledge of relational databases

  • Good algorithms knowledge

  • Comfortable working in Linux

  • Fluent in English


Preferred qualifications



  • NoSQL, especially distributed databases

  • RequireJS or single page application frameworks (e.g. AngularJS, Ember.js)


Who we are


TrustYou is the standard for reputation in the travel industry. We search and analyze literally ALL hotel reviews on the web, and generate a summary for each hotel on the planet - what did guests like and dislike about this hotel? Try it out yourself by searching any hotel on our website or our mobile app!


Our data is powering over 100 hotel search engines around the globe. Additionally, we have built a social media monitoring and survey product for hoteliers, TrustYou Reputation Management. What are my guests complaining about? TrustYou is used by more than 10,000 hotels to answer that question and improve their services.


TrustYou is a startup with engineering excellence in its DNA. Our employees are experts in big data, machine learning, natural language processing, interactive JavaScript applications and web technologies. Our tech stack is varied and modern.


We work hard, but value a great working environment just as much. We offer perks and a comfortable office for creative work. Xbox breaks and office beers on Friday nights are part of our culture. Our visits to Oktoberfest and our developer getaway trips are legendary.


Job details


Team or role: Software Engineering


Job type: Full-time


Job location(s): Munich, Germany; Cluj-Napoca, Romania


How to get this job


We’d love to see a note about yourself along with your resume.


Write us at jobs@trustyou.com

item.title: Sr Software Developer - Changing the Way the World Learns! at D2L (Kitchener, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Every day, our software is used by millions of people around the world, and we are looking for individuals who share in our excitement and passion for transforming the way the world learns. At D2L, we believe that learning should be accessible and engaging. Our goal is to create easy, flexible, and smart software that ignites the desire to learn in everyone. To do this, we need to give talented, enthusiastic, and passionate people opportunities to create, develop, and collaborate on projects that revolutionize the learning environment.


You will be helping learners achieve their full potential. Think about the good you will do for the world!


At D2L, we are looking for developers that will help us advance our goal of using technology to transform teaching and learning around the world. Our software is used daily by millions of people around the world and we need developers who are up to the challenge that this presents. As a developer, you will help make dreams a reality.


We are looking for seasoned software developers who are passionate about developing software using engineering best practices. Senior software developers use past experiences & know-how to enable teams to be more productive & effective through the code they write, the decisions they make and knowledge they share. Your ideas and perspectives are essential to making sure we are investing in the right technology and effectively advancing our goal.


HOW WILL I MAKE AN IMPACT?


We need experienced software developers to join a tight-knit team of passionate developers using the latest technology and open-source software to deliver innovative solutions to new markets. You will build web apps that are beautiful, accessible, and usable across all mediums. Senior software developers are accountable for the design and implementation of fault-tolerant and highly scalable distributed systems and APIs.

item.title: Software Engineer - Medical Mobile Apps at InSpark Technologies Inc. (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We seek a mobile engineer with a love of Android and iOS mobile development. Yours will be a pivotal role at the company with a high degree of influence over architectural and design decisions as well as responsibility for delivering high-quality, production-ready code within our regulatory and quality framework.


As a foundational member of the engineering team you will be primarily responsible for developing:


1.     The front-end for our iOS, Android and web applications for patients and their health care providers;


2.     On-device database management and local capture of user health information from connected medical devices and wearables.


3.     In conjunction with other developers, data transfer mechanisms to back-end systems for capturing, storing and managing all related health information.


You will be expected to verify your code through a variety of methods and work closely with other members of the team to perform system testing and validation studies.


As a lean start-up, our work environment emphasizes collaboration over supervision: We all know what we need to achieve and expect employees to work towards that end, individually and as a team. This role therefore has a high degree of individual responsibility attached to it. You will be expected to be self-motivated and have the confidence to share and pursue your ideas for how to achieve high-quality results in an efficient manner with limited direct supervision.

item.title: Node.js Developer at ADP (New York, NY)
item.description:
Unlock Your Career Potential: Technology at ADP. Do you enjoy exploring, identifying and inspiring the future of the workplace and the lives of millions of people? At ADP, the world's largest B2B cloud company, our Technology team is comprised of brilliant engineers, architects, data scientists, infrastructure experts, and more. We were first in our industry to offer a SaaS solution and continue to push the envelope utilizing the latest operating platforms to deliver the highly automated, intelligent and predictive solutions that are redefining what is possible. Named one of Forbes' "Most Innovative Companies" and one of Computerworld's "100 Best Places to Work in IT", we are committed to leading the way in product development and research, empowering you to bring to life the latest innovations that will forever change the way businesses manage their most vital asset, employees.



ADP is searching for a successful Senior Application Developer with Node.js to join our high performance team. The successful candidate will have a strong command of software programming, latest web technologies and frameworks. This is a senior position responsible for developing innovative, scalable and highly interactive web applications.
We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values:Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.


Responsibilities

item.title: Product Manager at Vena Solutions Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
About the Role


We’re looking for a detail-oriented Product Manager to work closely with our software engineers and product teams to build new and exciting projects. These projects will help revolutionize how companies work with their data and files through utilizing Vena’s software. At Vena, we believe that product releases should be fast and they should be often. To make this happen, our belief is that teams should be split by function and have end-to-end responsibility for what they build all the way into production.



As a Product Manager, your goal is to help us build an experiment-friendly culture that encourages failure and empowers teams to build great products and own their code all the way into production. Your role will be imperative in building autonomous team through alignment, transparency, and collaboration. You will be on the ground floor as we scale our teams and push ourselves to become the next great Canadian software company.



Responsibilities:



  • Drive Vena’s transition to Agile/Scrum software development in the role of Product Owner

  • Assist in establishing new and workable processes to make the development cycles increasingly effective each sprint.

  • Serve as the conduit between the user community (internal consultants and external customers) and the software engineering team through which requirements flow

  • Establish a shared vision across stakeholders by building consensus on priorities

item.title: Electrical Engineer at Sensoria Inc. (Redmond, WA)
item.description:
As an Electrical Engineer, you are a key participant in the design of Sensoria’s groundbreaking product offering, successfully engaging with an experienced multi-disciplinary team and global partners. You are responsive, flexible and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment. 


In this role, your responsibilities include:



  • Contribute in hardware development of consumer products from concept through prototyping, short run and manufacturing.

  • Perform hands-on system bring-up and validation.

  • Create detailed test plans.

  • Implement automated testing infrastructure.

item.title: Full-stack JavaScript hacker @ fast growing VC backed start-up at Ice.com (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
About us:

Our mission is to use software and analytics to bring transparency to the opaque world of jewelry. We are backed by leading VCs including Khosla Ventures, Maveron, and Crosslink. 

Note: we acquired the domain name (Ice.com) a year ago (it is unrelated to the previous company). 

A few reasons why you should be interested in this opportunity:

  • The jewelry industry is a fragmented, $80B market (in the US alone), growing at 5%+ annually, that software has yet to disrupt. 
  • You will be joining an awesome team led by Brandon Proctor (founding CMO of one of the largest e-commerce retailers, Build.com) and Justin Yoshimura (3x exits). 
  • We are extremely data driven and technology/software is in our DNA. You won't be a second class citizen here, guaranteed. 
  • We don't have time for assholes or politics. 
  • Competitive compensation package including stock options. 
  • Small (17 person) and agile team. 

What we'd like to see:

  • True, full-stack engineers with 2+ years of production experience in Python/Django or Node.js strongly preferred.
  • Strong foundation in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms, databases, software design and dev ops.
  • Work experience with relational databases and SQL.
  • Experience with agile development process in collaborative environment.
  • BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics OR 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Good understanding of performance tradeoffs.

Bonus Points:

  • We are currently using Magento, an open source e-commerce platform built in Zend PHP - yuck), but we are building a new, badass e-commerce platform in Django, Angular.js, Node.js and integrating it with Netsuite's order management tools (no need to re-invent the entire wheel, after all). Related experience is a plus.
  • if you have an awesome Github repo, open source contributions, or a cool project you can demo, please cut to the front of the line...

Responsibilities:

As a member of our small but seriously talented engineering team, you will play a key role in both shaping and building our technologies. Your scope will be broad, ranging from user-facing features to server-side components and libraries. We are looking for a generalist who enjoys learning and working with different technologies. And of course you will be expected to commit code on your first day. 

*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.

Design, implement and maintain drivers for controller peripherals (serial ports, USB, I2C, Ethernet, FireWire, SD Card, Force Sensor) 4. Support existing products 5. Write Unit Tests for implemented features 6. Participate in product architecture design

item.title: Director of Business Operations, Product at New Relic (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
New Relic


Director of Business Operations, Product


Portland, OR


New Relic is a fast growing all SaaS software analytics company.  As we continue to diversify across new products and customer segments we are looking to bring on a skilled, passionate, and collaborative Product Operations Leader with a strong execution track record.  


This leader will be a key player of the Product/CTO’s leadership team who will actively collaborate with a broad set of leaders across the company.  This person will also play a critical role in the broader Business Operations community at New Relic working to define the common core of what business operations means across the company.


Initially the Product Operations lead will be responsible creating the vision and roadmap of what is required to support the organization longer term while also driving the tactical execution of key product operations needs.  Over time this role will be responsible for recruiting and leading the broader product operations team required to scale the engineering and product management functions effectively as we grow.


Success in this role includes:



  • A well balanced product/investment portfolio that is aligned across engineering/product marketing needs and with external market opportunities

  • Strong leverage of data and business insights incorporate into the decision making of the engineering and product management teams

  • Increased effectiveness in how the team engaged across the company and in the support the team gets from critical company functions such as HR, Finance, etc.

  • Increased leverage and job satisfaction for the Engineering and Product Management leadership whom can move from “doing” the operations work themselves to being a partner of the new product operations capability


Required skills/experience:



  • 12-15 years of experience leading operations team for in a major business function (Product, Marketing, or Sales)

  • Strong operational skills and execution oriented

  • Skilled at executive communication and driving cross function collaboration

  • Understands the full cycle of product development

  • BS/BA – MBA desired but not required


A little about us:


New Relic is a software analytics company that, on behalf of our customers, makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates the performance monitoring data into a single, powerful interface. Our customers use New Relic every day to optimize millions of applications. 


New Relic is a San Francisco Best Places to Work award winner, an Oregon “Top Workplace” award winner, named a leader in the Gartner’s 2013 & 2014 “Magic Quadrant” for APM companies, a Top 100 OnDemand Company, Best of SaaS (THINKStrategies), Top 100 Coolest Cloud Computing (CRN); 10 Cloud Management Companies to Watch (NetworkWorld) – the list of accolades goes on. More important than all of that: we provide challenging work, opportunities to learn, high quality teammates, a standard-setting product, and a company on the move.


Our office is in the tech mecca of Portland, with easy commute access and a plethora of good eats and great coffee. We provide competitive compensation including equity and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc.)—all while maintaining the energy, agility and fun of a start-up. We can help with relocation and are open to H1-B transfers.


New Relic is most decidedly an equal opportunity employer. We seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.


To get started, click on the link below. To fast track your application, let us know in your cover letter why this job, product, and/or company is of particular interest to you. We look forward to talking!




#LI-SD1


Apply Here

item.title: Manager, Software Engineering at Rubicon Project (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Do you live to solve problems, technical and otherwise?  Do you take responsibility where others fear to tread? Are you passionate, fast and detail-oriented in your work?  Can you communicate as readily with executives as with developers?  Do you want to manage people while staying technically hands-on?


If your answers to these questions are “yes”, great!  The Rubicon Project is growing, and we need development managers who are thorough and agile, capable of breaking down and solving complex problems, and have a strong will to get things done.  In the Data Pipeline team you will work on real-world problems working on big data sets where accuracy and speed are paramount, take responsibility for your systems end-to-end and influence the direction of our technology that impacts customers around the world.

  • Be an end-to-end owner of software services spanning technology boundaries

  • Translate business requirements into technical designs and project plans

item.description:
The Role:

The UI Infrastructure team provides the building blocks used by the firm's 3000+ R&D employees to deliver high-quality, high-performance functionality to our customers in a timely manner. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work across a number of development scrum teams to support an agile continuous development and deployment environment. Strong technical and programming skills, excellent problem solving skills required. Day to day tasks involve development and integration of the Bloomberg Terminal's back-end infrastructure and the CI and monitoring framework needed for deployment and troubleshooting. The candidate will be responsible for ensuring the reliability, scalability and performance of the applications that are running on this infrastructure, as well as the long term evolution of the deployment monitoring infrastructure. The candidate will have experience with automation and monitoring using tools and technologies such as Jenkins, JIRA, Chef, Python, web and cloud services across a range of platforms including Windows, Linux, Solaris, and AIX.

item.title: Integration Architect - Bloomberg Law at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg Law continues to expand its presence in the area of legal research by providing high-quality and innovative legal research solutions. The company is committed to bringing innovative changes in the industry to the way lawyers conduct research, keep abreast of current developments, serve their clients and attract new clients. Through BloombergLaw.com, we offer integration of legal research, news, collaboration tools and market information that is unmatched in the industry. Bloomberg Law is a unique opportunity to work for a start-up team and business unit but all the benefits of working within a large, successful and well-established company.

The R&D Bloomberg Law Integrated Solutions team is seeking a self-motivated senior software developer/architect with an interest in designing solutions for complex data problems and implementing scalable architectures to support the legal research platform. In this senior role, you will work with cross-application teams to identify cross-cutting problems and develop robust solutions toward enhancing the product and building scalable applications. The candidate must exhibit excellent problem-solving, architectural and programming skills with passion for solving large-scale data problems, quickly learning emerging technologies. The candidate should also demonstrate the ability to deliver large projects independently, while positively collaborating with different teams.

item.title: Cloud Services System Engineer at MongoDB, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Join the fastest growing engineering team at MongoDB! We are looking for a systems engineer to join us in building the best database management system for the leading document database server. The MongoDB management service, Cloud Manager, is a cloud-based web application for deploying, monitoring, and backing up MongoDB deployments of any size and configuration.


Cloud Manager currently monitors tens of thousands of MongoDB nodes and backs up multiple petabytes of data. On a typical day, Cloud Manager processes over a billion metrics and replicates tens of billions of backup operations.


Tools we use include: MongoDB (of course!), AWS, CentOS, Chef, Nagios, Graphite, Load Balancers.


Responsibilities


You will design, implement, operate, and troubleshoot systems, services, and tools primarily in cloud-based environments. You will additionally participate in a weekly on-call rotation, and make occasional trips to our data centers.  Your responsibilities include resolving and escalating issues while advocating best practices to development teams.

item.title: VP of Software Engineer, Data at Centro (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
ABOUT THE PRODUCT AND ENGINEERING TEAM


At Centro, we’ve always been about making people’s lives better—from our employees to our clients. Today, we’re building a unified platform to execute every digital media advertising transaction, thus providing a new level of automation and intelligence in ad tech. This is an enormous task that will disrupt an industry and improve the lives of those who work within it.

To do this, we’re aggressively growing our team of engineers, product developers and designers. We are imaginative, passionate, determined and relentless in our efforts. Of course, we are fascinated by the complexity of engineering problems at this scale—it’s what brings bright minds together. But what keeps us coming back (and why we love coming to work everyday) is the chance to improve how work gets done: freeing up people’s time so that they can dream bigger and make life better.

Come build something amazing with us.


ABOUT THE ROLE


The ideal candidate will have experience in deploying, designing, and implementing big-data solutions using a diverse set of technologies and solutions. This leader will head a team that builds the powerful data discovery and analytical capabilities that provide the insight that drives strategic decisions for the enterprise, our customers, and optimizes business performance. The position will support each business unit with their data discovery and analytics. The ideal candidate will possess the thought-leadership skills to drive our big-data agenda and the interpersonal and networking skills to develop critical relationships across the organization.

item.title: Software Engineer(s), C/C++ and Java at Rockwell Collins IMS (formerly ARINC) (Annapolis, MD)

People from all over the globe choose Rockwell Collins as the cornerstone of their careers, helping create and deliver communications, integration, and engineering solutions that our global customers demand so that our world keeps moving and stays connected. Join Rockwell Collins and help shape our future while creating yours.

item.title: HBO Senior Software Engineer at HBO (New York, NY)
item.description:
OVERALL SUMMARY:


The Business Systems Software Engineering team at HBO enables the business workflows using creative and pragmatic technology solutions. We are a software engineering group that develops and supports applications critical to the creation, marketing, distribution, and reselling of HBO products and are a fundamental part of HBO’s innovation and success, with offices in New York City and Seattle.

Realizing this mission requires a staff of highly motivated and technically flexible software professionals across a variety of disciplines: development, program management, test, and design. We are hiring people to build a team that can create engaging, high-quality solutions, platforms and interactive experiences.

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer with the knowledge, motivation, and energy to help build robust and flexible custom applications as well as integrate third-party software packages. Our group supports departments such as Business Affairs, Creative Services, Enterprises, and Program Strategy and Planning.

item.title: Sr. DevOps Engineer - User Data at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Twilio operates a cloud communications service that is distributed with points of presence throughout the globe at a scale of thousands of servers. Because we are mission critical infrastructure for our customers, operational excellence is a key objective and that’s where DevOps comes in as a core competency.


About the job:

Twilio engineers own and run their products and services from conception to continuous operation. DevOps engineers play a key role and are embedded within teams to focus on the operational aspects of our services. 

Responsibilities:

Twilio's User Data engineers develop services to implement RESTful data services, MySQL & DynamoDB databases and power ETL through Kinesis-powered data pipelines. Some operational concerns are availability, throughput, latency as well as data consistency guarantees. Our DevOps engineers are focused on 24x7 availability, performance and manageability concerns of these services. 

You will collaborate with Architects and Engineering leaders to define and develop operational features, tools and processes including:



  • Tools and processes for configuration management of large numbers of databases and services. This includes participating in technology selection and architecture review to ensure zero downtime releases and maintenance as well as enable auto-scaling. 

  • Instrumentation for monitoring the health and availability of services including fault detection, alerting, triage and recovery (automated and manual).

  • Performance management, including benchmarking and monitoring of vital metrics, capacity planning, and resolution of performance problems affecting service levels. 

  • Custom diagnostic and troubleshooting tools. 

  • Developer facing support tools made available via our developer portal and to our customer support organization.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer, Measure at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Quantcast seeks software engineering generalists that will work up and down the entire technology stack to build new features and products to drive the continued success of our Measure and Advertise businesses.

At Quantcast, these full-stack polyglots work in all aspects of agile application development, from DB schema design through Java business logic to advanced Javascript on the frontend. They also work with QC-specific, and other industry-leading, big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, QFS) – our products are driven by data after all and we process an average of 30PB every single day!

The right applicant will thrive in an environment where independent decision-making based on product requirements is the norm. Individuals in this role will want to work on our many open-ended problems and will have an opinion when it comes to selecting the right tool/technology for the job (and the ability to explain why!).

As a Full Stack Software Engineer at Quantcast, you will have a major impact on how the world perceives and interacts with our products. We hope that you’ll bring your passion for application development to help us build truly world-class technology and products!

Example full-stack projects:

Advertising Reporting Infrastructure
Creating our client facing reporting infrastructure to provide campaign performance and analysis to internal and external clients

Online Measurement
Building new features for Quantcast Measure that will be viewed and used across the entire Web ecosystem

Mobile
Brand new mobile projects that range from prototyping to designing data schemas for both Android and iOS applications

Scaling Tools
Developing toolsets that support a number of core business operations at Quantcast

Brand Infrastructure
Building front end, data pipeline and server infrastructure to drive Quantcast targeting products for publishers

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Confident Financial Solutions (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Senior Software Engineer

Boulder, Colorado, United States | Information and Technology

COMPANY SUMMARY: Confident Financial Solutions is a venture-backed start-up based in Boulder, CO. We are the leading provider in automotive repair financing, and passionate about making a difference in peoples lives by getting them back on the road. CFS brings together smart, talented diverse people who are committed to building the best financial technology company in the country. Based on our core values: transparency, reliability, trust, integrity, and fulfillment, we are exceeding expectations in this field. Growth is unlimited and welcomed!

IDEAL CANDIDATE CHARACTERISTICS

The Senior Software Developer is a leading member of an agile development team building and working on enterprise grade software systems in the financial technologies sector. The Senior Software Developer is involved in all areas of development from design to development to testing as well as providing guidance to the junior development staff. The following are the core responsibilities of the candidate:

RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Develops software solutions by studying information needs, conferring with users, studying system flow, data usage, and work processes

  • Investigating problem areas and following the software development life cycle.

  • Develop features across multiple subsystems within our applications, including collaboration in requirements definition, prototyping, design, coding, testing and deployment.

  • Provide engineering support when building, deploying, configuring and supporting systems for customers.

  • Participate with the engineering and operations teams to define plans for standardizing, scaling and enhancing our products and the services utilized to deploy/install/release those products.

  • Investigate, analyze and make recommendations to management regarding technology improvements, upgrades and modifications.

  • Determine operational feasibility by evaluating problem definition, requirements, solution development, and proposed solutions.

  • Prepare and install solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming.

  • Improve operations by conducting systems analysis and recommending changes in policies and procedures.

  • Provides information by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing development and service issues.

  • Accomplishes engineering and organization mission by completing related results as needed and on schedule.

  • Supports and develops software engineers by providing advice, coaching and educational opportunities.


Benefits


BENEFITS


  • Competitive Salary

  • Paid Time Off

  • Medical/ Health Benefits Start Immediately

item.title: Scientific Software Lead, Proteomics at Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
At Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR), the NIBR Informatics team (NX) serves the global NIBR research community to provide best of breed, bleeding edge informatics platforms as well as in-depth data analysis services. Members of this group have a chance to participate in groundbreaking biomedical research activities to re-define the grammar for medicine in the future in the post-genome era.

NIBR Informatics is looking for a degree-educated scientific software lead with an excellent understanding of proteomics, genomics, and research data, as well as experience in software engineering principles, to join a multi-disciplinary Discovery Biology Informatics Group. Work location will be in Cambridge, MA.


This candidate will work closely with scientists and software engineers to re-define the NIBR-wide informatics systems to meet the challenges from proteomics enabled drug discovery research. This person should have proven record of building effective tools for scientists in a research environment. The candidate will be expected to work as a team member and/or leading a team to deliver solutions to support NIBR’s biology and proteomics research.



Responsibilities:



  • Actively work with scientists in disease areas to communicate with scientists effectively and understand their needs

  • Define proper informatics solution(s) to address the scientific needs

  • Work with internal and/or external software teams to design proper solutions to meet scientists’ needs

  • Serve as a key expert analyst to guide the engineering team to design proper data standards, data models and analysis tools to serve NIBR-wide informatics needs

  • Work effectively with different Informatics and IT groups globally to ensure that solutions are effectively and efficiently implemented

item.title: Cloud Systems Engineer at Cloudreach (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Cloudreach’s Systems Engineers work with challenging technical solutions for industry leading clients. We love all things cloud related and believe passionately in the innovation it can drive.


How will you spend your time at Cloudreach


You will be working in the following areas (and more!):




  • Green field development of Amazon Web Services infrastructure (EC2, RDS, EMR, etc), e.g. looking at an existing service or data centre and then architecting a more effective solution in AWS. You might work on a major eCommerce platform, a MySQL database migration, or building a scalable mobile backend




  • DevOps: Systems engineering work with frameworks such as Chef or Puppet - as well as helping to break down barriers between silo’d teams. We automate everything




  • Technical deployment and consultancy related to Google Apps for Business - for example designing a complex Single Sign On solution




  • Not doing any out of hours shift work - yay!




What do we look for?




  • You’ve studied Engineering, Computer Science or a similar subject




  • You’re super motivated and have at least a year’s working experience. We can find a great role for you with 1 year or with 10+ years experience




  • Scripting skills - ideally Python or Ruby, but talk to us if you love to hack in any language. We look for people who automate everything where sensible. If you had 10 servers, you wouldn’t update each one manually right?




  • You’ll probably prefer a command line to a GUI




  • Solid knowledge of Linux (or perhaps Windows) Systems Administration/Engineering




What are our cloudy perks?




  • A top spec laptop. You want a Macbook, not a ThinkPad right?




  • Unique ‘cloudy’ culture where we keep our feet on the ground and our heads in the Clouds - this year’s project is building a Quadcopter on our 3D printer




  • Plenty of holidays - increasing with every year of happy cloudy service. You’ll also get your birthday off to open your presents/eat lots of cake




  • Great career development opportunities with an assigned mentor




  • Centrally-located offices - where the cool kids hang out




  • Good food and team ‘cloudy’ lunches, taking over a restaurant every Friday




  • If you do something amazing, we’ll give you a spot bonus




  • The chance to work on side tech projects to build something cool, unrelated to your day to day work




  • Overseas work opportunities - if you want them




  • Working with a collaborative, social team and levelling-up your skills faster than you will anywhere else

item.title: Engineering Manager, Business Applications at New Relic (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
New Relic Engineering Manager, Business Applications San Francisco, CA or Portland, OR
Are you the ace engineering manager who will run part of our fast-growing Business Applications engineering team? You really do need to be an ace for this. Our engineers are particularly smart, creative, hard-working, and capable collaborators. They need leadership, not supervision. Management at NR leads by example. Managers here help engineers ship great features by providing resources, eliminating blockers, and keeping folks informed. If you're a command-and-control person, this is not the right place for you.   


If you've been a software engineer yourself, and you love helping other engineers excel and manage projects working with engineers and business users, we might be the perfect place.   Management here is serious business. We have the best management-mentoring program in any start-up -- perhaps the best, period. It is hard work. Your job as an engineering manager is to pave the way for engineers to do great things and lead projects across organizations. That could mean sitting in meetings so that engineers don't have to; it could mean working with other leaders to keep focus and without repeated changes helping engineers to stay focus and deliver; it could mean coaching an engineer all night through their first big conference presentation. It means whatever it takes to help our engineers ship great features, constantly level up--and have fun doing it! (Of course, you'll have fun too.)  


Tell us about your management philosophy in your cover letter and give examples of your risk-reward thinking with releases. And, of course, we want to hear why you might be particularly interested in New Relic.

item.title: Software Engineer at Hachi Labs (Bangalore, India)
item.description:
Come help us create the future of Hachi!


WE:
- at http://gohachi.com - are solving the problem of how people find and reach out to each other - a google map for people and relationships.
- Use PHP, MySQL, Neo4j, Sphinx, AWS, Git
- Are seeing excellent user-traction
- Have 41M+ people on Hachi. And their Billion+ relationships.
- Featured by MIT Tech Review, Techcrunch, Business Insider, and others
- Recipient of California Excellence Award 2013 (for software), Nominee World Technology Award 2012 (presented in association w/ TIME, CNN, Fortune, Technology Review, Science & Kurzweil AI; co nominees - Instagram, Pinterest)
- Have tons of data-engineering and data-science problems for you to solve.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING TO DO -
- We have some technical debt that we accumulated - blame it on inexperience, hurry to keep up with user-growth, adding more features, etc. Now we want to fix things and put a rock solid platform for future growth.
- Oh, and we cannot stop scaling, so we need to re-architect things while meeting demand-growth.
- And we also need to add new features, to keep our competitive edge.


YOU:
- Cringe when you look at bad code and bad practices. But instead of complaining, you set things right, even educate others
- Are a really strong developer, with 4-6 years of experience (2-3 years of PHP experience highly preferred)
- Have experience with database / query tuning and performance.
- Polyglots get bonus points. Experience across different types of languages gets mega-bonus points. Open source contributors get a red-carpet welcome to the interview.
- Have experience working with a legacy system and then incrementally re-architecting things, adding tests, etc.
- Are disciplined about unit testing, continuous-integration and other good habits (honestly, we are not yet there and we'd like your help)
- Are a good communicator.
- Believe in data-driven decisions.


IF INTERESTED:
Check out the product and give us your critical analysis. Share your Github profile along with resume. Email at: careers@gohachi.com.

item.title: Software Engineer (learning golang!) at Permission Data (New York, NY)
item.description:
@Permission Data we are in the process of completely overhauling our tech stack. We've chosen Go as our primary implementation language, and are creating a scale-able microservice architecture.


Have you heard all about go but not had a chance to try it out? Have you played around with it on side projects but not been able to use it at your work?

This is your opportunity. We are a small team who is using go for our next generation platform and we are looking for interested, talented developers from mid to senior level.


Work will encompass the full stack. For the front end we are using aurelia.io. On the database side we use what is most appropriate for the service. Currently that means we have postgres, mysql, and redis, with cassandra soon to follow.

We are automating our pipeline with saltstack, DCOS, Marathon, and Drone.


The team is small (9 people), so you have the ability to make a big impact. We do a lunch and learn every other Wednesday, but are constantly pushing each other to learn more in our slack channels. 

We believe in a healthy work-life balance, and use agile practices to facilitate that.


We believe in contributing to open source.


We are unable to sponsor any visas at this time.

item.title: Automation Test Engineer - Telecom at Gogo Business Aviation (Broomfield, CO)
item.description:
Gogo Business Aviation is the world's leading provider of airborne communications. Until recently, time spent in the cabin of a business jet meant that you were disconnected from the world circling below. That’s all changed. Airborne technology has finally caught up with the rest of the world. Simply put, voice, data and even the entire Internet can be at your disposal during flight–in the cockpit and in the cabin. Now you can use that time to return calls, answer email, download files or simply conduct a little firsthand Internet research. Using Wi-Fi or wired connections, in the U.S. or around the world.

As a key member of the Gogo Business Aviation engineering team, the Automation Test Engineer - Telecom will be responsible for quality assurance and testing of software associated with embedded Linux based data and telecommunications system products. The overall system involves proprietary software/hardware communicating via a wireless link through a satellite network to ground stations. You will be responsible for test case creation, test execution, and test automation development to verify the overall system including the application and embedded software.   

Gogo Business Aviation is committed to the development of full automation test tools and complete automated test environments as a necessity to our success. We understand that to truly scale software development in an Agile world it requires financial and resource commitment to automate regression test capability. We are creating world class automated test environments and we are looking for people that share our vision!      

Do you want to work on the latest technology with people who are experts in their field and have fun working together? 
Come on board the Gogo Business Aviation engineering team!  

How will you make a difference?



  • Verify, validate, and regression test software for features including: PBX switching systems, VoIP/SIP, wireless telecommunications protocols including data communications, and device’s graphical user interface;

  • Create test plans, test scripts and test cases for product validation and bug fixes based on system requirements;

  • Identify opportunities to introduce and implement test automation;

  • Identify and effectively troubleshoot software/network problems and implement appropriate corrections;

  • Lead test effort from early development to release of product. 

  • Occasional travel to work with contract developers will be involved. 


Gogo Business Aviation LLC is an equal opportunity employer and works in compliance with both federal and state laws. We are committed to the concept regarding Equal Employment opportunity. Qualified candidates will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, marital status, medical condition or disability.

item.title: Intermediate/Senior Javascript Developer to build complex applications at Ontario Institute for Cancer Research (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Position:  Intermediate/Senior Javascript Developers


Site:   MaRS Centre


Department:  Informatics & Biocomputing  


Reports To:  Associate Director, Bioinformatics and Software development


Salary:  Commensurate with level of experience


Hours: 35 Hrs/week


Status:  Full-time, Permanent



The Ontario Institute for Cancer Research (OICR) is looking for two Javascript Developers to contribute to the technical development of Informatics and Biocomputing platforms. Within the Bioinformatics and software development group, our mission is to create and improve infrastructures and tools used by cancer researchers around the globe to fight cancer.


Open Source applications built by our department are handling vast amounts of data (2+ PB) and run on large compute environments.


Genomic Data Commons (GDC)


The GDC (http://goo.gl/mZ7Z6N) is a project in collaboration with the University of Chicago (UC) and the National Cancer Institute (NCI). Development started 10 months ago with a Data Portal to provide a means for researchers to search through 2+ PB of legacy data. Built using TypeScript and AngularJS the Portal just entered user acceptance testing and development efforts will now be focused on the next phase of the project, a Submission System that will allow researchers to post and validate their data into GDC. Built using cutting edge technologies like ES6 and React (http://facebook.github.io/react/) this application will provide a dashboard-like mechanism to researchers. GDC Restful APIs are built in Python using Flask.


Role: Intermediate Javascript Developer


On GDC we are looking for a talented front-end developer with strong JS skills and professional experience working with JS MVCs (Angular, Ember, React). As part of the development team, you will be working closely with our architect/team lead and Senior Business Analyst and will be actively participating to the creation of the submission system.


Nice to have:



  • Experience with React, Webpack, Flux, ES6, d3.js

  • Interest or experience in functional programming (underscore, lodash, ClojureScript)

  • Interest or experience in reactive programming (Rx.JS, bacon.js)



International Cancer Genome Consortium Data Coordination Centre (ICGC DCC)


ICGC DCC (https://dcc.icgc.org/), is our live, production system currently hosting some 65+ cancer research projects. The ICGC DCC Portal enable researchers to search through clinical, gene and mutation data, as well as downloading raw genomic datasets. Built using AngularJS, the portal uses mostly Highcharts, D3, SVG for visualization. Our mandate is to keep improving the portal by adding more features, one of our recent addition was to allow researchers to launch their own data analyses (https://dcc.icgc.org/analysis). DCC back-end is built in Java.


Role: Senior Javascript Developer


On DCC we are looking for a talented front-end developer with strong JS skills and professional experience working with web-based technologies such as AngularJS, D3, SVG to take an active role in developing new visualizations and features for the portal. Having a passion for interactive data visualizations, you have experience wrangling and making sense of large, multi-dimensional and complex datasets. You will be working closely with our Senior Business Analyst and Product Owner to implement new features into the data portal.


Nice to have:



  • Working knowledge of interaction-design, usability, information visualization principles

  • Knowledge of visual encoding and understanding of their capabilities and limitations

  • Comfortable with mathematics and algorithms (dealing with power sets, recursions, graphs, abstract syntax trees)



Working on cutting edge technologies (BigData, Cloud environments, REST, Microservices, Object Storage ...), using modern programming languages (Java 1.8, Javascript, Python …) and frameworks (AngularJS, Spark, Spring Boot, Hadoop …), our teams strive to use technologies to obtain the best possible outcome.



If you are passionate about software development, are a quick learner, enjoy producing & sharing beautiful code and want to become part of a team building complex environments from the ground up, just get in touch.

item.title: Principal Platform Architect at Coupang (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
The Principal Platform Architect is responsible for the design and implementation of Coupang’s backend platform.  Successful candidate will work in a collaborative environment with Coupang’s architecture committee to recommend improvements to our platform.  The candidate will also work closely with strategic agile teams developing new components to enhance the services provided to Coupang’s customers.


Joining the Coupang USA team will give you an opportunity to work with a world-class development team on disruptive technologies and applications including:



  • Highly Scalable and Reliable services oriented architecture

  • Big Data Analytics supporting data collection, modeling, and optimization

  • Strategic domains such as mobile payments, pricing, search, personalization, and supply chain management

  • Consumer driven web and native mobile interfaces and APIs

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer at Apptio (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
The Position:


Help us create our market-defining SaaS enterprise applications! In this role, you will be responsible for designing and delivering a variety of exciting and challenging user-facing functionality. For example, our work includes interactive modeling, business intelligence and creating an extensible applications framework. The right candidate will be a solid JavaScript developer, collaborate exceptionally, have a knack for delivering appealing UI and demand a high-performance environment.


Job Responsibilities:



  • Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative, cross-functional, agile environment.

  • Team with product management to define desired capabilities.
