  • Design and deliver those capabilities with state-of-the art rich interfaces in JavaScript.

  • Contribute procedures, tools and practices to optimize team productivity.

  • Analyze problems from internal and external customers, debug and provide fixes.

  • Deliver initial quality, design for automated test-ability, and write unit tests.

  • Essential Qualifications and Experience:

  • Passion, energy and the desire to work very hard to deliver cool software.

  • Object-oriented software engineering with Java and JavaScript.

  • Complex object (data) models and business rules.

  • Large scale, data-driven web business applications, preferably SaaS.

  • Rich user interfaces with web 2.0 technology such as BI, graphical manipulation or complex tabular UIs.

  • Collaborative work style; effective communication; cross-functional teamwork.

  • Able to work with product management, field staff and customers to clarify requirements.

  • Experience delivering commercial software; familiarity with common roles and responsibilities, product and release life cycle, source code and change management, etc.

  • B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience.

item.title: Senior C++ Software Engineer at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
The nX Systems R&D team, based in Lugano - Switzerland, is seeking an experienced software engineer with an in-depth knowledge of C++.

You will build resilient, scalable, high-performance back-ends for critical client-facing financial applications.

You will be responsible for the full process of software delivery, starting from feature definition through scoping, implementation, debugging, rollout, monitoring, and maintenance. This includes software development and engineering tasks, as well as coordination and communication.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Platform at Flixster (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
For this position, we’re looking for a senior software engineer who excels at understanding big systems and how different types of client and third-party integrations interact with said system. Your work will involve integrating the services provided by our backend with our web and mobile clients, but also across middleware layers internally, and with external services. It takes a steady approach, a high standard for quality and reliability, and the willingness and ability to own many small and large parts of a high volume, high visibility workflow.


Responsibilities



  • You will own a set of small to large integrations across different internal and external services. Scalability and reliability is a key factor. Movie-goers around the country are depending on you!

  • You work closely with consumers and producers of the data, be it mobile client teams, our backend team, or an external service provider. Coordination and planning improvements and new features across these constituents will be key.

  • You build it, you run it. You design and implement robust software and the operational capabilities to keep things humming (trending, alerting, etc.)

  • You champion high quality and best engineering practices

item.title: Senior Enterprise Technical Program Manager at Time Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
The job:


Are you looking for a position where you can use your technical program management skill to deliver experiences that impact millions of customers? Are you a well-organized technical problem solver with great project management skills? Do you have a computer hardware or software engineering background? The ideal candidate has a track record of delivering large-scale, high-complexity technical projects on time, on budget, and to specification. S/he should be experienced with agile and waterfall methodologies and adept at following a “thin vertical slices” approach to product development. The ideal candidate is a good problem solver with 7 to 10 years of technical program management experience who is also an expert in project management. Core Responsibilities:In this role, you will be responsible for leading and implementing enterprise scale software projects with strategic data and analytic components and helping to optimize effective program management practices for Time Inc.


You will:



  • Start with a defined problem and work with a team to design and implement highly available technical solutions.

  • Work with other engineering team members to troubleshoot and fine-tune technical solutions.

  • Create effective and achievable project plans including workstreams, timelines, scope, and communications and status reporting plans.

  • Be the “go to person” for everything relating to the projects you own.

  • Interface with work stream and media teams and represent the core project team to review and manage deliverables to completion.

  • Deliver regular status updates with core team members and executives including reporting on key project activities, milestones, and escalating and solving real-time problems.

  • Schedule team meetings and publish all meeting minutes.

  • Ensure action items are properly assigned and completed with appropriate due dates.

  • Escalate project issues and risks where appropriate, and assure problem resolution.

  • Present project health to Executive Steering Committee on a regular basis.

  • Work with the program management team to design and implement simple sustainable project management and governance systems.

item.title: Principal Software Engineer (Service Owner - myBBC ID) at BBC (London, UK)
item.description:
myBBC is a new and high profile programme designed to make the BBC online experience feel personal and relevant to our audience, encouraging them to view, listen to, or play with our content; be that content they know and love, or content we help them discover. It’s basically about content!


As Tony Hall, Director General of the BBC, said; “it's the start of a real transformation – the myBBC revolution. How to reinvent public service broadcasting through data. But we will always be doing it in a BBC way – not telling you what customers like you bought, but what citizens like you would love to watch and need to know.”


Sounds exciting, eh?


So, what will you do on a daily basis, to help make a difference to the delivery and continuous development of the myBBC product? Glad you asked…


Service owners play a key role in our engineering function providing whole life technical ownership of our development. Working closely with Product Leads the Service Owners you’ll ensure that development is consistent with our world class quality values and total cost of ownership concerns.


You will initially work with our 3rd party supplier to establish this new service, whilst concurrently recruiting and forming the longer term team that will further develop and support the IDL.


You’ll also:



  • Support product management with stakeholder engagement, evangelizing the benefits of the service

  • Own and drive technical service innovation, while delivering end to end engineering excellence

  • Ensure the compliance of delivered product with functional and non-functional requirements

  • Manage/oversee a mutli-disciplinary scrum team(s)

  • Manage releases and the service transition to live

  • Oversee the full operational lifecycle, including sunset as applicable


You’ll also keep up to date with developments in the field that may be advantageous to your own delivery. As well as help and coach other team members as you see fit.

item.title: Engineering Manager, .NET at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
Our .NET Agent team is looking for someone with a passion for building amazing software that makes developers’ lives easier. Our team needs a caring creator to help grow and support our whip-smart agent engineers. Our agent powers New Relic’s software analytics products used to monitor thousands of applications. Programming agents is fun, challenging, rewarding, and kinda crazy.  We're passionate about wowing our users with visibility they never thought possible. 


As the manager of the team you'd be focused on creating the collaborative, creative, and purpose-filled environment, which makes these innovations possible. You will provide the technical leadership to help define and deliver New Relic’s products for Microsoft .NET users around the world. For us, technical leadership includes talking directly with customers and building connections with developer communities that our customers rely on to build their web apps, as well as managing the design, scope, direction, features, and quality within our .NET Agent.


To fast track your cover letter please tell us about a time you introduced positive change to your team, and why you want to join our fun dynamic company.

item.title: Software Engineer, Embedded Systems at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description: SolarCity is seeking a highly talented and versatile software engineer to develop technologies that enable wide scale deployment of renewable energy generation.   You will be part of a fast-paced and dedicated engineering team that develops embedded software and hardware systems for solar monitoring, energy storage and energy efficiency applications. Most of the software you develop will be in Python on embedded Linux platforms.  The ideal candidate will be an excellent programmer, have some experience with remote data acquisition and control, and be adept at rapidly learning and implementing new technologies.  Your work will affect every single one of our customers that have chosen clean, low cost energy.

item.title: Logistics and Operations Software Engineer at Good Eggs (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
What we’re building:


The Good Eggs operations and logistics team builds the platform that empowers our entire supply chain, from the tools that help our producers know what and when to make products, to the software and hardware that manages the flow of food through our warehouse and delivery network. Our systems go beyond the screen, and include mobile and hardware platforms that help our associates deliver food faster than anyone else in the industry.


How you can help:


We're looking for engineers who are interested in a multidisciplinary engineering environment, and who are excited by building high-scale software that interfaces with equipment and displays on the floor. As an engineer on our team, you'll be responsible for the architecture, design, development, and testing of new tools and equipment we are developing to streamline the process.


How we work:


We run a mature Agile engineering process complete with test-driven development, pair programming and continuous deployment of features throughout the day. Our core platform is built on Node.js, MongoDB, AngularJS, and CoffeeScript. We're in the process of expanding into new domains, including iOS application development and software that runs on embedded devices in our hub (IoT). Don't worry if you haven't done it all: we are happy to train the right person to work in this environment.

item.title: Software Engineer at Soylent (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
The Software Engineer Position


Soylent’s engineers build software to help get Soylent into customers hands as quickly and easily as possible. You’ll be tasked with creating tools to help with many aspects of e-commerce companies that operate at our scale. Projects in our pipeline include creating a robust order management system, integrating various data sources from 3rd party services into our backend databases, improving our internal business intelligence reporting tools, implementing processes to make our operating teams more effective, growing our e-commerce management tooling, and more.


We try to be as language agnostic as possible, choosing to work with the best tools and languages for the job (Although we really like Python and JavaScript). Scaling to meet consumer demand for Soylent will require engineers with knowledge in diverse areas such as building out our internal dev-ops tools or working closely with UX designers and frontend engineers to create great software experiences.


Responsibilities



  • Design and develop software with high level scripting languages like Python, JavaScript, etc.

  • Integrating with existing databases and APIs for payments and shipping

  • Building internal APIs for use by our frontend clients

  • Selecting frameworks, packages, and services 

  • Securing the data and privacy of all of our customers

  • Site analytics and usability testing

  • Working closely with UX designers, frontend developers, and 3rd parties

  • Building out our internal Postgres databases

  • Building devops and QA tools to increase internal development speed, reliability and efficiency

  • Ownership of projects that interest you

item.title: Front End Engineer at HopSkipDrive (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Technology


HopSkipDrive is securely seated right in the middle of the rapidly growing Sharing Economy market.  We leverage aspects of Geographic Information Services (GIS), Internet of Things (IoT), Big Data, Machine Learning, Microservices, and Cloud Architectures, solving the current technical challenges of the day.


Responsibilities



  • Reports to VP of Engineering

  • Resolve defects and develop features on our services, web or mobile products

  • Develop unit tests

  • Develop functional tests against consumer products

  • Write test plans for new and existing features

  • Perform regression testing with the team

  • Participate in sprint planning, daily scrum, retrospectives and brainstorming with the team

  • Participate in developing a startup culture that focuses on quality, safety, and fun

item.title: Full Stack Engineer (node.js) at HopSkipDrive (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Technology


HopSkipDrive is securely seated right in the middle of the rapidly growing Sharing Economy market.  We leverage aspects of Geographic Information Services (GIS), Internet of Things (IoT), Big Data, Machine Learning, Microservices, and Cloud Architectures, solving the current technical challenges of the day.


Responsibilities



  • Reports to VP of Engineering

  • Resolve defects and develop features on our services, web or mobile products

  • Develop unit tests

  • Develop functional tests against consumer products

  • Write test plans for new and existing features

  • Perform regression testing with the team

  • Participate in sprint planning, daily scrum, retrospectives and brainstorming with the team

  • Participate in developing a startup culture that focuses on quality, safety, and fun

item.title: OpenGL Software Developer at Vrse Inc. (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
We're looking for people to join our growing team who:



  • Seek out challenges and are comfortable with the unknown

  • Thrive in fast-paced, innovative, creative environments

  • Are expert communicators and collaborate well with others

  • Take initiative to solve tough problems

  • Are passionate about revolutionizing storytelling through virtual reality

  • Most importantly, have got grit


Responsibilities



  • Join the team that designs, implements, and maintains our mobile platform for virtual reality content

  • Architect high performance, scalable mobile solutions for media consumption

  • Partner with designers, product managers and colleagues to implement UX and design

  • Extend existing platform to incorporate new functionality and features for an improved user experience

  • Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability

  • Complete bug fixing and improve application performance


Qualifications



  • Experience building applications for windows and OSX

  • Experience with OpenGL, shaders, etc.

  • Solid understanding of the full development life cycle

  • Experience working with remote data via REST and JSON

  • A deep familiarity with C/C++


Optional, but a major plus



  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject

  • Experience working with a start-up

  • Experience with Unity

  • Experience with Metal

  • Experience with Video libraries, encoding, etc.

item.title: Platform Engineer at Keen IO (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Keen IO is seeking engineers to join our Platform team. We build and nurture an Analytics API that processes user data and queries around the clock, across diverse industries. Whether it’s gaming, e-commerce, advertising, publishing, or IoT, our platform aims to make Analytics so easy for developers that they can focus entirely on their product. Every day, every week, every month our challenge is to scale with a constantly growing data deluge and evolve along with our user’s needs.


About the Platform Team


We work together in a pretty novel fashion - servant leaders are elected from the team, by the team. Responsibilities normally held by a single manager are separated across multiple roles. We have very open discussions about our shared priorities.


We’re always iterating on how we work and what we build. We’re growing fast and we know that what worked a year ago won’t necessarily work a year from now. This applies both to the technology and the organizations of our teams. We want to provide the best analytics experience for developers and co-create the best work environment for each other - willingness to evolve is essential.


About the Job


By centralizing a data pipeline for hundreds of companies, we operate at a scale that none of them have to worry about. Looking to the horizon, we need to look at every piece of our infrastructure with a critical eye. We need to stay ahead of the curve. You will help us be thoughtful and deliberate about tackling the right bottlenecks at the right time. You’ll help make working on the platform easier and easier. You’ll have the opportunity to gain deep understanding of distributed systems and teach others! Most importantly, you’ll collaborate with some pretty amazing humans.

item.title: Senior Scala Software Engineer at Weight Watchers (New York, NY)
item.description:
Weight Watchers uses modern Lean and Agile practices as well as best of breed Engineering practices to deliver leading consumer focused products. Weight Watchers places a major emphasis on mobile and digital solutions to help our members reach their goals. This includes integrating with technologies such as Fitbit & iOS Health, as well as building custom, intuitive products to serve our millions of members.As we rebuild many of our core experiences, we are seeking talented people who are excited to join our team. This is a rare opportunity to join a company embracing a modern Technology culture, where you will have the ability to improve peoples lives in a very meaningful way and have a major impact on Weight Watchers offerings to our members. As reliance on health and wellness awareness increases, you can be be part of the team that is leading the way.

Senior Scala Software Engineer

We’re hiring a core team that will build a new product technology platform from the ground up. The new platform will be a vital part of the company’s transformation and its reimagined product offering. From technology selection and architecture to team structure and processes, the core team will take on the challenge of building a new Micro Service Architecture that will power Weight Watchers over the coming years.

item.title: Data Scientist at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting-edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise; mobile and desktop; external and internal; user-driven and automated; and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


We are looking for a Data Scientist with a machine learning background who is excited about the thought of working with big data to solve a complex, challenging problem. You must be able to architect and build a scalable system to process, analyze and validate models in real time.


You need to be entrepreneurial, have a desire to be part of a small team of highly motivated, mission-driven people, and have the appropriate experience to have significant input into all parts of the product and company.  You have to be a hands-on coder who enjoys not just implementing algorithms, but designing them from scratch.


Everything we do is hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member. You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary: we are growing very quickly, but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long-term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.


This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at LiveRamp (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Join our team and help us operate and optimize an environment with hundreds of machines and a four petabyte (and growing) Hadoop cluster. We write code to make administering that hardware a breeze, and work on projects alongside the rest of the LiveRamp engineering team. Your responsibility will be to do whatever it takes to get the job done -- one day it could be installing racks of hardware, the next day it could be scripting the deployment of a heterogenous environment of dozens of virtual machines.


We run a hybrid colo/EC2 environment with over 400 physical servers and at least as many virtual servers. We are responsible for ensuring high availability and low latency for the billions of HTTP requests we receive every day.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Maintain and grow our existing hardware/software infrastructure. Create tools for managing our massive hardware resources; fight to make our server:sysadmin ratio ridiculously high.

  • Optimize like crazy; squeeze every bit of performance out of our servers.

  • Work closely with developers to solve systems problems. Blur the line between ops and dev.

  • Code, script, and change hardware (disks, laptops, servers, etc.); support network, desktop, and security.

  • Help build a great company.

  • Automate everything! Especially in Amazon where instances appear and disappear constantly.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • B.S. degree in C.S, I.S., Mathematics, or comparable.

  • 3+ years of work experience in DevOps in Linux SysAdmin role, preferably in a fast-paced web application environment.

  • Smart, friendly, gets stuff done.

  • Loves hardware. Probably owns a soldering iron.

  • Lives at the command line.

  • Likes to code. Our ops team is unique; we are part of the development team. Seeking someone with at least two languages, such as Ruby, Bash, Java, Python, Perl.

  • Experience and interest in hardware and systems; you like the nitty-gritty of Linux.

  • Working knowledge of TCP/IP, ICMP, SSH, LDAP, DNS, and other low-level network things.

  • Working knowledge of storage, NAS, clustered file systems, RAID.

  • Virtualization experience (Xen, KVM, VMware or OpenVZ).

  • AWS or other Cloud management experience.

  • Intensely driven and proactive.

  • Ability to learn quickly.

  • Great team and business communication skills; project management communication ability.


Desired Additional skills:



    Puppet or other configuration management system experience highly desired, such as Ansible, CFEngine, or Chef. 
    Hadoop, MapReduce.
    Experience with petabytes of data

EMPLOYEE BENEFITS:



  • Stock. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future. 

  • Food. Enjoy catered meals, boundless snacks, and the occasional food truck.

  • Fun. We host events such as game nights, happy hours, camping trips, and sports leagues. 

  • People. Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Health and Saving. Receive the benefits of comprehensive health, dental, vision and disability insurance along with a 401k matching plan.

  • Location. Work in the heart of San Francisco – the best city in the world, and take advantage of our commuter benefits.

item.title: SaaSOps Engineer - $50k at Crossover (Cebu City, Philippines) (allows remote)
item.description:
SaaS Ops Engineer - $50k


Are you equally skilled at Elastic Load Balancing and balancing numerous projects across multiple products? Do you enjoy Cloudformation and forming the industry standard? Are you unafraid to take risks and scale ElasticBeanstalk with Jack’s chutzpah? Do you manage people with as much expertise as you manage traffic on Route 53? Are your presentations impeccable? Do you know the trending topics in technology and business processes like the back of your hand? You may be the wizard we’re looking for to transform our Saas optimizations.


Are you what we’re looking for:


Our ideal SaaS Ops Engineer is a highly motivated individual with a broad technical footprint. You get to optimizing SAAS infrastructure, become an expert on the latest SAAS technologies, and invent industry best practises along the way. You will be a principal contributor within our Engineering team, and will own the implementation, support and evolution of our SaaS environments, designing and building a highly scalable, unprecedented, globally deployed infrastructure.


If you are you a strong communicator and razor-sharp analyst and a creative strategist whose solutions that push the envelope, read on to apply!



As a DevFactory SaaSOps Engineer, you will:




  • Architect experience within large environments especially within core technology offerings.




  • Perform a wide variety of technical and administrative duties in overall systems design, development, and delivery.




  • Work in conjunction with IT, Engineering, and business groups to understand functionality, scalability, performance, security, and integration requirements from the database perspective.




  • Develop and maintain an in depth understanding of the application/system/database architecture and the general application functionality used to maintain data integrity.




  • Participate in SaaS infrastructure deployments.




  • Be a cross functional, contributing member of our Change Control Board (CCB) and Production Change Teams (PCT) to deploy changes to production and other environments.




  • Recommend solutions on system/database to meet the technical and business needs for SaaS applications.




  • Oversee data fixes for business issues or to address application issues.



  • Be accountable for proper backup and disaster recovery procedures.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Mars Science Laboratory (MSL) at Jet Propulsion Laboratory (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
Jet Propulsion Laboratory


Requisition ID 2015-5361
Posted Date 8/19/2015
Discipline Description Engineering Applications Software Engineering
Scheduled Hours 40
Hiring Organization 397G - DATA SERVICES
Education Bachelor's
Travel No
Clearance Options None
Job Locations US-CA-Pasadena
Category Software and Computing Systems
Career Level Level 3
Relocation Eligibility Yes
Minimum Years of Experience 6
Work Authorization U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident
Clearance Status None

Overview:


Do you excel in an environment that values exploration and discovery? We have a universe of opportunities waiting for you!




The Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) is NASA’s lead center for robotic exploration of the solar system. Our core competency is the end-to-end implementation of unprecedented robotic space missions to study Earth, the Solar System, and the Universe.




JPL, located in Pasadena, California, has a casual, campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.





We are proud to be part of NASA and Caltech, as we explore the universe and make history through new discoveries.




We aim to do things never done before and to go places few can go. We dare mighty things…do you?




Responsibilities:


You will be a Software Engineer and member of the Data Services Group (397G) reporting to the Group Supervisor and will contribute to the software planning systems of the Mars Science Laboratory (MSL).  

You will utilize domain-specific engineering expertise to understand the needs of the customer, translate needs into requirements, develop prototype applications, iterate with customers and then deliver quality applications. Involved in entire life-cycle of system, including planning, development, deployment and maintenance. Responsible for understanding and meeting software operational and engineering requirements.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Java at Chewy.com (Fort Lauderdale, FL)
item.description:
The Overview:


As an engineer on our Ecommerce Systems team, you will deliver solutions and features for the leading online pet retailer in the United States. You will lead a team that is responsible for the vision, strategy, product roadmap, and development of Chewy’s core Ecommerce Platform which consists of customer management, order and shipment management, returns management, catalog management, competitive pricing tools, search and personalization services, and operational analytics.  You will have significant influence over the vision, features, and design of this critical platform. Working with other technology teams, you and your team will design and build interfaces that integrate with vendor & supply chain systems, fulfillment systems, and financial systems. This is a high-profile position that will have exposure across the entire business.


You will write simple and sustainable code that reflects a constant understanding of the business impacts. This is a terrific opportunity to join a thriving startup and have a significant role in its success. There is a tremendous opportunity to grow professionally and to be a part of a dynamic and successful team.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Android at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We need a Senior Mobile App Developer with in-depth knowledge in Java and Android. This is an experienced position that requires fluency in the latest Java capabilities and Android SDK. As an Android developer you will be a key member of our growing mobile engineering team, developing industry-leading mobile applications and SDKs. The ideal candidate is a quick learner who is not afraid of digging deep into new technical challenges, loves to work with Kanban in small teams, and has experience shipping one or more Android apps that are currently available on Google Play Store. Backend experience in node.js and JSON REST API design is a plus. 


What we offer...


At HERE, we strive to deliver memorable moments and unforgettable experiences for our employees. You'll have the opportunity to work with highly respected industry professionals from around the world, and learn from their experiences every day. In return, we will prepare you for future opportunities to progress within the business and drive your own career; acquiring new skills and expertise along the way.

item.title: Software Engineer - All Levels at clypd (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
You will be learning all aspects of the system and contributing to them. You will work with the rest of the engineering and product teams to deliver quickly and fluidly using Agile methodologies. You will use Continuous Integration and Test Driven Development techniques to build rock-solid code.

Skills and experience:

  • Achieved at least a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering
  • Willingness to learn and improve your web stack skills: front end, back end or both
  • For front end: experience or interest in building interactive user experiences with modern HTML5 and JavaScript, and comfortable working with the services that drive them
  • Previous use of MV* frameworks on the client (AngularJS, Ember, ...) and/or server side (Rails, Django, Grails, ...) a huge plus
  • For back end: experience in working with large data sets, database performance, REST APIs, and Go a plus
  • Excitement about startups and working with a small (but quickly expanding) Agile team
  • Communication is key; our work is heavily team-oriented, and we are looking for someone who is comfortable participating and contributing to the team
  • Passion for delivering quality code and products. Code reviews and automated tests are an integral part of our development process. We are always looking for new ways to improve.

Our stack:

  • Ruby on Rails, React, JQuery, RSpec/Capybara
  • Go
  • Docker
  • PostgreSQL/RDS, Redis
  • AWS

Perks and benefits:

  • Competitive compensation and stock options
  • Comprehensive benefits package (Health, Dental, Vision, Long-term and Short-term disability, 401(k), cell phone subsidy, commuter safety subsidy)
  • Unlimited paid time off  - take the time you need to operate at peak performance
  • Learning culture that includes weekly Lunch and Learns and a formal mentor program
  • Amazing office space in Davis Square, one of the hottest neighborhoods in Somerville
  • Open and relaxed office layout, including standing desks, walking desks, and a choice of comfortable seating
  • Macbook and Thunderbolt display
  • Three rotating beer taps, iced tea and iced coffee on tap, wine bar, tea bar, and more
  • Game room with darts, foosball, Xbox One, PS4, and more
  • Fun team outings and celebrations, an annual company outing and holiday party

Who we are:

clypd is a leading player in one of the hottest emerging markets of programmatic TV, disrupting the $74 billion television industry. We are on a mission to change television advertising, to make it more efficient and effective for TV media companies, consumers, and advertisers. We've built an advertising technology platform to empower media companies with programmatic strategies. Our sales platform delivers workflow automation, data-enhanced decisioning and provides media partners with tools to manage their sales efforts.

We are looking for awesome people to join a growing and fun team. We aim to create an environment that is open and transparent, collaborative, supportive, and diverse. We are looking for engineers who want to learn about the latest technologies to craft scalable and maintainable code. The problems we are solving are challenging and interesting and we want your help.

item.title: Front End/UI Software Engineer at ObservePoint (Provo, UT)
item.description:
Come help us develop a scalable, distributed platform for ObservePoint's SaaS product!


ObservePoint's engineering team is an agile, value focused team.  We believe first and foremost in getting the right thing done for the right person.  The team is currently developing a state-of-the-art distributed, highly scalable quality management platform to bring unprecedented value to our customers.  To support us in our efforts, we're looking for talented, forward thinking engineers with a passion for delivering amazing products to happy customers.


As a front end/UI software engineer at ObservePoint, you will design, develop, and maintain a scalable SaaS application built on top of a service oriented architecture.  A successful candidate will work together with a talented UX expert, a team of other software engineers (including QA), and a product owner.


Some of the technologies we're using to build our platform are: 



  • AngularJS for the web application (this would be where the front end engineers will work most)

  • Scala and Play for the API

  • Scala and Akka for the backend micro services 

  • Cassandra and MySQL for database solutions

item.title: Lead/Senior Full Stack Developer at Scarlet (New York, NY)
item.description:
About Scarlet:


Scarlet is a new kind of a voice based information service that delivers personalized content at the right time.  We believe that there is a tremendous opportunity to create an effective and human solution to deal with the ever growing stream of information pouring out of our devices. 


 While exploring new opportunities for voice interfaces, we are first creating a consumer mobile application that helps people better start their day.  We are a small but fast growing early stage startup that is funded by the Samsung Accelerator.


Position Description:


Scarlet is looking for a founding engineer who can take a lead role in solving complex engineering problems to deliver highly relevant information to users in a natural, helpful and charming way.  Ideal candidates are individuals who are strong individual contributors, but also enjoy mentoring and working with other engineers. 


You will be our founding engineer to build and lead a high performing team that explores new applications of natural language processing, intelligent content aggregation, and voice-driven user interfaces.  Deep experience with agile product development, a love for human centered design, expertise in JavaScript development with focus on Node.js, and a passion to solve hard problems with creative solutions are all required to thrive in our fast-paced startup environment.



You will:




  • Build and deploy a scalable backend to support end user experience

  • Advance our web based tools and enhance our ability to deliver unique and personalized end user experiences

  • Integrate new sources of data into the system

  • Design and implement machine-based solutions to select and present data for end users

  • Analyze system performance and identify areas for improvement

  • Play a key role in building a top notch engineering team around you

  • Work closely with product, design and client teams to define, iterate and implement new features

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at Zeta Interactive (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
Innovation, collaboration, excellence and fun are at the core of everything we strive for at Zeta Interactive. We want to speak with you if you are passionate about elevating your career to the next level while making a tremendous impact at Zeta!


You will work with some of the best and brightest talent in the industry, challenging you to think out of the box and simplify and solve complex  problems in creative ways.


As a Lead Software Engineer, you will work (and own) challenging software engineering problems that can help revolutionize the digital marketing landscape. You will own  a problem from the beginning, partner with different functional groups and peers to define and understand it in a fast paced and iterative environment, and then lead execution on its solution. You will inspire others in the team with your work and creativity.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Scala / Functional Language Developer) at Citadel Technology Solutions Pte. Ltd. (Singapore)
item.description:
This role is also available in Kuala Lumpur and Jakarta with appropriate cost of living adjustments.


Citadel Technology Solutions Pte. Ltd. is a fully-funded and well-connected start-up providing cutting edge software development and hardware solutions for the next era in information technology.  


The company is looking to bring together an international team of world-class developers to deliver a highly confidential, critical IT service for a long-term, major government contract in Southeast Asia. This project will ultimately provide a high-profile system to be used by millions of users in the specified country.


Role


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be building a large scale, data intensive Web application using the latest technologies in an Agile environment. Your primary responsibilities will include:



  • Application design, engineering and development

  • Follow Agile practices, such as TDD, BDD, pair programming etc.

  • Own a set of stories and manage their end-to-end implementation

  • Work with distributed team to deliver end-to-end solution

  • Present and conduct demo for users, stakeholders, and technology groups as and when required

  • Using industry best practices to deliver quality deliverables


What We Offer



  • World-class software development facilities

  • Startup environment with minimal bureaucracy

  • Learning opportunities to acquire the latest and most advanced development skills (we invest heavily in our employee training and development)

  • Agile work culture, focused on innovation, team work, and open collaboration

  • Flexibility of job location (Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Jakarta)

  • Greenfield development with opportunity to be involved in full Dev lifecycle

  • Health/relocation benefits available

item.title: Operations Engineer | DevOps at Wikimedia Foundation (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Summary


Wikimedia is seeking a DevOps engineer to work on the Analytics team to help maintain and build infrastructure used to measure Wikipedia’s reach and impact.  DevOps engineers work with software engineers, technical operations, product managers and researchers to ensure they have the Big Data tools they need to improve Wikipedia for hundred of millions of people around the world.


Description



  • Perform day-to-day operational tasks (deployment, maintenance, configuration, troubleshooting) on many aspects of Wikimedia’s analytics infrastructure

  • Assist in the research, design, and implementation of Wikimedia analytics infrastructure and services

  • Implement and utilize configuration management and deployment tools (specifically puppet, salt)

  • Coordinate and communicate with other members of the Wikimedia engineering teams

  • Incident response and diagnosis of system outages or alerts

  • Write and update internal documentation of systems and processes

item.title: Software Engineer in Test - Data.com at Salesforce (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Salesforce is transforming the data industry with its Data.com cloud by bringing together the rich set of business contacts and company profiles. With this high quality data, professionals from sales, marketing, service, recruiting, etc, can use it and be more productive and effective in their business. Data.com includes over 30 million accurate community sourced business contacts and over 200 million accurate company profiles from Dun & Bradstreet. The combination of contact and account data along with social insight is exactly what businesses need to succeed in today’s mobile, social and open world. 


You will be working with world-class talented technical team and in the fast-paced, innovative environment to deliver a high traffic, high performance enterprise application & platform. As a fast growing company, our goal is to build an organization of smart and ambitious people, committed to our mission of building a billion dollar data business.

 Responsibilities:



  •  Create test plans and test case using test case management system

  •  Plan, design and enhance automation test framework

  •  Perform both manual and automation tests

  •  Automation test cases

  •  Validate code changes against existing test suites

  •  Investigate test and production failures, perform root-cause analysis and

  •  Create detailed, high-quality error reports

  •  Participate in product and feature design with developers

  •  Support product deployments to production environment

item.title: Information Security Engineer at Gap Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Information Security Engineer works as a member of the Threat & Incident Management team (TIM team). The TIM team is part of Gap’s Information Security organization (InfoSec), working closely with infrastructure, application, and managed service provider teams to ensure the security posture of Gap’s global enterprise is maintained, including endpoint, network, server and border security.



The IT Security engineers serve as Subject Matter Experts (SME) for InfoSec’s portfolio of monitoring and logging tools, providing research, expert advice, and direction on configuration and management of the tools.



The Security Engineer has direct responsibility for working with all GapTech teams in delivering subject matter expertise for cybersecurity incident response and computer forensics services for suspected or confirmed cybersecurity breaches, emerging threats assessment, and supporting legal e-Discovery requests.


Responsibilities



  • Identify security issues and risks associated with security events reported by L1 or L2 InfoSec teams, or via alerts from various security tools, and develop remediation and/or risk mitigation plans

  • Leverage a wide range of security technologies including, but not limited to: SIEM/syslog, IDS/IPS, malware analysis and protection, content filtering, logical access controls, identity and access management, data loss prevention, content filtering technologies, application firewalls, vulnerability scanners, LDAP, security incident response and Identity Management software

  • Participate in incident response and investigations of suspected information technology security misuse or compliance reviews as requested by Gap’s Security Council, InfoSec management, or as required when alerts are received from InfoSec threat monitoring tools and threat intelligence sources

  • Work with InfoSec product vendors and service providers, to evaluate potential security offerings, including product evaluations, pilots and proof of concept installations

  • Assist in responses to internal and external compliance audits, e-Discovery data collection, penetration tests and vulnerability assessments

  • Coordinate maintenance of security-related systems (Anti-Virus, Patching, Intrusion Detection, Logging, Anti-spam, etc.)

  • Monitor current and proposed laws, regulations, industry standards, and ethical requirements related to information security and privacy

  • Conduct research on emerging products, services, protocols, and standards relative to the information security arena

  • Other duties as assigned

item.title: Infrastructure Production Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
Bloomberg Careers - Infrastructure Production Developer 


The Role:


Bloomberg's Infrastructure Production group in R&D delivers a wide range of technologies for the Bloomberg environment. The team builds out common services that every Bloomberg team can use and consume to monitor, visualize and diagnose their applications and infrastructure. We also are the forefront in implementing modern technology ideology within the organization and assist all of the teams with implementation, automation and design. The Production Engineering team is a new team inside of the Bloomberg environment and is one of the most fast paced and soon to be widely used across the entire company. You will have the ability to be apart of a large cultural shift within the Bloomberg organization. If you like large scale systems, billions of data points a day, automating all of the things, hacking on opensource software and making a cultural impact, ask us where to sign up.


What You'll Do:



  • Design, architect, automate and deliver large scale production ready services for Bloomberg Employees to consume.

  • Build internal tools to monitor, visualize and diagnose all aspects of applications & hardware in the Bloomberg stack.

  • Work closely with our product and platform teams with architecture, design and scaling challenges they may have.

  • Help teams replace legacy software and design patterns with modern technologies.

  • Develop and maintain documentation, training and SLAs for managed infrastructure

item.title: Software Engineer at Entrepreneurial Finance Lab (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
About the Position:


EFL is seeking a technology guru to work directly on the intersection of software engineering and data science. As the primary lead on critical system operations and quality, you’ll have the opportunity to interact directly with clients all around the world and play a critical role in the smooth functioning of our critical modelling, data science, and software engineering processes.



You will work closely with EFL developers, statisticians, Account Managers, and customers. With responsibility for the end-to-end dataflow, you’ll ensure that our mobile platforms are working well in the field, our systems are running, and our data is being scored correctly. With responsibility for monitoring and client escalation issues, as well as critical roles during the new client launch phase, you’ll see an incredibly detailed view of how EFL works in 20 different countries around the world.



Primary Responsibilities:



  • Successfully manage and execute customer-facing Level 2 escalation issues

  • Develop hotfixes and upgrades to support a highly available cloud based platform

  • Participate in release deployment validation and processes

  • Develop automated testing frameworks and regression processes for a highly efficient quality system

  • Contribute and drive major development initiatives with codebases in Python/Django, R, MySQL, JQuery and React


Location: This position will be based either in our Boston office (in Cambridge) or Lima, Peru. At a minimum, this position will require an initial period of 2-3 months of up-front time spent in Lima followed by periodic trips back to Lima.

item.title: Senior Developer- Core Java at Infusion (New York, NY)
item.description:
Senior Java Developer


New York City


Are you a Java development superstar with strong consulting capability and proven record of designing and delivering innovative enterprise solutions?  Would you like to have an opportunity to build your own team and to positively impact our business?  If yes, read on!


Infusion is a global innovation, technology, and design firm.  We are seeking a Senior Developer to join our New York team. Our project teams build software from the ground up, using the best technologies and frameworks for the job.  You will help us create environments that maximize developer productivity, and help set our strategy for delivering major projects to our clients.


The Role:


You will be joining our Capital Markets team to build large scale business solutions and work directly with are clients - who are some of the world’s leading investment banks!  You will be responsible for developing new components for saving, calculating, and aggregating massive amounts of real time data for a massive overhaul of a global risk system. This ongoing program that will help transform the business and will allow the production of aggregated risk services, enable the allocation of capital, improve decisions for trading, and assess risk and overall accountability of across the Bank. 


H1 transfer and relocation expenses will be offered to qualified candidates.

item.title: Principal Software Engineer at clypd (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
You will be learning all aspects of the system and contributing to them. You will work with the rest of the engineering and product teams to deliver quickly and fluidly using Agile methodologies. You will use Continuous Integration and Test Driven Development techniques to build rock-solid code.
 

Skills and experience:

  • Achieved at least a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering
  • 10+ years of experience
  • Willingness to learn and improve your web stack skills: front end, back end or both
  • For front end: experience or interest in building interactive user experiences with modern HTML5 and JavaScript, and comfortable working with the services that drive them
  • Previous use of MV* frameworks on the client (AngularJS, Ember, ...) and/or server side (Rails, Django, Grails, ...) a huge plus
  • For back end: experience in working with large data sets, database performance, REST APIs, and Go a plus
  • Excitement about startups and working with a small (but quickly expanding) Agile team
  • Communication is key; our work is heavily team-oriented, and we are looking for someone who is comfortable participating and contributing to the team
  • Passion for delivering quality code and products. Code reviews and automated tests are an integral part of our development process. We are always looking for new ways to improve.

Our stack:

  • Ruby on Rails, React, JQuery, RSpec/Capybara
  • Go
  • Docker
  • PostgreSQL/RDS, Redis
  • AWS

Perks and benefits:

  • Competitive compensation and stock options
  • Comprehensive benefits package (Health, Dental, Vision, Long-term and Short-term disability, 401(k), cell phone subsidy, commuter safety subsidy)
  • Unlimited paid time off  - take the time you need to operate at peak performance
  • Learning culture that includes weekly Lunch and Learns and a formal mentor program
  • Amazing office space in Davis Square, one of the hottest neighborhoods in Somerville
  • Open and relaxed office layout, including standing desks, walking desks, and a choice of comfortable seating
  • Macbook and Thunderbolt display
  • Three rotating beer taps, iced tea and iced coffee on tap, wine bar, tea bar, and more
  • Game room with darts, foosball, Xbox One, PS4, and more
  • Fun team outings and celebrations, an annual company outing and holiday party

Who we are:

clypd is a leading player in one of the hottest emerging markets of programmatic TV, disrupting the $74 billion television industry. We are on a mission to change television advertising, to make it more efficient and effective for TV media companies, consumers, and advertisers. We've built an advertising technology platform to empower media companies with programmatic strategies. Our sales platform delivers workflow automation, data-enhanced decisioning and provides media partners with tools to manage their sales efforts.

We are looking for awesome people to join a growing and fun team. We aim to create an environment that is open and transparent, collaborative, supportive, and diverse. We are looking for engineers who want to learn about the latest technologies to craft scalable and maintainable code. The problems we are solving are challenging and interesting and we want your help.

item.title: Team Lead Software Engineer at TheLadders (New York, NY)
item.description:
Based in SoHo, TheLadders is an engineering-team-driven organization. We empower our software engineers to not just build great products, but to have a real say in the ‘how’ and ‘why’ the products are being built. We practice continuous integration, test-driven development, peer code reviews, pair programming and collaborative design studios. You’ll be on the cutting edge of current software development best practices and in the position to assist in the introduction of new ones.


At TheLadders, the Team Lead Software Engineer has not only the technical chops to roll up their sleeves and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy, and help develop your team to be amazing.


In this role you will:



  • Write high-quality, efficient, testable code in Java and other object-oriented languages

  • Collaborate with some of the best engineers in the industry

  • Mentor other developers

  • Contribute to planning, design, implementation, testing, operations, and process improvement as the leader of a Scrum team.

  • Build something incredible!


Responsibilities of the Team Lead Software Engineer:



  • Manage a team of software engineers (backend, frontend, full stack), including task planning and code reviews.

  • Drive technical projects and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment.

  • Take responsibility for the overall planning, execution and success of complex technical projects.

  • Contribute technically to projects.

  • Work closely with product management team to ensure we're building the best products.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Schrödinger (New York, NY)
item.description:
Our mission: Dramatically improve human health and quality of life by developing and applying advanced computational methods that transform the way compounds and materials are designed.


What we do:We develop a software platform for drug researchers, replacing labor-intensive procedures in favor of automation. Our platform gives access to an unparalleled combination of collaboration, data access, and computational modeling tools that speed up the drug discovery process. This technology allows scientists to run virtual experiments on massive compute grids and to analyze the resulting large dataset efficiently as a team.


Who we are: We are a community of passionate, friendly, and skilled team players. We are a diverse set of developers, entrepreneurs, and scientists who have made the decision to collaborate together on something with significant human impact. We take pride in our relationships with many satisfied clients, including numerous large pharmaceutical companies. Our investors are fellow technology visionaries, including Bill Gates.


The position: As a Senior DevOps Engineer at Schrödinger, you will design and develop scalable methods of building, deploying, and supporting our enterprise application services and systems across various machine infrastructures (primarily Amazon AWS). These are industry-transforming systems that our users (drug researchers) depend on daily to move their projects forward.


The position is one that draws on technical skills stemming from development operations, systems engineering, as well as systems administration. You will leverage these existing technical strengths to understand our existing infrastructure while being given the freedom to innovate major improvements to meet changing needs. This role is primarily an engineering one that does not require experience in the physical sciences (chemistry, biology, or physics).


Responsibilities:


Architect and implement the infrastructure for building, testing, deploying, tuning, and troubleshooting our engineering team’s production and development systems


Advise the development team on best practices throughout the design process of their applications, to ensure that they can be delivered to manageable and highly available production environments


Communicate frequently with stakeholders to prioritize infrastructure enhancements by DevOps team


Design and manage our monitoring/alerting systems


Organize and participate in the on-call schedule process for our operations team


Requirements3+ years of relevant work experience: DevOps/Infrastructure, Test Automation, Systems Administration, and/or Development


Experience working with modern infrastructure operations and automation tools:


server virtualization (e.g. Amazon AWS, Xen, Rackspace, VMWare)


cluster configuration (e.g. Chef, Puppet, Salt)


continuous integration and testing (e.g. Jenkins, Hudson, BuildBot)


Proficient knowledge of and passion for the UNIX operating system:process limits, devices


networking / http


system administration and bash


we primarily use Ubuntu/Debian, Centos/Red Hat


Experience solving security problems:


certificate management, network/firewall configuration, encryption


Experience working with Monitoring and Alerting Tools:e.g. Datadog, Nagios, Zenoss


Experience with a modern scripting language:


e.g. Python, Ruby


Experience with the deployment and maintenance of databases:e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle, MongoDB


Experience with source control


e.g. GIT, SVN


Proficient interpersonal skills (oral/verbal communication), complemented by an ability to collaborate in a team environment


Enthusiasm for solving interesting problems and a willingness to learn


Ability to ask smart questions, think outside the box, and be creative


Pluses:


Bachelors in CS/Engineering/related field


Experience deploying distributed web applications:


e.g. Apache, Nginx, NFS, LDAP


Experience working with containerization (e.g. Docker, Vagrant, LXC)


Advanced DBA skills


Experience with maintaining databases and database replicationScience minor or independent interest (chemistry, physics, biology, or related)


Check out the website for our platform here: https://www.schrodinger.com/livedesign/



We are prepared to offer a highly competitive compensation package for an exceptionally well-qualified candidate. Benefits include medical, dental, 401(k), flexible spending account, 3+ weeks vacation, and tuition reimbursement.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer at Logi Analytics (McLean, VA)
item.description:
Sr. Software Engineer



COMPANY OVERVIEW



Founded in 2000, Logi Analytics provides businesses the fastest and easiest way to deliver business analytics, dashboards, and reports to a broad range of users, as well as to embed them into existing applications – all for a fraction of the cost of other solutions. Unlike traditional Business Intelligence platforms that are complex and costly, Logi Analytics’ agile technology allows organizations to rapidly develop, deploy, and adapt BI applications that serve any number of users on any platform all without extensive development or professional services. Logi Analytics is headquartered in McLean, Virginia, with sales and support offices in the UK and Europe.  Logi Analytics is a privately held, venture-backed firm with investments from Updata Partners, GroTech Ventures, Summit Partners and LLR Partners. For more information, visit LogiAnalytics.com.



SUMMARY



This position will work closely with Development, QA, and Product Management to design and implement features and capabilities for Logi Analytics’ product line.



General:



Logi is looking for a technically proficient software engineer who has collaborated with a team to put enterprise software into production.  While this individual is capable of solving incredibly technical problems, he/she doesn’t need to solve every problem single-handedly, and actually enjoys bringing the best ideas together to design and implement the best possible solution.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES



•           Design, develop and maintain a rich data-driven Java application containing HTML5, CSS and JavaScript, Angular, NodeJS components


•           Gain good understanding of our suite of software products.


•           Work within our development team to maintain and enhance the product.


•           Take ownership of product sub-systems.


•           Provide a positive influence that will improve our products for our customers.  Invent new ideas to build new features and products to help grow Logi Analytics.

item.title: Sr Python Developer at EchoStar (Superior, CO)
item.description:
Summary:


Dishanywhere, a division of EchoStar Technologies, has an opening for a Sr Python Developer in Superior, CO to maintain, develop and enhance a wide variety of python backend datastore, middleware, and UI throughout the entire SDLC.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain reporting and data mining Python programs using MySQL databases, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Hive, and Hbase data stores.

  • Develop and maintain Python parsing programs which read CSV, XML and JSON data from files or other Rest services, process the data and upload it into one of the above data stores.

  • Develop and maintain Python scripts which provide WSGI interfaces providing Rest services and for interaction with Set Top Boxes (STBs).

  • Develop and maintain Python and UNIX shell scripts for process control.

item.title: CTO at Freedom at Freedom (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Would you like to improve lives of millions of people with your work?
Are you interested in building software that people will truly value - and pay for?
How about working to solve one of the biggest challenges of our era: digital distraction?


If you're a highly qualified engineer who finds that these questions resonate, Freedom is hiring a CTO to help scale our 6-person, venture funded, revenue-positive company. As CTO, you will manage and accelerate development of our platform, ensure product and engineering standards across our software, and build a world-class cross-platform engineering team.


The ideal candidate for this role will have demonstrated experience managing and scaling engineering teams, including the management of remote teams. We are a consumer software company, so the candidate should be comfortable with high scalability systems, consumer quality UX, and user-centric development. Prior startup experience, and experience with technical aspects venture fundraising or M&A (software due diligence, data rooms) a plus.


We expect compensation for this position to be a mixture of cash and equity, negotiated on an individual basis. We are open to a remote arrangement, but we'll expect a remote candidate to be in our Durham offices 25% for the first year. We're open to starting the relationship on a fractional basis. Please feel free to reach out directly via LinkedIn or email to Fred Stutzman, our CEO, with questions.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Portfolio.me (New York, NY)
item.description:
Portfolio.me has a small, fully dedicated team committed to building a dynamic, results-oriented work environment.  Using an investment strategy build upon an institutional investment strategy with exemplary out-performance, and our quantitative finance experience, we are working hard to launch a premium investment product.  We believe in educating and informing investors to bridge the gap between their social principles and their investments.


We are looking for an intellectually curious, and accomplished software engineer to help lead our development team, and add to our company culture.  We are socially conscious, and excited to positively impact both investing and corporate transparency.  Hopefully, working for a hedge fund or investment bank sounds or feels stale to you.


Being an Engineer at Portfolio.me is more than just an engineering role.  It is entrepreneurial, inquisitive, and technical leadership responsibility. You should be a technologist who is adept at solving problems, Developing a product that does not exist means creating the roadmap.   Working with a relatively complex data model, financial markets, as well as crafting a great UI experience present interesting day to day challenges.


You should love the idea of building a product versus maintaining a codebase, and taking on a leadership role.  Portfolio.me believes in interating and making things better over time as new technologies emerge.  Lean principles, test-driven development and continuous delivery matter to you.

item.title: Sr. Scientific Software Lead (IS Beta) at Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
At Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR), the NIBR Informatics (NX) serves the global NIBR research community to provide them with the best of breed, bleeding edge informatics platforms as well as in-depth data analysis services. The members in this group have a chance to participate in the groundbreaking medical research activities to re-define the grammar for medicine in the future in the post-genome era.

The NIBR Informatics is looking for a degree-educated Senior Scientific Software Lead with an excellent understanding of genomics, research data, and lab workflows, as well as experience in software engineering and informatics, to join a multi-disciplinary Discovery Biology Informatics Group. Work location will be in Cambridge, MA.

The successful candidate will work closely with scientists and talented software engineers to re-define the NIBR-wide informatics systems to meet the challenge arising from genomic drug discovery research. The ideal candidate should be a highly motivated team player with a strong understanding of genomics, as well as data management and analysis needs associated with target discovery and screening research. This person should have proven record of building effective tools for scientists in a research environment and be capable of leading a technical team to deliver solutions to support NIBR drug discovery biology research.

Major Accountabilities / Key Performance Indicators



  • Gather user requirements and perform needs assessments to guide development and selection of software systems.

  • Support scientific research with software systems which capture experimental design, enable data analysis and interpretation, and provide for regular communication on genomics projects.

  • Design and/or supervise development and testing of software systems to meet or exceed project objectives.

  • Lead, mentor, and inspire a high-performing team of developers by establishing high technical standards and demonstrating, by way of example, technical excellence in all stages of software development.

  • Manage and motivate high-performing teams of developers by setting clear expectations and delivering effective feedback.

  • Use software version control system, automated build tools, ticket tracking software, architecture documentation, and release engineering processes.

  • Develop and optimize techniques and methods to improve software development processes including test driven development, agile methodology, and pair programming.

  • Work closely with cross-functional groups (engineers and researchers, management, business analysts, and internal customers), in a highly matrixed organization to build constructive and effective relationships throughout the whole organization.

item.title: Director of Quality Assurance at Lumeris (Maryland Heights, MO)
item.description:
Join Our Growing Team!


Lumeris™ provides the information technology, guidance, and operational services necessary for hospitals and health plans to transform their organizations into high-performing accountable delivery systems.


Our revolutionary technology platform for accountable care integrates data from disparate systems across the continuum of care, provides complete visibility into the clinical and financial performance of the enterprise, and delivers applications and information to key stakeholders at the point of thought. Lumeris also provides health care consulting and professional services that help organizations establish the necessary clinical and business processes, methodologies, and operational capacity to create their own successful accountable health care delivery systems.


The depth and breadth of our solutions — combined with the company’s extensive real-world experience in accountable care — make Lumeris the ideal partner for any health care organization seeking the significant benefits of a better connected, aligned, and informed accountable delivery system.


Lumeris is privately owned by Essence Group Holdings Corporation (EGHC) and backed by investors including Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Camden Partners, and Sandbox Industries.


Why Join Lumeris?


At Lumeris you will be part of team that is focused on solving a national healthcare problem.  And you will have the ability to contribute while working for a purpose. Our environment is fast-paced and change oriented and is focused on growth and employee engagement.  At Lumeris we believe talent is utilized best when given the opportunity to succeed.  That is why we have removed the boundaries that inhibit success and focus on fostering an environment that allows employees to utilize their talents.



  • Implement consistent global Quality Assurance metrics and processes for activities to include visual inspection, test automation, and performance characterization to ensure organizational product quality is realized while improving release velocity.

  • Facilitates, prioritize, and communicates functional, non-functional, integration, end-to-end, and scheduling requirements for QA efforts associated with multiple intake paths within the product development lifecycle.

  • Manage employee staff and outsourced resources in transaction application and data analytics quality testing efforts as well as performance and stress testing management. Mentor and support colleagues to assure they continually build their skills while delivering QA on products that meet requirements and exceed expectations

  • Design, create, and implement testing strategies for complex lifecycle, high volume, multi-channel transactional healthcare SAAS applications systems and associated data applications including business intelligence and data analytics applications

  • Drive quality metrics and review performance levels against those metrics for transactional systems and data products

  • Drive continual performance efficiencies by way of best practices leadership and best practices adoption

  • Drive increased efficiencies and testing cost reductions by way of best increased and comprehensive automation practices

  • Develop the long term team strategy for QA testing, automation testing, load testing, QA best practices, and team talent development

  • Optimize and implement creative QA sourcing engagement processes, ensuring all capital and maintenance projects are delivered on schedule and to our quality standards

  • Contribute to the definition and compliance of standard quality processes, best practices, and lead changes where improvements must be made

  • Recommend and assist in the implementation of standardized tools for operational processes and liaise with vendors and internal customers to identify and implement value-added, industry standard best practices to achieve QA operational efficiency

  • Lead the QA team in a manner that delivers results as experts, but approaches software testing with the eye of novices Measure success by what you finish and deliver

item.title: Automation Quality Assurance Engineer at VMware Bulgaria (Sofia, Bulgaria)
item.description:
VMware is the leader in cloud infrastructure, business mobility and virtualization software. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and policy-driven automation technologies, VMware simplifies IT complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace.

With 2014 revenues of $6.04 billion, VMware has more than 500,000 customers, 75,000 partners, and 18,000+ employees in 120+ locations around the world. At the core of what we do are our employees who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Want to be part of a compassionate community that thrives on architecting what's next in IT?

Responsibilities:

• Work in SDDC [Software-Defined Data Center] Solution Quality Engineering team to Design and qualify SDDC Solutions for various customers including the non-functional attributes like performance, security, interoperability, etc., in Cloud environment
• Support in design and validation of Federation Enterprise Hybrid Cloud and VVRD [VMware Validated Reference Design] document, as part of Agile groups
• Identify the potential integration/interOp challenges from reading PRD and functional spec. of involved products, talking with customers, field engineers and internal customer to understand the interoperability requirement for products in suite, towards SDDC Deployments. Write SDDC level integration/interOp test plans, test specifications, and certify integration/interOp requirements
• Ensure test environment reflects the operating environment of our customers Design and implement the customer test beds and End to End applications/various workloads simulated from a customer environment, documented in Federation EHC and VVRD
• Design and execution of automation scripts to support Automation of E2E workflows/use cases derived out of Federation EHC and VVRD
• Design Interoperability/compatibility Test Matrix and Requirements-based use cases, Test execution, reporting and tracking the overall progress, analyze risks and come up with the mitigation proposals
• Work with the required stake holders to escalate/resolve open issues
• Have an excellent Customer Focus related testing and develop Customer use cases in order to have our products work in customer like environments
• Deep understanding of customers through use cases, Alpha, Beta, IT use and the validation of those use cases
• Need to build very tight relationships with the field in collecting feedback and by sharing engineering expertise
• Co-ordinate with development and test teams for SDDC Solution testing across various VMware products and 3rd party products
• Support the BU vision of multiple SDDC Deployments
• Drive implementation of End to End Automation of customer workflows/use cases
• Act as a customer advocate, looking for innovative ways to improve current quality processes and procedures
• Mentor junior engineers

Requirements:

• BS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, Master is preferred
• Experience in testing in an enterprise or system level environment
• Positive mindset, excellent attitude, energetic, motivated, sharp learner, dedicated and hard working
• Experience and knowledge in automation frameworks is a must
• Strong experience in gathering test/use case requirement from customers, PMs and reading spec., familiar with risk based test design, test cases (automation/manual) implementation and execution, test resource/planning knowledge and experienced in Solution level, Integration and InterOp testing
• Passionate about quality
• Good understanding about the best practices, SDLC/SQLC processes, methodologies of QE, detail oriented and good follow through skill
• Manage activities to meet their delivery dates and publish the testing status report to different functional teams, management, project, engineering etc. clearly on regular basis
• Experience in testing Cloud solutions
• Possess the in-depth knowledge of Operating Systems (Windows/Linux/Unix) and one or more of the following areas: System administration, Networking and transport protocols, Storage (SAN) and file systems technology
• Strong analytical skill, critical thinking and debugging/trouble shooting skills with initial triaging of software/hardware failures
• Strong collaboration skills, good leadership and initiative to work with teams which might cross different business units, departments and partners to finish the end to end product integration/interOp testing independently
• Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
• VMware product experience is a plus

VMware offers:
