• Attractive compensation package - competitive salary, flexible bonus scheme, company sponsored mobile phone plan and additional long term incentives
• Individual career path - management and technical career growth, enhanced by learning and development program, regular performance assessment, teams of world-wide IT professionals
• Healthy work environment - company sponsored medical program, food and beverage program, sport activities, open communication
• Work-life balance – 25 days paid vacation, regular team buildings and celebrations

Before you join, VMware will require you to go through a pre-employment screening process.

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.


No visa or work permit requirements for EU citizens or EU work permit holders

item.title: Senior Network Engineer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:


Bloomberg's R&D Network Design & Information Security (NDIS) group is responsible for the design, architecture, development and security of Bloomberg's internal and client-facing global networks, security, and cloud infrastructures. The Core Network WAN Engineering team is the part of the NDIS Core Networks group that is focused on the architecture, development and escalated support of the global WAN infrastructure.


Bloomberg's private WAN is a sophisticated carrier-grade multi-vendor network that leverages technologies such as MPLS, MPBGP, LDP, RSVP, MVPN, etc. The private WAN currently connects 14,000+ customer sites via 100+ global POP sites using 20,000+ CE network devices and 800+ core network devices.


The Core Network WAN Engineering team is seeking a dynamic, talented and experienced network engineer who thrives on being "in the trenches". The successful candidate must possess extensive programming experience in network automation, provisioning & performance management. The candidate is also expected to possess expert networking knowledge, experience, creativity and capability to work in a complex and fast paced network technology environment. The candidate will work closely with network operation groups to provide technical assistance and guidance. The candidate will also work directly with vendors to drive feature enhancements that are necessary to meet business needs. Ability to drive relevant strategic solutions in a complex environment is highly desirable.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Automation at Rapid7 (El Segundo, CA)
item.description:
Rapid7 is looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test to join the engineering team in our offices in El Segundo, CA. This team is focused on expanding Rapid7’s existing products and creating new product lines. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of shipping enterprise-class software to a large installed customer base.


Candidates must be able to quickly ramp up, learn our product suite and immediately set to transforming product stories into a functional test suite developed in Cucumber, specifically identifying key high risk quality targets. Prior experience in the security, networking and/or data analytics space is a plus. Candidates must have the ability to quickly grasp Rapid7’s current product designs, become proficient with Rapid7’s products, and become knowledgeable in company tools and technologies. This is an extremely hands-on, technical role. 


Using our current suite of framework tools, along with introducing appropriate new solutions to creatively build a world class verification automation framework, we expect out-of-the-box thinking from candidates as with all engineers. This SDET is a key member of the core Engineering team and will be responsible for creating a reliable, scalable test toolset approach for assigned product coverage, as well as contributing to the improvement of our release framework. The ideal candidate has a solid track record of day-to-day test automation framework development in Ruby or similar and contributing on verification strategy and risk mitigation improvements.


The Software Engineer is a key member of the CORE Engineering team and will be responsible for creating a reliable, scalable tools and test framework to help maintain and ensure stability and quality of our product.


We are an agile company with weekly(!) product releases. Great environment and attitude. As part of a scrum team you will be interacting with PM/Support/Customers to help us build the right things for our customers.


Responsibilities:



  • Enable the team to meet release based and SLA-bound release requirements

  • Test Extend and improve upon existing framework automation

  • Design, develop and refine Cucumber automation classes and code strategy for the automation framework

  • Analyze epics being developed and create succinct tools coverage as well as identify the areas for regression coverage

  • Develop reusable automated regression verification frameworks to improve test framework scope

  • Work to document, analyze and investigate issues found during test execution and present findings to help provide solutions

  • Work with all key groups to insure functional and non-functional requirements are tracked and converted into test components for continuous automation coverage

  • Drive towards delivery of those commitments throughout the iteration and raise risks early

  • Identify the risks and appropriate testing to validate coverage, and develop test plans and test cases

  • Be open to learning new technologies and new problem domains.

item.title: Engineering Manager at Tripwire (Portland, OR)
item.description:
About Tripwire


Why join us: IT security is in our DNA! With offices in Portland, San Francisco, Atlanta, London, Tokyo and counting, we have continued to grow by developing our products to meet the challenges posed by today’s threat heavy environment. Over 8,100 enterprises and government institutions worldwide, including 46% of the Fortune 500 rely on what we do to protect their critical IT infrastructure and sensitive data. We are passionate about your ongoing development and always making things better. Become a part of Tripwire, a team that brings out the best in you!


About Us: We are a leading global provider of risk-based security and compliance management solutions, enabling enterprises, government agencies and service providers to effectively connect security to their business. Tripwire provides the broadest set of foundational security controls including security configuration management, vulnerability management, file integrity monitoring, log and event management. Tripwire solutions deliver unprecedented visibility, business context and security business intelligence allowing extended enterprises to protect sensitive data from breaches, vulnerabilities, and threats. Learn more at www.tripwire.com or follow @TripwireInc on Twitter.




Job Summary


As a member of the Engineering Management team, this position will oversee a team of cross-functional engineers designing, developing and testing Tripwire’s flagship product, Tripwire Enterprise.  The value that the team delivers will sustain the product, support its large customer base and enhance the offering to meet the emerging needs of the information security market.


This position is responsible for supporting the engineering team through coaching, mentoring and adoption of strong working agreements and agile principles.  Successful candidates will have a leadership approach that empowers decision-making at all levels of the organization, focuses on removing impediments to team success, and holds individuals to high standards of craftsmanship, professionalism and execution.


This position will also provide value to the development of the organization, working to enhance engineering practices and drive continuous improvement toward efficient, innovative delivery.

item.title: Software Engineer at Synergyse (Toronto, ON, Canada) (allows remote)

Synergyse creates highly interactive and measurable cloud training, adoption and productivity tools. We started by teaching everyone how to use Google Apps proficiently and it worked really well. We are working on hard problems in big data, HTML5, media delivery and real time technology. Our backend technology and web runs on the Google App Engine. Synergyse is based in Toronto and we managed to be profitable within a couple of months of starting it. item.title: Forensisch software architect at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Forensisch software architect


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving



Word jij enthousiast van cutting edge frameworks en nieuwe technologieën?



Je vertaalt bij het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) de wensen van stakeholders naar concrete oplossingen. Dit doe je bij de groep Software Engineering, in het bijzonder voor het forensisch big data-platform Hansken.



Hansken wordt binnen en buiten het NFI gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering van ernstige misdrijven als kindermisbruik, moord, grootschalige fraude en andere delicten met grote maatschappelijke impact. Hansken draait op een gedistribueerde omgeving en verwerkt vele terabytes aan data per uur. Het analyseren van deze data kan miljoenen relevante sporen opleveren, denk  aan e-mails, chatberichten en GPS-coördinaten. Door nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen blijft het een uitdaging om steeds nieuwe typen forensische sporen doorzoekbaar te maken of slimme analyses toe te voegen, zoals entiteitextractie voor herkenning van kentekens, IBAN-nummers of adressen. Naast het dienen van een belangrijk maatschappelijk belang is Hansken ook een technisch zeer uitdagend project waar je telkens met nieuwe technieken in aanraking komt.



Als forensisch software architect ben jij voor Hansken de persoon die de wensen van stakeholders vertaalt naar concrete oplossingen. Je bent communicatief sterk en kunt Hansken uiteenzetten aan klanten en het management. Samen met ontwikkelaars beoordeel je nieuwe technologieën en frameworks op toepasbaarheid in de huidige architectuur. Vervolgens zorg je dat deze gebruikt worden. Je trekt de kar bij het besluitvormingsproces over gebruikte technologie en (technische) ontwerpbeslissingen op abstract niveau. Hierbij neem je onderbouwd besluiten en verdedig je deze. Bovendien leg je de architectuur vast en bewaak je deze.



Daarnaast ben je verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteit van Hansken. Je bewaakt de afgesproken principes en kwaliteitsrichtlijnen. Tot slot zul je zelf weinig ontwikkelen, maar beoordeel je wel kritisch de ontwikkelde code en zorg je dat deze voldoet aan de afgesproken architectuur.

item.title: R&D Team Leader Network Design And Security at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)

As a Senior Software Engineer on the Business Enablement team, you will help design, develop, and maintain the processes and tools that enable Code42 to achieve its objectives and better serve our users, both internal and external. item.title: Mobile & Front End UI Engineer / Inventor at Iodine (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Iodine is changing the way people find the right medical treatments. Our product is our voice, and we want you to shape it with us.


You work where design meets code. You know mobile UI patterns, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript like the back of your hand. You're passionate about experimentation, innovation, and playing around with the latest front-end technologies. You write clean, compatible, powerful user interfaces with speed. Bonus: You're passionate about understanding your audience, and dreaming up ways to build great technological futures for them.


As a mobile & front-end engineer, you’ll work closely with the rest of our design, engineering, product, and clinical team to turn ideas into tangible user experiences. You'll combine your keen design sense, stellar front-end chops, and the right technologies, to realize these ideas and validate them with users. Your wizardry will translate design concepts into living, breathing prototypes and finished products—all to help people make sense of health decisions.


You will co-own and shape the future of health & medical apps—both online, and in people’s pockets.

item.title: Developer Advocate (Evangelist)- Hot Open Source Software Company at Elasticsearch (Mountain View, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Want to work for one of the Coolest and Hottest Open Source Software Companies In The World


The Developer Relations program at Elastic focuses on increasing adoption of our technology and ensuring user success. In this role, you will serve as an advocate for Elastic's product line to Developer and Operations Professionals. Your primary role will be to engage with our user community through creating ops-oriented technical artifacts for our product stack, participating in user groups, representing the company at developer events and giving presentations on our technology.

item.title: Software Developer - Planning and Scheduling Systems at Tracsis plc (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
A talented software developer is sought to join our fast growing, successful software company which specialises in resource planning and scheduling software applications for the public transport industry.


The role will see the successful candidate interpret business requirements to develop and deliver high quality, customer focused applications and technical solutions. Working as part of an agile team, the role includes all aspects of the software lifecycle, from assessing business requirements and design through to testing, deployment and maintenance. We strongly encourage proactive learning, and personal development. We emphasise good technical practices and value long-term quality and continuous improvement.


Both recent graduates and experienced developers will be considered for this role. Candidates must hold a 2.1 or higher degree in Computing, Science, Engineering or Mathematics or a related discipline.

item.title: Systems Software Principal Engineer (C++, Polyglot) at Grier Forensics (Owings Mills, MD)
item.description:
Using C++ and other languages, you'll develop the next generation of security technology. We’ve used C++ to:



  • Accelerate device level forensics by more than 10x over existing technology

  • Implement new network protocols enabling collaborative defense against distributed attacks

  • Detect patterns of insider data theft in real-time through file system analytics


C++ is our language of choice for low level systems software. We write modern C++ (STL, RAII, and Boost). But, given our addiction to innovation and our position on its leading edge, our platforms and tools are always evolving. Therefore, a good fit requires that you thrive on learning new domains and tackling new challenges. Deep talent, problem solving, and a commitment to quality are more important than proficiency in any single language.


Our work straddles the fence between engineering and research. Like research, we’re inventing things that have never been done before. We thrive on discovery and are comfortable with risk. And our domain is never static. Yet, like engineering, we haven’t succeeded until we’ve produced well-built systems that people actually use.


We write code to be read. We’re looking for someone who cares deeply about clear, clean, well factored code. We emphasize architecture: the right architecture leads to a robust, simple, flexible implementation. Our project management is strong but hands off: you’ll be given clear goals and the support you need. From there it’s your job to deliver: you’ll be expected to solve problems independently and get the job done.


If this is the type of challenge you thrive on, we’d love to speak with you further. We’re located in Central Maryland, just outside of Baltimore and about a half hour from the beautiful Chesapeake Bay. Most of the time, you’ll be able to work remotely.


We offer competitive salary and benefits, including health, dental, and vision; 4 weeks paid vacation and holidays; opportunities to perform research, speak, and publish; unlimited technical books at our expense and whatever tools you need.


Grier Forensics is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

item.title: Senior Linux Systems Engineer at Synthetic Genomics, Inc. (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
At Synthetic Genomics, Inc., we are dedicated to developing and commercializing genomic-driven solutions to address global challenges. We are currently seeking a Senior Linux Systems Engineer to join our fast-growing, dynamic and collaborative team in La Jolla, CA.

As a member of the Information Technology department at Synthetic Genomics, you will work as part of a team of systems administrators and DevOps engineers to implement and support our SaaS application and Distributed Job Queue.  Candidate should be familiar with deployment pipeline tools such as Jenkins, Puppet, and Ansible, have solid systems engineering / operation experience and be able to contribute to all phases of project development cycle including definition, architecture, design, scoping, planning, implementation and testing.

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer, AWS Networking at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Amazon is looking for Software Development Engineers to build the software that monitors one of the world’s largest and most complex networks. Tens of millions of customers rely on Amazon’s network for using our retail websites, accessing content on their Kindles and building applications and businesses on top of Amazon Web Services (AWS). Our goal is to become The Infrastructure Platform for the world - achieving this goal requires high-leverage, massively scalable software systems. Our success depends on our world-class network infrastructure, and our network depends on our Network Monitoring team.



· You are interested in being part of a high-bar team with global responsibility for the Network Monitoring software used across all of Amazon’s businesses.

· Solving problems at scale excites you.

· You don’t implement specs from analysts and architects - you talk to your customers and design solutions to their problems. You automate and innovate.

· You do not push just one technology agenda - you choose the best tool for the problem at hand.

· You believe that the craft of software engineering is about writing code right the first time. For you, code reviews and automated testing are not chores - they’re a core part of writing great software.

· You don’t throw your code over the wall. You launch it, own it, support it and make it incrementally better for the benefit of your customers.

· You enjoy working in a flexible, fast-paced, collaborative team environment.

· Computer Science degree, or equivalent experience.

· Ability to gather customer requirements and deliver innovative solutions.

· Strong track record of launching projects of significant complexity.

· Ability to mentor other software developers to maintain architectural vision and software quality.

· Experience with software engineering best practices (code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, release and change management).

· Very strong problem solving and coding skills.

· Understanding of data structures, algorithms and their performance.

· Proficient at designing software systems, from high-availability large-scale distributed systems to your application’s object model.

· Understanding of the building blocks of computer systems; comfortable working with bits & bytes.

· Knowledge of at least one scripting language.

· Comfortable with Linux and a good understanding of networking concepts.



· Experience of working in a DevOps team.

· Experience developing robust, highly scalable distributed systems.



aws-sdesdm-ea

item.title: Java Frontend Developer (m/f) at Visual Meta GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for Java Frontend developers (m/f) on a full-time basis to help us invent, extend and scale our frontend services for leading shopping comparison platforms worldwide like LadenZeile and ShopAlike.


We, the IT team, believe in lean & agile software engineering and create websites for desktop, phone & tablet devices, native apps & inhouse applications for Visual Meta.


We code stuff that matters and in three different areas - Frontend, Mobile & Backend.


On the Frontend and Mobile side we deal a lot with modern web technologies such as Java, CSS, SASS, Javascript & jQuery.The Backend technology stack consists mainly of MySQL, Spring, Tomcat, GWT, HBase, Hadoop and ElasticSearch.


Your responsibilities:

  • Setting up A/B-Tests to assure effectiveness and user acceptance of new/already existing functionality

  • Monitoring and improving the page load time on desktop, mobile and tablet pages

  • Good knowledge and awareness on-page search engine optimization


What we offer:



  • A committed, successful and international team

  • Large impact due to small, excellent development teams and professional data center environments

  • Leading-edge technology to solve challenging problems and to build great software

  • Continuous training possibilities and room for further personal development

  • Flexible working hours and a great office in the heart of Berlin

  • Healthy snacks (fruits, cereals), water and hot drinks

  • Team events, movie nights, table football, ping-pong, company bikes, etc.


If you are interested in an exciting position within a friendly team, please submit your application in English to the attention of Marcel Pierry including cover letter, CV, your earliest starting date, salary expectations as well as relevant references.


We are looking forward to receiving your application!

item.title: Software Engineer - Network Function Virtualization Orchestration at Casa Systems, Inc. (Andover, MA)

The Software Engineer will impact the organization by focusing on Network Function Virtualization (NFV) Orchestration development in accordance with software development practices, procedures and quality standards established by the company.

item.title: Software Engineer - Cleantech Startup at EnergySavvy (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
EnergySavvy is looking to grow our flagship product team, Optix Engage. As one of Washington’s Best Workplaces two years in a row, we know that politics and bureaucracy never make great products. We focus on results and creating high-quality, user-centric software. Ideas and innovation thrive in our open, meritocratic culture.


Software engineering is the heart of our company. We rely on our developers to collaborate and shape the product direction. This means a leaner specification process and an excellent end product that's been built with the type of feedback you can only get by trying out aspects of each feature as they're developed. You’ll iterate quickly with an emphasis on clean and reusable code.


We’re building a new product that’s transforming the way businesses save money on energy. If you’re excited about the opportunity of working on a new product, making decisions around architecture and design, this would be a great fit for you. We don't care if you've never tried Python, Django or React. EnergySavvy embraces smart software engineers who are eager to learn, and if you've created great projects in Rails or other MVC frameworks, you'll pick it up fast.

item.title: // CriteoSeniorDeveloper.cs - Senior Software Engineer in Paris, France at Criteo (Paris, France)
item.description:
using System;


using System.Linq;


namespace CriteoQuestions


{


    class Program


    {


        static readonly uint THRESHOLD = 5;


        static uint Question(string text)


        {


            Console.WriteLine(text + " [y/N]");


            string answer = Console.ReadLine();


            return answer != null && answer.Equals("y") ? 1U : 0U;


        }


        static void Main()


        {


            string[] questionTexts =


                {


                    "Looking for a new challenge?",


                    "Want to work in the heart of Paris?",


                    "Do you enjoy solving hard problems efficiently and creatively?",


                    "Would you like to work where Big Data is more than a buzz word?",


                    "Want to work on a product at true web scale with 30B HTTP requests and 2.5B unique banners displayed per day?",


                    "Would you like to know more?"


                };


            uint score = questionTexts.Aggregate<string, uint>(0, (current, text) => current + Question(text));


            Console.WriteLine(score > THRESHOLD


                                  ? @"Contact a.dia@criteo.com today"


                                  : @"That’s a shame, you can learn more at http://labs.criteo.com/ maybe we can change your mind?");


            Console.ReadLine();


        }


    }


}

item.title: Full Stack Engineer - Budapest at Prezi.com (Budapest, Magyarország)
item.description:
We're looking for an engineer interested in writing and running the mission-critical backend services of Prezi and building forward thinking web experiences and interactions for our users.  


As a Full Stack Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to work with a growing start-up, building things millions of people will see everyday. You will experience and experiment with new technologies and work with a group of people whom you can learn and keep pushing things forward. This position is located in our Budapest office.



You should be excited about:




  • Joining a team that focuses on the growth of the whole product




  • Working in a small, cross functional team with other engineers, designers, data analysts, marketing, product managers.




  • Creating customer facing applications




  • New technology and design




  • Working in a challenging, fast paced and always changing environment.




  • Working with big data





Challenges you will be working on:




  • Participate in building a microservice architecture which scales, routes around failure and lets us build complex systems out of small components as well as maintain existing web applications.




  • Run everything into the cloud (AWS), rethinking the assumptions that no longer hold in our current architecture.




  • Help us build our emerging JVM based stack (built on the Netflix open-source stack, mostly in Scala), which will power our next generation of services.




  • Open source some of the awesome things we’re working on.




  • Develop and maintain existing backend services (mostly written in Python) to ensure they are efficient, reliable and secure enough for our many million users.




  • Exploring exciting relationships, patterns, answers in our enormous data sets




  • Developing high fidelity functional prototypes to validate growth initiatives




  • Pro-actively enhancing our web platform

item.title: (Senior) PHP / Symfony2 Developer (m/w) at Exozet Berlin GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Symfony2 is your most favourite framework and you have already used it in several projects. You know the bundles and how to apply them. For example Sonata (Admin, User, Media…) or Elastica. You know how to manage test suites with Jenkins – just because Continuous Integration should be part of every project. You love to design and develop complex web portals. Troubleshooter is your second name. For you large quantities of data are easy to handle and a bugfix triggers a dance of joy in you. You don’t hesitate to try out new tools and you are always open for new ideas. You love to share your knowledge with your colleagues and also project managers whom you advise in terms of best solutions, priorities and planning.



This is what you can expect


You develop individual solutions for our clients based on Symfony2 and PHP as part of our teams. You design databases with Doctrine and improve data base accesses. You fix bugs, write documentation and discuss possible solutions – with your team, the project managers, designers and QA. And sometimes even with our clients. You can expect exciting projects, nice colleagues, a family-friendly atmosphere and a wonderful view over the Tempelhof Airport Field.

item.title: UX Designer at CDK Global (Hoffman Estates, IL)
item.description:
ADP Dealer Services is now CDK Global.


Stability meets Agility. CDK is one of the largest technology providers to the automotive industry, with more than 26,000 dealer sites in over 100 countries and nearly 9,000 employees worldwide. From data scientists to sales and operations experts, we're hiring to support your growth and ours. GreenLight Your Career.


CDK Global is transforming the car buying process for both automotive dealers and car buyers. To achieve this lofty goal, we are deeply engaging with the our users to ensure that our products ignite efficiency and productivity while being delightfully easy to use. The User Experience engineering group at CDK is focused on the quality of the interactions people have with our technology and is looking for professionals that employ the principles and techniques of User Centered Design to join us. UX @ CDK follows a multi-disciplinary approach that focuses on all the users' emotions, beliefs, preferences, perceptions, and behaviors through an iterative research and design process. As a UX designer you will...



  • Transform the end user experience for CDK's automotive dealership solutions

  • Work closely with product development teams to follow user-centered design principles

  • Provide interaction and visual design

  • Drive the design vision, processes, and execution

  • Collaborate closely with UX researchers to ensure designs meets the needs of the user

  • Present and evangelize your work and the concept of usability across the organization

  • Operate with lean, agile frameworks and methodologies to improve the ability to respond to change

item.title: Java Software Engineer at Practichem (Morrisville, NC)
item.description:
Practichem is growing and needs to add an experienced full stack Java developer. You'll create full stack web applications using Java, AngularJS, CoffeeScript, Less, Jade, NodeJS, and related technologies.


You'll control real world equipment directly from a single-page browser application. Recent tasks we completed:



  • Display of huge data sets on a multi-tabbed interface within the browser

  • Pattern recognition and identification within large data sets

  • Multi-instrument integration with a coordination site

  • Creation of simulated instruments into Docker containers for load testing


You'll integrate browser controlled Arista™ into a whole browser based lab concept. Along with a great team of software and hardware engineers, you'll be bringing amazing products to the world. 


What makes this position stand out?



  • Control real hardware using web applications you develop.

  • Work in the highly technical domain of scientific instruments.

  • Choose your daily OS. Many of us prefer Linux.

  • You get a great computer (Lenovo or Mac) with plenty of RAM and huge monitors.

  • Count on professional User Interaction designers on our team.

  • Create new software using the latest frameworks and tools.

  • At Practichem, we make our own real, physical stuff.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at import.io (London, UK)
item.description:
import.io is a young start-up of just over 30 people, looking to shake-up the world of data. From our homebase in London, we’re working hard to give people a totally new way to access the web.


import.io comprises of many different and distributed parts, and we’re looking for someone who will help our complex and challenging systems evolve and grow!



You will be responsible for the overall health and well-being of our mission critical infrastructure. Things that may affect this include:



  • Increases and spike in load due to increase in query numbers, or increases in query complexity.

  • Ever-increasing numbers of pages that are crawled and structured by us for our enterprise data products.

  • Malicious attacks on our infrastructure, or AWS outages.

  • Suitability for architecture and components for scale, e.g. MySQL vs HBase.

  • Ability for systems to survive single or multiple points of failure.

  • Awareness of problems before, or as, they arise by monitoring and alerting of key metrics.

  • Bugs in our software or third party software that manifest as operational issues



Responsibilities would include:



  • Designing and improving distributed self-healing fault-tolerant distributed systems

  • Architecting and implementing changes to better respond to dynamic or projected increases in load or scale, changes of desired latency, or other changing parameters; including designing models, evaluating and choosing new components.

  • Automation and optimization of processes to build, test and roll out system updates, and to advance software through development, testing, staging and production.

  • Designing and implementing safeguards against malicious attacks on our infrastructure.

  • Designing and implementing monitoring, metrics and logging to identify any issues or performance improvements within systems, analysing information and presenting findings along with recommendations; including garbage collection, heap usage, log file analysis, latency, response times, load balancer statistics, database statistics, etc.

  • Blogging about our engineering, as well as communication of operational issues.

  • Emergency out-of-hours operational support

item.title: QA Automation Engineer - Consultant at OnDeck (New York, NY)
item.description:
As a QA automation engineer, you’ll work with development teams to code, test, and deploy quality features for our customers and internal users. Every day you’ll use our extensive end-to-end test automation framework and hands-on testing to support exciting new projects. We also put a heavy emphasis in the QA team on test automation – everything from web automation (using Selenium) to REST API automation to data persistence & validity (in SQL, MongoDB, and Salesforce) to model testing.


When you’re testing a feature for the first time, are you dreaming on how you could automate the process? Are you always looking for a way to use technology to finish a job better and faster? This position will give you challenging opportunities to grow professionally as a QA automation engineer.


As a QA Automation Engineer at OnDeck, you will:

  • Develop and maintain test documentation.

  • Monitor production issue backlog.

  • Work with QA team and development team to maintain and monitor execution of automation testing in development, QA, and staging environments.

ABOUT YOU

  • Agile principles and a balanced appreciation of the lean mindset - with a view to iterate and test rapidly where possible and sensible, and design and implement to ship a version of a solution sooner rather than later. (We aim to follow the spirit of the law, and not its letter.)

item.title: Lead MySQL DBA at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Lead Database Administrator with good system and database administration skills. As a Lead DBA you will managing a team of DBA’s who are responsible for the performance, integrity and security of our databases which is about 50 MySQL servers and dozen of Vertica Servers. The operations team leverages some of the most cutting edge technology to simplify an otherwise complex system.

Candidates should have a passion for building infrastructure for high-performance, "Big Data" systems. In this role, you will leverage open-source tools like MySQL, Hadoop, HBase, Hive, and Couchbase.  Candidates will at least be familiar with the technologies we are using but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings. However, you should have a true passion for systems engineering that is apparent in your past work.

item.title: Software Engineer, Backend at Cisco Meraki (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Meraki’s customer base has grown by a factor of 2-3 every year since we started, leading to a current request rate of over 200 million page views per day, and the Meraki backend team keeps our cloud management infrastructure scaling in the face of that growth.


Examples of the systems we've built/worked on include:



  • A secure, resilient overlay network that allows our backend to deliver configurations and gather statistics from our devices despite Internet routing anomalies and middleboxes.

  • A highly concurrent daemon that gathers updated statistics from every Meraki wireless access point, switch, and firewall every 45 seconds.

  • A custom database, written from scratch in C++, that processes over 1 million writes/second and intelligently partitions statistics data on disk for fast retrieval and efficient in-memory caching.


The backend team uses a number of different programming languages and systems, deliberately choosing the right tools for each particular application. We write code in C++, Ruby, and Scala. We use Linux, PostgreSQL, Rails, Jetty, Click, nginx, and memcached. We contribute to several open source projects.

item.title: Platform Engineer (Python) at Apervita, Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Platform Engineer at Apervita is responsible for the architecture and development of the back-end functions that drive the Apervita platform. Development is all in Python interacting with MongoDB as our data store to build a leading edge platform to revolutionize the healthcare industry in Clinical Decision Support and Quality of Care operations.


The Platform Engineer will design and build new reusable components and frameworks, optimize and refactor existing components, and design scalable and resilient solutions as the foundation for the platform. The Platform Engineer will also partner with the Front-End Engineering team to produce various features for our customers, enhance existing features, and ensure overall security, stability, and usability of the platform.


Apervita uses an Agile methodology and uses extensive unit testing and peer review as part of the development process.


The Apervita platform is a multi-tier application built on Python and MongoDB and extensively uses cloud computing principles.


Apervita strives to enable developers to spend as much time as possible on design collaboration and development, running a low-overhead methodology based on Agile and Continuous Integration principles. We want developers to do what they do best, rising to meet technology challenges and working together as a team to build a world class platform.

item.title: Quality Assurance Engineer at Emerlyn Technology, LLC (Conway, NH)

As a Quality Assurance Engineer you will be responsible for working with development and account support teams in developing test workflow, including functional, integration, regression, UAT, and performance/stress testing.
In addition:



  • Evaluate and recommend testing tools and environment.

  • Participate in installation and maintenance of testing tools and environment.

  • Document, prioritize and monitor issues.

item.title: Dev for Philly! *no remote work!* at Curalate (Philadelphia, PA)
item.description:
Curalate is looking for talented software developers to join our team.  Our engineering team today is deep in the trenches -- tackling some of the gnarliest problems out there at the intersection of computer vision and big data -- and we're looking for a few good coders to join us.


Although experience with our existing technology stack is great, we're much more interested in hiring developers with exceptional problem solving skills, creative out-of-the-box thinking, and comfort with quickly learning, evaluating, and deploying new technologies. While we're not looking for any specific industry experience (we'll hire recent grads), you should come prepared to join a fast-moving team. You'll be expected to dive into our stack and toolkit, and start shipping code on day one. We're not hiring code monkeys; you'll be given substantial feature ownership, and we'll expect you to contribute product ideas as well as code. Above all else, we're looking for others who are as excited above the potential in this space as we are, and who will be willing to join us in moving fast and breaking things as we execute against that vision.

item.title: Sr. Engineer (Dev Tools) at AudienceScience (Bellevue, WA)

item.title: Java Software Engineer at HERE a Nokia Company (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Sr. Engineer – Java


The HERE Reality Capture & Processing (RCP) Platform team is expanding!


The RCP Platform team builds services designed to efficiently deliver our immense collection of 3D street-level and aerial content to product teams to power the next-generation of 3D consumer maps, enhanced navigation systems and more. We are looking for experienced candidates who will be able to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment focused on innovation and be able to learn and integrate complementary technologies inside and outside their specific area of expertise to deliver highly scalable and fault tolerant systems to optimize the way content feeds in to all of our products in the automotive, enterprise, and consumer spaces.



Responsibilities:



With a global fleet of vehicles collecting petabytes of 3D street-level and aerial data per year, you will be:
• Contributing to an engineering team charged with designing, architecting and building a platform to transform these massive data sets into building blocks for content creation.
• Building out services and APIs providing direct access to these rich 3D datasets.
• Work with Amazon Web Services as a storage and computing platform, especially with S3 and EC2.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at OnDeck (New York, NY)
item.description:
OnDeck (ONDK) uses data aggregation and electronic payment technology to evaluate the financial health of small and medium sized businesses to efficiently deliver capital to a market underserved by banks. Through the OnDeck platform, millions of small businesses can obtain affordable loans. We are changing the way small businesses borrow money by combining our passion for Main Street with cutting-edge technology. We evaluate businesses based on their actual performance, not personal credit, and that’s enabled us to say “yes” more often and faster than traditional lenders.


What excites us at OnDeck? Technology. Innovation. Small businesses. We believe in our employees and power their growth through being challenged every day and offering careers that inspire. We’re all about teamwork, passion and making an impact. Oh and having fun – Whether it’s a game of Ping-Pong, team get-togethers or weekly happy hours in the office.


Department summary:


Technology at OnDeck is a mix of building cutting edge systems to provide a world-class user experience to our customers and partners, aggregate mountains of data to make real-time lending decisions, and of course move lots of money every day.  We have an emphasis on scalability, reliability and accuracy.


As a Software Engineer, you will: 



  • You will investigate, prototype, build and transition tools, frameworks, and products to other internal teams

  • Participate with Technology management in the development of technology products and services.

  • Build a team of diverse professionals to drive ideas from concept to implementation.

  • Speak and author papers to showcase the company as a technology innovation leader in the commercial lending space.

  • Transition successful implementations to engineering for full support and build out.

  • Drive organizational change around key innovation products.

  • Provide insight, feedback and assistance to other technology teams as needed.

item.title: MySQL DBA at Quotient, Inc. (Washington, DC)
item.description:
Why this job?


Quotient's IT Solutions and Services help clients use technology to enhance their service delivery and business processes. Quotient has a proven track record with Federal Agency customers. These roles will contribute to our nation's knowledge base and will be seen by millions of visitors seeking answers to a myriad of real life issues. 



• Optimizing DB configurations for performance and stability


• Monitoring DB performance and health


• SQL Query development/tuning


• Creating table structure creation and optimization


• Storing procedure and user defined function development


• Data modeling and design


• Backup / restore planning, testing, execution


• Disaster recovery planning and execution


• Managing project responsibilities and deliverables as part of an agile development process


• Providing technical design recommendations for solutions


• New DB installation and configuration


• DB replication set up and tuning


• Database security analysis, implementation, and maintenance


• Requirements analysis 


• Support white box testing of software applications


• Participates in agile development processes and practices


• DB Clustering techniques

item.title: Software Engineer, Mobile at MoLabs (New York, NY)
item.description: MoLabs is focused on building the next great mobile-first platform. To get there, we are assembling a world-class product and engineering team. MoLabs' software engineers develop the scalable, mobile-first technologies that change how users consume, explore and interact with information and the world. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing and UI design. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack. With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions. Software Engineers have a penchant for solving complex and interesting problems. Pushing the boundaries of current mobile platforms, you will perform technological feats under constrained environments and will be presented with exciting challenges in native mobile application development. Our Software Engineers in Mobile Applications work on many projects that carry varying responsibilities. You will build MoLabs products for either Android or iOS. If you are an Android Developer, you will develop applications primarily in Java and using the Android SDK. If you are an iOS Developer, you will develop applications and SDKs primarily in Swift or Objective-C and using the iOS SDK.

item.title: Senior Python Engineer at Clover Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Clover Health is driving down costs and producing improved health outcomes with a unique health insurance plan. We use sophisticated analytics and custom software to direct our own clinical staff to proactively fill in gaps in the care of our members. We have a proven model we're scaling out.


We're focusing on elderly and low-income patients that stand to benefit from our model the most. This puts us in a position to make a major dent in healthcare expense in the United States and reverse an unsustainable, decades-long spending trend.


We are looking for Senior Python Engineers to join our team. You'll be part of a team building applications and services to support our medical team, with opportunities to touch a wide range of technology. Python is the primary language of our tech stack, and we’re looking to add more python expertise to our team. You’ll work with the rest of the engineering team to set direction in building applications and data pipelines in python. We value moving fast, but we do so with a pragmatic approach that will allow us to sustain velocity over time.


Healthcare experience not required.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Autonomous Driving at HERE-Chicago (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Senior Java Software Engineer



The HERE Reality Capture & Processing (RCP) Platform team is expanding!



The RCP Platform team builds services designed to efficiently deliver our immense collection of 3D street-level and aerial content to product teams to power the next-generation of 3D consumer maps, enhanced navigation systems and more. We are looking for experienced candidates who will be able to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment focused on innovation and be able to learn and integrate complementary technologies inside and outside their specific area of expertise to deliver highly scalable and fault tolerant systems to optimize the way content feeds in to all of our products in the automotive, enterprise, and consumer spaces.



Responsibilities:
With a global fleet of vehicles collecting petabytes of 3D street-level and aerial data per year, you will be:
• Contributing to a engineering team charged with designing, architecting and building a platform to transform these massive data sets into building blocks for content creation.
• Building out services and APIs providing direct access to these rich 3D datasets.
• Work with Amazon Web Services as a storage and computing platform, especially with S3 and EC2.

a10:author.a10:name: Interhack Corp. and Secure Discovery LLC

item.title: Python/Django Engineer at Interhack Corp. and Secure Discovery LLC (Columbus, OH) (allows remote)
item.description:
A computer expert and electronic discovery firm is looking for an experienced Python and Django engineer to focus on an application that is currently being used to process evidence in legal proceeding across the United States. This candidate will work collaboratively to lead development of a web frontend for this existing data center application. Successful candidates are passionate about the art of problem solving through programming and will understand how to balance the tradeoffs of code that is simple, clever, secure, and of high quality.


The job is a contract position for a period of three to six months. Opportunities for full-time employment exist at the end of the contract period. Our offices are located in Columbus, OH but telecommuting may be possible for the right candidate.

item.title: Full Stack Developer at Bidalgo (Ramat Gan, Israel)
item.description: Bidalgo is looking for an outstanding Full Stack Developer to work on our next generation web platform and take part in the company's most important and exciting projects. Here at Bidalgo we work in a small and empowered team that utilizes bleeding edge technologies to rapidly deliver features to customers, measure results and iterate, while using continuous methodologies. Bidalgo's development team is responsible for building and developing smart big data algorithms to analyze user interactions with social media and mobile apps. We offer an industry leading SaaS solution. As a part of the engineering team, this role includes designing & developing production quality code. You will be working with the latest JS frameworks (Angular.js), Java, PHP and Node-JS, MySQL, RedShift and MongoDB. We believe in creative people, that are not afraid of new ideas and new ways of doing things. If you want the chance to make a difference and you're committed to quality - your place is us!

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Messaging at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Twilio platform enables companies to integrate communications directly into their applications via simple cloud APIs and with on-demand global reach.  Twilio is therefore challenged with abstracting away a world of complexity so that our customers can go global without concern for managing a global communications network, carrier integrations and relationships throughout the world.


About the job:


As a member of the messaging team at Twilio, you will enhance and scale the SMS and MMS platform that touches millions of people every day. To take it to scale, you will be developing a complex distributed platform in Scala and Java and will be concerned with availability, throughput, latency, and data integrity. There will be a significant data component so you will be working with distributed SQL and NoSQL databases and caches.  At the core are cloud technologies that enable deployment and management of computing resources globally.  


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with Product Managers, Architects and Engineering leaders to define, architect and build new customer-facing features.

  • Own, operate, and maintain your team’s services in a distributed production environment. Employ Agile methodologies to continuously deliver value to customers.

  • Drive quality by writing unit, functional, load and performance tests.

  • Release, monitor, and maintain features in a responsible, reliable way as part of our integrated DevOps practices.

item.title: Principal UI Engineer at Attivio, Inc (Newton, MA)
item.description:
Job Description


If you are passionate about creating impactful and intuitive UIs, consider yourself a trend-setter and creator of innovative solutions, have strong requirements gathering, design, coding and troubleshooting skills, and are relentless in your pursuit of developing well-architected software and delivering high-quality work, you will find the Principal GUI Engineer role in the Engineering Group satisfying and challenging.  You will be responsible for designing, developing, and supporting Attivio's new end-user, developer, and administrator GUI initiatives for Enterprise Search and Big Data markets.

Responsibilities also include –
•    Designing and developing the user experience for GUI initiatives, including creating and developing wireframes, storyboards and use cases.  
•    Creating and preparing recommendations on feature sets and technical infrastructure for assigned projects and new system modules.
•    Consulting with partners, customers, and end users to receive feedback regarding the design and maintenance of Attivio's technology and GUIs.
•    Researching and finding opportunities to take advantage of existing platforms and communities to improve user experience through GUIs.
•    Implementing GUI projects using Agile methodologies.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Gateway at Avigilon (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
Avigilon is seeking an experienced C++ engineer to redesign the gateway enterprise application. The focus of this role is on building a public communication layer between enterprise servers and web, mobile and third party clients.


The candidate must have experience in the following areas:



  • Architecture of cutting-edge object oriented C++ application for video, networking, communication and storage

  • Design of RESTful APIs with low-latency/real-time requirements

  • Ingestion, processing and handling of large, remote, real-time telemetry and video data sets

  • Collaboration with other product teams to define, design and implement new features


Our office is currently located on Middlesex Turnpike, Billerica but relocating to Assembly Row, Somerville in November.

item.title: Junior Software Engineer - C# at Intronis (Chelmsford, MA)
item.description:
This is an amazing opportunity for a Software Engineer to join a growing team of talented software developers at Intronis and make a major impact on the technical direction of our product. You will have the best of both worlds: join a software startup in the high-growth cloud market sector that has a real product, real customers and a rock solid financial picture and the opportunity to work on some cool technology at a company with a ton of growth potential.



We are seeking  talented, self-motivated software engineers who have experience with C#, .NET, Object Oriented design and implementation and Web Services.  Working closely with a team of analysts, developers, QA and other business resources you will be continuously improving and enhancing the primary interface for our growing customer base.  We work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where you will have the opportunity to grow and refine your skills while rotating through research and development, mainline development and sustaining environments.

item.title: Java software developer at AdClear GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for a reliable, responsible and motivated Senior Java software developer in the field of BigData and AdAnalytics.


AdClear is a growing Berlin start-up and one of the leading AdAnalytics and customer journey analysis providers. AdClear offers an integrated system for tracking, analysis and optimization of the complete online marketing.


What we offer:



  • Participation in an open-minded, creative and successful berlin based team (start-up spirit!)

  • Working with the latest technologies in an agile development process

  • Portfolio of large national and international clients/brands

  • Development of innovative, straight-forward new products as well as customer requested customer journey related derivatives

  • Excellent personal and technical development opportunities


Your job:



  • You will be part of our developers team and you will be responsible for developing sophisticated solutions for our national and international clients

  • Implementation of Java software components and transform legacy code into state-of-the art code

  • You will be responsible for our core tracking technology and develop it to the next stage

  • Statistical, heuristical and programmatically deal with Big Data

  • Research and evaluation of new technologies

  • Team Lead

  • Full time position

item.title: Senior Fullstack Engineer NYC at Curalate (New York, NY)
item.description:
Curalate is looking for talented senior software engineers to join our team.  Our engineering team today is deep in the trenches -- tackling some of the gnarliest problems out there at the intersection of computer vision and big data -- and we're looking for a few great coders to join us.


Although experience with our existing technology stack is great, we're much more interested in hiring developers with exceptional problem solving skills, creative out-of-the-box thinking, and comfort evaluating and deploying new technologies.


For this position, we're looking for accomplished engineers with at least three years of experience at a high-functioning technology company; you should know exactly what it takes to ship high quality software on-time.  And while this is an IC role, we will lean on you to help mentor the more junior members of our team.


We're not hiring code monkeys; you'll be given substantial feature ownership, and we'll expect you to contribute product ideas as well as code. Above all else, we're looking for others who are as excited above the potential in this space as we are, and who will be willing to join us in moving fast and breaking things as we execute against that vision.

item.title: Sr. Front-end Software Engineer on the EO Ground Segment Engineering team at UrtheCast (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
UrtheCast is growing at hyper speed and we're looking for a Sr. Front-End Software Engineer who will be responsible for designing, developing and testing user interfaces and front-end functionality to be used within the UrtheCast Ground Systems, as well as to support the Lead Architect in devising upgrades, refactoring strategies, common utilities and implementing UI/UX design procedures and testing processes, and produce or update the corresponding documentation.


What can we offer you?



  • Competitive compensation, full benefits and flexible time off

  • Great work environment, team and office location right over the water in the new Vancouver Convention Centre

  • Great lunch programs will provide you with an opportunity to learn and socialize, and our Friday afternoons will set the right mood for the weekend

  • Gym membership

  • Sports teams (soccer, dodgeball, etc) and lots of events

  • Fully loaded kitchen!


What you'll be doing, the gist:



  • Design, implement, test, and debug Ground Segment user interfaces

  • Code review and merge new features and test bug fixes to integration and production environments and monitor and execute server deployments

  • Support the discovery of requirements for the Ground Segment

  • Support the management of the sprint work across all systems

  • Participate in project strategy and product roadmap meetings

item.title: Sr. Network & Systems Engineer at Rewards Network (Miami, FL)
item.description:
The Senior Network and Systems Engineer position is responsible for ongoing assessment and maintenance of all Rewards Network’s Information Technology infrastructure, systems, and security. This position will be required to work independently and within teams to assist with operations management, problem management, and project management. Additionally, the Senior Network and Systems Engineer will be accountable for equipment evaluation, systems design, and compliance requirements. The person in this role will be responsible for contributing and achieving department and company goals.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities



  • Designs, implements, and maintains network infrastructure and system operations independently and as member of the Network and Systems Engineering Team.

  • Acts as escalation point to the Application Support Team and the Reward’s Network’s Support Center facilitating their efforts to resolve incidents and execute problem management.

  • Exhibits solid communication skills both verbally and written between team, department, organization and external entities.

  • Monitors Network & Security operations including infrastructure and systems “Alerts” and log entries resolving and/or escalating issues in a timely manner.

  • Adheres to Change Management and Quality Assurance requirements during configurations changes, vendor patch deployments, upgrades, and project execution.

  • Ensures there is a collaborative process of development and maintenance in place for all policies, procedures and standards as they apply to network, systems, and security infrastructure.

  • Familiar with implementations of process and security frameworks like ITIL v3 and ISO 2700x, and familiar with compliance initiatives like PCI DSS and SOC II & III.

  • Recommends and contributes to system and network opportunities for increased systems uptime, expanded operational performance and reduction of ongoing costs.

  • Develops, implements and manages project plans to facilitate implementation and operational rollout of network infrastructure and security solutions.

  • Leads by example, demonstrating best practices for trouble shooting issues, cross training within the team, and provides constructive feedback to peers to improve the strength of the team.

  • Provides 24x7x365 days a year support for all of Rewards Network’s Network Infrastructure, users, and outside departments on a rotating On-Call Schedule.

  • Capacity planning and performance analysis of infrastructure.

  • Develops projects to improve performance, efficiency, experience, capacity, etc. of environment

item.title: Technical Principal at ThoughtWorks (London, UK)
item.description:
ThoughtWorks is synonymous with innovation. We’re a diverse community of bright and passionate individuals striving to have a positive impact on the world. We’re dedicated to the art of software delivery, by keeping it lightweight, agile and open-source. Our clients are organisations with ambitious missions, where we deliver complex enterprise systems to help them solve their toughest business problems. As a Principal Consultant at ThoughtWorks you have total responsibility for technical delivery on a client engagement so you are likely to have extensive experience.


As a Principal Consultant, here’s what you can do at ThoughtWorks: 



  • Disrupt, Lead and Innovate.

  • Take the needs and challenges of a client and formulate the technical roadmap and technology solution that will support their business strategies and goals.

  • Provide Technical leadership across all areas of the enterprise, to ensure delivery of exceptional technical solutions

  • Formulate and articulate the technical and political implication of real world solutions

  • Orchestrate the management of technology scope and risks

  • Mentor on approach and execution of solutions, coach on technologies and establishing a team wide comprehension of solution capabilities and direction

  • Ensure technical expectations of deliverables are met

  • Drive ThoughtWorks’ Thought-Leadership on engineering and architectural practices and standards

  • Be an inspiration of innovation to the client

  • Become a trusted and valued partner of the client CIO/CTO and team

  • Exploit opportunities for networking and relationship building that arise out of delivery activities

  • Creates and supports sales activities

  • Maintaining strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products

  • Code! We don’t subscribe to the “post-technical” ivory tower leadership style



We work almost exclusively on customer site providing a mix of delivery and consulting services, so you’ll be flexible about travel. 



We offer amazing benefits from the day you start including private medical insurance, travel insurance, income protection, critical illness, life assurance, pension scheme, child care vouchers, personal development budget, 25 days holiday and a ride2work scheme.



To apply please submit your CV and tell us why you want to join ThoughtWorks. One of our recruiters will be in touch.


At ThoughtWorks we promote diversity in all its forms and reject discrimination and inequality. We proudly, passionately and actively strive to make both ThoughtWorks and our industry more reflective and inclusive of the society that we serve

item.title: Software Engineering Manager at Amazon (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?



At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.



Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.



What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?

· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.description:
