We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at MediaMath (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Platform Integrations team at MediaMath solves unique client challenges via the development of custom software solutions and bespoke integrations that leverage TerminalOne APIs, MediaMath technology platform services, and 3rd party technologies.


We are currently seeking a highly qualified DevOps Engineer to work in our New York office.


In this role, you will



  • Work in a fast-paced environment overseeing a combination of self-managed Debian boxes and Amazon Web Services

  • Troubleshoot, diagnose, and resolve production issues

  • Develop automation and monitoring solutions and tools, creating efficiencies in daily operational activities



Responsibilities:



  • Manage the scalability, performance, and availability of the Platform Integrations infrastructure and applications by solving for reliability against existing systems and services spanning the entire stack

  • Independently identify opportunities to improve system scalability and stability, and implement enhancements and best practices for modern development principles and methodologies

  • Develop tools and automation to minimize delivery time and increase developer productivity

  • Participate in the design and development of new and evolving services, architecture, and performance standards

  • Communicate and coordinate with internal teams and third party services to effectively resolve day-to-day issues and relay updates to the rest of the team

  • Develop strong relationships and collaborate with key internal engineering and product stakeholders; understanding the product and engineering roadmap, and acting as subject matter expert on advanced infrastructure and platform capabilities, features, and offerings

item.title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer at HBC Digital (New York, NY)
item.description:
As a Senior QA Engineer, your day to day activities include: developing test scripts, executing tests and analyzing results, solving complex problems, providing/evaluating solution options, collaborating with IT teams, researching new products and/or working on internal projects. Your job requires ability to: manage multiple tasks with competing priorities, adapt to changes in scope or schedule, work under tight timelines, be creative in working through obstacles, effectively communicate, collaborate with business and technical teams, and deliver on time. You are expected to know how to effectively manage a project from planning to delivery. You can be assigned individual project or participate in group project, in a lead or contributor capacity. Additionally, you are responsible for administrating of QA systems and tools. Last but not least, you will be conducting performance/load testing, and/or assigned functional projects.

Requirement:


  • Proficient with HTML, JavaScript, and CSS.

  • Fluent in Object Oriented Design and Object Oriented Programming.

  • Proficient in a high level programming language (Java/C# - prefer Java).

  • Ability to maintain/enhance existing (complex) Java code.

  • Familiar with Windows Server and Linux Operating System.

  • Proficient with SQL and able to create DB table schema, stored procedure, and trigger.

  • Good knowledge of system networking (understand switch, router, load balancer, network monitoring, etc.

  • Background in performance/load testing ecommerce architecture.

  • Knowledgeable of the various data exchange formats like XML, JSON, etc.

  • Ability to analyze complex data sets (log analysis, network package analysis, etc.

  • Familiarity with Continuous Deployment and Continuous Integration.

  • Ability to lead a technical team.

  • Ability to solve complex problems and recommend solution options.

  • Project management and time management skills.

  • Ability to effectively communicate with business and technical audiences.

  • Capable of multi-tasking and working through multiple priorities.

  • Self-starter, go-getter, and team player.

  • Flexible to work extended hours or off-hours when needed.

item.title: Senior PHP Software Engineer at The Idea People (Charlotte, NC)
item.description: The Idea People are looking for an experienced web developer. You will be responsible for delivering applications that drive cutting-edge technology development. You will be responsible for the creation and implementation of a wide variety of web-based products using PHP, JavaScript, HTML5, and MySQL/NoSQL. Our team enjoys challenges and thrives on cool design delivery.

item.title: Business Product Owner at MediaRadar (New York, NY)
item.description:
DESCRIPTION


You are a hands-on top performer who will augment our product team and focus on the future of our offerings. Your flexibility and desire to learn is essential. You have the passion and innate ability to become the “CEO” of every assigned initiative.



What you’ll be doing:



Our Business Product Owner will be an individual contributor, focusing on the business aspects of our strategic offerings. Your job will be spent on the following key objectives:



  • identifying and assessing business opportunities

  • building and managing product road maps

  • constructing the revenue model, understanding and managing revenue and costs levers

  • managing relationships with stakeholders in finance, marketing, sales and operations

  • establishing and maintaining key external partner relationships

  • working closely with the product and engineering teams in an agile environment to deliver amazing products to market

  • tracking success and failure via business analysis of metrics and analytics

item.title: Full Stack Software Developer at Intelliware Development Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Intelliware is looking for full stack software developers to join our dev team. If you’re looking to work on everything from front-end to server-side code and database architecture, we’d love to hear from you.


At Intelliware you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a top-notch team and work on a wide range of complex projects. We have a unique team-based Agile environment with collaborative project rooms where you’ll find continuous learning opportunities and challenging work. Project teams work closely with client subject matter experts, end users and IT teams to deliver anything from proof-of-concept prototypes to bulletproof, long living, high volume production applications.


While working within a team in an Agile environment, you will be:



  • Designing high quality applications that are highly scalable and extensible

  • Estimating, tasking and prototyping

  • Contributing clear and maintainable code to a shared codebase

  • Collaborating with cross-functional team members on features, design and implementation

  • Investigating, learning and applying new technologies/processes

  • Clarifying requirements with team and client representatives


Intelliware’s niche is delivering mission critical software applications for complex business or technical challenges. The nature of our work allows project teams the opportunity to work with a wide variety of technologies although our core development is in Java and JavaScript. Recent projects we’ve delivered include technologies such as: AngularJS, jQuery, Meteor, Node.js, MongoDB, Apache Wicket, Spring Batch, Spring Data JPA and Hibernate.

item.title: Newsroom Developer (Front-end Interactive) at Financial Times (London, UK)
item.description:
The Financial Times technology department is hiring a developer to join Interactive News, a joint Technology & Editorial team, working in the newsroom.


We are a cross-functional team of data- visual- and coder-journalists. We work with other reporters and editors from across the FT to develop engaging forms of digital journalism. This includes data visualisation, infographics, maps, multimedia long form articles, microsites, news apps, video graphics and experimentation with audio. We also create tools for the newsroom.


Much of our code is public on Github. Take a look:



  • github.com/financial-times

  • github.com/ft-interactive

item.title: Database Programmer and Developer at University of Oxford (UK)
item.description:
NUFFIELD DEPARTMENT OF ORTHOPAEDICS, RHEUMATOLOGY AND MUSCULOSKELETAL SCIENCES


Database Programmer and Developer (119821)


Grade 7: Salary in the range of £30,434 to £31,342 per annum


We are seeking a Database Programmer and Developer within the Nuffield Department of Orthopaedics, Rheumatology and Musculoskeletal Sciences (NDORMS) located at the Botnar Research Centre, Oxford.


You will be responsible for maintaining, expanding and developing complex software used to support several research projects run by the Epidemiology Unit as well as assessing and improving the quality of the software through appropriate testing during the development process. Duties will also include writing readable code with good documentation and developing and maintaining the Epidemiology Unit website. You will also advise other members of the group on IT methodologies and procedures.


You will have a degree in computer science or equivalent technical qualification and will be proficient in developing and maintaining web applications for data capture written in PHP using HTML5/CSS/Javascript. You will also have expertise in developing and maintaining console and web applications as well as skills in testing both console and web applications. Sound knowledge of the relational database model, SQL, data management and MySQL is essential. Knowledge of working in a mixed computing environment involving Windows and Linux servers and experience of working with confidential data and related software (e.g. TrueCrypt) would be desirable.


This is a full-time fixed term appointment for one year.


The closing date for this position is 12 noon on Wednesday 30 September 2015. You will be required to upload a supporting statement and CV as part of your online application. Interviews will be held on 7 October 2015.


To apply for this role and for further details, including the job description and selection criteria, please click on the link below: 


https://www.recruit.ox.ac.uk/pls/hrisliverecruit/erq_jobspec_version_4.jobspec?p_id=119821

item.title: iOS Software Engineer at Antsquare Technologies Inc. (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
Antsquare is seeking an experienced and self-driven iOS developer to help build our existing iOS app. You will be working on a small team solving problems that directly make a business impact to our customers. Daily tasks can and will include implementing new features and designs, optimizing the app for buttery smooth performance, and building tools to streamline our development process . Not to mention mentoring and learning from the current engineering team members & having a little fun as well!


Our current iOS app is built on top of some amazing open source projects and we would love to see any contributions back to the iOS community.

item.title: Front-End Engineer at Flexport (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Flexport is looking for talented front-end engineers to join our team here in San Francisco. This is a high impact and high ownership opportunity for self-starters interested in solving real-world problems and streamlining the inefficient industry of global trade.


What You'll Do



  • Create tools that make it easier for companies of all sizes to participate in global trade

  • Help build intuitive, highly efficient and performant interfaces to automate the repetitive parts of logistics


Our Stack


In the frontend, we serve a few isomorphic single-page apps using React for the views, organize the data flow with Flux architecture, and test our application with Jest. We use a hybrid version of Bootstrap styles mixed with hand-built Sass components as our CSS library and are moving away from Bootstrap as we continue building our apps. We follow OOCSS methodology and use Hologram for documentation.


On the backend, we're a Rails shop riding on AWS and Postgres RDS. Using Rspec we believe in just enough testing to provide full coverage without introducing a lot of change friction. Our architecture is light-weight and modular in nature adhering to the fat models, skinny controllers ideology.


Our Process


Flexport engineering is a close-knit team where everyone reviews each other’s Github pull requests. We are expected to learn from our peers and help others learn. Code is released almost everyday or whenever business requires. Our continuous releases are integrated with Travis and Github.

item.title: Senior C++ Developer: Rendering at Animal Logic (Moore Park, Australia)
item.description:
Animal Logic is seeking a Software Developer to join its core R&D group to develop and enhance our proprietary rendering software, including our state-of-the-art rendering engine, shading system, and scene representation.


You will be working alongside some of the best artists and developers in the world applying your technical skills to create new tools and techniques for generating highly realistic imagery!

item.title: Full Stack Product Engineer at Pusher (London, UK)
item.description:
Pusher is a communication layer for application developers that routes data at scale and in realtime. We want to improve the lives of other developers by making hard problems simple, freeing them from operating and maintaining their own realtime infrastructure.


We're looking to expand our product team to solve more problems for developers around the world. You will be part of a new team in Engineering who will be improving on the features of our current product and developing new ones to go alongside it. You will own the technology that surrounds the core message bus and makes things easy for our customers to integrate, understand and use Pusher.


By building applications and using our APIs, you will help us solve more problems for web developers who use our product. You will influence how our APIs are designed, and work with our platform engineers to bring them to life. You will also take ownership of several of our server libraries, and develop them further.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Web Development, aGalaxy at A10 Networks (San Jose, CA)
item.description: As a member of web development software engineering group, you will develop software for a Management system to manage Application Delivery and Security devices in the local network and in Private/Public Clouds

item.title: BAMx Software Engineer at BAMx (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Job


At BAMx, we use a variety of open source technologies such as Python, Flask, Angular, MySQL, Redshift, Redis, Eleasticsearch, Celery, and Docker.


We’re looking for someone with serious JavaScript chops to help us build out our AngularJS web application, our third-party integrations, and a Chrome browser extension.


If you can work onsite in NYC, love solving problems and want to work with a small, talented, dedicated team then please get in touch.

item.title: Lead Mobile Developer at Shoeboxed, Inc. (Durham, NC)
item.description:
You are a seasoned Mobile Developer and can help bring new features and improvements to our iOS and Android applications.


You’ll be working with both our product and development team on the mobile apps as well as with our marketing and management teams on mobile growth projects.

item.title: Platform Engineer at Moltin (Newcastle upon Tyne, UK)
item.description: The team at Moltin is building a suite of tools to help developers create eCommerce websites and applications. At the heart of our effort is the API, which delivers the required data and processing to any device in over 130 countries. Your role will be to join the core team on the API and will involve deploying new and updated features, as well as working on scaling and stability. You will have an opportunity to contribute and drive innovation at a quickly moving startup that will benefit from your experience.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Zillow (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Our Marketing Product Team is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help us reach out and expand our audience of Zillow fans. You’ll work with our Marketing group on a wide variety of projects with high visibility, right on the front page of Zillow.com. Your work will be seen and used by millions. You’ll have a lot of latitude to run with your ideas to make Zillow.com the best place anywhere for our users to make their home-ownership dreams come true.


What you’ll do:



  • Delight our users with the features you’ll ship.

  • Write performance-minded, highly-readable code using OO best practices

  • Take ownership of product features

  • Be involved at all stages of application development, from UI design to final testing

  • Invent elegant solutions to hard problems

  • Collaborate closely with UI designers, Program Managers, Developers and Testers

  • Have fun!


What you’ll need:



  • BS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering

  • Minimum of 5 years of software application, systems and web development experience

  • A proven track record of high productivity in application, architecture, design, coding, troubleshooting and debugging with a bias toward action

  • Experience designing and implementing high performance services and APIs

  • Experience implementing RESTful web services

  • Strong experience with Java or Python

  • Technical expertise in Ajax (Javascript, XML, CSS and HTML)

  • Ability to carry out tasks with limited need for supervision

  • The ability to work in a fast, agile and nimble environment with frequent change

  • Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills


You’ll have an edge if you have experience with:



  • Big data and No-SQL databases.

  • Customer targeting products such as segmentation and personalization

  • Spring framework

  • Tapestry, Mustache-Templates or YUI.

  • Developing on a Linux or other Unix OS platform

  • Relational databases, especially Microsoft SQL Server

  • Distributed systems design and development

  • Git

item.title: Software Engineers (to work in Python/Django) at Fusionbox (Denver, CO)
item.description: At Fusionbox, the engineers work on tasks that span from server provisioning and system administration to server-side development to JavaScript fronted interface developing. We use git, Puppet, nginx, Postgres, memcache, Django, Backbone, AngularJS, Ember.js, and React--but we are always open to trying out new things. In addition to working on client projects, we have our own portfolio of open source projects that the engineers maintain.

item.title: Software Engineer in Test at Spanning by EMC (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Our collaborative and iterative development approach has us testing all the time to avoid the last minute crunch. In order to do this we use lots of tools and test data to ensure that we can efficiently do functional, regression, and integration testing as part of the daily development process. The full team is involved in testing, but we need a mastermind to coordinate this effort for each engineering project that is running, playing a material development role on each project.  


This is a core engineering position where you will write production code. You are also responsible for ensuring that each feature can be built, tested, and deployed (along with our DevOps team) in a reliable and repeatable manner.  


Automation is a key part of this effort, but we also know that we need to be smart about what we test, when we test, and how we test. Very often the best results come from a well-informed user doing something "clever" with our app. We are looking for engineers that share these ideals and can help us take our test and development technology to the next level.

item.title: Sr. Site Reliability Engineer at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Senior Site Reliability Engineer to help with the building and operation of our Real Time Analytics Platform. The operations team leverages some of the most cutting edge technology to simplify an otherwise complex environment.

Candidates should have a passion for building infrastructure for high-performance, "Big Data" systems. In this role, you will leverage open-source tools like Zookeeper, Hadoop, HBase, Hive, and Couchbase.  Candidates will at least be familiar with the technologies we are using but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings. However, you should have a true passion for systems engineering that is apparent in your past work.


Responsibilities:



  • Build tools to ease provisioning and scaling of TubeMogul Analytics infrastructure

  • Monitor and improve service performance and stability

  • Continuously extend and improve infrastructure components to handle growth

  • Investigate failures and offer suggestions for future improvement

  • Work closely with development teams to ensure that platforms are designed with "operability" in mind

  • Assist our software engineering team to ensure proper monitoring and metrics are being built into the applications before going to production

item.title: Lead Android Developer (f/m) at DaWanda GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your Responsibilities:



  • Build up and lead a team of Android Developers

  • Developing Apps for Android phones by collaborating with product managers, designers and user experience teams

  • Specification of Restful APIs to connect our Apps with our backend (Ruby)

  • Write High Quality Code by Unit-, System- & Integrationtesting

  • Help driving the architecture and technology choices that enable a world-class user experience

  • Utilize various tools or frameworks to deliver rapid iterations of software features

  • Raise the bar on quality, consistency, maintainability, efficiency and all the other things that make great Apps great

  • Help define engineering best practices and provide technical mentorship to your team

item.title: Principal UI Software Engineer at clypd (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
You will be learning all aspects of the system and contributing to them. You will work with the rest of the engineering and product teams to deliver quickly and fluidly using Agile methodologies. You will use Continuous Integration and Test Driven Development techniques to build rock-solid code.
 

Skills and experience:

Achieved at least a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering
10+ years of experience
Willingness to learn and improve your web stack skills: front end, back end or both
For front end: experience or interest in building interactive user experiences with modern HTML5 and JavaScript, and comfortable working with the services that drive them
Previous use of MV* frameworks on the client (AngularJS, Ember, ...) and/or server side (Rails, Django, Grails, ...) a huge plus
Excitement about startups and working with a small (but quickly expanding) Agile team
Communication is key; our work is heavily team-oriented, and we are looking for someone who is comfortable participating and contributing to the team
Passion for delivering quality code and products. Code reviews and automated tests are an integral part of our development process. We are always looking for new ways to improve.

Our stack:

Ruby on Rails, React, JQuery, RSpec/Capybara
Go
Docker
PostgreSQL/RDS, Redis
AWS

Perks and benefits:

Competitive compensation and stock options
Comprehensive benefits package (Health, Dental, Vision, Long-term and Short-term disability, 401(k), cell phone subsidy, commuter safety subsidy)
Unlimited paid time off  - take the time you need to operate at peak performance
Learning culture that includes weekly Lunch and Learns and a formal mentor program
Amazing office space in Davis Square, one of the hottest neighborhoods in Somerville
Open and relaxed office layout, including standing desks, walking desks, and a choice of comfortable seating
Macbook and Thunderbolt display
Three rotating beer taps, iced tea and iced coffee on tap, wine bar, tea bar, and more
Game room with darts, foosball, Xbox One, PS4, and more
Fun team outings and celebrations, an annual company outing and holiday party

Who we are:

clypd is a leading player in one of the hottest emerging markets of programmatic TV, disrupting the $74 billion television industry. We are on a mission to change television advertising, to make it more efficient and effective for TV media companies, consumers, and advertisers. We've built an advertising technology platform to empower media companies with programmatic strategies. Our sales platform delivers workflow automation, data-enhanced decisioning and provides media partners with tools to manage their sales efforts.

We are looking for awesome people to join a growing and fun team. We aim to create an environment that is open and transparent, collaborative, supportive, and diverse. We are looking for engineers who want to learn about the latest technologies to craft scalable and maintainable code. The problems we are solving are challenging and interesting and we want your help.

item.title: Senior software engineer - equity + market salary at Ice.com (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
About us:

Retail Growth Fund acquired the Ice.com domain in 2014 to launch the best place for women to discover and purchase jewelry. We don't take any inventory because we're a marketplace - which means our capital goes towards building IP and acquiring/retaining users. 

A few things that make us interesting:

  • The jewelry industry is a fragmented, $80B market (in the US alone), growing at 5%+ annually, that software has yet to disrupt. 
  • You will be joining an awesome team led by Brandon Proctor and Justin Yoshimura (3x exits). 
  • We are extremely data driven and technology/software is in our DNA. You won't be a second class citizen here, guaranteed. 
  • We don't have time for assholes or politics. 
  • Competitive compensation package including equity in a high growth VC backed start-up (Crosslink, Maveron, Quest, Polaris). Salary/equity is determined based on a sliding scale: if you would like a higher salary, we can issue you less equity, and vice versa. 
  • Small (12 person), growing, and agile team. 
  • $1k gift card to dog food our own marketplace sellers! 

What we'd like to see:

  • True, full-stack engineers with extensive experience in Python/Django or Java. (Django is a key part of our stack but we use some Java). 
  • Strong foundation in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms, databases, software design and dev ops.
  • Work experience with relational databases and SQL.
  • Experience with agile development process in collaborative environment.
  • BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics OR 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Good understanding of performance tradeoffs.

Bonus Points:

  • We are currently using Magento, an open source e-commerce platform built in Zend PHP - yuck), but we are building a new, badass e-commerce platform (Django, Java, Node.js and integrating it with Netsuite's order management tools (no need to re-invent the entire wheel, after all). Related experience is a plus.
  • MS or PhD
  • if you have an awesome Github repo, open source contributions, or a cool project you can demo, please cut to the front of the line...

Responsibilities:

As a member of our small but seriously talented engineering team, you will play a key role in both shaping and building our technologies. Your scope will be broad, ranging from user-facing features to server-side components and libraries. We are looking for a generalist who enjoys learning and working with different technologies. And of course you will be expected to commit code on your first day. 

*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.

item.title: Lead PHP Developer/Architect at Guidepoint (New York, NY)
item.description:
Guidepoint is seeking a Lead PHP Developer with heavy Microsoft SQL Server experience to join its Engineering team. Our Engineering team is a highly collaborative organization consisting of engineers with the highest levels of technical depth, programming skill and a passion for quality.


An ideal candidate is expected to absorb an immense amount of business logic and have a curious mind for process flows to data models and code interaction. Must have prior experience successfully leading a team of 4-12 developers for at least one year. Imperative that candidate can unblock fellow developers and weigh-in daily while getting own User Stories completed.

item.title: Technical Support Lead at Vena Solutions Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
About the Role


Lead the support team and build a strong feedback loop between the product development and customer support teams to ensure that customer success. Use customer feedback to improve the product, and technical feedback to improve our customer service. You will be the voice of our customers internally, bringing product feedback and technical issues to the engineering team, and using your deep understanding of our customers to influence the prioritization of product improvements.


You will also communicate product and technical updates to the customer success team, so that they can expertly resolve any issues.


The Technical Support Lead will work with internal teams including Professional Services, Quality Assurance, and Product Development as required in order to completely resolve customer issues.



Responsibilities



  • Prioritize and escalate highly impacting issues

  • Manage / coordinate critical communications

  • Ability to manage and resolve customer issues

  • Manage customers’ expectations and experience in a way that results in high customer satisfaction

  • Develop and maintain technical expertise in assigned areas of product functionality and utilize that expertise effectively to help customers / partners

  • Create knowledge base materials dedicated towards operational efficiency while also empowering and enabling the Customer / Partner Community

  • Research, document, and escalate cases according to procedure

  • Review support cases for technical and troubleshooting accuracy

  • Ensure client requests are acknowledged and resolved within service level agreement times

  • Provide a superior client experience by providing timely updates and problem resolution

  • Identify and document opportunities for improvement based on client suggestions

  • Work closely with Product Development and the Quality Assurance teams to move issues through the software release process

  • Actively participate in job related training

  • Define and describe technical best practices

item.title: Technical Principal at ThoughtWorks (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
ThoughtWorks is synonymous with innovation. We’re a diverse community of bright and passionate individuals striving to have a positive impact on the world. We’re dedicated to the art of software delivery, by keeping it lightweight, agile and open-source. Our clients are organisations with ambitious missions, where we deliver complex enterprise systems to help them solve their toughest business problems. As a Principal Consultant at ThoughtWorks you have total responsibility for technical delivery on a client engagement so you are likely to have extensive experience.


As a Principal Consultant, here’s what you can do at ThoughtWorks: 



  • Disrupt, Lead and Innovate.

  • Take the needs and challenges of a client and formulate the technical roadmap and technology solution that will support their business strategies and goals.

  • Provide Technical leadership across all areas of the enterprise, to ensure delivery of exceptional technical solutions

  • Formulate and articulate the technical and political implication of real world solutions

  • Orchestrate the management of technology scope and risks

  • Mentor on approach and execution of solutions, coach on technologies and establishing a team wide comprehension of solution capabilities and direction

  • Ensure technical expectations of deliverables are met

  • Drive ThoughtWorks’ Thought-Leadership on engineering and architectural practices and standards

  • Be an inspiration of innovation to the client

  • Become a trusted and valued partner of the client CIO/CTO and team

  • Exploit opportunities for networking and relationship building that arise out of delivery activities

  • Creates and supports sales activities

  • Maintaining strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products

  • Code! We don’t subscribe to the “post-technical” ivory tower leadership style



We work almost exclusively on customer site providing a mix of delivery and consulting services, so you’ll be flexible about travel. 



We offer amazing benefits from the day you start including private medical insurance, travel insurance, income protection, critical illness, life assurance, pension scheme, child care vouchers, personal development budget, 25 days holiday and a ride2work scheme.



To apply please submit your CV and tell us why you want to join ThoughtWorks. One of our recruiters will be in touch.


At ThoughtWorks we promote diversity in all its forms and reject discrimination and inequality. We proudly, passionately and actively strive to make both ThoughtWorks and our industry more reflective and inclusive of the society that we serve

item.title: Software Engineering Manager at Amazon (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?



At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.



Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.



What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?

· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.
