item.title: DevOps Engineer - AWS, Cloudera, Hadoop... at Chartboost (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We deal with an extraordinary amount of traffic, our platform encompasses everything from API calls to servicing a real-time dashboard to delivering ads to mobile games. 


We are looking for someone with energy to take our mission-critical infrastructure to the next level. This includes provisioning, load balancing, service hosting and uptime, monitoring, alerting and everything else. 


You are looking for the opportunity to work in a complex, high traffic system and be given the freedom to create this system the “right way”.  We really want this role to “own” this side of our platform and build and be responsible for making our platform awesome and reliable.

item.title: Software Engineer in Test at Sprout Social Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Software Engineer in Test role is critical in Sprout Social’s success as it is responsible for accelerating delivery, increasing quality and tackling some of our most difficult problems.  SETs create scalable and efficient test automation, verify performance against real-world scenarios and data, and create specialized testing tools for use throughout the diverse Sprout stack.  This role works closely with every part of the Sprout Engineering team, giving exposure to a broad set of technologies, people and challenges.


The Sprout Social software that is used by more than 15,000 brands around the world. Companies like Adobe, Pivotal Labs, Google, Marvel, and Evernote rely on Sprout to create stronger relationships with their customers through social media.


If Java is your bread and butter, you have a passion for testing, and you are a stickler for quality software, we’d love to talk with you.


Responsibilities



  • Design, implement, and maintain test automation systems for continuous integration

  • Work with manual testers to evaluate test cases for inclusion in automated regression tests

  • Work with manual testers on automation tests of newly developed features

  • Develop toolsets to augment QA and developer testing

  • Assist in performance and scalability testing

  • Collaborate with product engineering when specialized testing tools are needed

  • Work closely with front and back-end engineers for support and code review

  • Work with front-end and back-end engineers to insert certain automation at appropriate times during coding, code review and deployments; specifically ensure a defined set of tests are run before code deployment

  • Work with QA and Engineering leadership to ensure that coded scripts align with business goals/objectives for Sprout

  • Gather and present metrics related to test automation, ensuring deviations from standards and procedures are made visible in a timely manner

  • Maintain our automated test library and perform routine checks to ensure that scripts are current

item.title: Principal Engineer (Matching Engineering) at eHarmony (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
eHarmony is looking for a highly talented individual to join our Matching Engineering team! Every day, eHarmony matches millions of people based on deep compatibility, built on decades of psychological research and Machine Learning. Matching is the core of eHarmony, and you have a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be right in the middle of it. 

Your challenge as a Principal Engineer on our team will be to implement and scale these matching systems, to support ever more complex modeling processes, across a rapidly growing community of users. 


In this position, you will be responsible for:



  • Getting to work with innovative new technologies (e.g. Hadoop/Map-Reduce, NoSQL stores like MongoDB and Voldemort, AWS based cloud computing, SOA via REST services)

  • Working on a matching system that creates trillions of potential pairings in our candidate pool (over 51 million registered users)

  • Designing core back-end Matching components

  • Coding day-to-day in Java, and other languages such as Scala, Ruby, Groovy, C++.

  • Analyzing and improve the efficiency, reliability and scalability of components across the Matching infrastructure

item.title: Principal Software Engineer at Minted (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
About Minted:


Minted is a design marketplace that connects you to the world’s best independent artists to create something one-of-a-kind. Minted’s unique crowdsourced model represents a modern marketplace – one where the community decides what goods are showcased and sold. This model ensures fresh, on-trend designs are continuously being added to Minted. Our community of independent artists and designers spans 48 states and 43 countries. Our art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 40 million homes worldwide. Minted is funded by Benchmark Capital, IDG Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners, along with angels Marissa Mayer, CEO of Yahoo!, Jeremy Stoppelman, CEO of Yelp, and Yishan Wong, former CEO of Reddit. We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA. 


About the Role:


Minted is seeking a talented principal software developer with a strong vision who is looking for the opportunity to express that vision across Minted.  You’ll help design and implement a top tier 1 ecommerce platform, helping it scale 100x beyond its current load. You will develop your vision and teach our talented engineering team how to build it while enabling independent artist all over the world to bring their talent to consumers.


Specific Responsibilities:




  • Create strong object oriented designs, both for module and service level interactions




  • Serve as a technical lead on our most demanding, cross-functional projects.




  • Consistently create clean code and teach best practices to junior engineers




  • Dive deep understanding our complex eCommerce systems to derive root causes and propose fundamental changes




  • Design both large and small changes to existing software, and decide which is needed




  • This is a startup!  You will get lots of opportunity to show off your design skills in a large and complex environment with great growth potential




  • Find operational problems through dashboards and alarming.




  • Prove success of projects with metrics and reporting




  • Work with a minimum of technical supervision and supplemental engineering support, while responding efficiently to multiple program priorities




  • Effectively research and benchmark Minted’s technology against other competing systems in the industry




  • Contribute intellectual property through patents.

item.title: Early Stage Career - Java Software Engineer at Kobalt Music Group (London, UK)
item.description:
As a graduate software engineer at Kobalt you’ll be involved in the whole development lifecycle: requirement gathering, specification, development, building, testing and deployment of our in-house system and writing fast, reliable and clean code on a daily basis. Our new developers are always mentored by an existing and more experienced member of the team.


This is no small task: our system is currently responsible for sending worldwide notifications of all of our clients’ songs; and it delivers albums, singles and videos to a whole host of digital services, including iTunes, Spotify, YouTube and many others. It also licenses use of our clients work in TV, Film, Games, and Adverts. Once all of that has been done, it then has the not-so-small job of processing the millions of resulting payments through to our clients. All of this is just the tip of the iceberg, and everything that happens in our system is reflected in our industry-leading client Portal so that our clients know what’s happening.


This means that you’ll be working with core Java libraries, Swing UI, J2EE technologies and Apache/Tomcat, and testing with JUnit. You could be modifying or creating new third party integrations with AWS, PayPal, Docusign or others. Perhaps you’ll be adapting our processes for encoding, transcoding, and delivering master audio and video files. No one week will be like another as we strive to improve and innovate.


At all times you’ll be responsible for ensuring your changes move swiftly through our continuous integration processes, and liaising with other departments to improve their overall experience of our systems.

item.title: C# Developer - Sling TV at Sling TV (American Fork, UT)
item.description:
Summary:


Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet. We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. This is an exciting position in a fast moving project that requires the ability of candidates to hit the ground running. What we’re building is revolutionary and every employee participates in a profit sharing program. Come be a part of changing the face of TV!


Sling TV delivers content from Disney/ESPN, HBO, AMC, Turner, Scripps, EPIX, Univision and Maker Studios, and is available on Amazon Fire TV, Amazon Fire TV Stick, current-generation Roku players, Roku TV models, Xbox One, Android, iOS, Macs, PCs.


#TakeBackTV


Responsibilities and Desired Skills:



  • This engineer will be part of a dynamic team working on video applications for game consoles

  • Need extensive experience with the C# programming language

  • An intimate understanding of Object Oriented design principles and patterns

  • An intuitive understanding of software design/architecture and the ability to discuss and make design considerations and trade-offs.

  • A strong understanding of computer architecture concepts such as operating systems, processes, threading, memory, libraries, etc.

  • Strong development experience with Windows and Visual Studio

item.title: Software Developer (All Levels) at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX is on a path of unprecedented growth. The development team is aggressively driving innovation, design, implementation and deployment of large scale distributed applications and web services. Our core mission is to solve complex problems around big data and analytics. To develop and modify software to drive (pun intended!) the accuracy of predicting traffic flow and deliver the most valuable and accurate results to our customers!

The INRIX development team is a great place to grow your career and skillset. Our roadmap is bursting with opportunity for engineers to bring their best (and then some), solving intriguing challenges, and tangibly impacting the customer experience.

What you’re looking for:



  • A cutting-edge stack that combines open source and custom code to create a high-end traffic data and services platform serving millions of customers

  • Practical experience in working in a fast paced “start-up like” environment with high performing teams

  • Be part of a team where fun, smart, passionate, ambitious engineers are focused on delivering complex data and services that must be delivered with extremely low latency

  • A fast–growing global company where you’ll be challenged (required) to think about things that no one has thought of yet

  • A position where you’re an important voice in development, not one of many

  • Design, implement, and deploy large scale distributed applications and web services

  • Solve complex problems to develop software to drive the most valuable and accurate results to our customers


What we’re looking for:



  • Senior, Mid-Level, and Junior Software Developers -- experience with software development, architecture and deign, enjoys creating exciting products through hands-on coding

  • Experience in designing, implementing and deploying large-scale distributed applications and web services

  • Experience maintaining and extending applications and services through their lifetime

  • Experience in developing in Java on enterprise platforms (C# equivalent experience accepted)

  • Solid understand of graph algorithms

  • Demonstrated strong technical judgment in conjunction with passionate customer-focus

  • Be collaborative, have a strong work ethic, be reliable and a self-starter

  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in computer science, mathematics, or related discipline


 What’s so exciting about our platform?

We’re working on a cutting-edge stack that combines open source and custom code to create a high-end traffic data and services platform serving millions of customers.  You’ll be joining a team focused on delivering engineering solutions to support complex services that must be delivered with extremely low latency.  You will have a strategic role driving decisions that will shape INRIX's capabilities and the future technical direction of our products.
Ideal Candidates have:



  • Strong experience in open source stacks and some experience in MSFT stack

  • Working knowledge in probability, statistics and analytics,  GIS/LBS concepts highly desired

  • Experience delivering and operating SaaS product offerings in an iterative, agile software lifecycle in AWS or Azure

  • Experience in Big Data architectures, NoSQL DB’s, Hadoop/HDFS/map/reduce, real time streaming analytics, visualization, or other technologies in the Big Data Analytics stack


Why make the move:



  • INRIX motorboat – Get your boat license and we’ll pay for the gas. You can walk from your office to the dock in 15 minutes. Take your family and friends skiing or tubing.  Yes, it’s big and it’s fast!

  • Free car – Well…. not really free.  But we have test cars with the latest traffic technology that you can take home.  We pay for the gas. 

  • Great Benefits – We’re as good as or better than most companies our size.

  • Free onsite snacks and drinks; Free Friday lunches – The food comes to you so that you write lots and lots of good code (at least we’re honest).

  • Bonuses 2x per year and Stock Options – Because you like to be rewarded and recognized for your hard work.

  • No Vacation Policy – You’re an adult and can manage your own vacation time.  Work hard; play hard.  Why does your company still have a vacation policy?

  • Family – We don’t believe that you should miss your child’s play because you have to attend a meeting. 

  • Are you ready to join a different kind of company?


INRIX is a leading provider of real-time traffic information, connected car services and analytics worldwide. The company leverages big data analytics to reduce the individual, economic and environmental toll of traffic congestion. Through cutting-edge data intelligence and predictive traffic technologies, INRIX helps leading automakers, fleets, governments and news organizations make it easier for drivers to navigate their world. 

Our vision is simple – to solve traffic, empower drivers, inform planning and enhance commerce.  INRIX is at the forefront of connecting cars to smarter cities and serves more than 350 blue-chip customers in more than 40 countries around the world.


Exciting things are happening all the time. Come join us!

item.title: Software Engineer (Tower UI) at Ansible (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Ansible is looking for a Front-end Software Engineer to help design and build our Ansible Tower product.  The candidate will be responsible for working closely with various teams to ensure designs are not only possible, but have the required data from the provided REST APIs. Job leveling to be determined by years of relevant experience and skill set.


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Engage with the user experience team to make design visions a reality

  • Collaborate with other UI Developers, back-end engineers and various solution stakeholders to ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs

  • Develop maintainable, scalable, and testable front-end code

item.title: Software Engineer at Google (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.


Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. 



Responsibilities


  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.

item.title: Front End Engineer at Expedite Financial (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT THE ROLE


Our front end engineers build both consumer-facing and internal applications that transform a complicated and data-intensive domain into simple, intuitive, and delightful experiences. Our front end stack is composed of API-driven javascript apps built in React, AngularJS, and sass.  In this role you will collaborate with designers, product leads, and platform engineers to build beautiful and intuitive applications, comprised of reusable components with good performance and usability across browsers and mobile devices.



ABOUT YOU



  • You have deep knowledge of javascript, HTML, CSS, and browser behavior

  • You have experience with modern javascript frameworks (React or AngularJS preferred)

  • You have an interest in usability and design aesthetics

  • You are familiar with modern front-end tool chains – build tools, unit tests, linters, debuggers

  • You naturally build for structure, reusability, and sharing – you make other developers happier and more productive

item.title: Java/Scala Software Engineer at Feedzai (Lisbon, Portugal)
item.description:
We are looking for very high-tech engineers that have experience or have shown the ability to deal with hard software engineering problems - from an algorithmic and distributed systems perspective.


If your passion is building high-performant, scalable services, with elegant APIs and architectures you’ll fit right in! Join us in disrupting the hot market of digital payments and online fraud prevention!


Responsibilities:



  • Design & implement our backend architecture, from the data layer, to service orchestration to our RESTful APIs

  • Build the libraries and frameworks we use to build high-performance, reliable distributed services

  • Work on automated deployment as well as distributed logging and analytics so that we can be on top of things

  • Write reusable and testable code using the best tools for the job and participate in code reviews

  • You’ll be hyper-technical - deep understanding and optimisation are in our blood

item.title: Agile Coach / Scrum Master at Shoeboxed, Inc. (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Shoeboxed is looking for an Agile Coach/Scrum Master to play a critical role in the success of our two agile product teams.

As our Scrum Master, you’ll facilitate all scrums, sprint planning, stakeholder involvement, and retrospectives. Every day you’ll help your Scrum teams stay focused, organized, on-schedule and happy while keeping the rest of the company abreast of progress, setbacks and updates to deadlines or requirements. You’ll also be responsible for overseeing that we’re using the most relevant Agile methodologies and that the productivity, velocity and customer impact of all Agile product teams improve with each release.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Transactional at Flixster (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
For this position, we’re looking for a senior software engineer who will drive the expansion of our movie ticketing platform. Your work will power online ticket sales for major theater chains. Every ticket sale will happen via the components you build and operate. It takes a steady approach, a high standard for quality and reliability, and the willingness and ability to own a high volume, high visibility workflow.


Responsibilities



  • You own the transactional data flow that powers our movie ticketing service (reliability, security, traceability, throughput, performance, etc). Movie-goers around the country are depending on you!

  • You build it, you run it. You design and implement robust software and the operational capabilities to keep things humming (trending, alerting, etc.)

  • You champion high quality and best engineering practices

item.title: Software Engineer at ALTA Language Services (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Software Engineer: Mid and Senior Level Positions Available

The engineering team at ALTA is a small group empowered to make decisions, think independently, and embrace the newest coding and technology paradigms. We write internal business applications as well as customer facing sites that are the core of all operations. We strive to push new features into the language services market and hunt for business opportunities to explore with our tech.

item.title: Sr iOS Software Engineer at iRobot Corporation (Bedford, MA)
item.description:
Explore and leverage your career with one of the world’s foremost leaders in diverse robotics – from consumer, telepresence, and international defense and security, we are constantly creating robotic products that improve, impact, and change lives.


  As a Sr. Software Engineer – iOS Applications at iRobot, you will be developing mobile applications that control iRobot’s Consumer Home Products.


 In this role, you will collaborate with robot developers, designers, testers, and business managers.  You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the product development life-cycle.  The ideal candidate must be able to pick up new technologies quickly, be a strong team player, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands. 


What you will do


As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you will develop new apps that interface with Consumer Robots, which are used by millions of people.



  • Design, implement, and test a new, iOS based, robot control application.

  • Collaborate with technical architects, test engineers, and user interface designers.

  • Write high quality code that is well documented and unit tested.

  • Participate in and drive code reviews.

item.title: Web Developers to build home for beautiful photography at 500px Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
We’re on the lookout for senior/intermediate, performance-driven Frontend and Backend Web Developers who can help take 500px to the next level of scale, speed, and user experience.


Role responsibilities:



  • Designing, implementing and optimizing products and services used by millions of users.

  • Improving real-time algorithms for photos rating, image recognition, personalization, and spam detection

  • Building highly scalable API services in Go and Ruby

  • Working with UI/UX Designers to fuse backend services with beautiful UIs


Example of the most recent projects we've accomplished:



  • Weighted keywords photo search

  • High performance dynamic image resizing and watermarking

  • Web organizer to manage thousands of photos

  • Large scale image classification

  • Real-time timeline service

item.title: Lead / Sr. C# Full Stack Engineer (C# / MVC / SQL Server) at Medidata Solutions (New York, NY)
item.description:
Medidata Solutions (NASDAQ:MDSO) has an immediate opportunity for highly skilled Lead Software Engineers to work on our flagship product Rave. Rave is used everyday by pharma companies, biotech and clinical research organizations the world over. Medidata's Rave is part of a platform that provides our customers with the most advanced tools for planning, executing and managing their clinical trials. Result? 7 of the top 10 grossing drugs in 2013 were developed on our Medidata platform. 


We are continually building and improving our SOA cloud-based clinical trial solutions to put innovative technology and insightful data into the hands of researchers allowing new treatments to reach markets safely, efficiently and effectively. Working at Medidata will allow you to impact society in a positive way.


The engineers who best fit at Medidata are those that make good decisions, communicate well, and are eager to make an impact. We are curious, flexible, passionate, honest and selfless. We enjoy freedom and responsibility and can get things done. We are not afraid to fail and have the confidence to remain calm in stressful situations. We can survive on our own but prefer working as part of the team of equally talented peers. We are self-improving and disciplined and enjoy learning and sharing what we've learned. We are missionaries, not mercenaries.


What's in it for you?
We offer our engineers a highly competitive compensation that includes base, bonus and a strong benefits package that includes medical and dental insurance, vision care, short- and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts FSA), commuter FSA, 401K, tuition reimbursement program, paid company holidays and unlimited paid time off.

We provide top of the line computers (PC or MacBook Pro), adjustable standing desks and the most comfortable work spaces. We have plenty of space for collaboration, game room and a private rooftop terrace.


We help our developers be more efficient by providing them with a license for Visual Studio Premium with MSDN, a ReSharper license, and a PluralSight subscription.


Every engineer gets an opportunity to work on a personal-interest project for two weeks every six months. We send people to conferences to learn, get exposed to new ideas and bring back the knowledge and the contacts that they acquired.

item.title: Team Leader: Software Engineering at SaleCycle (Houghton le Spring, UK)
item.description:
The web-based SaleCycle platform forms the core of our business and handles an incredible amount of data from our 500+ international clients. Leading a team of Engineers to continuously achieve business needs is a vital role; it’s not just about man-management but motivation, empowerment and inspiration – all of which you’ll provide to your team.



As a Team Leader, you will...


• Provide an environment where your team can succeed; motivating & inspiring them as a great leader
• Take up the role of Scrum Master ensuring there is mutual satisfaction for both your team and Product / Business Managers to allow delivery of high-quality products
• Continually grow your own knowledge – being the best you can be – sharing this knowledge with the wider team; mentoring and supporting them in a style they respond to best
• Conduct analysis of existing business practices, making relevant improvements where needed and supporting in estimating the size of tasks to ensure effective planning
• Adopt a collaborative approach with the whole business by acting as an expert technical liaison and providing ad-hoc support as needed

item.title: Web Application Architect at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Web Application Architect for our Platform Architecture team. The Platform Architecture team is responsible for the robustness and long-term scalability of TubeMogul's platform, from backend to the UI.

Members of the Platform Architecture team are expected to be thought and action leaders within engineering, looking ahead and figuring out how to solve TubeMogul's most difficult problems.  This requires a unique combination of hardcore (and hands-on) technical chops, architectural vision, software engineering savvy, and excellent communication skills.  You should possess a passion for technology that is readily apparent in your work and/or personal projects.  Ideal candidates will have deep experience with high volume user-facing systems.


Responsibilities: 



  • Research, advise, and design the backbone architecture of TubeMogul's front-end products:  Web UI, mobile UI, ad units. 

  • Design, prototype, and/or implement new user-facing features in TubeMogul's products.

  • Specify or help to design/build reusable libraries and frameworks that support TubeMogul's products.

  • Optimize web applications to maximize speed and scale. Support diverse clients from high powered desktop computers to small footprint mobile devices.

  • Write client-side code for web-based applications, create fast, easy-to-use, high volume production applications, and develop prototypes quickly.

  • Communicate and lead technology adoption efforts across teams.

item.title: Software Engineer (Scala) at Connexity (Camarillo, CA)
item.description:
Connexity is looking for a talented, highly motivated Software Engineer II (Scala).  We are not a LAMP stack shop, but rather a NoSQL, Big Data, Real-Time stream processing shop. Our architecture is unique and our software stack purposefully diverse. We are searching for an engineer that likes a challenge, wants an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies, and thrives in small teams. We are looking for a developer that wants to "own" key aspects of the client interface and take pride in its evolution. Your contributions will be immediate and will be felt throughout the company. Connexity is fun, fast-paced, and open-ended with a strong entrepreneurial spirit and with emphasis on being innovative.  We also provide ample opportunity for our engineers to grow their skillset beyond web development, offering a chance to design around several NoSQL platforms including Hadoop.


YOU WILL BE ACCOUNTABLE FOR



  • Write design specifications, programming specifications, and documentation

  • Develop and maintain applications written in a Scala platform environment, operating on a Linux platform or appropriate technologies

  • Create logic to interface with RDBMS and NoSQL systems (Postgres, HBase, Hadoop)

  • Develop systems and APIs for interfacing with open and proprietary network services and complex business logic/algorithms

  • Design, deliver, develop and implement features and functionalities for large-scale, multi-tiered, distributed software applications, tools, systems and services

  • Assist in the writing of unit and functional tests and documentation for the projects/tools

  • Assist in gathering and analyzing of business and functional requirements and translate requirements into technical specifications for robust, scalable, supportable solutions that work well within the overall system architecture

  • Working with members of the Engineering team, participate in the completion of aggressive goals and meet strict deadlines

  • Try to resolve problems and roadblocks as they occur and escalate as necessary

  • Interact with internal and external peers and/or managers to exchange semi-complex information related to assigned activities

  • Be an active participant in an Agile/SCRUM environment

item.title: Software Development Manager at Communication Service for the Deaf (Austin, TX)
item.description:
CSD is now hiring a Software Development Manager to lead the development and implementation of next generation products and services for Deaf and Hard of Hearing communities. The Software Development Manager leads our team of designers, developers, programmers, and engineers charged with releasing innovative technologies benefiting the global marketplace.

You'll get to:


  • Lead CSDs multi-state Software Development team, ensuring optimal allocation of internal and contracted programming talent and resources to ensure timely delivery of deliverables and project milestones. Evangelizes and drives engineering best practices.

  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders in evaluating strategic technology development, management of product priorities and projects, defining the goals and development plan for each software project, and establishing policies and procedures for software engineering and programming teams to meet product specifications

  • Provide technical insight and judgment of feature/schedule/cost tradeoffs. Ensure that product architecture and technology decisions support corporate strategies and future direction of the products

  • Manage the Design/Code Review, Unit Test, Component Test and such activities, and support the Quality Assurance team with ensuring quality products and deliverables

  • Establish platform scalability metrics, testing criteria, data samples, and system configuration and revises, as appropriate, to support long-term growth and sustainability of services

  • Define and publish coding best practices and standards, scalability goals, and provides continued mentorship of the development team to adopt and apply those standards

  • Ensure timely delivery of software products based on established specifications

  • Define, deploy, and drive sustainable and repeatable process improvements through the entire software development lifecycle

  • Tailor and implement software development methodologies, best practices, and standard work to achieve the highest product quality while continuously improving performance, productivity and execution of the software organization

  • Motivate and mentor team members, developing a sense of empowerment and shared responsibility for CSD products and services

  • Define and champion leading software technologies to improve the efficiency, quality, and ease of use of our products and solutions

Most importantly, the ideal candidate will be an experienced professional who wants to change the world for the good. Lex Luthers need not apply.

Benefits


CSD offers a competitive benefits package for full-time employees. For a full list of benefits and perks, please visit the career page.

Communication Service for the Deaf, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer and drug free and tobacco free workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at MediaRadar (New York, NY)
item.description:
You are a passionate software engineer looking to help lead a strong development team. Youre a proud problem solver with a strong technical gut feel with hunches more often right than wrong about where problems lie. A constant learner, youre a continuous contributor to the team IQ level. Youve got the ability to take on and lead individual assignments and complete them soup to nuts. As much as you love the elegance and power of good architecture, your number one focus is delivering software to do the job and you pride yourself on doing that well.


What youll be doing:


Our Lead Software Engineer will be responsible for the following software feature activities:


  • Shared responsibility in the Design and Architecture of a feature

  • Ensure that the proper plumbing is in place for the given feature

  • Analyze complexity

  • Implementation (i.e coding) of the feature in a mostly vertical fashion (i.e UI, Business Layer, Database Access and Schema Design, External Interfaces)

  • Fully understands and follows the companys Software Development Processes (i.e SCRUM)

  • Ensures quality of implementation and support the feature during testing/bug fixing phase

  • Authors required documentation (in code or WIKI)

  • Keeps all assigned cases up to date and updates statuses as required

  • Perform code reviews

  • Mentor and assist other developers

Lead Software Engineers:


  • Tackle hard engineering problems with many unknowns, fail fast, find how to get the job done

  • Are self-sufficient and expected to tackle an entire feature. Ability to overcome difficulties with little or no help is required

  • Must be able to identify any gaps in application platform, propose and implement solutions

  • Are key contributors to feature scoping and development estimates. Their projections have a high (90%+) degree of accuracy. They rarely, if ever, miss the due date

  • Are proactive about developer testing. They frequently utilize unit tests to ensure long term health of their code

  • Are able to code across all levels with ease. Their code is well structured and displays best practices in software development

  • Have drastically less bugs in their code. They are quick to fix issues that come up

  • Ensure overall quality of the software (quality of code, performance, security, extensibility, etc.)

  • Use engineering know-how and common sense to assess impact of their work on the platform

  • Are able to interface and communicate effectively with people in other departments

The Ideal candidate is:


  • Motivated, works extra without being asked

  • Technically strong, has deep understanding of current and future technology

  • Must be a great team member

  • Passionate about the team, project and work

  • Hardworking and fully dedicated to the success of the project

  • Obtains 100% trust and confidence of manager

  • Pushing innovation and emerging technologies forward


Whats in it for you:

We value our employees time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive salary, first-rate health insurance, including vision and dental, 401K with match and transit discounts and a comfortable, informal office with a friendly atmosphere. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture. We are located just a few blocks from Penn Station and Herald Square.



Benefits


Check out what it's like to work with our awesome team here: http://muse.cm/1Mt0NCg

We value our employees time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive salary, first-rate health insurance, including vision and dental, 401K with match and transit discounts and a comfortable, informal office with a friendly atmosphere. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture. We are located just a few blocks from Penn Station and Herald Square.


To apply:

If you meet the above criteria and want to be part of a collaborative, creative environment, please APPLY NOW.

item.title: VP of Engineering at Zeppidy (Portland, OR)
item.description:
This role is responsible for leading our high performance platform development team, development planning, enhancements to platform architecture, high quality on-time releases, technical documentation, security, hands on best practice code, technical support, and development operations.


Individuals applying for this position must have the developed skills to quickly get underneath technical details and easily articulate broad and deep technical details. This executive role will be the primary technical interface of the company to all stakeholders.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES


Owner and key contributor of:


1)  Zeppidy Platform Development Team




  • Lead, manage, and grow Zeppidy’s high performance local and remote platform development teams




    • Supervises, and provides performance management to project managers, developers, and QA team.




    • Leads daily agile scrum and workload.






  • Recruit and Develop the Best Engineering Talent




    • Work closely to continually enhance our platform development team through training, coaching and mentoring for both technical and soft skills.




    • Be a developer advocate in the community and ensure the company continues to hire top talent who fit our culture, enabling them to excel in our fast-paced, goal-orientated, and nimble environment.






  • Risk Management of Code Knowledge and Intellectual Property




    • Continually for cross-train developers on system architecture, code base, business rules, processes, and procedures.




    • Maintain technical documentation to ensure completeness and updated including use cases, system architecture, server info, data flow, database, code and module documentation.






2)  Zeppidy Platform and Architecture




  • Release High Quality Software






  • Implements best practice coding and implementation solutions of platform functionality




  • Plan development schedule from product roadmap and deploy on time system changes that meet requirements for functionality, performance, scalability, reliability, security and adherence to development goals and principles.




  • Define and prioritize project backlog for successful incremental releases. Update and manage execution of the backlog for incremental releases.




  • Meets measured strategic development goals on time and within budget




  • Lead the progression of the Zeppidy platform ensuring innovation ahead of industry alternatives




    • Work collaboratively with executive team on the vision for Zeppidy’s architecture to support the demands of today and the future.  




    • Lead platform management and development team to execute the vision.




    • Analyze competition and recommend appropriate development strategies and platform enhancements






  • Lead the Evolution of the Development Operational Model




    • Evolve development organization standards, policies, processes, procedures, key performance indicators, and organizational structure to support the organization activity and growth.






  • Lead the Advancement of our Software Development Lifecycle




    • Advance and evolve our agile development process and tooling to help our teams stay productive, happy, motivated, and accountable to platform development goals.






  • Manage Development Reporting and Finances




    • Monitor, review and provide executive-level progress updates and results to development plan.




    • Work closely with CFO and CEO to create and monitor development budgets and financial forecasts.






3)  Zeppidy Executive Team




  • Work closely with the executive team to help run and grow the business. Be a key contributor to the executive team. Help create and execute company strategy in alignment with core purpose and values.




  • Be the public’s technical face for the company. This includes investor relations (calls during due diligence), fund raising, developer community, press & media as needed.




REQUIRED EDUCATION AND SKILLS




  • Computer Science or related degree or equivalent professional qualification




  • 8+ years of experience designing and developing web and mobile solutions




  • 5+ years of experience in leading web and mobile development of consumer applications in early stage companies




  • 5+ years of supervising an Agile team




  • 3+ years experience with TDD or BDD, unit testing and end-to-end testing.




  • 3+ years experience formulating executive level presentations and reports




  • Demonstrated public speaking skills and presence




  • Demonstrated project management skills with firm understanding of the SDLC




  • Current hands-on best practices leveraging MySQL, Solr, Java, PHP, Drupal, Javascript, XML, JSON, Restful APIs, Geospatial data, Maps, Android, iOS.




  • Familiarity with Jira and GitHub




  • Mastery of UI/UX design




  • Ability to develop new approaches to complex design problems






  • Ability to prioritize and manage work to critical project timelines in a fast-paced environment




  • Superior attention to detail, excellent at multi-tasking, good organization skills




  • High degree of flexibility and resourcefulness in resolving issues and bringing ideas to life




  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively




  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills




PREFERRED EDUCATION AND SKILLS




  • Master’s of Business Administration or another advanced degree




  • Experience with RETS and IDX real estate data formats




  • Understanding of the residential real estate ecosystem

item.title: wanted: Senior Front End Engineer / bandmate at The Hackerati (New York, NY)
item.description:
What We Do


Technology Consultancy


The Hackerati is a boutique tech consulting firm delivering Engineering as a Service to a diverse client base, from Fortune 250s to startups. We focus on providing product delivery services in the areas of agile, big data, cloud, mobile / multi-screen, and web applications. We are a team of unconventional thinkers, visionaries, scientists, and entrepreneurial engineers.


Work We've Done


In the last 3 years, we’ve worked on a broad range of projects, including Web (90M unique visitors per month), APIs, native mobile (iOS/Android with millions of downloads), mobile web, machine learning, natural language processing, Big Data (330+ TB/mo), real time bidding, real time event processing (10k events/second), wearable devices, facial recognition, augmented reality, programmatic advertising, wrangling browsers and geospatial applications.


We are technology and process agnostic, so as a team member you’ll be exposed to many different technologies. We use proven technologies, following basic architectural principles and design patterns and practice Agile Engineering in a collaborative shared repo team development setting.


Our stacks consist of Objective C, Swift, Java/Android, Java/Hadoop, PHP, Python, Scala, Groovy/Grails, Ruby/Rails, Angular, React and Erlang.  


A great plus of being a Hackeratus is that you can draw upon a broad and deep collection of best practices from our respective Practice leaders to help you grow professionally.


Why You Should Join Us


We're not afraid to be our wild selves.


We’re different. With mottos like be fearless and weird is good, our unique perspectives on life and technology make us great people to learn from and work/party with. We sponsor lunches and happy hours, band practice, electronics like Glass/Oculus/Myo, and we’ve presented at the UN—twice. We rock that familial vibe, and you should join us if you enjoy a blurred line between work and play.


What To Expect


Deliver the industry's most challenging projects.


As Hackerati consultants we solve problems. Hard ones. To do so, we deploy teams of Hackerati to work onsite with clients around NYC, and build products in-house, both for ourselves and clients. Engagement teams vary in size and a typical project lasts between 6 and 9 months—Thus there is on-going diversity of cool new things to build.

item.title: Senior Product Manager for Music Business Startup at bookya.com (Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia)
item.description:
Join Bookya in Amsterdam & Kuala Lumpur and be part of the most exciting music business startup



The Senior Product Manager at Bookya.com will drive product development of the Bookya mobile-apps and website while being also responsible for conceptualization throughout the launch.

He/she is the primary liaison between the organization and our other globally distributed teams.

Working closely with our CEO, CFO and CGO to evolve high-level strategic vision into actionable tactics that provide Bookya users with a delightful experience. He/she is responsible for addressing incoming inquiries and issues raised by other terms in a timely fashion and communicating larger issues. He/sher provides visibility of efforts to others at Bookya and recognizes contributions.


What you do?


  • Defines and manages product roadmap, setting expectations with all relevant stakeholders including senior leadership team.

  • Be the subject matter expert for bookya's internal tools, mobile apps, and overall website.

  • Works with broad cross-section of internal teams including engineering, design, marketing, finance, culinary, and operations to define requirements, plan delivery, design solutions, and manage products through launch.

  • Proactively identifies and resolves strategic issues that may impair the organizations ability to meet is strategic, financial, and technical goals.

  • In partnership with design (UX and visual) and other product managers, the Senior Product Manager defines scope, requirements, use cases/user scenarios, test case documents and design specifications.

  • Synthesizes business requirements, identifies areas of uncertainty, recommends solutions, gathers buy-in from stakeholders, rolls solution out to team, shepherds feature through development and reviews the product before rollout.

  • Develops metrics to measure success of program features, analyzes results, and partners across the organization to develop action plans and enhancement recommendations.

  • Anticipates bottlenecks, provides escalation to management, anticipants and makes tradeoffs, and balances the business needs versus technical and operational constraints.

  • Leverages consumer insights and competitive intelligence to inform product decisions.

  • Balances and allocates team resources to achieve broader objectives while handling smaller requests.


Benefits



  • Enjoy working in a creative startup environment.

  • Equity, Share-of-Profit and Bonus Payments.

  • ... contact us to learn about all amazing benefits.

item.title: Senior iOS and Android Developers at Infusion (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Infusion, an award winning Microsoft Gold Partner, has new openings for a talented and experienced Senior .Net Consultant with a background leading projects ensuring that they are completed to the highest standards. As a Senior Consultant you will lead high profile projects, working with the best talent in Krakow to ensure we continue to deliver for our clients.


Infusion creates digital experiences and advanced technology solutions that bring our clients' businesses to new levels. Our international offices offer a full suite of information technology services with a focus on talent, technology, and design-driven methodologies, placing Infusion at the forefront of interface exploration. Infusion builds touch solutions on all platforms executing tablet, touch, and gesture based solutions for many of the world's largest organizations in the retail, financial services, hospitality and tourism, and government sectors.


Key Responsibilities and Duties:



  • Develop application components and features with limited oversight.

  • Independently resolve problems, test and debug.

  • Adhere to project governance-developing according to industry best practice.

  • Work with senior team members to validate design and implement decisions.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Elevated Careers) at eHarmony (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
As a founding member of our new Job Compatibility Engineering Team, we are looking for a Senior Software Engineer. You will work our product to develop the next generation of matching technologies to power eHarmony’s new Job Compatibility product for job seekers and recruiters. Our mission is to provide candidate users with an entirely new way to find jobs that fit their skills at companies with which they are profoundly compatible, and recruiters to find talent that will truly thrive in their new positions. You will work on the technology that will bring this mission to life.


As the Senior Software Engineer you will:


Drive the development of an entirely new enterprise website



  • Work with internal and external resources to implement and integrate new and existing systems

  • Create modules to extract features and signals from diverse data collections

  • Process large data logs to detect patterns and insights

  • Build tools to improve the targeting and relevance of eHarmony’s job matching platform

  • Work with Machine Learning specialists, Product Management and QA Teams to deliver reliable, high-performance systems

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Internal Tools at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Sr. Software Engineer to help build tools for monitoring and tracking the performance of various aspects of our distributed platform.  This role will exercise your creativity and ability as an engineer to design and create tools to work against various big-data systems, such as Couchbase, Apache Kafka, and Vertica.  You will work as a full-stack engineer, developing in the database access layer, service layer, UI layer, and everything in between.

Candidate should be familiar with the different parts of the Java application stack as well as Python, but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings.  However, you should have a true passion for technology that is apparent in your work and/or personal projects. You will work in an agile, high-pace environment with other talented engineers to build mission-critical tools with high-visibility.


Responsibilities:



  • Design and build tools for the QA team to properly test and monitor their respective systems.

  • Work with different platform developers to expose any vulnerabilities in their respective systems.

  • Build SLA reporting tools for managers to determine the health of the overall system and uptime metrics.

  • Improve and maintain the different internal tools written in Java and Python.

  • Mentor junior developers (i.e. demonstrate good coding practices and help them architect code intelligently).

  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team.

item.title: Senior Front End Developer Javascript and AngularJS at RealMassive (Austin, TX)
item.description:
RealMassive is looking for an über-talented & energetic front end web developer to help build and deploy our game-changing marketing platform. Creativity, personality, tats & piercings encouraged.


About You...


You are an experienced software engineer who is passionate about building quality software that delights customers and meets our organizational needs. You are a leader: others hold you in high regard and look up to you as a specialist in software development. When you promulgate opinions on software, others listen. For years, you worked diligently to establish a rock solid foundation in computer science. You continuously learn new technologies and stay apprised of current trends. When you create, it’s fast, clean, and elegant. Junior engineers are constantly learning from you and your work. You are on a path of continuous improvement. You can deliver under pressure and on strict timelines. You’re comfortable leading a team in agile practices and getting the most out of them. You can manage and code on multiple projects. You have an entrepreneurial spirit and strong will to jump in, produce, and lead. You’ve worked hard to get where you are, and you’re not done yet. Your next steps are Technical Director or VP of Engineering.


This senior level role reports directly to the CTO and includes coding and leadership.


Requirements



  • Expert foundation on the principles of computer science. A degree in computer science or related field; Masters or PhD preferred.

  • Expert in Javascript, AngularJS, and other front end frameworks and technologies.

  • Experience all across the stack.

  • 2+ years managing multiple projects.

  • 2+ years experience managing scrum teams.


Benefits



  • Competitive compensation (salary and stock options)

  • Medical & dental insurance

  • Relocation assistance available

  • Work with a close-knit, passionate team providing key innovations to an industry controlling an $15 trillion asset base.

  • Offices centrally located downtown with beautiful views of Austin

  • Weekly happy hours and other fun team building events


If you think you would be a good candidate, e-mail us a resume and cover letter to jobs@realmassive.com. No recruiters please.

item.title: Front-End Engineer at Body Labs (New York, NY)
item.description:
Body Labs is looking for a highly-skilled and driven Front-End Engineer to help us design and build great products that provide amazing experiences, with an emphasis on web application development. We need someone who has the experience and skill to make the right design and development choices, and write awesome code. You’ll be part of our internal product/engineering team, requiring teamwork, focus, and drive.


More than anything, we are looking for someone who will be passionate about what we are doing, and who is genuinely excited to come into the office and work hard to tackle tough problems. We are a small company and put a premium on esprit de corps. You must be a team player who can interact with others and be able to separate the wheat from the chaff. We want to work with someone who is energized and motivated, who thrives in a fast-paced, high growth environment, and who enjoys working closely with a small team. You will have to understand Body Labs’ high level goals and be able to connect your daily activities with the company’s long-term aspirations.


Responsibilities include:  



  • Design and implement new and existing software and web products

  • Build distributed, large scale data processing pipelines

  • Develop internal tools and architectural code standards

  • Debug and optimize existing and new code

  • Work independently and as a team, participating in code reviews and weekly product meetings

  • Pick up new technologies and learn on the go

  • Write awesome code that you can be proud of!

item.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
What does this role entail? You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting-edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise; mobile and desktop; external and internal; user-driven and automated; and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


More specifically, we are building apps on both Android and iOS, a customer-facing web application, a robust web services API, machine learning-driven analytics, and large-scale data processing. As a full-stack engineer, you must be hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member.


You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary: we are growing very quickly, but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long-term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.


This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Full Stack JavaScript Developer at New Visions for Public Schools (New York, NY)
item.description:
New Visions for Public Schools is looking for a Full Stack Developer to join our CloudLab Team, whose role will be to provide technical leadership around the analysis, design,development, testing, implementation and  integration of secure REST APIs and service-oriented web applications in both client and server-side Javascript frameworks (Angular JS, Node JS, Hapi) with backends in both MongoDb and Postgres.  The New Visions CloudLab Team designs, builds and maintains web applications that respond to educator needs and supports school leaders in effectively integrating data and technology. This team’s work is integral to New Visions’ direct support to nearly 200 public NYC high  schools in modernizing their tech  infrastructure to improve the responsiveness and quality of operations, instruction and student support. The problems we are solving are challenging and interesting and affect urban schools everywhere.  We are looking for an engineer excited about public service and the prospect of joining a fun and growing team in an open and transparent, collaborative, supportive, and diverse environment. 


Essential Job Functions



  • Leadership, Vision, and Communication

  • Help lead the New Visions CloudLab in its evolution from a leading non-profit edtech laboratory to a software development operation that employs smart practices and technologies to create scalable solutions for schools around the world.

  • Play a visionary role in the design and communication of a software architecture that will leverage modern Javascript frameworks to allow the optimum blend of flexibility, security, and scale.

  • Play a leadership role on a team of four engineers in adopting continuous integration and test driven development techniques and best practices to improve the stability of both our existing and future tools.

  • Provide ongoing guidance as we explore and wrestle with the inevitable trade-offs between  scalability vs. flexibility, complexity vs. user capacity, utilities vs. out of the box solutions, etc.

  • Play, teach, and learn with us in search of the most agile and sustainable ways to organize the fun that is our work.


Software Design and Development



  • Work directly with the School Tools and Systems Development team on discovery, specification, implementation, user-feedback, and iteration of applications that gain adoption and improve schools by winning hearts and minds.

  • Collaborate with relevant New Visions staff within iterative design cycles that are coupled to data coaching and school-facing relationships that ground product development in the careful qualitative appraisal and optimization of user-experience, as well as rigorous analysis of resultant usage analytics and student performance data.

  • Develop secure REST APIs and service-oriented applications in both client and server-side Javascript frameworks (Angular JS, Node JS, Hapi) with backends in both MongoDb and Postgres

item.title: Web Developer at Istituto Italiano di Tecnologia (Genova, Italy)
item.description:
Fondazione Istituto Italiano di Tecnologia is looking for a web developer to join the Digital Unit team based in Genova, Italy.


We offer a competitive salary, young and friendly company culture, casual dress and a flexible work environment.


We are looking for a front-end Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.


It's really important that you have a good knowledge of all the technologies that make a website work behind the scenes. We expect you to get involved, helping to maintain and extend the existing code base, creating brand new sections of websites as well as developing new sites and web applications.


Responsibilities



  • Develop functional and appealing web applications based on usability

  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use

  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs

  • Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability

  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders

  • Create quality mock-ups and prototypes

  • Write functional requirement documents and specifications

  • Maintain graphic standards and branding throughout the product's interface

  • Provide website maintenance and enhancements

  • Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies

  • Assist back-end developers in coding and troubleshooting

item.title: VP, Mainframe Infrastructure - Software Engineering - Development Management at Fidelity (Cary, NC)
item.description:
As the VP of Mainframe Infrastructure within the capital markets; trading and database technology organization, your role is to provide leadership, oversight, direction to a specialized Mainframe focused team while delivering key software solutions and support for the core infrastructure for Fidelity brokerage system.



As the leader of the Brokerage Mainframe Infrastructure team, you will develop and maintain critical software that provides routing, workload management, failover, scalability, and continuous availability infrastructure components. A seasoned and proven manager with CICS internals knowledge to provide expert level understanding of mainframe technologies and software development practices. Emphasis of the position is to provide thought leadership and technical direction in several key technologies.


Primary Responsibilities:  



  • Expected to drive tasks such as;  analysis of current and future application and infrastructure requirements, coding and testing of mainframe software components, vendor software evaluation, design, consulting and significant performance engineering and testing. 

  • Develop scalable and creative technical solutions in close collaboration with application and architecture teams.

  • Ability to complete software development projects by the agreed upon target date and budget with the highest level of quality, using appropriate development methodologies

  • Will insure that there is clear and concise documentation created for all phases of the assigned projects.

  • Drive the creation or enhancement of complex infrastructure and mainframe engineering solutions and requires skills beyond traditional application development.

  • Work with a geographically dispersed team


Why Fidelity?



  • Three consecutive years on CareerBliss’ Top 50 Happiest Companies Employees Survey

  • A company that is committed to innovation and being an industry leader by investing in technology

  • More than 12,000 technology professionals utilizing an Agile methodology enterprise-wide

  • Access to top-tier technology platforms, OS, and frameworks

  • Non-traditional benefits like our Concierge Service, Computer Equipment Purchase Assistance Program and profit sharing eligibility


Company Culture


At Fidelity, you can find it all here.  We reward ambitious, passionate individuals with a work environment that fosters diversity, teamwork and collaboration as well as encourages innovative ideas and fresh thinking. We recognize the value that employees’ individual differences can contribute to the bright and strong future of our company.

item.title: Systems Administrator at Outbox AXS LLC (Los Angeles, CA)

The Systems Administrator is responsible for helping to manage an office IT infrastructure including network switches, firewalls, wireless access points, telephone systems and end user workstations. item.title: Director, Solutions Architect-Java, Agile, Product Delivery at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Fidelity Strategic Investment Products and Data (SIPD) is seeking Director, Solutions Architect to lead project delivery for our Retail Managed Account Product Line.  The Solution Architect will create and maintain architecture plans and specifications for related applications.  He/she also guides project and program level decisions to ensure alignment with the Fidelity Enterprise Technology architecture strategy. Strategic Investment Products and Data (SIPD) is a shared technology services organization within Enterprise Technology.  SIPD manages and supports Guidance and Planning tools, Managed Accounts offerings, and Integrated Data Solutions across multiple Fidelity companies. The Director of Architecture will be located in Durham, NC; Smithfield, RI; or Merrimack, NH with periodic travel to Boston and North Carolina depending on location.

  • Participate in all aspects of Manage Accounts product innovation

  • Develop and assess technical solutions for the Managed Account product line

  • Identify approaches, tools, techniques, and technologies to meet business requirements

  • Recommend solutions that address functional and quality goals of systems

  • Establish, implement, and enforce appropriate architecture standards in the creation and implementation of the technical solution

  • Ensure delivery teams are following engineering best practices

item.title: Support and Integrations Engineer at Myriad Group (Mexico City, Mexico)
