item.title: Infrastructure Platform Engineer (Chef) at Bloomberg LP (Washington, DC)
item.description:
Bloomberg Careers - Infrastructure Platform Engineer (Chef) 


The Role:


Bloomberg's Infrastructure Platform group in R&D delivers services which support the fast-paced Bloomberg environment. This includes key infrastructure capabilities used across all of Bloomberg's products and services.


As a Infrastructure Platform Engineer, you will be primarily responsible for the design, maintenance and administration of the system and services built to automate our compute environment. Our enterprise uses Chef for this function and we are deploying Chef across all of Bloomberg's unique large-scale systems. Not only will your work be used by thousands of technologists at Bloomberg, but as an active open-source contributor, Bloomberg encourages you to work on projects and commit code that raises the bar for the community as a whole.


Talk to us about how you can become part of one of the newest, most technical diverse Chef installations in the industry; we have problems to challenge even the best engineers!

item.title: Cloud Systems Engineer at Cloudreach (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Cloudreach's Systems Engineers work with challenging technical solutions for industry leading clients. We love all things cloud related and believe passionately in the innovation it can drive. 


We're a global top-tier partner for both Amazon Web Services and Google - two giants of the cloud computing industry. We are looking for Windows or Linux engineers who are capable of delivering awesomeness on cloud engineering projects. Maybe you're a Systems Administrator, a Systems Engineer, a Site Reliability Engineer, or perhaps a DevOps Ninja - we can offer you something new. 


Our Cloud Platforms team is the best at what they do - DevOps meets consultancy. It's not your average job because Cloudreach is not your average company. You won't be bored - there's plenty of variety in our project work and you'll always be learning.


Not if. When will you join the best Cloud engineering team in the industry?


Where has Cloudreach come from?



  • We were an idea formed in a London pub. Now we're a global business with hubs across Europe and North America. That growth is fuelled by a special team, developing tech solutions for interesting clients you will have heard of

  • We were voted #1 Small Business to Work For in 2013 and our management won Best Leadership


How will you spend your time at Cloudreach?


You will be working in the following areas (and more!):



  • Green field development of Amazon Web services infrastructure (EC2, RDS, EMR, etc) e.g. looking at an existing service or data center and then architecting a more effective solution in AWS. You might work on a major eCommerce platform, a MySQL database migration, or building a scalable mobile backend

  • DevOps: systems engineering work with frameworks such as Chef or Puppet - as well as helping to break down barriers between siloed teams. We automate everything.

  • Technical deployment and consultancy related to Google Apps for Business - for example designing a complex Single Sign-On solution

  • Not doing any out of hours shift work - yay!

item.title: Infrastructure Engineer at Rally Software (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Rally is seeking an experienced, self-motivated, and passionate Infrastructure Engineer to join our team.  Are you someone who loves to solve big problems and who doesn’t settle for the status quo?  We believe in finding the right tool, hardware, or software for the job, we don’t care if it’s open source or proprietary.

If it makes our systems faster, more secure, and scalable we want to hear about it.   Because we are an Agile company you won’t be working in a silo.  We need you to have broad experience in system administration, network operations, some coding experience, build and release engineering, performance engineering and site operations.  We don’t expect anyone to know everything, we just need people who are quick studies that aren’t afraid to jump in with both feet and learn by doing.


An entrepreneurial fast paced mentality is critical for success in this position: a passionate can-do attitude, exceptional communication skills, and the ability to collaborate while acting as a thought leader in your area of expertise will serve you well at Rally Software. Does this sound like a challenge you're ready for?


Once hired, here’s what we’ll need you to do.


Key Responsibilities:




  • Partner with developers, architects and the business to optimize the integration and delivery of existing and new services




  • Support, troubleshoot and maintain the Rally global production infrastructure ecosystem (AWS, data center, and on-premises installations)




  • Build and maintain configuration management recipes in Chef




  • Enable autonomy in development teams through the creation and delivery of valuable self-service and automation capabilities




  • Work with developers and product owners to lead operational readiness throughout the SDLC




  • Pair with other engineers to promote skills enhancement and knowledge sharing




  • Research and share the latest innovations in automation and virtualized infrastructure




Skills Required:




  • BS/MS in Computer Science or 5+ years of relevant industry experience




  • Prior experience supporting large scale, highly available, service-oriented, distributed production systems.




  • Very strong Linux experience in a highly-available production environment




  • Experience building production hosting environments from bare metal up




  • Familiarity with SaaS, PaaS or IaaS




  • Strong understanding of best practices around release engineering




  • Exposure to different types of data storage




  • Strong written & oral communication skills are essential




  • Experience using tools such as Git, Docker, Puppet and/or Chef




  • Advanced scripting skills




You will be successful in this role if you:




  • Believe in Agile principles and iterative development




  • Can be autonomous and self-driven but work across teams to collaborate on common ideas and strategies




  • Are comfortable working with automation and are willing to learn tools you aren’t familiar with




  • Enjoy exploring and experimenting with new ideas and sharing with others




  • Can communicate ideas clearly and effectively




  • Have a positive attitude when engaging with our customers (development teams, the business and occasionally external customers)




Location: Boulder, CO (relocation assistance available)


Rally’s global headquarters is in Boulder, Colorado, with 9 additional offices spanning 4 continents. At Rally we believe that we can’t inspire innovation in our customers if we’re not innovative ourselves. We empower our teams by offering them flexibility, autonomy, and a culture founded upon open communication and collaboration. Recently awarded Best for the World: Worker Impact award for the third year in a row by B Labs, Named #8 on the “Best Medium-Sized Workplaces” by Fortune Magazine, a “Best Company to Work For in Colorado” and ranked in the “Top 100 Best Places to Work” in the nation from Outside Magazine, Rally offers a highly collaborative culture and work-life balance that attracts and retains top talent.


Rally is an Equal Opportunity Employer!

Rally Software Development Corp., a wholly owned subsidiary of CA, Inc.

item.title: Senior Program Manager - Mobile at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX is seeking a talented, passionate Senior Program Manager on our Mobile team.  This is a leadership position for a results-oriented person with the ability to communicate effectively, encourage sound decision-making, and guide your team to successfully deliver on commitments. The applications and services built by the team are highly visibility within the company. 


This role is a unique opportunity to join a successful company and help grow it to the next level.  If you want to lead the delivery of a wave of inspiring new consumer applications and services that will bring millions of people greater sanity, improved communication and better productivity then this is the role for you.


Who we’re looking for:

The ideal candidate is results-oriented, collaborative, assertive, organized and is committed to delivering amazing work in a team environment. You will be responsible for delivering mobile products and services as a Product Owner of the Android mobile team.  As a Product Owner, you will work with UX, services groups and other POs to deliver on key scenarios for the next INRIX Traffic application. As a Product Owner, you will work with customers to determine needs and/or deliver custom solutions.  You will review internal processes, make continual recommendations for improvements and sets vision, values, methods, and metrics for the team.



  • You’re experienced in Android mobile app and cloud services development, and can ramp up on complex engineering challenges with ease.

  • You’re a master communicator – it is a key strength of yours and you can communicate complex problems in simple, easy-to-understand language to a variety of audiences – engineers, partners, customers, designers, salespeople and executives.

  • You’ve worked with a number of external clients before, and understand their expectations for understandable costs, regular updates on projects, etc.

  • You have deep engineering experience, and can guide the team to create the right layers between reusable app platform components and core product experience.

  • You’ve seen products get into trouble in every way imaginable, and know how to avoid these pitfalls on your future projects.

  • You’re an expert in Agile engineering process and can prepare and communicate product roadmaps that are based on weekly agile sprint delivery cycles.

  • Proven results as a Product Owner in short sprint cycles.

  • You have a history of working through ambiguity to create great products.

  • You constantly push our product forward and our team to achieve more than they thought they could.

  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Computer Science (or a great reason for not having one).

  • You have managed a UX process to deliver great experiences in your projects.

  • 6+ years of relevant professional experience.

  • Prior experience as a developer is a plus.


What you’re looking for:



  • A fast paced “start-up like” environment with an Agile workflow and small, high performing teams.

  • Being part of a team where smart, passionate, and ambitious engineers, testers, and PMs both support and challenge one another.

  • A fast–growing global company where you’ll be challenged to think about things that no one else in the company has thought of yet.

  • A position where you have the chance to influence major industries that most people interact with regularly and help define the future state of the art experiences for those industries.


We also have some great perks:



  • INRIX motorboat – Get your boat license and we’ll pay for the gas. You can walk from your office to the dock in 15 minutes. Take your family and friends skiing or tubing.  Yes, it’s big and it’s fast! 

  • Free car – Well not really free... but we have a couple new test cars with the latest traffic technology that you can take home. We pay for the gas. 

  • Free Parking & Electric Vehicle Charger onsite - We have a covered garage with enough spots to go around.

  • Great Benefits – We’re as good, or better than most companies our size.  We even pay 100% of our employees’ medical, dental, vision, and disability premiums. 

  • Lots of free food – We have free onsite snacks and drinks; Friday family style lunches, and stocked fridges with lunch items for everyday!  The food comes to you so that you write lots of good code (at least we’re honest). 

  • Bonuses 2x per year and Stock Options – Because you like to be rewarded and recognized for your hard work. 

  • Open Ended Vacation Policy – You’re an adult and can manage your own vacation time.  Work hard; play hard, and don’t bother counting the days. 

  • Family – We don’t believe that you should miss your child’s play because you have to attend a meeting.  The CEO even sends a handwritten card and gift to your child on their special day.  How many CEO’s do that?


INRIX is making a positive impact in the world:


INRIX, Inc. is the fastest growing traffic intelligence platform in the world delivering smart data and analytics to solve transportation issues worldwide. INRIX is leading efforts to leverage Big Data to reduce the economic, environmental and individual toll of gridlock. 

Today, commuting by car or public transportation can be slow, aggravating, and well… painful.  In this position you’ll have the power to keep millions up-to-date and in control of their daily schedules and commutes, just for starters.  You’ll also have the freedom to propose brand new consumer products and user scenarios in which INRIX provides value to millions of consumers multiple times a day.  This is bigger than navigation – there are whole new product categories to invent.


Are you ready to join a different kind of company?  Exciting things are happening all the time. Come join us!

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer (Ruby, Rails, Clojure) at Medidata Solutions (New York, NY)
item.description:
Medidata Solutions (NASDAQ:MDSO) is seeking a passionate Software Engineer to join one of our cloud based web application development teams. Our mission is to work with the absolute best engineers to provide clinical research organizations with the most advanced tools for planning and managing their clinical trials.


Have you ever wondered how the drug that you pick up in a drug store goes from an idea in a researcher's mind to being approved for use around the world?  We make the software that medical researchers use to manage clinical trials -- enabling researchers to verify the efficacy and safety of new drugs -- which allows the industry to bring new drugs to market quickly and efficiently.  This position will allow you to work with a team that helps connect clinical trial subjects with new and innovative medicines following all regulatory requirements to optimize the clinical study process. 


We are continually building and improving our cloud-based clinical trial solution to put innovative technology and insightful data into the hands of researchers allowing new treatments to reach markets safely, efficiently and effectively. 


If you are interested in applying your passion and skills to truly impact society in a positive way and not just work for a company that creates yet another social media network app please read on.  


What we are looking for:
Software Applications Engineers with 2+ years experience building cloud based web applications. You’ll demonstrate a passion for your craft, be self motivated and eager to engage in high impact, challenging, engineering problems while continuously raising the standard of quality in our products and services in a full solutions-oriented SaaS environment.  Your responsibilities will include hands-on implementation and development with Ruby on Rails and MySQL amongst other tools 


What’s in it for you?
We offer our engineers a highly competitive compensation that includes base, bonus and a strong benefits package that includes medical and dental insurance, vision care, short- and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts FSA, commuter FSA, 401K, tuition reimbursement program, paid company holidays and unlimited paid time off.

We send engineers to conferences and seminars to learn and get exposed to new ideas and bring back the knowledge and the contacts that they acquired.


We provide top of the line computers (PCs or MacBook Pro), adjustable standing desks and the most comfortable work spaces. We have plenty of space for collaboration, game room and a private rooftop terrace.

item.title: Full Stack Senior Software Engineer - Sling TV at Sling TV (American Fork, UT)
item.description:
Summary:


Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Move Networks, makers of Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet.


We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. This is an exciting position in a fast moving project that requires the ability of candidates to hit the ground running. What we’re building is revolutionary. We only hire super stars and every employee participates in a profit sharing program. Come be a part of changing the face of TV!


Sling TV delivers content from Disney/ESPN, HBO, AMC, Turner, Scripps, EPIX, Univision and Maker Studios, and is available on Amazon Fire TV, Amazon Fire TV Stick, current-generation Roku players, Roku TV models, Xbox One, Android, iOS, Macs, PCs.


#TakeBackTV


Responsibilities:



  • An intimate understanding of Object Oriented design principles and patterns.

  • An intuitive understanding of software design/architecture and the ability to discuss and make design considerations and trade-offs.

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer at The College Board (Reston, VA)
item.description:
Senior Systems Engineer




Job ID: AD20150406-55610

Description:


Introduction


The College Board, a national educational organization, is conducting a search for Senior Systems Engineer in our Shared Services organization, who will be resident in our Reston, VA office.


Summary


The Sr. Systems Engineer will support system management, software deployments, system monitoring and reporting, performance/stress testing, and other operational activities.  This individual will provide engineering support to IG staff in the form of process automation, tools development, and systems integration, leveraging a combination of existing tools as well as selecting, implementing and developing additional ones.  The Sr. Systems Engineer will address trouble shooting and problem resolution with a focus on the development of tools to create repeatable processes for deployment, maintenance, and operation of software and systems.  This position collaborates with IG engineering and operations staff, developers, and business unit personnel to identify opportunities for improvement and then insures that these plans are properly implemented and operated.


The Sr. Systems Engineer will support day to day operations of the SOA platform at the College Board. This includes, but is not limited to, deploying business services, implementing end to end transactional monitoring, creating and applying run-time governance policies, ensuring QoS and SLAs are met through the use of monitoring, run time quotas, and throttling, participating in troubleshooting of complex multi-team, multi-component SOA based systems, detecting and helping mitigate security risks, proactively identifying performance bottlenecks or system performance degradation. This position works closely with the NOC, operations, networking, development, QA, release management, and enterprise architecture groups.


Responsibilities



  • Troubleshoot issues related to production and non-production servers and applications to ensure a consistent and positive experience for our customers.

  • Execution of daily operations activities in support of Data Center Operations, which includes validating the health of the production and non-production servers by reviewing the daily event log, monitoring performance and operation of applications, servers, and networks.

  • Work closely with peer Infrastructure teams to ensure seamless operation of the production and non-production environments.  Ensure application patches and virus prevention signatures are current. Perform regularly scheduled maintenance, routine tasks, or emergency system maintenance to minimize system downtime.

  • Detect, troubleshoot, and resolve any hardware, software, or operating system problems.

  • Develop, maintain, communicate, and implement written processes and procedures related to all aspects of Data Center Operations.

  • Deliver well-provided customer support and communicate and implement defined change management procedures.

  • Candidate will support implementation efforts of infrastructure upgrades/enhancements as required.

  • Develop increasing expertise in key technologies including security and disaster recovery/business continuance planning.


Qualifications


Education/Experience:



  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent with 5+ Years experience in IT with a broad range of exposure to all aspects of operational, stress and performance evaluations, systems analysis, and system engineering.

  • Experience with Linux system administration

  • 3+ years experience with support of Oracle, Linux and AIX systems are required. 

  • Demonstrated understanding of database concepts in the Oracle relational database platforms

  • Possess a working knowledge of architectural frameworks and methodologies

  • Demonstrate a broad knowledge of operating systems and software development tools


This position will be subject to a background check.


Apply


If you are interested in joining the College Board and you meet our qualifications, we encourage you to APPLY by following the link below to send us your resume and a brief introductory cover letter that includes salary expectations. 


Benefits


We offer our employees an outstanding benefits package which includes 4 weeks of paid time off, a generous retirement plan, tuition reimbursement and ongoing professional development and training.


Mission


The College Board’s mission is to connect students to college success and opportunity. We are a not-for-profit membership organization committed to excellence and equity in education. Among our best-known products are the SAT®, PSAT/NMSQT®, and Advanced Placement Program®. 


The College Board is committed to diversity in the workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The College Board participates in E-Verify, a service of DHS and SSA, where required. Please understand that only qualified applicants will be contacted.




Requirements:
Desired Travel Less than 25%
Areas of Expertise IT Infrastructure
Highest Level of Education Bachelor's Degree
Job Type Full Time
Location Reston, VA
Years of Relevant Experience 4-5



Apply Here


PI91780763

item.title: Javascript Engineer to help disrupt software security at Codiscope (Boston, MA)
item.description:
There’s incredible excitement and urgency around developing secure software.  But today’s security tools are unwieldy and expensive to implement, fit poorly in modern agile development processes, and often simply pile up bugs of questionable value.  We’re disrupting software security by replacing assessment tools with development tools that build security into software as it’s developed. We scale secure development in today’s app focused, DevOps centric, continuous deployment world.


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will help our users understand the impact that our products are having in their organization. You will transform mountains of data into actionable insight. You will tackle challenges to deliver blazing fast performance, scale through a microservices architecture, and drive new data storage solutions like NoSQL. You will play a prominent role in our small but strongly backed company and you’ll help accelerate our success.


Responsibilities:



  • Redesigning and transitioning our legacy J2EE application stack towards a MEAN stack

  • Helping move our product to a SaaS model addressing features such as multi-tenancy, streaming

  • Manage for performance and flexibility in distributed architectures

  • Being a strong communicator with ability to coordinate and follow-up aggressively

  • Conducting technical evaluations of new JS frameworks and plugins

  • Conducting code reviews

  • Mentor and develop junior engineers

item.title: Research Scientist - Text-to-Speech at Amazon (Gdask, Polska)
item.description:
Amazon TTS team researches, develops and delivers cutting edge multi-language Text to Speech technology, leading in voice quality, accuracy and ease of use.

As part of our development team you will work within the Amazon Digital Products department. This department has developed significant digital businesses including Amazon MP3, Amazon Video on Demand, IMDB, Amazon Fire TV, the Kindle Fire and our recently released Amazon Echo.



We are a team of creative people who successfully combine passion and ambition in creating one of the best speech synthesizers in the world, and now are one of the most visible teams within Amazon where you will get the chance to have a huge influence on making a positive impact on customers all over the globe.

At Amazon, we take pride in building complete end-to-end solutions, staring from researching a problem, implementing the solution, building a scalable and reliable service and ensuring the service is there when you need it.

Our goal is to build a next generation Text-to-Speech (TTS) system that takes the user experience to the next level and speaks a large variety of voices in the world’s most spoken languages. The challenges we face is handling whole variety of data which need to be pronounced correctly (such as names, surnames, proper names, foreign words), as well as finding correlation of end-user ratings and internal TTS quality metrics. This requires an engineer approach to improve the basis of huge amount of synthesized texts and semantic knowledge of the text to improve pronunciation of context specific words.



This position is based in Amazon Development Center in Gdansk, Poland.



As part of our development team you will be responsible for research in speech synthesis, providing analysis using mathematical modeling tools to answer important questions, designing system architectures, utilizing code (C/C++, Perl or Java) and existing tools for modeling or prototyping, effective communication with management as well as with colleagues from computer science and business backgrounds. You will be involved in projects from concept to deployment, working closely with our core technology team, taking part in the complete project lifecycle.


  • MSc. or PhD degree in Computer Sciences, Machine Learning, or related technical field.

  • Proven track record of achievements in language research and development for Text-To-Speech, Automatic Speech Recognition or Natural Language processing

  • Professional experience in software development.

  • Knowledge of C/C++

  • Proficiency in at least one scripting languages (Perl, Python, Hadoop, Hive, etc)

  • Strong fundamentals in problem solving, algorithm design and complexity analysis.

  • Fundamentals in object-oriented design and data structures.

  • Strong personal interest in learning, researching, and creating new technologies with high commercial impact.




  • Knowledge of parametric and/or unit selection TTS technology.

  • Knowledge of software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.

  • Clear, professional communication skills able to contribute to team discussions.


When applying, please enclose the following statement:

„I hereby give consent for my personal data included in my offer to be processed for the purposes of recruitment, in accordance with the Personal Data Protection Act dated 29.08.1997 (uniform text: Journal of Laws of the Republic of Poland 2002 No 101, item 926 with further amendments.

item.title: Perl Software Engineer - Las Vegas, NV at SUPERNAP (Las Vegas, NV)
item.description:
Join SUPERNAP - A Switch Company
Switch, the developer of SUPERNAP data centers, is the revolutionary technology solutions company led by inventor and solutionist Rob Roy. As Founder and CEO he holds 218 patents and patents pending that have produced an essential and future-forward transformation in data center architecture, engineering, technology and operations. His vision also resulted in the creation of the SUPERNAP CORE Cooperative. It is the world’s only $3 trillion independent purchasing and collaboration ecosystem, guided by the company’s unique operating ideology called Truth in Technology.

Designed by Rob Roy, the Switch award-winning Tier IV Gold SUPERNAP data centers are certified as the highest-ranking colocation data centers in the world and are maintained by the highest-rated mission critical operations teams. With more on-net, independent cloud providers than any other physical cloud gateway, SUPERNAP connects thousands of clients and providers from within the facility. SUPERNAP is the recognized world leader in colocation design, development and mission critical operations.

SUPERNAP, with clients ranging from sophisticated startups to Fortune 100 powerhouses, enables unparalleled mission critical solutions that make a difference in innovation, ROI and communities as a whole.

Perl Software Engineer - Las Vegas, NV

The purpose of this position is to design, architect, develop and test new web-based software applications and address issues with production systems, while also providing technical research, support and training as necessary. The ideal candidate will have a hard time placing a title on their skill set because besides being a Perl rockstar, they are also revered as a Linux Engineer, have a very respectable amount of network knowledge, and are just as good at "putting out fires" as they are with developing new code.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Responsible for architecting, developing, and testing new web-based applications in Object Oriented Perl.

  • Improve, fix, and test production web-based applications in Object Oriented Perl.

  • Utilize MySQL and DBI for data storage and retrieval within Perl applications.

  • Make technical recommendations based upon the current production applications and future applications.

  • Discuss and clearly articulate complex technical topics with technical and non-technical staff, and occasionally customers.

  • Eager to interact with other teams and departments, as well as customer facing and commercial teams.

  • Experience with relational databases and SQL.

  • Knowledge of HTML, JavaScript and CSS.

  • Systems/software development experience in a Linux and/or *nix environment.

  • Advanced Perl Scripting, threading, forking and object oriented concepts experience.

  • Source control (GIT, SVN, CVS, etc.) experience.

  • Knowledge of PC LOAD LETTER.

  • Good sense of humor.



    • Computer Equipment and Software:

    • Education and Experience:



  • BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent technical schooling and/or work experience.

  • 5-10 years experience (additional certifications preferred).




    • Physical Demands:

    While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, bend, use hands, operate a computer, and have specific vision abilities to include close and distance vision, and ability to adjust focus working with computer and business equipment.

    The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds.
    ____________________________________________________


    A STRICT BACKGROUND INVESTIGATION AND DRUG TEST WILL BE REQUIRED OF ALL CANDIDATES IN ALL DEPARTMENTS.

item.title: Software Engineering Team Lead at Cake Solutions Inc (New York, NY)
item.description:
About Cake Solutions Inc


Using the very latest technologies, Cake Solutions helps organisations take innovative and disruptive ideas and develop them into reactive software solutions. Cake’s success is underpinned by our unique One Team® approach that allows for standalone projects or close collaboration with the clients’ technology teams. Cake provides mentors to guide the entire organisation through modern software engineering, continually transferring skills and knowledge to client teams in the process. This enables Cake to deliver not just software but to transform the way organisations think about and execute software delivery.


As an early adopter of change in the IT industry, Cake embraces the use of the latest bleeding edge programming languages and tools to implement system components including big data, machine learning and the Internet of Things. Cake delivers the appropriate technical solution to a business problem and can transform the way organisations think about and deliver production-ready high quality systems safely and predictably.


Our experienced, cross-functional agile teams enable the delivery of entire solutions not just lines of code. They appreciate the importance of continuous integration, continuous delivery, DevOps and rigorous testing.


Cake team members are published authors, prolific bloggers and experienced speakers. They have extensive experience in designing, building and implementing scalable Reactive Applications and are encouraged to continually research and innovate and to publish thought leading insights.

item.title: Senior Manager, Software Engineering - Dallas, Texas at Axxess (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
With growth comes new opportunity!  We are looking to add a dynamic and driven Senior Manager of Software Engineering to lead, mentor and manage multiple agile teams comprised of software engineers, team leads and product managers.  This position will be based out of our Dallas, Texas office.


If you are motivated by the opportunity to create amazing products, delight customers and deliver an outstanding product experience in a fast-paced, forward-thinking company with an extremely bright future - check this out!


Axxess is a technology company providing software for health organizations to efficiently run their business. Axxess empowers health care companies with easy to use, cloud based software integrating all aspects of their operations, so they improve patient outcomes while growing their business. 


Why Axxess?


It’s simple.  We do business differently, by empowering you to build the technology to create mind-blowing, first-to-market, superior products - leading healthcare into the future. We build the best because we only hire the best.


We do culture differently, too. You will quickly see how we approach our business, as we believe our team should work smart, and play harder.  


We are an open, agile environment, where transparent conversation ignites collaboration with a team of great thinkers.  Everyone freely contributes, ideas override egos, and the best idea always wins.  We embrace new technologies and pride ourselves on sustainable and quality code.  In our world, opportunity paired with imagination is limitless and we build what others can only hope to dream.  We’ve created an atmosphere allowing you to produce your best work, by catering to the creative.  Collaborate in a space designed to inspire the sharing of ideas on whiteboards; chill by yourself in the lounge or play a game of Madden or pool.


We are deliberate about our environment; we’ve built it to inspire creativity, where we are excited to come every day to pour our passion into our products.    We Dream. We Build. We Empower.

item.title: Director of Eastern Region Solutions Engineering & Services at Puppet Labs (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Department: Customer Success
Reports to: SVP of Customer Success       
Location: Anywhere, East Coast   

Enjoy leading technical, customer-facing teams?  Do you love IT automation software?  Excited about what Puppet is doing and want to be a part of it?

Puppet Labs is hiring a Director of Eastern Region Solutions Engineering & Services to help drive strategic direction for the department and set the daily operations for the Eastern Region, which is comprised of Solutions Engineers (pre-sales) and Professional Services Engineers (post-sales).  The Director will coach a growing team to ensure we are delivering outstanding services to Sales and our customers.  

In this role, you will both ensure we continue to support our Sales team and champion our customers needs and oversee PS engagements with customers as well as manage team members, milestones, and activities.  You will coordinate with peers and other departments, such as User Experience, Engineering, and Sales to collaborate on special initiatives and to formalize feedback and communication loops.  

You will work with the other Customer Success Directors to ensure best practices in pre and post-sales activities are implemented across the organization.  You will participate in the development of the services roadmap and represent the needs of customers.  Working with the Director of Partner Enablement you will ensure that the Eastern Region service and training partners are enabled to provide high-quality support through Puppet authorized partner programs.   

This position operates in a team-oriented environment.  As a result, you must build and maintain strong and effective working relationships internally with peers on the services management team, sales, marketing, business development and product marketing.  As a leader you must also ensure that your team creates and maintains effective working relationships with various internal and external teams.

Qualifications

  • A combination of  8 years management experience in building, leading and growing field-based pre-sales teams and professional services teams in an enterprise software or open source company.  Focus of experience should be on the pre-sales side.

  • Excellent leadership skills, with proven success in hiring, leading, engaging and motivating staff, as well as working effectively across departments.

  • Strong customer orientation with demonstrated experience in achieving a high level of customer satisfaction

  • Able to identify problems, resolve escalations (including collaborating with others when necessary), act decisively and show good judgment.  Able to gain sponsorship and consensus on key initiatives

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; highly refined interpersonal skills; and high caliber presentation skills.   The ability to successfully translate product information to both technical and non-technical professionals at all levels of an organization is required.

  • Empathy with our customers and their problems through experience in a Unix/Linux systems administration or development role.

  • Strong industry knowledge (configuration management, data center management, and systems management domains)

  • Excellent time and project management skills

  • Experience in developing and launching service offerings;  generating and interpreting business and service delivery key metrics; and managing multi-department budgets

  • Ability to travel up to 35-50% nationally and internationally

  • BA or BS degree in computer science or a related field

Application Instructions

Please include a cover letter with your application describing why you are interested in working for Puppet Labs, and how you feel your experience fits the listed qualifications of the position.

Working for Puppet Labs

Our mission at Puppet Labs is to drive the cost of technology change to zero.  We make IT automation software for systems administrators, freeing them from repetitive work and fire-fighting so they can do more interesting and higher-value work for their organizations.  Our most important measure of success is their love for our products.

We're growing fast, but we're determined for everyone here to have a real impact on the company and our customers every day.  We're driven and restless.  We encourage creativity and collaboration.  By challenging each other, we foster continuous improvement.  We hire carefully for passion, self-motivation, intelligence, curiosity, and adaptability.

We offer excellent health benefits for employees and family, a flexible time-off policy (that we do insist you use), and a variety of methods to grow your skills and further your career.  We have employees all around the US, the UK, Sweden, Canada, the Czech Republic and Australia.  Our headquarters in downtown Portland, Oregon, is one block off Tom McCall Waterfront Park with views of Mt. Hood, Mt. St. Helens and the Willamette River.

Puppet powers thousands of companies, including Twitter, Yelp, Disney, Google, Citrix, eBay, NYSE, Cisco WebEx, Salesforce, Bank of America and PayPal.  Our investors include Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, VMware, Google Ventures, Cisco, True Ventures, Radar Partners, and Emerson Street Partners.

Puppet Labs is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact 877-575-9775 for assistance.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Area 1 Security (Redwood City, CA)
item.description:
The role: 


We’re looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our team. This role involves building out systems that support the biggest and most targeted companies in the world, enabling the whole engineering org to iterate at top speed in an open, decentralized environment. Systems management and automation is the name of the game here - in development, testing, staging and production. If you love working on software products that have an impact and want some serious experience under exponential growth conditions, this is it. 



We also realize there's a lot to accomplish in this position, and we're open to people who want to work full time remotely as long as they're able to travel to our office in Redwood City as needed. 



Here’s more about what you’ll accomplish at Area 1: 


* You'll act as an "engineer for the engineers," helping others understand the architectures and platforms underlying the solution. 


* You'll have free reign to make improvements wherever you find inefficiencies. 


* You’ll debug complicated failures and be able to grok complex systems from their roadmaps all the way down to their syscalls. 


* You’ll build and lead a DevOps team as we scale.

item.title: Software Engineer at Best Friends Animal Society (Kanab, UT)
item.description:
Are you an amazing Software Engineer who can provide expertise, leadership and mentorship to our IT team so that homeless pets will have technology on their side?  Our IT is growing so come work among the beautiful red rocks of Southern Utah!


Position Summary:  Responsible for providing technical expertise, leadership and mentorship to the software engineering team.  Ability to help define and set coding and architecture standards and practices and give similar input on other technical items.  Will work closely with the Sr. Manager of Application Services to determine priorities, technical approach and future direction.  Will actively generate code, participate in code reviews and be involved in deployments and operational support.


Responsibilities:



  • Providing software engineering team with leadership, technical expertise and mentorship.  Working closely with the team on ensuring that the project goals are being met with the solution being coded, that standards are being followed and efficient practices are being employed.  Will help to define a standard methodology for development and ensure that all solutions are compliant. (40 percent)

  • Actively generate code, do code reviews and similar operation support/project related activities.  Will take an active hand in projects and difficult operational issues. (40 percent)

  • Work with the Sr. Manager of Application Services to understand and plan future work, discuss technical approach and other similar items. (10 percent)

  • Participate in required administrative tasks.  Will actively participate in operational support meetings, CRM support meetings and other key business support items. (10 percent)

item.title: Software Engineer- iOS at Sling TV (American Fork, UT)
item.description:
Summary: Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Move Networks, makers of Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet. We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. This is an exciting position in a fast moving project that requires the ability of candidates to hit the ground running. What we’re building is revolutionary and every employee participates in a profit sharing program. Come be a part of changing the face of TV!


Responsibilities:


You will be responsible for the software design, implementation, and maintenance of one or more of our client platforms that include smart televisions, set top boxes, mobile phones and tablets, desktop and laptop computers, and other consumer devices.


You will have a history of developing elegant and intuitive user experiences on a variety of platforms, and know what separates mediocre user experience from great ones. Collaborating with the team, UX designers, and product management, you will create an innovative UI experience optimized for your platforms.

item.title: Manager, Software Development at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Amazon strives to be the world’s most customer-centric company, where customers can research and purchase anything they might want online. We set big goals and are looking for people who can help us reach and exceed them. Kindle is the best-selling product in the history of Amazon.com and our team is responsible for providing the best shopping experience for all the Amazon.com devices and accessories including Kindles, Tablets, Echo, Fire T.V. and much more. We are the most innovative and fastest growing businesses at Amazon. You should be passionate about customer experience and think it’s fun to utilize, extend, and invent Amazon’s AWS technology. This critical role will continue to build on the current success by leading a software development team responsible for multiple aspects of the Devices and Accessories store. We are looking for a proven, hands on, results-oriented Software Development Manager to lead a team that will build the future experience for our customers, who are looking for the best product and accessories to meet their needs.



In this role you will be responsible for:

  • Hiring, leading, mentoring a world-class engineering team

  • Working effectively with product managers, designers, and business teams to deliver the best overall experience factoring in financial goals and usability goals

  • Working closely with engineers to architect and develop the best technical design and approach

  • Establishing a consistent, scalable engineering framework and excellent development processes

  • Owning and report on status of development, quality, technical operations, and system performance




  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field is required.

  • Deep understanding of computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms and programming languages, messaging and asynchronous architectures)

  • A track record of great hiring of technical team members and leaders

  • Minimum 6 years of software development experience

  • Minimum 3 years of people management experience

  • Track record of building quality software and operating services delivering high quality, performance and availability.

  • Experience working effectively across functional teams

  • Ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast-paced environment

  • Ability to communicate and discuss software components in simple, general terms with business partners and in great detail with software development engineers

  • Strong sense of ownership, urgency, drive, independence, and flexibility

  • Analytical approach to problem solving and a track record of driving results through continuous improvement

  • Ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously and proficiency at leveraging precious resources

  • Composed, poised and professional demeanor




  • High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously

  • Composed, poised and professional demeanor

  • Willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done

  • Well-timed tenacity and conviction

  • Vocally self-critical

item.title: Producer ( Berlin, Helsinki, Dortmund ) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The Opportunity


As a producer you will be instrumental in supporting the development team in achieving excellence in terms of delivering software. You will help facilitate the lean development process, track progress against Key Performance Indicators and will help organize and support planning and other daily activities as the team requires. You will be expected to showcase your excellent organisational, problem solving and analytic skills.


What we are looking for



  • You have 4-5 years of Software Project Management or Software Product Management experience, ideally in an e-commerce company

  • You have sound knowledge and experience of managing and supporting software development using industry standard agile project management methodologies

  • You have effectively managed features and requirements documents, project management documents and team roadmaps.  You are able to bring a team together to craft a joined up plan, you understand risk mitigation and dependency management.

  • Activities such as Backlog grooming, Task Prioritization, Roadmap Management, Daily Standups, User stories, Jira, Product/Feature Mockups and Processes diagrams are in your DNA

  • You have strong communication skills and actively drive projects, breaking down complex problems into manageable, structured work packages. You effectively manage stakeholders and third party expectations and undertake periodic, appropriate reporting

  • You have drive and are you motivativated to get things done.  You lead by example, you talk data, you facilitate, you resolve, you negotiate and get things done

  • You thrive in an international environment and are fluent in verbal and written English 


Your Responsibilities



  • You will be the organizational engine of your team, responsible for managing product releases and executing the end-to-end integration plan

  • Your main focus will be on non-core-engineering tasks to enable successful end-to-end delivery and operation.  You will be expected to manage your team’s external project dependencies, external deliverables and roadmaps

  • You will refine requirements from Business KPIs, features and user stories

  • Your special focus will be on ensuring all end-to-end delivery tasks are completed for a successful product release

  • You will be part of an engineering team and you will play  key role in facilitating the team to take them forward. On a day-to-day basis, you will work very closely with the team and will facilitate taking decisions as a unit


What you can expect from us



  • Autonomy and trust to deliver using agile techniques in an entrepreneurial environment

  • A career development path developed jointly with you with potential for developing breadth and depth in skill set

  • A unique corporate culture where results are what matters, all within a relaxed office environment

  • A highly motivated international team of colleagues who will both inspire and support you


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Manjuri Sinha at jobs@zalando.de

item.title: Software Engineer -Voice Guidance,Text-to-Speech(TTS) at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)

HERE Berlin is an innovative branch where an international team of 50+ nationalities create Location Based Services at the highest level.

The Navigation team offers a unique chance of developing voice guidance features for cutting edge turn-by-turn navigation products used on automotive, smartphones, mobile devices and web services.


You will be responsible for creating high quality voice directions for navigation systems used in over 40 different countries/languages.


 The responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
 


  • Design, development and maintenance of voice directions software for turn-by-turn navigation products

  • Being accountable for the quality assessment of the software both functionally and non-functionally.

  • Documentation of developed code, tools and test environments

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Whistle (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Join our pack! The role:


We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to build out new applications and features for our web apps, mobile apps and our device. You’ll play an important role in building out applications that support our mobile apps, partner integrations, customer- and internal-facing web experiences, and scaling our platform as our number of customers grows.


As our team grows there’s lots of opportunity to grow into team or technical leadership, so consider growing with us!


You will:



  • Architect, plan and develop beautiful, functional web experiences for customers, partners and internal users using React and Ruby on Rails

  • Scale our platform to accommodate the growing number of Whistle customers

item.title: Senior Software Developer at Criteo (Paris, France)
item.description:
Senior Software Developer


CRITEO is looking to recruit senior software developers who turn it up to eleven for its headquarters in Paris, France.


Your mission:


Build systems that make the best decision in 50ms, half a million times per second. Across three continents and six datacenters, 24/7.


Find the signal hidden in tens of TB of data, in one hour, using over a thousand nodes on our Hadoop cluster. And constantly keep getting better at it while measuring the impact on our business.


Get stuff done. A problem partially solved today is better than a perfect solution next year. Have an idea during the night ? Code it in the morning, push it at noon, test it in the afternoon and deploy it the next morning.


High stakes, high rewards: 1% increase in performance may yield millions for the company. But if a single bug goes through, the Internet goes down (we’re only half joking).


Develop open source projects. Because we are working at the forefront of technology, we are dealing with problems that few have faced. We’re big users of open source, and we’d like to give back to the community.

item.title: Salesforce Developer (m/f) at Delivery Hero (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About the Job:


Delivery Hero is building the next generation global online food ordering platform. Our awesome international team already operates in 34 countries worldwide. We feature an environment with feedback exchange throughout the company from people who are genuine, ambitious and fun. We are looking for passionate and smart people to join us on our mission. Our ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, innovative, and good at “getting things done“. So, would you like to play an active role in our future? If so, then there is an exciting job and a workplace in the heart of Berlin waiting for you!



Your Mission:



  • Design, configure and administration of SFDC including but not limited to, Apex, VisualForce Pages, Triggers, JavaScript, Workflows, Approval Processes, Apex, assignment/escalation rules

  • Design, develop Salesforce components using apex code, visual force pages, SFDC APIs

  • Work cross-functionally with other engineering teams, such as product development and Interface development

  • Author technical design documentation that fully defines all application code and the underlying methodology for the design decisions made

  • Contribute in conducting code reviews to ensure that code quality is at the highest level possible

  • Troubleshoot issues, Identify complex problems and analyze potential solutions including workarounds as well as provide timely fixes


We offer you:



  • Startup atmosphere: Kicker, Video games and parties

  • Safety of a large company: pension scheme and stability

  • Nice work environment and English as working language

  • Spare time to spend on research and training

  • Flexible and agile company with flat hierarchy

  • For applicants from abroad: relocation package and german lessons

  • Please apply with your complete documents in English or German language.

item.title: E-commerce Software Engineer at Canada's Largest Retailer! at Loblaw Digital (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating e-commerce businesses for Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. We create leading mobile-responsive e-commerce experiences including Loblaws Click & Collect, an innovative online grocery shopping experience. We also built and now operate the award-winning site JoeFresh.com in Canada and the US, as well as the Joe Fresh iPad and iPhone apps, and we are proud to announce the launch of beautyBOUTIQUE.ca, our newest site that allows all Canadians to #bringBEAUTYhome with the click of a button.

We are based in downtown Toronto and operate like a start-up with extensive resources. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, collaborate, and fun team working to transform the way Canadians shop.

To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to solve challenging problems and make significant and lasting impact on Canadians.


We are an agile shop, constantly tinkering with our process to make all our lives better. That process includes JIRA Agile for end-to-end agile project management and defects, Bamboo for CI, Git (Stash) for source control, Selenium for automated testing, JRebel and 15" Retina MacBookPro's for all our developers.


Responsibilities:



  • Java Development on the hybris eCommerce platform

  • Responsive front-end development using Javascript, CSS, HTML in a Spring framework

  • Translate wireframes, creative design, and functional requirements into functional xHTML/ CSS / Javascript

  • Develop JavaScript using standard frameworks

  • Conduct and participate in design sessions and review design documents

  • Conduct code and architecture reviews

  • Lead and participate in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning

  • Profile eCommerce application to identify performance bottlenecks.

  • Debug and refactor code as needed to improve those performance bottlenecks.

  • Some system administration of Linux, Apache, Tomcat and Oracle environments.

  • Work with various Loblaw IT teams to design and architect integration into Loblaw IT systems.

  • Work together with external design and development agencies.


Skills & Requirements



  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar

  • 3+ years of experience in software engineering

  • 2+ years experience in object oriented design and development in Java

  • 1+ years experience developing with the Spring Framework

  • Advanced skills using J2EE Frameworks and Libraries specifically such as Hibernate, JPA and JDO

  • Database development skills including SQL programming, solid understanding of relational database technologies, logical and physical data modeling, preferably on an Oracle database

  • Backend and Frontend/Web development experience with JSP, JavaScript, JSON, jQuery, HTML, CSS

  • Experience with web app servers, such as JBoss, Websphere, and Weblogic

  • Experience using standard development tools, such as Eclipse, Ant, Git

  • Experience developing SOAP and/or REST based web services

  • Strong understanding of XML and JSON and how to manipulate using document based and stream based API’s

  • Experience working with an Agile methodology, frequent releases, automated testing, builds, deployment

item.title: Security Engineer at Braintree (Chicago, IL) (allows remote)
item.description:
About Us:


At Braintree, we’re building products that make payments easier—so easy that they fade into the background, making entirely new kinds of interactions possible. Our full-stack payment platform lets companies build their own experiences and then scale their businesses around the globe. We have developer friendly APIs built to integrate with various platforms - Ruby, Python, Java, PHP, Node.js and .NET - and we also have SDKs for iOS, Android, and Windows.


Our technology fuels companies like Github, 37Signals, Uber, Airbnb, OpenTable. Heroku and more.


We're also in a unique position to greatly impact how merchants and customers interact. The product teams at Braintree work together with Venmo, the mobile payments company we acquired in 2012. Our joint offering, Venmo Touch, gives our users one touch purchasing within apps, eliminating the need to retype your credit card number inside each app you download. Recently acquired by PayPal, we're now in an even greater position to change the way people pay.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at ROBLOX (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
DevOps Engineer


About the Job


Become a critical member of an elite technical team advancing the infrastructure of ROBLOX, the largest platform in the world for emerging and independent game developers. We aren’t just building a publisher tool, but rather a technology platform providing developers with the tools they need to create their own world class games, bringing User Generated Content to the gaming space. With our user base consistently growing, we remain the #1 ranked kids entertainment site in the U.S. by ComScore. Each month we have more than 5 million active users and over 80 million total hours of engagement with peak concurrent users approaching over 200K.


You, being a talented engineer with the ability to take a big problem and break it down into smaller pieces to find the best possible solution, will work closely and collaboratively with our 5-person Ops Team on our internal development tools and automation pipelines. You will build out and significantly automate several parts of our continuous integration and test automation systems, design and build tools used internally by the engineering team, and help implement best in class configuration management and provisioning systems. You are a jack of all trades who loves having an impact on your team and product by:



  • Maintaining a 99.9% SLA for a 24/7/365 production environment

  • Developing automation to automatically detect and recover production issues in all layers from hardware, configuration, networking, and vendor outages, and continuous software upgrades

  • Quickly resolving complex problems encountered during the installation and operation of our applications, to ensure negligible impact on players and internal operations

  • Prioritizing and multitasking daily responsibilities, while being flexible enough to respond to emergent high-priority issues

  • Designing, deploying and configuring extremely complex computing environments characteristic of large-scale gaming systems

  • Leading in the execution of disaster recovery procedures and system failover efforts

  • Collaborating with highly skilled and driven colleagues in a dynamic, agile environment

  • Managing systems and developing contingency plans

  • Participating in on-call rotations


Our infrastructure management system is highly automated, enabling engineers to interact with thousands of servers across multiple environments in parallel via the command line. Our application space includes database scalability, caching, message queuing, wide-table search, recommendations, user ratings, services for mobile devices, gaming cloud management, and virtualization. We live in both the cloud and traditional data center environments.


Perks & Benefits: 



  • Robust medical, dental and vision insurance

  • 401k

  • Flexible time-off

  • Wellness reimbursement

  • Free onsite parking & other commuter benefits

  • Free catered lunches & a fully stocked kitchen with unlimited snacks!

  • Chance to work with a top-notch team on cool and unique projects!

item.title: Development Lead, Loblaw Digital at Loblaw Digital (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Loblaw Digital is the team behind building and operating the digital businesses for Canada's largest and most successful retailer. We create leading mobile-responsive e-commerce experiences, including Loblaws Click & Collect (shop.loblaws.ca), an innovative online grocery shopping experience. We also built and operate the award-winning JoeFresh.com (Canada and US), along with the iPad/iPhone app.

Based in downtown Toronto, we operate like a startup with the resources of a much larger company. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, collaborative, and fun team working to transform the way Canadians shop.

To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to solve challenging problems and make a significant and lasting impact on Canadians.
Role Mandate:

Working from our downtown office, you will report to the Director, Software Development and will assist in building, improving, and maintaining a world-class, multi-channel eCommerce platform. This is a hands-on technical role, leading and mentoring a team of both senior and junior developers within the eCommerce Team. You will also lead by example, developing software across the full-stack of a multi-channel platform from HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to server-side Java.

Responsibilities:

• Manage the day-to-day activities of the Development Team
• Ensure long-term direction of the project from a technical perspective
• Motivate, coach, and train team members in a manner that will exceed business’ expectations

• Lead the effort to create and refine a modern, efficient front-end using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML using the Spring framework
• Translate wireframes, creative design, and functional requirements into final products

• Construct design documents and documentation to aid in maintenance and code reuse

item.title: Lead iOS developer at Hushmail $100K - $150K at Hushmail (Vancouver, BC, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
We're looking for an expert-level iOS developer to lead the ongoing development of Hushmail for iOS.


This is a permanent, full-time, senior-level position for an experienced iOS developer at our office in Vancouver, BC. You'll play a lead role working on iOS apps for the popular secure email service, Hushmail. This is your opportunity to be responsible for an app that will become an essential tool for a large number of our customers and play a important part in the future direction of our company. Hushmail is a small company, but well-established and profitable.


This role is potentially a great fit for someone who is the top performer on their team at a larger organization and is interested in working for a smaller company where their work can have more impact without giving up stability. Or someone who is tired of churning out simple marketing apps and wants to sink their teeth into a complex app with a rich feature set and the potential to greatly enhance that feature set.

item.title: Senior Security Researcher at Kaspersky Lab (Woburn, MA) (allows remote)
item.description:
The senior security researcher reports to the head of the Global Research and Analysis Team (GReAT) in the United States. The position will encompass a wide range of activities, including technical anti-malware research, tracking APT campaigns, discovery of new threats, government relations and media activities.


Job Location could be considered. Working from home is an option.


Responsibilities



  • Active technical research on IT security issues and malware threats.

  • Participate in GReAT research activities by assisting with malware sample collection, collaboration with external entities and providing
    guidance and ideas on forensics.

  • Participate in the discovery and investigations into new and ongoing advanced threat actors (global APT research).

  • Create and deliver presentations at internal and external security events.

  • Actively participate in press tours and Security Analyst Summit
    planning.

  • Develop and maintain relationships with top journalists and actively
    participate in social media as part of the company’s expert positioning
    activities.

  • Serve as a company expert on security topics for media, as required by PR teams globally.

  • Participate in government relations activities.

  • Participate in meetings and presentations to government officials to disclose current research and emerging threats.

  • Help support and pre-sales teams with intelligence on malware threat landscape. Assist local sales/marketing/support teams with
    presentations at partner conferences and local events.

  • Engage in operations with respected national and international law enforcement to aggressive fight against cybercrime. Provide
    intelligence for expert positioning and to Anti Malware Research operations.

  • Assist with promotion and correlation of malware threat research with technologies. Assist with reviewing white-papers and videos to
    promote company technology.

  • Content creation; analyse and describe malicious threats and create blog posts for SecureList.com and Threatpost.com. Make short and
    long term predictions on the evolution of threats.

  • Proposes ideas aimed at improving performance of GReAT and assumes responsibility for achieving group goals.

  • Prototype development; imagine and develop prototypes or new technologies.

  • Assist with testing newly released products and technologies from Kaspersky and competitors.

  • Additional activities could be assigned.


The Team


Established in 2008, the Global Research & Analysis Team (GReAT) is an integral part of Kaspersky Lab’s R&D department, and leads the company’s anti-malware research and innovation. The team’s security analysts are based around the world, each contributing a unique set of skills and expertise to the research and design of solutions to combat increasingly complex malware code. Today, GReAT comprises 40 experts working in Europe, Russia, the Americas, Asia, and the Middle East. Costin G. Raiu has led the team since 2010.


GReAT undertakes incident response for the company’s customers during malware-related incidents. Other key departmental responsibilities include thought leadership in threat intelligence, driving and executing initiatives focused on improving malware detection accuracy rates and efficiency, and supporting key customer accounts with malware intelligence expertise.

item.title: Senior Software Development Manager at SonoSim, Inc (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
Job Description – Senior Software Development Manager


SonoSim, Inc., a start-up company, is seeking a Senior Software Development Manager to lead the technical team in scaling our product suite, company, and team. This candidate should be a self-motivated individual with strong leadership skills seeking to work in a high energy, team-oriented and friendly environment. This position reports directly to the CEO.


Job Description



  • Provide technical project management and leadership in the overall production of a high-quality ultrasound training client-server application using Agile/Scrum methodologies. This software-based product incorporates some hardware elements.

  • Manage a collaborative team of software engineers, QA analysts, and system administrators to deliver a high-quality ultrasound training simulation product.

  • Responsible for the technical production schedule and the implementation of evolving business requirements and feature sets into working product.

  • Produce iterative releases every 2 weeks as part of our Scrum methodology.

  • Liaison between Executive Management and Development Team.

  • Grow and scale technical team as company expands.

  • Collaborate with Director of Operations on Product Fulfillment, including management of Release Versioning Software, Activation Files, Software Updates and Upgrades, Server Management and Data Transfer.

  • Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation.

  • Oversee continual improvement of the code base through targeted refactoring, working unit tests, and any necessary design documentation.

  • Employ Quality Assurance best practices and standards defining, collecting, and interpreting metrics and diagrams.

  • Participate in regular status reviews with all stakeholders

item.title: Node / Javascript Engineer at Weight Watchers (New York, NY)
item.description:
Uniquely positioned to lead the way in the exciting HealthTech industry, Weight Watchers uses modern Lean and Agile practices as well as best of breed Engineering practices to deliver leading consumer focused products. Weight Watchers places a major emphasis on mobile and digital solutions to help our members reach their goals. This includes integrating with technologies such as Fitbit & iOS Health, as well as building custom, intuitive products to serve our millions of members.

As we rebuild many of our core experiences, we are seeking talented people who are excited to join our team. This is a rare opportunity to join a company embracing a modern Technology culture, where you will have the ability to improve peoples lives in a very meaningful way and have a major impact on Weight Watchers offerings to our members. As reliance on health and wellness awareness increases, you can be be part of the team that is leading the way.

To help us achieve our goals, we are seeking Node Software Engineers to join our team. You will leverage your knowledge to develop new consumer focused products using modern Engineering such as Continuous Integration and Deployment. As a developer at Weight Watcher, your code, designs and decisions will be highly visible, and will directly impact and delight lots of users.

item.title: SharePoint Developer at MetroStar Systems (Reston, VA)
item.description:
MetroStar Systems (MetroStar) is an award-winning Information Technology solutions provider. We are seeking a result oriented SharePoint Developer to join the MetroStar team at a customer site in downtown Washington, DC.  A security clearance is not required, but the candidate must be able to obtain a Public Trust for receiving a government badge and authorization to work on premises.


The individual needs to know SharePoint front-end admin configuration, front-end custom development using SharePoint Designer, and back-end custom development using Visual Studio.  ASP.NET and SharePoint object model experience is needed.


Responsibilities include but not limited to:



  • Build, configure and integrate 2007/2010 SharePoint websites

  • Develop and administer web parts, timer jobs, workflows and InfoPath forms

  • Implement style sheets, templates and workflows for content types

  • Optimize pages for peak performance

  • Prepare and migrate content

  • Create custom SharePoint style sheets and web parts

  • Create and modify web pages within SharePoint applications

  • Design and develop user interface elements in SharePoint

  • Perform master page deployments

  • Design and develop websites using SharePoint Designer 2010

  • Write, test and deploy code using ASP.net, C#, JavaScript, HTML, CSS and XSLT

  • Manage software artifacts using Team Foundation Server

  • Design and develop InfoPath Forms

  • Manage and administer InfoPath 2007/2010 and 2010 InfoPath Services

  • Display data, charts and dashboards using SharePoint 2010 Excel Services / Business Intelligence

  • Analyze and troubleshoot problems within intranet environment

  • Administer the intranet search engine (i.e.,configuring, monitoring and reporting);

  • Monitor broken links

  • Establish and publish performance metric reports;

  • Conduct testing to support intranet enhancements including all code changes

  • configuration changes and system upgrades

  • Work with business systems development staff to integrate applications

  • Communicate with Microsoft technical support and customer infrastructure staff to resolve

  • issues related to intranet

  • Conduct Section 508 testing, remediation and documentation

  • Provide Tier 2 end user support for intranet (i.e.,system enhancements and upgrades)


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:



  • Two years of experience in SharePoint front-end administration (for example, administering lists, views, web parts, etc. with Full Control)

  • Two years of experience developing web front-end with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and XLST - including working within SharePoint Designer

  • Sine experience with application development experience using the Microsoft .NET Framework with C# ASP.NET and SQL Server


Educational/Training Requirement: Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Computer Science (or at least six years of software engineering experience


Security Clearance: Ability to obtain and maintain a government clearance


Physical Requirements / Work Environment: Works in a normal office environment with controlled temperature and lighting conditions

Travel: Some travel may be required


Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA): Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job duties of the position.


The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of MetroStar Systems.

MetroStar Systems is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Equal Opportunity Employment/ Affirmative Action provider including Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled.
