MetroStar Systems is an award-winning Information Technology solutions provider. We are seeking a result oriented .NET / SharePoint developer to join the MetroStar team at a customer site in downtown Washington, DC. This position is 80% .NET and 20% SharePoint.


The .NET / SharePoint developer is responsible for supporting and developing mission critical web applications and SharePoint sites.


Security Clearance: Must have an Active Secret Clearance


Responsibilities include but not limited to:



  • Provide Tier 2 end user support for intranet (i.e., system enhancements and upgrades)

  • Design and develop InfoPath 2010/2013 Forms

  • Design and Develop Web Applications using .NET, C#, JavaScript, HTML, CSS and XSLT

  • Software development experience including: OOP, Visual Studio, Windows Communication Foundation, RESTful service implementation, Service Oriented Architecture, and SQL Server

  • Communicate with Microsoft technical support and customer infrastructure staff to resolve issues related to intranet

  • Work with business systems development staff to integrate applications

  • Conduct testing to support intranet enhancements including all code changes, configuration changes and system upgrades

  • Establish and publish performance metric reports on a regular basis

  • Display data, charts and dashboards using SharePoint 2010/2013 Excel Services / Business Intelligence

  • Customize SharePoint Sites using SharePoint Designer 2010 and 2013

  • Design and develop InfoPath 2010/2013 Forms

  • Manage software artifacts using Team Foundation Server

  • Customize SharePoint Sites using SharePoint Designer 2010 and 2013

  • Perform master page deployments

  • Optimize pages for peak performance

  • Implement style sheets, templates and workflows for content types

  • Design and develop user interface elements in SharePoint

  • Develop and administer SharePoint web parts, application pages, timer jobs, workflows and InfoPath forms

  • Build, configure and integrate 2010/2013 SharePoint websites

  • Architect and Implement web services, business objects, and other middle-tier framework using the .NET framework


Qualifications


Educational/Training Requirement:



  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering (or at least six years of software engineering experience


Experience:



  • ASP.NET and SharePoint object model experience required

  • Must have experience designing and developing.NET web applications that interact with enterprise databases and web services

  • Need to know SharePoint front-end admin configuration, front-end custom development using SharePoint Designer, and back-end custom development using Visual Studio

  • 7 years' experience developing web applications

  • 7 years' experience developing using the .NET framework

  • Experience developing using OOP methodology

  • Experience developing in Agile environments

  • Experience designing WCF and ASP.net Web Services

  • Management and coordination experience with large systems rollout

  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills, particularly with a customer focus


 Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:



  • Strong knowledge of .NET Framework, C#, AJAX, JS, jQuery, HTML, CSS, ADO.NET, LINQ, Visual Studio 2010/2012

  • At least one year of experience in SharePoint front-end administration (for example, administering lists, views, web parts, etc. with Full Control)


Physical Requirements / Work Environment:



  • Works in a normal office environment with controlled temperature and lighting conditions


Travel:



  • Some travel may be required


Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA): Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job duties of the position.

item.title: Principal Software Engineer, Realtime Bidding at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Principal Software Engineer to help define our next-generation, real-time bidding platform. With over 250,000+ decisions per second, we are building out infrastructure enhancements to focus on availability, performance and availability.

Candidates must have solid experience working on large-scale, distributed systems. This will be an opportunity to take a lead on several core projects with considerations on key architectural and design decisions.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead software development projects enhancing our distributed real-time bidding system, the core of TubeMogul’s technology platform

  • Collaborate on key architectural decisions and design considerations

  • Monitor and plan out core infrastructure enhancements (a.k.a. stay ahead of possible scalability bottlenecks)

  • Troubleshoot and resolve system problems and customer issues under very tight service level agreement.

  • Work with machine learning team to implement optimizations to increase campaign effectiveness

  • Mentor junior developers (i.e. demonstrate good coding practices and helping them architect code smartly)

  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team

item.title: Android Developer - Sling TV at Sling TV (American Fork, UT)
item.description:
Summary:


Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet. We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. This is an exciting position in a fast moving project that requires the ability of candidates to hit the ground running. What we’re building is revolutionary and every employee participates in a profit sharing program. Come be a part of changing the face of TV!


Sling TV delivers content from Disney/ESPN, HBO, AMC, Turner, Scripps, EPIX, Univision and Maker Studios, and is available on Amazon Fire TV, Amazon Fire TV Stick, current-generation Roku players, Roku TV models, Xbox One, Android, iOS, Macs, PCs.


#TakeBackTV


Responsibilities:


Working as part of a team to deliver a great television experience on a myriad of devices ranging from televisions and set top boxes to mobile devices. Primary responsibility is to improve our Android application, while also identifying techniques to simplify complexity and redundancy across the application. The ideal candidate has a history of developing elegant and intuitive user experiences on a variety of platforms, and knows what separates mediocre user experience from great ones.

item.title: Software engineer (work with Node.js on a realtime relational database) at Airtable - democratizing the database (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
From a software engineering standpoint, Airtable is a uniquely challenging product — it has a purpose-built relational database engine supporting realtime synchronization between different users, collaborative undo and formula calculations, and visual revision history. On the outside, it has a polished, desktop-grade web interface and beautifully tap-friendly mobile apps.


We're looking for engineers who understand the difference between solving hard computer science problems and writing highly maintainable code in a team setting, and can cheerily excel at both.



Unlike single-purpose apps, we think of Airtable as a horizontal toolkit composed of intuitive building blocks that people can repurpose to create their own applications. Our product roadmap is filled with interesting enhancements and additions to this toolkit that greatly expand the boundaries of Airtable's capabilities.


Our company is built upon a philosophical commitment to providing the best possible experience for the end user, even if it requires going to great lengths in engineering and design effort. We plan on building this company for decades to come, and while we love rapid iteration where it makes sense, we also take the time to make farsighted architectural decisions and place great emphasis on code quality over raw speed.


We believe in the power of highly motivated and capable individuals to accomplish great things in small teams, with end-to-end ownership of projects and rapid iteration. If you'd like to join us, we'd love to hear from you.

item.title: Lead UI Developer at RPX Corporation (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
RPX is seeking a dynamic individual to contribute to the success of the Data and Technology Solutions department. In this role, the Lead UI Developer will help design, deliver, and support technology infrastructure to meet the growth needs of RPX. In this role, this individual will be a trusted technology expert in the web applications team responsible for conceptualizing and designing technology solutions to meet business needs. The Lead UI Developer will provide technical thought-leadership in collaboration with the product management team, engineers, and their respective managers to deliver innovative and automated solutions in an agile, dynamic environment. This individual reports to the Director, Engineering & Enterprise Architecture.


Role



  • Influence web application architecture across development teams and establish standards and best practices

  • Interact closely with Product/Engineering management on the road map and technology concepts

  • Collaborate with global development teams in bringing the concepts to market rapidly

  • Build rapid prototypes and demo application features

  • Keep a pulse on the trends in the industry and identify technical innovations

  • Participate in cross company technical initiatives

item.title: Product HW/SW Support Engineer at The Intellisis Corporation (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Our Product Team is responsible for delivering ASIC and board products to our customers. The support of the products as well as basic design data will be key to our success and our customers success. Each member of the team is armed with the field experience to deliver real world, real-time solutions.

We’re looking for product developers with customer-facing experience who want more direct customer interaction and experience. It’s important to be a careful listener, with the ability to demonstrate knowledge and professionalism throughout customer engagements. Successful candidates will have an Electrical Engineering degree and a minimum of 5 years relevant experience. This position reports to the Sr. Director of Professional Services.
 
We offer a focused, driven culture and an exciting working environment. If you are excited about helping Intellisis lead the Machine Learning revolution, we would like to talk to you. Salary is commensurate with experience and the company offers health insurance and an employee-funded 401(k).

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, iOS Team at TripAdvisor (Boston, MA)
item.description:
TripAdvisor, the world’s largest travel site, is looking for a talented senior software engineer in the native iOS team.


In this role, you'll be a driving force in the iOS team. You will take the lead on key technical features, help others in the team with the harder problems, work closely with product on specs, and interface with the API and Android teams to take the app to the next level. We iterate and deploy code fast, and everyone is looking at the impact that the team makes to our numbers.


We're rocketing up the hockey stick, playing with the coolest toys, and working on interesting problems that engage both the technical and aesthetic sides of the brain. We move quickly - projects are short (generally 3-7 days), and we have a new native release every month. The features you create will be used by millions of people every day. Trip is well known for having an extremely strong engineering organization - you'll be working with the best and getting stuff done, in the fastest growing area of an incredibly profitable, growing, fun company. Download our iOS app and give it a spin!


The Facts:



  • Our apps are used worldwide and have been download over 110 million times

  • TripAdvisor has over 108 million average monthly mobile unique visitors, which is doubling year-over-year

  • We have over 5 million unique users / engineer, among the highest in the industry

  • As mobile devices are replacing desktops and laptops as the standard for browsing the web, we have a unique opportunity as well as the market position to capitalize on enormous monetization potential

item.title: Java Developer - Publishing/Newsroom at Financial Times (London, UK)
item.description:
Projects you might work on



  • A greenfield development role, working on a team building a new content platform using APIs for content delivery and harnessing triple store capabilities for semantic enrichment in order to offer more flexible ways to ingest FT content that will lay the foundation for building the next generation of FT.com. We actively use BDD, continuous delivery and DevOps within the team as a recipe for success and accelerated agile delivery.



  • A position within our Editorial Technology programme. This exciting new programme means working directly with our Editorial team to support the newsroom's continued digital evolution through the creation and adoption of new tools and improvements to existing tools.  Work will initially include exploring the world of data in the newsroom, and using our Content API to feed into our CMS.


Responsibilities


This role will work within the development team, developing and unit testing solutions to meet business requirements in a timely manner. Development at the FT is done within larger programmes of work using individual agile streams and within that framework this role will be required to implement fully robust software solutions, working closely with the QA team members to develop a repeatable, end-to-end testing process.

item.title: Systems Engineer, AWS Network Monitoring at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Amazon is looking for Systems and Software Engineers to build and scale the software that monitors one of the world’s largest and most complex networks. Tens of millions of customers rely on Amazon’s network for using our retail websites, accessing content on their Kindles and building applications and businesses on top of Amazon Web Services (AWS). Our goal is to become The Infrastructure Platform for the world - achieving this goal requires high-leverage, massively scalable software systems. Our success depends on our world-class network infrastructure, and our network depends on our Network Monitoring Scaling team.



- You are interested in being part of a high-bar team with global responsibility for the Network Monitoring software used across all of Amazon’s businesses.

- Solving problems at scale excites you.

- You do not implement specs from analysts and architects - you talk to your customers and design solutions to their problems. You automate and innovate.

- You do not push just one technology agenda - you choose the best tool for the problem at hand.

- You believe that the craft of software engineering is about writing code right the first time. For you, code reviews and automated testing are not chores - they are a core part of writing great software.

- You do not throw your code over the wall. You launch it, own it, support it and make it incrementally better for the benefit of your customers.

- You enjoy working in a flexible, fast-paced, collaborative team environment.

- Very strong problem solving and coding skills.

- Bash experience plus knowledge of at least one scripting language (Python, Perl, Ruby)

- Strong track record of working in areas of significant complexity and 'getting things done'

- Record of mentoring other engineers to maintain architectural vision and software quality.

- Understanding of data structures, algorithms and their performance.

- Proficient at designing software systems - from high-availability large-scale distributed systems to bespoke scripted solutions.

- Advanced UNIX (preferably Linux) systems engineering skills.

- A strong understanding of core internet technologies (e.g. TCP/IP).

- Understanding of the building blocks of computer systems; comfortable working with bits & bytes.



- Computer Science degree, or equivalent experience.

- The desire to work in a fast paced and constantly evolving agile environment

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Android Team at TripAdvisor (Boston, MA)
item.description:
TripAdvisor, the world’s largest travel site, is looking for a talented senior software engineer in the native Android team. In this role, you'll be a driving force in the Android team. You will take the lead on key technical features, help others in the team with the harder problems, work closely with product on specs, and interface with the API and iOS teams to take the app to the next level. Download our Android app and give it a spin!

* TripAdvisor has well over 100 million average monthly mobile unique visitors, which is doubling year-over-year

item.title: Backend Software Engineer at Football Radar (London, UK)
item.description: At Football Radar, we analyse and predict football matches. As a backend engineer you’ll have the chance to help build and maintain all the software that makes that possible – everything from modern web applications to statistical models, real time data platforms to cloud infrastructure. Our backend engineers are involved in everything the company does and deal with all kinds of different challenges. A lot of our code is in Scala, which we are using increasingly, but we still have lots of PHP code, and a few odds and ends in other languages. You don’t need to know Scala for this role, however: we’ll help you learn it if you don’t know it, and many of our engineers had no real Scala experience before they started. We are just looking for great programmers who are passionate about their work. If you like a challenge, and want to work with really smart people, we would like to hear from you.

item.title: Software Engineer at Yext (New York, NY)
item.description:
We believe the most successful engineering orgs move quick and communicate efficiently.  To facilitate this, we keep our teams small at at 3-7 members, use Scrum methodology, and run two week sprints with daily stands up.  The first Monday of the sprint is planning, and the second Friday is demo day where teams show off what they've accomplished the past two weeks.


Our mission is to be a global software company that is constantly pushing the envelope.  Whether it's scaling our systems to handle another 100k locations, doing R&D on new products and features, or minimizing the time it takes information to go from our CMS to our publisher partners, our engineers work on challenging problems that make an impact.  The best way to learn is hands on, so we're going to have you pushing code from week one.  


Responsibilities



  • Participate in full life-cycle software development

  • Design, implement, and deploy highly scalable and reliable systems

  • Build storage systems, libraries, and frameworks.

  • Contribute ideas for new features and identify areas for improvement proactively

  • Collaborate effectively across teams, including outside of engineering

  • Write clean, tested, and well-documented code

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at OpenGov (Redwood City, CA)
item.description:
OpenGov is a fast-growth SaaS software focused on transforming the way the world analyzes, shares, compares, and allocates public money. We've raised over $26M in funding, have 60+ employees and are based in a modern office in Redwood City. We value excellence, resourcefulness and trust each other to do our best work of our careers.


Are you interested in building the applications team at OpenGov? We're looking for an outstanding hands-on engineering leader who is passionate about designing and delivering an incredible user experience that will revolutionize the way governments share their financial information.


You are a strong technical leader (especially with front-end technologies like JavaScript) and enjoy recruiting, mentoring and coaching. You are just as comfortable working with product and design as you are diving into code to build our world-class application.

item.title: Principal Architect / Engineer - Full Stack at New Context Services (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
• Responsible for overall application architecture that serves thousands of API requests per second in a highly secure infrastructure project

  • Contribute on a daily basis to code base

  • Collaborate with existing team of engineers on development efforts / direction

  • Create and execute forward looking technology roadmap

  • Collaborate with security and engineering teams to deliver world class software through an open source security platform

item.title: Hiring Devs Who Get Things Done & Love Continuous Deployment at TSheets (Eagle, ID)
item.description:
On the surface, we build time tracking software that our customers’ employees love. Beneath the surface, you will find the development team tackling mobile technologies, web technologies, location-based services, multi-homed data centers, distributed caching strategies and generally working on providing exceptional products and user experiences every day.


If deploying code daily to hundreds of thousands of users sounds interesting, exciting, and challenging, you might be a great fit!


In addition to technology challenges, we are a tight-knit team that supports each other in every way we can. Joining our team means making meaningful contributions and quickly seeing those contributions come to fruition.


What You Will Do



  • Help define and build new features in a clean and modular way

  • Write code used by hundreds of thousands of users every day

  • Assist in the design and implementation of our REST API

  • Debug and resolve application issues reported by our users

  • Receive and provide implementation feedback in the form of peer code reviews

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Rewards Network (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
This role will be part of a team that makes the Rewards Network production application stack as well as configuration manager a priority. In coordination with your team, you will be supporting Web Sites, back-end processes, integrations to partner systems as well as provide the business with on-demand ad-hoc data requests and analysis.



  • You will triage, communicate status, and drive resolution for issues with the iDine.com website, our partner websites, APIs, as well as the tools and backend systems that support our entire Dining Rewards Program

  • You will help automate both deployments and configuration management using tools like Chef and Team City

  • You will carry out root cause analysis of incidents and provide developers with the necessary analysis to fix production defects

  • Supporting the business and the Agile Development teams, you will assist with their functional understanding of the production system as it works

  • Working regularly with the Development Team, you will learn how to debug existing software and help offload developer support responsibilities

  • You will participate in an on-call rotation

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Grammarly (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Summary


Grammarly is a bootstrapped, profitable company with millions of registered users. Grammarly’s automated proofreader helps the world’s 2 billion English speakers improve the quality of their writing.


We are looking for a hands-on DevOps Engineer who will be responsible for writing code and building systems to improve the performance and operational efficiency of our distributed NLP and growth systems. As a DevOps Engineer with Grammarly, you will establish and support operational needs for Grammarly’s SF office, function on-call with an operations team, and provide operational tooling and support for feature delivery teams.


What You Will Accomplish



  • Review and design the architecture of new projects with development teams

  • Improve services and tools that are in production

  • Develop our automation and deployment strategies

  • Scale our data storage systems

  • Analyze and address performance and stability risks

  • Develop various components of our service platform (e.g., network servers, queue brokers, storage systems, etc.)

  • Fine-tune and automate deployments

item.title: Lead Designer at comScore (Amsterdam Zuid-Oost, Netherlands)
item.description:
We’re looking for an open-minded UI / UX designer, capable of taking end-user insights and business objectives and creating UIs that solve problems, drive engagement and help the end-user to effectively use our products.


You’ll be working on creating designs, UI prototypes and user interaction models for new features and improving UI / UX on our Digital Analytix product. Close collaboration with the front-end (UI) engineering team, Product Management, the central UX team and QA engineers will also be an essential part of your work.


There are a number of upcoming projects that you would also be working on, which will give you a great opportunity to try out new design and UX strategies and technologies that will help you stay at the top of your game.

item.title: Senior Back End Engineer at White House Custom Colour (Eagan, MN)
item.description:
You are passionate about solving problems. You think big picture and excel at making all the pieces fit together; from server infrastructure to adding new endpoints to a RESTful API. You strive to make an impact in a team setting and aren't afraid to express your opinions and ideas. 


What You Will Do


This is a back end engineer position responsible for developing and maintaining server-side components and infrastructure that supports web and mobile apps. You will be responsible for architecting, developing, and shipping code for new and existing products. You will be working with a group of like-minded people who share your passion for technology.


Responsibilities



  • Own and manage server-side development for web and mobile projects including new features, product updates, and new product ideation/prototyping

  • Architect and develop APIs for both internal and external use

  • Work with established APIs to integrate into projects

  • Work closely with other engineers and management

item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer at IT Glue (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
Overview:


We are seeking a full-time Ruby on Rails developer to join our growing team as we work on an exciting new product that is absolutely blowing up. We are a local software-as-a-service (SaaS) business founded in 2013 providing documentation software for IT service providers worldwide.


We are well-funded and are currently in what can only be categorized as hyper-growth. We need your help to rapidly implement new features and help us scale the platform as we extend our global reach.


You Will Love:



  • Challenging and diverse projects built on the latest open source technologies

  • The opportunity to get in early while on the precipice of a massively successful product

  • Working with a team of young, highly-driven and like-minded individuals

  • A team that appreciates and demands the craftsmanship of elegant, well-tested code

  • The opportunity to have a direct and meaningful impact on our products and customer base without any bureaucracy or red tape

  • We love collaboration and your input will be more than welcome

  • The ability to learn from, and mentor, other developers hungry for knowledge and better ways of doing things

  • 27" iMacs

  • An office with a full kitchen and gym

  • Extended health and dental benefits

  • Flexible work hours/environment

  • Highly competitive table tennis matches

item.title: Senior Web Developer at Jonas Construction (Markham, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Jonas Construction is seeking a motivated individual who enjoys working within a fast paced, dynamic environment, who isn’t afraid of pressure and can provide expertise and leadership while developing complex web applications (back and front-end). If you are someone who gets excited about new technologies, who is passionate about coding and solving problems and doesn’t see it as a day job, but a hobby. Then we are looking for you!


The Jonas Development team understands the entire Software Development Life Cycle, with solid knowledge of integrated systems. We value the opinion of everyone within the team while choosing new technology, working on architecture or designing an UI. The ideal candidate will be a highly creative and a self-motivated problem solver with the ability to handle numerous projects simultaneously.  In addition, this strong communicator requires a proven ability to articulate ideas.

item.title: Web App Developer: Ruby on Rails at MojoTech (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
We're looking for an experienced software engineer to join our team in Boulder.


REQUIRED EXPERIENCE.



  • Professional programming experience in multiple languages, preferably developing web applications.

  • Some experience with Ruby on Rails and at least one JavaScript framework.

  • Practical knowledge of RDBMS principles.

  • You must be able to show us some code (either your own, or as part of a team), ideally with Rails.


BONUS QUALIFICATIONS.



  • Strong grasp of data-structures, algorithms, and design patterns.

  • Git gurudom.

  • Some experience with Node.js.

  • Ability to evaluate cutting-edge technologies for use in production environments.

  • Having fun with clouds (e.g. AWS).

  • Some experience with native mobile development.

  • Deep familiarity with the web’s many 4-lettered acronyms (e.g. HTTP, JSON, REST, AJAX, CORS).


DESIRED SKILLS & CHARACTER.



  • A passion for programming.

  • Up on recent movements in software development.

  • Curiosity to learn about new technologies and approaches.

  • Resourceful and self-initiating.

  • You can work independently, but you know that great software takes teamwork.

  • Detailed and organized. Ability to meet deadlines and work efficiently.

  • Big ideas over big egos. Show-offs welcome, but no “I” before “team”.

  • You write code for humans first and computers second.

  • You know the difference between software engineering and hacking, and you can do both.

  • You are passionate about code quality.

item.title: Software Engineer, Red Bull TV at Red Bull Media House (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
As a global media company, Red Bull Media House produces, publishes, distributes and licenses high-quality programming. Millions of viewers around the globe experience our TV and video products through Red Bull TV, a global digital video service with a growing portfolio of applications on key platforms including Apple TV, Xbox, Chromecast, iOS, Android, Amazon Fire TV as well as select Smart TV devices.


The engineering group within Red Bull TV is responsible for providing the underlying apis and infrastructure required to deliver the VOD, Live and Digital Linear consumer experiences across all devices and platforms. Engineers will work in conjunction with the product architect to design and implement modern, scalable and maintainable solutions to any technical requirements. They will be heavily involved in growing the team and will be expected to contribute to any significant technical decisions.

item.title: Java Developer at State Street (Boston, MA)
item.description:
State Street is searching for Java Developers to join our technology teams across the enterprise and spanning all levels. We're looking for Full Stack Developers from entry level through architects.  


Successful candidates will have demonstrated work experience in:



  • Understanding the business process and business requirements.

  • Creating technical designs for complex business problems.

  • Building software as part of an Agile team, including analysis, development, testing, and interacting with other teams.

  • Change control and deployment of software in production and to business units.

  • Supporting the functionality delivered in production. 

  • Proactively discovering issues and resolving them before business impact.

item.title: Software Development Engineer at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Amazon makes shopping more convenient for millions of customers and Dash Button and Dash Replenishment Service (DRS) are bringing this to a new level, revolutionizing the future of e-commerce. Reordering favorite consumables is easy with the simple press of Dash Button. With DRS, we will enable connected devices to fully automate replenishment, reordering needed consumables when they start to run low.



Our team is responsible for the backend web services, mobile app experience, and developer facing SDK & experiences that power the Dash Button & DRS. We are looking for talented Software Development Engineers to develop new & innovative experiences. This is an opportunity to work with a broad set of technologies and develop & deploy exciting new experiences to customers on a regular cadence.


  • Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science or related field

  • 3+ years of professional software development experience

  • Strong Computer Science fundamentals in areas such as data structures and algorithms

  • Strong object-oriented design and coding skills in at least one modern programming language such as Java, C++, or C#

  • Experience building scalable systems/applications in a complex, distributed environment

  • Self-directed and capable of working effectively in a dynamic environment

  • Excellent leadership, problem solving and analytical skills

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills




  • Experience playing a lead role in building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers

  • Experience developing software in a UNIX/Linux environment

  • Experience building distributed systems with strict performance requirements

  • Experience with iOS, Android, and/or web development

  • Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

  • Knowledge in many disparate technologies, ranging from front-end user interfaces through back-end systems and all points in between

  • Experience communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior leadership to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy

item.title: Sr. Software Development Engineer - iOS at OfferUp (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
You have a solid career in software development and fell in love with iOS. You have a portfolio of successful apps you’d love to show us. You have a strong understanding of Objective-C, a deep knowledge of Cocoa and Cocoa Touch framework classes, and a hearty appreciation for Agile and iterative development practices. On previous projects you’ve worked with map integration, push notifications, social SDKs, and JSON responses from web APIs. You share our passion for good UX/UI design and have strong experience building compelling touch & gesture interfaces. 


You will be responsible for the creation and implementation of significant portions of the OfferUp iOS app. You will craft clean and well-documented code, hit deadlines, exercise professionalism and maintain an active interest in the overall success of what we're building as a company, beyond just the scope of your projects.

item.title: iOS Engineer at SwiftKick Mobile (Austin, TX)
item.description:
SwiftKick is hiring skilled, creative, and adaptable iOS Developers/Engineers. This is an opportunity for developers with strong Swift/Objective-C experience and attention to detail, to contribute to a variety of challenging and cutting edge apps. You will drive the development of apps that embody SwiftKick's commitment to building pixel-perfect products that people love to use.


Our projects usually range from one to six months. In a year, you could easily work on six different projects. Typically 2-4 people are assigned to each project, each with an opportunity to give input on design and development. We encourage collaboration and creativity. You will interact with our engineers and may architect solutions with our customers and their engineers as well.


As a member of the SwiftKick team you must be inspired by technology and have a passion for creating innovative technical solutions in a fast, energetic environment.

item.title: (Senior) Datenbankentwickler (m/w) MS SQL, MySQL at infoteam Software AG (Bubenreuth, Deutschland)
item.description:
(Senior) Datenbank-Entwickler (m/w)
MS SQL, MySQL


Bei der infoteam Software AG werden Sie Teil eines genialen Teams. Sie arbeiten für inter­nationale Kunden aus den Bereichen Industrie, Life Science und Medizin­technik für unsere Nieder­lassung an unserem Standort in Bubenreuth bei Erlangen.


Ihre Aufgaben:


Als Teil unseres dynamischen Datenbank-Entwickler­teams sind Sie zuständig für die fachliche und physikalische Daten­modellierung. Sie sind mit­ver­antwortlich, in welchen Strukturen und Formaten die Daten abgelegt und mit­einander verknüpft werden. Sie erstellen Daten­importe und -exporte, Reports und treiben unser modernes OLAP-System voran. Außerdem über­nehmen Sie die Administration und das Monitoring laufender Systeme. Auf Basis von funktionalen Kunden­anforderungen entwerfen Sie das technische Design und übernehmen anschließend selbst die Programmierung. Sie stehen in enger Abstimmung mit den Bereichen Analyse und Architektur und bieten Support bei der Lösung von System­störungen.

item.title: Staff Software Engineer - Web Development, ACOS at A10 Networks (San Jose, CA)
item.description: You will be responsible for developing high performance, responsive user interfaces for A10 network management GUI. The clean, intuitive, and beautiful user interface you will build plays a critical role in the A10 user experience -- allowing users to navigate through page flow and visually manipulate network management components. You will develop core frontend components of a fast, scalable, complex web application (Angular JS, Django, HTML5, Sass, CSS, JavaScript) using libraries and frameworks (e.g. Knockout JS, Angular JS, Ember JS, Batman JS, Closure).  The sleek, beautiful results of your work make you an integral part of our product/engineering group as you define, design, and develop new features with a top-caliber team.

item.title: Senior Systems Architect at Zymeworks Inc. (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
We are seeking a Senior Systems Architect to help improve our software infrastructure. We pride ourselves on developing useful and robust software, and would like to have a world-class development environment for our team including automated builds, continuous integration, monitoring and fault tolerance.


 As Senior Systems Architect, your responsibilities would include:



  • Facilitating the transition of our platform from our own in-house cluster to the cloud

  • Creating and managing standardized software development environments for the Software Development team

  • Interfacing between Software Development and Systems Administration teams 

  • Developing automated systems for deployment, monitoring and fault tolerance

  • Working with the systems team to provide the necessary services for the software development team

  • Helping improve software deployment, monitoring and development processes taking into account systems requirements

  • Laying the foundation for a strong DevOps team, and establishing a common language between developers and system team members.

  • Envisioning long term goals for our infrastructure along with the Software and Systems team leads.

item.title: Java Software Engineer at Blue Coat / Perspecsys (Mississauga, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Are you an outstanding Java Developer looking for an exciting company where you can contribute to today's hottest information technology? We are currently looking for developers for projects to build out our core platform for protecting sensitive corporate data in the cloud. You will be working with some of the world’s leading cloud solutions, and inventing the next generation of cloud security.


Our elite engineering team has immediate openings for experienced or junior software engineers with expertise in enterprise server software and web application development along with the capability to excel. We are looking for creative, out-of-the-box developers eager to tackle difficult problems. If you love working on leading-edge projects, from design to coding to implementation, have a wide range of technical skills, and have the right aptitude and mindset to become one of the best, then we need to talk. Come be part of the excitement - apply now!

item.title: Software Engineer at Google (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.


Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.



Responsibilities


  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.

item.title: Sustainable Software Engineer at Appboy (New York, NY)
item.description:
We're looking for Sustainable Software Engineer to build internal tools and features for the Appboy platform. In addition, this role will also require the candidate to be the technical escalation for our success team when needed. This role is a software engineering role, as this person will also be responsible for programming on the Appboy dashboard or backend, helping out the mobile team, and working on minor infrastructure projects. One day you may be building internal tools to help our success and support organizations with automating a workflow, and the next day building new features to be used by thousands of Appboy customers.


Sustainable Software Engineers may be required to split on-call responsibilities with other team members, though after-hours support is uncommon. Proficient Support Engineers have the opportunity to grow into full-time backend software engineers on the Appboy platform.


We are not interested in recent coding school graduates at this time, please do not apply if you recently graduated from schools such as General Assembly or App Academy.



Responsibilities:
-Become an expert in how our product works from a technical standpoint
-Be the technical point of contact for customer issues from Appboy’s customer success organization
-Add new features and fix customer-facing bugs
-Build or buy new support tools to help automate common tasks and challenges

item.title: Senior .NET & Web developer at DecisionHealth (Gaithersburg, MD)
item.description:
DecisionHealth is seeking talented and highly motivated Senior- and Mid- level .NET & Web developers to build state-of-the-art business-to-business web products in the healthcare sector.


Want to work in a no-BS continuous improvement environment? Where excellence and getting things done matter more than dress code or process formalities? Where professionals like yourself invest time strategically to minimize support needs and preclude firefighting? Then come and join us in this exciting, critical stage in our growth, as we implement Lean development practices, pay out the technical debt, and create a sustainable tech platform for business growth!


DecisionHealth is a 30 years old information product company, specializing in the area of healthcare administrative reference information, with headquarters in Gaithersburg, MD -- right in the heart of the Rio/Washingtonian waterfront! To passionate craftsmen looking to make a difference we offer a developer-friendly agile process, healthy work/life balance, respect for industry-accepted best practices, and a small team environment where your voice will be heard.


Responsibilities include working independently and in teams to develop web applications and backend systems that meet user specifications, participating in all activities from user story mapping, to brainstorming screen mockups, to high-level design and prototyping, to coding, unit-testing, and deployment support.

item.title: Senior Java Software Engineer at EcoSys (New York, NY)
item.description:
Be heard, have influence and do work that is constantly challenging. Being a developer at EcoSys means that you’re part of a collaborative team focused on a product that is actively changing, not just supporting and maintaining an existing product. You’ll work alongside of our owners and newbies alike on cutting edge enterprise software that’s pushing the envelope in the areas of enterprise-level data volumes, user configurability, and flexibility.


We’re looking for a seasoned Java server-side developer with a wealth of experience designing, developing and perfecting server-side systems that are able to process complex business rules, multi-layered transactions and scale to thousands of users. As a Java expert you will be designing and building complex object-oriented systems.  You must have a firm handle on how to solve real-world business needs with elegant, reusable and efficient Java code/architecture. Only veteran software developers with demonstrated full-lifecycle delivery experience will be considered, meaning you need to possess a strong foundation in the science and discipline of structured programming.

item.title: Quality Assurance Engineer (m/f) - Rendering & Cloud Computing at Dassault Systemes 3DExcite GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
In Research and Development we provide expert solutions for 3D realtime visualization, asset management and immersive use cases. You will be part of the Quality Assurance department which ensures the quality of our products with a focus on 3D high-end visualization and virtual reality.


Show all in: Munich - Germany, Research & Software Development, Permanent


 Job Responsibilities


Verify & validate next generation 3D rendering & distributed rendering technology on API level



  • Work on next generation 3D rendering & distributed rendering technology for usage in workstation, HPC and cloud environments

  • Verify and validate software libraries on API level

  • Create automated functional, stress and performance tests

  • Create test specifications and plans

  • Enhance test infrastructure

  • Work as part of a Scrum team and collaborate closely with relevant stakeholders

item.title: DevOps Engineer for VC backed fast growning Start-up at Ice.com (Menlo Park, CA)
item.description:
About us:

Our mission is to use software and analytics to bring transparency to the opaque world of jewelry. We are backed by leading VCs including Khosla Ventures, Maveron, and Crosslink. 

Note: we acquired the domain name (Ice.com) a year ago (it is unrelated to the previous company). 

A few reasons why you should be interested in this opportunity:

  • The jewelry industry is a fragmented, $80B market (in the US alone), growing at 5%+ annually, that software has yet to disrupt. 
  • You will be joining an awesome team led by Brandon Proctor (founding CMO of one of the largest e-commerce retailers, Build.com) and Justin Yoshimura (3x exits). 
  • We are extremely data driven and technology/software is in our DNA. You won't be a second class citizen here, guaranteed. 
  • We don't have time for assholes or politics. 
  • Competitive compensation package including stock options. 
  • Small (17 person) and agile team. 

What we'd like to see:

  • Experience running a large-scale mobile and web operation
  • Experience with configuration management tools such as Ansible or Fabric
  • Strong Linux skills (Ubuntu preferred)
  • Strong Python development experience
  • Hands-on knowledge of high-availability approaches such as load balancing, failover, clustering and disaster recovery
  • Familiarity with performance and security best practices
  • Passion, drive, energy, a sense of humor and a great attitude!

Initial Responsibilities Include:

  • Build and improve platform services including web application hosting, databases, and networking
  • Automate the provisioning, configuration, scaling, and monitoring of our platform
  • Manage vendors and integrations used to deliver Ice.com services
  • 24/7 on-call rotation
  • Promote knowledge sharing and DevOps culture across our entire engineering department

Some of our Perks:

  • Entrepreneurial culture
  • Great Health care, Vision, and Dental plans
  • Build a team and product from the ground up
  • Have a suggestion? ...We would love to hear it. :)
  • Jewelry discounts for yourself, wife, or kids ;)

*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.

item.title: Development Operations Engineer at Megaport Operations Pty. Ltd. (Brisbane, Australia) (allows remote)
item.description:
To assist with automation of existing and future systems and infrastructure, collaborating with both the development and networking teams and enabling the success of both our present and future environments, which add to the success of the business as a whole.


Key area of responsibility



  • Own and manage our cloud-based infrastructure deployment

  • Monitor, operate and maintain seamless application server updates

  • Create new information pipelines to aid reporting at all levels of the business

  • Identify improvements in the development process

  • act as second level support for NOC engineers.

  • Implement and maintain monitoring tools for production hardware and application servers.

  • Manage backups for file systems including data for various application such as Git, Bugzilla, Puppet, apache servers, VOIP customer calls.

  • Work with developers in selecting the correct technologies and processes for future product deployment to production.

  • Research potential new technologies to be used for development, operation of various tools needed for deployment, configuration and monitoring


 Key objectives or deliverables



  • Provide a robust, reliable platform that supports the systems and infrastructure

  • Support, develop and suggest new tools on our environment

  • Provide expert integration and automation advice to the development and engineering teams to ensure cloud-based infrastructure is world class

item.title: Principal & Sr Software Engineer, iOS Applications at iRobot Corporation (Bedford, MA)
item.description:
Explore and leverage your career with one of the world’s foremost leaders in diverse robotics – from consumer, telepresence, and international defense and security, we are constantly creating robotic products that improve, impact, and change lives.


  As a Principal Software Engineer – iOS Applications at iRobot, you will be developing mobile applications that control an ecosystem of Robots in the home.


 In this role, you will collaborate with robot developers, designers, testers, and business managers.  You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the product development lifecycle.  The ideal candidate must be able to pick up new technologies quickly, be a strong team player, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands. The ideal candidate will also have experience building mobile applications (iOS) that control real time systems.


What you will do


As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you will develop new products that are used by millions of people.



  • Develop new apps for IoT products that are used by millions of people.

  • This position will help to mentor and grow other engineers.

  • Design, implement, and test a new, iOS based, robot control application.

  • Collaborate with technical architects, test engineers, and user interface designers.

  • Write high quality code that is well documented and unit tested.

  • Participate in and drive code reviews.

item.title: Front-End Architect at EcoSys (New York, NY)
item.description: As the leader of our front end development team you will be seeing through your vision of an ideal UI architecture, focused on extensibility, performance, and usability. You will be choosing and applying modern web frameworks on top of an existing highly scalable and flexible back end. You will be designing mobile/responsive best practices and then guiding team members in applying them. EcoSys EPC’s web functionality includes a configurable interface whereby users can build dashboards and interactive screens from UI building blocks that include rich HTML5-based graphical data visualizations, responsive spreadsheets and forms, and an in-browser report builder.  These are the building blocks your new framework will deliver.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - C#/JavaScript at GoFormz (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
GoFormz is a San Diego startup looking for great developers to add to a rapidly-growing engineering team.  Our goal is to help individuals and businesses replace paper forms with web and mobile-based digital forms, and then to provide ubiquitous access to the collected data.


What will I be working on?

We work on a wide variety of projects and technologies, and you will have a lot of freedom to choose what you will work on.  We do everything from JavaScript/HTML5 web apps to mobile app development to solving complex database/platform architecture problems.  One thing is certain; you will be a core contributor working on production code.  The work you do will become part of the day-to-day life of thousands of our customers. 


What is it like to work at GoFormz?



  • We have a fantastic team that gets stuff done and is fun to work with!

  • Our office is in San Diego, CA right next to the bay. 

  • Everyone has the best hardware for doing their particular job. You tell us what that is.  We have some pretty sweet monitor setups.

  • The environment is fast-paced, so you will see the results of your work immediately

  • We actually care about your physical health.  Everyone in the office has automatic sit/stand desks, and we provide membership to an executive health club/gym as well as providing healthy food snacks.

  • You will receive equity.  We also pay well - at or above market.

  • Full gold-level health and dental insurance is provided

  •  You will have plenty of opportunities to use and learn cutting-edge technologies with which you are currently unfamiliar.

item.title: Python Developer at Esri (Redlands, CA)
item.description:
Are you an exceptional, driven, and passionate Python developer who also has knowledge and experience with C++ or C#? Join our agile and innovative team responsible for designing and developing next-gen Esri software.



Responsibilities:



  • Create Python packages and modules that follow the Python and industry-standard design patterns

  • Design, develop, and maintain Python packages for GIS analysis, data management, and visualization workflows

  • Develop a new robust and rich Python window for computing analysis and mapping workflows in ArcGIS for Desktop

  • Find, analyze, and fix bugs/performance problems whenever and wherever they occur

  • Build and ship quality software by working effectively with members of other software development teams in an agile, highly interactive, and creative environment

item.title: Senior Frontend Engineer for Onefootball at Onefootball GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
While being the latest platform launched by Onefootball, our web app (https://app.onefootball.com) is at the centre of our sharing infrastructure and an important source of information for football fans on both mobile and desktop. 

Your Role


You’ll join our web team and work directly on the existing code base of the web application and the related administration tools. The product is fresh enough so that we don’t have a lot of cumbersome legacy code and we follow the industry’s best practices to keep the job pleasant. We're always open to suggestions and expect you to use your experience to constantly improve our product. You should be fun to work with and like to learn and teach everyday. Also we value pragmatism and intellectual curiosity. Since you'd be working closely with other teams from different departments, your job is to make sure your voice is heard both inside and outside your field of expertise.

The position is located in our awesome football office in Berlin. We offer free drinks and food and great team events such as tech talks, football public viewings, sport events, lunch roulette and of course support with relocation and Visa application processes.

Who we’re looking for


You are passionate about programming and have already successfully developed products for a large and diversified user base. You ideally have more than 4 years of experience in coding for the web, a solid background in computer science concepts and a good understanding of the entire lifecycle from design, engineering to release and maintenance.

You master unit testing and respective frontend developer tools (we use bower + grunt + less but any similar variation is fine). You have a good comprehension of browser performances, UX across multiple screen sizes and you are attentive to details. Ideally, you have gained a significant experience with AngularJS.

If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you. And if you’re a football fan, all the better.

item.title: Quality Engineer- TDD Environment at Zipcar (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Zipcar is the world’s largest ‘car-sharing’ company and is looking to add new senior talent to our Engineering team.


Today, Zipcar provides hundreds of thousands of people with a viable alternative to traditional car ownership, saving them money, time and headaches. Around the world—from coast to coast, across Canada, the UK, and college campuses in between—people are making the decision to live car free and enjoying the convenience and environmental benefits of having “wheels when you want them”.


As we continue to grow our operations, we are looking for talented, passionate people with great ideas to join the Zipcar family. We aim to create an environment that is supportive, diverse, and as fun as our brand. If you’re results-oriented, dedicated, and ready to contribute to an unparalleled member experience for our community of Zipsters, we encourage you to apply.


To learn more about Zipcar, what we do, and how we do it, visit zipcar.com. For further employment opportunities, visit http://www.zipcar.com/about/jobs


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with development and product owners to drive continuous improvement of the Zipcar member experience

  • Continually add Business Value to Agile Teams through Proactive Participation

  • Design and execute automated functional tests within the test automation framework

  • Develop and Maintain functional Regression tests

  • Pair with team members to identify and mitigate software risk through exploratory testing and other techniques

  • Lead improvement initiatives to process, testing, and tools. Own improvement initiatives identified in team retrospectives.

  • Analyze production defects, and drive effective corrective actions


Requirements:



  • 3 or more years of experience testing Web Applications in a hosted environment

  • Hands on Experience developing automated functional tests using Selenium or similar tools

  • Experience with an Object Oriented programming language (Java, Python, Ruby, etc.)

  • Prior experience working in an Agile software development environment, collaborating with developers and product owners

  • Experience with creating SQL queries and using relational database technologies or experience with non-relational data stores such as Hadoop, Cassandra and MongoDB.

  • Strong command of Linux operating systems

  • Experience testing front end web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Adaptable and willing to work in a dynamic, fast paced environment


The Ideal Candidate Has:



  • Prior experience with Ruby on Rails, Scala/Playframework or Enterprise Java

  • Experience with Hadoop, Cassandra or MongoDB

  • Experience with software version control using GIT

  • Prior experience with testing using Rspec

  • Self-motivated, with a passion for learning

  • Experience interfacing with telematics infrastructure and geospatial data

  • An obsession with delivering outstanding customer experience

  • A commitment to Zipcar’s ideals of sustainable resource sharing and urban mobility


As a member of the Zipcar Team you will receive:



  • Competitive Compensation

  • Competitive Benefits Package

  • Free Membership

  • Discounts on services, products and much more


While we appreciate every applicant’s interest, only those under consideration will be contacted. We regret that phone calls will not be accepted.


Zipcar is an EEO Employer - Minorities / Females / Protected Veterans / Disabled


To all recruitment agencies: Zipcar does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Zipcar employees or any other company location. Zipcar is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Advidi (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
If you would like to be involved in shaping the future of internet advertising (innovation), develop features which will be exposed to hundreds of millions of users every day (big data), go off the beaten path to design and develop high performance and high availability web applications (challenges), then you will be pleased with what Advidi has to offer. The Advidi SOA is composed of multiple critical components which are handling large amounts of live traffic and is the backbone of our business workflow. Thus, high availability, zero-downtime and minimum response times are critical.


As a DevOps engineer you will be taking part in the development of exciting new features for the company’s core software products. We are looking for people who get things done and would like to work on projects that add value to business and would enjoy working within an inspirational environment.


Responsibilities


You will support, develop and enhance highly scalable and highly available infrastructure for all our projects in Google Cloud. You will find a balance between creating awesome things that create an immediate impact and making sure that they're secure and maintainable in the long run. You will have an opportunity to be involved with product development as a software engineer and be able to develop your programming skills to the next level.

item.title: Software Development Engineer at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
At Amazon Web Services, we run one of the largest networks in the world. We are taking all the industry trends and blending them into the critical foundation of utility computing: the network. Our goal is to become the infrastructure platform for the world and our team will make the bones of the platform “the network”, work flawlessly. Not only supporting Amazon.com at the global level, but amazing global companies. (http://aws.amazon.com/solutions/case-studies/all/).



Amazon Networking is looking for senior software engineers to build a platform to manage thousands of network devices; providing significantly improved control, visibility and predictability for Amazon’s global network. Our goal is to eliminate human intervention and errors from network engineering, network build and device management by building tools and systems to successfully manage thousands of heterogeneous devices in dozens of data centers across the world.



ROLE

You are interested in being part of a high-bar team with global responsibility for network automation software used across all of Amazon’s businesses. You are interested in solving difficult software problems at massive scale. You want to talk to customers directly and design solutions that solve their problems through innovation and automation. You understand how to build software in a continuous integration and continuous deployment environment. You are interested in working autonomously and owning your own code from requirements to launch and for supporting it in the field. You enjoy solving challenging problems and working in a fast-paced, flexible, collaborative team environment.

· Strong customer orientation with ability to work directly with customer/product owner to define requirements and the associated acceptance criteria for user stories.

· Excellent software development skills, preferably in Python or Perl with Java, C/C++, Ruby acceptable as a substitute.

· Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development team with solid understand of the principles of continuous integration (CI), continuous deployment and test driven development (TDD).

· Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to apply design patterns to common software problems and define dimensions of a solution including robustness, scale and maintainability.

· Strong communications skills both written and verbal are required for this role. The ability to present complex ideas in a convincing and understandable manner are a key requirement.

· Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment and as part of a cross-functional team with the ability to influence others as a senior technical contributor.

· Ability to mentor more junior software developers in best practice with demonstrated capability to maintain architectural vision and software quality during the implementation cycle.

· Knowledge of and previous development experience in a Linux or UNIX environment with a good understanding of networking concepts.

· 5+ years of industry experience in core product development, building production quality software.

· A solid grounding in Computer Science fundamentals, data structures, algorithms and deftness at object-oriented design and systems architecture: a bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science (or equivalent) is required.



· Certified Scrum Master Certification is a plus.

· Familiarity with networking protocols (OSPF, BGP, HSRP/GLBP, IPSEC/VPNs, DNS, HTTP).

· Familiarity with SOA design principles include orchestration and RESTful Interface definition.

item.title: Application Security Engineer at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
Are you ready for your next security challenge? New Relic is growing our world-class security team, and you have the opportunity to be part of it!


If you want to work in a dynamic environment with fast paced adoption of innovative technologies that creates a constant flow of new security challenges - then we have the job for you!


We are looking for passionate security professionals that want to be part of an exciting company that values employee empowerment, experimentation, and work-life balance. The right person will be driven to solve complex security challenges, push their skills, and learn new ones.


In this role, you will be responsible for promoting, designing, and evaluating application security in all phases of the development life cycle. You will work with groups and individuals from across the company, including development, support, and QA. More importantly, you will be on the leading edge of defining how to do security right in a continuous-deployment, cloud-based environment.


In this role, your responsibilities will include:

  • Working with engineers to build secure software, addressing and mitigating security issues and risks

item.title: Cloud Systems Engineer at mParticle (Boca Raton, FL) (allows remote)

We are looking for a skilled Cloud Systems Engineer who will be responsible for supporting our growing application infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have a deep technical understanding of Linux operating systems and at least an intermediate understanding of Windows operating systems, strong experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), advanced scripting skills, experience with variety of monitoring solutions, deep understanding of network communications and excellent troubleshooting skills.


Finally, we are seeking someone who wants to be a major contributor in a small, dynamic work environment, loves a challenge, and has a strong balance of technical and people skills.
 
The Cloud Systems Engineer will be responsible for:

  • Participate in on-call rotation and provide hands-on support during emergencies, outages, and service transitions.

  • Adhere to a comprehensive incident management program including problem management.

item.title: Integration Engineer at NSONE (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Integration Engineer
Come help us lead the infrastructure-as-code revolution

NSONE is based in New York City with offices in San Francisco and Singapore. Were a world class team of internet infrastructure experts, working on deep solutions to real world traffic management problems, and operating a large global delivery infrastructure powered by bleeding edge technology.

Tight-knit, customer focused, driven by innovation

NSONE is not a sprawling, hierarchy addled behemoth. We are lean and fast, and theres a tight loop among our entire team. Were all about automation, intelligent distributed systems, and quick iteration.

The role

Were looking to add a new member to our small but fast growing engineering team: an Integration Engineer who can draw on their passion for infrastructure-as-code along with their broad community knowledge and connections to craft all manner of integrations for our cutting edge DNS platform. This dynamic position will involve writing and maintaining code in various languages - much of it open source - centered around getting data into and out of our platform. Youll work on in-house repos as well as contribute to various well known community infrastructure projects. Youll also work in our REST API and other internal systems to create and maintain integrations with other SaaS platforms.

No matter which language, you will be expected to write clean, maintainable, and fully tested code along with top notch documentation. You should have experience working on open source projects in a distributed environment (typically GitHub), including handling tasks like Pull Requests and Issues. Knowledge of various Continuous Integration systems such as Buildbot and TravisCI will be helpful. You should be familiar with the package distribution systems of various programming languages such as pip, gem, npm, etc and ideally have some experience contributing to them.  

You should have good general knowledge of the modern internet infrastructure landscape, especially well known and up-and-coming infrastructure-as-code projects and various IaaS and SaaS providers in the space.

Youll need to be able to quickly digest and understand diverse technical documentation and APIs of varying quality. Communication skills are equally important as youll be expected to maintain relationships with the project leaders, providers and services that youll be integrating with. Youll take ownership of all the integrations and work autonomously towards aggressive development goals.

Some stuff youll work on:

  • REST API clients (to our service), in various languages (open source)
  • Integrations with other SaaS platforms related to both ingesting data into our platform as well as pushing notifications externally. Examples include Pingdom, New Relic, Datadog, Catchpoint, Pagerduty
  • Create and maintain NSONE DNS modules for various configuration management systems such as Ansible, Chef, Puppet
  • Create and maintain NSONE DNS modules in infrastructure projects such as Terraform, libcloud, fog.io, Netflix denominator
  • Maintain developer relationships with all of these providers and projects

Working @ NSONE

Were a small, well funded startup with a casual work environment and strong work ethic. Theres a lot to do so we keep meetings and process to a minimum. Were headquartered in NYCs Financial District. We like to have fun, but skip most of the fancy startup gimmicks (fresh beer yes, gourmet chef and afternoon yoga no). We prefer candidates local to NYC or SFO, but will happily consider well qualified remote employees.

We offer:

  • competitive compensation (salary and stock options)
  • medical, dental, and vision
  • commuter benefits
  • 401k
  • flexible hours and time off

NSONE is an equal opportunity employer.

item.title: Front End Engineer at Flite (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Flite is looking for a Front-End Software Engineer with great well-rounded technical skills and a talent for building awesome web applications. As a part of Flite's exceptional engineering team, you will build out the next generation of Flite's world class ad platform. Flite is a powerful, dynamic creative platform for scaling mobile, native, and rich media ad campaigns. Flite’s self-service platform is used by the world’s biggest brands and publishers to create better ads optimized in real time. Better ads. Better internet.


You will be responsible for participating in technical design discussions, implementing new features and products, working with UX designers, researching and evaluating new technology, and maintaining a well-tested and high quality software codebase. We're looking for someone with a deep knowledge in Javascript and knowledge using various frameworks and packages such as Backbone, Mustache, Underscore, jQuery, React, etc. Knowledge of Java, Java APIs, and JSP is also important, but you should be able to understand how web application development works no matter the kind of stack or technology is employed. Experience with web advertising platforms or building systems around ad servers/tech, reporting/charting packages, and SQL/NoSQL databases is a huge plus. You should have great communication skills and be able to work closely with User Experience and Product Management to build beautifully designed UIs that are rich and user-friendly.


This role is for you if:



  • You love to use and learn about the latest Javascript frameworks and technology

  • You want to make software that makes a difference for our customers

  • You thrive in a "roll up your sleeves and get it done" work culture

  • You appreciate simple, reusable, fast, and elegant software

  • You are eager to share your expertise and experience with others

  • You want to be part of a small, close-knit team

  • You enjoy working in an agile development environment with an aggressive release schedule

  • You want to work in a startup environment and enjoy actively participating in groups


Compensation:



  • Competitive salary

  • Attractive stock option plan

  • Medical/Dental/Vision insurance

  • Use as much as you need vacation/PTO

  • 401K, commuter, FSA

  • Casual and fun work environment

item.title: Senior Java Software Developer with NOSQL & Cassandra Experience at BlackRock (New York, NY)

The Aladdin Product Group develops and supports every facet of BlackRock’s information systems needs.
