item.title: Information Security Engineer Ethical Hacker at Time Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Job


The Information Security Engineer (Application Security) will join a team of other Information Security professionals reporting directly to the Global Manager - Application Security. The position will have primary responsibility for managing security architecture reviews, vulnerability assessments and penetration testing. The Information Security Engineer will be part of a team providing state-of-the-art technical expertise and support to clients, IT management and staff in risk assessment and the implementation of appropriate data security procedures and products.


You Will:



  • Collaborate with the Information Security staff in the evaluation of risks and threats, development, implementation, communication, operation, monitoring and maintenance of the IT security policies and procedures which promote a secure and uninterrupted operation of all IT systems

  • Identify emerging vulnerabilities, evaluates associated risks and threats and provides countermeasures where necessary

  • Monitor developments within application security and ensure internal policies, procedures, tools and awareness programs reflect current security methods such as those published by OWASP, WASC, etc.

  • Serve as a point of contact with business clients and consult with infrastructure and software development teams to design proper security architecture

  • Act as security liaisons with software developers globally

  • Conduct security architecture reviews for new development (web, digital, mobile) and modifications to existing ones

  • Conduct internal and oversee external penetration tests

  • Design and implement Secure SDLC program (policies, methodologies and tools) across the company globally

  • Execute formalized Information Security programs and processes, such as vulnerability management, event monitoring, data loss prevention, and incident response

  • Evaluate, implement and support information security related technology

  • Respond to information security alerts and analyze events for appropriate action

  • Conduct security awareness training for software developers

item.title: Pre Sales Technical Evangelist at Openmind Networks Inc (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
Are you a smart, creative, people-oriented engineer? Are you passionate about the software developer community? If so, we’d love to meet you!


Golgi is a cloud service for connectivity and data transport that decreases time to market in delivering IoT Solutions. Developers define their service using Thrift and use Golgi to generate type-safe APIs specific to their needs. Golgi significantly cuts development time and allows the developer to concentrate on adding value to their app or device.



You will be a passionate evangelist for Golgi (http://golgi.io) as well as a champion for developer interests within Openmind Networks. This is a position for engineers who love being out in the wild working with developers around innovative technology.
You will help build and foster the community and help extend the technical direction around the product by being the lead Developer Advocate for Golgi.


Your responsibilities will include the following:


- Educate prospective clients by assessing customers’ needs and recommending solutions that optimize value for both the customer and Golgi - Create momentum and drive the success of Golgi through your interactions with third party developers


- Hands-on coding with developers on-site; 1st line technical support for developers


- Evangelize Golgi by participating in technical presentations on conference panels, at user groups, on social media/blogs/forums, at meetups, through technical articles, etc.


- Generate sample content (demo applications/snippets), tutorials and technical documentation using a variety of development languages and platforms; Publish open-source projects that allow developers, partners and customers to quickly understand and utilize our SDK


- Advocate for developers internally and influence the technical direction and roadmap for Golgi. Work cross-functionally with Engineering, Business Development, and Marketing

item.title: Software Developer Specialist at NASDAQ (Philadelphia, PA)
item.description:
Description of Group:


Global Technology Services (GTS) is committed to maintaining NASDAQ’s technology leadership position by developing and delivering innovative, cost efficient and short time-to-market technology solutions to our business partners and customers. GTS provides technology and tools to the NASDAQ MarketWatch teams around the world.


The NASDAQ MarketWatch department conducts two major functions — disclosure and compliance — to maintain an orderly marketplace and a level playing field for market participants, investors and the general public. In an effort to foster marketplace integrity, the MarketWatch department oversees the complete and timely disclosure of material information by NASDAQ-listed issuers. In addition, MarketWatch monitors compliance with NASDAQ rules and policies through real-time surveillance of price and volume information reported by market participants.


Typical Job Functions:



  • Assist in the design, development, and support of Nasdaq's MarketWatch Surveillance and related current and future applications.

  • Translate business requirements into well-designed and documented software components based on a mix of technologies (Java EE, AngularJS, Jersey, Junit, Postgres, MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server, etc.)

  • Work closely with NASDAQ Marketwatch, infrastructure support, and development teams

  • Provide major contributions to the overall architecture of MarketWatch tools with a focus on scalability, maintainability and performance

  • Participate in all phases of the lifecycle of software application development with an emphasis on architecture, design, quality, code reviews and implementation

item.title: Senior Software Developer at Rackspace, the #1 managed cloud company (Windcrest, TX)
item.description:
Do you believe in the power of Open Source? Does contributing to the Open Source community WHILE working making you happier than an engineer who just found the ultimate gif? Is collaboration a key component to what makes you tick? If you answered yes to any/all of these, then you really need to be a Software Developer at Rackspace.


With the largest OpenStack public cloud in the business and our commitment to build the best private cloud offering in the industry, the life of a dev at the Rack can be different but don’t worry we will help match your skills, passions and birthday wishes with the right opportunity. Here’s a preview to get you started:


Private Cloud:
Rackspace has some of the most notable upstream OpenStack contributors on the planet. Duh…we co-founded the thing so of course we do and you will have the opportunity to do the same. Private cloud devs literally pound out Python code from all over the globe in one of our offices or from the comfort of their own home if they have shown superior abilities, yet don’t worry we have the tools to keep you connected when you need to be. These teams manage, scale and optimize every aspect of the customer’s environment including a little Ops work so be ready to own it like it’s your own little baby.


Public Cloud:
The largest OpenStack public cloud in the world just obviously means huge, large-scale, highly distributed customer environments that extend to many of our 10+ global data centers. Python, Ruby, PHP you name it. Teams are made up of specialists for each but they dabble in everything. Swiss Army code knives are just how we roll. This squad pulls in other devs from other business units, infrastructure engineers and quality engineering all to get the job done. No one fails alone because they are never left alone. Even as they push the bounds of big data or whatever comes out next they learn together and win together.


What are you waiting for? Click that apply button, get a chance to talk with one of our talent specialists and get ready to jump on in to the best adventure you’ve ever had.


Still not convinced? See what the Rackspace teams are doing for our customers. Rokkan Story

item.title: Software Developer at Excel4apps (Pittsburgh, PA)

We enjoy our work as much as we enjoy working together and want developers who can get things done while having a positive influence on our workplace environment. The successful candidate must enjoy developing software, care about code quality, and be committed to craftsmanship.


Job Outcomes

  • Provide level 2 support; investigate and debug product related issues.

  • Develop in-house tools to improve productivity.

  • Review co-workers' code changes.

item.title: Software Developer- Build Footlocker's eCommerce Platform at Footlocker.com / Eastbay (Wausau, WI)
item.description:
Footlocker.com / Eastbay is on the cutting edge of on-line retail technology. Our evolution has led us to expand our systems and we are searching for ambitious, tech-savvy and forward thinking Software Developers who want to take taking their career to the next level without losing the ability to code innovative and amazing applications.


Footlocker.com / Eastbay operates the direct-to-consumer business for Foot Locker, Inc. - the world’s leading retailer of athletically inspired footwear and apparel. Our brands include Footlocker, Eastbay, Champs Sports, Footaction, Kids Foot Locker, and Lady Footlocker. In fact we manage 16 of the largest sport inspired web and mobile sites on the net, which enjoy over 250 million visits per year. 


Footlocker.com / Eastbay has ambitious goals. Help us exceed them! 


Our Development Team is good at what they do. They work with new technologies on innovative projects, delivering elegant solutions through collaboration. Our team members are best-in-class; they are Students of the Business; aggressive and clever. We want a growing Developer who has the passion to be part of this motivated team!


This is an ideal environment for a savvy, solutions oriented developer to come in and truly progress in their career. Footlocker.com / Eastbay is looking for a developer to plan, develop test and document computer programs. Here’s what you can expect as a Footlocker.com / Eastbay Developer:



  • Collaborate with team mates to design, develop, enhance, and maintain key E-Commerce solutions

  • Provide business process flow and architectural design documentation

  • Effectively troubleshoot and communicate to help solve software issues

  • Stay current with software tools, technologies, and methodologies

  • Engage in a highly collaborative Agile Development culture

  • Grow as a Student of the Business through interaction with teams across the organization

item.title: Senior Security Engineer at Code42 Software, Inc. (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
A Senior Information Security Engineer at Code42 helps to build and maintain infrastructure and products that are of the highest security standard. In this role, you will collaborate with people from throughout Code42 to enhance and maintain the level of security that Code42 and it's customers need.Code 42 is seeking a Senior Information Security Engineer to help maintain our high standard of security in a rapidly growing cloud infrastructure. Continuous vigilance of threats to us and our customers, as well as the ability to quickly assess the implications of cutting edge technology, will be your focus. 


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING



  • Review, analyze, and respond to security incidents

  • Design, build, and maintain security infrastructure

  • Conduct security assessments using automated tools and manual penetration testing techniques 

  • Define security requirements for Code42 technical infrastructure and product software

  • PerformAssist with incident handling and forensic analysis

  • All other duties as assigned

item.title: Android Engineer at SwiftKick Mobile (Austin, TX)
item.description:
SwiftKick is hiring skilled, creative, and adaptable Android Developers/Engineers. This is an opportunity for developers with strong Java experience and attention to detail, to contribute to a variety of challenging and cutting edge apps. You will drive the development of apps that embody SwiftKick's commitment to building pixel-perfect products that people love to use.


Our projects usually range from one to six months. In a year, you could easily work on six different projects. Typically 2-4 people are assigned to each project, each with an opportunity to give input on design and development. We encourage collaboration and creativity. You will interact with our engineers and may architect solutions with our customers and their engineers as well.


As a member of the SwiftKick team you must be inspired by technology and have a passion for creating innovative technical solutions in a fast, energetic environment.

item.title: DevOps Engineer / FinTech Startup at IEX (New York, NY)
item.description:
IEX is looking for what we are calling our next System Reliability Engineer – you may also know this role as DevOps, WebOps, SystemsOps, and so on. The right person for the job will be an insatiably curious tinkerer with technical chops, who may or may not have done this type of role before. Bonus points if you take an interest in the stock market, though a willingness to learn all about the inner workings of the market is a must. In this role, you’ll be constantly optimizing and automating our processes and systems, in an effort to improve reliability, scalability, and maintainability. Plus, you’ll take on real-time responsibilities, such as monitoring, incident management, and recovery.


Coding and scripting is part of our daily life (we like python, bash, awk, sed and we are currently exploring Go). You’ll be exposed to how the technology interacts with the business side, and will gain a deep understanding of application logic and business data work-flows which is essential during the recovery process when an incident occurs. Experience with any layer in our stack (Linux, Java, C++) is highly beneficial particularly around the areas of performance and capacity. Experience in an agile environment is a plus, and a willingness to tackle the challenge of innovating within a regulated environment is key.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Responsible for monitoring the health of our systems

  • Participate in the engineering process as we design, build, and manage our systems.

  • Build tools to monitor and automate processes.

  • Be a core contributor in our change management and the post mortem processes

  • Troubleshoot issues across the whole stack - hardware, software, applications and network.

  • Document current and future configuration processes and policies.

  • Translates customer needs and projected product utilization to operational reliability targets.

  • Write systems reliability plan and report progress on attaining reliability targets to team and senior management.

  • Guides other functions (e.g., development, market operations, business development, subscribers, etc.) on reliability techniques, application and system functionality.

  • Educates and mentors team/company on operational best practices

item.title: Java/Ruby Developers at Miklos Systems, Inc. (MSI) (Fairfax, VA)
item.description:
Java and Ruby Software Developers


Northern Virginia


Relocation assistance will be available to qualified candidates.


Miklos Systems, Inc. (MSI) was founded in 1993 when Betsie Miklos chose to build a better kind of software development company. Over the years, people who have come to MSI have found approachable management, a culture of integrity, and an environment of technical excellence. Together, we have become a small company with a large impact on our people and our customers and we are pleased to announce that we have just become 100% employee-owned.


MSI employees work with customers across the Federal Government to build tools vital to our nation’s security. Our engineers, developers, and testers solve problems ranging from big data analysis to automated testing, from cloud engineering to website design and development.


Our Positions



  • Most require a TS/SCI clearance with polygraph or ability to obtain a clearance.



  • Are located in Northern Virginia, at customer locations.



  • Offer access to many contract positions via multiple contract vehicles.

item.title: Web App Developer: Ruby on Rails at MojoTech (Providence, RI)
item.description:
We're looking for an experienced software engineer to join our team in Providence, RI.


REQUIRED EXPERIENCE.



  • Professional programming experience in multiple languages, preferably developing web applications.

  • Some experience with Ruby on Rails and at least one JavaScript framework.

  • Practical knowledge of RDBMS principles.

  • You must be able to show us some code (either your own, or as part of a team), ideally with Rails.


BONUS QUALIFICATIONS.



  • Strong grasp of data-structures, algorithms, and design patterns.

  • Git gurudom.

  • Some experience with Node.js.

  • Ability to evaluate cutting-edge technologies for use in production environments.

  • Having fun with clouds (e.g. AWS).

  • Some experience with native mobile development.

  • Deep familiarity with the web’s many 4-lettered acronyms (e.g. HTTP, JSON, REST, AJAX, CORS).


DESIRED SKILLS & CHARACTER.



  • A passion for programming.

  • Up on recent movements in software development.

  • Curiosity to learn about new technologies and approaches.

  • Resourceful and self-initiating.

  • You can work independently, but you know that great software takes teamwork.

  • Detailed and organized. Ability to meet deadlines and work efficiently.

  • Big ideas over big egos. Show-offs welcome, but no “I” before “team”.

  • You write code for humans first and computers second.

  • You know the difference between software engineering and hacking, and you can do both.

  • You are passionate about code quality.

item.title: Senior JavaScript Developer (m/f) at Datapine GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
For further boosting our international project we are looking for a Senior JavaScript Developer that likes a challenging and exciting work environment and want to support our experienced development team.





Your task:




  • You will be part of our highly skilled developer team and contribute to the development of our innovative SaaS tool




  • You will take action in developing and maintaining the frontend part of our tool




  • Furthermore, you will optimize the platform for high scalability and


    performance

item.title: Operations Engineer at Clover (Sunnyvale, CA)
item.description:
You'll help build and operate systems that many billions of dollars flow through and that manages a large fleet of our smart payment terminals and POS devices. Availability, reliability, and security are paramount, but we also need to build new products and features at a rapid clip.


* Design, develop, deploy and manage highly available and scalable systems
* Monitor site reliability, availability, and performance
* Roll code out: roll-out planning, dry-runs, database migrations, datacenter cutovers, post-roll-out stability monitoring, etc.
* Trawl logs debugging systems issues
* Scale infrastructure
* Review architecture and designs with engineering before rolling out code
* Test site-to-site failover and recovery
* Ensure systems are secure
* Automate everything from deployment to monitoring and management to incident response

item.title: Ruby Developer at Toptal (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a Ruby developer motivated about building a variety of Ruby applications, including projects ranging from web development with Ruby on Rails, to complex groups of back-end microservices, to command line utilities and data processing scripts. Your primary responsibility will be to design and develop applications and to coordinate with the teams working on different layers of the infrastructure. Thus, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and building quality products is essential.


By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.


This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.


Responsibilities



  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Ruby code.

  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.

  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.

  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation.

  • Apply scalable application fundamental design principles as needed.

  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at NFL (Culver City, CA)
item.description:
The National Football League is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help make our applications amazing & incredible to use! We recently released our first Open Source project, launched a new iOS app & our team is thriving with start-up methodologies.


What’s it like to be an NFL Senior Software Engineer?



  • You have a voice at the table to innovate our software development

  • You own the custom mobile-centric software application products you build for our fans

  • You create replay-worthy experiences for our fans

  • You build products for our use of video, social & live data applications

  • You champion a legacy suite of online applications unlike any other

  • You feel the engagement of your work used by over 60 million of our fans


We’re growing our team with permanent, onsite talent & competitive compensation packages that include full healthcare benefits, bonus, pension, 401K, employee discounts, reimbursements as well as NFL Media Culture Committee perks (see our company page for more details).


Our NFL campus on Los Angeles’ west side houses the offices as well as studios for NFL Digital Media & NFL Network.

To apply, please send us your latest resume & links to your work!

item.title: Android Engineer at LiveSafe (Arlington, VA)
item.description:
We are looking for a mid-level Android engineer to join our mobile engineering team. We develop both Andorid and iOS native moble applications used by over 100,000 people across the world. We are constantly looking to improve our platform and branch out onto new devices (Android Wear, IoT) to deliver added value for our users.


The kind of engineer we are looking for will likely identify as a:



  • Polyglot that gets a special satisfaction from picking up a new language, framework, or tool

  • Problem solver that does not relent until digging and discovering an issue’s root cause

  • Collaborator that thrives in a social, transparent, and “got your back” team environment

  • Person who cares deeply that their work realizes positive outcomes for our world

  • Someone that stays on the bleeding edge of technology to help enhance user experience even with new OS releases


You probably also have:



  • Strong opinions on what makes certain languages/tools/frameworks good, bad, or ugly

  • Sufficient experience with your favorite language/tool/framework to describe its faults and shortcomings

  • A pet software design principle that drives you nuts when not used

item.title: DevOps Engineer on our massively scalable messaging platform at Pusher (London, UK)
item.description:
Pusher is a communication layer for application developers that routes data at scale and in realtime. We want to improve the lives of other developers by making hard problems simple, freeing them from operating and maintaining their own realtime infrastructure.


We're looking to expand our engineering team so we can solve more problems for developers around the world, and part of that mission means continually improving the way we deploy and maintain our platform.


Some of the things you will be doing:



  • Increasing automation and reducing deployment time on our platform, while still maintaining Pusher's reputation for maximum reliability.

  • Writing custom tools for diagnosing and resolving problems.

  • Being part of our on-call rota, while building tools and infrastructure that mean you are never called.

  • Contributing to decisions about the team's architectural direction.

item.title: Full Stack Python Developer at Tixie (Portland, OR)
item.description:
Position:


Development Engineer; Tixie Consumer Engagement Platform 


What we are looking for:


We are seeking an experienced mid-level developer to develop the full-stack (front-end + middleware including API integration + data layer) of our new products and product iterations. You will work closely with members of our small team to develop and flesh out features and integrations. Proficiency with taking non-technical feature requirements and translating them is essential.


To be considered for this role you must have experience with Python, Django, and developing an API. For this level role it is expected that you have prior experience developing functional web apps from the ground up, applying Bootstrap or other UI frameworks, and using appropriate versioning, testing, and security practices. Some nice to haves are experience with deployments, server maintenance, and iOS development.


 This is a challenging job but also a rewarding one. Come be a part of the action!


Working Conditions



  • Ability to work out of our NW Portland office in a startup environment preferred.

  • Remote location in the US will be considered.

  • Flexible work schedule.

  • Tixie is an equal opportunity employer.


This is a full-time employee position, with competitive salary and benefits. Evening and occasional weekend hours are not a regular component of the weekly schedule, but aren’t entirely unheard of.  Interested applicants should electronically submit resume, portfolio, web links, and cover letter to jobs@tixie.com:


Compensation
Based on experience

item.title: Junior Front End/.Net Developer at VALID Systems (Fort Worth, TX)
item.description:
VALID Systems is looking for a junior front-end JavaScript developer with .Net (C#) skills. This position will report to the Director/Manager of Software Development.  Familiarity with WebStorm, Visual Studio or similar IDE preferred.


VALID Systems is modernizing our internal customer service portal product using the latest HTML/JS technologies. You must enjoy consuming JSON data strings, and learning/working with opinionated JavaScript frameworks like EmberJS.


Must be comfortable learning technologies and tools that are used to build our web-based user interfaces and Web API middleware. You will be expected teach yourself as well as be instructed in building dynamic interfaces to rich Internet applications using MV* JavaScript frameworks and C#.


* Unfortunately, we cannot accommodate Visa Sponsorship for this role at this time.

item.title: Developer Relations Manager at JW Player (New York, NY)
item.description:
Millions of Developers around the world use JW Player to create unique, powerful video experiences for their audiences. They are one of the secrets to our success and we plan on doubling their number in the next year.  For just a few examples of their collaboration, see our Experiments page (http://www.jwplayer.com/innovation/experiments).


In order to do that, we would to add a Developer Relations Manager to launch and enrich our JW Developer Community. As our Relations Manager, you will use your creativity to provide developers with the tools and educational materials they need to use our player, platform and mobile SDKs to create innovative video, advertising and data analytics applications.


In this role, you will:



  • Maintain online resources and content for developers who use JW Player, JW Platform, JW Player mobile SDKs for Android and iOS, and more. Content will be sourced from our Product teams and include the developer web portal, API documentation, tutorials/code examples, demo apps, blog posts and experiments.

  • Regularly curate documents, layouts, and organization according to developer feedback.

  • Be the primary point of contact at the company for the developer community through direct channels as well as social media.

  • Provide crucial developer feedback and feature requests to our Product Managers.

  • Work with our Support, Engineering and Sales teams to advise developers in creating custom applications of JW products and services.

  • Organize periodic online and in-person JW Developer events.

  • Identify and bring new developers to the community.

item.title: Front-End Engineer at Apervita, Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Front-End Engineering focuses on the user experience of the Apervita platform, developing the user interface features and the overall feature framework. Front-end engineers use advanced JavaScript and CSS techniques to create the client-side experience for the Apervita platform. Front-end engineers collaborate with the UX team and Platform Engineers to ensure a robust and secure user experience. 


The Front-End Engineer will primarily use JavaScript, CSS, and HTML (specifically JavaScript MVC frameworks and Sass). Those with Python experience are encouraged to build end-to-end features, diving into the platform core and collaborating with Platform Engineers to build the best overall feature-rich experience.


Apervita strives to enable developers to spend as much time as possible on design collaboration and development, running a low-overhead methodology based on Agile and Continuous Integration principles. We want developers to do what they do best, rising to meet technology challenges and working together as a team to build a world class platform.

item.title: Backend developer - Medior/Senior C# .NET at Amsterdam based startup at Neocles (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Are you ready to change an industry and work on software serving global players? Then join our team!


You will write server-side code (.NET C#) for web-based applications and create robust high-volume production applications. You're able to develop prototypes quickly and will work with a team of developers and product managers to ensure that engineering know-how and excellence is shared and nurtured. You have to be able to communicate your ideas clearly and concisely and work in a team well. And last but not least you "Think API".

item.title: Software Engineer at Trade IT (New York, NY)
item.description:
TradeIt engineering team exhibits high energy, deep technical skills and a drive to get things done. Jobs are broadly defined and interact with Product Design, Product Management, Business Development and Marketing.


The Front-End team works deep within javascript to create a highly dynamic environment. If reading the jQuery release logs and listening to or arguing with Douglass Crockford is your idea of a fun afternoon, then we’re looking for you to come help us push the boundaries of what browsers can do.



Our Mobile team strives to find the smoothest and most efficient implementations of pairing backend data (mainly JSON) with a turly unique interface. We don’t pick sides, so if you’ve signed more Apple NDA’s for developer previews than you can count or if someone says Halo and you think of the Paranoid team before the XBOX game, we’re looking for your skills.



The Back-End team works with GRAILS, Java, MySql, Redis and all things based on OO principals. Configuring and  building scalable, high-performance, back-end applications in groovy to interface with a dynamic web and mobile front-end is part of the day to day. If you believe that a problem well put is half solved, we’ve got a comfy place for you to write elegant solutions.



We're looking for great developers on each of our product teams: mobile applications, back-end infrastructure, and front-end web applications. One-to-one fit or a one-to-many, we're interested in both seasoned veterans and recent graduates and all flavors in-between.

item.title: Senior Full-Stack Ruby on Rails Developer at Aureso (Singapore) (allows remote)
item.description:
Keeping sight of the big picture while developing well-architected enterprise SaaS solutions excites you? You have strong experiences in working with Ruby and building cloud services/software solutions? Ideally (not obligatory) you also have acquired deep developer knowledge (min. 2 years experience) in at least one of the following fields: Digital Marketing, CRM, Capacity Planning, Business Intelligence or Big Data management? Then you are the one we are looking for to strengthen our engineering team!


This is an exciting opportunity (temporary/project-based or full-time) for mid-/senior-level RoR developers who are interested in defining and revising the architecture direction, building key elements of it and providing thought leadership. You will design, develop and ship innovative new user experiences for the automotive retail industry (and beyond) and assist in monitoring the production service to ensure reliability and performance.


You'll be on a team with a lot of freedom, and as a result, own a lot of responsibility. Take features from conception to completion and become a core member of the development team at every level of the platforms stack!

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer f/m at Smaato Inc. (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
The Systems Engineering Team at Smaato operates a highly available, globally distributed, latency bound web service hosted exclusively on Amazon Web Services. Our environment relies heavily on Ubuntu LTS in EC2, as well as many other AWS services. We are actively expanding to include new technologies and new operational capacity through automation and monitoring. We are also looking into all that new and hip container stuff.


Key Responsibilities:
You are an experienced Linux Systems Engineer, comfortable with working in terminal, and editing in vi. You lust for automating infrastructure tasks, and are willing to take on a slew of challenges to help build something new and enable us to meet new challenges.
You dream of running large clusters of systems efficiently, and quickly resolving problems as they appear. Your desire for a monitored and properly metricked platform borders on obsessional. You have used BSD and four different flavors of Linux, and found them all just not quite perfect enough. You see the potential in quickly adjusting infrastructure around the needs of the moment, and prediction around upcoming requirements.

item.title: Software Engineer at Google (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.


Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.



Responsibilities


  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.

item.title: Senior Java Engineer for Disruptive Insurance Startup at Goji (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Insurance is a complex product that everyone needs but few understand. At Goji, our mission is to deliver something that consumers aren’t getting anywhere else – clarity and peace of mind. In a market that bombards consumers with gimmicky ways to save, we provide consumers an easy way to comparison shop top brands and purchase insurance that best fits their needs. By combining human expertise with smart technology, Goji has helped over 700,000 people make better, more informed decisions. As a result, we have grown quickly to become one of the largest independent, online insurance agencies in the country.


Job Summary:


Our vision is to integrate the fractured value chain from consumers to insurance carriers by building cutting-edge applications (e.g. Expedia or Charles Schwab for insurance). Thus, technology and data are at the core of what differentiates us in a large industry that is ripe for disruption. Here are a few of the ambitious projects we are working on:



  • A responsive SaaS application for our sales process that integrates a robust predictive dialer, a dynamic customer relationship management system, and an end-to-end insurance buying platform

  • Real-time lead buying platform based on rigorous data analytics

  • Integrating with carrier partners to transact policies completely on our platform

  • Customer facing portal to purchase, view and manage policies


The Goji development team is led by folks who have leveraged their backgrounds in computer science, math and engineering to build and scale multiple technology companies. We strongly believe that empowered people are the key to building a great company, and our development process focuses on iteratively improving our product as well as ourselves as individuals and as a team. We are looking to add a Senior Engineer who can be a core member of our team and work on every part of the stack to accelerate product development. So if you share our ambition and want to help shape the technology that will make it happen, then join our team!

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Quotient, Inc. (Bethesda, MD)
item.description:
Why THIS job?


Your work will be seen by medical researchers all over the world as you work for Quotient on site with the National Institute of Health and it’s Departments, Library, and Research Centers designing and updating their websites, databases and creating new online, interactive tools.


Quotient, established in 1999, is a small business providing a range of technical expertise to include web design and development, program and project management and information technology solutions and support to government and private industry. Quotient is dedicated to providing the highest quality and most cost-effective solutions to our clients. Quotient has a solid track record based on timely completion of contract requirements and superior work quality. Quotient’s core capabilities include: web and enterprise content management, web design and development, application design, development and maintenance, cybersecurity, systems engineering, and project management. 


Since our inception, Quotient has served defense and civilian Federal Government clients, growing steadily in both the number of contracts and the scope of our business enterprise.  


We have an opportunity in Bethesda, MD for a JEE Developer (7 + years of experience necessary).  This is a permanent position that offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.



  1. Strong JEE application full life cycle development experience.  Proficient in JEE and all aspects of Object Oriented Application Development and Object Oriented Programming

  2. Strong Analysis experience including Rational Unified Process (RUP), Domain Modeling, Usecases, Data Patterns, etc.

  3. Ability to provide development guidelines utilizing design skills including Infrastructure and Feature definition, Componentization, Object Oriented Design using UML

  4. Ability to participate in code reviews, assist with project plans and resource allocation.

  5. Programming in Java, proficient skills in JEE components such as: EJB, JNDI, Servlets, JSP.  Experience in Spring, Hibernate, Ant/Maven.  Knowledge and experience with SQL, Javascript.

  6. Understanding of web services technologies.

  7. Relational Data Base knowledge/experiences such as Oracle database. Demonstrated experiences in understanding and writing complex queries, a good understanding of stored procedures, best practices in programming for relational databases.

  8. Ability to work in Agile environment.

  9. Experiences in Unix platform, Linux, Window 7, etc.

  10. Experience with tools such as Eclipse, Visio, Toad, Jira, Git

  11. Ability to understand/pick up business domain knowledge within a short time period. Good verbal communication. Good writing skills such as writing systems or application documentation, etc.  Ability to multi-task in the software development life cycle

  12. Good team player and is willing to work with domain people (non-IT people) as well as developers and team leader.

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer at Sauce Labs Inc (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Sauce Labs provides the world's largest automation cloud for testing web and native/hybrid mobile applications. Founded by the original creator of Selenium, Sauce Labs helps companies accelerate software development cycles, improve application quality and deploy with confidence across 500+ browser / OS platforms. Join us in making the world a better place for continuous integration and software development. We’re building a next generation infrastructure as a service platform.


We’re looking for Senior Systems Engineer to join our Ops Team. This role will be responsible for the successful operations and scaling of the infrastructure and software that powers Sauce Labs and launches over 10 million VMs a month.


Responsibilities:




  • Write tools and scripts to provide automation and self service solutions for ourselves and other teams




  • Design new systems to support production services




  • Install, configure and debug hardware and systems in our data center;




  • Creatively solve scale challenges regarding a rapidly expanding cloud environment;




  • Work with real hardware - high density Cisco UCS B-series blades and C-series rack-mount servers, Nexus networking (10Gb+ core network), storage (NAS and SAN), Mac-in-a-datacenter, custom appliances for mobile devices, load balancers, and beyond;




  • Help improve monitoring and identify key performance metrics;




  • Proactive R&D - discovering and implementing new tools, emerging technology, etc.;




  • Disaster recovery design, implementation, and maintenance;




  • Create NOC runbooks, procedures, documentation, and diagrams of the environments you manage;




  • Troubleshooting and resolution of server/network issues;




  • Help maintain hardware in Sauce’s colocation facilities;




  • Help build out new data centers around the globe;




  • Participation in 24x7 on-call rotation.




Here are a couple of examples of the kind of projects you might work on:




  • Optimize hardware and configuration for improving hypervisor performance.




  • Automating and migrating a system configuration to our UCS platform for faster production scaling.




  • Building and optimizing a logstash cluster for our development team to monitor and analyze production system usage.




We have a lot of big projects and decisions that need to be made, and in this role you would be a key part of that process. Sound like fun? Here’s what we’re looking for:


Our Ideal Candidate:




  • 3+ years recent experience working as a Linux administrator/engineer at scale (hundreds of systems) and designing/deploying ‘highly available’ solutions;






  • 2+ years of recent professional experience designing, developing, and operating Configuration Management solutions such as Chef, Puppet, Salt (preferred), or Ansible (preferred) at scale;




  • Solid experience in Linux tuning, profiling, and monitoring;




  • Strong skills in at least one language: Python (preferred), Ruby, Bash.




Bonus points for:




  • Experience deploying/managing KVM-Qemu and LXC




  • Solid understanding of cloud/networking/distributed computing environment concepts; including TCP/ IP connections, firewalls, VLANs, etc.




  • Experience and understanding of contemporary metrics, monitors, and logging solutions especially statsD, Graphite, ELK, Splunk, Nagios, etc.




  • Provisioning and automation with Cisco Unified Computing System Manager




  • Highly organized, able to multi-task, able to work individually, as well as within a team, and across teams;




  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written across all user levels;




  • Deployment automation in physical and virtual environments (PXE, Cobbler, MAAS (preferred));




  • Working knowledge of load balancing technologies (hard/soft);




  • Proven experience collaborating in a cross functional team environment;




  • Familiarity with software engineering practices, including n-tier architecture, configuration management, development methodologies (e.g. agile, waterfall, spiral, prototyping), etc.




Notes:



  • This role can be based in either South Bay or in San Francisco. Some travel to South Bay or SF is required.

  • Relocation available.

item.title: Be a hero in helping us solve complex Big Data problems! at kCura (Portland, OR)
item.description:
The Sr. Software Engineer (Portland) is responsible for delivering results for the Product Development department by:


• Contributing to an Agile team that solves complex challenges and builds working software


• Rapidly producing high quality code • Being a dependable and highly skilled development resource for peers


The Sr. Software Engineer performs the following functions, in addition to others, in the administration of their position:


• Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code.


• Prepares and installs solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming.


• Improves operations by conducting systems analysis, recommending changes in policies and procedures.


• Encourages pair programming and collaborative design


• Thinks out loud- Consistently communicates ideas to others


• Provides development expertise to team members  through education and review


• Always open to new ideas and encourages innovative practices amongst peers


• Works collaboratively with QA professionals to encourage defect prevention over detection


• May be required to handle technical support calls after hours about two times a year. If Client Services is working on a ticket and they are not able to solve an urgent issue, they will reach out to the level I developer to assist to get the issue resolved.


In addition to the above responsibilities, the Senior Software Engineer is expected to display professionalism in the following ways:


• Maintain an attitude of commitment through outward display of willingness


• Practice positive interactions - lean on encouragement in place of judgment


• Impress responsibility on others by displaying ownership in tasks


• Act in the best interest of the overall team

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (.NET) - IoT/Cleantech Company at Syncromatics (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Tagline: Make Transit Work


Come help us build the next generation of technology for the transportation industry!


Syncromatics is a leading provider of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) serving transit agencies, universities and private operators across the country.  We collect GPS and other sensor data from buses, shuttles, trolleys and other moving vehicles and then transport it via cellular networks to our back-end systems for real-time aggregation, analytics, alerting and reporting.  All of this information is used by dispatchers, transit planners and the riding public to make transit systems more accessible to riders, and run more efficiently for operators.


Location: Downtown Los Angeles, CA (DTLA)


Syncromatics is headquartered in the PacMutual building, located adjacent to Pershing Square and easily accessible via the 7th St/Metro Center and Pershing Square Metro stations.  Many of our employees take advantage of public transportation.  Employees who choose to drive are made fun of for excessively loving their cars and paying for parking.  The Pershing Square/Bunker Hill area is a thriving, revitalized area of downtown Los Angeles with limitless restaurants, coffee shops, gyms, shopping and other amenities.  Our building alone houses Water Grill, Tender Greens, Starbucks, Earthbar, two amazing French cafes (Le Pain Quotidien and Pitchoun), a sandwich shop, a crepe place, Verizon, FedEx and a high-end boutique fashion store that never has any customers.  Did we mention that a Whole Foods is going in a few blocks away where you'll be able to overspend on lunch every day? The Kogi taco truck also sets up shop nearby every Friday!


The Role:


In addition to being able to consume vast quantities of food, we're looking for a strong .NET generalist eager to work in an environment with a diverse ecosystem of applications:  web apps and services, native mobile apps, high-level embedded apps, network programming, the Actor Model (Akka.net), messaging systems, relational databases, etc.  We don't expect incoming engineers to have experience/expertise in all of these areas but we seek those who are looking to learn new things and have confidence in their own ability to get up to speed quickly.


Problems you will tackle:



  • Building a highly-available, distributed system using messaging systems and the actor model

  • Reporting on large amounts of event, log and time-series data

  • Building out scalable RESTful APIs for both internal and external consumption

  • Building real-time, web-socket based user interfaces


Our Engineering Culture



  • We pride ourselves on being connected with the growing open-source community in the .NET world.

  • TDD, continuous integration, frequent deployments.

  • ChatOps - in addition to being the control center for deploying apps, our chat rooms give us insight into our system health, Kanban process and where people are eating lunch.


Benefits:



  • Generous Health and Dental Benefits, 401k plan, bonus plan. Parking stipend, or if you take public transportation, we'll cover the entire pass (including Metrolink)!

  • kegerator, ping pong, caffeinated beverages, snacks, you know, standard issue stuff…

item.title: Application Engineer at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 


We are looking for a talented individual to be a key technical evangelist about Exaptive, educating the user community and customers in writing, presentations, and short videos.  He or she will support the sales process through demos, technical training sessions, proposals, and proofs of concept to identify customer needs, design solutions, and communicate Exaptive’s unique value.  This role is the bridge between us and our community, communicating our story to our community and representing that community in shaping our company’s direction.


We will provide intensive training during which you will create top notch documentation and video tutorials for our users – written and video.  The role will evolve according to the dynamic needs of a startup and to your talents and professional desires.           


This position will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to other Exaptive and customer locations. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as an opportunity to excel. The startup environment is not for everyone, but offers the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 



Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). We were also recently named a Gartner Cool Vendor (http://blogs.gartner.com/michael-shanler/cool-vendors-in-life-science/).  Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 

If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation expenses.

item.title: Mobile Engineer at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting-edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise; mobile and desktop; external and internal; user-driven and automated; and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


More specifically, we are building apps on both Android and iOS, a customer-facing web application, a robust web services API, machine learning-driven analytics, and large-scale data processing. As a mobile engineer, you will be working on both platforms in addition to working in the API layer.


You must be hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member. You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary: we are growing very quickly, but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long-term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.


This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Backend Engineer at Nimble Collective (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Do you love animation? Do you want to use your coding super powers to change the animation world? Then this is an opportunity of a lifetime.


The animation landscape is ripe for disruption and we want you to be the catalyst. We have the technology to change everything about creating. But we need talented, prolific and endlessly creative engineers to join us in blazing this new trail! Come with us on our journey to enable millions of creators to manifest their visions for billions of eyeballs!


Nimble Collective seeks a motivated deadline driven, flexible and positive individual focused on developing our backend service-based architecture. You will be instrumental in designing the services that control the flow of data in an animation pipeline, working closely with our pipeline and frontend engineers. Understanding of Computer Generated Imagery process is a bonus.

item.title: Web Developer at Garena Online Private Limited (Singapore)
item.description:
Description:


The web developer would be someone with strong experience in web and server side technologies. This is a fast-paced position that requires a high degree of energy and focus without compromising quality.


Responsibilities:



  • Write server-side Python code as well as client-side Javascript/HTML/CSS code that powers the whole web user workflow

  • Build new features and fix bugs

  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use

  • Optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Implementation of security and data protection

  • Write high-quality, clean, maintainable code using engineering best practices (unit testing, source control, continuous integration, automation, design patterns, etc.)

  • Collaborate with other software engineers, product managers, user experience designer, and operations engineers to build new products with web technologies

item.title: C# Developer at Best Lawyers (New York, NY)
item.description:
Best Lawyers is seeking a C# Developer for a new interactive legal platform, built on the foundation of our 35 years as the most respected legal peer review network. The primary role will be to develop and support an API infrastructure for this initiative. The developer will also be challenged to maintain, improve, and create new features in an ever-changing environment while ensuring stability and site performance.


We are seeking a passionate developer looking to join a strong team. We need a proud problem solver, constant learner, and a continuous contributor to the team IQ level.

item.title: We would Love to Find a Great Front End Web Interface Developer! at SocialFlow Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Create dynamic and compelling tools and visual dashboards so the most recognized news, media, retail, and publisher brands in the world can get the most out of their social media efforts.


We utilize the emerging best practices and standards for quality software development.


We use github for workflow; topic branches + pull requests. Management is lean and meetings are short.


We have a web service based architecture which empowers front-end engineering to develop truly real-time, dynamic content, without waiting around for a backend team to build the other end of each feature.


Organizationally we attempt to develop cross functional teams. If you want to also work on the controllers or schema, that is encouraged, but not required.


We need developers that have an eye for UX, and can innovate rapidly on top social media APIs. We currently work with Twitter (Official Partner for Ad Tech & Engagement and Publishing), Facebook (Official Marketing Partner for Ad Tech and Community Management), Google (Integrated Partner), Pinterest (Official Partner), LinkedIn and G+ with more to come.


SocialFlow is a great place to work where you can feel proud knowing many of the most recognized brand names in the world are using the products you have helped to create.

item.title: Systems Engineer at ROBLOX (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
About the Job
Become a member of an elite technical team advancing the infrastructure of ROBLOX, the largest indie game development platform in the world with more than 17 million unique active users. We are ranked #1 among kids entertainment sites in the U.S. for the number of daily visitors, total minutes, total page views, total visits, and average length of visits by ComScore. Each month we have more than 4.4 million active users and more than 70 million hours of engagement. Our users have created more than 15 million games and have played 2 billion hours since 2008.

As a Data Center Ops Engineer, your duties will include, but are not limited to:



  • Maintain a 99.9% SLA for a 24/7/365 production environment

  • Triage, troubleshoot, and solve production issues caused by failures in hardware, configuration, networking, vendor outages, and continuous software upgrades

  • Quickly resolve complex problems encountered during the installation and operation of our applications, to ensure negligible impact on players and internal operations

  • Prioritize and multitask daily responsibilities, while being flexible enough to respond to emergent high-priority issues

  • Design, deploy and configure servers and complex firewall environments

  • Assist in implementing disaster recovery procedures and system failover efforts

  • Collaborate with highly skilled and driven colleagues in a dynamic, agile environment

  • Collect, document and help manage vendor-related services

  • Manage systems and develop contingency plans

  • Participate in on-call rotations


Our infrastructure management system is highly automated, enabling engineers to interact with thousands of servers across multiple environments in parallel via the command line. Our application space includes database scalability, caching, message queuing, wide-table search, recommendations, user ratings, services for mobile devices, gaming cloud management, and virtualization. We live in both the cloud and traditional data center environments.


Perks & Benefits:



  • Robust medical, dental and vision insurance

  • 401k

  • Flexible time-off

  • Wellness reimbursement

  • Free onsite parking & other commuter benefits

  • Free catered lunches & a fully stocked kitchen with unlimited snacks!

  • Chance to work with a top-notch team on cool and unique projects!


ROBLOX does not accept unsolicited resumes from 3rd party recruiters.

item.title: C# Developer at Best Lawyers (Aiken, SC)
item.description:
Best Lawyers is seeking a C# Developer for a new interactive legal platform, built on the foundation of our 35 years as the most respected legal peer review network. The primary role will be to develop and support an API infrastructure for this initiative. The developer will also be challenged to maintain, improve, and create new features in an ever-changing environment while ensuring stability and site performance.


We are seeking a passionate developer looking to join a strong team. We need a proud problem solver, constant learner, and a continuous contributor to the team IQ level.

item.title: Product Marketing Manager - Mobile at New Relic (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to join our Product Marketing team, leading outbound product marketing activities specifically for our New Relic Mobile product, used by thousands of developers to ensure the performance of literally hundreds of millions of mobile app instances. If you’re looking to make an impact in mobile, this is a great way to do it!


In this role you will be the “CMO of the product”, owning product & competitive positioning, sales enablement, market & competitive analysis, product launches, customer development, and more for New Relic Mobile. What makes product marketing at New Relic different is that we provide product marketers with an exceptionally broad, experienced team of marketing colleagues as a foundation to do the some of the best work of your career.

item.title: Software Developer for dynamic startup, latest web technologies at MindLink Software (London, UK)
item.description:
You will work with our kick-ass core development team to design, develop and deliver our high-quality full-stack solutions in JavaScript and C#.


Want to build high-quality mobile applications? You will, with MindLink targeting all major mobile operating systems (iOS, Android, BlackBerry 10) we use hybrid technology (cordova) to deliver a native experience with a highly shared code base.


Excited by developing and using your own APIs? MindLink has a core RESTful API that can be used to develop integrating components - you will help shape that API and use it for fun and useful side projects. Think hooking into GitHub, JIRA or the London Underground.


Love the latest technologies? We are passionate about using the latest technologies to deliver even better applications. The latest advancements in ECMAScript and .Net are readily brought in to make code more readable, more efficient and more modern.


Want to improve your JavaScript or .Net knowledge? You can, MindLink is full of bright engineers who you will work with closely developing across the full MindLink stack.


Care deeply about performance? We do too! Whether it's improving the user experience or optimising protocols to minimise data transfer there is always a way to get a little more performance.


Want to take on the next big challenge? MindLink is making professional chat easy, elegant and powerful. Innovating what once was stale and integrating into the lives of millions of professionals in companies around the globe.


Think you have the skill, ideas and playful determination to join our team? You could be part of research and development or the fast-paced agile product release team.

item.title: Software Engineer, Firmware at Cisco Meraki (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The firmware team (wireless and switching & appliance) develops the software that runs on our networking gear. We focus on simplicity over bell and whistles, and leverage data from thousands of networks around the world to continuously improve the performance and stability of our products.


Because our devices are managed from the cloud, customers are able to deploy firmware upgrades to their networks with just a few clicks. This means that we can develop new features, iterate on existing features, and fix bugs far more quickly than most of our competitors.


Example projects and tasks for the firmware team include:



  • Implementing a scalable, distributed wireless roaming feature to seamlessly hand off client connections between access points in large campus deployments.

  • Developing fast and accurate deep packet inspection features so network administrators can see what applications are being used on their network and use that to inform decisions about network policies.

  • Implementing controlled delay queuing to help counteract "buffer bloat".

  • Analyzing data collected from thousands of networks to improve channel selection, airtime fairness, and bit-rate selection for wireless clients.

  • Implementing dynamic routing protocols such as OSPF with enough flexibility to support our customers' use cases while keeping the configuration interface easy to understand.

  • Implementing VRRP-based high-availability features so our appliances and switches can be deployed in redundant pairs.

  • Virtualizing our security appliance firmware, and then building out a testbed of thousands of virtual appliances (each with simulated clients behind them) for scale testing our products.

item.title: Full Stack .NET Web Developer at Frontpoint (Vienna, VA)
item.description:
Are you seeking the freedom to creatively solve interesting problems while also engineering something that genuinely makes a difference? Join the company that brought technological advancement to the home security industry!


We’re looking for a full stack .NET Web Developer to join our awesome development team.This is a fast paced, enterprise scale, B2C environment. Our developers build software for all components of the organization. This involves heavy front-end web development for systems that are both internally and externally facing, integration with back-end third party APIs, analytical services, & tons of data. We have awesome tools at our disposal like the latest Visual Studio, Resharper, the RedGate SQL Bundle, top-notch hardware setups.  We use the latest versions of all our tools and do our best to keep up with the rapid evolution of javascript and other front-end frameworks.


 If you like a start-up culture without the start-up risk, you’ll love working at Frontpoint! 


Responsibilities:



  • Write tons of code across the full stack – front end Web UI, middle tier service layer, and back end database

  • Perform analysis of requirements and design

  • Create and execute unit tests and perform basic systems testing

  • Participate in peer code reviews and technical meetings

  • Mentor lower-level engineers in coding practices and process

  • Work in an Agile Scrum team process, collaborating closely with fellow developers, DBAs, QA, team leads, and stakeholders

  • Troubleshoot and support system and application problems

item.title: Senior .NET Developer at Excelian (London, UK)
item.description:
Excelian are looking for Server Side C# Developers who will be an enthusiastic and disciplined technologist, with experience across multiple projects, able to take on a variety of development roles in fast paced financial markets projects.


You should be someone who keeps abreast of the key technology trends in their field and who is keen to contribute to the community of technologists across the company, as well as mentoring more junior developers. In particular, you must be delivery focussed, adaptable, pragmatic yet thorough and able to analyse requirements.


We need you to contribute to the design of elements of code and applications, implement best practice and have experience of working in a variety of methodologies, including Agile and Waterfall. Fundamentally we are looking for someone who is more than just a developer who has a consultancy mind-set, can write enterprise quality code at the same time as contributing to the client and Excelian.


 As a server side developer, the candidate will be responsible for:



  • Designing and implementing database schema, i.e. tables, stored procedures, functions, keys, indices, etc in SQL Server 2005/2008

  • Implementing interfaces/apis to expose access methods to database in Data Access Layer, Business Logic Layer, etc

  • Designing and building WCF, Windows Service components to fulfill the business process flow

  • Coordinating with Front-End UI developers and BAs to ensure smooth and seamless delivery

  • Writing Unit Tests to ensure desired code coverage (>80%)

  • Implementing automated regression test framework using Fitnesse

item.title: Senior Designer - UI/UX experience at Loggly (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Loggly is seeking a Sr. Designer to join our Software Engineering team. Loggly is the world’s most popular cloud-based enterprise-class log management solution.  We’ve recently received $15M in new funding to accelerate our rapid growth and we’re staffing up.


Our customers send us an explosive volume of log data 7x24x365.  Our challenge?  Make it easy for our users to instantly understand what their logs are telling them. This is real-time big data that is mission critical for our customers.  Do you have the code-writing capabilities to take on this task? And to succeed in a big way? 


About the Team


The product team at Loggly believes that the quality of our software and its simplicity reflects directly on us as professionals.  And because our customers are all engineers themselves, they notice.  We’re relentless about crafting a product that is innovative, delivers a user experience that people remember and is ever faster and more robust.


As a key and senior member on our team, you will collaborate with other executives, engineers, product management, and operations. We’re a small team so every individual matters. 


Our culture is fun, fast-paced, performance-oriented, open, collegial, and we are constantly pushing the technology envelope to the edge!  All of our positions are based in the financial district of San Francisco, CA right on top of a BART and Muni stop.


 We are looking for:


We're looking for a UI / UX Designer who can help drive the interface from both a technical perspective across all of our design assets as well as CSS code. You must be a critical, inventive thinker with a clear sense of user-centered design process, an excitement for understanding and using data, and an ability to communicate your ideas effectively.


You'll lead the evolution of our product with conceptual design, but have enough respect for your craft to be able to implement pixel-perfect design. You'll champion the voice of the user by conducting ongoing research of how people are using the Loggly product - using this feedback to inform your design. You are a part of the engineering team, and should be technical enough to grow to understand the core use cases around our audience of DevOps and SysAdmins.  


 What you'll do:



  • Translate complex visions and product functionality into simple, streamlined, and elegant designs that emphasize minimal effort for our thousands of customers.

  • Create and communicate design principles and guidelines for our team to follow.

  • Deliver detailed prototypes, mockups, wireframes, and design assets. 

  • Design tools and workflows for internal teams.

  • Run design reviews with cross-functional teams and conduct usability testing with external customers.

  • Work from high-level requirements and ask the right questions to gather all relevant information to guide design direction.

  • Quickly iterate on multiple design explorations to arrive at a simple, but robust solution, accounting for complex requirements.

  • Design for current experiences while also envisioning and creating new experiences for future features.

  • Collaborate on and present work to a range of stakeholders – executives, engineers, product managers and business leaders.

  • Stay current on emerging design trends, music innovations, and broader technologies and identify opportunities to incorporate best current thinking into product designs.


 What’s Next


If you're interested in joining the team; please send us your resume. Let us know how you fit the bill for each of our requirements. Loggly is a place that values individuality, variety, and diversity. We have lots of hikers, bikers, gamers, musicians and other interesting folks so use your judgment and write to us in your own voice about your talents.  If you have a presence on the web that we can easily access where you contribute to an open source project, write a blog, or practice another craft besides designing powerful software, we’d love to hear about it.


We’ll start with an initial phone interview and based on that, we’ll invite you in to meet the team – starting with the CTO and CEO; as we said, we’re a small team and every member is important!  We hope you’ll do some research on Loggly and try out our product before you arrive.




  • Loggly is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

  • **Immigration sponsorship will be considered**

  • **NO relocation available**

  • **Must work onsite full-time in San Francisco, CA**

item.title: Polyglot / Artisan Engineer at LShift Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Fantastic opportunities available for skilled Software Engineers to join LShift in our London Office. Be a part of the most interesting technical team around!


Our outlook is moulded around the principle of recruiting only candidates who combine breadth and depth of outlook and experience. We do not recruit people to slot into a particular technical role, but all-rounders familiar with a broad range of operating environments, programming languages, etc., combined with a high level of software engineering expertise.

item.title: C++ Experienced Software Developer at think-cell Software GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for smart, creative developers with a solid theoretical background. You should be able to look at a problem from the user's perspective, discuss abstract concepts with fellow developers, as well as produce an elegant implementation. Developers we have hired in the past mostly hold an exceptional master's degree in computer science or even a doctorate.


At think-cell, we like flat hierarchies. You will work largely independently and will be responsible for the whole range of activities when implementing a new feature. We expect each of our developers to do architecture, design, implementation, customer feedback and bug fixing,  rather than splitting these activities between several people. We thus minimize communication losses and put everyone in control of their own work. Your ideas are welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better.


We have published several scientific articles in the areas of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Graphics and we will encourage you to do the same. We sponsor visits to conferences and have close connections to universities and research institutes in the U.S. and Germany.


think-cell encourages a healthy work-life balance. We do not work at night or on weekends, and support our staff's families with a full-time company nanny. She is available for free when children are sick, or if you just feel like spending an evening out.


We pay very competitive salaries, and offer our developers EUR 120,000 annually following one year of employment. If necessary, we will go out of our way to help you relocate to Berlin, and will do what we can to help you acquire a work permit.

item.title: Software Engineer at Noom (New York, NY)
item.description:
You


Noom is looking for an awesome Software Engineer who's a true team player and passionate about engineering, with tons of programming experience (doesn't matter if it was at Apple or in your mom’s basement) and excellent communication skills. A CS background or degree usually helps a lot, but is not a strict requirement if you really know your stuff.


Our Tech


At our core, we are a team of great engineers from world-class companies, so we take our tech very seriously. We work to improve our tools and approaches every day -- whether pushing the envelope with automated unit-tests or writing a super-optimized data analysis framework. We don't over-engineer and also don't under-engineer -- just the right tool for the job.


We take great pride in our code because we all want to innovate quickly. We build everything from Android software to C++ image recognition, from web UI to pedometer data analysis. Our apps operate off-line, and we have built lots of client-side infrastructure to lazily load and sync data with the server. This allows us to keep the server side relatively simple while still serving millions of users: Spring/Flask, Spring MVC, mySQL/Mongo.


We run Hadoop-based machine learning to find out what makes people stick to habits, create online clustering algorithms to match people to their ideal support group, serve millions of users with many terabytes of data, and tackle many difficult challenges every day. Because we are small dev team (17 strong), working at Noom gives you the unique opportunity to both use what we have created and build many more foundational technologies.  


Our Culture


We have worked hard to build an awesome company culture, stealing a bit from Google (many of us are ex-Googlers) and improving on it to become one of Crain’s “Best Places to Work in NYC 2013”
