Our tech team works with a ton of interesting Noomers and advisers, including our in-house psychologist as well as fitness experts, physicians and researchers.  We test our prototypes on sample users, averaging 2 user-tests a day, so you’ll be able to see how real people react to your work and iterate.  So unlike most tech companies, you’ll interact with a diverse network of people.  After all, we are team of problem solvers, always interested in learning and growing.


If you’re worried about being pigeonholed, fear not.  You’ll get to choose a mission (usually for 4 - 6 months) and work on the projects you’re interested in. We also have frequent company-wide hackathons. Everyone on the team is a generalist -- we explore new frameworks, and learn them quickly. We like to learn.


We are now ready to double the size of our engineering team with some incredible engineers (read on below!).


Our Company


Noom, Inc. is a mobile solutions company focused on preventative health.


Noom's research-backed products help people achieve real, positive outcomes. Noom was awarded a grant from the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and was also recently selected as one of seven healthcare startups chosen to participate in the 2014 New York Digital Health Accelerator (NYDHA).


Noom's apps boast more than 32 million installs worldwide and its flagship app Noom Coach for Android has been the #1 top grossing Health and Fitness App since 2012 in the Google Play Store. Noom has offices in New York City, Berlin, Seoul and Tokyo.


But we need your help -- read on if you think you’ve got the stuff.


Our Products


At Noom we tackle some of the world’s biggest problems -- obesity, diabetes and heart disease.  We believe the best way to do this is by focusing on nutrition (TechCrunch) and fitness (GigaOm).  More than just counting calories, our mobile software applications offer intelligent, scientifically-backed, customized nutrition- and exercise-coaching designed to impact habits and behavior.  


Our flagship app, Noom Weight Loss Coach, has been the #1 top grossing health & fitness application since 2012.  It achieves the best outcomes in the industry with over 10 pounds lost per paid member.  How, you ask?  Great question!  It has:


* A coaching engine that generates personalized daily tasks & realtime motivational feedback;


* The world’s most accurate food database, crowd-sourced by users & instantly searchable;


* Virtual support groups created using automated clustering technology and tracked using scalable management tools.


* A focus on simplicity and friendliness, to make all of the above easy to use


* Many more features focused around guidance & motivation for our users


Our Benefits


If you want to learn how a startup really works on the inside, then Noom is the place for you. We have an incredible amount of transparency, with weekly all-company TGIFs where the wine and the information both flow freely (much to our legal counsel’s dismay).  Because you’ll have equity in the company and have to make many decisions in your work, it’s important for you to know what’s going on.  


We have an amazing chef (we love her!) who prepares gourmet lunches every day for all employees (along with afternoon smoothies and random breakfasts and dinners), a lively office with frequent visitors, and a dedicated team who work hard and play hard, with frequent offsites (beach, anyone?) and team outings (from shuffleboard to wine tasting).  We also have more cakes than is probably healthy (welcome cakes, birthday cakes, goodbye cakes and cakes just because -- no joke).


Plus health insurance (100% paid by Noom) and a 401(k). We also have a $200 wellness budget, which you can spend on everything from triathlon registration fees to massages.

item.title: CTO - Data Scientist w/ AWS + financial data expertise at Quadrant (New York, NY)
item.description:
Quadrant builds innovative tools to find, visualize, and analyze data. We are looking for an in-house CTO + Data Scientist with strong AWS and financial data experience. You will be a core member of a founding team in a small office. Great communication and adherence to very high standards is essential.


We're building an industry-leading platform for querying, analyzing, scaling and distributing time series data. The CTO must be fluent in large-scale data processing using AWS services. Words that shouldn't scare you include partitioned tables, automated testing, Amazon Aurora, Cloudflare, recommendation engines. You must also like building things that have never been built before.


Our clients include large banks, asset managers, hedge funds.


Qualified candidates will be:



  • Intellectually curious & competent

  • Speed and Security focused

  • Experienced in implementing best practices and techniques

  • Organized

  • Able to design & implement high-performance systems

item.title: Software Engineer at Lyst (London, UK)
item.description:
Lyst are looking for software engineers who enjoy writing python to work on the huge technical challenges that come with building the world’s leading fashion commerce site.


As a software engineer you will ensure that the platform continues to over exceed shoppers expectations, helping us to constantly release new features and improve functionality. You will work in a product-led cross-discipline team on everything from helping to choose the best tools and frameworks to working with design and product exciting new features. You will have a huge chance to influence the way code, culture and product are built at Lyst.


At the heart of Lyst is a huge data aggregator that lists millions of fashion products from hundreds of retailers. On top of this we build systems that help people discover and follow their favourite fashion brands, ensuring that all of our users are inspired and happy throughout their shopping experience.


As a software engineer at Lyst some of the thing you will be working on:



  • Building real products that fix real world problems, predominantly in a Python based technology stack.

  • The huge challenges that come from working with a database with over 9 million products and a spider architecture performing 3.8 million updates a day.

  • Exposure to product specific teams fixing problems like; Shopping personalisation, Universal Checkout System, Marketing automation technology, PaaS, Our own Data Analytics platform, a new search function and personalisation etc

  • Fixing the interesting problems we face in the best way possible; we are not constricted to tool sets and languages. If you find a solution to a problem that will work better, we use your idea. Best idea wins.

  • Our universal checkout system that allows our users to find any item of clothing from any retailer on our platform, in stock, in their size and ready to buy.

  • Our internal and external REST API’s

  • Creating a development platform, tools and pipeline that is effective and easy to iterate with.

  • Building your own brand and skills. Lyst is a company that will encourage and support you to get involved in the wider community. Events like FOSDEM, PyCon, JS London are regular occurrences on our calendar.

  • Creating better solutions for everything we do, from our culture to the code. This is your company, own it.

item.title: Data & Reporting Analyst for Non-Profit - Raise the bar of Afterschool Programs at Boys & Girls Harbor (New York, NY)
item.description:
Interested in making a measurable difference in the lives of children?  Join the Boys & Girls Harbor team on its mission to empower children and their families to become full, productive participants in society through education, cultural enrichment, and social services.  Boys and Girls Harbor is a leader in arts-infused education offering programming in early education, afterschool programming and performing arts.


We are seeking a dynamic Data & Reporting Analyst to deliver data driven insights to enhance the quality of our programs and services.  In this role you will serve as a data analytics and business intelligence expert by deploying and maintaining infrastructure and data services around educational program recommendations and reporting. 


What You Will Do



  • Define and implement a new data strategy, data store, and tools to collect data for ongoing analysis

  • Interface with business users and technical teams to bridge the gap in terms of data needs and business logic understanding 

  • Develop internal and external business metrics and reports

  • Develop dashboards, visualizations and manage data requests related to key performance goals

  • Explore data and provide insights, working closely with program teams to identify opportunities to optimize revenue and growth potential

  • Be the champion for sharing data across the organization and actively present findings

item.title: Senior QA Performance Engineer at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Fidelity Investment's Fidelity Institutional Technology (FIT) division is seeking a Senior Software Quality Assurance Performance Test Engineer for our Durham, NC site. The individual will be responsible for managing the projects as well as testing of  multi-tiered distributed applications. A strong background in performance testing and/or in web development is well suited for this position.  Knowledge of multiple application infrastructures and strong communication skills are required. The Performance Testing & Engineering team is a group of highly skilled engineers who help design, test, and monitor high performing financial service products. In addition to a diverse and deep technical understanding the team members are experts in performance testing and financial services.


Fidelity Institutional Technology (FIT) enables business partners to win in their respective marketplaces by designing, building and maintaining the technology platforms and products of Fidelity Institutional and parts of the Retail and Workplace Investing divisions.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Develop test strategies using project artifacts as well as in depth interviews of architects and development leads

  • Create or modify performance scripts for Web based applications using HP LoadRunner with the Web and Web Services protocols

  • Execute performance tests on applications to assure capacity and stability of the applications meets requirements for production deployment.

  • Monitor all impacted systems for network connection disruptions as well as any obscure application behavior resulting from a network anomaly.

  • Measure resource consumption of components and processes and latency at measurable points in the systems under test

  • Identify application bottlenecks and assist engineers with improving application performance and reducing latency

  • Communicate performance testing results and identify areas for improvement with stakeholders at all levels

  • Manage project deliverables and drive delivery of performance output with project managers, developers, and peers.

  • Provide interim reports as well as a final report that summarize results to senior management.


Why Fidelity?



  • Three consecutive years on CareerBliss’ Top 50 Happiest Companies Employees Survey

  • A company that is committed to innovation and being an industry leader by investing in technology

  • More than 12,000 technology professionals utilizing an Agile methodology enterprise-wide

  • Access to top-tier technology platforms, OS, and frameworks

  • Non-traditional benefits like our Concierge Service, Computer Equipment Purchase Assistance Program and profit sharing eligibility


Company Culture


At Fidelity, you can find it all here.  We reward ambitious, passionate individuals with a work environment that fosters diversity, teamwork and collaboration as well as encourages innovative ideas and fresh thinking. We recognize the value that employees’ individual differences can contribute to the bright and strong future of our company.

item.title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
The SRE team at New Relic consists of engineers who work directly within New Relic's development teams providing operationally focused thinking and development within our products. If you love building highly available products and sharing your experience with others, you will enjoy helping us take our platform to the next level of excellence.

This is a challenging and exciting space. We are actively working to improve the high-availability characteristics of our platform at scale. Designing systems for transparency, with abundant logging, monitoring, and graphing, helps us easily determine the health of the system at any moment. It takes creativity and skill to weave diverse requirements into the functionality our customers have come to depend on. 

Responsibilities:



  • Work directly inside development teams with an eye towards developing for operational readiness.

  • Improve and build upon our automation tools for systems provisioning, monitoring, trending, and management.

  • Independently learn new technologies and master the New Relic platform so that you can provide 'full stack' diagnostics, when necessary, to help determine the root cause of internal problems.

  • Communicate effectively with fellow SREs and other engineering teams, and describe problems succinctly with sufficient detail that you can hand-off an ongoing problem to another team or a peer for completion.

  • Strategize with fellow SREs and other engineering teams on complex problems, and make decisions and recommendations about systems improvements after analyzing possible courses of conduct.

  • Perform periodic on-call duty as part of a global team maintaining the availability and performance of the New Relic site and APIs used by third-party services, as well as the various internal services and systems that these core interfaces depend on.

item.title: QA Lead / Software Engineer in Test at Simply Business (London, UK)
item.description:
Simply Business – We are looking for a QA Lead (this could be a ‘step up’ role for you, or you could already be coming with this experience)


Based onsite in Moorgate, London


The exciting part = It’s totally a blank canvas for someone to come in and set the direction and strategy of our QA and drive that change across the company.


We’re the UK’s leading price comparison site for small businesses and startups looking for insurance. We’ve completed disrupted an ‘old school’ and traditional industry and revolutionized it with our state of the art technology and now we’re looking to grow!


The role



  • You will be our most senior QA person and responsible for taking an excellent Agile QA team to a
    new level

  • Hands-­on whilst leading a team of 6 QA Analysts and setting the direction and strategy for the team
    and the QA function as a whole

  • You will liaise with our Tech Leadership team to continue the strong integration of our QA function in
    the development process

  • As we do Continuous Delivery, your testing focus will be geared heavily to the automation side of
    things, but we do what makes most sense for each situation

  • Work with product owners and track leads to review and set story and feature acceptance criteria

  • Implement business functionality in a testable form

  • Develop appropriate and maintainable test automation functionality at unit, integration and system
    tiers

  • Act as a customer champion within the team, representing risks and needs when implementing
    solutions


Some things we believe in


*Creating an best-in-class technology culture – Agile / Lean / TDD / Continuous Delivery (we release software to production about 14 times a day on average) / pair programming / cross functional teams working together on projects (Dev/QA/UX/product) / Active participation in open source


*Never chaining ourselves to a technology – always experimenting and ‘using the right tool for the job’


*Thought leadership – we host meetup groups and present talks in our office and the community


*Creating a great working environment and culture (modern open plan office, flexible hours, remote working, regular team events, paid company holidays abroad, afterwork clubs – like UX, Robotic, Data science clubs, finish early on fridays, ruby coding challenges over pizza, lunchtime TED talks and lot’s more!)


*Continuous learning – we look to pay for conferences and courses. Recently we have sent some of our team out to Miami, Portugal and Barcelona for tech events and conferences (paid for).


Our tech stack


Cucumber / RSpec / Turnip / Jasmine
Ruby on Rails
MongoDB
RabbitMQ
Puppet/Boxen
AWS
SASS / HAML / HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / CoffeeScript / jQuery


This list is always changing as we do not believe in limiting ourselves with technology, we are always experimenting and using the right tool for the job

item.title: Senior Operations Engineer at SugarCRM (Cupertino, CA)
item.description: SugarCRM Operations has an immediate opening for a customer-focused information technology professional in the role of Site Reliability Engineer. Leveraging Open Source technology to deliver highly available services, our operations group provides 24/7 support in an energetic, fast paced work environment. The successful candidate will possess the focus to work through challenges to ensure customer success and the drive and autonomy to work independently.  You possess excellent written and oral communication skills, deep technical knowledge and experience in a startup environment. We're looking for someone who will be a mentor and can help define the infrastructure that powers all of our online services. You are self-motivated and have a strong commitment to quality.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Data Management at Rise Interactive (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Rise Interactive | Careers | Senior Software Engineer - Data Management


Rise Interactive (http://www.riseinteractive.com), a rapidly growing full service interactive advertising agency, is looking to hire a Senior Software Engineer, focused on Data Management, into the Innovation team.  We are seeking a detail-oriented, highly motivated individual contributor that is excited about joining a new Innovation department and contributing professionally to an entrepreneurial company with an expanding Fortune 500 client base.


SUMMARY AND SCOPE


We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help us build out our marketing and analytics platforms.  Our platform processes billions of records today – and we’re just getting started.  This role is not a research or analytical role.  Our goal is a developer who is extremely strong in data science rather than a data scientist with limited coding skills.  This is an individual contributor role that is expected to contribute to production solutions.  This position will develop the entire data pipeline from source to cube/data node.


Responsibilities:


We operate a cross-functional team that specializes when needed but aims to have everyone able to contribute.   Duties of the Senior Software Engineer include:



  • Implement and optimize data processing pipeline for terabytes of data

  • Design and build our data warehouse as well as real-time data reporting systems



  • Promote and nurture good team practices such as unit testing, code reviews, build/test automation, etc.

  • Proactively mentor and guide application developers to improve their quality and simplicity in design and code

  • Design, build and use tools to understand our product platform behavior and performance

  • Design and conduct experiments to test concepts, technologies, and algorithms

  • Implement analytics tools to maximize the value of collected data

  • Implement data tests in our data quality framework to ensure data is clean and accurate

  • Adhere to security policies and guidelines to ensure our data is protected and safe

  • Embrace and assist in evolving our Agile (Scrum) team processes and developer role responsibilities

item.title: Platform Mobile Engineer at SHOP.CA (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Mobile is a key channel for SHOP.CA and we want to provide our customers with the best mobile (App and HTML) shopping experience.  As Head of Mobile Engineering, you will be responsible for creating, maintaining and executing SHOP.CA’s mobile strategy for phone, tablet across HTML and app solutions.  You are passionate about mobile and user experiences and will create mobile solutions that our customers love to use.  You will create daily KPIs and measure and report on the success of our mobile channels focusing on results first.  You are innovative and will work to create solutions that leverage the latest mobile capabilities in localization, notification, bar-code scanning, voice, etc to create stunning ecommerce solutions for our customers.  You have drive, energy and passion to contribute to a hyper-growth startup in the fastest growing segment in Canada.


Responsibilities:



  • Contribute to the SHOP.CA development organization helping to make SHOP.CA a world-class mobile destination with a terrific consumer experience

  • Develop daily KPIs on mobile site and app utilization, conversion rates, etc

  • Make proactive recommendations to improve customer experience based on analytics

  • Lead the strategy and recommend solutions to meet SHOP.CA’s mobile strategies including

  • support for mobile HTML on phone and tablet devices as well as apps.

  • Participate in development planning sessions and meet agreed deliverable dates for new

  • features and enhancements

  • Safeguard consumer data in accordance with SHOP.CA’s data security policies

  • Adhere to SHOP.CA’s software development lifecycle (SDLC)

  • Work effectively with a tight team of world-class designers, web developers and back-end developers

  • Define, and implement front-end standards for performance, analysis and personalization

  • Quickly resolve outstanding defects and issues

  • Use all available and emerging creative development tools in your work

  • Work collaboratively with team members to clarify business requirements, create comprehensive and viable designs with effort estimations.

  • Actively participate as a direct resource to projects as required in the following areas:


    • Wireframe development (PhotoShop or other similar programs), site (XHTML, DHTML, HTML,

    • CSS, AJAX, JSP, PHP, Flash and JavaScript files) and other solutions employed by SHOP.CA

    • Architect, design, develop, maintain and support all software components of SHOP.CA mobile solutions (iOS, Blackberry & Android)

    • Implementation of business logic server-side in Java/JSP to support the mobile eCommerce platforms.


  • Creating documentation for new features and application changes

  • Supporting our QA team in testing your features formally (test scenarios) as well as informally.

  • Build out QA test ‘lab’ for devices and handsets necessary for the QA team to adequately test SHOP.CA’s mobile strategies

  • Working with our infrastructure team to debug issues as they arise in production.

  • Innovating new solutions and researching new technologies that may complement SHOP.CA’s eCommerce site – help make SHOP.CA’s mobile commerce experience world class


We work in an aggressive, energetic and sometimes frantic environment where exceptional coders thrive. You must be willing to join an early stage, hyper growth company that will require significant time commitments to be successful. It’s not for the meek here, but if you have what it takes, we will push you hard and you’ll gain incredible experience and knowledge solving challenging software engineering projects.

item.title: Back-end Senior Developer at Avaaz.org (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Avaaz is a global civic movement with a community of almost 41 million members and growing. Already, we've been a key force in bringing UN statehood recognition to Palestine, passing revolutionary anti-corruption legislation into law in Brazil, smuggling in sat phones to Syria and humanitarian relief into Burma, and so much more. We’re nimble, multi-lingual (17 languages and counting!), and fiercely independent (100% funded by small online donations from members). We’ve held over 10,000 rallies and events in every country in the world (including the largest climate march in history) and raised over $50 million online. But we’ve just scratched the surface of what’s possible -- and we need the right Senior Developers to help take Avaaz to the next level.



The Senior Developer will be a member of the tech leadership within the organisation, and will take on the challenge of creating a modular, service-oriented back-end that will enable us to scale. We are looking for candidates who have intimate familiarity and experience with industry best practices in software engineering. A strong candidate will have expertise in areas including software design, testing, and technical management. They will also support junior developers, and must be excited to train and mentor them to maintain a high level of quality while implementing solutions quickly.



Our stack:




    Web servers provisioned on AWS




    Legacy web application written in PHP with a MySQL storage




    New micro-services developed mostly in Python, using MySQL and Big Data storage engines




    New front-end service developed using React





Responsibilities:




    Ensure existing and new systems are robust to high traffic, and resilient to failures.




    Ensure that the tech team produces clean, maintainable, extensible, and well-tested software.




    Ensure that our code and software architecture correctly utilize applicable design patterns.




    Support our transition to service-oriented architecture through the design, development, and implementation of micro-services.




    Support continuous improvements to our engineering processes.




    Assist with recruitment and developer training, to ensure that all software developers achieve and maintain a high level of skill.




    Mentor more junior developers on their professional journeys within the Organization.




    Lead and oversee the development of new tools as required by the Organization.






Location:


Avaaz is a virtual organization, with most of our work done over email, telephone and Skype. Our staff are based in cities all over the world and meet at team retreats twice per year. Avaaz covers office costs, either to establish a home office or to rent one, and we support staff to house themselves in local similar organisations when preferred.



Compensation and Benefits:


Salary varies with location and experience, but is highly competitive with leading non-governmental organizations. Benefits also range with location, but include 5 weeks paid vacation per year.





10 more reasons to join Avaaz!


1. We’re winning -- our campaigning works and we’re changing politics and practices across the world. Check out our recent victories at http://www.avaaz.org/en/highlights.php. Or see what the world’s media is saying about us at http://www.avaaz.org/en/media.php.


2. Our tactics are bold and effective -- we do what’s needed to win campaigns, whether it’s pioneering the use of satellite phones and critical technology to support democracy movements or rallying the largest climate protests in history.


3. The mission is the metric -- large funders don’t control our strategy. We work with members to do what’s best for the world each and every time.


4. We thrive in risky situations -- we don’t let powerful forces like Rupert Murdoch’s media empire bully us with legal, brand or financial threats. We’re experts at navigating risk and meeting threats head on, in the media, the courts or on the streets.


5. We pay sustainable salaries -- our salaries are competitive and we believe in supporting long term commitment to the work we do.


6. Our team is awesome -- it’s chock full of brilliant people at the top of their fields in law, politics, civil society and more. We’re no drama and a heck of a lot of fun.


7. We have great work-life balance -- it’s a professional responsibility and there’s huge support to nail it. We believe we all work best when we are rested and enjoying a full life outside of the office.


8. You can be anywhere -- except for a few roles that require a specific location, our staff can be based anywhere with an airport and a great internet connection. If you want to work from one of our large offices in New York or London, you can do that, or live on an island somewhere!


9. We’re fiercely meritocratic -- our hierarchy is based on judgment and we are constantly checking it against objective standards that are 100% transparent. We believe in the best ideas becoming instantly recognized and adopted, and all jobs and roles are assigned meritocratically.


10. There’s no drama -- we work as one team to change the world. You may need to see it to believe it, but we’ve got a team where gossip, drama, internal politics and all that draining stuff just doesn't exist.

item.title: Senior Front-End Developer at HealthCare.com (New York, NY)
item.description:
HealthCare.com (corporate name is Healthcare, Inc.) is comprised of an experienced team of entrepreneurs, engineers, online marketers, product developers, data scientists and healthcare experts. We were founded in 2014, and formed with the mission of building a world-class web application (and eventually mobile) to help our users to become better healthcare consumers.  As the Senior Front-End Developer, you will: 



  1. Be involved in the strategic parts of the UX process


  2. Work closely with UX and UI designers, project managers and back-end engineers to implement versatile front-end solutions to web development problems


  3. Embrace emerging standards while promoting best practices in order to push the limits of what a browser can do


  4. Implement responsive, adaptive and mobile websites that are flexible to the many different devices and browsers


  5. Manage his/her own time, and work well both independently and as part of a team


  6. Launch, iterate and make a difference. Provide front-end coding expertise, and be ready to make our products better for our users

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Mobile iOS Android at MAG Technologies (Dallas, TX) (allows remote)
item.description:
MAG Technologies is a well funded startup, and the developer of a secure chat mobile app. Our app has a strong focus on privacy, user choice, and beautiful, usable interfaces. The positions are for self-starting senior developers who can take ownership of project components and deliver long-lasting, maintainable, extensible, and optimized code. Given the app is a messaging app, there is a server tech component as well. We are thus looking for great computer scientists with a broad expertise in object oriented software development, service oriented architecture and APIs, and an advanced expertise in Android and/or iOS. This is a unique opportunity to lead the technical evolution of an app in the prestigious mobile chat and messaging space. 


Responsibilities will include:



  • Design, Development, and Testing of newer features in the Android or the iOS version of the app

  • Fixing bugs and maintaining code - all the while ensuring we follow industry best-practices and design patterns, and ensure the most efficient use of computing and storage resources

  • Collaborating with other engineers on the project

  • Researching, exploring, and executing newer, better approaches to solving our software development and maintenance challenges

  • Participating in some user testing, as well as receiving feedback on app usability, and improving the app based on such feedback

  • Interfacing with XMPP server, and possibly coding a bit on the server side as well

  • Using many modern APIs, SDKs, and tools, and learning new tools as needed


Remote applicants: Only those within a 3 hour drive from downtown Dallas, TX, please.


What else to expect?



  • Walking meetings

  • Top notch equipment

  • Being surrounded by startup enthusiasts, and highly qualified software engineers both within and outside the company

  • Awesome Dallas high-rise views

  • Flexible work schedules, as long as goals met

item.title: Software Engineer - Web App Developer at Rally Software (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Are you are an experienced senior developer with a broad skill set and a passion for tackling complex and challenging problems? Rally is growing rapidly, so the problems we solve are big and getting bigger. We think about quality, testing, and scaling all the time. We dedicate considerable developer time to making sure we’re doing the right things, the right way.

Rally Engineering is a team of polyglots, and if you explore our repos you will find a variety of languages including: Java, JavaScript, CoffeeScript, Clojure, and Ruby. But we never exclude candidates because of their language of choice. Instead we focus on code quality and design, whether OO or functional. Our largest data store is a relational database however we’ve embraced NoSQL solutions like Cassandra, Datomic, and MongoDB.

Automated testing is a first-class citizen at Rally. We test at every level, from fast running unit tests to full-stack integration tests that drive dozens of concurrent browsers using Selenium. Our test suite is one of the largest and most comprehensive you might ever encounter. Yet our build pipeline from commit, through full test suite execution, and package for production deployment is exceedingly fast.

At Rally we seek people who are passionate about the software industry and want to work with the best and brightest. We value teamwork, the ability to make and meet commitments, dedication to continual improvement, and a proven track record in creating successful, highly usable software.

We strive for a healthy, productive work/life balance, while enjoying the opportunity to substantially contribute to the direction and success of a vibrant software business.

item.title: iOS Developer at Friends of The Web (Baltimore, MD)
item.description: We're looking for an experienced iOS developer to join our small team. As a developer at Friends of The Web, you’ll participate in and lead a diverse set of projects, both internally driven and for a range of clients. You’ll have an opportunity to continue to develop your own skills while solving interesting problems and helping to guide the development of our products.

item.title: Data Quality Analyst at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
Digital & Technology at Sainsbury’s has never been more exciting. Our brand new centre of excellence in Holborn is crafting world-class apps and services to revolutionise retail. Ambition knows no bounds here and we’re recruiting some of the most talented colleagues around to make sure we reach our amazing potential.


Our customer data will be more incisive and more accurate than ever before, thanks to you. As a Data Quality Analyst, you’ll offer real expertise to our Customer Insights and Customer Analytics teams. Not to mention developing the ‘single customer view’ as part of our Helios project.


As a Data Quality Analyst you’ll:



  • Be responsible for the quality of customer data – ensuring everything from accuracy to time management

  • Manage the process that allow us to load and transform third party data as well as other ad-hoc data processing requests

  • Vigilantly investigate poor data quality and anomalies while also resolving customer and product data quality issues

  • Work with Customer Analytics to derive new data for the marketing database using SAS

  • Offer outstanding support to the Customer Data Senior Business Analyst on other projects when needed


You’ll need:



  • SAS or SQL programming experience for data manipulation

  • A background working with large volumes of customer and transactional data

  • In-depth understanding of how the Data Protection Act applies to consumer marketing

  • Excellent MS Office skills, especially in Excel

  • A relentless approach to throwing yourself into your work with little supervision and the networking and communication skills to support it


As a level C4 colleague, you can expect:



  • Car loan up to £10,000 or season ticket loan on public transport

  • 10% discount at all Sainsbury’s stores and online shopping

  • Sainsbury’s 7.5% Retirement Pension Plan

  • Bonus scheme enabling you to earn an extra annual payment of up to 10% of basic salary

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Priceline.com (Norwalk, CT)
item.description:
Are you a Software Engineer passionate about creating great software?  Is your mantra “Class, Responsibility, Collaboration?”  Do you want to develop products that are very important to the growth and success of the company?  Do you want to work very closely with the business folks?  Are you looking for a company that is not too big, not too small, and has a casual and agile work environment?  If so, then we just might have the perfect job for you!


The Rental Car group at priceline.com is looking for a talented engineer to join our services tier team.  In this software engineering role you will develop services software that supports the searching and booking of rental cars on priceline.com and other company-owned web sites, mobile platforms, as well as through our affiliate API.

We strongly believe that there is real value to the organization in crafting and engineering software beautifully so that it can be easily understood, maintained, and extended. We work directly with the business team and are involved in shaping our product and improving our business.  The Rental Car business is a major contributor to the company’s bottom line and still has significant opportunity for growth.  We work hard at creating software to improve the business and we do so in a casual, fun and flexible work environment.


You will have the opportunity to use your Java skills to craft internal and external Web services; connect to external suppliers via Global Distribution Systems (GDS) and Web services; work with high capacity, multi-threaded systems; create and use various kinds of caches; build interaction points between the Rental Car product and the other Priceline products (e.g. Hotels, Airline); build tools to help manage and control our systems, and much more!

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer (PaaS) at MuleSoft (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
MuleSoft is looking for Node.js full stack developers to join our award winning API Platform team in San Francisco.

You will get to pioneer a greenfield JavaScript/Node.js project with a growing team creating brand new services and features for our award winning AnyPoint API Platform. You will work on a team that developed RAML - a new language to design REST based APIs, and started large open source projects such as RAML Designer, Console, RAML parser, and many others.

You will have the opportunity to apply Node.js to develop high-performance and highly-scalable event-driven components which  provide the backbone for the API platform, and a set of shared services across the Anypoint Cloud platform. This is a greenfield project so there is tons of room for you to be creative, solve impossible problems, try new technologies and make your personal mark on things. In addition you have the opportunity, client-side, to use JavaScript and React.js for developing Single Page Applications.

You’ll get to work with a great team of smart and talented engineers in San Francisco, as well as plenty of opportunity to travel to our engineering team in Buenos Aires, Argentina. We have a really nice office space with lots of company perks, and we run regular meetups and hackathons. Most importantly you’ll have a lot of fun doing this.

item.title: Technologist with C++ focus for high frequency trading firm at Xanadu Trading (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
Xanadu Trading is a young knowledge and technology based proprietary trading start-up. We are active in one of the most intense industries in the world. We trade our own capital, for our own risk and benefit, and have no customers. Xanadu is focused on high frequency algorithmic black box futures trading as well grey box options market making on Eurex, LIFFE and CME. We have offices in both London and Barcelona.


Options market making software needs to be at the same time very fast and responsive as well as reliable and bug-free. This is what has made developing in this area one of the most challenging, difficult and interesting propositions around. Xanadu's young technology department not only aims to compete in this area, but to disrupt it - from (almost) scratch, and with less man power than most competitors. And in order to do so, we are looking for great technologists.


As one of the first technologists in our young startup you will work directly with Xanadu's founder and head trader and will have varied and often changing responsibilities. In general, you will be responsible for working on parts of our automated trading tools in C++. Depending on your preferences and business requirements you might also do some front end development in Java - or work on statistics, data analysis and data visualization in R. Whatever it is going to be, it will be at the very heart of what Xanadu does and crucial to its success.


In summary, we offer:
  - Highly intellectual and competitive atmosphere
  - No sales pitches (we don't have customers - we code for ourselves, to our specs, to solve our problems, on our timeline)
  - Ability to use advanced mathematical modelling skills
  - Ability to write robust and highly efficient code, where both make a tremendous difference
  - English speaking work environment
  - Free food
  - Social activities
  - Nice office space
  - Very competitive salaries (salaries are negotiable and depend on experience - for fresh graduates total remuneration starts at 36k€ excluding benefits)

item.title: Hadoop Developer, Senior at Booz Allen Hamilton (Chantilly, VA)
item.description: Ingest data from various structured and unstructured data sources into Hadoop and other distributed Big Data systems. Support the sustainment and delivery of an automated ETL pipeline, using a suite of COTS, GOTS, Java, Perl, and other tools. Validate data that is extracted from structured and unstructured data inputs, databases, and other repositories, using scripts and other automated capabilities, logs, and queries. Enrich and otherwise transform the extracted data as required. Produce monitoring and reporting of data flow through the ETL process and perform data extractions, data purges, or data fixes in accordance with current internal procedures and policies. Complete problem tickets containing bug fixes, design modifications, and changes based on customer requirements. Track development and operational support via user stories and decomposed technical tasks in a provided issue tracking software, including GIT, Maven, or JIRA.

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer at Motorola Solutions (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Senior Software Development Engineer


Location: Seattle, WA



We are a small agile team that works like a startup within a big company. Motorola Solutions is known around the world for innovation in Enterprise Mobility, Public Safety and Wireless Infrastructure. We are leading the next wave of innovations that enable people, enterprises and governments to be more connected and more mobile. We are seeking a senior software developer to join our team in Seattle to work with our core WAVE product and IP telephony code. Our ideal candidate will have protocol-level IP network development experience and a desire to work on challenging problems in a multithreaded distributed system.



You will work on the WAVE audio processing Engine, the WAVE SDKs, network modules, IP telephony, Supernode peer routing, and other sophisticated real-time two-way communications components. Our software is used by demanding organizations worldwide and we have very high quality and craftsmanship standards.



You will be responsible for creating and maintaining sophisticated low-level code and the frameworks required to test, build, and certify it. Your optimization and debugging skills will be called into play daily. Understanding of H.323, SIP, and audio CODECs will be of great value to our team. Your professionalism lets you learn quickly, adapt to changing situations, help others, and take care of the details. You communicate well and get along with other people. And your sample code is a joy to read.



Key Responsibilities:



  • Design, development, and maintenance of core WAVE components

  • Specifications, architecture, wiki pages, and other design documents

  • Creation of unit tests and test scaffolding

  • Cross-training and mentoring

  • Providing accurate estimates and meeting your scheduled commitments

  • Primarily acts as a multiplier by building systems, authoring tools, or introducing policies or patterns that raise the level of productivity of the entire organization

item.title: Developer at Ecology and Environment, Inc (Portland, OR)
item.description:
Ecology and Environment, Inc. is a fully integrated environmental consulting firm committed to supporting sustainable development through responsible environmental stewardship.  We are seeking an Associate- and Senior-Level innovative and forward-thinking Developer at our headquarters in Buffalo, NY or our regional office in Portland, Oregon.  In these challenging positions, the Developer will be responsible for designing and developing web-based solutions and will work with colleagues and clients to create appealing and fully functioning websites.


This challenging position requires the candidate to have experience with ASP.Net C# web development to develop project websites and internal systems.  Experience with ASP.Net, C#, and SQL server required.  Our developers are part of an integrated IT/GIS group which is a very dynamic results-oriented group.  Our successful candidates must be highly motivated to work in a very fast-paced and exciting consulting environment. 


Responsibilities:



  • Develop modern, data-driven ASP.NET web applications using Visual Studio, C#, and SQL Server using Microsoft platforms, frameworks, and tools

  • Use modern web development technologies including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to build fast and intuitive user experiences

  • Participate in project planning meetings to design and document software features, requirements, and specifications

  • Communicate directly with stakeholders to share project updates, provide training, discuss new feature ideas, and troubleshoot problems or issues

  • Maintain, support, and enhance legacy applications

  • Remain current on web technology trends, and rapidly learn and apply new skills and tools during the life cycle of a project

  • Assist with business development initiatives (demonstrations, client meetings, presentations, bids and proposal support, etc.

  • Senior-level:

    • Serve as lead developer for new and existing projects

    • Work with managers and developers in making platform, technology, and tooling decisions

    • Mentor junior staff developers and perform QA/QC on other team members solutions



  • Associate-level:

    • Serve as developer for new and existing projects with opportunity to take on lead developer responsibilities

    • Opportunity to work with managers and developers in making platform, technology, and tooling decisions




Requirements:



  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or a related field

  • Senior-level:

    • 7+ years of experience with custom web based data driven application development, using C# and .NET technology is required.  Including working experience in using Microsoft platforms, frameworks, and tools

    • Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, and Javascript and jQuery frameworks

    • Strong knowledge of Web Services (REST & SOAP)

    • Transact-SQL experience



  • Associate-level:

    • 3+ years of experience with custom web based data driven web application development, using C# and .NET technology is required.  Including working experience in using Microsoft platforms, frameworks, and tools

    • Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and Javascript and jQuery frameworks

    • Familiarity with Web Services (REST & SOAP)

    • Familiarity with Transact-SQL



  • Collaborate on solutions by facilitating and improving communication amongst technical staff and clients

  • Excellent problem solving skills. Good oral and written communication skills with external and internal clients of varying levels of computer literacy

  • Must be a self-starter, highly motivated, organized, and self-disciplined in order to organize time and work efficiently in a face-paced and exciting consulting environment

  • Experience with consulting or contract work is a plus

  • Ability to travel as needed for client meetings and business development


Must be eligible to work in the United States.  Visa sponsorship will not be provided for these positions.


E & E is its people. We are a knowledge based culture with an integrated staff of more than 85 scientific and engineering disciplines – a group of innovators who pave the way in implementing environmental solutions. E & E offers a competitive compensation and benefits package along with opportunities for professional growth in a flexible, team-oriented environment. Please view our website at www.ene.com to apply on-line.


Ecology and Environment, Inc. is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

item.title: Cloud/DevOps Engineer for Connected Audio at Bose at Bose Corporation (Boston, MA)
item.description:
About The Team:

The Algorithms & Cloud Experiences group is a small interdisciplinary team that builds compelling cloud applications for connected Bose products. We participate in the full product/feature lifecycle: imagining new customer-facing features, designing compelling user interfaces, constructing appropriate software architecture and infrastructure, implementing compelling proofs of concept, and scaling our solutions to serve millions of users. Join us to invent and build exceptional experiences, beginning by helping millions of customers rediscover their love of music.

Job Description:

We are seeking a cloud engineer to expand our core team. In this role, you will be responsible for the architecture, implementation, and scalability of our cloud services. The ideal candidate will be comfortable choosing the appropriate technology underpinnings, defining the end-to-end architecture, configuring the full stack through DevOps techniques, managing the data, and working with Application and Algorithm specialists to ensure the system’s scalability and performance. The ideal candidate is a cloud native, deeply familiar with handling computationally heavy workloads using Infrastructure-as-a-Service solutions.

Please take a few minutes to insert a cover letter when you apply! We truly value candidates who take a few extra minutes to give us a clear understanding of what makes you 'tick'. Tell us whatever you think is most important. If you're not sure how to start, here are some ideas:

• What technologies would you most like to use and/or learn about at Bose?

• What are the 3 most important things you're looking for in a career at any company?

• Tell us something about you to help us understand why you are unique.

item.title: VP Engineering at Joist (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Don’t say we didn’t warn you; there’s a reason we’re the fastest growing startup in Toronto!


Joist is on a mission to transform the business of home improvement. And we’re having a blast while making home improvement dreams a reality.

- Ranked in the Top 25 business apps in the Apple App Store (out of 19,500 business apps)
- Tens of thousands of highly engaged customers, growing very quickly
- $5B+ in transactions processed since launch
- Millions of homeowners have experience working with a Joist-powered contractor
- Funded by top tier US & Canadian VCs


Checkout our app: http://joistapp.com and our concierge service: http://joisthome.com



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


THE ROLE


We are looking for a passionate, impact-driven product VP, Engineering to recruit and build our Engineering Team (Engineering Leads & Engineers). What are the our engineering team's key values? What are the most important engineering objectives to focus on right now? How will the way we are building technology either block us or enable us to create amazing customer experiences 3,6, and 12 months from now? What will increase our engineering velocity AND engineering team morale? How do we empower engineers to be involved in creating the best product in the world? You will fearlessly lead the charge to answer these questions and engineer product that delivers incredible customer experiences for both contractor and homeowner.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


WHAT YOU'LL DO


Work with the founders and key leaders within, and contribute to company vision & strategy


Leverage the team build an engineering vision to rally the company around


Translate company vision and strategy into a incredibly well engineered product


Remind yourself that first and foremost you are a fearless leader of people (specifically, engineers!)


Build a team of highly executing Engineers & defined Joist's engineering organization culture and principles


Give direction to your team of Engineering leads by turning the product roadmap into actionable engineering objectives and key results


Help the engineering and product team find clarity of direction and priority, give them advice on how to find their own path for growth, and get the obstacles out of their way


Make sure the trains run on time, and manage team output and release cycles effectively


Lead your teams in setting qualitative objectives and quantitative goals


Ensure Joist's vision for engineering excellence is translated into product


Ensure your Engineering Leads and Engineers are estimating work units correctly


Manage the agile development process and get the most out of your teams


Keep the engineering and product team motivated and excited about their work, help them organize and focus their thoughts and attention, and get them communicating effectively with their peers, their community, and the rest of the world


Critically challenge your Engineering Leads to support their decisions and think of engineering as the vehicle to deliver customer experiences


Foster a culture of customer customer love, speed, ruthless prioritization within the Engineering Team


Hold your team accountable to rigorous decision making around prioritization and testing of hypotheses


Instill pride in our product with everyone who touches the product (product managers, designers, engineers, support staff, etc)


Articulate product plans, benefits and results, to Joist team members, customers, vendors, investors, and the Board of Directors



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


SOUND LIKE YOU?


You have 7+ years experience as a leader of a product organization


You have lead recruiting, training and ongoing coaching of a product team


You realize that developing great people requires a different set of skills than developing great product
You thrive in technical organizations and have a technical background but most of the really hard, long term problems are about people
You still have great technical chops but prefer not to be heads down in code all day


You are a team builder, and know how to recruit, hire, build, coach, and retain engineering teams


You give a shit about great code and understand when to optimize for speed vs. code quality


You are a stickler about managing unit tests, system tests and regression tests. In fact, you are passionate about automating testing overall


You know how to get people to hit deadlines. You know when it’s OK to push hard for the team to hit a deadline even if it means yet another all-nighter or weekend
You know when to tell the CEO to get stuffed because the team has reached maximum stress / effort


You understand the different character types and which prefer carrot vs. stick.


You are passionate about creating a strong engineering culture that gives engineers both structure and autonomy


You know the company product roadmap of the back of your hand, and prioritize engineering FEROCIOUSLY against high-level business goals



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


PERKS
♦ You’ll have a huge impact on a product used and adored by hundreds of thousands of businesses worldwide
♦ Young, energetic, flexible and super fun work culture
♦ Weekly team outings (such as the infamous Joist Wine Fridays)
♦ A standard issue Joist green hoodie and t-shirt
♦ Be self-directed: No managers or clients peering over your shoulder
♦ Open vacation policy: Take time off as needed on your own schedule
♦ Flexible work times: The # of hours sitting in a chair does not = productivity
♦ A kegerator that never runs out of premium beer and Sriracha / Frank's Hot Sauce stocked in the fridge


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


COMPENSATION: Based on experience


LOCATION: Downtown Toronto - checkout photos of what goes on at Joist HQ (located in Toronto) here: https://www.joistapp.com/careers.


TARGETED START DATE: Immediate


Visit our careers page here: joistapp.com/careers to learn more about working with the Joist team.

item.title: Quality Data Analyst at Wisconsin Hospital Association (Fitchburg, WI)
item.description: This position performs analysis of clinical, quality process and outcome measures associated with healthcare improvement projects.  Works with project staff to design and execute databases to maximize functionality and access to data and reports.  Work with Chief Quality Officer and Quality staff to develop various ad hoc reports.  Assist WHA members with understanding their data.  Develop processes to ensure the integrity of data and accuracy of reports.

item.title: Internal Systems Application Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Internal Systems department develops technology and enterprise-level applications that keep the company running. We build applications and infrastructure that allow our employees to connect and perform their day-to-day jobs. Our applications range from a highly tuned in-house Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system to communication and collaboration tools.

The successful candidate will be a motivated, creative and well-rounded application developer with strong communication skills, as we work directly with every part of the organization.


>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Sales Intelligence (OO Development, SQL)

The Sales Intelligence group builds a metadata driven CRM. Our in-house CRM empowers our sales force, provides insights to enable product growth and helps manage all aspects of the sales cycle. Features include a flexible back-end that allows for dynamic configurations of screens and NLP integration to scrape data.

Communication Tools & Applications (C++)

The Communication Tools & Applications group supports Bloomberg's Analytics Team in building the Bloomberg HELP HELP platform. This platform enables our 300,000+ clients to connect in real-time with our unparalleled analytics and technical support staff. HELP HELP includes a number of sophisticated components including a high availability distribution system that uses NLP and machine learning to route all incoming phone calls, instant messages and emails.

Network & FIX Infrastructure (C++)

The Network & FIX Infrastructure group develops systems for electronic trading and enterprise transactional feeds for the world's largest private network, Bloomberg. Our configuration and monitoring systems are distributed across the entire network to collect real-time performance metrics. The algorithms we build optimize network traffic and connectivity for various Bloomberg products.

Security and Compliance (C++ / C#)

The Security and Compliance group builds the Bloomberg terminal's access control system and trading compliance system. The access control system manages all aspects of security including entry to our facilities and access to the Bloomberg terminal. Our tools ensure that our business and systems can operate at all times, even during power outages or transportation disruptions. The trading compliance system hosts rules of country-specific eligibility requirements for our electronic trading platforms.

Network Applications (C++)

The Network Applications group architects and develops a superior network management system used to design, provision, troubleshoot and monitor the world's largest private network. We build applications that direct client connections, send traffic from one data center to another, troubleshoot, configure network devices, and deploy and upgrade client appliance software.

Contracts and Exchanges/Contribution Entitlements (C++ / C#)

The Contracts and Exchanges/Contribution Entitlements group develops three main products: Exchanges/3rd Party Entitlements, Enterprise-wide Contracts Management and the Customer Service Web Portal. Our Exchanges/3rd Party Entitlement systems are designed to accommodate a high volume of hits. Bloomberg's legal department uses the Contracts Management System to fully automate client interaction during contract negotiations and execution. The Customer Service Portal is a web-based interface that provides clients with the tools to manage their suite of Bloomberg products.

Installations and Electronic Trading Integration (C++/SQL)

The Installations and Electronic Trading Integration group builds the configuration management tool that controls much of Bloomberg's electronic trading platform. We develop the applications that support the infrastructure of Bloomberg's order enterprise system. These applications are developed for both the Bloomberg terminal and the Bloomberg Professional mobile app.

HR Tools and Applications (C++, Node.js)

The HR Tools and Applications group builds Bloomberg's Human Capital Management (HCM) and Business Process Management (BPM) systems. We develop highly available systems that provide an excellent user experience in over 75 countries. Our group uses JavaScript-based UI frameworks, MS SQL Server, Oracle databases, and web services written in C#, C++, Java and Python.

Ticketing Systems (OO Development, SQL)

The Ticketing Systems group ensures that the global company runs smoothly, handling all types of tickets from simple temperature control requests to complex enterprise project management. The group maintains the ticketing application and infrastructure, which includes an intelligent distribution server that guarantees requests are routed to the right people. Additional features include a comprehensive suite of searching and reporting tools, intricate graphical support applications and quality assurance mechanisms.

Global Installs and Customer Support / Special Projects (C++/SQL)

The Technical Operations/Special Projects group works with our Chief Risk and Compliance Office (CRCO) to ensure that we protect the security of clients' logins and provide platinum customer service. Our tools help clients gain terminal access when traditional means are unavailable. This includes authentication using SMS messages, automated calls and system-generated security questions. The group works with the CRCO to develop solutions to protect the Bloomberg terminal from hacking.

item.title: Data Associate Refining and Chemicals at Wood Mackenzie (London, UK)
item.description:
Our expertise in the refining and chemicals sectors is driven from our unique databases, economic models and forecasts. We provide comprehensive asset and company valuations, in-depth market analysis and insight into key issues. This objective research helps companies around the world to identify, evaluate and rank growth opportunities.


Role Purpose


This role is in the EMEARC Refining and Chemicals team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the team's data from end to end; assisting Research Analysts with tasks ranging from data sourcing to building VBA/SQL solutions and the population and production of the team's research products, ensuring data integrity at all times and with a view to delivering workflow process efficiencies wherever possible.


Main Responsibilities


• Primary ownership of the team's data
• Collect and compile industry data from both external and internal Wood Mackenzie sources into team spreadsheets and then into the Wood Mackenzie database
• Create and maintain automated processes involving databases, spreadsheets and web sites
• Create and prepare datasets for data visualisation solutions such as Spotfire.
• Maintain data quality and integrity, revising as necessary, and maintaining audit records of base data and subsequent revision for all Refining and Chemicals teams
• Produce reports and data queries as required by the team
• Collect and compile data using feeds from both external and internal Wood Mackenzie sources using Kapow Software
• Contribute to the effort of synchronising all web scraping, forecasting and reporting platforms across Markets teams
• Create and maintain data links to mapping interfaces and implement edits to and maintain the currency of the regional maps where relevant
• Prepare charts and tables for publication/presentation and assist with publishing research to the Wood Mackenzie client website
• Devise and implement data gathering and storage protocols to minimise business risk and maximise operational efficiency
• Support data gathering and processing activities to support consulting engagements as appropriate
• Understand and interact with other Wood Mackenzie teams by developing relationships with wider Data and Operations Analyst community

item.title: Front End Developer at Spin Systems, Inc. (Fairfax, VA) (allows remote)
item.description:
In addition to being an extraordinary engineer, we want a team member who is passionate on wearing different hats in a small product team:  designing new features, making good product decisions, writing bullet proof code, programming at all levels of the application stack, and contributing to the design of beautiful user interfaces.  We would like you to have most of the following skills prior to joining our team.  If you think you’re missing one or two skills, you can make up for it with passion, attention to detail, a collaborative attitude, a willingness to learn -- and we’ll teach you the rest when you arrive.


Responsibilities



  • Participate in all phases of the system development lifecycle including creating technical designs, program code, test plans, and verifying test results. Apply reusable code design and design patterns in a test driven development environment

  • Develop technical design documentation based on functional design specifications and implement solutions using object oriented programming techniques

  • Work as part of a team of developers (user-interface, middle tier business logic, data access) and application architects interfacing with business analysts, database developers, infrastructure architects, and quality assurance testers to ensure the successful delivery of an integrated solution meeting the needs of the business.

  • Provide development estimates for implementation and project plans

  • Review applications in all phases of development to ensure adherence to development standards.

  • Research, recommend, and adopt best practices and design patterns for development.


 Qualifications



  • A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, or a similar science and engineering discipline, and a minimum of 3 years of progressive post-graduate experience. 

  • 3+ years as a professional engineer, building and maintaining web applications from concept to production.

  • Fluent with the core of our current technology: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and jQuery.

  • SharePoint 2013 administration and/or development experience using NCSS (No Code Sandbox Solutions) or SharePoint 2013 App Model is a very strong plus but not required.

  • Proven skills developing RESTful and oData services using C#.

  • Experience in writing complex SQL queries and executing SQL, TSQ, PL/SQL scripts using ADO.NET against MS SQL Server and Oracle databases.

  • Strong object oriented design skills and familiarity with n-tier applications and Service Oriented Architecture.

  • Preference given to candidates exposed to test driven development and agile software methodologies such as SCRUM and XP

  • US Citizens only, Secret Clearance required.


 EOE/M/F/D/V.  We participate in E-Verify

item.title: Site Reliability Team Developer at Stack Exchange (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Stack Exchange is growing fast, and our infrastructure needs just keep getting bigger.  We’re looking for a developer to join our Site Reliability Engineering team of outstanding sysadmins and developers working on sites that see 3000-4000 hits per second during peak times.


At Stack Exchange we’re passionate about our technology.  We own and operate our own infrastructure, and take the time to do it right.  We like to stay on the cutting edge of technology, so you will always being working with or working towards using the latest and greatest there is.  We get all the hardware we need for redundancy and performance, and we create our own tools when needed (like our open source monitoring system).


Some projects that you will be working on:



  • Bosun and scollector - our open source monitoring system and data collection agent written in Go

  • Opserver - our open source dashboard and additional monitoring tool

  • Building systems to automate some of the SRE pain points around a mixed Windows and Linux environment including deployment, patching, inventory, and config management

  • Extend some of the open source projects we use including logstash and puppet


Technologies you’ll work with:



  • Windows 2012 and 2012 R2

  • Modern Linux distributions - we’re running CentOS 6 and 7

  • IIS, DFS, Multi-site AD, SQL Server 2012 and 2014

  • Go and C# as primary languages, plus some work in Powershell, Python, etc.

item.title: Software Engineer at Telit (Lincolnshire, IL)
item.description:
About You:


We are looking for a developer with experience in building high-performing, scalable, enterprise-grade applications. You will be part of a talented software team that works on mission-critical applications. You will be responsible for application development while providing expertise in the full software development lifecycle, from concept and design to testing. We have only a small technical team here so your skills are key to our success. Local candidates only.



  • Design and develop high-volume, low-latency applications for mission-critical systems, delivering high-availability and performance.

  • Ensure designs are in compliance with specifications.

  • J2EE / JBOSS / Tomcat / CentOS

  • JIRA / Confluence

A few things we are working on:
