  • Windows services that drive network components.

  • Carrier billing and signaling feeds, CDR loaders, event storage and management.

  • Integration feeds to other divisions (inter-company web services).

  • Migrating source control, bug tracking, and requirements management.

item.title: Software Engineer at Silicis Technologies Inc (Westfield, IN)
item.description:
As a key member of the Silicis team, you will be responsible for development, execution and measurement of Silicis’ software. You will also be responsible for the continued integration and modification of existing software to improve performance and meet new platform requirements. The ideal candidate is a versatile developer who can translate design solutions to the highest quality standard C#, WPF, and C embedded software, and has an eye for detail that allows them to own the final quality assurance of their solutions. The applicant must demonstrate a strong interest in application development, the development process, and a curiosity and excitement for new software technologies and techniques. This position will also work closely with other disciplines as needed in a team environment that includes other electrical, software, mechanical, and aeronautical experts all working toward the success of Silicis’ platform.


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Designing, coding and debugging applications in C# for robotic platform and ground control applications

  • Work closely with Electrical Engineers on electronics & low level system interaction

  • Participate in software, electronics and systems design requirements/reviews for identification of metrics, system risk and reliability analysis

  • Coordinate software system installation during final assembly and verify system functionality to ensure specifications are met

  • Maintain standards compliance

  • Support, maintain and document software functionality for internal use and field training manuals

  • Perform multidisciplinary tasks in order to meet design/delivery requirements & timelines

  • Full lifecycle application development

item.title: Enterprise Support Engineer at Unity Technologies (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Unity’s Technical Support team is at the front line of the company; we solve the problems that other people can’t solve, and we look good while doing it. Our customers have crazy tight schedules and high expectations, and our developer relations engineers are up to the challenge in providing rapid, accurate, and personable assistance. As a member of the specialized Enterprise Support team, you will be instrumental in ensuring the success of our very-highest-profile customer productions.


Travel is a must, and it certainly won’t hurt to have a passion for solving intractable, never-before-seen problems on a daily basis.

item.title: TECHNICAL BUSINESS ANALYST at GroupeSTAHL (Sterling Heights, MI)
item.description:
Position Summary



The Technical Business Analyst collects, documents, and maintains the authoritative list of requirements for all development efforts.  The Technical Business Analyst is accountable for the functional design and adherence to corporate software development methodologies, as well as coordination across all technical resources throughout the lifecycle of a software development project.  Secondary responsibilities include creation and maintenance of various types of documents, testing support and assisting in project management/delivery activities. The Technical Business Analyst drives the collaboration with business area(s), IS, and technology to ensure that requirements are gathered and communicated effectively in order to meet the clearly defined system objectives.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities


- Responsible for defining and managing the scope of Business Systems projects.


- Track projects, timelines and ensures execution of the Technology Projects.


- Defines functional, usability, reliability, performance and support QA requirements of a system.


- Creates and performs feature testing and determines environmental needs.


- Provides the link between the technical and business views of the system by ensuring that the technical solutions being developed will satisfy the needs of the business.


- Partners with business, architecture and infrastructure and oversees all service levels to ensure business area satisfaction.


- Defines development strategy, standards and support tools.


- Proactively works with stakeholders to identify future system opportunities and enhancements.

item.title: Database Engineer at News Distribution Network (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Overview:


NDN attracts entrepreneurial-minded individuals, who are looking to boldly disrupt and relentlessly innovate in  a fast-paced and rewarding digital media environment. We seek passionate and dynamic talent looking to join a collaborative team that provides a wealth of opportunities for career development and growth.


The Database Engineer will be based in Atlanta, GA at NDN’s headquarters, and will report to the Senior Manager  of Engineering Operations. S/he will primarily be responsible for developing and maintaining SQL/RDBMS along with all functions related to data.


About You:



  • You are a detail oriented database engineer

  • you take pride in writing clean and clear SQL

  • You take pride in writing clean DRY code.

  • You don’t need micro managing. You can be given a task and ensure it gets completed properly on time.

  • You are a team player, who enjoys collaboration and working in an agile environment.

  • You are confident enough in the work you do to give an Operations Engineer your cell phone number.


The Perks: 



  • 100% paid medical, dental, and vision benefits for employees and dependents

  • Competitive salaries

  • Apple products for all employees

  • Complimentary on-site gym & discounted local gym membership

  • Free on-site parking in Buckhead office

  • A stocked kitchen full of free food and drinks!

  • Social events and celebrations

  • Relaxation areas, golf putting greens, ping pong, pool and play station

  • Inspirational, colorful and collaborative work environment

  • Business casual work attire (jeans!)

  • Free NDN swag

item.title: QA Engineers, Mid-Sr. Levels at Tripwire (Alpharetta, GA)
item.description:
Tripwire delivers advanced threat protection, security and compliance solutions, enabling enterprises, government agencies and service providers to confidently detect, prevent and respond to cybersecurity threats to their business. Headquartered in Portland, Oregon, Tripwire’s customer base extends into vertical industries including government, energy, financial services, retail, manufacturing, education and entertainment. Almost all executive branch agencies of the U.S. federal government and half the Fortune 500 turn to Tripwire for their IT security and compliance needs. With thousands of customers in nearly 100 countries, there’s a reason why organizations turn to Tripwire.
Tripwire is growing and we have multiple Software Engineering openings for our core product, Tripwire Enterprise. Most of our work is server-side. We are most interested in talent and drive, but specific experience and skills matter too. Ideal candidates will have backgrounds like this:


  • Enterprise product development using modern C++

  • Scalable, distributed systems using asynchronous messaging (e.g. AMQ)

  • Knowledge/interest in the field of security

  • Agile process based on the SCRUM framework


As a successful candidate, you will demonstrate clear thought processes and communicate well with technical and non-technical audiences. You should thrive in a collaborative environment, advocate directly and politely for ideas, and speak up in support of your team. You should be a creative problem-solver, providing thoughtful approaches to challenging technical problems that solve real business needs.

item.title: UX Designer (m/f) - Rocket Internet at Rocket Internet SE (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description: As a UX designer, you will tackle complex web and mobile ecosystems and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs across many ventures. As part of our agile team of designers you will work in close collaboration with Product Management, Engineering, Research and Marketing in a fast-paced, highly-dynamic environment to create the most beautiful, relevant, and user-friendly products in the world.

item.title: Software Engineer, Devops at HookLogic, Inc. (Ann Arbor, MI)
item.description:
Job Description



HookLogic Engineers develop proprietary software platforms used by the world’s largest e-commerce retailers. Our engineering team consists of talented, team-oriented individuals who are empowered to take advantage of the latest cloud and distributed technologies to deliver reliable, high-throughput applications. Our core languages are Java and C# and we commonly utilize technologies and platforms such as SQL Server, Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, and AWS Services such as Kinesis, DynamoDB, Redshift, Lamda, and SQS. 


As a member of the Devops team, you’ll build tools to facilitate the deployment and management of our applications and deploy scalable cloud infrastructure to support them. You’ll work to migrate our standard cloud fleets to CloudFormation-driven fleets. You’ll help improve our processes and security using the newest and best available techniques and cloud services. You’ll help us plan for and monitor our applications during peak traffic periods, and give our other engineers the tools they need to properly monitor and take ownership for the performance of their own applications.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Opera Mediaworks (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
Responsibilities


We are looking for a talented individual to join our team of developers responsible for building the Opera advertising platform.


This position will entail delivering everything from small incremental improvements to existing systems, to building out new systems as we continue to refine our operation and grow into new market verticals. As well as being enthusiastic about the product we are building, the qualified candidate will be skilled in application architecture, and will have rock-solid hands-on experience with all or most of the technologies currently in use. These include: Linux, PHP, Javascript, HTML, XML-based web services, and MySQL. This is a fast-paced dynamic environment that calls for someone with ample skills and energy. This position is located in San Francisco, CA and San Mateo, CA. Work in a Global company. Flexible work hours.



  • Responsible for maintaining and evolving the Opera advertising platform.

  • Design system architecture and code applications based on product and market input from Product and Engineering management.

  • Improve development process and add automation to create high quality, reliable system builds. Experience with Subversion is preferred.

  • Must be willing and able to check on our production environment, deploy a release, or assist in problem diagnosis and correction as needed.

  • Publish release notes and conduct in-house demonstration and training on new features before they are released.

  • Work closely to coordinate all phases of development lifecycle with other members of the development team.

item.title: RHEL Engineer- Platform Services- $216K at Crossover (, ) (allows remote)
item.description:
As the Engineer for Platform Services you will provide technical engineering and implementation services for the planning, design, integration, and testing of Enterprise Cross-Domain Services (ECDS) on RHEL platform. You will interface with the client in the design process to translate security and business requirements into technical designs. You will also Coordinate designs with enterprise architects, service consumers, and certification and accreditation authorities.


Key Responsibilities


· Install, configure, and maintain RHEL systems to support business processing requirements.


· Provide top level technical support, assist in the evaluation of new products and services, and may manage vendor SLA.


· Networking and storage-related switching, routing. Configuring static routes, packet filtering, and network address translation.


· Implement, design, and manage complex Virtual and physical RHEL server infrastructures. SME in provisioning Servers, Various hypervisors and management platforms (vSphere/vCenter, VCAC).


· Implement and maintain system management software, as well as research, analyze, and implement software patches and Hardware modifications to resolve deficiencies. Setting kernel runtime parameters & Shell scripting for automation.


· Perform capacity and resource planning by assessing risks and developing contingency plans.


· Maintain production change control schedule and, when needed, assist in the change control.


· Support and schedule operating systems installations and upgrades, as well as layered software packages, in accordance with established IT policies and procedures. Software automation, Puppet preferred.


· Assist with the configuration and maintenance of physical and logical components.


· Monitor, analyze, and tune the technical system to achieve optimal performance levels.


· Ensure compliance with established standards, policies, and configuration guidelines.


· Develop and maintain a comprehensive technical system configuration and database library of all supporting documentation.


· Develops business cases and gains basic understanding of project and operational budgeting.


· Assists development team with modeling, physical design and application tuning.


· Assists in the recommendation of strategies for data center and infrastructure management from business continuity, DRP, monitoring, storage, security.


· Routinely audits hardware and software to ensure compliance with established standards, policies, procedures, and configuration guidelines.


· Implements and use backup and restore techniques.


· Mentors less experienced administrators on an ongoing and often formal basis.


· Solid knowledge and experience with Red Hat (RHEL) OS (4x, 5x, 6x) and application delivery/packaging solutions, including


· RPM consolidation, critical patch management using Satellite, Kernel tuning and Shell scripting (bash, perl).


· Experience with VMware, SRM, console management, and virtualization system backup capabilities.

item.title: Backend Software Engineer at Planet Labs (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Software touches every corner of our company, enabling us to continually improve every process by controlling the tools that run them. In addition to our internal tools that control the manufacturing, testing, operating and optimizing the satellites we also run a massive data processing pipeline that crunches terabytes of imagery (and will soon do that every single day). We run a cloud-first, API-driven architecture. Our goal is to enable everyone in the world to access our imagery, so huge web-scalability is a requirement. Our ‘full stack’ runs from the spacecraft to our web tools, and there are enough hard and interesting problems to keep many teams busy for a long time to come.


Our Backend Software engineers currently code primarily in C and Python. We run tens of thousands of jobs per day on an AWS infrastructure with PostgreSQL, Flask and ElasticSearch.  Our applications are built on a foundation of open source projects. We work to be active contributors of those projects and dedicated stewards of new open source image processing and infrastructure projects.

item.title: C++ Software Engineer, Mid and SR. Levels at Tripwire (Alpharetta, GA)
item.description:
Tripwire delivers advanced threat protection, security and compliance solutions, enabling enterprises, government agencies and service providers to confidently detect, prevent and respond to cybersecurity threats to their business. Headquartered in Portland, Oregon, Tripwire’s customer base extends into vertical industries including government, energy, financial services, retail, manufacturing, education and entertainment. Almost all executive branch agencies of the U.S. federal government and half the Fortune 500 turn to Tripwire for their IT security and compliance needs. With thousands of customers in nearly 100 countries, there’s a reason why organizations turn to Tripwire.
Tripwire is growing and we have multiple Software Engineering openings for our core product, Tripwire Enterprise.
This position is a leadership role requiring hands-on ability, deep technical expertise and the ability to influence across teams.
We are most interested in talent and drive, but specific experience and skills matter too. Ideal candidates will have backgrounds like this:


  • Enterprise product development using modern C++

  • Scalable, distributed systems using asynchronous messaging (e.g. AMQ)

  • Knowledge/interest in the field of security

  • Agile process based on the SCRUM framework


As a successful candidate, you will demonstrate clear thought processes and communicate well with technical and non-technical audiences. You should thrive in a collaborative environment, advocate directly and politely for ideas, and speak up in support of your team. You should be a creative problem-solver, providing thoughtful approaches to challenging technical problems that solve real business needs.

item.title: Software Engineer Python Specialist Job Ref 19 at First Light Fusion Ltd (Begbroke, UK)
item.description:
Vacancy Specification


First Light Fusion is seeking a Python engineer to join our cutting-edge numerical team that is developing a set of tools for the prediction and analysis of inertial confinement fusion. We have built a multiple-fluid compressible flow solver from the ground-up that brings together heavily templated C++ for performance and Python for user interaction.


Our toolset makes extensive use of third party libraries such as CGAL (www.cgal.org), OpenVDB (www.openvdb.org), VTK (www.vtk.org), and boost::python for wrapping. Work is coordinated through github and organised through agile best practices, including test driven development where appropriate. The successful candidate will engage with the existing technical program, while also providing leadership for the Python components of development, including architectural decisions.


Additionally, we continue to develop a library of Python code to process in-house experimental data. The successful candidate will contribute to the architecture and quality-control of the diagnostic tools in this ever expanding code base. It is anticipated that this stream of work will involve significant time in close collaboration with the experimental team, for example engaging in pair programming.


Benefits


A competitive package, opportunity to participate in the company’s share option scheme, and relocation expenses.


How to apply


Please upload a covering letter / supporting statement and CV to www.firstlightfusion.com/careers quoting the job reference. We will commence interviewing candidates on 30th September 2015 and the post will remain open until filled. Two referees should be available on request.


Informal enquiries may also be addressed to careers@firstlightfusion.com. 


CVs sent by recruitment agencies will not be read, and in the event that the company receives a CV from both the direct applicant and a recruitment agency the CV will be treated as a direct application by the individual only. Unsolicited contact from Recruitment agencies will be disregarded. 


We are an equal opportunities employer. This role will be subject to background checks.

item.title: PHP DEVELOPER - CTO at SkipassGo srl (Trento, Italy)
item.description:
SkipassGo is looking for an experienced PHP developer to join the team and help deliver software which contributes to our business goals. Our office is located in Trento in the TechPeaks incubator.  You will be part of one of the most innovative ecosystem in Europe thanks to the connections we have with the University, Research Centers and Startups and will be involved in the events, conferences and social activities. You will be developing our business intelligent tools, distribution platform, smart applications and internal and external API’s. 


We use the following stack: PHP, MySql, JQuery, HTML5, Amazon AWS, Angular.Js, Elastic Search


Responsibilities



  • Implement and code new solutions using existing and new technology

  • Setup, management and analysis of metric management system

  • Coordinate the technical team (both resident and non-resident)

  • Design a flexible and efficient backend

  • Support recruiting of further team members

  • Overall system architecture

  • Decide on methods, platforms and programming languages

  • Choose and manage vendors used

item.title: Developer Relations Engineer at Unity Technologies (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
Unity’s Technical Support team is at the front line of the company; we solve the problems that other people can’t solve, and we look good while doing it. Our customers have crazy tight schedules and high expectations, and our developer relations engineers are up to the challenge in providing rapid, accurate, and personable assistance. As a member of the specialized Enterprise Support team, you will be instrumental in ensuring the success of our very-highest-profile customer productions.


Travel is a must, and it certainly won’t hurt to have a passion for solving intractable, never-before-seen problems on a daily basis. 


**Also hiring in San Francisco, Austin and Montreal

item.title: Software Engineer at SaleCycle (Houghton le Spring, UK)
item.description:
The web-based SaleCycle platform forms the core of our business and handles an incredible amount of data from our 500+ international clients. As a Software Engineer, you would ensure the continuous delivery of current features and services whilst delivering new and exciting products that keep SaleCycle at the forefront of the remarketing industry; you’re a pivotal part of this organisation!



As a Software Engineer, you will...


• Write high-quality code for SaleCycle’s portfolio of products, within an Agile team environment; code that forms the backbone of the business
• Conduct reviews of existing systems and processes to ensure we’re always performing to our best capacity
• Share your knowledge and experience with your team, mentoring newbies and helping everyone excel at what they do
• Collaborate with the wider business, in particular the Product & Business Managers, in order to accurately deliver what they need whilst also providing ad-hoc tech advice & support to all

item.title: Senior Windows Engineer at SANS Institute (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description: Senior Windows Engineer responsibilities will be focused on the installation, maintenance and monitoring of SANS critical computing infrastructure, including our Learning Management System, Active Directory/IDP, and other Windows OS and Linux-based OS-based server systems. In addition, the position will be responsible for continually monitoring and adjusting the performance of our learning management systems and other business critical systems, identifying system performance issues, and making recommendations on hardware or software modifications to optimize system performance.

item.title: Senior C# Azure Developer at Stealth FinTech (London, UK) (allows remote)
item.description:
You’ve been developing Azure-based applications using C# and love elegant design. The problem-solving aspect of software development excites you every day. You’ve been wanting to join a FinTech startup, but have been put off by the restrictions of location and working practices. You long to apply your hard-won skills to one of the most cutting edge and fast-growing areas of tech in the UK. You just haven’t found the right company - yet.


You have been developing cloud-based applications for long enough that you no longer think in terms of racks and conserving resources. You are comfortable with the complete cloud-based ADLC and have experience in utilising many of Azure’s PaaS and IaaS features.


You’ve worked on complex, unfamiliar domains in cross-functional teams. You are comfortable communicating with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


WHY WORK WITH US?


You’ll be joining a hand-picked team, all brilliant in their respective fields.


You’ll be stretched and tested within a supportive team environment.


You can create a genuine work/life balance. You will be required to get together regularly with other team members, but you won’t have a daily commute. We’re a modern company with modern working practices. You just need to take pride in and ownership of your work and deliver what's needed.


FinTech is booming and we will be at the forefront.


WHAT YOU'LL DO


You’ll be working in a small team with our CTO building the back-end of our FinTech services. This will be cloud-based and capable of supporting thousands of customers and millions of transactions. To do this, you’ll have access to the latest software and hardware.


You’ll have mutual responsibility for all aspects of the development lifecycle from spec through to build, test and deploy. You’ll meet regularly with both technical and non-technical co-workers, but you’ll mostly get to choose from where you work.


The code you produce will be fast, efficient and robust and readable.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Zymeworks Inc. (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
We are seeking a Senior DevOps Engineer to help improve our software infrastructure. We pride ourselves on developing useful and robust software, and would like to have a world-class development environment for our team including automated builds, continuous integration, monitoring and fault tolerance.


 As Senior DevOps Engineer, your responsibilities would include:



  • Interfacing between Software Development and Systems Administration teams 

  • Facilitating the transition of our platform from our own in-house cluster to the cloud

  • Creating and managing standardized software development environments for the Software Development team

  • Developing automated systems for deployment, monitoring and fault tolerance

  • Helping improve software deployment, monitoring and development processes taking into account systems requirements

  • Working with the systems team to provide the necessary services for the software development team

  • Laying the foundation for a strong DevOps team, and establishing a common language between developers and system team members.

  • Envisioning long term goals for our infrastructure along with the Software and Systems team leads.

item.title: Software Engineer - Automated Trading at Optiver US LLC (Chicago, IL)
item.description: Optiver’s Automated Trading Systems teams strive to develop the world’s best trading software. We face a variety of problems with high degrees of difficulty: managing scarce bandwidth resources, building extremely low latency systems to respond to market events, automatically pricing diverse sets of financial instruments with extremely low error tolerance, and allowing intuitive control of a highly complex system. All of this must be done with the future of our company and of trading in mind. These systems must also be simple, flexible, and well-architected so they can quickly be changed to meet the dynamic needs of our traders. We already have a team of great developers, but we need more.

item.title: Software Engineer (Backend) at PlayLab Ltd. (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
We are a mobile games company based in Bangkok, Thailand.  We do everything in-house. That means we don't outsource any of our work. We focus on casual games for both IOS, Android and other platforms. 



 The role


As a software engineer on our backend team your prime responsibility is to create and support features needed in our games as well as working together with systems engineers on the team to ensure reliability and scalability of the platform.


You will get to work on technologies such as Ruby (mostly RoR), eventmachine, MySQL, Redis and Cassandra. We are however not set on these technologies and they will most likely change in the future, you will be part of figuring out which technology to bring in next.


What you would be doing:



  • Collaborate with system engineers to improve current features and bring new into production.

  • Making sure our backend is of great quality.

  • Get hands-on experience with building a scalable backend for millions of users.

  • Build a nice platform for our game developers to built great games on top of

  • Investigate and implement new technologies to improve our service.


About the backend team:


Our culture is fairly startup-y, with a flat hierarchy and lots of freedom to work on what you think is important. We try to hire smart people, and trust them to do smart things. We track player progress, store game state, handle in-app purchases, and process large amounts of analytics data, amongst other things. 


Our engineering culture also like in the startup world - we test heavily, move fast, automate everything. We do regular code reviews, and weekly tech talks to share skills.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at BBC (London, UK)
item.description:
myBBC is a new and high profile programme designed to make the BBC online experience feel personal and relevant to our audience, encouraging them to view, listen to, or play with our content; be that content they know and love, or content we help them discover. It’s basically about content!


As Tony Hall, Director General of the BBC, said; “it's the start of a real transformation – the myBBC revolution. How to reinvent public service broadcasting through data. But we will always be doing it in a BBC way – not telling you what customers like you bought, but what citizens like you would love to watch and need to know.”


Sounds exciting, eh?


So, what will you do on a daily basis, to help make a difference to the delivery and continuous development of the myBBC product? Glad you asked…


The primary focus of this role is on the creation and maintenance of RESTful web services, written in Java and deployed on AWS. You will be expected to be familiar with technologies such as Spring, Camel, JUnit, Mockito. In addition, experience of Swagger, Apigee-127 and Node.js will be a significant plus. Similarly, knowledge of AWS, including SQS, DynamoDB and Lambda will help to get you started quickly.


Being involved in the full life cycle of the products, you’ll need to be able to adapt quickly to new or changing requirements, produce rapid prototypes and communicate effectively with the team as a whole, not just other engineers.


We’re agile in our development with a multi-disciplinary team working closely with a Product Owner, Business Analyst and Project Manager along with dedicated QA and our colleagues in User Experience & Design.


As we receive high levels of traffic, you will be responsible for ensuring that the performance and scalability of Notifications services meets the demands of our audience.

item.title: Java Software Engineer at BBC (London, UK)
item.description:
myBBC is a new and high profile programme designed to make the BBC online experience feel personal and relevant to our audience, encouraging them to view, listen to, or play with our content; be that content they know and love, or content we help them discover. It’s basically about content!


As Tony Hall, Director General of the BBC, said; “it's the start of a real transformation – the myBBC revolution. How to reinvent public service broadcasting through data. But we will always be doing it in a BBC way – not telling you what customers like you bought, but what citizens like you would love to watch and need to know.”


Sounds exciting, eh?


So, what will you do on a daily basis, to help make a difference to the delivery and continuous development of the myBBC product? Glad you asked…


You’ll:



  • Build, design and deliver high quality, high volume, high availability and high performance solutions in line with guidance and best practices of the department

  • Have daily liaison with the product owner, technical lead and design teams to ensure the definition, design and development of new features run smoothly.

  • Be responsible for work quality, ensuring it meets the technical standards for all BBC Online output.

  • Develop, test, release and document applications using best software engineering practices to ensure timely service delivery and ease of maintenance.

  • Provide time and resource estimates to assist in the planning of projects.

  • Provide technical advice to the editorial and design teams on new application concepts and to establish their feasibility through prototypes.

item.title: Senior Java Developer (m/f) wanted! at Project A Ventures (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced Java developer who wants to take responsibility in a powerful startup environment! We are a team of strong IT experts that creates new startups from scratch and scale them big in europe and worldwide. In the past we successfully ramped-up a lot of startups like minodes and Intelipost.





Why we are different? - 5 reasons to work in the Project A environment:



(1) We are open-minded for new technologies and we use them when it makes sense.

(2) We are 100% pragmatic. You’ll work in an agile environment with frequent architecture talks, but without eternal planning meetings.

(3) We love lean and efficient solutions and prefare Tomcats over EJB container.

(4) Our internally developed framework does the annoying tasks for us and we can focus on the really interesting issues.

(5) We belief in a strong interdisciplinary teamwork of development, business-intelligence, marketing and operations.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
Digital innovation at Sainsbury’s has never been stronger. We’re leading the way for the retail industry, building world-class apps and services from our centres of excellence in London and just outside Coventry. And our ambition knows no bounds. That’s why we’re recruiting and developing some of the most talented colleagues around – and you’re next on our list.



We’re looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to work across both production and non-production environments, tirelessly delivering and supporting changes to our systems and business applications. It’s about driving the pace of change forward whilst maintaining the integrity of our services and, ultimately, increasing the value of our business.



As a Senior DevOps Engineer you’ll:




  • Offer inspirational coaching and mentorship to up to four DevOps engineers

  • Implement DevOps technologies and processes, e.g.: containerisation, CI/CD, infrastructure as code, metrics, monitoring, etc.

  • Automate wherever possible whilst always knowing how far is ‘too far’

  • Act as subject expert on at least one of the team’s applications

  • Work collaboratively with all delivery teams to transition changes into production

  • Track system and service performance to make sure we’re meeting SLAs

  • Be part of the on-call and out-of-hours rota when necessary

item.title: Infrastructuurspecialist at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Infrastructuurspecialist


Ministerie van Veiligheid en Justitie, Nederlands Forensisch Instituut


Functieomschrijving


Je levert bij het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) een belangrijke bijdrage aan het ontwerp en de inrichting van de technische infrastructuur van verschillende platforms.


Als infrastructuurspecialist buig jij je over het beheer van de technische infrastructuur en alle componenten van een platform, waaronder de hardware, netwerksoftware, protocollen, communicatieverbindingen, beheermechanismen en de onderlinge afstemming en koppelingen tussen netwerkcomponenten.


Je ontwerpt hiervoor de netwerkinfrastructuur en de hardware infrastructuur en richt deze in of je participeert hierin. Je monitort de platformbelasting en adviseert proactief. Ook los je incidenten op en je rapporteert hierover.


Het Nederland van nu zoekt ICT’ers. Bij de Rijksoverheid werk je als ICT-specialist aan belangrijke thema’s als privacy, security en cybercrime. Ook draag je bij aan ontwikkelingen in big data, cloud-oplossingen en bring your own device. Zo werk je mee aan het Nederland van nu.

item.title: Senior Ruby / Rails Engineer (Washington, DC) at LivingSocial (Washington, DC)
item.description:
You know LivingSocial as the marketplace to buy and share the best things to do in your city and beyond. And while we're bringing excitement and value to our merchants and consumers, we're also committed to creating a world-class environment for our employees. Our talented LivingSocialites bring an all-hands-on-deck approach to our work, taking pride in being collaborative, creative, and flexible. If you’re passionate about working as part of a team to drive value to businesses of all sizes, you may have just found your new home.


LivingSocial is revolutionizing local eCommerce. With millions of consumers and tens of thousands of merchants using our web and mobile tools, we're constantly improving our suite of products. Using data to drive decisions, our engineers are solving hard problems at the heart of our business. We’re looking for hungry, creative, and pragmatic engineers to help us continue innovating - you can learn more about our team on our tech blog and our public github repository.


We are looking for a Senior Ruby / Rails Engineer to join the Consumer Engineering team. 

Your responsibilities: 



  • Build intuitive, responsive experiences our millions of customers will enjoy engaging with every day

  • Help customers find what they’re looking for, and discover new things across our varied suite of offers

  • Find new ways for our customers to engage with us through sharing, personalization, etc. 

  • Personalize our content to provide the most value to our customers  

  • Optimize placement of promotions to deliver measurable ROI to merchants  

  • Work with our shared services teams to implement and integrate with our backend platform


Desired skills, experience & qualifications:



  • 5+ years of web development experience; preference given to candidates who have experience with large applications of some scale 

  • Exceptional competency in object-oriented programming 

  • Experience developing in a web framework, with Ruby on Rails background a plus 

  • Solid foundation/knowledge of Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)

  • Experience working across the software stack (Ruby on Rails, JavaScript/CoffeeScript, MySQL, Redis) 

  • Excited about deploying to production multiple times a day

  • Comfort collaborating daily with your team (could be a distributed team) and other groups

  • You can take smart risks and champion new ideas


Compensation:



  • Competitive base salary and bonus plan 

  • We’ve got you covered with health, dental, and vision offerings and a fantastic 401(k) matching contribution that vests immediately

  • Generous paid time off program

  • Some of our offices offer commuter benefits, all of our offices offer snacks...lots of snacks

  • Opportunity to work with committed, talented people with a great sense of humor




LivingSocial appreciates your interest in our company as a place of employment. It is the policy of LivingSocial to provide equal opportunity for employment to all qualified employees and applicants, regardless of race, religion, religious affiliation, ancestry, citizenship status, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, or veteran status. This policy applies to all areas of employment including recruitment, placement, training, transfer, promotion, termination, pay, and other forms of compensation and benefits. The company will comply with its legal obligation to provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities.

item.title: Angular Application Developer at Bublup Technologies, Inc. (McLean, VA)
item.description: Bublup is hiring Angular developers to create state of the art interfaces for large-scale and highly interactive applications. Our projects are ground-breaking in terms of how users will interact with data and each other. We are looking for people who love to write code, but also have a great imagination.  Starting bonuses available for top candidates!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - In Test at NetSuite (Kitchener, ON, Canada)
item.description:
We are looking for a skilled and energetic software developer who loves the challenge of working on a fast-paced team where he or she will build systems they can be proud of. The selected candidate will become a critical member of our growing software development team responsible for creating and supporting new features for NetSuite’s Enterprise Payroll solution.


More specifically, the person in this role will be expected to:



  • Attain a full understanding of the NetSuite Enterprise Payroll solution.

  • Develop high quality new features and enhancements that delight customers.

  • Fix product defects.

  • Follow established software development processes.

item.title: Backend Developer, Open Source at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Booking.com is looking for Software Developers who are passionate about their craft, who thrive on challenge and who believe in success through collaboration – people who would complement our existing team of developers!


We offer an international, result-driven, fun, and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, Booking is the place to B!


B.responsible


Our technical culture derives strongly from our strong ties to the Perl community. We appreciate what open source means both for our business and also for internal projects. Some of our most useful hacks inside the company have come from someone scratching the proverbial itch.


Even if you do not have Perl experience, your colleagues will help you get up to speed in order to be able to start solving real problems from day one. You will work independently and will also be responsible for making technical decisions within a team. Our development strategy is agile and we work in small Scrum teams of 5-7. We do several rollouts every day, are data-driven and do extensive A/B testing.


As a Software Developer, you are responsible for the development, performance, and scaling of our public website as well as internal systems, which includes using: Perl (5.14), DBI, Mason, Moose, Sereal, Plack, nginx, Javascript, MySQL, Memcached, Redis, Hadoop, Elasticsearch, git, and CentOS Linux.


Important aspects of the job include:



  • Rapidly develop next-generation scalable, flexible, and high-performance systems.

  • Solve issues with the site and internal systems, prioritizing based on customer impact

  • Act as an intermediary for problems, with both technical and non-technical audiences

  • Collaborate with the team, Team Leaders and Product Owners to prioritize projects


B.offered


We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits.  IT also has monthly hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.


This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

item.title: Senior PHP Developer (m/f) wanted! at Project A Ventures (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced PHP developer who wants to take responsibility in a powerful startup environment!

We are a team of strong IT experts that creates new startups from scratch and scale them up in Europe and worldwide. In the past we successfully ramped-up Startups like Tirendo, nu3 and saatchiart.
Why are we different? - 5 reasons to work in the Project A environment:

(1) We are open for new technologies and we use them whenever it makes sense.

(2) We are 100% pragmatic. You will work in an agile environment with frequent architecture talks, but without eternal planning meetings.

(3) We know about the benefits of TDD, BDD and Clean Code and make use of it!

(4) We are not afraid of huge architectural challenges. For instance we developed our own e-commerce software called “Yves & Zed” (more http://goto.project-a.com/)

(5) We belief in a strong interdisciplinary teamwork among web development, business-intelligence, marketing and operations.

item.title: iOS Application Developer at Bublup Technologies, Inc. (McLean, VA)
item.description: Bublup is hiring iOS developers to create state of the art interfaces for large-scale and highly interactive applications. Our projects are ground-breaking in terms of how users will interact with data and each other. We are looking for people who love to write code, but also have a great imagination.  Starting bonuses available for top candidates!

item.title: JavaScript Developer - Sling TV at Sling TV (American Fork, UT)
item.description:
Summary:


Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet. We are seeking a Software Engineer  to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. This is an exciting position in a fast moving project that requires the ability of candidates to hit the ground running. What we’re building is revolutionary and every employee participates in a profit sharing program. Come be a part of changing the face of TV!


Sling TV delivers content from Disney/ESPN, HBO, AMC, Turner, Scripps, EPIX, Univision and Maker Studios, and is available on Amazon Fire TV, Amazon Fire TV Stick, current-generation Roku players, Roku TV models, Xbox One, Android, iOS, Macs, PCs.


JavaScript and HTML 5 engineer to support Xbox and HTML5 clients.  This is AP work and backend analytics.This is a unique opportunity to develop video ecosystem software in JavaScript around the built-in video support in HTML5. We have influence in the web standards and are heavily involved in emerging video delivery systems. The position involves developing web-based client-side software to interface with our high-scale video back-end systems. This position is focused on creating JavaScript libraries to support a web UI built on our video ecosystem framework.


Responsibilities:



  • Follows coding standards, unit tests and integration tests

  • Communicates constantly with other server and operations teams

  • Takes ownership of the project and innovates on library API design and standards

item.title: Junior Java Developer (m/f) wanted! at Project A Ventures (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for an Java developer for one of our ventures who wants to take responsibility in a powerful startup environment!

We are a team of strong IT experts that creates new startups from scratch and scale them big in europe and worldwide. In the past we successfully ramped-up a lot of startups like Toroleo, Minodes und Intellipost.




Why we are different? - 5 reasons to work in the Project A environment:


(1) We are open-minded for new technologies and we use them when it makes sense.

(2) We are 100% pragmatic. You’ll work in an agile environment with frequent architecture talks, but without eternal planning meetings.

(3) We love lean and efficient solutions and prefare Tomcats over EJB container.

(4) Our internally developed framework does the annoying tasks for us and we can focus on the really interesting issues.

(5) We belief in a strong interdisciplinary teamwork of development, business-intelligence, marketing and operations.

item.title: Data Analyst / Report Developer at stratton (Port Melbourne, Australia)
item.description:
Do you live and breathe data, and are you excited about the possibility of using your skills to become a key member of a fast growing Australian company? If this sounds like you, then you want to work for us.


We need a senior data analyst who can help drive the next phase of growth for our business. In this role you will be responsible for planning, implementing and managing all aspects of our data-driven strategy. We have a suite of in-house developed software and access to large volumes of website data collected since the company's inception. You will closely work with all of our departments including software, marketing and sales with the view of upgrading our data reporting and analytic capabilities and advising on strategies for optimising growth within the organisation.


We are a business that defines itself through the smart and efficient use of technology. We may be a finance company, but we’re nothing like other finance companies; no stuffy old bankers, no bean-counters, and no corporate bureaucracy – just a dynamic, fast-growing business with a passion for the cutting edge. We’re successful because we disrupted our industry 12 years ago and continue to do so today - we do things differently, and our information technology team plays a critical role in our success.


Whether you have many years experience and are now looking for a new challenge or an intermediate data analyst ready to take the next step in your career, if you’re smart, driven, enjoy a challenge – and most importantly, love data – then we want to hear from you.

item.title: Senior Web Developer at Zeta Interactive (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
You will work with some of the best and brightest talent in the industry, challenging you to think out of the box and simplify and solve complex problems in creative ways.


We're looking for a talented and seasoned Senior Web Developer to join our team. You should be someone who can take an idea from concept to execution and then test it in all the browsers. You should be able to speak fluent jQuery and have a love for the latest web dev trends. You should also be able to provide leadership and mentorship for other members of your team who may be geographically distributed.


Innovation, collaboration, excellence and fun are at the core of everything we strive for at Zeta Interactive. We want to speak with you if you are passionate about elevating your career to the next level while making a tremendous impact at Zeta!


Responsibilities



  • Display a passion for coding

  • Own problems, develop solutions and mentor and inspire other developers

  • Wear multiple hats in a sprint cycle, from a product owner to an architect to a coder

  • Innovate and collaborate as part of a larger multi-location Engineering Team

  • Interface directly with other functional groups, including our customers, product management and DevOps to identify and define features


Why Work For Us:



  • Generous time-off policy

  • Daily catered lunches

  • Company sponsored team outings

  • Friday happy hours

  • Benefits include: medical, dental, vision, 401k, LTD, STD, etc.

item.title: Senior C# Developer with web application experience at Vergic (Malmö, Sweden)
item.description:
We are currently recruiting a Senior C# Developer for our Development team. Are you a brilliant backend developer? Are you a team player ready to create amazing user experience?


The role as Senior C# Developer is based in Malmö. He or she will be part of our core development team that continuously enhance the Vergic Engage platform (web application) with new features that bring value to our customers. Responsibilities include among other things:



  • Build amazing software applications of high quality

  • Follow, improve and communicate best practices for back-end engineering (e.g. coding standards & unit tests)

  • Drive the completion of all kinds of work tasks.

  • Help break down, estimate and provide just-in-time design for small increments of work

  • Build strong team by actively helping team members.

  • Continuously learning as an individual and in a team. 


We want you to set high standards for yourself, your performance and your results. At the same time we are offering a fantastic opportunity within an exciting and developing company. With us, you will become a part of a company that is characterized by growth, innovation and development in an environment of teamwork. Your colleagues will challenge and contribute to your personal and professional development.

item.title: Windows Systems Engineer at WSM International (Saint Clair Shores, MI) (allows remote)
item.description:
WSM is an established industry-leading technical services and solutions integrator undergoing a rapid growth phase due to demand for our cloud adoption, migration, transformation, security and DevOps services.


We offer virtually unlimited career growth potential for talented and motivated developers, systems engineers and server administrators.


We thrive in a casual, open, friendly and collaborative environment. Our work is rewarded with very good pay and an awesome benefits plan including health, term life, short and long term disability, 401k with company match (yeah!), dental, vision and flexible PTO. This is a full-time, 40 hour/week position.


We're looking for a sharp, self-motivated and self-managed Windows Systems Engineer to meet a growing demand for Windows environment cloud and server migration projects. 


You'll help plan, architect, consult and execute on a wide range of workload, application and data migrations working both independently and as part of our Windows systems engineering team. 



  • Evaluate, estimate and perform proof-of-concept for server and cloud migration projects (all Windows-based)

  • Collaborate with team members as well as operate individually to execute all phases of complex migration projects

  • Maintain existing Windows-based environments

  • Gain an in-depth understanding of our customer's objectives and related system interactions through direct customer, partner and/or WSM business staff communications, meetings and project discovery sessions

  • Work closely with partners, customers and colleagues to define and clarify project plans, deliverables, expectations, and scheduling

  • May contribute to DevOps tool chain implementation, DR and/or security initiatives as a part of the overall server or cloud transformation & migration engagement for WSM customers and partners

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Sainsbury's (Coventry, UK)
item.description:
Digital innovation at Sainsbury’s has never been stronger. We’re leading the way for the retail industry, building world-class apps and services from our centres of excellence in London and just outside Coventry. And our ambition knows no bounds. That’s why we’re recruiting and developing some of the most talented colleagues around – and you’re next on our list.


We’re looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to work across both production and non-production environments, tirelessly delivering and supporting changes to our systems and business applications. It’s about driving the pace of change forward whilst maintaining the integrity of our services and, ultimately, increasing the value of our business.


As a Senior DevOps Engineer you’ll:


• Offer inspirational coaching and mentorship to up to four DevOps engineers
• Implement DevOps technologies and processes, e.g.: containerisation, CI/CD, infrastructure as code, metrics, monitoring, etc.
• Automate wherever possible whilst always knowing how far is ‘too far’
• Act as subject expert on at least one of the team’s applications
• Work collaboratively with all delivery teams to transition changes into production
• Track system and service performance to make sure we’re meeting SLAs
• Be part of the on-call and out-of-hours rota when necessary

item.title: Web Developer/Senior Web Developer - myBBC Notifications at BBC (London, UK)
item.description:
myBBC is a new and high profile programme designed to make the BBC online experience feel personal and relevant to our audience, encouraging them to view, listen to, or play with our content; be that content they know and love, or content we help them discover. It’s basically about content!


As Tony Hall, Director General of the BBC, said; “it's the start of a real transformation – the myBBC revolution. How to reinvent public service broadcasting through data. But we will always be doing it in a BBC way – not telling you what customers like you bought, but what citizens like you would love to watch and need to know.”


Sounds exciting, eh?


So, what will you do on a daily basis, to help make a difference to the delivery and continuous development of the myBBC product? Glad you asked…


The primary focus of this role is on the creation and maintenance of the Notifications front end platform, written in JavaScript and deployed on AWS. You will be expected to be familiar with technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS, JSON, Ajax. In addition, experience of Node.js, PhantomJS and SASS will be a significant plus. Similarly, knowledge of AWS, including S3 will help to get you started quickly.


Being involved in the full life cycle of the products, you’ll need to be able to adapt quickly to new or changing requirements, produce rapid prototypes and communicate effectively with the team as a whole, not just other engineers.


We’re agile in our development with a multi-disciplinary team working closely with a Product Owner, Business Analyst and Project Manager along with dedicated QA, our colleagues in User Experience & Design and DevOps.


Our audience uses a diverse range of devices and browsers to access BBC services; you will be responsible for ensuring that the performance and reliability of the Notifications UI remains consistent.

item.title: Software QA Automation Engineer at CYREN GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The Software Quality Assurance Automation Engineer will join our Anti-Spam R&D team to oversee the entire development process, from start to finish and monitors every phase of the software development process to ensure design implementation quality.  The incumbent ensures that our software adheres to set standards by using state of the art automation tools and techniques.



  • Map the QA aspects of development process into goals such as verifications, activities, measurements, abilities, and commitments

  • Set up and maintain test environments

  • Test new features and verify bug fixes (whitebox & blackbox testing)

  • Understand overall security implications of new bugs and features

  • Ensure interoperability and standard conformance of new features

  • Track security issues in 3rd party components

  • Maintain and improve the (automatic) build environment (includes writing own scripts etc.)

  • Analyze issues brought up by operations and support

  • Write extensive documentation

item.title: Senior Platform Engineer at HelloSign (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We are 7 full-stack engineers and 1 front-end engineer seeking you: a back-end guru. Do you seek out scaling challenges? Have you architected a platform to achieve 10x capacity? Do you have experience managing the complexity of long-running concurrent jobs? Are you brimming with opinions about how best to eliminate side effects and simplify concurrency management? If so, let's chat!


Our Engineering Team


Our team of 8 engineers is friendly, curious, driven, and highly collaborative. We support one another and regularly hold code reviews to facilitate learning and reduce friction during our 3-week releases. We strive for clean, readable, maintainable code. Our engineers also work closely with other teams in the company, including creative, product, and customer support. The entire company works together at our open office in downtown San Francisco.

item.title: Contract Senior Sitecore Engineer at Razorfish (El Segundo, CA)
item.description:
Our LA office is looking for a Senior .NET Engineer for a 4+ month assignment to help with new development for a major website redesign. This person will be responsible for designing and writing code to support the web applications that we are delivering for our client.




  • Writing framework code based on design specifications

  • Learn new technologies

  • Provide direction in the analysis and fixing of defects

  • Work with other disciplines to satisfy business requirements and provide technical constraints

  • Work with Engineering Team to establish a collaborative environment between technology and the other disciplines

  • vities on one small to medium sized project

  • Responsible for day to day work assignments within a project

  • Report status to technology leadership or PMO

  • Assist Business Development and project teams in scoping and estimating project work for small to medium sized projects

  • Follows standard policies and procedures; recommends improvements as appropriate.

item.title: Software Developer at Nanometrics (Ottawa, ON, Canada)
item.description:
We are looking for a software developer to join our team of smart, creative engineers to help build our next generation of products.


How we work


We work in an informal, fun, fast-moving, collaborative environment with minimal hierarchy. While we have the freedom to set our own hours and the flexibility to maintain an excellent work/life balance, we work hard to ensure that our products are delivered on time.


We develop a full range of software -- from customized Linux kernels and advanced signal processing applications, to web services and APIs.  We believe in using the best development tools and practices, and use an Agile approach.


What we do


Nanometrics creates innovative software and systems for detecting and monitoring seismic activity. Our products make a difference in people’s lives by helping to understand the significant human impact earthquakes have around the world. Our customers are leading researchers and companies who use our products for earthquake scientific research as well as natural disaster warning systems, nuclear non-proliferation monitoring, and induced seismic activity detection. Our systems are deployed on every continent and in some of the most remote and harsh environments on Earth, from deserts and mountains, to the Arctic and the bottom of the ocean.


This position is available in our Ottawa office, located on the edge of the Greenbelt. Close to biking paths and bus routes, and a short commute to many nearby residential areas.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - growth stage startup at Next Step Living (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Next Step Living, one of the fastest growing companies in the U.S., is embarking on a brand new platform vision that will act as a companion to our existing business model. We are looking for and experienced Senior Software Engineer to join the team and help drive forward our  vision of becoming a national & trusted consumer facing brand. 


As a Software Engineer at Next Step Living, you will help build a new customer-facing product from scratch, and deliver new features to market on a regular basis. Through excellent product and software design, we will enable our company to grow more rapidly, and extend our positive environmental impact nationwide.



What You’ll Work With




  •  Dropwizard




  •  Postgres




  •  Nginx




  •  Rabbitmq




  •  Redis




  •  Jenkins




  •  AWS




  •  Docker




  •  Also in our tech stack: Angular 1.4 (with migration to 2.0), TypeScript, TypeScript, Mocha / Chai, Protractor, NodeJS, Loopback.io / ExpressJS, Android, RxJava

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer at Ping Identity (Denver, CO)
item.description:
As a Ping Identity SRE, you will be involved in every facet of our On-Demand SaaS services. From conceptual design of interconnected sub-systems to network design, platform testing and analysis, security policy, service troubleshooting, and application performance. Ping SREs own responsibility for application performance, monitoring, and adherence to SLAs. Everything needs to just work, all the time... and you’re the one who’s responsible. If things need to get fixed in the middle of the night, you’re the one to get it done.


Working within the DevOps Team, you’ll be expected wear many hats. From first responder to performance analysis, system architect, capacity planning and monitoring support. Our DevOps team is fully integrated and running continuous deployments daily. SREs are expected to provide input wherever possible in the product’s development, deployment and design.

Responsibilities:



  • Linux systems administration, configuration, troubleshooting and automation.

  • Experience with virtualization platforms such as VMware, Xen, KVM and public cloud resources such as AWS or Rackspace Cloud.

  • Analysis of complex system behavior, performance and application issues.

  • Development of monitoring solutions and analysis across multiple data centers.

  • Capacity analysis and planning, traffic routing, and security policies for Ping’s market leading Single Sign-On SaaS applications.

  • Develop, maintain and administration of cutting-edge infrastructure deployment tools.

  • This is a 24/7 on-call position with a rotation schedule. You’re expected to jump out of bed to fix stuff when it’s down.

item.title: VP, Architecture Consultant at State Street (Boston, MA)
item.description:
This role is part of/in support of the Office of Regulatory Initiatives (ORI); ORI was created to manage complex enterprise risk issues, often spanning multiple functions and businesses. ORI is focused on the areas of Capital Planning and Stress Testing; AML; Liquidity; Credit Risk Management; Legal and Compliance Reputational Risk Management; Interest Rate Risk, Volcker Rule, IT.


The ADM Architecture Consultant, Vice President job duties are varied and complex and does require excellent architecture, technical, analytical, communication and conflict resolution skills, financail domain expertise including quantitative analysis and trading/P&L, cash flows, accounting skills and strong business judgment.


Role and Responsiblities:



  • Envisioning, architecting, designing and implementing financial systems across front, middle and back office

  • Engaging as a technology leader for building and maintaining a high-level technical architecture and business credibility with business users, system developers, and operations staff. 

  • Develpoing Enterprsie Common Service Frameworks including Messaging Bus, BPM, Cloud, Common UI, Alert/Event, Report, Web Services, and Security solutions

  • Driving Key technology and business transformation initives, providing architectural guidnaces, and oversight of development teams across the bank.

  • Successful realization of business opportunities via delivering timely and cost efficient IT systems promoting the tenet of servive oriented architecture and resue of existing assets by standardizing, commoditizing and automating system and busioness processes to drive cost efficiencies.

  • Working with / leading / guiding / influencing multiple blended teams of full-time employees and onshore / offshore contractors operating at multiple locations across time zones. 


Domain and Technologies:



  • Deep understanding of financial products, trading strategies, pricing models, P&L attributions, Risk calculations and Accounting. 

  • Strong Programming skills in J2EE, Rules, BPM, Cloud, UI, Enterrpise caching, various Open Source like TomCat, JBoss and best of breed commercial productions, DB2, Oracle, C++ and scripting languages with in-depth knowledge of related enterprise best practices, standards, and libraries. 

  • Hands-on experience with web-services and knowledge of SOA standards, and other approaches to service-oriented integration, working with databases, including competency in VLDB (Teradata, Exadata, Hadoop), source code management best practices, continuous integration, and automated testing. 

  • Experience integrating heterogeneous custom and enterprise class products tools as well as Database Appliances and Reporting/Business Analytics. 

  • Experience in various software development approaches from Waterfall to Agile, including test-driven development.

item.title: Senior or Mid-Level iOS Engineer - International Product Development at JUST EAT (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
As a Senior or Mid-Level Android Engineer at JUST EAT you will work on a product that generated over £1billion worth of orders in 2014, but wait... It's still growing!? 


As an Engineer in International Product Development what will you be doing?:



  • Our International Product Development team work on our platform and apps across 15 different countries.

  • Working in Continuous Delivery / Deployment and having full stack control to meet your's and your teams objectives.

  • Using OKR's to be aligned with company wide objectives, and create great clarity about what will make the boat go faster!


If you are a Senior Engineer you will:



  • Will become a trusted technical authority and specialist in one or more technical areas of your team. You’ll be someone the rest of the team and your Technology Manager can turn to for engineering advice and guidance.

  • Collaborate with other product development teams and use their feedback as a basis for improvements.

  • Write technically sound, clean, maintainable code – with practical application of established patterns and practices.

item.title: Full-Stack Developer at Wunder (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
We don’t like job descriptions at Wunder. Truth be told, we don’t even like calling them jobs. That said, we need someone to join the team and help us save the world, so call this what you will...


Wunder was founded with one simple vision: to address the greatest crisis of our generation by accelerating the proliferation of renewable energy. Members of our team have raised hundreds of millions of dollars in private equity, developed energy infrastructure solutions for the Department of Energy, and built digital products used and loved by millions of people. Now, we’re saving the world.


We have an amazing opportunity for an experienced, dependable, intellectually curious, and creative Full-Stack Developer to join our fast-growing startup. Like the rest of us, this person will wear many hats; you will work closely with our partners, customers, and investors. Specifically, you will be overseeing the development of our customer-facing investment portal that will help us build a strong investor base to finance the renewable energy infrastructure of the future.


You’ll be working side-by-side with the founders, collaborating and executing to make Wunder’s vision a reality. Additionally you’ll be helping to build a top notch engineering team, chock full of talented, curious, and ambitious engineers.


If you get excited about bringing an entirely new asset class to market, building an organization aimed at saving the world, and ensuring that all of the details needed to make all of that happen are covered, then this is the role for you.

item.title: Software Engineer, Insights Applications (Contractor) at Red Bull Media House (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
Red Bull Media House is building a program to deliver a new level of actionable insights around online conversations and engagement that can be used to better inform business decisions across marketing, media and digital teams. The development of a proprietary social analytics and insights reporting platform aims to translate and distill large volumes of data into an accessible understanding of target audience whereabouts, affinities, behavior and trends. These insights will be used to influence major innovation initiatives as well as decisions related to athlete sponsorships, music artist partnerships, video and film projects, events, digital product functionality, editorial planning, brand campaigns, media and marketing solutions among many others.


 The Software Engineer within the Red Bull Digital Analytics & Insights group is responsible for the implementation and maintenance of the various software products and tools required to drive global Red Bull Digital Analytics & Insights platform and business operations including analytics and insights reporting, UX configuration and construction, user management, marketing and advertising.

item.title: Principal Test Analyst at Department for Work and Pensions (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
Here at the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) we are re-platforming our entire IT onto new hardware, operating systems, application server technologies and application integrations, conducting large scale data migration, introducing new functionality and modernising front end user interfaces and applications. These IT systems underpin the services that support 22m citizens, annual processing of 7.35m benefit claims, payment of £165bn in benefits and pensions, and over 90,000 employees across 950 locations.


Key accountabilities: 


1. Define QA and Testing Processes and Tooling for your team 


Work with all other roles throughout the team to agree assurance and testing processes to assure the quality of their output such that it is unambiguous and consumable by following processes 


Drive ‘Shift Left’: work to define processes that reduce or eliminate defects by engineering in quality from the outset


Define Testing processes to exercise software produced, spanning functional, performance, security, accessibility, and operational testing and utilising appropriate test automation


Work with the team to identify tooling for use throughout the lifecycle, with an emphasis on smooth interfacing to allow process continuity (continuous build/integration/testing/delivery)


Follow continuous delivery principles, for example, regularly reflect on and adjust your approach to be more effective

2. Execution of Testing Activities within your team (during ‘Sprints’ and / or small iterative cycles)
Take responsibility for ensuring the conducting of test activities within your agile team


Integrate within the full Agile lifecycle, attending all regular meetings, identifying work you’ll progress, progress and blockers


Build automated tests utilising your own and departmental frameworks to ensure maintainability (cross-browser and cross-platform)


Conduct performance tests and lead reviews on tuning applications and infrastructure components


Conduct application and infrastructure penetration testing to validate security against the OWASP Testing Guide and in line with CESG (CHECK) and NIST standards


Conduct operational acceptance testing to include monitoring (e.g. protective monitoring and GPG-13), alerting, transactional integrity, failover and recovery (resilience testing), disaster recovery where applicable, and log rotation. Working with WebOps team to define quality operational standards


Conduct automated and manual accessibility testing; WCAG 2.0 AA or AAA conformance with user testing of zoom technology, screen readers, speech technology, plain English, and general understanding of WAI-ARIA (across mobile and desktop devices).


Direct any other Test professionals or team members engaged in testing


Engage specialist support (inside or outside of Testing) in areas such as automation, performance and security


Leading the continuous quality improvement activities through to ‘Live’ and beyond including defect reduction

3. Contribute to the Test Community
Share best practice and actively seek to improve consistency of approach and compliance with GDS (Government Digital Service) standards.


Actively network within DWP and outside to share your approach, take ideas and input from others, and to support others their work delivery


Attend and contribute to Test Community meetings and events


Engage with local Academy programmes to encourage inclusion of Testing content within Academy content and offer a local contact for academy trainers and attendees when Testing questions arise.

item.title: Lead Software Development Engineer Quidsi, Amazon Subsidiary at Amazon (Jersey City, NJ)
item.description:
Quidsi Inc., is a subsidiary of Amazon and entrepreneurial parent company to Diapers.com, Soap.com, BeautyBar.com, Wag.com, Yoyo.com, Look.com, Afterschool.com, Casa.com and Vinemarket.com. We are a mom-centric retail technology company. We deliver delightful experiences, products, and expertise by offering a curated selection of products, lightning-fast delivery, incredible customer service, and an easy-to-navigate shopping experience.



Quidsi’s sites are host to millions of daily visitors and our warehouses are run by hundreds of autonomous Kiva robots. Our entire operation from our websites/apps, to our fulfillment centers and customer care center is focused on creating an enjoyable end-to-end customer experience. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and driven people who are energized by what if (the meaning of Quidsi in Latin). If you'd like to help us build the place where people can find and buy anything online, come and innovate with us!



We are building a high caliber technology team consisting of the brightest minds who raise the bar and enjoy being vigorously challenged. The ideal candidate is passionate about design and architecture with an unwavering commitment to code quality.



The Senior Software Development Engineer is an idea generator who offers innovative solutions through a combination of creative thinking and deep understanding of the problem space. Projects will leverage Amazon’s technological capabilities and platforms to make Quidsi’s solutions compelling, unique and sustainable.



Responsibilities:

· Propose, prototype and evaluate multiple areas of optimization for our e-commerce applications and mobile-optimized sites

· Build high availability/ high reliability software on time

· Construct secure, scalable, and low-latency services and mobile applications

· Provide hands-on code contribution and shipping responsibility - libraries, API's, documentation

· Partner with Marketing, Merchandising and other business stakeholders to define functional solutions for business problems

· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field or corresponding experience equaling 4 year degree

· 5+ years experience in at least one of the following modern programming languages: Java, C#, C++, Python, Ruby, Scala, Groovy or any other modern non-scripting language

· Minimum of 2 years of web applications/services experience



· Building highly-available distributed systems on a cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS)

· Delivering low-latency, consumer-internet-scale web services

item.title: Software Engineer C#/.Net at WheelRight Ltd (Oxford, UK)

The business is expanding rapidly and requires dynamic developers to join the development team. The WheelRight systems are designed using a combination of software, hardware and mechanical designs working together. This is an opportunity to be involved in the capture and processing of real-time data along with back end database design and customer interface development.
