item.title: c# / .net Developer at Dealogic (London, UK)

Join Dealogic and help transform how capital markets operate. We are the way financial institutions enable their people to collaborate, make decisions and execute socially important function of optimising the flow of capital around the world. We deliver the best and most innovative software technology and the most respected and trusted content through highly skilled, connected and creative people.


The Role

You will be working in an Agile environment with Continuous Integration and Delivery as part of the process. Currently we are delivering every two weeks to our clients, however our ambition is to continuously be able to deliver when a feature is ready.

The team consist of technology driven individuals interested in working on cutting edge technologies with quality products and data.


There is a good mix of Greenfield & Brownfield projects the team is undertaking as part of   the roadmap and good design is at the forefront of what is currently being worked on.

item.title: Network Architect at Belk (Charlotte, NC)
item.description:
The Network Architect (NA) is a member of the Belk Infrastructure Engineering team and is responsible for leading the process that aligns our technology foundational components to business system initiatives.  The NA role is to coordinate, direct, and design network infrastructure activities as well as provide technology direction in support of the project and support teams.


The NA possesses a broad knowledgebase with a focus on strategic technologies including: Cisco Networking technologies including (LAN, WAN, SAN, VoIP, Wireless, Firewall), HP Networking, Palo Alto, Checkpoint and similar non-Cisco technologies.


The NA will also work with decision makers in other departments to identify, recommend, develop, implement, and support cost-effective technology solutions.  The NA will participate in overall IT planning, bringing a current knowledge and future vision of technology and systems.


The NA role works in close partnership with Belk’s Domain Architects, the Enterprise Architecture and Security teams aligning technical solutions to business and technology strategies. This position will be responsible for designing and delivering solutions which are fault tolerant, flexible, and scalable to support our development, test and production environments.


The scope of this position includes collaboration and participation with all IT Infrastructure core components; furthermore, the NA will be a liaison between Belk IT and Belk’s business partners, such as HP Enterprise Services, and will work collaboratively to maintain and operate all related systems in support of end-user access, performance, and stability.

item.title: Market Data C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Market Data department develops high quality software that handles inbound and outbound data for various Bloomberg products. We manage massive volumes of data from major exchanges and contributors around the globe including the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE), the London Stock Exchange (LSE) and the Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSX). We deliver billions of data points a day to customers through our market-leading enterprise reference data product. Our data enables global market makers to make financial decisions and is held to the highest standards. Our developers are involved in all aspects of the software development life cycle including requirements gathering, project management, design, development, testing and release.

There are two main groups in Market Data (Feeds and Data License). More information on individual teams within these groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred team.

>> Feeds

The Feeds group builds low latency systems in a Linux environment. We gather data from financial sources across the globe to deliver quality market data sets. We strive to provide the highest quality of data while maintaining minimal latencies on high throughput real-time market data.

Exchanges

The Feeds Exchanges team develops feed handlers from North and South American exchanges. We provide critical data to our clients for high profile exchanges such as NYSE, NASDAQ, CME, BM&F/Bovespa and TSX. Our initiatives include improving the resiliency of our feed handlers through enhanced data recovery mechanisms while upgrading to our latest infrastructure to improve upon our data model.

Contributions

The Contributions team processes data from central banks, global banks and inter-dealer brokers for non-exchange traded OTC markets using industry standard protocols. We strive to make our system simple, efficient and fault resilient. We build scalable and massive infrastructure used by our business and operations teams to increase data accuracy, deployment and troubleshooting of real-time feeds, reducing time-to-market for our clients. Ongoing projects include the next generation of cloud infrastructure to increase fault tolerance, load distribution and on-demand resource management.

News

The News team provides reports on earnings, interest rates and major economic indicators like unemployment numbers, housing reports and consumer indices. Our systems connect the Bloomberg terminal with information from social media such as Twitter and Weibo. Our automated systems also cater to algorithmic trading.

Tactical

The Tactical team excels at investigating, debugging and fixing mission critical problems as they occur in real time. Our main goal is to provide a timely response to all client-facing issues. We build tools to better debug and enhance the development experience. Tactical developers work closely with feed handler developers to identify gaps in the product and enforce operational and functional standards, upholding quality in the market data product.

>> Data License

Data License is Bloomberg's market leading enterprise reference data product. Our customers are key financial players who use our products to power their trading applications, risk management and corporate action processing, which requires our system to be ultra-reliable and our data to be of the highest quality. Our product lines offer a variety of programmatic interfaces for a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including fixed income, credit default swap, currencies, equities and futures and options. We work closely with our business and sales teams to develop solutions to satisfy customer demands.

Core

The Financial Data Delivery Core team builds and maintains high performance systems that feed billions of data points per day to Bloomberg's customers through its market leading enterprise reference data product. Our system delivers information on nearly all types of financial instruments to key players in the industry who rely on its accuracy.

Bloomberg Valuations (BVAL)

The BVAL team builds a product that calculates pricing for over two million liquid and illiquid fixed income securities at several snapshots throughout the day. This evaluated pricing data is delivered with related regulatory information to enterprise customers in order to meet requirements such as net asset valuation calculations. Our product calculates, validates and delivers millions of data points. This rapidly growing product requires a highly efficient, scalable and fault-tolerant architecture. We are working on a proof of concept using Hadoop to address scalability needs and new offerings that will allow our clients to evaluate their portfolio risks and help them meet the many new regulatory requirements.

Content

The Content Generation and Distribution team builds systems that deliver a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including equities, options, derivatives, indices, bonds, commodities and currencies. We work with hundreds of databases and a distributed system that utilizes multiple processes across dozens of machines to generate the needed data. Our data is delivered to clients via various mechanisms such as web services, MQ and SFTP.

Workflows/Analytics

The Workflows and Analytics team designs and implements flexible, usable, and performant systems for ensuring data quality and consistency across our feeds and workflows. Developers in our team use a variety of technologies, including C++, Python, Perl, Java, JavaScript, Comdb2 and Hadoop.

Metering

The Metering team is responsible for building high performance distributed systems for managing large volumes of client data. We work with multiple groups within Bloomberg and develop tools to transform and efficiently store the data for trend analysis, billing and business intelligence. We are leveraging Hadoop to meet the demands of the massive amount of data we collect and analyze, and the complexity of algorithms that operate on the data. Our technology stack for the next generation system will include Webservices, Apache Kafka and Hortonworks Hadoop distribution.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer at NewsCred (New York, NY)
item.description:
NewsCred has always had a clear social mission – to help the journalism industry survive by building the world’s first content ecosystem and disrupting the status quo.


How are we doing that? By building a revolutionary technology platform for all of the world’s content. Filtering, streaming and organizing millions of articles a day, in real-time. That’s a lot of data, a lot of content and a lot of opportunity to build something amazing. Join a brilliant, fun team of engineers that are solving big problems every day.


NewsCred is looking for a Full Stack Software Engineer with the technical skills and talent to navigate our entire stack, solving interesting and challenging problems along the way. Whether you’re:



  • improving our search infrastructure using the latest techniques in information retrieval and natural language processing, or

  • analyzing terabytes of usage logs to discover what content performs best for our customers, or

  • building a revolutionary content consumption UX,


you will play a key role in all parts of the product lifecycle: brainstorming, design, prototyping, planning, implementation, and launch.


Individuals that succeed at NewsCred are intelligent, highly motivated, fearless team players with great senses of humor.  They proven self-starters and quick learners. You will write lots of code that solves both visual and technical challenges, delivering high impact solutions to our customers around the world.


The Stack
We’re not dogmatic about specific technologies but here’s a list of some of the stuff we’re using:



  • Python

  • Solr

  • Django

  • AngularJS

  • MySQL

  • MongoDB

  • Ansible


The Team
The engineering team at NewsCred consists of some of the most brilliant, considerate, and fun-loving people you’ll ever meet. We're highly selective; we seek people who can contribute and share in the success and happiness of our team. We organize ourselves into small, autonomous teams that are as self-sufficient and independent as possible. This allows us to maintain our scrappy, entrepreneurial culture as we grow


About You
You love creating software so much that it’s disconcerting to your family and friends. The idea of game night and free lunch sound fun. You find few things as satisfying as reading and writing beautiful code and you plan on pushing some code on your first day. You’re irresistibly curious about the latest emerging technologies. You may or may not have a computer science degree.

item.title: Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer for a PROFIT500 Company at Microdea, Inc. (Richmond Hill, ON, Canada)

The Gig:


QA engineers work closely with development engineers and play a critical role in all phases of development projects from requirements review to release. The successful applicant must possess a strong understanding of highly scalable enterprise level web based application testing and Client/Server application testing through all stages of the system development life cycle based primarily on a Windows platform. They must be able to identify current best practices for common UI design and functionality. Knowledge of SQL, relational database applications (database schemas and structure) are a must. Job tasks include, but are not limited to, translating test plans into automated test scripts, unit test cases and end-to-end workflow test scenarios. QA engineers are expected to have initiative and strong analytical skills and welcome the opportunity to take a role in applying effective quality management processes from early development phases to final release. The qualified individual will join a growing quality assurance group within a growing engineering organization.

item.title: Senior Front-End Engineer at Industrial Color (New York, NY)
item.description:
GlobalEdit is looking for a proven, motivated Senior Front-End Engineer to join our 12-person development team. We are a leading provider of a powerful SaaS platform that optimizes and accelerates creative production. The company is Private Equity-backed, based in New York City, and has approximately 30 employees. Our Clients include over 60 of the leading fashion brands, retailers, and entertainment companies - including Under Armour, Cole Haan, MTV, L.L. Bean, Showtime, and CBS. We're part of Industrial Color brands, a family of creative production companies. Check out our video: vimeo.com/91347892

We're looking for a talented front-end engineer to join our engineering team and help us build the future of the globaledit SaaS platform. The ideal candidate is passionate about creating products that are functional, efficient, and beautiful. You'll help us define and build the next generation of a platform that is used everyday to drive commerce, advertising, and entertainment at the biggest names in those industries. You'll partner with our product team, UX designers, and back-end engineers and the rest of the globaledit team to deliver great products. A passion for the photo and video industry is a huge plus, because youll be directly involved in shaping the way creative professionals work.


RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Hand-coding standards-based, CSS-driven HTML pages, leveraging MVC frameworks, CSS pre-compilers, HTML templating frameworks, unit tests, dependency management and task/deployment automation

  • Collaborate with product and design team members to tune designs where progressive enhancement or graceful degradation would be required for browser compatibility, or a stronger user experience could result from an alternate visualization.

  • Optimize page performance (reflow, payload, etc) for devices of all sizes.

  • Support integrations with APIs and client libraries from internal services and external vendors.

  • Leads/Participates in module design to ensure high quality and portability at an accelerated rate.

  • Collaborate with product team members to estimate tasks and solidify delivery schedules.

  • Introduce and educate colleagues on front-end best practices and new techniques/frameworks/libraries that could be interesting for the progression of the product.

  • Create rapid prototypes to evaluate new product concepts, when valuable/necessary.

  • Collaborate with Engineering colleagues to ensure seamless integration and support of functional/business requirements.

  • Collaborate with QA team members to ensure highest quality prior to shipping.


Benefits



  • Competitive benefits including medical, 401k, and PTO

  • Beautiful 30k sq. ft office in the TriBeCa neighborhood (NY, NY).

item.title: Lead Systems Engineer at Atlassian (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Job summary


Be a part of an energetic and fast moving team that delivers incredible, innovative improvements to our infrastructure and site operations. More than 330,000 teams and 2.5 million developers love Bitbucket and use it every day to manage their Git and Mercurial repositories. We're in the process of building our infrastructure and refining our operational processes for the next several years, to make our platform even more scalable, reliable and speedy to accommodate the next level of our explosive growth. This role will lead our systems engineering team to evolve our infrastructure and processes to help take the team to the next level. This is a rare opportunity to get in early and help drive our systems and operations strategy. You'll collaborate often with the development team and product managers and will assist with the design, build-out, monitoring, scaling, optimization and support of Bitbucket's customer-facing and mission critical infrastructure systems. We're serious about security, performance, reliability, observability and quality, so you'll be refining our operational processes to ensure our team is prepared for anything.


More about you


The Team Lead we’re seeking will have experience leading a team and be effective at mentoring and motivating people and leading projects. You should have past experience in leading a world-class systems engineering or operations team for a high traffic service. A good understanding of SaaS infrastructure and operational best practices is also key to this role. You should be one of those naturally curious types, always looking to improve things, love dabbling in your own side-projects and learning new skills that are not a necessarily part of your normal day job. You’re probably someone who enjoys sharing knowledge with your team, asking for help when you need it, and at the end of the day, thrive on leading people to help them grow.

item.title: Ruby Architect at Razer Inc. (San Francisco, CA)

This particular role requires significant experience in full stack web application development utilizing Ruby on Rails under Heroku and Amazon Web Services.

  • Insure successful delivery and 24/7 operation of all developed services and applications

  • Design and implement well-structured, easily maintainable, well-documented code, APIs, and test scripts

  • Optimize and/or debug code as needed to maximize performance, scaling, usability, and quality

  • Assimilate new technologies and solve complex problems, formulating and evaluating technical alternatives based on experience and data-driven decision making skills

item.title: Software Engineer & Consultant at Cake Solutions Inc (New York, NY)
item.description:
About Cake Solutions Inc


Using the very latest technologies, Cake Solutions helps organisations take innovative and disruptive ideas and develop them into reactive software solutions. Cake’s success is underpinned by our unique One Team® approach that allows for standalone projects or close collaboration with the clients’ technology teams. Cake provides mentors to guide the entire organisation through modern software engineering, continually transferring skills and knowledge to client teams in the process. This enables Cake to deliver not just software but to transform the way organisations think about and execute software delivery.


As an early adopter of change in the IT industry, Cake embraces the use of the latest bleeding edge programming languages and tools to implement system components including big data, machine learning and the Internet of Things. Cake delivers the appropriate technical solution to a business problem and can transform the way organisations think about and deliver production-ready high quality systems safely and predictably.


Our experienced, cross-functional agile teams enable the delivery of entire solutions not just lines of code. They appreciate the importance of continuous integration, continuous delivery, DevOps and rigorous testing.


Cake team members are published authors, prolific bloggers and experienced speakers. They have extensive experience in designing, building and implementing scalable Reactive Applications and are encouraged to continually research and innovate and to publish thought leading insights.


We make the most of messaging infrastructures, modern DBMSs, and all other services that make up today's enterprise systems. Automated provisioning, testing, integration and delivery allow us to release high quality systems safely and predictably.

item.title: Senior Data Analyst - Data Conversions Manager at Fidelity (Cary, NC)
item.description:
The Workplace Investing Data conversion and Implementation team is looking for a Data Conversion Analyst in our Stock Plan Services (SPS) organization. SPS provides public companies with the expertise and convenience of a single provider to administer their equity compensation programs across a range of vehicles, including: Employee Stock Purchase Plans, Restricted Stock Awards/Units, Stock Option Plans, and Stock Appreciation Rights.


This position is a data-centric role that is looking for a detail-oriented Analyst to help manage multiple projects within our Data Conversions team. This role will be a client-facing position that interacts with multiple clients outside of the Fidelity organization, so a service-minded individual is a must! if you enjoy working with people and problem-solving this role could be a great fit. The candidate must be highly organized and should be able to move seamlessly between multiple implementations and ever-changing client requirements.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Organize and conduct data conversion project status meetings, including communicating status to internal project management, Fidelity business partners, outside vendors and clients

  • Maintain detailed project plan, issues and action items list throughout the implementation, while documenting requirements and addressing operation process issues to accomplish business objectives; and determining required changes and their impact

  • Provide input and suggestions into process improvements and discretionary projects

  • Build strong partnerships with client and third party vendors

  • Communicate project status and technology issues to sponsors stakeholders and senior management

  • Collaborate with each other WI management teams and business partners to share approaches, develop solutions, and improve capabilities to successfully deliver projects

item.title: Data Architect that loves mobile games? Join us! at Hothead Games (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
Hothead Games is a 130-person game development studio focused on free-to-play for iOS and Android devices. Millions of people play our games and this generates large amounts of data. Efficient and effective storage, transformation, analysis and archival are all top priorities. We are seeking an ambitious individual to take a lead role in planning and executing on all aspects of our data-related technologies.

Have extensive experience with multiple databases? Passionate about creating software architectures that are robust and scalable? Want to work on the bleeding edge of Big Data?  Then you need to join our world-leading mobile game studio and help us wrangle hundreds of terabytes of data into understandable, actionable information.

We expect the successful candidate will be an experienced software engineer/architect that will formulate and execute the vision for our proprietary Big Data platform. Are you up for it?


Responsibilities:



  • Define requirements, create technical designs and assist with the implementation of internally-developed analytics systems

  • Oversee the daily operation of analytics data processing, automating the process wherever possible

  • Educate internal stakeholders on best practices for analytics-related processes in the company

  • Assist data analysts, game designers and others with advanced queries, sophisticated A/B tests and other complex data problems

  • Advise game teams on databases and other data-related aspects of game client and server software

  • Perform load and stress tests and analyze performance of running production systems in order to optimize database use and remove bottlenecks

  • Perform tests to sanity check accuracy of internal and 3rd party data

  • Assist the Director of Technology with supervision of the work of programmers on the Analytics Team

item.title: Principal Medical Software Architect at Cambridge Consultants (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Main purposes of the job


This position offers the rare opportunity to take a leadership role in the Medical Technology business and help shape the future of intelligent, connected medical devices. If you are excited about solving complex, multivariate technical and systems challenges in the medical domain, are passionate about developing robust, safety-critical software that serves a meaningful purpose, and have excellent interpersonal and leadership skills, then this role could be for you. You will work with our clients and lead the creation of innovative multidisciplinary products and technologies in the medical space.


This role offers continuous exposure to the latest developments in an exciting field poised for growth, as well as the variety of working with many companies, technologies, and people who are passionate about the future of the role of technology in healthcare.


This role is based in our new state-of-the-art innovation center, located in Boston, MA.


Type of work undertaken by the group


The Medical Technology Division undertakes the development of innovative new medical devices and systems from concept, through prototype manufacture, to new product introduction, often surmounting considerable technical challenges.


We undertake development projects across a wide range of categories including surgical tools, drug delivery devices, diagnostic instruments, and critical care.


We combine highly creative lateral thinking with excellent technical skills and broad industry experience to form powerful development teams. Our work ranges from complete product developments to providing consulting services for our clients on their technology, strategy or development processes. Every project is a unique technical challenge, and provides a rich learning experience.



Typical development project examples include:



  • Cloud-connected disease management product with crowd sourced data analytics

  • Point of care diagnostic instrument with sample handling, optics and microfluidics

  • Embedded systems for remote patient monitoring applications

  • Wireless pacemaker implant, including ASIC development

  • Novel surgical tool involving machine vision, automation, and complex UI

item.title: DevOps/Ruby Engineer at Stitch Fix (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
About the Team


Stitch Fix has an extensive internal platform for managing our business, from inventory management to warehouse logistics to our own Personal Styling platform, each serving thousands of internal users who run the business every day.  Our public-facing infrastructure is growing as well, helping millions of our customers be their best selves.  It’s all tied together with an array of user-facing applications and back-end services.


We’re ops savvy, but not ops-focused. While we are currently hosting our Rails apps on Heroku and leveraging their add-on ecosystem, we are only married to what works, and are constantly re-evaluating our technical infrastructure.  We aren’t afraid of change if that helps us deliver faster, better, and more reliable solutions to our business partners and customers.


This is where you come in. Stitch Fix needs a Ruby and Rails developer with a keen interest in development tools, technical operations and “developer happiness”.  We have a lot of applications, services, and infrastructure, and we need someone who can be dedicated to make sure it’s meeting the needs of the development team.


About the Role


You’d be walking into a welcoming and diverse environment that is built around partnership, integrity, feedback, responsibility, and innovation. We have over 20 Rails apps and services, hosted on Heroku, and deployed with a high degree of consistency. Our mature engineering team is truly partners to those that run Stitch Fix by providing efficiency & effectiveness with the tools we develop.


You’re excited about this opportunity because you will...



  • Make application development and deployment easier for the engineering team

  • Help us solve thorny problems around performance and fault-tolerance

  • Build tools and systems to manage security

  • Make sure we’re up-to-date on the best practices of our service providers (Heroku, AWS, etc.)

  • Investigate new tools & technologies our team can use to solve problems for the business

item.title: Vice President Software Development at Kliger-Weiss Infosystems, Inc. (Greenvale, NY)
item.description:
POSITION MISSION:


KWI continues to be the true leader in enterprise-class cloud platforms for end-to-end retail solutions. We support all of our retailers on a single platform, providing economies of scale to all.  As the leading cloud based retail provider, KWI represents thousands of stores with millions of transactions across 100 plus retailers – by far the largest solution provider of POS in specialty retail. 


The Vice President of Software Development is responsible for leading the design, development and delivery of innovative cloud-based enterprise solutions to meet evolving business, market and customer needs. The Vice President of Software Development will be accountable for establishing a clear strategic vision, building process excellence, building organizational capability, driving execution and measuring and improving performance to deliver market-leading quality. The Vice President of Software Development will oversee the entire Software Development Life Cycle process. This includes leading the Architecture, Development, Quality, Software Development Support and Store Systems teams. This position will also lead offshore development initiatives and interface with clients and vendors.



JOB FUNCTIONS:



  • Build and lead high performance teams sharing common vision and goals, adapting quickly to challenges and changing business environments.

  • Ensure delivery of software products on time with first-time quality.

  • Establish world class software teams: hire, train, and mentor talent that meet our core values.

  • Define, deploy, and drive sustainable and repeatable process improvements through the entire software development lifecycle.

  • Tailor and implement software development methodologies, best practices, and standard work to achieve the highest product quality while continuously improving performance, productivity and execution of the software organization.

  • Define and champion leading software technologies to improve the efficiency, quality, and ease of use of our products and cloud-based solutions.

  • Define and measure Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and drive corrective actions throughout the entire software department based on real data and results.

  • Manage and facilitate multiple development teams both local and remote to ensure software development efforts meet quality objectives and launch targets while promoting cross-functional teamwork.

  • Identify both strategic opportunities and potential threats associated with emerging technologies, and execute software development plans that ensure our cloud-based solution remains best of breed.

  • Prioritize, direct and appraise the activities of development managers.

  • Determine, justify and obtain approval for project resources and prioritize and manage resource allocation based on changing business priorities.

  • Manage morale of software development organization. Create and communicate employee performance evaluations and development plans. Ensure consistency in all compensation actions for organization.

item.title: Chief Engineer ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems) Connected Safety (m/f) at Harman Becker Automotive Systems GmbH (Karlsbad, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your Responsibilities:



We are developing several industry-first ADAS products. Our ADAS products combine powerful in-vehicle processing, V2X connectivity, and cloud analytics, taking advantage of Harman's strength in highly complex systems. Now we need an experienced chief engineer who can help us design our next generation products and deliver those that we have already been awarded. As the ADAS chief engineer you will directly supervise a team of systems / software engineers, and provide technical guidance to a larger cross-functional team. Your tasks at Harman will include:




  • Work with systems and software engineers to develop and document connected safety implementation requirements, from the physical to the application layer, including key vehicle interfaces.

  • Lead the technical architecture development for Connected Safety, defining the interaction between external environmental sensing, map data, V2X communications, and cloud connectivity.

  • Define / invent features that support our Connected Safety roadmap: What will it take to make cars drive themselves? We are looking for your creativity to refine our plans.

  • Lead the activity to develop a demonstrator for Connected Safety features: Proof that your ideas will work.

  • Participate in industry forums and stay current on state of the art to ensure a competitive position for Harman. We want you to be a thought leader in the industry.



Our Offer


Continue your career at Harman, one of the worldwide leaders in infotainment and car audio. We have been successfully doing business for decades and are proud to have all premium car manufacturers as clients. As a Harman employee, you will have the opportunity to actively shape the future and be an important part of Harman's success story. Our dynamic and international business offers you numerous opportunities to further develop and make an impact. Your knowledge and commitment will be rewarded with an attractive compensation package. HARMAN is an employer who values equal employment opportunities for both, women and men. Applications from qualified women are particularly welcome.

item.title: Senior Ruby / Rails Developer at ICFLIX (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
We are looking for a Senior Billing / Subscription Management Engineer with Ruby experience who gets as excited as us about web security, machine learning, big data, and cloud scalability to join our nimble engineering team – we are looking for someone with Ruby experience but is also  open to learn other languages, as long as you're excited about learning new stuff.



  • Develop web-related event based applications including the architecture, design, coding, integration, and maintenance of web and database applications; implement and automate back end systems.

  • Maintain and develop solutions on a social platform, scaling high traffic sites for Ruby on Rails, on platforms similar Amazon Web Services

  • Build with Responsive Web Design.

  • Coordinate the needs of all business owners, create and execute project work plans and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements.

  • Analyze and resolve day to day issues and bug reports.

  • Communicate and enforce coding standards.

  • Adapt quickly to legacy and evolving architecture, systems, processes and applications.

  • Exercise sound professional judgment when solving immediate problems in production environments.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Cake Solutions Inc (New York, NY)
item.description:
About Cake Solutions Inc


Using the very latest technologies, Cake Solutions helps organisations take innovative and disruptive ideas and develop them into reactive software solutions. Cake’s success is underpinned by our unique One Team® approach that allows for standalone projects or close collaboration with the clients’ technology teams. Cake provides mentors to guide the entire organisation through modern software engineering, continually transferring skills and knowledge to client teams in the process. This enables Cake to deliver not just software but to transform the way organisations think about and execute software delivery.


As an early adopter of change in the IT industry, Cake embraces the use of the latest bleeding edge programming languages and tools to implement system components including big data, machine learning and the Internet of Things. Cake delivers the appropriate technical solution to a business problem and can transform the way organisations think about and deliver production-ready high quality systems safely and predictably.


Our experienced, cross-functional agile teams enable the delivery of entire solutions not just lines of code. They appreciate the importance of continuous integration, continuous delivery, DevOps and rigorous testing.


Cake team members are published authors, prolific bloggers and experienced speakers. They have extensive experience in designing, building and implementing scalable Reactive Applications and are encouraged to continually research and innovate and to publish thought leading insights.


We make the most of messaging infrastructures, modern DBMSs, and all other services that make up today's enterprise systems. Automated provisioning, testing, integration and delivery allow us to release high quality systems safely and predictably.


Cake are looking for a passionate and skilled Operations Developer with a real passion for on-going learning and continual skills development.  The role will involve maintaining and creating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelines, to ensure the development process is automated and repeatable.  You will be helping to build and deploy system infrastructure in a cloud focused environment while providing operational advice to developers when appropriate.Another responsibility will be monitoring existing clusters of deployed instances in the Cloud maintaining backups and performance (manually scaling where appropriate), identifying errors, troubleshooting, improving alerting on failure and also deploying new code releases to those environments. 


If you are interested in an exciting and challenging DevOps role please send us your CV; if your qualifications match our requirements, we will schedule a telephone interview. We would also be delighted to see & discuss your published works (blogs, articles, books, contributions to open source projects).

item.title: Big Data Engineer with National Travel at CLARITY SOLUTION GROUP (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Note: For this position you will be required to travel throughout the country on a weekly basis.


DOES WORKING FOR AN ORGANIZATION WITH THESE BENEFITS, APPEAL TO YOU?



  • Working on complex transformation programs across many clients and many industries

  • Unlimited paid time off

  • Competitive compensation which includes uncapped bonus potential based on individual contributions

  • Mentor program

  • Career development

  • Tremendous growth opportunities (company is growing at a rate of 35% or more annually)

  • Strong work/life balance

  • A smaller nimble organization that is easy to work with

  • Visibility to the leadership team on a daily basis

  • Be a part of an Elite Data & Analytics team


IF YOU ANSWERED YES TO THE ABOVE ITEMS, KEEP READING!


We are looking for individuals with the ability to drive the architectural decision making process, who are experienced with leading teams of developers, but who are also capable and enthusiastic about implementing every aspect of an architecture themselves.


OUR DATA ENGINEERS:



  • Are hands-on, self-directed engineers who enjoysworking in collaborative teams 

  • Are data transformation engineers


    • Design and develop highly scalable, end to end process to consume, integrate and analyze large volume, complex data from sources such as Hive, Flume and other APIs

    • Integrate datasets and flows using a variety of open source and best-in-class proprietary software


  • Work with business stakeholders and data SMEs to elicit requirements and develop real-time business metrics, analytical products and analytical insights

  • Profile and analyze complex and large datasets

  • Collaborate and validate implementation with other technical team members

item.title: Infrastructure Technology Architect at Time Warner Inc. (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Time Warner, Inc. - Job posting preview























The Technology Architect is responsible for the research, formation, creation, documentation and any and all work product related to architectures under their domain of expertise or assignment. Such domains include, but are not limited to Workplace/End-user technologies, Security, Networking and Compute/Data Center/Cloud Platforms.







This role is also responsible for steering of the technology strategy within portfolio of EIS developed Architectures. The Technology Architect Assists the Chief Architect and the Integration Architects in maintaining a complete and appropriate strategy based on defined project needs, design principles, best practices or industry direction. The Technology Architect brings a wide range of Technical and professional capabilities to the role and acts as an escalation point for technical issues related to the deployed architectures within EIS and within Technology Groups of Time Warner or its Divisions.

Responsibilities:






Within their Domain of Expertise (SME for a particular core capability):




  • Provide project specific architectural and comprehensive technology designs, solutions and implementation plans for areas under their domain of control.




  • Review and evaluate, cost and develop optimized infrastructure designs based on rigorous understanding of returned benefits and ROI/TCO. .




  • Evaluate entire projects from a technical stance, guaranteeing that the methods and technologies used are practical and correct and fit for purpose.




  • Validate and challenge the detailed technical infrastructure architectures provided by the technology partners, fellow team members and vendors in support of a project or technical solution.




  • Assist in transition of the developed solution to implementation with partnership from O&E.




  • Act as final path of escalation within their area of expertise for any architecture under their development or control.




  • Investigate the viability of upcoming and emerging technologies to improve the infrastructure's stability, longevity and adaptability.




  • Consult in development of architectural strategy, including technology standardization, infrastructure guiding principles and modernization.




  • Develop a technical architecture based on any R&D or existing knowledge that are dependable, scalable and fit for purpose and can be transitioned to implementation by SI&D or O&E.




  • Assure any developed architectures fit appropriately within the overarching EIS Vision and Strategy for that service area.




  • Beyond an individuals Domain of Expertise (General Technology and cross-technology):




  • Have a detailed understanding of other technologies and exhibit proficiency in those technologies beyond their core capability.




  • Be stretched by assignments into detailed understanding of those areas of technology (such as Workplace/End-user technologies, Security, Networking and Compute/Data Center/Cloud Platforms.




  • Understand the “cross-pollination” of technology verticals and be able to apply both areas of expertise and areas of knowledge to provide a cohesive end to end architectural approach and solution.

item.title: Ground-breaking Social Enterprise Seeks - Full Stack Engineer at Social Finance Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Social Finance is now hiring a Full Stack Engineer to work alongside our growing team, including founder Toby Eccles, director Stephen Brien and product manager Daniel Miodovnik.


As a full stack engineer, you will have end-to-end responsibility for the technology on which our apps, analytics and insights are built. In addition, you will architect, develop and launch our suite of new products and services. As an engineer within Social Finance Digital Labs, you will be at the forefront of the technology revolution we are bringing to the public and social sector.


This will be a challenging role. To deliver on this vision will require all of your energy, abilities and ambition. You will be a polyglot, already adept across the full-stack and keen to get up to speed with new technologies. You will be an engineer at heart: hands-on, unafraid of getting stuck in and focused on great results.


Your day to day activities will encompass anything and everything that’s required to build great tech: architecture, engineering, story planning, and of course, heads-down coding. You know what a high performance team looks like and will insist that the team is well organised so as to achieve brilliant results.


You probably bring several years of applied experience, perhaps in a start-up, tech firm or consultancy. And you will definitely bring a thirst for learning, a love for technology and a deep desire to solve real world problems.

item.title: Social Commerce Developer at SHOP.CA (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
SHOP.CA is Canada’s leader in online shopping, providing a premium Canadian experience that combines an authoritative selection of products, unparalleled service and a social commerce. Launched in July 2012, SHOP.CA has become the fastest growing retail site in Canada and top 10 most visited Canadian owned ecommerce site.  As a SHOP.CA Social Commerce development team member, your role will be to work on Social Commerce, ensuring that integrations with social networks continue to work through upgrades as well be in charge of integrating the SHOP.CA platform with new social networks.  You are innovative and will work to create solutions that leverage the capabilities to create stunning ecommerce solutions for our customers.  You have drive, energy, and passion to contribute to a hyper-growth startup in the fastest growing segment in Canada.


Responsibilities:



  • Contribute to the SHOP.CA development organization helping to make SHOP.CA’s Social Commerce world-class for customers a terrific user experience including Member Registration, Connection Social Profiles to SHOP.CA Member Profiles, Social Sharing Out from SHOP.CA and Social Sharing In to SHOP.CA, and Invite-a-Friend

  • Quickly resolve outstanding defects and issues

  • Work collaboratively with team members to clarify business requirements, create comprehensive and viable designs with effort estimations

  • Participate in development planning sessions and meet agreed deliverable dates for new features and enhancements

  • Safeguard consumer data in accordance with SHOP.CA’s data security policies

  • Adhere to SHOP.CA’s software development lifecycle (SDLC)

  • Work effectively with a tight team of world-class designers, web developers and back-end developers

  • Create documentation for new features and application changes

  • Supporting our QA team in testing your features formally (test scenarios) as well as informally

  • Work with our infrastructure team to debug issues as they arise in production

  • Innovate new solutions and research new social networks and their technologies that will complement SHOP.CA’s eCommerce site – help make SHOP.CA’s Commerce platform experience world class including working with Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest and many more.

  • Actively participate as a direct resource to projects as required in the following areas:


    • XHTML, DHTML, HTML, CSS, AJAX, JavaScript files, and other solutions employed by SHOP.CA

    • Architect, design, develop, maintain and support all software components of the SHOP.CA Social Loyalty Network platform

    • Implementation of business logic server-side in Java for low level social network integrations



We work in an aggressive, energetic and sometimes frantic environment where exceptional coders thrive. You must be willing to join an early stage, hyper growth company that will require significant time commitments to be successful. It’s not for the meek here, but if you have what it takes, we will push you hard and you’ll gain incredible experience and knowledge solving challenging software engineering projects.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Java) at Linkable Networks (Boston, MA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Linkable Networks was founded on the premise that the disconnect between digital media and physical retail was a major gap in delivering a great experience to consumers. Since 2011, we’ve been nose-down building a scalable platform that provides brands and retailers the ability to engage, reward and incent their consumers directly and across any channel – online, mobile and in-store.


To do this we've built a sophisticated platform that spans the three major credit card networks and integrates into merchant POS data feeds.  We've built our cloud based platform to deal with scale from a number of directions- from high volume real-time user interaction to batch processing of huge data feeds.  As we continue to roll this platform out to customers we're recognizing the the application of our solution is broader than we ever realized and we're working hard to meet the demands of our customers to extend the range of our capabilities.


In order to keep growing we’re seeking well rounded Senior Java Engineers who have demonstrated success at building large scale distributed systems in creative ways. We want engineers who are excited about the challenge of delivering software on horizontally scaled architectures to processes huge numbers of transactions and user requests a day.


We have a great team of smart, committed and hard working engineers.  Everyone on our team has a stake in our process, our design, our delivery and our customers' satisfaction.  We're committed to building the best product possible and leading our space. 


Collaboration and communication are central to our process.  Successful candidates will possess a combination of strong technical expertise and communication ability.  You'll need to be able to clearly express (verbally and in writing) complex technical ideas to your engineering teammates and be able to translate those ideas so that colleagues in business operations can understand.


If this sounds good to you we'd like to hear from you.  We offer competitive salary, benefits, stock options and weekly team lunches.  Please see our Stack Overflow Careers company page for more details.

item.title: SR. QA Engineer at Tripwire (Portland, OR)
item.description:
Why join us: IT security is in our DNA! With offices in Portland, San Francisco, Atlanta, London, Tokyo, Singapore and counting, we have continued to grow by developing our products to meet the challenges posed by today’s threat heavy environment. Over 8,100 enterprises and government institutions worldwide, including 46% of the Fortune 500 rely on what we do to protect their critical IT infrastructure and sensitive data. We are passionate about your ongoing development and always making things better. Become a part of Tripwire, a team that brings out the best in you!

About Us: We are a leading global provider of risk-based security and compliance management solutions, enabling enterprises, government agencies and service providers to effectively connect security to their business. Tripwire provides the broadest set of foundational security controls including security configuration management, vulnerability management, file integrity monitoring, log and event management. Tripwire solutions deliver unprecedented visibility, business context and security business intelligence allowing extended enterprises to protect sensitive data from breaches, vulnerabilities, and threats. Learn more at www.tripwire.com or follow us @TripwireInc on Twitter.


Job Summary

The Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer is responsible for a leadership role in an agile 
research and development organization, working closely with scrum teams to execute on product backlogs, champion customer focused solutions, drive successful defect resolutions, and communicate product readiness to key product stakeholders. 


Key Responsibilities & Duties



  • Take a lead role and mentor junior staff members, both on and near-shore 

  • Facilitate initiative level planning across multiple scrum teams

  • Evangelize and implement best QA and Development practices 

  • Apply independence and creativity to problem solving across project assignments 

  • Establish and drive short-term and long-term goals for a small team of test engineers 

  • Design, author and execute automated and manual test procedures to ensure timely defect discovery 

  • Document clear, concise and detailed product defect reports and work with developers to ensure successful defect reproduction and resolution 

  • Engage and participate on an Agile team of a world class software engineers 

  • Provide ongoing project status to direct management and stakeholders 

  • Maintain strong customer focus when producing results 

  • All other duties as assigned. 




Scope

Working independently and with the Scrum teams, the Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer resolves a wide range of diverse problems utilizing personal judgment and experience to develop solutions in a creative manner. Interacts with employees at all levels of the organization and takes personal responsibility for meeting the needs of the customer while demonstrating an understanding of business objectives. Authority to act within defined policies within the area of expertise/knowledge as directed. Effectively communicates research findings to the organization and develops plans for implementation. Determines necessary resources required and develops goals and metrics for function.

a10:author.a10:name: The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine Inc.

item.title: Data Warehouse Developer/Architect (210122) at The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine Inc. (Bethesda, MD)
item.description:
The Henry M. Jackson Foundation, for the Advancement of Military Medicine (HJF) is seeking a Data Warehouse Developer/Architect to support the Surgical Critical Care Initiative (SC2I) located at the Walter Reed National Military Medical Center (WRNMMC) in Bethesda, MD. HJF provides administrative and management support to SC2I.    


The Surgical Critical Care Initiative (SC2I) capitalizes on unprecedented advances in casualty research and clinical care by partnering Department of Defense efforts with civilian academic leaders to introduce paradigm-shifting approaches in care based on biomarker assessment into routine practice.


Responsibilities:



  1. Design/develop data warehouse applications and systems to support SC2i operations by incorporating data from Program data sources including laboratory and clinical applications and legacy data stores.

  2. Design/develop data integration strategies and methods to allow SC2i data warehouse applications and systems to interact (consume and feed as necessary) with external collaborator’s systems.

  3. Provide technical support to scrub, curate, and migrate legacy study data into Program data warehouse applications and systems.

  4. Participate in required program meetings at USUHS, WRNMMC, Naval Medical Research Center, and offsite collaborator locations.

  5. Performs other duties as needed.

item.title: Senior Business Analyst at Code42 Software, Inc. (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for the planning, delivery, launch, and ongoing optimization of Code42’s business operations by creating & modifying our critical business processes empowered by best in class business application tools, workflow automation & business intelligence. You will develop the strategic vision and roadmap for critical business units you support. You will be responsible for managing the intake of requests, establish working teams to define the requirements, translate them into technical requirements when necessary, prioritize their delivery and manage them through execution. You will provide business process leadership to both our business units, as well as our technical delivery teams. As a key driver in the business you will anticipate bottlenecks, mitigate project risks, quantify the impact of making tradeoffs, and balance business needs against technical constraints. You will work closely with stakeholders across the to identify and drive innovative solutions that achieve business goals and align with long-term vision.

A successful candidate will be well versed in what it takes to ensure business process efficiency and excellence that can scale with us not just this year but in the years to come. Implementing & configuring best in class business systems will be key tools to help deliver positive results. You’ve done this before, and you’re excited to do it again-bigger, faster, better. You will be measured on two major areas: (1) delivering the scalable business processes, controls and tools that allow us to achieve hyper-growth (2) continually driving down cycle times in key transactional areas that allow our existing teams to do more with less. 



YOU’LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR



  • Identifies project requirements by interviewing customers; analyzing operations; determining project scope; documenting project success metrics

  • Develops problem solutions by describing requirements in a work-flowchart and diagram; studying system capabilities; analyzing alternative solutions; preparing business requirements for delivery by internal development teams, or external 3rd parties

  • Develops project requirements & estimates by identifying phases and elements, personnel requirements, and costs.

  • Determines operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.

  • Monitors project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions.

  • Helps coordinate user-acceptance testing & sign-off for changes in process & tools

  • Provides training to user groups as needed on process & tool changes

  • Maintains process & system quality by researching and resolving problems; maintaining data integrity and security.

  • Maintains quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.

  • Prepares reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information.

  • Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.

  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

item.title: Senior Software Developer (Java) at adacado (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
Adacado is looking for exceptionally motivated people who love to see the impact of their work on a global scale and who want to be a part of something special and highly unique.


Adacado is seeking an experienced (Java) software developer to evolve our real-time creative advertising platform.  The successful candidate will work closely with all members of the development team to design, implement, test, and deploy the next generation of the Adacado software suite, and maintain each iteration from cradle to grave.  As Adacado is quite diverse in its functions, a senior developer will always have the opportunity to (and is expected to) learn and play with new technologies, and to bring innovation to the table, evolving, enhancing and optimizing the Adacado platform over time.  The successful candidate must also have the ability to diagnose problems across the entire software and hardware stack rather than just debug a piece of code.


Adacado is not expecting you to arrive with everything you need to know.   We work in a highly collaborative environment where we’ll educate you on the technologies we’ve adopted while you help to further innovate Adacado, be it software, procedures, or fun!


Adacado is located in the heart of Vancouver with easy access to public transit and employees are offered generous telecommuting privileges.  We also have a hub in Kelowna, BC.  We maintain very flexible work hours, a casual dress code and a relaxed low-pressure environment.  All developers in the office are provided with dual-monitor stations or laptops and the freedom to use whichever development tools they are most comfortable with.   Lunch is served hot every Friday, snacks are plentiful, and we engage frequently in events beyond work.

item.title: Operations Engineer at Cloudreach Europe Limited (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
Cloudreach are Europe’s only top tier partner of choice for both Amazon Web Services & Google - the giants of the cloud computing industry. We’re the best at what we do. We provide a range of valued services to the Enterprise, and we see the need to recruit a number of highly technical and dynamic individuals to help us maintain our reputation and continuous customer satisfaction as we continue to grow in the cloud !!



Why do you want to work with us?



  • You want to be one step ahead: The future of IT is in the cloud, and we work with the leaders in this space. You will get exposure to new technology and new data analytics tools.

  • You want interesting work: This role is complex and analytical, with the chance to become an excellent data modeller and to work both with internal teams and directly with clients. You will endeavour to automate any repetitive tasks.

  • You want a progressive culture: The established culture is friendly, with a lot of banter and we firmly believe that work should be fun. At the same time we value personal growth and understand that a great organisation is one made up of diverse individuals.

  • You want to broaden your knowledge of food or drink: We’re in the heart of Edinburgh, next to some of the oldest and best restaurants and pubs in the UK. We regularly go out for lunch and after work as a team. And if you’re not up for a wee jaunt to the pub, there’s always beer and juice in the fridge.



What we are looking for?

Cloudreach is looking for a number of capable sysadmin engineers or developers who have a passion for operations with 3-5 years relevant experience who are keen to grow their technical and business skills in a fast growing company. We’d like to see someone who has had exposure to infrastructure with automation. If you are curious about the Cloud and have possibly dabbled with AWS and Google Apps we want to speak to you. We subscribe to the concept of "DevOps", where we use development skills in the operational environment in order to increase service quality. Typically our customers use an extensive array of technology running on either Linux (with Open Source) or the Microsoft stack.
The beauty of this role is that as the hardware layer is abstracted, you focus on honing your technical skills, and the interesting stuff, rather the heavy lifting. The intent is to fix or work around the root cause of operational issues, so that they do not reoccur.

You will be working with the following new technologies (and more):



  • Linux / Open Source

  • Microsoft technologies

  • Management of and automation of management of these systems

  • Amazon Elastic Computing cloud

  • Google Apps



Responsibilities



  • Action incident / problem cases related to the support of customer systems in line with Service Level Agreements

  • Liaise with customer directly in the case of major incidents

  • Carry out pro-active maintenance

  • Action service requests

  • Ensure knowledge of the platforms is accurately maintained

  • Produce statistical information as required to support ITIL reports

  • Assist in customer migrations by Service Delivery teams (to Google Apps / Amazon Web Services)

item.title: Python Software Developers at Rackspace, the #1 managed cloud company (Blacksburg, VA)
item.description:
Do you believe Open Source will always innovate faster? Are you most comfortable on the cutting edge of technology? If this describes you and you’re ready to attack some of the most complex problems in the industry, then it’s time for you to take on the challenge of being a large contributor to the Open Source world for Rackspace.


With over 300,000 customers hosting their environments from ten data centers across the globe, the opportunities to build, design, develop, and provide solutions in an in enterprise cloud computing environment is here.  Rackspace can help you carve out a new career path.  This isn’t a wish, it’s the real deal.


Would you like to be part of the next big product in the Rackspace cloud? As a cloud API developer on the Atlanta team you will design and develop a variety of products that connect the Rackspace managed cloud together with other innovative Cloud products.

The role you will play will help customers seamlessly integrate cutting edge tools into their system architectures, that will change the face of computing. As a result, you will have an opportunity to work on many high impact, high visibility products that will take fanatical support to new heights.


Do you want to be the next Fanatical Racker? Rackspace is looking for a software developer who will design and develop cutting-edge APIs for large-scale cloud based services. Join us and work with a team of energetic individuals who are passionate about Rackspace as the #1 Managed Cloud provider. You will work on a dynamic, Agile team to develop high-quality software in a fun, collaborative environment!


As a software developer at Rackspace, you will be working in a high-energy team, writing great software by using the best software development practices in the industry today. Passion for all aspects of software development is a must.


This position is located in Blacksburg, VA, a town in southwest Virginia.  Blacksburg, home of Virginia Tech, is nestled on a plateau between the Blue Ridge and Allegheny mountains. You’ll be doing world-class development for a cloud computing leader in a beautiful location with a temperate climate and very short commute time.


Responsibilities:



  • Write web application front-end code in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

  • Unify disparate product data models into a coherent user experience.

  • Diagnose and fix bugs

  • Write clean and maintainable code using engineering best practices (unit testing, SOLID principles, Agile methods)

  • Work with other software developers, product managers, user experience designers, and operations engineers on a daily basis

  • Mentor and guide less experienced team members to provide technical direction

item.title: Information Security Analyst at California State University - Northridge - CSUN (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Job Title: Information Security Analyst
    
Job ID: 4977
    
Full/Part Time: Full-Time
    
Regular/Temporary: Regular
    
Job Code: 0420 Information Technology Consultant -12
    
Job Grade: Expert
    
Department: IT Information Security-8280
    

    
CSUN's Commitment to You
    
CSUN is strongly committed to achieving excellence through teaching, scholarship, active learning and diversity.  Our values include a respect for all people, building alliances with the community and the encouragement of innovation, experimentation and creativity.  CSUN actively encourages qualified candidates to apply who demonstrate a commitment to serving a diverse student population as well as a commitment to maintaining an inclusive work environment.
    
About the University
    
Serving more than 42,000 students each year, CSUN is one of the largest universities in the United States. CSUN ranks 10th in the country in awarding bachelor's degrees to underrepresented minority students, fifth nationally in awarding master's degrees to Hispanic students and enrolls the largest number of deaf and hard-of-hearing students of any U.S. state university. CSUN's 171 academic programs and engaged centers enjoy international recognition for excellence. CSUN currently partners with more than 100 institutions of higher education in 22 countries around the globe and attracts the largest international student population of any U.S. master's level institution. Situated on a 356-acre park-like setting in the heart of Los Angeles' San Fernando Valley, the campus features modern educational buildings and world-class LEED Gold-certified performing arts and recreational facilities recognized as among the best in the country. CSUN is a welcoming university that champions accessibility, academic excellence and student success.
    
Major Duties
    
Under the direction and general supervision of the Information Security Officer (ISO), the Information Security Analyst conducts regular security/risk assessments and internal security audits to identify gaps between campus policy/standards and current practices and procedures. The incumbent generates remediation action plans and manages through to completion with key stakeholders and system owners; conducts university-wide threat assessments, and recommend updates to the annual IS Plan, Policies and Standards; conducts confidential data and protected data system reviews; coordinates with campus procurement, vendors, and campus stakeholders to conduct documented product and service-provider security risk assessments; for on-premise and cloud-hosted solutions; manages the day-to-day operations of the campus-wide Information Security Awareness Training program, including online training management systems, development and distribution of periodic awareness updates via various communication channels, campus events, and targeted training sessions and department/college presentations for specialized risk areas; e.g. PCI, FERPA, HIPAA, Red Flags; generates security reports and key metrics, and produces management-level summaries.  In partnership with network engineering, monitors and tunes the university Intrusion Detection Systems; serves in a secondary capacity for conducting forensic investigations, incident response, security systems/server administration, and responding to reports/inquiries submitted by members of the university community via email, phone, in-person, and the case management system; perform other duties as assigned.
    
Qualifications
    
Equivalent to graduation from an accredited four-year college or university in Information Security, Computer Science or a job-related field.  Equivalent to five years of full-time, senior level experience working as part of an Information Security team in support of a medium-to-large diverse organization.
    
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
    
Thorough knowledge of the CISSP Information Security domains, risk assessment methodologies, NIST security standards, and California laws and regulations related to data privacy. General knowledge of LAN/WAN network systems, firewalls, VPNs, VoIP, virtual server platforms, storage area networks, web application development, and other information technology systems. Functional knowledge of: Desktop computers (Windows, XP, 7 and MAC OS X), Governance, Risk, and Compliance Systems (Risk Sharing Asset Management (RSAM)), Vulnerability Assessment Systems (Qualys and Accunetix), Forensics Equipment (Encase, BackTrack, media cloning hardware), Anti-Virus and Anti-Malware (Microsoft Security EndPoint (SCCM), Symantec EndPoint, and other AV/AM hardware and software), Awareness Training Software (SkillPort, LearnerWeb, SANS, etc.), Web Content Management System (Drupal), Intrusion Detection systems (Juniper firewall/IDS).  Ability and specialized skills to: apply and assess user needs; identify, analyze and address user problems; provide ongoing project leadership to technical development staff; analyze problems and propose effective solution; understand functional and procedural requirements and develop alternative solutions; relate system solutions to departmental management and staff; and communicate effectively both orally and in writing; make presentations; conduct meetings; provide user training; and establish and maintain effective working relationships with others. Excellent interpersonal, communication (written/verbal), analytical, organizational, teamwork and time management skills. Ability to build and maintain positive working relationships as part of a team.
    
Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule
    
The university offers an excellent benefits package.

The salary range for this classification is: $6249 - $10,541
The anticipated hiring range: $6249 - $6667, dependent upon qualifications and experience.

Hours: Full-Time; 40 hrs/wk: Monday - Friday; 8:00am - 5:00pm.
    
General Information
    
This position is a sensitive position as designated by the CSU.

A background check (including a criminal records check) must be completed satisfactorily before any candidate can be offered a position with the CSU. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current CSU employees who apply for the position.

The person holding this position is considered a 'mandated reporter' under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment.
    
How To Apply
    
Please complete the CSUN on-line application/resume upload submission process in order to be considered for any open position within the university and its auxiliaries. The hiring department will contact the best qualified candidates and invite them to participate in the interview process.

Application Screening begins September 9, 2015, and will continue until position is filled.

In order to be considered in the initial review, applications must be submitted prior to the date listed above. Application submissions received after the application screening date will be reviewed at the discretion of the University.

For more detailed information on the application and hiring process, please view the link below:
http://www.csun.edu/careers/
    
Equal Employment Opportunity
    
California State University, Northridge is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.  We consider qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or disability.
