item.title: Analytics, Trading, And Execution C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Analytics, Trading, and Execution is the largest and fastest growing department in R&D, and we are looking to add skilled software developers to our six core groups. The applications and infrastructure we build connect supply and demand across all asset classes on worldwide exchanges. Trillions of dollars of capital move through our systems daily; as a result, market leaders rely on us to flawlessly and seamlessly manage their positions and execute their orders.

We are looking for bold, energetic, and independent developers to take ownership and responsibility in growing our industry leading applications. The ideal candidates should be able to lead projects, work with the business, meet clients, and understand their workflows to build high performance software. Our engineers are responsible for front-end UI/workflow applications, server-side/back-end development, system design, and high performance transactional database programming.


>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Trading Solutions

Trading Solutions is the largest group within Analytics, Trading, and Execution. The group designs and builds Bloomberg's three core order management systems, a fully developed connectivity and integration product and an order execution platform. These mission-critical trading applications are used by broker dealers and investment advisers throughout the world for managing orders, executions, quotes and positions. We are the global leader in building and delivering vital financial trading applications that allow banks and investment managers to manage their order flow, risk, P&L and the entire trade life cycle. Institutions rely on our advanced tools for market compliance, connectivity and algorithmic strategy trading. Collectively, our teams provide a front to back environment to meet our clients' ever changing needs.

Fixed Income, Currencies, and Commodities

The Fixed Income, Currencies, and Commodities (FICC) electronic trading group develops a global product that facilitates dealer to client trading, liquidity, and straight through processing using the Bloomberg terminal. It is the primary mechanism by which our buy-side clients source liquidity. Over the last 20 years, FICC has evolved from selling a simple dealer platform to offering a sophisticated trading platform with an array of trading styles. Responsibilities include infrastructure design and implementation, database management and user interface development.

Equity Trader

The Equity Trader group provides highly resilient, efficient, configurable and distributed real-time trading platforms. We build the analytics used to make trading decisions, the UI used to interact with the market and other traders, tools to automate workflow, and advanced alerting to monitor ongoing activity. The system handles millions of transactions per day and enables traders to send orders to over 5,000 liquidity destinations globally. The transactions are published and mined for real-time analytics and post-trade execution analysis, and are then fed back into the system to shape tomorrow's trading decisions.

Institutional Sales Applications

The Institutional Sales Applications group develops multi-asset applications for sales professionals that empower them to provide world-class service to their institutional clients. Our applications leverage sophisticated algorithms to present easy to understand answers to questions that a salesperson faces throughout the day. Successful developers are interested in finding solutions to manage and distill large volumes of disparate data.

Portfolio and Risk Analytics

The Portfolio and Risk Analytics group develops applications that provide transparency to asset managers and analysts, to help them to make well-informed financial decisions. Our clients use our real-time system for performance analysis and returns attribution, risk analytics, intraday monitoring, optimization and idea generation. Portfolio and Risk Analytics also provides a suite of global, transparent and independent indices to serve the needs of the investment community. Our team applies broad financial and mathematical knowledge across a range of asset types to develop a constantly growing set of analytics. The scale of these calculations offers opportunities for optimizing the system using Hbase, Spark, Redis and Solr. The team is redesigning a large part of our architectural stack to keep pace with the tremendous growth of our product.

Tradebook

Tradebook is building the next generation low latency trading platform, which supports multi-asset trading, exchange routing and order matching. With high capacity and sub-microsecond latency, the new system will be the foundation for Tradebook's future and propel it into more markets. Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker and technology provider of a cross-asset electronic trading platform, supporting equities, futures, options and FX trading. We focus on developing real-time black box and algorithmic trading systems, connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions to 120+ liquidity venues globally.

item.title: Senior or Principal Data Engineer at BandPage (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
BandPage is seeking a senior data engineer who is passionate about music and eager to disrupt the music industry in a positive way.   We are on a mission to empower new and established musicians to build their fan bases, increase their revenue, and make a living at their craft.  BandPage is already used by over half a million musicians, including nearly all of the most popular artists.  Meanwhile, BandPage is integrated with most of the popular consumer music services, including Spotify, Rdio, Rhapsody, XBox Music, Vevo, etc.  Join us and help build the “operating system” for the music industry.


RESPONSIBILITIES


Data Discovery and ETL - Utilize the appropriate frameworks and tools to perform the ETL layer for disparate data sources. Consider proven methods of ETL and propose abstractions of those methods to aid in solving the ETL problems associated with data ingestion.


Data Storage Optimization - Constantly strive to optimize the data storage layer to fit the current and future needs of the applications it supports. This includes being aware of issues and making recommendations about scalability prior to, or in advance, of development of of an algorithmic solution.


Advanced Algorithms - Actively apply your knowledge of advanced algorithms, machine learning, and data models to unique problems in the domain of music. Adapt existing principles of logical inference and computer science to new problems in the company’s vertical.


Team Player - Participate in knowledge sharing activities including giving talks on topics in your area of expertise, contributing to the internal knowledge base via wiki or other, participate in code reviews, and support fellow team members in algorithm development including whiteboard sessions.

item.title: Fashion+Big Data Startup looking for Backend Engineer, Madrid at StyleSage - Fashion meets Big Data (Madrid, Spain)
item.description:
StyleSage is a venture-backed fashion tech startup that creates cutting edge innovation in the data and fashion space. As recent graduates from Techstars, the world's #1 startup accelerator, we are looking for a motivated backend engineer to join our product team in Madrid, Spain.

You will be responsible for the building tools that process, analyze and monitor data -- the most important part of our product! Additionally you will:



  • Build tools that analyze data to make the quality checking process faster and more automated

  • Work with our team of international experts in web data extraction

  • Perform ad-hoc data analysis on existing data in our database

  • Use machine-learning techniques to find insights and data anomalies

  • Our current development team is only 4 people, so you will also get to see all other activities as well


We are looking for a Full-Time candidate to work with us in our Madrid office.


Interested? Apply today!

item.title: Senior Data Scientist at Booz Allen Hamilton (Springfield, VA)
item.description:
Key Role:
Conduct statistical analysis, modeling, and simulation for various federal clients that lead to actionable decisions affecting government operations. Use statistical methods on large data sets to characterize uncertainty through statistical methods. Leverage knowledge of large data analysis and perform research at graduate-level mathematics to ensure study results are properly interpreted and documented. Implement analytical approaches that will require knowledge of statistical programming languages, including SAS and R and traditional programming languages, including Java, C++, and others. Work closely with stakeholders and teammates from non-mathematical disciplines to ensure that operational strategies are considered in the context of applying statistical theory. Use statistical theory through modeling, simulation, and large data analysis to deliver lasting measurable improvements to organizations.

item.title: Data Services Engineer at Discovery Digital Networks (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Discovery Digital Networks, the premier publisher of digital-native programming for the Internet age, is looking for a Data Services Engineer with an affinity for working with data to support, evolve and expand our web and data infrastructure.


The candidate must be willing and able to function on a small team working with designers, front-end engineers and data scientists. This position will require knowledge of Python and PHP, and some familiarity with Javascript and MySQL. Experience with Amazon Web Services, Linux server administration and packages/frameworks like Flask, SQLAlchemy, React and Lumen is a plus. Successful candidates will typically have at least 3 years of experience. Ping pong skills also a plus!


We offer a competitive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, and a 401k matching plan, in addition to other perks.  Join our collaborative, fun, and creative work environment!


Some representative daily tasks include:



  • Maintaining and enhancing the ETL that feeds our data warehouse;

  • Building and supporting new and existing data tools and products;

  • Maintaining and developing both customer facing and internal web services;

  • Helping to improve the performance and reliability of the entire Discovery Digital Networks technology stack.


 Some possibilities for initial projects:



  • Updating data warehouse to include detailed geographic and demographic data;

  • Using machine learning algorithms to create tools to help producers create better content;

  • Creating dashboards to surface warehouse data to users.

item.title: Senior Engineer at HERE-Chicago (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
HERE, a Nokia company, is a leader in navigation, mapping and location experiences. We combine highly accurate and fresh maps with cloud technology to enable rich, real-time location experiences in a broad range of connected devices – from smartphones and tablets to wearables and vehicles. To learn more about HERE, including our work in the areas of connected and autonomous driving, visit http://360.here.com



The Team:



The RCP group designs and builds hardware and software for capturing, processing, and extracting information from street-level imagery, 3D Lidar data, aerial and satellite imagery, as well as dense GPS probe data from smartphones and vehicles. These rich datasets are used to power next-gen 3D consumer maps, navigation and assisted driving systems, and more. HERE Maps, a division of Nokia, provides detailed road and navigation data for nearly 100 countries, and can be found in four out of five vehicle in-dash navigation systems. Licensees of HERE’s platform include Microsoft, Yahoo, Amazon, and Baidu. 



The Position:



Within RCP, the Data Operations Team manages the software processing pipeline for transforming petabytes of raw data into useable information.  The team is also responsible for data quality control, measuring and analyzing pipeline performance and addressing data issues that may be identified.  We are seeking a Senior Engineer to help us build tools to enable, expedite and enhance Data Operations Team’s QA and analytical efforts.  Example work for this team will be building and maintaining tools to improve the efficiency and efficacy of terrestrial and satellite data QA review.

item.title: Fashion+Big Data Startup looking for Front/Full-Stack Developer, Madrid at StyleSage - Fashion meets Big Data (Madrid, Spain)
item.description:
StyleSage is a venture-backed fashion tech startup that creates cutting edge innovation in the data and fashion space. As recent graduates from Techstars, the world's #1 startup accelerator, we are looking for a Front-End/Full-Stack Developer to join our team in Madrid! As Front-End Developer your main responsibilities would include:

ETL/DWH Engineer

item.title: Data visualization engineer: Javascript at Timetric (London, UK)
item.description:
Timetric is looking for a data visualization engineer to join our small London-based technology team, and help us build great data-visualization products. Our core technology is Javascript, using ReactJS, talking to a Python/Django backend, and we build interfaces for people to visualize and explore rich datasets.


Although the technology team is small, we're part of a growing company, and we're responsible for a suite of established B2B business intelligence products, working closely with a world-class sales team and expert content creators.


We've got ambitious plans to grow and improve all our products, and build first-class interfaces that inform and delight our users. We'd love to hear from data-savvy, design conscious developers who'd could help us!

item.title: Data Scientist at Evidence for Policy Design (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
Evidence for Policy Design at the Harvard Kennedy School of Government (EPoD) seeks a qualified data scientist to provide support on data analytics initiatives. The candidate will work with our Data Analytics Lead to perform data cleaning and analysis, manage databases, and produce graphics and basic software applications. In addition, the candidate will be involved with the production of policy-related op-eds and data journalism-style pieces.



The position is part-time with an initial duration of 6 months and may be open to extension based on performance and subsequent demand. The position may involve travel to India.



To apply, please send a CV, cover letter, and link to your GitHub account to Eric Dodge (epod@hks.harvard.edu) with “Data Scientist Application” in the subject line. Applications will be accepted through September 30, 2015.

item.title: Machine Learning at Hivemapper (Burlingame, CA)
item.description:
Hivemapper maps the Earth for drone fliers. That's a lot of data!  How do we teach our data collection engine to systematically crawl and extract the billions of pieces of data we need to map the earth for drone fliers.  Our earth crawler and extractor has acquired hundreds of millions of interesting objects on the planet, from 'hidden'  to 'hidden' . We have 'hidden' spanning the entire earth. 



At Hivemapper you'll help design and build the machine learning systems to collect the earth's data and instantly deliver the most relevant results to drone pilots. One day you might be figuring out how to process these terabytes of data and those billions of database rows. Another day you might be designing how to send five square miles of detailed 3-D map data to our drone fliers in under 100 milliseconds. And another day you might be out flying a drone with the man who took Hivemapper to Nepal.


We are backed by Spark Capital (Oculus Rift and Twitter), Google Ventures, Homebrew, and Harrison Metal.


[Hivemapper is currently building in stealth mode]

item.title: Junior Malware Analyst at Kaspersky Lab (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
• Defining malicious functionality in Windows x86 malware

  • Adding signatures to antivirus database

  • Keeping current with latest malware threats affecting our customers

  • Travel to conferences to give presentations is optional, but always encouraged.

item.title: Data scientist at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Data scientist


Ministerie van Veiligheid en Justitie, Nederlands Forensisch Instituut


Functieomschrijving


Je beantwoordt met behulp van data-analyse vragen rond opsporing en bewijswaardering. Dit doe je bij het kennis- en expertisecentrum voor intelligente data-analyse (Kecida), onderdeel van het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI).


Kecida zet intelligente data-analyse in voor het oplossen van forensische vraagstukken. Ook richten we ons op onderzoek en ontwikkeling in kunstmatige intelligentie en helpen we de openbare orde en veiligheidsector met het inzichtelijk maken van grote hoeveelheden data.


Als big data engineer pas je data-analyse toe, zoals machine learning, tekstanalyse en netwerkanalyse. Je weet data in het juiste formaat te krijgen, zodat je ze snel in kunt zetten. Vervolgens gebruik je statistiek om inzicht in data te krijgen en machine learning voor het benutten van deze inzichten. Daarnaast houd je je bezig met onderzoek en ontwikkeling op het gebied van data-analyse en data science. Tot slot werk je aan consultancyprojecten voor een diverse groep opdrachtgevers binnen de openbare orde en veiligheidsector, zoals projecten over fraudeopsporing.

item.title: Data Scientist (The Walking Dead) at Next Games (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
If you’re a startup-minded pro with a passion for games and a brain that can tackle any given problem in a unique way, then keep on reading as we’re on the look for our new team member for The Walking Dead game team:


DATA SCIENTIST


As our Data Scientist, you’re responsible for generating insights from large data sets produced by our games and players. Working closely with our EP’s and game teams you’ll get to service and manage our day-to-day data requests and analyses hands-on.


This is what you’ll get to work on:



  • Work with product teams to define data to be collected from our products for analysis

  • Analysis of key performance indicators, such as customer acquisition, retention, lifetime value and virtual economy balance

  • Defining the data acquisition of AB tests and analysis of the gathered AB test data to estimate the effect on key metrics and choose the best features

  • Develop models for predicting player behavior

  • Answer in-depth analytics questions from the team and create reports of the results

  • Identify and report actionable insights to internal stakeholders, suggest recommendations and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating results


Your experience and skills include:



  • 2+ years experience in a data scientist or analyst role, involving some of the following: data analytics, CRM data analysis, data mining, business intelligence, machine learning, predictive modeling

  • Expert knowledge in SQL-related languages

  • Knowledge in statistical programming languages (R, etc.) and in Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Pig, NoSQL, etc.)

  • Experience in interpreting data and analytics results to provide actionable insight into user/product behavior and deriving conclusions from those insights

  • Comfortable working in an international, fast-paced, challenging and stimulating organization

  • Excellent written & verbal communication skills in English


Here at Next Games we aim high, and will ask you to do the same. In exchange, you’ll be part of a team that is great to work with, who is dedicated and passionate about what we do – we believe passion is contagious. Giving each Nextgamer the tools and means to succeed in their job is our priority. We believe the fruits of our labor should be shared with everyone at Next Games. We offer the opportunity to work with a great bunch of passionate and dedicated people, a competitive salary and benefits package, and first and foremost a big challenge.



If you believe in the same things, don’t hesitate any longer, apply now!



When you apply, please email your CV, a cover letter along with your salary request to data.scientist@nextgames.com. Please apply soon, as we’ll proceed once we’ve found the right person to join our team!



For further information about the position please contact our CPO, Joakim Achrén at +358-500 625 398 during the following time:



Friday 21.8. between 13.00 – 14.00 (EEST)

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Query Processing at Tableau Software (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
What you’ll be doing…


You’ll be developing cutting-edge software for the best visual data analysis products available. Query processing is one of the most complex technical challenges in Tableau. You will compile, optimize and rewrite queries for all different types of data sources. In addition to traditional relational query optimization, you’ll work on optimizing federated queries across multiple data sources with diverse, often non-relational, data models. You will be expanding the analytical product capabilities and performance of the Tableau products through query optimization and through our custom in-memory columnar storage engine. You will be constantly challenged to leverage your creativity and your technical prowess to improve Tableau.

Some of the things you’ll be doing include…



  • Extend and improve Tableau’s query pipeline that creates analytical queries enabling visualization of data.

  • Improve the performance and scalability of our in-memory data engine and extend it to support ever more diverse kinds of data.

  • Improve query performance through new algorithms, caching, concurrency, and scaling. These queries can operate on dozens of database platforms, enabling individual users and enterprises to rapidly federate and explore their data through insightful visualizations.

  • Create innovative algorithms to provide a better experience with live queries against an ever more diverse set of data sources. These may include API-based web data sources, cubes, graph data, relational and NoSQL systems such as Hadoop.

  • Leverage your creativity and technical prowess to extend our customer’s ability to see, understand, and “reach out and touch” their data; in whatever form that data it happens to be.

item.title: Messaging Migration Engineer at bluesource (Grapevine, TX)
item.description:
The Messaging Migration Engineer develops migration tools and reporting systems for bluesource’s Data Migrations team.  The team takes data from a variety of source email and IM archiving systems, including those developed by Symantec, EMC, HP, Microsoft, and pushes it into an alternative platform that our customers want to move to. Target platforms may include Cloud systems like EV.Cloud and Office 365. Often these systems do not have public APIs, and will require out-of-the-box problem solving and innovation. In this position you will have a critical role in the future of the migration processes, and designing automated toolsets that will enable us to deliver the work for customers more rapidly and accurately, while supporting the expansion and success of a fast growing team.


General Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain a data migration and reporting toolset to migrate data between a variety of data archiving platforms.

  • Gather and document requirements from the Data Migrations Manager and Data Migrations Analysts to extend and improve the data migration toolset.

  • Assist the Data Migrations team with project tasks as required, and to dogfood the toolset.

  • Manage time efficiently, work with minimal supervision

  • Document tools and train analysts to use them

item.title: Data Analyst at MillimanMAX (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
We are looking for an individual who has the skills and drive to help our data scientists go faster by handling the responsibilities of profiling complex datasets, by identifying inefficiencies and rectifying them, by reconciling and mapping datasets, and by interacting with clients around data related subjects when the need presents itself. You will exist at the intersection of databases, software and modeling – you’re a generalist. You will have the unique opportunity to grow with the company from the ground up in a fun and challenging work environment. This role may also potentially serve as a bridge for candidates seeking training in data science and ultimately desiring a transition to a data science role. The analyst position will be a crash course in anything and everything related to the field.


Candidate profile:



  • This is an entry level role – we are looking for recent BS grads (CS, Math and Stats majors preferred)

  • Prior work with SQL, MATLAB or modeling not necessary but experience is a plus

  • You need to be a good detective, eager and willing to learn about a range of topics -- whatever is thrown your way.

  • ABOVE ALL: You need to be independent, resourceful and creative.

item.title: Data Engineer (m/f) at Project A Ventures (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:

  • You will integrate, transform and index data from various data sources and develop meaningful data representations and visualisations

  • You will deal with the challenges of growing data amounts (performance, scaling, data quality)

  • You will work in an agile software development process in close collaboration with a product management team

item.title: Software Engineer (ETL) at AnswerOn (Longmont, CO)
item.description:
Utilizing your arsenal of skills and talents, you will solve unique problems in the management of client data, by designing, implementing, maintaining and executing ETL processes for the management of client data. You will also provide data support for predictive modeling and statistical analysis of client data. We will expect you to have an enthusiasm for working in small groups in a high-energy bootstrap environment. Right candidate will be trained on all these processes. 
 
Responsibilities:



  • In this position you will be trained and responsible to create, maintain and execute custom data management (ETL) processes using;

  • Business Objects Data Services (BODS) in order to support analytical modeling and statistical analysis of client data.

  • Store and manage client data using SQL Server.

  • Create and manage data warehouses to support analysis of client data.

  • Prepare analytical modeling output for delivery to clients using BODS.

item.title: Lead Data Architect at Leap (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We're looking for a Lead Data Architect, ideally with experience working on a SAAS or enterprise product.  You will work closely with the CTO and founders to discuss new schema design and future predictive capabilities for our real-time financial analytics products.  You should have experience with system design that follows best practices and leverage REST API's, as well as the ability to ensure that our entire stack is testable and scaleable. You like solving core problems around scalability and performance, thinking about how to leverage new tools, and optimize systems.


If you have management experience, or looking to grow in that area, this role will evolve into a technical leadership role as we grow.


Responsibilities include:


• Work closely with the CTO and Product team to define, design and prototype new features to our custom analytics and data visualization tools


• Develop highly scalable data ETL, data warehouse, and reporting solutions


• Help mentor the team on data architecture, new tools, and predictive functionality


• Investigate, propose, and/or prototype new tools for added security, storage and scalability

item.title: Principal Software Engineer - Hadoop, Big Data at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Fidelity’s Strategic Investment Products and Data (SIPD) technology organization is seeking a highly technical and passionate Principal Software Big Data Developer. The candidate will be responsible for leading and executing several of our strategic data initiatives for enabling the next generation customer analytical platform using big data technologies. This job also requires strong oral and written communication, relationship management and conflict resolution skills. The ideal candidate will be an energetic and resourceful team-player and leader who can effectively work with our globally distributed technology team. If you are looking for an opportunity to delve into the Big Data world with a leading technology organization, then this role is for you!


SIPD supports Fidelity's Managed Accounts business which delivers advisory solutions for Fidelity clients through the PWIS sales channels and online self-service channels such as Fidelity.com. 


This position is located full time in Durham, NC.


Responsibilities:



  • Work across technology teams to understand and define system and technical requirements for EDW and Big Data

  • Work and transition seamlessly between relational, data warehouse and big data platforms

  • Lead a team in the design/development of data ingestion and data transformation for EDW and big data applications

  • Lead the development of data pipelines using Hadoop, NoSQL, In-Memory and Distributed search platforms

  • Primary point of contact for development team to the project manager, lead systems analyst and QA lead

  • Design and deliver complex architectures for customers

  • Participates in requirements gathering and scope estimation meetings

  • Responsible for Technical Systems Design (TSD) document delivery and reviewing all project artifacts including requirements (SRA) and functional specifications (SDS)

  • Manage development for content pipeline and processing systems for real-time and predictive analytics

  • Capable of advanced performance tuning of hadoop jobs (hive, pig, map reduce, etc.)

  • Rapidly prototype and validate big data applications

  • Mentor software engineers in code design and optimization

  • Perform on-call support responsibilities with rotational schedule

item.title: Senior BI Consultant at Infusion (New York, NY)
item.description:
BI Senior Consultant


Role:


We are looking for a Business Intelligence Consultant to join our team in New York. Infusion’s Business Intelligence (BI) practice is a Microsoft Gold Certified BI Partner that was awarded Microsoft Impact Award for BI Partner of the Year. Our team consists of highly skilled individuals that are specialized in business process automation, data management, design, architecture, reporting and analytics. The BI Team takes a business first approach with our clients as we work closely them to understand and analyze their business and operational processes; their data collection mechanisms; their data reporting and decision making processes. This analysis allows us to formulate a vision and plan to work towards streamlining their enterprise wide processes to efficiently collect, manage, report on and analyze the data that is required by decisions makers.


We create a vision that looks beyond the traditional walls of departmental data silos and increases proactive lines of communication across an enterprise to ensure the right people are receiving the right data at the right time (when it is needed). Typically, we utilize the Microsoft Business Intelligence technology stack to build enterprise solutions that complement an organization's BI vision and goals. We provide our clients, across various different industries, with the tools and skills to organically grow and evolve Business Intelligence throughout the organization.


Job Duties:



  • Perform Enterprise wide business process analysis

  • Work closely with our clients to define system requirements

  • Design/implement Databases, Data warehouses and BI solutions around high volume enterprise applications

  • Develop business insight through reporting and dashboarding solutions

  • Provide training for our clients in the BI and data warehousing space

  • Execute rapid prototyping to support presales activities

  • Provide team leadership/co-ordination on projects

  • Provide expertise in cutting edge BI technology

  • Participate in Industry communities

item.title: HPDC Developer at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
A Developer at 1010data creates large-scale analytics solutions; this includes designing the associated high-performance database structure, data transformations, and workflow processes.


You will be developing adaptive distributed system software and high-speed communication system software to support high-performance distributed computing (HPDC) applications.


The successful candidate will have a passion for writing code and be instrumental in building a highly scalable, 24/7 availability platform for our in-house data center. 


Experience in specific programming languages isnot required; however the right candidate knows how to program and has the interest and ability to learn new languages quickly.


The right person appreciates the end-end ownership of building tools from scratch and is confident embracing new technologies to make a tangible impact and evolve our product as we continue to change the rules of big data discovery.


Responsibilities:



  • Design and implement parallel processing systems that operate on multiple terabytes of data

  • Build, tune and manage cloud based applications

  • Create technology solutions which have critical business impact

item.title: Core Developer; large-scale analytics solutions at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are seeking a Core Developer to design and implement large-scale analytics solutions; including building tools and interfaces used both internally and by customers, high performance data manipulation algorithms, and innovative ways to visualize and deliver result sets to customers.


Our Core team builds portable code that enables our customers to use 1010data’s system in a more autonomous way while maintaining performance when dealing with massive amounts of data.  They work directly with our customers for tangible feedback on products/technology, enabling rapid release cycles.


If you appreciate the end-end ownership of building tools from scratch and are confident embracing new technologies to make a tangible impact come evolve our product as we continue to change the rules of big data discovery.


Responsibilities:



  • Design and implement parallel processing systems that operate on multiple terabytes of data

  • Build, tune and manage cloud based applications

  • Create technology solutions which have critical business impact

item.title: NoSQL? Great! Come help expand our Big Data solution across our platform! at kCura (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
As an Elasticsearch Engineer at kCura, based in Chicago IL, you will leverage your knowledge in Elasticsearch to build Relativity Data Grid- a NoSQL data store that allows users to horizontally distribute large amounts of text and data. This is your opportunity to work on a next generation data store that will allow Relativity to handle massive amounts of data. If you have the desire to be continually challenged and work where boredom is an anomaly, then join our team and be part of a successful company experiencing rapid growth in the eDiscovery field.



Responsibilities:




  • Design and implementation of APIs and services to expose the data and abstract the tools

  • Experience with relational databases

  • Experience building intensive data driven applications

  • Elasticsearch experience

  • Real time data processing utilizing Elasticsearch technologies

  • Familiarity building Logstash/Elasticsearch/Kibana logging system

  • Scaling distributed data systems

  • Optimizing distributed application systems to maximize performance

  • Configure/optimize Elasticsearch clusters

  • Design, build, and test systems for scalability and stability while processing petabytes of data

  • Integrate Elasticsearch tools into the Relativity architecture

  • Actively participating in our SCRUM process

  • Troubleshooting issues by fixing defects and responding to client specific problems

  • May be required to handle technical support calls after hours about two times a year. If Client Services is working on a ticket and they are not able to solve an urgent issue, they will reach out to the level I developer to assist to get the issue resolved

item.title: Vice President of Engineering at DraftKings Inc. (Boston, MA)
item.description:
DraftKings is seeking a Vice President of Engineering with experience and passion for building and leading high performing engineering organizations.  You must have a proven track record of leading from technology teams through hyper-growth period through IPO.  Reporting to our CTO, the Vice President will partner with internal business stakeholders to ensure the delivery of highly performant solutions against the product roadmap at scale.  You will advocate for technology and continuously improve both process and people. You will be responsible for recruiting a world class development, QA and IT team.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead and inspire our engineering teams in building world-class products that will benefit and delight customers worldwide.

  • Collaborate with leadership and cross-functional product teams to form technology roadmaps in support of the product plan.

  • Lead and collaborate on key architectural decisions and design considerations.

  • Track and manage key metrics like system costs, team performance and business KPIs.

  • Constantly remove organizational bottlenecks and scale issues as the team grows.

  • Develop and mentor upcoming leaders and key engineers.

  • Drive successful project execution.

  • Ensure appropriate process to deliver industry benchmark in reliability and performance.

  • Ensure software engineering best practices are utilized and continuously evolved.

  • Set goals and perform annual reviews of direct reports.

  • Develop and manage to the Annual Operating Plan.

  • Develop and refine organizational structure and direct reporting roster.

  • Provide goals and direction to direct report and require the same through the org.

  • Develop, mentor, retain and advance staff in order to create a growth environment.

  • Partner with key stakeholders, including: exec team, product management, marketing, sales, and customers.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Data) for a Rapidly Growing Startup at PaperG (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
PaperG is looking to hire an experienced Sr. Software Engineer who can help build our next generation data collection, analysis and visualization platform.


We need this platform to capture all of the data PaperG produces and a corresponding data visualization system to help us leverage this data. Needless to say, this platform needs to be running 24/7, scale with increasing load, fault tolerant and easy to monitor and manage.


Are you up to the challenge?

If so, and you enjoy a collaborative open office environment, flexible working hours, participating in hackathons, shipping early and often, and free team lunches, let's talk.

item.title: Software Engineer In Data at Dataminr (New York, NY)
item.description: At Dataminr, we are looking for dedicated software engineers to help us sort, analyze and deliver relevant information from terabytes of unstructured data in the social media space. We strive for strong abstractions that allow for fast iteration, easy integration and short development cycles, allowing us to constantly learn from our data and empowering our clients to apply these insights toward product enhancements.

item.title: Mjukvaruingenjör inbyggda system at Evidente AB (Göteborg, Sverige)
item.description:
Vi söker de bästa. Vi söker dig med yrkestolthet. Vi söker dig som ser dig själv som en stark programmerare, som förstår vikten av kvalitet och som vill leverera mjukvara du känner dig stolt över.  


Som ingenjör på Evidente arbetar du med mjukvaruutveckling av inbyggda system i alla faser från koncept till färdig produkt.


Vi har lika delar uppdrag inne på vårt kontor och ute hos kund. Våra kunder finns inom fordon, telekom, medicinteknik och industri. Vårt arbete genomsyras av stort engagemang och hög kvalitet.  


Vårt strukturerade arbetssätt i kombination med våra erfarna och duktiga kollegor ger dig utmärkta verktyg att nå resultat och utveckla dig själv.

item.title: Data Infrastructure Engineer at Content Square (Paris, France)
item.description:
Content Square is one of the current fastest growing companies, deploying lots of analytics tools through a critical data pipeline. This infrastructure needs to remain strongly reliable and available, with minimum downtimes.


As a Data Infrastructure Enginneer you will



  • Design efficient architectures to store and analyze petabytes of data.

  • Think about clever data models to serve product’s features, while minimizing costs.

  • Develop tools to help data-scientists to work with the available clusters.

  • Document your work, prove it works, make it work better!

item.title: Big Data/Hadoop Developer at Arbisoft (Lahore, Pakistan)
item.description: Experienced Hadoop Developer who loves designing and working with large data sets. The developer is expected to coordinate with developers to build large scale applications that will impact real world problems. As he/she will be called upon to write detailed technical specifications, the senior developer must possess excellent written communication skills.

item.title: API Engineering Manager at Namely (New York, NY)
item.description:
Do you wholeheartedly believe in the Open Source Software movement?  Does the opportunity to build an API ecosystem and development team while interfacing with internal and external developers sound like your kind of challenge?  Can you lead Namely in building and executing a vision for the future of Web APIs and Services?



Namely is looking for a Manager of API Engineering to lead a team within our Engineering organization.  This position will partner with the leaders in Engineering, Product, QA and Project Management to deliver APIs and documentation that ensure the best possible experience for both internal and external customers.  As the Manager of API Engineering, you will be driving the architecture and standards for Open Source software at Namely.

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Semantico Limited (Brighton, UK)
item.description:
Semantico is an award winning digital publishing solutions company with offices in central Brighton and the USA. We deliver innovative solutions and consultancy to a global client base of publishers and scholarly institutions.


We’re proud of the fact that every aspect of our work is in-house, from initial requirements gathering through UX design and build, all the way to aftercare for the products we deliver. Our clients value Semantico’s partnership approach: we don’t just build products, we build relationships that allow us to understand and deliver on our clients’ long-term needs.


We are looking for a talented Senior Java Developer to join our fast-paced and innovative solutions team. Team members are expected to be able to work across projects of all scales, from large internal investment programmes run with agile methodologies, to small features for client sites which are well-defined prior to sale and run to strict timeframes.


As a growing company, every member of our team is valued and invited to have a say in the future of the Semantico technical strategy. We also believe in training – each staff member has their own training budget - and promoting from within, so this is an ideal environment if you are always looking to learn something new and want to build on your career.


In return, we offer an exciting opportunity in a company at the forefront of digital publishing. A competitive salary and bonus scheme are available for the right candidate as well as a personal training budget, a contributory pension plan, 31 days’ holiday inclusive of public holidays and increasing with service, a 35 hour week, Cycle to Work scheme, childcare vouchers, various fresh coffees, fruit delivered to the office, a relaxed dress code. Our office hours are 9.30 – 5.30pm.


To apply for this position, please read the full job description below before sending in your CV and a cover letter that includes your salary expectations and why you feel you are suitable for the role to HR@semantico.com


The closing date for submissions is end of play on Wednesday 23 September.  


We will endeavour to reply to all applicants to advise whether or not they have been invited to interview.


If it is not obvious from your application that you have the right to work in the UK, please confirm in your covering letter that you have this right and that you are UK based, or that you are moving to the UK and specify the timescales for your relocation. 


Full Job Description


Primary Purpose of the Role:


The Senior Java Developer will design and develop new software, major enhancements to existing applications, and fixes within defined time, cost, and quality targets.


Principal Relationships:




  • Developers




  • Technical Team Leads




  • Project Manager & Scrum master




  • QA team




  • Systems & Support teams




Key Responsibilities




  • Work with technical leads, project management and quality assurance


    staff to design and develop and deploy high quality applications for our clients




  • Develop systems that adhere to architecture standards, risk management and security policies




  • Work on projects both large and small, with the same attention to detail




  • Understand project development from both a commercial and software engineering perspective




  • Work with systems and support teams to deploy applications and provide post-deployment aftercare




  • Unit test software thoroughly to ensure highest quality levels possible




  • Produce updates to system documentation




  • Utilise system analysis skills to understand business requirements and produce system designs




  • Assist in estimating and planning work




  • Work with quality assurance staff to aid in testing and develop automated test scripts




  • Assess code for compliance to standards, perform code reviews and design reviews




  • Take a lead role on development projects, mentoring colleagues as required




  • Work on multiple projects with varying priorities and deadlines




  • Recommend best practice techniques for build, test and project delivery through constant evaluation of activities




  • Review existing applications and end to end solutions, providing recommendations for improvement

item.title: Big Data Architect at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The opportunity


As a Big Data Architect at Zalando, you will be in charge of building, scaling and architecting one of the largest big data platforms in ecommerce. You will develop big data solutions, services, and messaging frameworks to help us continuously process our data faster and more effectively. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.


What we are looking for



  • A university degree in Computer Science,  Mathematics, Statistics or comparable subject, with an academic record of high achievement

  • Fluency in at least one programming language, such as Python, Java and/or Scala

  • Solid knowledge of data structures and applied machine learning techniques

  • Demonstrated experience working on time-critical, mass data-processing, parallel data-processing and database initiatives

  • Deep knowledge of Hadoop, Cassandra, Spark, MapReduce, Storm, Kafka, and/or other big data technologies and their capabilities

  • A passion for working with relational (e.g. PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g. Cassandra, Redis) databases

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures and RESTful APIs

  • Peerless analytical and critical thinking skills

  • Creative thinkers who value accountability, goal-setting and focusing on solutions instead of problems

  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities



  • Prototype, design and build a mass data-processing and log data-processing architecture that will supplement to our existing analysis and DWH architecture

  • Align multiple teams to support new big data solutions

  • Help evaluate and push for the adoption of technologies that are best suited for specific projects

  • Share your knowledge via coaching, code reviews, articles and tech talks

  • Demonstrate excellent communication skills and act as a liaison between your team and others


What you can expect from us



  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing conference talks and blog posts to industry networking Community: hack weeks, movie nights, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more



  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Matthias Rempel at jobs@zalando.de.

a10:author.a10:name: New York University - Division of Libraries

item.title: Data Services Specialist at New York University - Division of Libraries (New York, NY)
item.description:
The QDA & Survey Research Specialist will be working in a vibrant and collaborative environment on a team that supports all phases of the data lifecycle for quantitative, qualitative, and geospatial research. Data Services offers access to specialty software packages, software training and support, and consulting expertise for many aspects of numeric, qualitative, and spatial data for research, including data access, analysis, collection, data management, and preservation. The successful candidate will work closely with Division of Libraries professionals and faculty as well as with colleagues in NYU Information Technology Services (ITS) with respect to referrals, service development, technology, standards, resources and projects.


*Please note that this is a two year fixed term position with potential to renew.

item.title: Software Engineer - NAVIS - A "Top Workplace" 3 years running! at NAVIS (Bend, OR)
item.description:
NAVIS is looking for a creative, motivated Software Engineer to join us as a critical member of our Engineering Team in beautiful Bend, Oregon.  


NAVIS is seeking highly-competent "development athletes" to join our team, rather than position players.  This means you know how to develop rich code, regardless of the tools you use - you are very capable and easily learn new technologies.  We are re-architecting many of our products from the UI through the database, and we are exploring (and have already implemented) new technologies to add to our existing technology ecosystem.  The primary focus of this position is coding new, creative, operational software that enhances our products. 


It’s an exciting time to be at NAVIS!


This developer will design, develop, optimize and test client/server and web applications in an Agile / SCRUM setting primarily based on .NET and Open Source / Open Stack technologies. As part of the Engineering Team, you will collaborate closely with the Chief Technology Officer (CTO), Chief Innovation Officer (CIO), Technical Team Leads and other Product Team members, to design exceptional software / product solutions to meet customer needs.


If NEW software development is appealing, this position could be a great fit! The Engineering Team has multiple projects that often start at the concept stage and develops new products and/or product features from scratch. Our products are constantly evolving with our client needs - we are not simply maintaining existing products.


This is a full SDLC development position. The candidate must be willing to take on all aspects of the development process, and be ready to support applications in production environments. He/she may be asked to test code sets, document software, and implement products and related solutions. Strong knowledge of design patterns and software development best practices must be shown at all times. A high degree of creativity and motivation is required of the successful candidate, who is expected to operate with limited direct supervision. This developer needs to have a willingness to do whatever it takes to make the products and the company successful.



WHY WOULD YOU WANT TO WORK FOR NAVIS?



  • NAVIS was a finalist in the 2015 Oregon Tech Awards Technology Company of the Year in the Growth category!- http://www.navisblog.com/navis-finalist-in-the-15-oregon-tech-awards-technology-company-of-the-year…;

  • NAVIS is growing fast due to high market demand for our products. Our products are successful because they truly help our clients succeed and grow. We demonstrate our value to our clients every single day.

  • We are building new technologies and enhancing existing ones - we are NOT standing still. We are re-architecting our products from the UI through the database. This means we need strong, creative, intelligent developers with great ideas that love to build awesome software products.

  • Our technology is blossoming and we will be utilizing some of the latest and greatest technologies on the market today.

  • The Oregonian has listed NAVIS as a "Top Place to Work in Oregon" in 2012, 2013, and 2014. We live the core values listed below - they are not window dressing.

  • Strong technical leadership in a team-based atmosphere

  • Your work matters; your impact will be visible

  • Local, established Oregon-founded and based company

  • Healthy financial foundation

  • We give generously to local charities and offer opportunities to participate to directly help those in need

  • Competitive base salaries with a 10% annual bonus target and a full benefits package, including matching 401(k)

  • WORK / LIFE BALANCE - what a concept!!

  • You get to LIVE and WORK in Central Oregon - what could be better than that?



At NAVIS, we live our Core Values:



  • Golden Rule: Treat others as you would want to be treated

  • Integrity: A person of your word, highly trusted

  • Innovation: Open and involved in creating or executing on "new"

  • Passion: Love the TEAM, the clients and the work we do

  • Attitude: Consistently display a positive, can-do attitude



LOCATION OF THIS POSITION:


To foster a highly-collaborative team environment, this position will be located in beautiful Bend, Oregon.  Relocation assistance is provided, as needed.



ABOUT BEND, OREGON:


Bend, the county seat of Deschutes County, covers 32 square miles. To the east is high desert vegetation and to the west, Bend is surrounded by U.S. Forest Service land. The city is noted for its scenic setting, mild climate, year-round recreation opportunities and growing economy. At an elevation of 3,625 feet, Bend enjoys the predominately dry climate of the Great Basin. Sunny days, cool nights and low humidity characterize the weather.


 Love the outdoors? 


 The following activities are all right out your doorstep (quite literally, in many cases):



  • Mountains, mountains, mountains: the Three Sisters (Faith, Hope and Charity), Broken Top, and Mount Bachelor are the five most prominent peaks nearby, and offer activities galore

  • Climbing: world class rock climbing is just 25 minutes north of Bend at Smith Rock

  • On the River: the Deschutes River flows right through the middle of town - people use it for kayaking, paddle boarding, floating the river, fishing, or simply walking its banks

  • Skiing: Mount Bachelor is just 25 minutes southwest of Bend, and there are other ski resorts nearby offering Alpine and Nordic skiing at all skill levels – snowshoeing, too!

  • Mountain Biking: there are many miles of existing trails for all skill levels, and new trails currently under construction

  • Fishing & Boating: countless lakes, streams, rivers, ponds and reservoirs at your disposal

  • Hiking & Camping: dozens of designated campsites nearby with access to trails

  • Golfing: 20+ courses sit in the surrounding area

  • Whitewater Rafting: there are multiple guiding companies in the surrounding area

  • Hunting: bow or rifle hunting for deer, elk, bear, water fowl, etc.


 In addition to Bend's outdoor recreational ethos, there are now 13 (yes – 13, and counting) craft breweries in town! World-class craft beer is one of the cultural pillars of Bend - after a fun day at the slopes or on the river, a well-deserved beverage is a staple among we Bendites.


 Check out the Official Bend Oregon Video created by VisitBend.com for more information on the area:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u6zSKJqalug ;


Don't take our word for it - take a look at what others are saying:


The Top 10 Best Places to Live Now - Men's Journal - http://www.mensjournal.com/expert-advice/the-10-best-places-to-live-now-20150312/bend-oregon


Can Bend Become the Next Boulder?  This Venture Capitalist Thinks So, and Here's Why - Geekwire-  http://www.geekwire.com/2014/qa-venture-capitalist-dino-vendetti/ ;


Bend, Ore., A Brewer's Town - New York Times - http://www.nytimes.com/2012/04/22/travel/in-bend-ore-craft-brewing-is-booming.html?_r=0 ;


Bend, Ore., The City You'll Love to Hate - Washington Post - http://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/travel/…

item.description:
NAVIS is looking for a creative, motivated Software Engineer to join us as a critical member of our Engineering Team in beautiful Bend, Oregon.  


NAVIS is seeking highly-competent "development athletes" to join our team, rather than position players.  This means you know how to develop rich code, regardless of the tools you use - you are very capable and easily learn new technologies.  We are re-architecting many of our products from the UI through the database, and we are exploring (and have already implemented) new technologies to add to our existing technology ecosystem, including the use of functional programming with Clojure / ClojureScript.
