item.title: Foundational Applications C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Foundational Applications department builds some of the most innovative and heavily used applications and infrastructure in the financial industry. We work on communication systems, compliance and archiving solutions, charts and visualizations, news, search and recommendation systems and big data infrastructure.

Our developers operate at the intersection of in-depth technical research and an aggressive time-to-market. We not only own the full life cycle for the products we build, but also work closely with our business counterparts and UX design teams to strategize on next generation features and functionality. We are dedicated to using and contributing to open source, have an active presence at industry conferences and collaborate with top universities.

>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.


Instant Messaging

Bloomberg Instant Messaging (Instant Bloomberg, or IB) is used by the Bloomberg community for real-time communication including exchanging quotes, trade ideas, news and other financial information. IB handles close to 250 million post events per day. Our usage has grown considerably over the past few years, requiring that we maintain a sophisticated UI and a state-of-the-art distributed architecture which can scale to the most extreme load without compromising performance. We also build a unified multimedia communications product called BConnect. We work with open source software and encourage interaction with the wider technology community by contributing changes and taking part in related meetups and conferences.

Bloomberg Vault

Bloomberg Vault (BVault) is a startup within Bloomberg developing a cloud-based compliance archiving service, eDiscovery tools and real-time compliance monitoring infrastructure. The explosive growth of social media and web collaboration require businesses to remain compliant with an increasingly regulatory environment. Our software, hosted in Bloomberg's private cloud, archives over 60 billion messages and has gained rapid market adoption with over 700 enterprises. Our infrastructure processes over 200 million messages a day, checking content and interaction patterns, and providing analytics and event-driven reporting.

Mail

The Bloomberg Mail (Message) group builds a cloud-based platform used for Internet email, bond announcements and pricing, financial research distribution and other communication on the Bloomberg terminal. Our network of users, connected through the platform, relies on our real-time performance, ironclad security and tight integration with financial data and Bloomberg applications. Message is built on top of open source, commercial and proprietary technologies. This highly available distributed system includes comprehensive storage, search infrastructures, real-time email transport and delivery pipelines. We build APIs for integration with other applications and systems, and a feature-rich user interface optimized for our customers.

News

The News group develops one of the most heavily used applications on the Bloomberg terminal that provides search, real-time alerts and analysis. We build systems that process over one million news stories a day from over 80,000 sources. We provide scalable products that meet strict indexing latency requirements and synthesize and present an overwhelming amount of unstructured information to our clients. Bloomberg News uses our systems and workflows making them the fastest, most influential news agency in the world.

Government Intelligence

The Government Intelligence group helps investors quantify the impact of government activities such as legislation, regulation and contracting. Our work includes ingesting large unstructured public data sets and discovering actionable data points to alert clients in real-time. We design scalable search and database solutions to aid discoverability and analysis.

Charts and Custom Indices

The Charts and Custom Indices group builds visuals that make it easier to absorb information and identify data trends. In addition to visualizations, we develop analytical platforms that retrieve, aggregate and process large data sets. Our services run on dedicated Linux servers and require stability, scalability and speed.

Search and Discoverability

The Search and Discoverability group builds a federated search and question-answering engine to ensure Bloomberg clients can find the right information as quickly as possible. We use open source search technologies and natural language query understanding to build an intuitive search functionality. Our platform searches millions of data points from dozens of structured and unstructured data stores and natural language question-answering engines.

Financial Data Infrastructure

The Financial Data Infrastructure group builds the next generation of infrastructure to take in large amounts of financial data. We use big data and cluster management technologies to achieve high performance, reliability and transparency. Current initiatives include: price history infrastructure to store and manage billions of historical time series data points; data pipeline to ensure transparent and accurate delivery and governance of data; data snapshot for real time access to thousands of data points about millions of securities; and, Bloomberg Query Language to provide a rich access and calculation layer on top of all Bloomberg data.

item.title: Data Architect at Blackbaud (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
Build a great career. Help the people that change the world.


Where else can you work alongside talented people, develop a rewarding career and create impactful tools for some of the world’s most successful and socially responsible nonprofits? It's not something you find every day. But we have it all: a growing, fast-paced software business, an environment where you can thrive professionally and the everyday reward of knowing that you’re part of a community that’s enabling meaningful change and we are immensely proud that our expertise is helping our 29,000+ customers accomplish their missions. They serve as a constant source of inspiration to us, and give purpose to our work.


Description:


We’ve got tons of data; you’ve got the skills make it useful. As a Data Architect on our Shared Services team, you will use your experience architecting, designing large-scale systems using Big Data technologies (e.g. BigTable, Hadoop, Cassandra) to help us design and build a highly reliable and highly scalable data platform to help us manage, analyze and productize vast amounts of non-profit data. The new platform will serve as the foundation both for a suite of new data services that enable our clients to deliver on their missions with increased efficiency and effectiveness, as well as for several existing data systems that we will be refactoring.


We work in small, close-knit agile teams. Our goal is to maintain an atmosphere that balances tough projects while still having fun. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to:



  • Work in a progressive, team-oriented, growth-driven environment where innovation is king

  • Nurture, grow or change the direction of your career map – we see the value in exploratory andconventional goals

  • Solve challenging problems with like minds to make the solutions a reality


Responsibilities:



  • Lead architecture/design, technology selection and implementation of a data platform over Big Data technologies

  • Drive innovation by exploring, investigating, recommending, benchmarking and implementing data-centric technologies for the platform

  • Contribute to the technical design efforts - ensuring the system design meets scalability andperformance requirements

  • Provide technical mentorship for junior engineers on new technologies and development techniques

  • Be the technical architect for our data platform.


About Us:



  • Modern office space with private balcony, comfortable seating and gas grill

  • Beautiful views of the Berkeley Marina and Golden Gate Bridge

  • Easily accessible by BART (via the free Emery-Go-Round shuttle), Amtrak and public transit

  • LEED-certified building (LEED-EB:O&M Silver rating)

item.title: Software Infrastructure Developer (C++) at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
We develop the core foundation on which Bloomberg developers build their applications - libraries that interface with a wide range of technologies, programmable real-time data-processing pipelines, deployment systems and development tools. We are technologists who live and breathe high-performance, well-factored, scalable, testable code which can react quickly to new business initiatives.

Our developers are valued as technical experts and go-to resources throughout the company. Our users, as well as our managers, are highly technical people. Within our group, all developers have responsibility for the full software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering through coding to deployment and maintenance.

More information on individual teams, technologies, and their products can be found below. You will have the ability to select the team you are interested in based on your preference or expertise.

Teams in Software Infrastructure:

Application Frameworks

UI Framework - We build and maintain an in-house real-time data-processing framework, which is used by over 3,000 developers to write high-quality, easy-to-use and efficient applications within the Bloomberg Terminal. We are responsible for extending the core libraries to support more varied, complex and scalable solutions, and enhancing the toolkit for application developers, such as adding tools for performance analysis, debugging, introspection and optimization.

Rapid Infrastructure - We produce the next generation of tools for enhancing developer productivity and the infrastructure behind the Bloomberg Terminal. We are responsible for creating software in C++ in both UNIX and Windows development environments. We work closely with other stakeholders to produce both the frameworks and tools used by all application developers to build and deploy their UI and applications.

Developer Experience

We are a team of technologists, engineers, evangelists and trainers charged with helping our developers deliver their best work. We are not afraid to make large investments to build our own tools when it will make us better able to outpace the competition. At the moment we work with Phabricator, Jenkins, DPKG, GitHub Enterprise, Coverity, Jira and anything that fills gaps and joins them together.

Market Data Distribution

API Technology - We are responsible for Bloomberg's data distribution infrastructure, which is the largest in the world, providing low-latency market-data and value added Bloomberg data via our open API (http://www.bloomberglabs.com/api/). We support scalable, distributed, high-performance software that provides mission-critical data delivery to all Bloomberg desktop customers and a large number of enterprise-level applications.

Market Data Systems - We build backend services and distribution infrastructure for Enterprise Solutions products such as, but not limited to, BPOD/B-PIPE (Bloomberg's consolidated real-time and reference data feed) and the rapidly expanding Event Driven Trading Feed (EDTF) business.

Systems Infrastructure

We build low-level UNIX infrastructure that is critical to Bloomberg's systems. Our areas of responsibility include: high volume, low latency realtime data distribution; enterprise wide software deployment systems; FIX connectivity; and PKI security services. As the rest of Bloomberg R&D fundamentally relies on our products, we have high standards for correctness, performance and scalability. We are a highly collaborative team who are passionate about building reliable systems to solve real world problems.

Ticker Plant

We develop real-time software for our high-profile system which sits at the core of the Bloomberg infrastructure. We process market data from around the world, driving the majority of downstream Bloomberg applications. We address the market demand for low-latency solutions by providing innovative software powered by the most comprehensive, timely and accurate financial data in the world. We work closely with multiple businesses and sales groups to design and develop our applications to satisfy ever-growing customer demands.

item.title: Backend Engineer at Grammarly (San Francisco, CA)

Summary


Grammarly is a bootstrapped, profitable company with millions of registered users. Grammarly’s automated proofreader helps the world’s 2 billion English speakers improve the quality of their writing.


We are looking for talented engineers who will have a big impact on our technical direction. You will join a company where risks and exploration are the norm. You will be part of a team that envisions, collaborates, designs, and develops highly scalable and highly available services to help writers around the world communicate more effectively.


As a Backend Engineer on the Grammarly Data Team, you will work on constructing the Grammarly analytical data pipeline using the coolest building blocks out there and effective creations of your own; build out our code metrics, log collection, and querying stack; and enable other teams building data pipelines for their services. Your ambition and skill will drive and impact our entire platform. If you want a big challenge, this is your next gig!


What You Will Accomplish



  • Build internal real-time analytical data acquire-attribute-aggregate pipeline using:


    • Spark & Spark Streaming, Reactive Streams

    • Cassandra

    • Kafka

    • Scala


  • Build a high-load, big-data, distributed, no-single-point-of-failure, horizontally-scalable, lambda-architecture app

  • Build extensible high-load APIs and client-side instrumentation tooling

  • Build querying and visualization layer on top of Looker, Tableau and custom web-app

  • Perform integration to loop the analytical insights back to Grammarly product

  • Relentlessly work to optimize performance and data processing

  • Help to improve our development cycle, including CI/CD, deployment, documentation, instrumentation, and monitoring processes

  • Become a member of an award-winning, amazing, driven, focused team which is disrupting the market.

item.title: Software Developer - Data Visuzalization and Analysis at Esri (Redlands, CA)
item.description:
Have you ever wanted to tell a simpler, yet impactful story with your analytic results? Combine your analysis expertise with your eye for design to create outstanding visual representations of data. Join the Analysis and Geoprocessing Team and help us build cutting-edge software and applications that enable ArcGIS users to ask questions, perform analysis, and effectively present their results.


Responsibilities:



  • Design, develop, and implement data visualization functionality to be used in conjunction with geospatial data across the ArcGIS platform

  • Enable ArcGIS users to better understand and communicate analysis results using interactive, informative, and attractive charts and graphs

  • Find, analyze, and fix bugs/performance problems whenever and wherever they occur in the software

  • Build and ship quality software by working effectively with members of other software development teams

item.title: Software Development Engineer - Big Data at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
Are you an engineer who wants to work for a strong and innovative online travel technology company? Do you have a passion for turning data into meaningful information? Does working on a world-class analytics platform backed by a cutting edge Big Data implementation scaling to hundreds of terabytes any interest? Do you want to work with (and learn how to use) the latest Big Data technologies in the Hadoop ecosystem? 

Expedia Inc. the largest Online Travel Agency is looking for an experienced, highly motivated, self-directed Software Development Engineer to join the Hotels.com technology team.  In this role you will be responsible for the delivery of solutions on top of the Hadoop big data platform and will play a key role in a huge technology pivot. This entails working with the delivery team and business partners to flesh out requirements, complete solution design, development and ultimate delivery to the end consumers.  Our team has experience using a wide range of technologies and many years of Hadoop experience so we guarantee that you won't be bored and will learn a lot. We are also constantly looking for ways to improve our development methodologies and welcome fresh ideas and approaches


Responsibilities



  • Develop various facets of the Hadoop EDW Java/Hadoop ecosystem

  • Write clear, efficient, tested code

  • Develop code as part of a wider team through pair programming and code reviews

  • Contribute to both program and system architecture

  • Evolve development standards and design patterns

  • Work with business stakeholders to flesh out and deliver on requirements in an agile manner

  • Deploy and maintain applications in production environments

  • Communicate and document solutions and design decisions.

item.title: Software Engineer, Distributed Data at BuzzFeed (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Company


BuzzFeed is the social news and entertainment company, providing the most shareable breaking news, original reporting, entertainment, and video across the social web to our global audience of more than 200M. BuzzFeed is also redefining online advertising with social, content-driven publishing technology.


BuzzFeed is headquartered in New York City, with additional offices in 16 cities in 10 countries across the world.


The Job


As a software engineer sitting with our Data Tribe, you’ll help build the next generation of data tools. The ideal candidate shares our belief that the right tools and data can empower our editors and producers to do amazing things they didn’t previously think possible. The overall mission of the team is helping the company learn how content works and performs no matter how it lives; you’ll be building flexible systems to support that. Because we produce content for a social web, you’ll build out integrations with external platforms to assist in data collection, build flexible systems to support all the different ways we can categorize/organize content, and develop and maintain tools for unifying and communicating data for audiences across the company.


You



  • have technical proficiency in Python or other high-level OO languages

  • have experience with external platforms APIs (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube)

  • are familiar with various DBs (mySQL, Redis, Mongo)

  • value reliability and simplicity over performance

  • value UX and craft elegant and intuitive interfaces

  • identify opportunities to automate and build tools to make your team’s lives easier


What you get in return



  • A competitive compensation package (including equity) and benefits that start on day one

  • A collaborative & close-knit team: our team is NYC-based and in the office because as great as technology is, there are few substitutes for in-person collaboration

  • Top of the line equipment and an office stocked with plentiful snacks, coffee, drinks and more

  • A company that takes its work seriously, while taking ourselves not-so-seriously

item.title: DevOps Ninja at 4th Down Software (San Diego, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Are you looking to utilize your current skill set and to grow/enhance your capabilities working with a software-focused team that is building industry-leading technology?



4th Down is seeking a bright, self-motivated DevOps Engineer who is a “jack of all trades” with experience in system administration, analytics and software development. If you enjoy solving problems, influencing system design and implementing the latest and greatest technology and techniques, then here’s what you’ll be doing:

item.title: Big Data Engineer: real-time video sharing at Grabyo (London, UK)
item.description:
If you like working with emerging tech in a start-up environment, then you'll fit right in. We build an innovative platform to power real-time social video sharing for clients like BSkyB, ITV, Channel 5, Wimbledon, NHL, Formula-e and many more.


Responsibilities



  • Be social and have fun. Office culture is important to us. We work in small teams to create and develop new products and features continuously.

  • Data Engineer – you love big data and have an in depth knowledge of how to navigate around it.

  • Taking ownership of the entirety of data on the platform – process multiple sources of social video data for real-time analytics and prediction / performance modelling.

  • Write modern code for a modern platform. Cloud programming (AWS). Big Data. NoSQL. MapReduce. API orientated. Scalability.

  • Problem solving. Complex problems, smart solutions.

  • Ownership. Your products.

  • Some examples of #whatwedo: java, rest, dynamodb (nosql), redshift (sql), kinesis (streaming), emr (hadoop), spark, elasticsearch, redis

item.title: Senior C++ Developer at Sisense (Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel)
item.description:
We are Sisense. We disrupt the Business Intelligence market. Our product allows business users to analyze humongous amounts of data without being experts and without help from IT. How? By building on a set of unique and cutting edge technologies, wrapped up in a killer product. We are looking for talented C/C++ engineer to be part of our core technology team. 


As an engineer in Sisense, you will be part of the team developing the core of our Big Data Analytics Columnar Database, ElastiCube.
ElastiCube is an award winning database with an advanced query execution engine.


You will develop and improve advanced features/technologies including:



  • Big Data transformation engine (TB scale).

  • Multidimensional queries (advanced analytics)

  • Cache-oblivious algorithms.

  • Superscalar decompression.

  • In-chip vectorization.

  • Parallel I/O.

item.title: Data Scientist at Feedzai (Lisbon, Portugal)
item.description:
We are looking for data scientists with as much skill as passion and large amounts of both! Come and help us disrupt the hot hot market of digital payments and online fraud prevention!


You will be working in a cross-functional team where you will be able to tackle complex fraud detection problems and where your main responsibilities will be:



  • Work close with our product development team and with other R&D team members in thorny fraud detection problems.

  • Support your answers and findings with appropriate statistical techniques and methods.

  • Contribute to the team knowledge by keeping up with the state-of-the-art in machine learning applied to our domains.

  • Communicate findings within the organization, particularly the management, product and delivery teams.

  • Develop solution prototypes and help integrate them with the product.


What we offer:



  • Career growth and ninja skills over a set of emerging technologies and tools such as Spark, Scala, Hadoop, Cassandra, R, Weka, and more.

  • Independence to choose preferred tools and techniques to solve problems and minimize time-to-completion.

  • Become a member of an award-winning, amazing, driven, focused team which is disrupting the market.

  • Relaxed working environment in Lisbon, Europe’s Leading City Break Destination city.

item.title: Analytics Platform Developer at nModal Solutions Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
We are looking for an outstanding Developer to help us build the next phase of our platform- someone who writes great code fast and wants to be involved in creating fantastic software and getting it to market quickly.  There aren't any layers of management here- you will be working directly with the founder and CEO, and will be a core part of the team.


Your mission is to build new connectors to state of art data APIs as well as enhance the nModal cloud data platform.  


You will get a chance to build at scale with the Azure platform, and integrate with technologies such as Tableau Software, Google BigQuery, Amazon Redshift and others. 


We work on a fast release schedule, whether it is to implement incremental enhancements or launching something new by desiging and building a minimum viable product and geting it into the hands of beta testers and customers quickly.


This is a contract position, 5 months to start, with the potential for a permanent position as a core member of the development team.

item.title: Report Developer/Product Analyst at Spoonflower (Durham, NC)
item.description:
If you haven’t heard yet, Spoonflower is an e-commerce-based business that makes it possible for individuals to design, print and sell their own fabric, wallpaper, or gift wrap.  Printed to order, no quantity is too small or too large. We digitally print all of our fabric at our  facility in Durham, North Carolina.  We love what we do.  Surface design aficionados, fabric lovers, internet geeks, DIYers, designers, sewists, and quilters call it home.



As a Report Developer/Product Analyst within our Product Development department, we will look to you to collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather, analyze and document reporting requirements to meet business needs.  The Report Developer is expected to translate business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports and dashboards, potentially created from multiple data sources.  Our reporting environment is a custom web application with Ruby on Rails, DataTables.net, Google Visualization, D3, and other components. If you have full stack development experience, but you favor writing complex SQL over all other disciplines in the stack, we are looking for you.


Job Responsibilities:



  • Write and understand complex SQL routines that perform well on large volumes of data

  • Use data mining, segmentation, and other analytical techniques to capture important trends

  • Demonstrate expertise in data extraction, transformation and loading (ETL) between similar and dissimilar systems using SQL Programming

  • Demonstrate expertise of data transformation between flat files, XML and relational system structures

  • Employ analytic skills to create hypotheses and share stories about what the data is telling us

item.title: Software Engineer - Hotel Data Management at trivago GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
For our headquarters in Dusseldorf, Germany, we’re looking for an experienced developer to manage and further improve our core hotel data. We want someone to increase the amount and quality of metadata we have by analysing, investigating and interpreting data delivered by our partners and match these to our hotel data. If you have experience with fuzzy string matching, utilizing text retrieval, machine learning and other optimization techniques, and are confident tackling over 700,000 hotels worth of data then we want to hear from you!


Your tasks:



  • Evaluate partners’ datasets for potential inclusion into the trivago hotel search.

  • Develop and optimize intelligent algorithms to determine matching of entities in 31 languages.

  • Leverage big data and machine learning techniques to improve our automated matching process.

  • Improve the overall quality of our hotel information by developing systems that reduce the risk of duplicate data. We encourage thinking outside the box!

  • Experiment with our cutting edge technologies to investigate and correct anomalies within the data.

  • Analyse and improve efficiency, scalability and stability of our current processes by taking them apart and rebuilding them in your own innovative way.

  • Become the technical interface for our content-related development teams and technical account managers and help them decipher all matching related issues.

item.title: Software Project Leader (m/f) at Harman Becker Automotive Systems GmbH (Karlsbad, Deutschland)
item.description:
Tasks:



  • Overall responsibility for the Software Project Management of an large-scale Infotainment project

  • Planning, prioritization and monitoring of all development and maintenance activities

  • SW Project organization, risk management and reporting (internal and to the customer)

  • Responsible for the Change Management process (incl. internal/external Change Control Boards)

  • Regular Meetings with the Customer for all aspects of the software development.



Our Offer:


Continue your career at Harman, one of the worldwide leaders in infotainment and car audio. We have been successfully doing business for decades and are proud to have all premium car manufacturers as clients. As a Harman employee, you will have the opportunity to actively shape the future and be an important part of Harman's success story. Our dynamic and international business offers you numerous opportunities to further develop and make an impact. Your knowledge and commitment will be rewarded with an attractive compensation package. HARMAN is an employer who values equal employment opportunities for both, women and men. Applications from qualified women are particularly welcome.

item.title: Frontend engineer (Javascript) at Canva (Sydney, Australia)
item.description:
At Canva, we work to make a significant positive impact on society. Our mission is to democratise design.

Since launch in April 2013 we have grown exponentially, and the journey has only just begun. Join Canva, and be part of this adventure. We are one of the world’s fastest growing startups.

Your colleagues, like you, will be the top of the industry. We mean it, when we say it is important to us that we create a workplace that you love coming to.

Our culture is unlike anywhere else and our offices are designed and constantly improved to let you do great work.

At Canva you can be part of a company that is growing rapidly, building a product that users really love. Just check out our Twitter stream.

Engineering is a core part of who we are. We work hard to have a best of breed engineering culture. You will work with a carefully selected team of ex-Google, VMware, ThoughtWorks, and Atlassian engineers. Foremost; the engineering team takes pride in it’s focus and prioritisation around engineering fundamentals. The team strives to use the most appropriate tools for the tasks at hand, and to strike a measured balance between getting things done and long term maintainability. The team is tight, with no big egos, and welcome self-driven engineers to come and join in on the adventure.

item.title: Software Engineer - Big Data Java Developer at Rubicon Project (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Rubicon Project has engineered one of the largest real-time cloud and Big Data computing systems.  We are looking for great engineers to build high performance, high scale backend systems to take on trillions of transactions without breaking a sweat.


In this team, you will be working on Rubicon Project’s high performance real-time bidding platform. You will be working on big data solution using Java 8, Apache Spark, Hadoop, and Kafka and apply principles of Reactive Programming to build mission-critical systems at scale.

item.title: Data Migration Engineer (PHP, MySQL) at Vanilla Forums (Montréal, QC, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
anilla is looking for a hard working individual who wants to join a profitable and rapidly growing SaaS startup. We have the best forum product on the market, an incredible list of customers to match, and we're looking for someone to help us migrate customers from legacy platforms to Vanilla.


Preference will be given to candidates in Montreal. Remote work in the US or Canada will be considered for the right candidate.


Responsibilities:



  • Migrate data from legacy forum products such as vBulletin to Vanilla

  • Export data using APIs

  • Maintain and develop the Vanilla Porter migration tool

  • Create new tools to automate repetitive migration tasks

  • Troubleshoot migration issues, often after hours

item.title: Projektleiter/in Internet of Things für Big Data Analytics at Festool (Wendlingen, Deutschland)
item.description:
• Leitung von Projekten im Bereich Internet of Things (IoT)

  • Analyse und Auswertung großer Datenmengen zur Optimierung interner Prozesse

  • Entwicklung von neuen Datenauswertungen und -visualisierungen mit internen Kunden (z.B. Produktmanagement, Konstruktion, Versuch, Service oder Vertrieb)

  • Aufbau einer Big Data IoT-Plattform für Festool zur Speicherung, Analyse und Visualisierung großer Datenmengen

  • Nutzung und Erweiterung des persönlichen Netzwerks im Bereich IoT und Big Data (z.B. auf internationalen Konferenzen)

item.title: Forward Deployed Engineer at Jut, Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We’ve built an incredibly powerful analytics platform and need to make sure users are tapping into this power to maximizes Jut’s impact in their organization.


This is a technical customer facing role where your coding, scripting and product expertise will be a key factor in customer success.

item.title: Help Desk/Junior Systems Engineer at Factual (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Factual is looking for a Junior-level Help Desk/Systems Engineer to help handle the management and growth of our cloud and internal computing and network infrastructure.  We're a technical group of people working in a relaxed environment with various demanding infrastructure needs.  There's almost no 24/7 component to this job but there are a lot of machines and systems to keep configured and happy and we have a very high standard of careful, detail-oriented, responsive professionalism.


Responsibilities:



  • Maintain computing and networking infrastructure.

  • Share support burden for mostly technical internal staff

  • Repair and recover from hardware or software failures

  • Devops and automation of internal and production infrastructure

  • System/network monitoring & troubleshooting

  • Participate in on-call rotation duties

item.title: Backend Services Software Engineer at Bedrock Analytics Corporation (Oakland, CA)
item.description:
Bedrock Analytics is looking for exceptional engineers with strong Java, Scala, and/or Python skills and a well-rounded background in computer science. You should have a proven track record of delivering robust, high-availability services and understand the ins and outs of scalable data processing and analytics. You can envision the way a system works end-to-end and how the services that compose it work together, and you enjoy creating new and effective software. You are interested in the different ways data can be organized, analyzed, and visualized to make effective use of the insights it contains.


You like working in an Agile best-practices environment. You understand the importance of testable, modular, efficient code, so that's what you write. Ideally, you will have been building cloud-based systems with a similar DevOps stack to ours – AWS, Chef, etc.


A few of the fun problems we're working on:



  • Predictive Insights and Recommendations

  • Data-Driven Stories

  • Microservice-based Analytics

  • Machine-Learning-Augmented Data Processing

item.title: Scientific Software Developers at D. E. Shaw Research at D. E. Shaw Research (New York, NY)
item.description:
Extraordinarily gifted software developers are sought to join a New York–based interdisciplinary research group pursuing an ambitious, long-term project aimed in part at fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.  Among the group’s current research activities is the development of new algorithms and software for large-scale data analysis and simulation both on commodity clusters and on massively parallel special-purpose supercomputers of our group’s design.

Particularly relevant areas of expertise might include computational biology, Python and C/C++ programming, molecular dynamics, scientific visualization, computer graphics, full-stack web development, scientific workflow management, high performance data-parallel computing on multicore and GPU architectures, and the development of large-scale data management, cheminformatics, and/or analysis frameworks, but specific knowledge of any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability and a demonstrated track record of achievement.

If you are interested in being part of a team of the world’s leading biologists, chemists, and computer scientists, please use the link below to submit your application material.  We are prepared to reward exceptionally well-qualified individuals with above-market compensation.

To submit an application, please use the link provided below: 
http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Ads/StackOverflow/JrSP

D. E. Shaw Research is committed to building a diverse team. We offer an intellectually rigorous and stimulating work environment that is also supportive, flexible, and welcoming. We do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

item.title: Devops @ San Diego Patient Centered Web App at VisionTree Software (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
This is a sys admin / devops class job.



  • Manage our postgres db cluster software

  • Manage backups

  • Manage system updates

  • Work with developers on supporting the application from the system level to the application code

  • Document your work

  • Provide original research and guidance for future upgrades/plans


This is a contract position and compensation is variable based on experience and hours desired.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Microsoft - Visual Studio Online (Redmond, WA)
item.description:
Become a key member of the Visual Studio Cloud Services (VSCS) development team led by Brian Harry and build the next generation of development tools and services in the cloud! Visual Studio Online’s goal is to become the single place for all developer targeted services - for both the internal One Microsoft Engineering System and for customers. It provides software development teams with capabilities of project planning, work item management, version control, build automation, test lab management, elastic load test, Application Insights and more. We ship new features every 3 weeks at http://www.visualstudio.com   and our adoption is growing at a very rapid clip. Ultimately, our audience is Engineers like YOU! Come onboard to build one of the most mission-critical services that will set the tone for all future engineering practices - inside Microsoft and outside in the developer community!


VS Online makes use of a wide range of technologies on premise and in the cloud, so you’ll have the opportunity to learn new stuff and go deep in many domains. Our key technologies are Azure, SQL Azure, AAD, and ASP.NET MVC on the backend. On the front end we use Knockout to build out an awesome user experience on the web, WPF for VS, and SWT for Eclipse.


The Shared Cloud Services team (which is part of VSCS) owns delivering all of the core platform services including Account, Identity, Profile, Licensing, Billing & Subscriptions, and Customer Acquisition & Engagement to VSO services. Our problem-space is platform-centric and systems-engineering centric with design challenges around scale, performance, and security and API design. We are looking for a seasoned engineer who can contribute to the Customer Acquisition & Engagement team. This team is chartered with increasing the funnel of adoption for VSO services all the way into converting users into broader and deeper usage of VSO capabilities. The team owns both the user experiences as well as the backend services needed to drive broader customer engagement. In this role, you will be contributing to the engineering efforts owning design, implementation, testing deployment and live site support for multiple backend services and user experiences. You will architect backend services and the corresponding user experiences and work with other teams across VSCS, Azure, AAD and DevDiv to ensure that the components plug in well with the overall architecture. You are expected to drive the technology strategy and be proficient with the technology stack (Web Services, REST, SQL, JavaScript and jQuery) and own the testing strategy for the components. You will be working on ambiguous and open ended problems, drive long-term architecture and partner with team members to deliver innovative and exciting customer experiences.


Key Responsibilities:


Implement complex features and components and support them at scale


Contribute to the DevOps lifecycle for Customer Acquisition & Engagement team


Improve technical excellence by evaluating, defining and evangelizing engineering best practices.


Collaborate with teams across Microsoft.

item.title: Software Engineer (C++) at Granta Design Limited (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our talented development team working on innovative applications for our flagship GRANTA MI: Materials Gateway product, which links the CAD, CAE & PLM systems used by thousands of designers and analysts to GRANTA MI, the leading system for materials information management.


What you will be doing:



  • Developing clean maintainable software, mainly with C++, but also in a range of other languages, including C#, Java, Python, and others.

  • You will be involved in all stages of the development lifecycle, from design and specification through development and quality.

  • You will be responsible for ensuring that the Gateway platform products are developed and maintained to a high standard, working closely within the team and with the Product Manager.

  • You will be proactive, bringing your ideas and creativity to bear on our product development process.


Some special attractions of the job:



  • The opportunity to work within a talented team using the latest technologies.

  • Developing solutions for world leading companies.

  • The chance to make a real contribution, focus on your areas of interest and broaden your skills.

  • The opportunity to be actively involved in development.

  • May be particularly exciting to those with an interest in science or engineering, especially materials.


Career development


We value our people and work hard to create an environment which rewards positivity and supports personal and professional development. As part of this commitment we provide a tailored induction plan, regular reviews and excellent opportunities for progression.


This role offers excellent development potential, with the opportunity to improve your development skills across a broad range of technologies and practices. You could progress to a technical or team lead role in the future.


What we can offer you:



  • Competitive salary.

  • A 12.5% non-contributory pension scheme.

  • Share Options.

  • Healthcare or gym membership.

  • Flexible working hours.

item.title: Senior Software Scientist at GrammaTech, Inc. (Madison, WI) (allows remote)
item.description:
We have offices in Ithaca, NY and Madison, WI — but will consider remote employees when there is a strong match of skills and experience. Please reference job #RR11-01



Innovation is at the heart of GrammaTech. We are constantly pushing the boundaries of software research and development – from software assurance and software integrity to cyber-security threat mitigation and autonomic computing. 



GrammaTech was founded 26 years ago, with a firmly-grounded purpose to help organizations develop tomorrow’s software.  Given the ever-increasing dependence of software in today’s connected world, our staff is able to focus on the most challenging software issues through a constant stream of highly innovative research and commercial development programs – focused on the evolving cyber security landscape, software hardening and intelligent systems.  Within these projects, GrammaTech employees have the opportunity to work with industry, academic, and government experts, significantly advancing their skills in engineering, research, marketing, or sales.



So, do you want to have an opportunity to work with software assurance experts?  Have the ability to publish and further your software engineering skills in cyber security?  Work alongside some of the most cutting edge research and engineering teams?



GrammaTech's engineering teams work on the software challenges of the future within a culturally rich environment and great career growth opportunities.








Responsibilities:



The primary responsibility is to design and implement research prototypes based on ideas drawn from academic literature and original research. Team size varies from project to project. On small projects, a scientist may implement a significant portion of the prototype, while on larger projects they will lead a team of engineers. Our scientists are expected to:



  • Generate ideas for innovative solutions (original or drawn from the literature) that address needs identified by research sponsors. Write proposals for research contracts.

  • Translate research ideas into working prototypes.

  • Manage engineers implementing research prototypes: identify risks, plan work, monitor progress, review designs and code used in prototypes. Adapt your plan as you learn more about the sponsor’s needs and the benefits/deficiencies of the prototype.

  • Document research results in written reports. Present results in person at meetings with research sponsors.

  • Work with research sponsors to ensure success of any demonstrations or evaluations of the research prototype.

  • Collaborate with product and marketing team to identify a strategy to turn the research prototype into a marketable product.

item.title: Software Engineer - Core Java at OptionsCity Software (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Join us as a Software Engineer - Core Java


At OptionsCity, we partner with financial institutions to streamline their trading operations by providing services and tools including pricing, risk management, execution, and automated trading systems. Our vision is to change the way trading professionals think about and utilize technology.


The OptionsCity development team follows Agile Software Development principles to produce state-of-the-art software designed for the professional trading community. Using OOP/OOD, OptionsCity provides market data and order routing capabilities that power our state-of-the-art market making, trading, and risk applications. As a member of this team you will be a key contributor to maintaining existing applications, improving core technology, and creating new software to expand OptionsCity’s coverage of global asset classes and solutions required to support them.


Other responsibilities including contributing to the existing automated testing frameworks for new and existing implementations as well as assisting support staff in any escalated production cases.


What you’ll be doing:



  • Work on the business-level services provided by our platform, from market making, opportunity identification, pricing, risk management, order and trade management, to exchange connectivity

  • Work on the core services exposed by our platform, like threading, persistence, messaging

  • Contribute to the entire ecosystem: Metro, Freeway, API’s

  • Push the platform forward from a quality and performance point of view through systematic refactoring

  • Actively participate in discussions around design, architecture, and problem solving

  • Work closely with Dev-Ops for configuration, automation and deployment

  • Participate in application testing to ensure high quality software

  • Provide development support to second level support team

  • Participate in agile related meetings to plan, assess and improve the development process


What we’re offering:



  • The opportunity to change the way trading professionals think about and utilize technology 

  • Technology-­driven company, founded by software developers

  • The opportunity to make an immediate impact in an open, merit­-based environment

  • Small tech team of 20 gives you direct access to CTO

  • Agile methodology (Scrum)

  • Work on all aspects of our trading systems including high ­performance, multi-­threading, real­time kernels, etc.

  • Work within a development organization from which you are expected to learn and which expects to learn from you

  • Open-­ended career path

  • Opportunity to learn about the options trading industry

  • Outstanding benefits: health, dental, vision, 401K, life, long term disability and commuter plans, Monday morning breakfasts, and lunch + beverages provided daily

  • Competitive salary + equity incentive

item.title: Senior Front End Developer Pioneering Business Forecasts at Intensity (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Intensity applies expertise in economics, data science, and machine learning to solve the most complex and challenging issues that organizations face in the competitive marketplace. We are seeking a senior level front-end developer to implement the technical design and development of web-based applications that deliver pioneering business forecasts and data visualizations. This position requires a can-do/will-do attitude, a love of coding, and a passion for solving challenging problems. The position is located in San Diego, California.



RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES:


Specific responsibilities and duties for the Senior Front End Developer include:



  • Implement the user interface technical design and development of enterprise-class, cloud-hosted, web applications

  • Write robust front-end code with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks and libraries

  • Develop rich, interactive data visualizations, including graphs, charts, and other dynamic features

  • Design and implement user authentication and security features

  • Collaborate with product managers, UI designers, and back-end developers to define functional requirements and translate them into technical requirements

  • Rapidly solve problems and fix bugs

  • Work with technology partners and vendors as required



QUALIFICATIONS


Qualifications for the Senior Front End Developer include:



  • Extensive experience building highly interactive web application interfaces

  • Deep expertise in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript MVC frameworks and libraries

  • Expertise designing and developing rich, interactive data visualizations

  • Strong understanding of web standards, cross-browser compatibility, responsive design, Bootstrap, CSS frameworks (LESS, Sass), and AJAX

  • Excellent understanding of database development, including basic data structures and algorithms

  • Experience with Agile processes, test-driven development, continuous build, and integration tools

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively

  • Problem solver and technology enthusiast

  • Creativity, innovation, and resourcefulness

  • Bachelors and/or Masters degree from a top university



PREFERRED


Preferred experiences and capabilities for the Senior Front End Developer include:



  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks (AngularJS, ReactJS, KnockoutJS, Backbone, etc.)

  • Experience with data visualization toolsets (D3)

  • Working knowledge of Java or Python, Ruby on Rails and/or PHP

item.title: Software Infrastructure C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Software Infrastructure department develops the foundation on which Bloomberg developers build their applications - libraries that interface with a wide range of technologies, programmable real-time data processing pipelines, deployment systems and development tools. We are technologists who live and breathe high performance, well-factored, scalable, testable code that reacts quickly to new business initiatives.

Our developers are valued as technical experts and go-to resources throughout the company. Our users and managers are highly technical people. Within our group, all developers have responsibility for the full software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering and coding to deployment and maintenance.


>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.


Ticker Plant

The Ticker Plant group is at the core of both the Bloomberg Professional Service and Enterprise Solutions products that process market data from around the world and drive the majority of downstream applications. The Ticker Plant system provides low latency processing of market data from around the world while servicing client queries from our cutting edge time series database. Our systems process billions of ticks a day and are highly fault tolerant and scalable. Our group researches and implements industry leading technologies such as high throughput time series database, low latency tick streams, and various efficient, robust and scalable components for Bloomberg's market data storage and distribution system.

Feeds Infrastructure

The Feeds Infrastructure group provides the platform that supports our feed handlers in processing market data from exchanges and contributors around the world. The platform consists of a high performance, reliable and scalable framework used to build and deploy these feed handlers and the host environment in which they run. The team provides solutions that can be reused across feed handlers to meet the market's quickly evolving demands. Our systems run 24/7 and require resiliency and seamless failover.

Feeds Infrastructure Applications

The Feeds Infrastructure Applications group builds an array of services used by feed handlers, Ticker Plant, the Enterprise product and terminal applications. The services facilitate the global distribution and processing of market data, system scalability and operational management of feeds. We solve some of the most critical feed and Ticker Plant software problems and provide the tools to manage these systems.

Data Distribution (API)

The Data Distribution group builds and maintains the largest global network in the world, spanning five continents. The infrastructure is built using state-of-the-art technologies to deliver low latency market data and news throughout the world via OpenAPI (www.openbloomberg.com/open-api). The group uses commodity software/hardware platforms to develop high performance C++ code and multithreading to achieve peak rates and optimize bandwidth and latency.

Application Framework

The Application Framework group builds the infrastructure and libraries used for developing applications at Bloomberg. This includes the application runtime environment, the UI toolkit exposed to developers, the client-side rendering engine and integration with real-time data. We are responsible for advancing the next generation of UI technology and giving our applications the advantages of the latest paradigms and features. Our group builds the tools for profiling and debugging applications and a custom IDE for developing them.

item.title: Software Engineer at Tuft & Needle (Phoenix, AZ)
item.description:
About the Tuft & Needle Engineering Team:
We view Tuft & Needle not as a mattress company that makes software, but as a software company that sells mattresses. We’re a small team of 3 passionate full-stack developers. We frequently seek out advice from each other and believe in continuous learning. We’re incredibly focused on results and don’t expect specific, regular hours in the office (we have a pretty sweet office though). Although sometimes we pair program, we aren’t religious about it. We believe process should be extracted from things that are working well. We aren’t philosophically against formal scrum sprints and stand-ups, but have found our team to work well without them so far.


Our Values:
Several months back, we sat down as an engineering team to decide on what our team values are that drive our decisions. The following are a few of these values to give a taste of what we believe as the Tuft & Needle engineering team.


- End-to-end ownership: Each project gets an Engineering owner that is responsible for the success of the project.


- Launch early and iterate: Done is better than perfect. Although we maintain a minimum standard of quality, we believe in getting value out of features and enhancements as soon as possible, while rapidly iterating.


- Do things that don’t scale: We believe that our software should automate existing manual processes to save time, rather than preempt potential needs to avoid building unnecessary software. Our litmus test for deciding on new features is “Has the team done this manually first?”. Of course, we’re pragmatic even about this value.


- Pragmatism: In a growing startup, our philosophy is that it’s important to be pragmatic. We are rarely dogmatic and use Judo moves to efficiently solve problems.


Our Technical Environment:
Our stack consists primarily of Ruby, Rails, Postgres, Mongo, Angular, CoffeeScript, HAML and SCSS running on Heroku. Our codebase has excellent test coverage and we have Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment. Refactor without fear and ship daily! We also believe in leveraging quality APIs and tools. We use and love Stripe, CircleCI, Segment, Heap Analytics and Optimizely.

item.title: Senior Front-End Engineer at Lawn Love (San Diego, CA)

Hi there!


We're Lawn Love, a new type of lawn care service. We are bringing software and smart operations to the very large, thoroughly antiquated lawn care market.


In this age of technology, why does getting a lawn quote still require multiple phone calls and an in-person visit? Why is payment still a cash-under-the-doormat sort of affair? If I can order a private car with the push of a button, why is yard care such a hassle?


That's what we're fixing. We're well funded by great investors (Y Combinator + others) and are growing quickly.


As an early engineering hire, you'll have broad ownership over the product and will help define our culture as a company.


Here's what you can expect from us:


- Great compensation and real ownership (both equity and over the product).


- We'll make your life easier with great benefits (full health coverage, open vacation, regular catered meals).


- New gear and whatever else you need to be productive.


We'd love to hear from you at jobs@lawnlove.com. Resumes are cool, but we're far more interested in seeing what you've built. :)

  • Develop and maintain ETL processes;

  • Manage data quality and consistency in the company data warehouse.

item.title: Sr Big Data Engineer at Time Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
The job:


In this role, you will be responsible for the delivery of solutions on top of the Hadoop big data platform implementation and playing a key role in this huge technology pivot. These solutions drive business value from powering the most critical business decisions to powering how the site behaves through various avenues of personalization. This entails working with the technology and business team and  partner to flesh out requirements, complete solution design, development and ultimate delivery to the end consumers.


You will:



  • Develop various facets of the Hadoop EDW ecosystem and Map Reduce jobs

  • Understand customer analytics needs, and translate them into pluggable Hadoop Hive UDFs/UDAFs

  • Evolve development standards and design patterns for overall EDW Hadoop-based Development

  • Prototype creative solutions quickly

  • Help other engineers get the most out of the platform you own

  • Provide timely and appropriate communication to business owners, stakeholders, and users on issue status and resolution

item.title: Lead Pipeline Developer - Animated Features at Animal Logic (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
Animal Logic, an award winning animation, visual effects and design studio is coming to Vancouver! ‘Cover your butts’ it’s The LEGO ® Movie Sequel!


We will be adapting our existing Lego pipeline to meet the creative requirements of several new films. Our global Pipeline team is responsible for creating software used by artists in craft departments such as Modelling, Rigging, Animation and Lighting, to assemble and manage complex workflows in a highly iterative pipeline.


We are looking for an experienced Lead Pipeline Developer to join the Pipeline team, working from our Vancouver studio.


As one of the first crew members in that facility, you will be pivotal in establishing the team, and will be involved in recruiting and mentoring. You will collaborate daily with production and technical personnel in both Vancouver and Sydney. You will also be involved in software design, reviewing code, and evolving development practices across multiple sites.


You will have experience in the visual effects/animation industry, and will ideally have previously lead small teams. You will have an excellent ability to communicate effectively with both technical and creative crew, and have demonstrated your capability to operate independently as well as within a larger team.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Microsoft - Visual Studio Online (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Become a key member of the Visual Studio Online Services development in Raleigh/Durham, NC and build the next generation of development tools in the cloud! This opportunity allows you to 1) work with the latest technologies, 2) work with and learn from some of the best engineers in the industry, and 3) have a big impact on the software development industry.


We're in the process of making significant improvements to the look, feel and performance of our web front end and are looking for talented web developers to help lead the charge in modernizing our web experiences.  Join our team and help deliver best-in-class workflows and experiences for developers just like yourself!


Visual Studio Online provides software development teams with version control, build automation, project and bug management, social engineering experiences and more. We use agile development methods and ship new features every three weeks to VisualStudioOnline.com, which is built on Azure and growing fast with 3M users already. 


VSO makes use of a wide range of technologies, so you’ll have the opportunity to learn new stuff from industry experts and go deep or broad. Our key technologies are C#, Azure, SQL, and ASP.NET including MVC and REST on the backend. On the front end we use jQuery, JavaScript and TypeScript to build out an awesome user experience on the web, WPF for VS, and SWT for Eclipse and IntelliJ. 


VSO is at the center of our cloud-based development experience. If you enjoy building software with a broad range of technologies and being part of a smart, agile team that’s making software development better, join the VSO team!


Key Responsibilities:


Implement complex features and components and support them at scale


Contribute to the DevOps lifecycle for Customer Acquisition & Engagement team


Improve technical excellence by evaluating, defining and evangelizing engineering best practices.


Collaborate with teams across Microsoft.

item.title: Software Developer @ Cloud-Based Behavioral Analytics Software Company at RedOwl (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
Do you love bringing data to life? We do, too. Our platform does statistical analysis on large datasets, and shows our users the results in beautiful, intuitive ways. We're focused on building the best threat detection application on the market. You'll work with a great team of engineers, data scientists, mathematicians, and product folks. We're good people, we love working together, and want you to feel the same way. If the above sounds like your kind of thing, we'd love to talk with you.


You're a RedOwl Developer if you can:



  1. Write exemplary code;

  2. Display an understanding of our system as a whole;

  3. Contribute to the quality of the platform while holding others to a high standard during code reviews, design meetings, and deliverables;

  4. Serve as a mentor to, and learn from, other RedOwl developers; 

  5. Contribute to the broader technical community via open source projects, writing, or presenting; and

  6. Identify and suggest new technologies that may make sense for our platform.

item.title: AngularJS / UI Developer at ScienceTRAX (Austin, TX)
item.description:
ScienceTRAX is looking for bright, energetic, entrepreneurial minded people who want to make a difference. Yes, we build software, but we build software that helps advance medical science. The challenge of applying technology to medicine is one that drives us and if it drives you, then this might be the right place for you.


We’re building data collection and analysis software to facilitate medical research.  Through the use of our web-based application, our customers collect patient information, send patient surveys, manage clinical trials and much more. Powerful data analytics is then used to find trends and correlations to turn the data into information that can then be used to improve patient care.


StudyTRAX prototyping is done using Balsamiq for Confluence.  As a developer, you will help develop and refine the prototypes and then implement them using AngulerJS. Being a small team, each developer makes a significant contribution to the product.  We are constantly evolving and updating our tools to keep up with the rapidly changing environment.


One big advantage to this job is that you will be working from home.  This allows for an extremely flexible working environment and it makes for a short commute :)

item.title: Director, Engineering at LegalZoom (Glendale, CA)
item.description:
LegalZoom runs on technology, and as dot com innovators, we look to technology to help us advance and optimize everything we do. Because of this, we rely on a backbone of committed tech superstars who make our site and software more stellar everyday.


What you’ll do:



  • Lead a team of developers supporting company’s overall mission and strategy

  • Provide guidance for team’s development activities

  • Contribute to the technical architecture strategy and emerging software development lifecycle practices

  • Evangelize agile approach to software development

  • Evaluate current staffing needs and effectively recruit to build out team as needed

  • Work team to ensure adherence to company’s guiding principles for software development

  • Work with stakeholders to design solutions

  • Develop and implement process improvements for engineering team

item.title: Front End Web Developer at Newforma (Manchester, NH)
item.description:
Do you love web development?  Do you dream about Javascript?  Does building a modern single-page web application that is put to use by architects, engineers, and contractors around the world sound like your idea of fun?


Newforma has a unique opportunity for a few talented developers to help us pick technology and define the architecture for our future products.  Successful candidates will work with a talented team of engineering veterans to rebuild existing applications as a modern cloud and mobile-based solution.


We are a leading provider of software for design and construction firms worldwide.  Creating software that makes a difference in the Architecture, Engineering, and Construction industries is what drives our company. If you have the drive, confidence and technical expertise required, we’d like to hear from you.

item.title: Tech Lead / VP Engineering at Mentimeter (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Build a globally scalable real-time platform as fast and as beautiful as possible.


Together with the CTO you are responsible for making a globally scalable real-time platform as fast and as beautiful as possible. We also expect that you to strive to improve the quality and effectiveness of the Tech team, together with your colleagues.


Day to day work includes moving the platform forward with technological improvements and the product by developing new features or improving existing.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at Metrigo Gmbh (Zalando SE) (Hamburg, Germany)

item.title: Mid-level Developer at Maritime Planning Associates (Newport, RI)
item.description: Maritime Planning Associates, a Veteran Owned Small Business, is seeking a Mid-level Developer to support the development of geospatially enabled decision aids and associated geospatial data and data management systems. This position will support programs either in the Newport, RI or Virginia Beach, VA regions. The successful candidate will be an independent, self-motivated programmer responsible for development and extension of code bases built primarily on Java programming. Successful candidate must have the ability to work efficiently, independently and meet hard deadlines.

item.title: Spark Developer at Cybraics, Inc. (Reston, VA)
item.description:
Essential Functions:



  • Research and design best fit solutions for environments



  • Write Java and/or Scala code for the Apache Spark framework



  • Write tests to validate and maintain the solutions



  • Evaluate data files and streams for use in the platform



  • Work within a highly technical team – contribute and collaborate
