item.title: Director of Engineering at 8tracks (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Do you feel there should be a better way for people to find and enjoy the limitless spectrum of music created by mankind, much of which is now available online in some form -- if you know where to look? Do you love 8tracks but think the product could be even better?

8tracks is the best place for people who care about music to create and consume playlists. Its crowd curated platform offers unprecedented depth and relevancy in a "lean back" fashion -- spanning every imaginable style, activity or mood -- and an unmatched opportunity for music discovery, with less repetition and a uniquely human touch.

8tracks ranks #3 in the US among internet radio listeners aged 18-34 (after Pandora and iHeartRadio) and reaches 8m MAU who stream 30m hours/month. Two-thirds of the music streamed on 8tracks hails from Independent artists and labels, and two-thirds of the music streamed is delivered to iOS and Android devices. Supported primarily by advertising sales, the business has operated at or near profitability for the last 3 years. Founded in 2008, 8tracks is backed by Index Ventures and Andreessen Horowitz, with offices in Mission Dolores (SF) and the Flatiron District (NYC).

We’re looking for an exceptional executive to lead the engineering team and work alongside the CEO and VP of Product to create the best online music experience.


Responsibilities



  • Keep our team of 9 engineers happy and productive

  • Oversee development of back-end infrastructure, iOS, Android, Web (Rails/Backbone) and analytics (Redshift)

  • Deliver consistent quality to the product team

item.title: Embedded Linux Software Engineers (m/w) at Zühlke Engineering GmbH (Eschborn, Deutschland)
item.description:
Zur Verstärkung unserer Teams in Eschborn (Frankfurt am Main), Stuttgart, Hannover und München suchen wir


Embedded Linux Software Engineers (m/w)


Ihre Tätigkeit


Sie arbeiten an der Umsetzung von strategischen Projekten als Softwareentwickler und übernehmen die Verantwortung für das Design und die Implementierung von eingebetteten Systemen – vom BSP und Treiber bis hin zur Applikation. Beginnend mit der Machbarkeitsanalyse über die Aufwandsabschätzung bis zur Projektarbeit bringen Sie Ihre Ideen ein und konstruieren funktionierende Lösungen.



Die enge Kooperation mit unseren Kunden aus unterschiedlichen Branchen, wie zum Beispiel Energiewirtschaft, Medizintechnik und Logistik ist dabei von entscheidender Bedeutung. Reisen innerhalb von Deutschland fallen bei Ihrer Tätigkeit an.

item.title: Testengineer forensische software at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Testengineer forensische software


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving



Ben jij dé testengineer voor onze forensische applicaties?



Je test forensische applicaties bij de groep Software Engineering van het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) en verbetert het testproces.



Als testengineer pas je zelfstandig testframeworks toe. Je past deze waar nodig aan en breidt ze uit. Je communiceert open en eerlijk, en bent niet bang om ons op onopgemerkte fouten te wijzen en het initiatief te nemen om deze adequaat op te lossen.



Voor het testen van applicaties maken we nu gebruik van JUnit, Mockito en JBehave. Deze testen maken deel uit van een continuous delivery proces dat is opgezet met Bamboo, waarbij vanuit de issue tracker (Jira) met 1 druk op de knop applicaties kunnen worden gebouwd, getest en uitgerold. Jij gaat dit proces verbeteren en doorvoeren.



Je ontwikkelt applicaties die binnen en buiten het NFI gebruikt worden voor opsporing en bewijsvoering. Denk aan een zoekmachine om in beslag genomen digitaal materiaal te doorzoeken, en aan software voor het detecteren van kleine afwijkingen in digitale foto's om de unieke camera te achterhalen. Doordat jij de kwaliteit van de software en het testproces verbetert, draag je bij aan de waarheidsvinding. Hiermee vervul je een belangrijke maatschappelijke rol.

item.title: Studio Engineering Director at ROBLOX (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
ROBLOX is the largest user-generated content site in video games. On the ROBLOX platform, developers from the user community create elaborate online multiplayer environments that anyone can explore and play. ROBLOX generates over 1.4 billion page views, 70 million total engagement hours each month, and is ranked #1 by comScore in the US for total engagement time with kids and teens. Our mission is to become the global leader in user-generated gaming and creation for all ages. Check out our latest news at blog.roblox.com.


Help us build the world's best user generated gaming platform. We are seeking a hands-on engineering director to lead our Studio Team in delivering a developer environment where millions of kids learn to build and write code. If you are interested in having high impact on a MMO game platform used by millions of players worldwide, we encourage you to apply.




  • Architect and manage the ROBLOX Studio product




  • Lead a team of talented engineers through hard, challenging problems




  • Iterate to make this product both easy to use and extremely powerful




  • Coordinate with other teams such as Product and Core Engine to deliver key platform features

item.title: Full-stack Software Developer at LiveStories (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
LiveStories is looking for a senior software engineer interested in making a difference. 


Responsibilities:



  • Develop software with Python/Pyramid, JavaScript, MongoDB, and ElasticSearch

  • Follow well-accepted coding and documentation practices

  • Write unit tests

  • Optimize application for scalability

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Government Intelligence Team at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
How does government influence finance? What government activities can move financial markets? Which companies benefit from government activities and which are negatively impacted?

The R&D News department is currently working on building brand new products to help financial professionals solve these questions.

The government intelligence team is looking for an enthusiastic, experienced software developer who can start contributing immediately to the success of this exciting new suite of products. A successful candidate should enjoy driving product development by collaborating closely with business stakeholders. The candidate will be tasked to solve a variety of technical problems including ingestion of large unstructured public datasets, discovering actionable data points to alert clients in real time, designing scalable, extensible search and database solutions to aid discoverability and analytics, and designing user interfaces to make sense of confusing government data for the busy financial professionals that make up our target client base.

item.title: Java Developer at Altamira Technologies (Chantilly, VA)
item.description:
Altamira is a top open source technology company in the national security space. Headquartered in McLean, Virginia, Altamira serves the defense, intelligence and homeland security communities by focusing on creating innovative solutions leveraging common standards in architecture, data and security.


If you would like to be part of an Agile software development group working on challenging, cutting-edge applications for our customers, send us your resume!  In this position you’ll be able to create software utilizing technologies such as: Hadoop, Accumulo, Apache Storm, RabbitMQ, OpenNLP, OpenCV, jQuery, AngularJS, D3.js, AWS and many more.


Position Description


We are looking for a software engineer to build scalable back-end features for an emerging open source Big Data analysis and visualization platform called Lumify.  This platform offers exciting challenges for processing various types of structured and unstructured data to create a top-notch distributed system.


If you’re a passionate engineer who enjoys working with talented peers in a result-oriented environment, check out the project at http://lumify.io and contact us to join our team!

item.title: Senior Web Application Software Engineer at Datto Inc (Norwalk, CT)
item.description:
Responsibilities:




  • Lead and mentor a talented team of developers to develop, design, and implement scalable and future-proof software solutions.

  • Enhance the company’s internal and client facing web portals.

  • Solve interesting and challenging problems from refactoring to design and testing.

  • Audit, evaluate, and refactor existing legacy code.

  • Participate in a fast-paced agile software development lifecycle.

item.title: Development Data Team Lead at Markit (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
• You will be creating and leading a medium sized, focused team, supporting the data needs of our UI Development team across a variety of clients

  • You have proven success in establishing and growing high performance teams focused on delivering high quality software on time and on budget

  • You have a solid understanding of web development and an in-depth understanding of API development and best practices

  • You fully believe in documentation and building exactly to spec

  • You understand how to build reusable components that have the flexibility to meet multiple clients’ needs


Web Development Culture


We pride ourselves in having a large community of developers who actively support each other through open dialogue and brain storming. We love to solve problems quickly and elegantly while keeping the codebase maintainable and lean. We value a collaborative environment where ideas are valued and exchanged not only through our technology, but together in person, using tools like 50-foot whiteboards, and lots of sticky notes to map out and create sites, apps and tools that help people understand complex information.


What you will do and learn



  • Engineer and maintain high traffic, highly visibility APIs for the world’s largest financial firms and media outlets. (We received 5 billion hits last month).

  • Gain exposure to the stock market and other financial data, while developing APIs that deliver dynamic information from a variety of sources.

  • Use proprietary technologies and standard best practices to build and deliver high performance APIs.

item.title: Android Developer at Gravy (Leesburg, VA)
item.description:
Gravy is a four year-old technology company poised to disrupt the world of consumer insights. The company has a unique, proprietary platform that captures and leverages rich data on local events and venues. Through its SDK and API, the company combines this data with mobile consumer behavioral data to drive consumer segmentation and activation. Gravy uses this powerful combination of location and behavioral data to create profiles that our clients use to execute pinpoint targeting of experiences and messaging to drive local store visits and retail sales results. Gravy is currently partnering with leading media, retail, and hospitality companies to increase engagement, activation and sales.







Position Summary






We are seeking a qualified Android developer to join our mobile development team. This developer will work on new features for existing apps as well as entirely new apps as part of a capable and fun team spanning many technologies.


The successful candidate will have a teamwork orientation and commitment to developing high-quality code. You will be a self-starter capable of breaking down complex tasks on your own and asking good questions when you encounter ambiguous requirements.

item.title: Entwickler Data Warehouse / Informatica und Oracle PL/SQL (m/w) at DekaBank Deutsche Girozentrale (Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland)
item.description:
Die DekaBank ist das Wertpapierhaus der Sparkassen, gemeinsam mit ihren Tochtergesellschaften bildet sie die Deka-Gruppe. Mit unseren vier Geschäftsfeldern – Wertpapiere, Immobilien, Kapitalmarkt und Finanzierungen – sind wir Partner der Sparkassen in der Vermögensanlage und -verwaltung. Dies umfasst nicht nur Produkte wie Investmentfonds und Zertifikate, sondern auch Asset-Management- und Bank-Dienstleistungen rund ums Wertpapier. Dabei werden die Geschäftsfelder vom Sparkassenvertrieb und insgesamt 13 Zentralbereichen unterstützt.


Entwickler Data Warehouse / Informatica und Oracle PL/SQL (m/w)
Ref.-Nr.: 5003 1530, in Frankfurt, Vollzeit- oder Teilzeittätigkeit möglich


Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Entwickler im Rahmen der Anwendungsbetreuung für Data Warehouse, Schnittstellen und ETL-Workflows

  • Erarbeitung von Lösungen sowie deren Implementierung, Test und Deployment auf Basis von Oracle, Informatica und PL / SQL

  • Durchführung laufender Performance-, Optimierungs- und Pflegemaßnahmen

  • Management von internen und externen Datenschnittstellen und Abstimmung mit Schnittstellenpartnern

  • Beratung und Betreuung interner Kunden


Ihr Profil:



  • Fundierte Kenntnisse im Design und in der Entwicklung von komplexen Datenbanken oder Data-Warehouses

  • Expertenkenntnisse in ETL-Tools, vorzugsweise Informatica PowerCenter sowie in PL / SQL

  • Idealerweise Erfahrungen im KAG- oder Wertpapiergeschäft


Sie arbeiten gerne im Team und zeichnen sich durch eine strukturierte und selbstständige Arbeitsweise aus. Neben einer ausgeprägten Kommunikationsstärke besitzen Sie gute analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten. Dank Ihrer zielorientierten Arbeitsweise sind Sie in der Lage, in einem komplexen Systemumfeld effizient und reibungsfrei zu agieren. Ein hohes Maß an Verantwortung, Flexibilität und Belastbarkeit setzen wir voraus.


Freuen Sie sich auf ein attraktives Umfeld:
Wir bieten Ihnen einen modernen Arbeitsplatz sowie ein leistungsorientiertes Einkommen mit zahlreichen Nebenleistungen. Dazu gehört auch eine Vielzahl von Angeboten, um den vielfältigen Anforderungen von Beruf und Familie gerecht zu werden – vom Deka Health Center bis zur Kinderbetreuung.

Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Onlinebewerbung! Weitere Infos rund um Ihre Karriere bei der Deka-Gruppe finden Sie auf www.dekabank.de/karriere. Bei Rückfragen steht Ihnen unsere Bewerberbetreuung unter (0 69) 71 47 - 39 99 gerne zur Verfügung.


Die Deka-Gruppe strebt eine Erhöhung des Frauenanteils an. Daher werden Frauen
– bei gleichwertiger Qualifikation – für diese Stelle bevorzugt eingestellt.

item.title: Data Engineer at Clover Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Clover Health is driving down costs and producing improved health outcomes with a unique health insurance plan. We use sophisticated analytics and custom software to direct our own clinical staff to proactively fill in gaps in the care of our members. We have a proven model we're scaling out.


We're focusing on elderly and low-income patients that stand to benefit from our model the most. This puts us in a position to make a major dent in healthcare expense in the United States and reverse an unsustainable, decades-long spending trend.


We are looking for a Data Engineer that embodies our values to join our team revolutionizing healthcare.

item.title: Developer/Project Manager at Personal BlackBox (New York, NY)
item.description:
Personal BlackBox is looking for a Project Manager who can lead a world-class team in agile development efforts.


A key contributor to our rapidly growing business, the Project Manager will be an integral member of our development team, responsible for full lifecycle execution on products – leading, developing, implementing and supporting enhancements for our applications. The ideal candidate is a results-oriented leader who is data driven, can prioritize well, and can communicate clearly with a talented team.


Key Responsibilities include:



  • Contribute to software design and architecture discussions, product development, and customer proposals

  • Lead project scoping efforts to perform project-level estimates and priorities, and track project budget, timelines, and resources utilization

  • Work with technology team on the prioritization, solution creation, and achievement of business goals

  • Provide work direction, project status, and feedback to all team members and assist in issue resolution

  • Identify and track risks and opportunities for project deliverables. Escalate risks to plan as required.

  • Ensure high quality deliverables are produced while working within budget and meeting deadlines

  • Demonstrate project deliverables and present to technical and non-technical audiences

  • Champion an enthusiastic, empowered, diverse, rewarding, and synergistic team environment

  • Lead and ensure team compliance of development processes, tools, and controls

item.title: Frontend Developer - Meteor / Javascript - FinTech Startup at Ldger Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
We're seeking front-end javascript developers to join our intimate NYC-based team to build our next generation platform for new exiting financial products.


We use - and love - Meteor as App platform, which gives us reactivity and “database everywhere” as well as a unified environment. 


You will help design and develop our financial service platform for AltFi products - allowing customers to model and execute exciting complex financial models. This includes analyzing and modeling financial data, data visualization and exporting results.


Our backend micro services are built in Node.js , integrating nicely with Meteor.

item.title: Associate Developer at Finsight (Juneau, AK)
item.description:
This opening is for an associate developer to participate in a range of projects spanning from


enterprise systems for fisheries management to data collection and research software using a wide


variety of technologies. This position requires strong time management skills to be successful on


multiple projects simultaneously. The ideal candidate will have demonstrable experience building


applications in either Java or C#. The successful candidate will report to a technical project manager


and will participate in 2-4 person teams, and be expected to engage on site with clients regularly.


Compensation for this full-time salaried position will depend on experience, and will include health


insurance benefits and paid vacation time. The job must be performed on site in Juneau, AK. Travel,


housing, and/or relocation support are negotiable. We are not able to offer H1 visa sponsorship for


this position.

item.title: Android Developer at Angaza (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Angaza builds technology to solve global energy poverty: we enable financing of solar energy solutions for off-grid consumers. To do so, Angaza develops a mix of custom hardware and software for some of the most demanding and dynamic markets in the world, including Africa and India. We are a for-profit company, based in California and Kenya, that aims market forces at the linked crises of climate change and global development.


If you join the five-person technical team in San Francisco, you will take our Android application to the next level. This application enables partners and consumers across Africa and India to access and manage solar energy products, and is the key customer-facing component in the Angaza platform. You will overcome significant technical challenges, from implementing intuitive abstractions for first-time smartphone users to handling real-time connectivity with limited resources in harsh network environments. You will work closely with the rest of the engineering team.

item.title: Frontend Developer at Angaza (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Angaza builds technology to solve global energy poverty: we enable financing of solar energy solutions for off-grid consumers. To do so, Angaza develops a mix of custom hardware and software for some of the most demanding and dynamic markets in the world, including Africa and India. We are a for-profit company, based in California and Kenya, that aims market forces at the linked challenges of climate change and global development.


If you join the five-person technical team in San Francisco, you will focus on frontend development, and will have numerous opportunities to become involved throughout our technology stack if you choose. Your focus in frontend development will be on delivering features and leading the technical direction for the single-page application used by our customers every day. Interesting technical challenges abound, including real-time interaction, low-connectivity environments, hypermedia APIs, and visual communication across languages and cultures. You will become a core member of the engineering team.

item.title: Senior Software Developer at StartJG (Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong)
item.description:
You'll be responsible for developing the framework and foundation for forward-looking interactive experiences that span the virtual and physical realms.


We value building a culture with strong engineering values and goals because we think this is crucial to creating a great company and product. We believe in building things "right" the first time!

item.title: Scrum Master at petaFuel GmbH (Freising, Deutschland)
item.description:
Die petaFuel GmbH sucht zum 01.11.2015 einen dynamischen Mitarbeiter, der Spaß daran hat, die Verantwortung für den Scrum-Prozess zu übernehmen.


Vor einiger Zeit wurde der Prozess im Unternehmen eingeführt und hat zu großen Erfolgen und Mitarbeitermotivation in unseren jungen Teams geführt. Damit die Kommunikation zwischen den Abteilungen optimiert werden und der maximale Nutzen aus dem Prozess gezogen werden kann, möchten wir durch einen Scrum-Master Unterstützung finden.  



Um zielgerechte und dynamische Workflows zu garantieren, arbeiten Sie Abteilungsübergreifend zusammen mit Product Owner und den Teams.


Sie werden in der Einarbeitungszeit alle Abteilungen durchlaufen und die Produkte und Dienstleistungen kennenlernen.

item.title: Senior Developer / Manager with Java and SQL for Telco Big Data Pioneer at mCentric (Las Rozas, Spain) (allows remote)
item.description:
Senior Developer / Manager with Java and SQL for Telco Big Data Pioneer


We are looking for a Senior Developer ready to confidently apply a solid technical and managerial skillset to create new or upgrade current solutions, proposing and defending innovations.


You will be using your experience as a Senior Developer to create and upgrade solutions which interact with the mobile telecommunications core network, familiarising yourself with a multitude of mobile telecommunications protocols, standards and infrastructure variations of those standards. mCentric solutions range from Data Plan Management, xDR Navigation, SIM Registration, Voucher Services, and other basic mobile network solutions which in turn are feeding its data into a dynamic and intelligent promotions platform allowing for precise Microsegmentation applied to intelligent and interactive promotions and reporting. Our solutions are responsible for dealing with billions of events processed per day, millions of concurrent user sessions, and are expected to deliver results in real time. To handle the demand, several of the solutions are built over a Big Data structure. In fact, mCentric solutions are running over the first BDA installed in Africa.

item.title: Frontend Developer /Visualization Expert at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The opportunity


Welcome to Zalando, one of the most exciting places for data science in Europe. At Zalando, love for fashion meets enthusiasm for top-notch data-driven technology. Within six years, we have become Europe’s largest online fashion store and we believe that a deep understanding of customer wishes and fashion trends is key for continuing this success story. To develop and enlarge this understanding, we are building one of the strongest data science teams in the business world. Our current projects include product recommendation, automatic fraud detection, customer segmentation and much more. We harness huge amounts of data from many different sources, create statistical models and develop and apply state-of-the-art algorithms. We are looking for you to join our team – to start immediately, in a permanent role and at our beautiful Berlin location.


What we are looking for



  • You have at least two years of work experience as frontend developer

  • You know JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3/LESS by heart and are able to create interactive prototypes out of thin air

  • You have experience with single page application frameworks like angular, backbone, ember, Meteor or Knockout

  • You are familiar with modern build tools like grunt or gulp

  • You keep up to date with latest developments in web technology

  • Experience with data visualization libraries like D3.js is a plus

  • Our team likes to work hard, but also to nurture a friendly and casual work environment. Joining coffee breaks is highly recommended to get to know your team members and it would also be great if you could help organize team events from time to time

  • It would be great if you want to work fulltime, but if you want only do part time, we will find a solution

  • We don’t need your date of birth or a picture of you in your application


Portfolio


We would like to get to know how you work. Please include an example of a project you are proud of in your application. You can send us a link, screenshots or anything that allows us to get a first idea of your style in a few minutes.


Your responsibilities



  • You will design and implement tools and visualizations that allow users to understand data analyses and interact with them

  • You will collaborate with data scientists, developers and product managers within an agile workflow to produce high quality outcome for challenging tasks

  • You will take responsibility for the whole lifecycle of the visualization projects, from choosing the technical platform, to creating UI designs /mockups and implementing them, right up to presenting results


What you can expect from us



  • A corporate culture where your skills are judged only by your results – our motto: wear sneakers, not ties

  • An international team of colleagues who will both inspire and offer you support

  • Training and further development opportunities to expand your skills and help you on your way

  • Free fruit and drinks, spacious kitchens and areas where you can relax

  • You’ll never get bored, there’s always something going on at Zalando

  • Attractive employee discounts in our online shop

  • Powerful hardware system environment on your desk, in a cluster and in the cloud


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Sameer Shaikh at jobs@zalando.de

item.title: Back-end developer in fast growing Start-up at Energimolnet by Playback Energy AB (Gothenburg, Sweden)
item.description:
Come help us save the environment and disrupt a whole industry while doing it!


Energimolnet is built to boost the energy sector by making it fun, easy and truly scalable to develop energy related services that improve efficiency and save the environment. We manage billions of data points and provide the world’s most comprehensive infrastructure for collecting and distributing energy data. Our users save energy by using services they already love -- while we automatically extract data from energy bills, utility web-sites and smart-meters.


Grow with us


We are now expanding in Europe and looking for a back-end developer to join our growing team in Gothenburg. Your main responsibility will be to improve our data collection capabilities and implement new features that will help us grow globally. Our stack is highly distributed and we focus on what we do best and let Heroku, MongoLab, Iron, Papertrail, Mailgun, AWS, etcetera do the rest.


Your responsibilities



  • Lead the back-end development for data collection and monitoring as we enter new geographical markets

  • Be part of general planning and architecture decisions regarding cloud infrastructure and API-design.

  • Help our customers with support questions about the API and data collection

  • Pet-projects: Play around with the API and IFTTT to demonstrate and inspire how Energimolnet can be connected to smart lights and web services

item.title: Senior Software Designer-Developer at Wiland, Inc. (Niwot, CO)
item.description:
Wiland is seeking dedicated, high caliber professionals who are smart and energetic, have a positive attitude and take pride in their work. Currently, we have an opening for a Senior Software Designer-Developer. This Designer-Developer will work closely with the Architecture Team, Development Team, and Product Management to design and develop software for Wiland. The Senior Designer-Developer is responsible for performing a variety of technical activities for assigned projects and maintenance requests as dictated by business priorities. The activities include creating design plans, writing detailed design documents, conducting design reviews, communicating specifications to the development team, developing software, preparing integration test plans, and providing technical leadership to the development team. The primary responsibilities of the Senior Software Designer-Developer position include:



  1. Reviewing and contributing to project Requirements Documents as necessary.

  2. Assisting in the conceptualization and development of solutions for approved projects.

  3. Collaborating with the assigned architect(s) to create design plans, data flow and data models.

  4. Independently preparing detail design documents (process flows, process specifications, and pseudo-code) suitable for use by developers.

  5. Conducting review sessions of completed designs, test plans, and release plans.

  6. Providing technical leadership to members of the development team participating in the project; mentor developers, ensure adherence to development standards, conduct code reviews, etc.

item.title: Technical Engineer (Customer Success) at Logi Analytics (McLean, VA)
item.description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW



Logi Analytics enables enterprises to make better use of their data by delivering on the promise of analytics everywhere. By providing both a Web-based data discovery solution and a business information platform that can be embedded within applications, systems and processes, Logi Analytics helps its customers from the corner office to the factory floor to be more informed, make better decisions and improve corporate performance. With more than 1,200 customers worldwide, Logi Analytics meets the needs of organizations ranging from small businesses to Global 2000 enterprises. The company is headquartered in McLean, Virginia and has sales and support offices in the U.K. and Europe. Logi Analytics is a privately held, venture-backed firm with investments from Updata Partners, GroTech Ventures, Summit Partners and LLR Partners. For more information, visit LogiAnalytics.com.



SUMMARY



The Technical Engineer will assist existing customers in all aspects of the implementation, use and functional operation of Logi Analytics products. The incumbent must have a working knowledge of a wide range of technologies and serve as a contributing member of the team in technology discussions and operations. 



Responsibilities:



The range of the technical skills that are required to support the interaction between the Logi platform and client environments includes:



  • Web-based scripting technologies (JavaScript, CSS and/or HTML)

  • Common database systems (SQL Server, Oracle and/or MySQL)

  • SQL query writing

  • Basic networking skills, to include operating systems and OS security interactions

  • ETL processes and data modeling / data warehousing

  • Web Application technologies such as, DHTML and XML

  • Java and VB.NET programming language

  • Web server setup and configuration (IIS, Tomcat, Weblogic, etc.)

  • Data-driven web applications


The Technical Engineer will also:



  • Establish and maintain working relationships with internal teams, including professional services consultants, product management, engineers, and support staff

  • Maintain current functional and technical knowledge of the entire Logi Analytics product line

  • Manage and drive competing requests across simultaneous client engagements

  • Provide clear and constructive product feedback to product management based on customer requirements

  • Help to document best practices in developing and deploying Logi Analytics solutions

item.title: UI Architect at Enova (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The UI Architect will report to one of our Engineering Managers, and work closely with business and engineering stakeholders to define and execute requirements.



Our software engineering team:


Our engineering squads work right alongside our teams in operations, analytics, accounting, marketing, and even recruiting. We are expected not just to be the experts in technology, but to be able to fully understand what we are trying to build as a company--then make it possible.



We are constantly driven to work harder and learn new things not from some top-down initiative, but from the feeling that we owe it to our peers to keep up with their growth. We have passionate debates about technology with consensus in solutions, flexible team structures, an irrelevance of title in problem solving, and a desire to Do The Right Thing.



Our culture defines who we are, and who we aspire to be. We want you to be a part of this culture at Enova.



We speak this language:


Our primary application stack includes Ruby, Rails, Haml, SASS, PostgreSQL, and Debian, but we’re enjoying using some JavaScript frameworks and other newer platforms depending on the project. We work to stay on the cutting edge of technology and contribute back to open source projects, because flexible frameworks build the foundation for our businesses. It feels good to give back.



On average, we release two new products per year, with eight code releases per day, and we’re getting faster all the time. We’re dedicated to creating quality software quickly, and we're creating a solid, stable, and flexible service-oriented infrastructure to get there.



And yes, we’re Agile, use TDD, and everything else process-wise you’d expect of a modern fast-paced technology-driven company. By now, we’re sure you’re looking for the next hot waterfall-development firm, but we’ll stick to what we know.



This is where YOU come in:


As a UI Architect, you will be the elite representative of our UI culture. You will be responsible for setting a vision, guiding direction and upholding high standards within our culture. You will collaborate closely with a group of talented UI Engineers, UX Designers, Visual Designers, Marketing Associates and other key business stakeholders to establish and maintain frontend development standards across the company.

item.title: (Senior) Manager, Sales Engineering f/m at Smaato Inc. (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
The areas Sales Engineering/Sales Support are all about the customer, whose problems should be eliminated as soon as possible. Professional expertise, enthusiasm and a pleasant nature are the keys to your success in this position. Our support engineering team can solve complex problems through the implementation of action plans for our customers, our own expertise and through professional communication.



  • Liaising with other members of the sales/account management teams and acting as technical experts.

  • Responsible for development and delivery of product demonstrations and producing support materials for other members and clients

  • Able to convey customer requirements to Product Management teams

  • Self-motivated with a proven track record in knowledge of technology.

  • Developing long-term relationships with clients through managing and interpreting their requirements.

  • Investigate issues reported by our clients or internal teams and explore irregularities you find by monitoring our system

  • Use a variety of tools, e.g. log analysis, SQL queries

  • Coordinate the solution of identified issues with our partners, internal engineering and product teams

  • Communicate any serious issues to internal and external stakeholders and keep them updated on their resolution

  • Take charge of our systems in order to monitor our platform from the functional side, monitor fraud levels and other KPIs

  • Work with external partners to find the best way to technically integrate our products & APIs into their systems and help them with any obstacles they may encounter

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at Enova (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Lead Software Engineer


Lead Engineers report to one of our Engineering Managers, and work closely with business stakeholders to define and execute requirements.



Our software engineering team:


Our engineering squads work right alongside our teams in operations, analytics, accounting, marketing, and even recruiting. We are expected not just to be the experts in technology, but to be able to fully understand what we are trying to build as a company--then make it possible.



Both inside and outside engineering, we drive each other to learn more and to build better. This makes for a culture and passion made from individuals working together, not a top-down initiative. We have earnest conversations about technology, structures and process, and the best path forward, building consensus and a shared mission from the ground up



Our culture defines who we are, and who we aspire to be. We want you to be a part of this culture at Enova.



We speak this language:


Our primary application stack includes Ruby, Rails, PostgreSQL, and Debian, but we’re enjoying using some JavaScript frameworks, Go and other newer platforms depending on the project.  



We work to stay on the cutting edge of technology and contribute back to open source projects, because flexible frameworks build the foundation for our businesses. It feels good to give back.



On average, we release two new products per year, with two code releases per day, and we’re getting faster all the time. We’re dedicated to creating quality software quickly, and we're creating a solid, stable, and flexible service-oriented infrastructure to get there.



This is where YOU come in:


As a Lead Software Engineer you’ll be one of Enova’s heavy hitters, overseeing technical components of major projects. We’re going to ask you to build a bridge, and you’ll get it built, no matter what. You’ll balance technical requirements with business needs, while advocating for a high quality codebase when working with full business teams. You’re fluent in ‘technical’ language and ‘business’ language, because you’re the engineer everyone counts on to understand how it works now, how it should work, and how it will work. And through all this, you’ll make sure our younger team members develop to be amazing engineers.

item.title: Software Engineer - Research (Java) at GrammaTech, Inc. (Ithaca, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
We have offices in Ithaca, NY and Madison, WI — but will consider remote employees when there is a strong match of skills and experience. Please reference job # SWD15-01.


Innovation is at the heart of GrammaTech. We are constantly pushing the boundaries of software research and development – from software assurance and software integrity to cyber-security threat mitigation and autonomic computing. 


GrammaTech was founded 26 years ago, with a firmly-grounded purpose to help organizations develop tomorrow’s software.  Given the ever-increasing dependence of software in today’s connected world, our staff is able to focus on the most challenging software issues through a constant stream of highly innovative research and commercial development programs – focused on the evolving cyber security landscape, software hardening and intelligent systems.  Within these projects, GrammaTech employees have the opportunity to work with industry, academic, and government experts, significantly advancing their skills in engineering, research, marketing, or sales.


So, do you want to have an opportunity to work with software assurance experts?  Have the ability to publish and further your software engineering skills in cyber security?  Work alongside some of the most cutting edge research and engineering teams?


GrammaTech's engineering teams work on the software challenges of the future within a culturally rich environment and great career growth opportunities.


Responsibilities:


Under guidance of a principal investigator (PI), a software engineer on a research project will implement innovative prototypes to explore new approaches to problems in software engineering. A research-oriented software engineer is expected to:



  • Study and implement approaches drawn from academic literature or in-house design.

  • Evaluate the resulting prototype implementation to test its value in addressing the research goals.

  • Report results to the PI and respond by adapting the prototype to better address research goals.

  • Contribute to presentations and written reports that keep research sponsors up to date on project progress.

  • Prepare prototypes for demonstrations and evaluations by research sponsors. Respond to any last-minute complications to ensure a smooth and successful evaluation.

item.title: Software Test Automation Engineer at GrammaTech, Inc. (Ithaca, NY)
item.description:
This position is available for our Ithaca, NY and Madison, WI offices only. Please reference job # SWQ15-01



Innovation is at the heart of GrammaTech. We are constantly pushing the boundaries of software research and development – from software assurance and software integrity to cyber-security threat mitigation and autonomic computing. 



GrammaTech was founded 26 years ago, with a firmly-grounded purpose to help organizations develop tomorrow’s software.  Given the ever-increasing dependence of software in today’s connected world, our staff is able to focus on the most challenging software issues through a constant stream of highly innovative research and commercial development programs – focused on the evolving cyber security landscape, software hardening and intelligent systems.  Within these projects, GrammaTech employees have the opportunity to work with industry, academic, and government experts, significantly advancing their skills in engineering, research, marketing, or sales.



So, do you want to have an opportunity to work with software assurance experts?  Have the ability to publish and further your software engineering skills in cyber security?  Work alongside some of the most cutting edge research and engineering teams?



GrammaTech's engineering teams work on the software challenges of the future within a culturally rich environment and great career growth opportunities.


Responsibilities:








Primary tasks and responsibilities will include:



  • Maintaining and enhancing our automated build and test infrastructure.

  • Developing new techniques to automate additional testing activities.

  • Working with the IT staff to ensure that the test organization is well provisioned and that testing machines are running smoothly


You will report to the test team leader, but will interact closely with all of the product team members. You will be instrumental in setting near-term goals and shaping our long-term vision for test automation.



There is plenty of room in this position for growth and skill development. Additional responsibilities will be assigned to exploit your strengths.

item.title: VP of Software Engineering, Centro Direct at Centro (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
ABOUT THE PRODUCT AND ENGINEERING TEAM


At Centro, we’ve always been about making people’s lives better—from our employees to our clients. Today, we’re building a unified platform to execute every digital media advertising transaction, thus providing a new level of automation and intelligence in ad tech. This is an enormous task that will disrupt an industry and improve the lives of those who work within it.

To do this, we’re aggressively growing our team of engineers, product developers and designers. We are imaginative, passionate, determined and relentless in our efforts. Of course, we are fascinated by the complexity of engineering problems at this scale—it’s what brings bright minds together. But what keeps us coming back (and why we love coming to work everyday) is the chance to improve how work gets done: freeing up people’s time so that they can dream bigger and make life better.

Come build something amazing with us.


ABOUT THE ROLE


We are looking for a software engineering leader to head our Chicago development group and take responsibility for a group of directors, managers and engineers to build our flagship product, Centro Direct. This is a senior leadership role focused on scaling the organization and practices and delivering best-in-class functionality and usability, with high quality, at a competitive velocity, managing through engineering manager direct reports and driving agile product delivery across multiple teams. The group includes teams that are responsible for both front-end and backend components for our 24x7 SaaS service and partners closely with product management This role is responsible for guiding architecture and driving to high availability across all services.

item.title: Softwareentwickler Java (w/m) at GULP Information Services GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Im Bereich Softwareentwicklung & Systemadministration in unserer Zentrale in München


Bei GULP erwartet Sie ein Umfeld, in dem Sie sich wohlfühlen werden sowie eine vielseitige Position, die Ihnen Gestaltungs- und Handlungsspielraum lässt. Sie arbeiten in einen engagierten Team von Gleichgesinnten, in vorderster Front neuer Technologien und Prozesse (Continuous Delivery, DevOps, Srum, Kanban), selbstständig und auf Ihre Bedürfnisse abgestimmt. Klingt interessant?


Dann haben wir spannende Aufgaben für Sie



  • Software-Entwicklung für unsere neuen Online-Angebote.

  • Unterstützung bei Machbarkeitsanalysen und Aufwandsschätzungen.

  • Optimierung der Anwendungslandschaft hinsichtlich Security, Performance, Last und Ausfallsicherheit.

item.title: Quality Engineer (f/m) for high-conversion mobile commerce platform // Berlin at NewStore (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Our Engineering team, highly values a strong quality mindset and an equal spread of participation. You will be an integral part of the team by working closely with Product Owners, Engineering and DevOps teams to ensure timely feature delivery and outstanding software quality.


We follow Agile methodologies and continuous deployment best practices and strive for a very high degree of test automation. We automate many aspects of QA including acceptance tests, regression tests, performance and load tests. You have a skill for anticipating and preventing problems as well as teasing out bugs. Feature definitions will be augmented by your acceptance criteria in collaboration with the Product Owners.


As member of one of our scrum teams you contribute various levels of automation code to the sprint. Without your feedback nothing gets deployed to production.

item.title: Quality Assurance Engineer at recruiterbox.com (Bangalore, India)
item.description:
Recruiterbox is tech company focussed on solving problems in hiring. At our cozy little office, we are building the best recruitment software that the industry has seen. It is a profitable SaaS product used by thousands of companies across 20 countries. You might recognize a few of our customers: Groupon, Zomato, Drupal etc.


Our small team in Bangalore loves making elegant and robust software. To help us achieve this goal, we are looking for an analyst who will take responsibility of maintaining the quality of the product we ship. You can know more about our engineering practices and culture from our engineering blog


What you get:



  • Exposure to truly challenging problems that affect thousands of users

  • Work with passionate, smart people like yourself

  • Potential stock options

  • Macbook Pro

  • Free food :)

  • Market Salary

item.title: Software Developer, HPC Runtime at CD-adapco (Austin, TX)
item.description:
• Maintain and enhance our MPI framework support

  • Manage threads

  • Launch, monitor and clean-up processes

  • Bind processes to topologies

  • Handle submission to HPC batch schedulers

  • Support our proxy servers and SSH tunneling

  • Do benchmarking, memory monitoring, and other system validation


Our Software


STAR-CCM+ represents the cutting edge of physics simulation software including CFD, Solid Stress, and Discrete Element Mechanics. It combines the disciplines of design engineering, physics, software engineering, and high performance computing.

Engineers use our software to aid design of a range of applications including the design of: passenger jet engines, wings,  container ships,  vacuum cleaners, and machines that detect pulmonary embolisms.  

STAR-CCM+ is a client-server application that runs on Windows and Linux. The server is written in C++ and the client in Java. The STAR-CCM+ server is an High Performance Computing application that supports a range of compute environments from multi-core workstations to the largest supercomputers in the world. Regardless of the compute environment users of STAR-CCM+ are able to visualize results and change input parameters on the fly through a local client connected to a local or remote server.

We believe in releasing regularly (3 times a year) to ensure rapid response to our customer’s needs and to rapidly deploy enhancements into real engineering production environments where product development will benefit from our efforts.


Who Can Help Us


We are looking for an experienced software guru who is ready to meet challenges as our runtime environment becomes more complex. Your contribution will be crucial to our core business ensuring our application can perform in a range of environments.

This position is hands-on. We need someone who loves actually doing this kind of work and has the ability to research and propose solutions to our problems.

item.title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer - 865 at Cambridge Consultants (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
Would you like to be part of one of the largest independent wireless development teams in the world?  The Wireless Software Group is growing, so if you want to create innovative products for a wide variety of clients, Cambridge Consultants is the place for you. We are a team of highly motivated and professional engineers and we'd like you to join us.


We are part of the Wireless Division at Cambridge Consultants and use first-rate engineering processes and tools to develop cutting edge products across diverse markets.


Our informal and friendly environment is a great place to work, offering support and encouraging innovation and where there is real passion for excellent engineering.


Main purpose of the job


Working on Cambridge Consultants’ wireless projects, you will design and write embedded software for complex systems. In most cases this will involve working with one or more software or hardware engineers as part of a multidisciplinary project team.


You may also lead software teams either technically or as a team lead, depending on where your strengths lie. You may also participate in meetings with clients and potential clients from time to time and a small amount of travel may be involved. We define embedded software as software working at the electronics/software boundary and/or in a constrained environment (e.g. tight memory, low power).


Type of work undertaken by division


The Wireless Software Group develops software for wireless applications. We have particular strengths in low power, low cost radio implementations, with application areas such as telecommunications, healthcare, industrial and consumer goods. We have a significant pre-developed IP library to reduce development time and risk, including mature and proven Bluetooth and DECT protocol stacks.


Recent examples of our work include the complete development of a wireless medical telemetry system and a family of satellite communication units. Both of these examples involved the design and development of new hardware alongside the software development. Further examples include ZigBee and Bluetooth developments, an Air Traffic Control radio system and high value front ends for telecommunications network equipment.


The group carries out software design and architecture, as well as coding, mainly in C and Python.


Team sizes tend to be small and are made up of highly skilled engineers. High quality work is therefore essential from every team member.


Specific responsibilities


In this role you will be responsible for:



  • The design, development and test of whole software subsystems, sometimes on more than one project at once

  • The design of interfaces between your code and that of other software engineers on the team

  • Delivery of high-quality code, compliant with the client’s requirements

  • Carrying out your specific project tasks within the timescales and budgets agreed with the project manager

  • Defining regression tests to ensure that your software is robust and complies with the specification

item.title: Software Engineering Manager at Crossover (Cebu City, Philippines) (allows remote)
item.description:
Aurea is partnering with Crossover to fill this position. Crossover specializes in finding and managing the talent in today’s global workforce and will help you through the recruiting process.


Are you one of top Software Engineering Managers in the world? Do enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you interested in a full-time rolewith an annual compensation of US$100,000 while working 100% remotely? At Aurea, and you’ll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world.


What to Expect as a Software Engineer Manager at Crossover


Choose Crossover and you will play a dynamic leadership roles in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for managing, developing, and evaluating from 4 to 6 teams of 3-4 individuals. You will own the process of breaking specifications created by the product management team into clear tasks and timelines, as well as assembling the results into high value, reusable components. We expect you inspire and enforce high quality within the teams you manage. You will run nightly builds, test cases for every change, and regression test runs. Under your management, we expect to see consistent improvement in both static code quality metrics and weekly production.


The Type of Software Engineer Managers We’re Looking For


Crossover values a culture of excellence. We need managers who are not only technically proficient, but also demonstrate the following qualities:




  • Ruthless commitment to impeccable code quality




  • Willingness to embrace the concept of iterative development as the means for building seamless products




  • Readiness to give all the effort necessary to do an excellent job - even if it means putting in extra time to research the problems you’re facing




  • Perfectionism: knowing how a job should be done and not stop until it’s done correctly




  • Enthusiasm for working both independently and in groups




  • Excellent remote management skills (you will be using Skype, GoToMeeting, Google Docs, etc.)




  • Commitment to increasing efficiency in the workplace by continuously automating parts of the software engineer process

item.title: DevOPS Engineer/ Team Lead, Sr at Adam Plus Company (New York, NY)
item.description:
Yonder is a mobile-only, digital music service that provides users with free access to millions of songs to download and play, commercial free. Yonder is pre-installed in smart, mobile devices where it replaces paid download, streaming and Internet radio services with an integrated music experience. Yonder Music is searching for a driven, self-motivated, hands on leader to join our fast-growing engineering team as a DevOPS Engineering team lead.


You will help formulate our growth plan, evaluate and deploy new technologies, and ensure that our infrastructure and tools can support our fast-paced growth. We are enjoying rapid growth in many markets and are planning to scale our services and platform very quickly. Are you at home with AWS in integrated real-time environments and are eager to learn more about their new services the day they’re announced? If so let’s talk, you might be the DevOps engineer we’re looking for.


We are building a top notch engineering team and are looking for an experienced DevOps engineer to contribute to building, maintaining, instrumenting and automating our product and development infrastructure. If you’re ready to join an outstanding and passionate team of engineers at a fast-moving startup where you can learn, grow, and have real technical ownership, look no further.


We’ll expect you to:



  • Follow best practices to build, maintain, monitor, and automate our ops infrastructure

  • Work closely with developers to design and build systems and processes required to support rapid product development and high-availability and secure operations

  • Scale our operational infrastructure to keep up with our user growth by region

  • Create operational documentation and troubleshooting guidelines

  • Keep abreast of the latest developments in the DevOps world

  • Participate in on-call rotations as needed

item.title: Director, QA Engineering, Xamarin Platform at Xamarin (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Your Role:


Xamarin is looking for a passionate leader for the quality team who is experienced and highly committed to delivering results in an fast-paced environment.  Design, develop, drive and deliver test strategies and methodologies, and take a hands-on approach to see that they are implemented timely and efficiently.


The Director of QA Engineering will be focused on ensuring the quality of our platform product, which lives in a world where both of the platforms that we target (Android, Mac and iOS) are in constant evolution as well the development environments that our users use (Windows and Mac).


The ideal candidate is a hands-on, articulate, and focused leader by example, who can own the testing process, mentor others, collaborate across teams and help foster a culture of quality in the company. They will be responsible for ensuring all product components conform to the established technical and performance requirements and for creating a collaborative work environment.  


Key Responsibilities:




  • Oversee and drive all QA responsibilities for the Xamarin Platform. This may include creation and maintenance of automated test strategies, creating and overseeing manual testing plans, test new features for existing and preview products, scheduling QA resources against development needs as far in advance as possible, and clearly communicating the output of QA’s efforts to the development team at regular intervals.




  • Partner with development teams to ensure proper test coverage and test automation is delivered with each release as well as helping to improve the engineering processes to deliver a quality product.




  • Manage QA team (QA Engineers in-office and manual off-shore team) on projects, including coordinating team efforts and mentoring team members.




  • Continuously assess and improve existing testing methodologies and processes, with a focus on how those processes can better serve the product health and development team bandwidth.




  • Work directly with the Project and Product Managers as needed to coordinate release schedules, and come up with flexible solutions that maintain quality and target ship dates under potentially evolving timelines. 




  • Make sure QA testing timelines and process are visible and understood by other product leads, setting clear expectations for both the input needs and targeted output of the QA department’s work.




  • Be an arbiter for the highest possible product quality, and work with the developers and managers to find creative solutions towards maintaining and improving quality, while also allowing for the flexibility necessary in a fast paced development environment.




What We Are Looking For:




  • Demonstrated experience managing a QA engineering team




  • Software programming experience




  • Experience working closely and collaborating with development teams on projects of varied timeframes and scales




  • Strong communication, leadership, interpersonal and team building skills




  • Success in communicating cross-functionally and across management levels in formal and informal settings




  • Strong people management skills, with proven ability to hire and grow talented teams

item.title: QA Engineer (NYC) at Imagine Easy Solutions (New York, NY)
item.description:
We're looking for a QA Engineer (NYC office) looking to play a key role in our product and engineering teams.


Our engineering team is changing the Education Technology industry. Our products include EasyBib, Imagine Easy Scholar, and Imagine Easy Academy. Members of our engineering team work on products that millions of students use.


Responsibilities include and will not be limited to:



  • A strong urge to expand our end-to-end automated test coverage using Selenium, Protractor and Ruby with RSpec or other suitable tools

  • Enable our engineering team to assist and improve our tests and test process

  • Work closely with support and product teams to diagnose bugs, identify edge cases, and identify areas that need more test coverage

  • Work hand in hand with engineering team to set up QA practices and testing frameworks, and enable developers in writing tests

  • Perform manual testing on new features or bugs that have been fixed

item.title: Software Developer at SPIRIT Global Energy Solutions (Frederick, CO)
item.description:
Position Summary:


Accountable for Real Time software design and develop of innovative automation technology used for artificial lift of oil production.  Responsible for new product software engineering throughout the product development life (idea-to launch) and sustaining engineering.  Researches, designs, and develops computer software systems, in conjunction with hardware product development.  The position reports to the Automation Engineering Director who is based in Frederick (Denver), CO.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following.  Other duties may be assigned. 



  • Reviews and validates system software requirements to determine feasibility of design constraints.

  • Designs, develops and updates functionality for automation software systems and sub-systems.

  • Evaluates hardware and software interfaces and system requirements working in a multidisciplinary team.

  • Develops and directs software system testing procedures to verify software functional requirements.

  • Coordinates installation of software system.

  • Consults with customers concerning maintenance of software systems.

  • Identifies, evaluates, and develops tools and processes necessary to meet engineering and business goals.

  • Provides timely communications on significant issues or developments.

  • Maintaining a focus on safety, quality and reliability.

  • Conducts problem root cause investigations and determines proper resolution.

  • Participates actively in software design and code reviews.

item.title: Software Engineers - Research (Binary Rewriting) at GrammaTech, Inc. (Ithaca, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
We have offices in Ithaca, NY and Madison, WI — but will consider remote employees when there is a strong match of skills and experience. Please reference job #SWD15-03


Innovation is at the heart of GrammaTech. We are constantly pushing the boundaries of software research and development – from software assurance and software integrity to cyber-security threat mitigation and autonomic computing. 


GrammaTech was founded 26 years ago, with a firmly-grounded purpose to help organizations develop tomorrow’s software.  Given the ever-increasing dependence of software in today’s connected world, our staff is able to focus on the most challenging software issues through a constant stream of highly innovative research and commercial development programs – focused on the evolving cyber security landscape, software hardening and intelligent systems.  Within these projects, GrammaTech employees have the opportunity to work with industry, academic, and government experts, significantly advancing their skills in engineering, research, marketing, or sales.


So, do you want to have an opportunity to work with software assurance experts?  Have the ability to publish and further your software engineering skills in cyber security?  Work alongside some of the most cutting edge research and engineering teams?


GrammaTech's engineering teams work on the software challenges of the future within a culturally rich environment and great career growth opportunities.


Responsibilities:


Under guidance of a principal investigator (PI), a software engineer on a research project will implement innovative prototypes to explore new approaches to problems in software engineering. A research-oriented software engineer is expected to:



  • Study and implement approaches drawn from academic literature or in-house design.

  • Evaluate the resulting prototype implementation to test its value in addressing the research goals.

  • Report results to the PI and respond by adapting the prototype to better address research goals.

  • Contribute to presentations and written reports that keep research sponsors up to date on project progress.

  • Prepare prototypes for demonstrations and evaluations by research sponsors. Respond to any last-minute complications to ensure a smooth and successful evaluation.

item.title: Front End Engineer at Raise.com (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Job Description:


As a front-end engineer at Raise, you’ll be leading engineering efforts for the client-side of our gift card marketplace. You'll work closely with our backend engineers along with the product team to build powerful, beautiful and responsive front-end web applications using the latest technologies and techniques.


We are a small, fast growing team—there is immense growth potential both from an engineering and a business standpoint. If you're a smart, diligent problem-solver who enjoys working autonomously, and is willing to take complete ownership of a project while meeting deadlines, this is the perfect role for you.


___


Raise Engineering:


Our software engineers are solving problems at scale for our online, gift card marketplace. Our user base and e-commerce transactions are growing exponentially. The challenges of keeping our services running 24x7, and adding new features to accelerate our business, all while moving incrementally to a continuous-deployment, microservice architecture are all awesome problems to solve. An understanding and commitment to our team approach to software development is of primary importance. Teams build software here. Besides obvious technical strengths, we look for passion for well-crafted software, professionalism, drive to learn new technologies, the joy of building solutions for our business and users, and the desire to cultivate a challenging, innovative, and supportive engineering culture.


Engineering teams at Raise have a great deal of autonomy and independence, with real ownership of the products and features they build. This role requires a unique balance of software-development skill and product sense — so the ideal candidate will have experience building substantial customer-facing products or services.


Impact- Raise is an engineering culture at its core. Our goal is to create an optimal environment where engineers regularly see and feel the difference they make.


Elegance - We care about code. Every engineer, from leadership to individual contributor, code on a daily basis.


Tackling Challenges - We don’t believe in being fast followers. Instead we’re focused on creating amazing experiences for customers while solving problems they knew existed.


Professional Growth - Each engineer has an individual career plan carved out for them upon joining Raise. Whether you want to be an individual contributor or have aspirations for leadership, we’ll work to help you realize your career goals.


Smart Team - Great people want to work around great people. We understand that, so we’ve created a thorough and systematic hiring process to ensure we only hire top quality engineers.


Disruptive Goals - Raise engineers think BIG. We never settle for mediocrity and are excited about our future.

item.title: Java Developers transforming data into elegant solutions at Landmark Information Group (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
Landmark Solutions developers work on a range of projects, typically for government or public body customers.  Our speciality is transforming data into elegant solutions that deliver insight and value.  We do this mainly by implementing authenticated web services that consume, retrieve, query and modify structured data.  We implement syntactic and semantic validation and business logic and persist the data to relational, data-warehouse and object stores.  Many projects also contain web site user-interfaces.  Our core technology is Java 8 and we utilise many web modern frameworks including Spring 4, Hibernate 4, Google Guice, JDBI, Dropwizard, Jersey and JAX/RS.  We apply an agile development process where possible, centred around Jira, using Bitbucket, git, feature-branches and peer-reviews where possible.



You will be part of a vibrant and ambitious team who are making a real difference to our business by designing and delivering first class software in an environment of dynamic and outcome focused delivery. Our objectives are technically challenging and we deliver products which generate a key part of the business’ revenue. Are you looking for a challenge that will push your boundaries in terms of your personal development, and help contribute to business success through developing innovative solutions for our customers? If so, we’d love to hear from you.


Our developers have an important voice in how our solutions are constructed, so an open and collaborative approach to change is essential. Our teams have great opportunities for personal development and therefore the role would benefit a self-motivated learner.

item.title: Rails Developer at Connexity (Camarillo, CA)
item.description:
Connexity is looking for a talented, highly motivated Rails Web Developer / Software Engineer.  The candidate will be responsible for both minor and major functional enhancements to our UI.  Used by outside customers, our internal business team, and our developer team, the UI is our fastest and cleanest view into highly complex, multidimensional data.  As a core member of our UI team, the candidate will be the cornerstone of making our rich data accessible and visible, and by doing so will provide other groups in the company with the insights necessary to grow revenue.  With close to 200,000 streamed transactions per second and database tables with over a billion rows, we need a creative problem solver to provide windows of insight into our data.
 
We are not a LAMP stack shop, but rather a NoSQL, Big Data, Real-Time stream processing shop. Our architecture is unique and our software stack purposefully diverse. We are searching for an engineer that likes a challenge, wants an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies, and thrives in small teams. We are looking for a developer that wants to "own" key aspects of the client interface and take pride in its evolution. Your contributions will be immediate and will be felt through out the company. Connexity is fun, fast-paced, and open-ended with a strong entrepreneurial spirit and with emphasis on being innovative.

We also provide ample opportunity for our engineers to grow their skillset beyond web development, offering a chance to design around several NoSQL platforms including Hadoop.

YOU WILL BE ACCOUNTABLE FOR



  • Building Ruby/Rails interfaces that make it easy to understand and control complex, multi-dimensional data

  • Creatively leveraging AJAX to pull from Redis and Hbase in order to provide real-time views of large datasets

  • Identifying reports that can be offloaded to helper applications for faster rendering

  • Helping with the schema design for NoSQL databases

  • Optimizing ORM queries to maintain good performance across large datasets

item.title: Business Intelligence Analyst at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
Sainsbury’s, one of the UK’s largest retailers is investing heavily in digital innovation - its aim being to build a centre of excellence where digital output is shaped using leading best practice frameworks and methodologies to produce the world class apps and services. The team is growing rapidly and looking for talented colleagues to help deliver ambitious and market leading services that live up to Sainsbury’s industry leading reputation.



We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to work as part of the BI team, transforming our data and analytics capabilities. That means providing our colleagues with as little as three clicks and 30 seconds to access information, three minutes to insight and a real focus on driving actions to deliver value to the business.



As a BI Analyst, you’ll:



  • Assist the business with their questions/ challenges by building custom scripts, analysis, analytics and insight (using tools such as SAS, R, Python, Tableau, MS-SQL, D3)

  • Provide statistical analysis, build analytical models, handle data and reporting and deliver visualizations in the form of interactive dashboards

  • Work on multiple projects relating to BI and Analytics, working both cross functionally and independently

  • Show a genuine interest in new technologies and tools for analytics purposes, trying out new tools and approaches through hackathons, data drives and POCs

item.title: Web Application Developer - modern front-end / finance+trading at Extremely Heavy Industries (Greenwich, CT) (allows remote)
item.description:
Extremely Heavy Industries is searching for an experienced front-end software developer to help build sophisticated, data-rich web and mobile applications using modern web/Javascript frameworks and data visualization libraries.


We create highly polished web apps for private financial clients. We specialize in tools to track and visualize portfolio performance, risk, and trading activity across a wide range of asset classes, countries, and strategies.


This posting includes an extended onsite engagement with one of our clients - a major hedge fund based in Greenwich, CT. This will involve direct collaboration with high-level developers and trading desks to build out an internal UI framework and collection of apps for research and analysis across the firm. Regular (often daily) onsite presence for this project is essential.


-------------------------------------


Location: Greenwich, CT + ongoing options for NYC/Westchester County/remote.


Job Type: Both salaried and independent contractor arrangements can be considered.


Compensation: Highly competitive, commensurate with experience.

item.title: Data Engineer at Essence (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Company:

Essence is a global digital agency and the world’s largest independent buyer of digital media. We blend data science, objective media and captivating experiences to build valuable connections between brands and consumers. Clients include Google, HP, Method, and Barclays. The agency is more than 480 people strong, manages over $700MM in media spend and deploys campaigns in 71 markets via offices in London, New York, San Francisco, Seattle, Singapore and Tokyo. Visit essencedigital.com for more information, and follow us on Twitter at @essencedigital.
