We are looking for a Data Developer who can write clean well designed Python and PL/SQL in a timely and scalable way. You must have strong experience building and optimizing ETL processes in a heterogeneous environment (Oracle 11g, PostgresSQL).


We’d like you to:




  • Troubleshoot, test and maintain large-scale data warehousing systems and ETL processes to ensure strong optimization and functionality

  • Develop new features and tools as needed

item.title: Engineering Manager, Mobile Software at Razer Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Razer is seeking an experienced Software Engineering Manager to join the team in our San Francisco office. In this role you would manage our mobile development team (located in San Francisco and Singapore), coordinating a diverse multi-disciplinary group of software engineers and quality assurance personnel. In addition to stand alone mobile application development, the mobile software team also develops the mobile apps that power our hardware. We’re looking for someone who is not only a great engineering manager, but someone who also has a deep understanding of the mobile and wearable technology space.


Responsibilities:



  • Manage a distributed team of software and QA engineers who are designing, developing and supporting compelling, high quality mobile applications on Android, iOS, Windows Phone, and wearable platforms

  • Work closely with senior leadership, project management, and other teams within the company to develop, update, and implement mobile product strategy, and develop the mobile product roadmap

  • Collaborate with management on budget planning and then manage to the approved budget

  • Work with project management to develop and enforce a supportable delivery schedule based on agreed priorities and business requirements

  • Manage internal and external dependencies to insure the software and hardware teams deliver on schedule

  • Remove roadblocks and provide support to insure all team members have what they need to succeed

  • Take ownership of the quality and stability of all mobile development projects

  • Assist with employee performance reviews and professional development for your teams

  • Help develop and enforce engineering and project management processes and best practices

  • Provide presentations to senior leadership on team software roadmap, delivery schedules, etc.

  • Communicate early and often about any significant events or issues affecting the team or delivery schedules

  • Travel to meet with remote teams, stakeholders, and partners. Quarterly at minimum, more often if necessary.

item.title: Trading Solutions - Enterprise Messaging Software Developer (C#/Java/C++) at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The Enterprise Connectivity and Integration team is looking for skilled developers to work on its message processing workflow engine and delivery platform. The system balances numerous requirements while merging ETL design, real-time processing, systems programming, web delivery and human computer interaction for graph-based message transformation.
The team is building new functionality and features as we extend our capability with a generic messaging framework that includes routing and processing heavy traffic loads across an array of circumstances. Developers can expect to contribute immediately and will be working on:
-High performance distributed system to support asynchronous workflows, faster fault-recovery.
-Parallel data processing, message enrichment, data transformation and delivery mechanisms all within a high throughput, low latency, secure server environment.
-Open source technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Storm and more.
-Streamlined user interface.

item.title: Cyber and Technology Specialists at DSTL (Porton Down, UK)
item.description:
Serve your country. Help save lives.


In the rapidly evolving world of cyber, it’s never easy to predict the future.  Yet there’s one thing we can guarantee – joining Dstl will give you a valued role in protecting the UK and its citizens, while advancing the cyber-capability our military commanders can use alongside conventional weapons.  



We have a range of positions on offer in our growing cyber team. These are not stereotypical ‘computer hacker’ roles. It takes an incredible range of people to achieve our goals – you may not even consider yourself a ‘cyber’ professional. What you do need is expertise in:



Electronics, Systems Engineering, RF Communications, Networks /Communications/Protocols or Software

item.description:

We are a powerhouse in the Public Relations software space. By investing in our brand and technologies we are driving the change in our industry. We are always investing in our people; through amazing training and management, empowering you to drive your career. 


(And of course) We work hard, but we play harder!

You will implement scalable solutions for our platform

You will use your object-oriented design skills to define and optimize complex relational models
You will pair with other seasoned engineers to solve complex problems and produce rock-solid, reusable, test-driven code

You are...

Flexible to work in a startup environment
A problem solver
Excellent in communication skills, both verbal and written
A team player

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Synthetic Genomics, Inc. (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
At Synthetic Genomics, Inc., we are dedicated to developing and commercializing genomic-driven solutions to address global challenges.  We are currently seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our fast-growing, dynamic and collaborative team in La Jolla, CA.

The successful candidate will play a large role in our distributed software efforts and will be in charge of micro-services integration within our current platform. You will be responsible for architecting and implementing new distributed processing services for reliability, performance and scale. You will also collaborate with our bioinformatics team to deliver the best possible end-user experience.

item.title: Product Manager, Xamarin.Forms at Xamarin (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Your role:


Xamarin.Forms is a revolutionary framework that enables developers to build native UIs for iOS, Android, and Windows with a single, shared codebase. We are a small, dedicated team that moves quickly and is focused on making cross-platform mobile development delightful and are working on one of the most popular features of Xamarin.


As a Product Manager on this strategic product, you will be the driving force in defining the Xamarin.Forms product roadmap, working collaboratively with engineering, product marketing, sales and customer success.


Key Responsibilities:




  • Own and define the product vision and roadmap for Xamarin.Forms




  • Work directly with end users in our vibrant Xamarin.Forms community to understand and address their issues and make building apps with Xamarin.Forms a delight.




  • Write customer-informed product specs and work closely with design, engineering and QA to bring your projects to life




  • Be the overall product owner, and collaborate to formulate and execute go-to-market schedules for new and existing products




  • Deliver the business cases for each iteration, by comparing customer benefits and alignment to product and company strategy




  • Communicating with and coordinating between Product Team Leads to make sure inter-product module dependencies are taken into account when creating roadmaps for future releases




  • Stay current with emerging trends and products in mobile development




What We Are Looking For:




  • An enthusiastic and high-energy individual who wants to make an impact on developers’ lives in the mobile industry




  • Demonstrated success defining and launching successful, customer-valued products in a fast-paced environment




  • Software product management experience




  • Great communication and planning skills; easily communicate product needs with a diverse set of technical and non-technical stakeholders




  • Ability to coordinate planning for multiple product modules, set clear expectations with product stakeholders, and pro-actively communicate the status of meeting those commitments




  • Experience writing code or a background in engineering

item.title: Senior Ruby Developer (Berlin or remote) at GoHiring GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland) (allows remote)
item.description:
As our base of customers grows, we have some exciting engineering challenges coming up and would love your help as a Senior Ruby Developer (Berlin or remote).

... get excited about good quality code and engineering quests
We innovate by building smart customer-driven backend solutions. This implies exciting engineering challenges and missions. Our roadmap is not based on fixed deadlines. We start with MVP’s and iterate from there.

... think small is beautiful
Automation matters to us. We are a small, high caliber team and only want to grow if really necessary. We discovered creating value by staying small and agile.

... like to work from the place you love
We build this company to work from the place we are most productive and happy. For us office is optional. As a distributed team we use collaboration-tools to stay connected, participate in each other’s work and post cat pictures.

item.title: Senior Front End Engineer at Cision US (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
Why Cision?



  •  We are a powerhouse in the Public Relations software space. By investing in our brand and technologies we are driving the change in our industry. We are always investing in our people; through amazing training and management, empowering you to drive your career.  (And of course) We work hard, but we play harder!

item.title: Game Developer at Powerhouse Gaming, Inc. (Loomis, CA)
item.description:
As a developer at Powerhouse, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining software which interacts with external hardware devices, web services and other applications to complement our growing library of products and services.  As a Game Developer you will be responsible for the following:



  • Be a part of an engineering team that will play a strategic role in developing cutting edge applications

  • Utilize and follow agile methodologies and principles

  • Work in all layers of software development to produce clean well documented code

  • Successful candidates will have solid analytical and logical cognitive skills, strong technical and non-technical communication skills, as well as excellent problem resolution and technical decision making abilities.

item.title: Senior iOS Developer at Salesforce (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Salesforce is seeking Senior iOS Developers who are passionate about developing for the iPhone and iPad. This role is hands-on in developing cutting edge mobile software applications to meet the business needs of our clients, and will apply functional knowledge and technical expertise in the implementation and maintenance of custom software.  This individual has a passion for innovation, and is a hard-working, results-oriented software engineer who can communicate effectively and lead a team of developers in large-scale enterprise-class mobile application development efforts for some of the world's biggest companies.

Required Skills/Experience: 



  • Bachelor's degree required in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or Electrical Engineering

  • Demonstrable experience with real-world iOS projects for the App Store or Enterprise distribution

  • Experience building and delivering highly scalable, reliable, and complex software systems on-time and on budget

  • Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, continuous integration, build processes, testing, and operations

  • Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through launch

  • An eagerness to learn new things and to help others do the same

  • Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and project management to understand requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs

  • Strong customer relations/customer management skills

  • Ability to lead development teams

item.title: Software Protection Engineer at INSIDE Secure (Glasgow, UK)
item.description:
Following the acquisition of Metaforic Ltd. last year, INSIDE Secure are looking to grow the newly-formed Software Protection division. We are responsible for developing the Metaforic Core and Metaforic WhiteBox software security products.


Metaforic Core adds a "software immune system" to applications; a topology of interlocking checks which can detect attempts to tamper the program's executable and react appropriately. A radical source-to-source transformation is used to combine checks with customer code and obfuscate critical regions.


Metaforic WhiteBox is a cutting-edge cryptographic recompiler which allows keys and other secrets to be encoded within the execution of a routine itself, protecting otherwise exposed secrets from attackers.


Our software protection engineers design and develop these and other solutions for our customers. By their nature they target multiple platforms including Windows, OS X, Linux, iOS and Android.


As a software protection engineer at INSIDE you will:



  • work well in a small team

  • use common collaboration tools like Slack and JIRA

  • be able to write clean, maintainable C and C++ code

  • be unfazed debugging at the lowest levels

  • be confident to develop new software protection mechanisms

item.title: Front-end Engineer at Likelihood (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The front-end team at Likelihood is responsible for building an advanced, yet simple interface for our machine learning platform. With it, non-technical users at our customers are able to easily create experiments that power beautiful, data-driven website and mobile experiences. We seek talented JavaScript engineers with strong design sensibilities and a desire to create interfaces that are a pleasure to use. 


You'll be working from the ground-up with a small team to guide the architecture and implementation of our web applications. We'll want you to build upon your ideas about what other applications we can create that enable companies to provide personalized experiences for each of their individual customers.

item.title: Frontend developer at Wiremind (Paris, France)
item.description:
About Us:


We are a young start-up based in Paris and dedicated to the field of Revenue Management for the transportation sector. We believe in tools that mix business intelligence, applied mathematics, ergonomics and software intelligence to make sense of very large amount of data. We aim to remove unnecessary complexity to our users while allowing them to focus on high-value actions to improve the overall margin of their business.


Our main solution is a saas software for transport companies that let them do their yield and pricing just right.


We are looking for a talented frontend engineer who is ready to work in close relation with the CTO to tackle challenges met by a young technological startup. 


Responsibilities:


You will be in charge of developping new features for the front-end part of our solution.


The back-end part is responsible for extracting data from our client's reservation system, transforming it by applying several steps (standardization, forecasting, pricing algorithms...) and loading it in our managed datastores.


The frontend is a single-page application on which clients can freely modify their pricing position according to realtime adjusted metrics like competitor's prices, daily sale's speed, suggest optimal price... 


Our technological stack is as follow:



  • Backend: Python, SQLAlchemy, Scrapy, Celery, Flask

  • Frontend: AngularJS, D3js

  • Data-store: Postgresql, Elasticsearch


Requirements:



  • Strong Knowledge of Javascript, CSS, HTML

  • Rigourous, autonomous and hard-working


Bonus Points:



  • Working experience with AngularJS or D3js

  • Experience in working in a technological start-up


Other details:


This is a fulltime position located in Paris. 
Please include a brief personalized cover letter (in english or french) with your application.
Salary: Negotiable depending on the profile and degree / training / experience.

item.title: Senior Computational Scientist at European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a Senior Computational Scientist to join the BioSAXS group of the EMBL.



The successful applicant will be responsible for the design, coordination, implementation and deployment
of software and method developments, ranging from integration of biophysical devices and methods at
the BioSAXS beamline to data collection strategies and subsequent analysis methods. He/she will also
be involved in the user support at a dedicated biological SAXS beamline P12 on PETRA 3 ring utilized by
over a hundred groups per year. All beamline specific developments are to be coordinated with the MX beamline responsibles, as well as Computer and Instrumentation groups.



Methods development requires collaborative maintenance of the existing code base with the other
members of the group with specific emphasis on the development of novel statistical and machine
learning approaches for data analysis and validation.

item.title: Core Financial Applications C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role: 

The Core Financial Applications (CFA) department designs and builds business-critical solutions for a diverse set of customers in the financial industry. Our products include analytical and research applications for equities, fixed income, mortgages, commodities, economics, foreign exchange and financial derivatives. The products we build help traders, investment bankers, corporate treasurers, research analysts and portfolio managers solve complex business problems.

As a software engineer in CFA, you will be responsible for the full development life cycle of key projects. You will learn about finance from our subject matter experts and through Bloomberg University courses. Your ingenuity and enterprise will help improve and progress our products in a highly competitive and challenging marketplace.

Our software engineers are quick, resourceful, flexible and collaborative. They combine their technical skills and product knowledge to craft unsurpassed solutions for our customers.

>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Derivatives & Cross Asset

The Derivatives & Cross Asset group is one of the fastest growing in both CFA and Bloomberg. We deal with analytics required by a variety of trading, risk management and regulatory reporting applications. The front, middle and back offices of major financial institutions involved in the USD 700 trillion derivatives industry use our products to make sense of the complexity, risks, pitfalls and regulations surrounding these financial instruments. Our derivatives teams meet these challenges by offering a one-stop solution that brings transparency, efficiency and excellence to market professionals.

Fixed Income Pricing

The Fixed Income (FI) Pricing group builds a product that is the market standard for pricing and provides up to date and accurate information to the global financial community. We are focused on building low latency, high throughput systems that employ advanced statistical techniques for generating real-time and accurate pricing information. FI Pricing also builds analytics products that revolutionize the fixed income market place. Our application suite includes high precision pricing algorithms, accurate end-of-day price generation systems, liquidity hubs for storing and retrieving pricing information, sophisticated user interfaces and big data analytics platforms. These products are extensively used by various market players such as portfolio managers, risk officers, analysts and traders.

Foreign Exchange

The Foreign Exchange (FX) group provides market leading analytic functionality and award-winning currency pricing and data. Because FX trades are over the counter (bank to bank; not traded in exchanges), it is important for traders to have transparency into market prices. Our tools provide this service in real-time and allow users to perform FX forwards analytics on them. We develop high visibility applications for FX valuation, idea generation and price discovery workflows, as well as high volume real-time pricing engines.

Commodities

The Commodities group builds products that offer transparency in supply, demand, and pricing of oil, power, natural gas, metals and agricultural goods. We build systems and functionality to house everything from hourly power transmission rates to 15-minute updates on ship movements. Technical opportunities run the gamut from architecting systems to designing databases to UI development. Another aspect of this group is to track and manage the lifecycle of millions of futures and options securities across 100+ exchanges around the world. Our futures and options product makes discoverability of such securities easy, which proves to be a very important for our clients in a dynamic environment.

Economics

The Economics group puts the fundamentals of our economy in front of hundreds of thousands of clients every day. We develop the tools that manage real-time releases of economic statistics coming from governments around the world. We also develop analytics and visualizations of economic data to help users better understand the underpinnings of our financial system.

Equity

The Equity group's product is used by over 100,000 financial professionals worldwide to make investment decisions aimed at increasing alpha. This functionality is among the most used across the Bloomberg terminal and is invaluable to clients. The product allows for clear understanding of vast global data sets spanning 30+ years, big data analytics, real-time alerting and complex financial data. We build applications for discovering and analyzing market trends, aggregating and evaluating analyst predictions, and screening and back-testing investment ideas. The group is made up of fast-paced teams passionate about time-to-market, performance and visual design.

Fixed Income Core

The Fixed Income Core group develops software to support analytics and data that move global fixed income markets. We cover government, corporate, money market, municipal and preferred instruments. Our clients depend on our pricing algorithms, high performance calculation libraries, trading applications and real-time big data analysis to make informed decisions. Our applications are used a million times a day and our APIs are invoked billions of times a day.

item.title: Java Devops Engineer at Spinn3r (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Ideal Candidate


We are looking for candidates outside of the U.S. and Canada to maximize our time zone distribution. Ideally there should be least a 4 hour overlap with the Pacific Standard Time Zone (PST / UTC-8). We're based out of San Francisco but are migrating to the international level. If you don't have a natural time overlap with UTC-8 you should be willing to work evenings to be able to communicate easily with the rest of the team.


We're interested in someone comfortable with a generalist and devops role. You should be knowledgeable of standard system administration tasks and have a firm understanding of the role of load balancers and cluster architecture. It's 100x harder to write code if you don't know how the underlying operating system works.


We are also looking for someone with a legitimate passion for technology, big data, and analyzing vast amounts of content.


Culturally, we're a remote company and want to embrace it as a way to reward our employees. We are fine with you working in remote locations as long as you're generally available for communication and are productive.


We want someone to come in full time as a contractor role. I suspect we will need about 40 hours from you per week.  


Job Responsibilities:



  • Understanding our crawler infrastructure and ensuring top quality metadata for our customers. There's a significant batch job component to analyze the output from the crawl to ensure top quality data.

  • Making sure our infrastructure is fast, reliable, fault tolerant, etc. At times this may involve diving into the source of tools like ActiveMQ, Cassandra and understand how the internals work. We contribute a LOT to Open Source development if our changes need to be given back to the community.

  • Building out new products and technology that will directly interface with customers. This includes cool features like full text search, analytics, etc. It's extremely rewarding to build something from ground up and push it to customers directly. 


Architecture:


Our infrastructure consists of Java on Linux (Debian/Ubuntu) with the stack running on ActiveMQ, Cassandra, Zookeeper, and Jetty. We use Ansible to manage our boxes. We have a full-text search engine based on Elasticsearch and store our firehose API data within Cassandra.


We have a totally new stack and infrastructure at this point. We recently did a full-stack rewrite and moved all the old code to our new infrastructure. This means we have very little legacy cruft to deal with.


Here's all the cool stuff you get to play with:



  • Large Linux / Ubuntu cluster running with the OS versioned using both Ansible and our own debian packages for software distribution.

  • Massive amount of data indexed from the web and social media.  We index from 5-20TB of data per month and want to expand to 100TB of data per month.

  • Large Cassandra install on SSD.  

  • SOLR / Elastic Search migration / install.  We’re experimenting with bringing this up now so it would be valuable to get your feedback.


Compensation:



  • Salary based on experience. We're willing to be competitive and a great company to work for.

  • Ability to work remotely at home. Live work balance is a must.

item.title: Senior Business Systems Analyst (Must have strong Salesforce.com experience) at CDK Global (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
CDK Global is seeking at Business Operations Analyst


POSITION SUMMARY


The Business Systems Analyst III provides advanced level of expertise in identifying, driving, developing and/or deploying technical systems and/or reporting solutions within the Services group. Associate is responsible for independently conducting the analysis of business issues and requests that require the creation, updating and/or enhancements to Services business systems and/or reporting solutions.


This person will apply their strong knowledge of established Services business processes to recommend appropriate solutions that help solve the identified business need(s). The BSA utilizes advanced knowledge of Salesforce, SQL, Tableau, and/or other applicable tools, technology, and business systems to perform gap analysis, document business requirements, recommend solutions, identify level of effort and deliver on complex business-critical projects. You will work directly with business and technology stakeholders, Services program management and supporting resources to identify and recommend appropriate technical solutions.


The Business Systems Analyst performs configuration and testing of agreed upon solutions as assigned. You will provide expert level of technical and business expertise to other team members including solution analysis, quality review and testing of developed solutions.


The Business Systems Analyst actively participates in business strategy discussions relating to new functionality, system solutions or other broadly scoped initiatives as assigned.


PRINCIPAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Business Analysis: Plans, conducts, and documents analysis efforts associated with assigned business processes and issues or initiatives that require creation of new and/or updating of existing business systems, tools and/or critical business processes. This includes managing business process review (BPR) sessions with stakeholders, documenting business requirements, providing relevant solution options and creation of functional specifications and use-cases to support any associated business system configuration or development efforts.

  • Systems/Application Support and Administration: Provides expert level of systems support, maintenance and administration for assigned systems.This includesadministration and configuration associated with assigned database, CRM, telephony or related applications and tools to ensure alignment with the requirements of the business. Provide subject matter expert to team members and stakeholders on assigned systems and other business-critical applications.

  • Reporting Development and Data Analysis. Develops, executes, and maintains assigned datasets, reports and data mining efforts specific to all core business systems supported by the Services Operations team. This includes performing expert level data and impact analysis on assigned metrics, business processes and systems to ensure accuracy and relevance to Services initiatives and business priorities.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES



  • Proven track record of researching and analyzing complex technical issues and then summarizing them via table, graphs, and written analysis

  • Strong verbal and interpersonal skills; exceptional writing skills demonstrated by delivering clear, correct and timely communications and effectively working with others.

  • Ability to analyze complex data or systems issues and to provide actionable recommendations to impacted teams based on the analysis

  • Ability to analyze complex business processes and identify efficiency opportunities and/or solutions to resolve process gaps or related business challenges

  • Identify, develop and document requirements that clearly support and communicate needs to Services stakeholders, IT and supporting teams

  • Ability to effectively present analysis and data findings to wide range of technical and non-technical audiences

  • Detail oriented with excellent time management and organizational skills to meet critical deadline

  • Ability to interface effectively with multiple functions/organizations and all levels of management.

  • Ability to design solutions that anticipate areas of contention and are adaptable to future changes

  • Strong data and problem solving ability

  • Ability to analyze, test and document solutions to ensure business requirements have been satisfied

  • Ability to administer data warehouse systems and other assigned systems/tools

  • Ability to effectively troubleshoot data inaccuracies, identify root causes, and take corrective action

  • Ability to effectively mentor and train associates within job family


PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & WORK ENVIRONMENT


Duties are performed in an office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the manual ability to utilize a computer keyboard and the ability to read printed material. Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane. Duties may require being on call periodically and working outside of normal working hours (holidays, evenings and weekends).

item.title: Software Engineer Python/Django at OptimData (Paris, France)
item.description:
Entreprise


OptimData est un centre de R&D en fort développement fondé en 2015 par Laurent Couillard, ex DG d’Exalead, avec un actionnariat composé de Technia et Transcat, leaders internationaux reconnus dans la distribution de solutions IT d’entreprises. Son objectif est de développer, de maintenir et de distribuer des solutions logicielles en mode SaaS afin d’aider les industriels dans leur transformation digitale. OptimData se démarque par une approche innovante basée sur la valorisation des données internes et externes à l’entreprise.


Dans un premier temps, OptimData répond aux besoins non couverts dans le domaine du service après-vente dans les secteurs des biens d’équipement et machines spéciales au moyen de l’application ProductInUse.


L’équipe d’OptimData est composée d’ingénieurs R&D passionnés par les enjeux et problématiques modernes liés aux données: Big Data, Apprentissage automatique & Internet des objets.


Mission


ProductInUse est une application web basée sur une stack web moderne: ReactJs/API Rest Django/PostGreSql/Cassandra. Vous serez en charge du développement de l’API qui est un composant central dans l’architecture car il est “responsable” du modèle de données. Ce composant est basé sur le Django Rest Framework et la librairie d'analyse de données pandas.


Les objectifs du poste sont:



  • Mise à jour du modèle de données

  • Développement des nouvelles API

  • Contribution à l’amélioration de la partie devops (déploiement, monitoring …)


Étant donné la position centrale du poste, les interactions avec les équipe connectivité, data science, infrastructure & front seront nombreuses. L’équipe travaille en “sprint” hebdomadai


Environnement



  • Infra: Cloud IBM sur debian

  • Versionning: git/github

  • Devops: ansible

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Enterprise Evaluated Pricing at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Data License (DL) is Bloomberg's market-leading enterprise reference data product. We build and maintain high-performance systems that process & deliver billions of data points per day. Our customers are key financial players that use our products to power their trading applications, settlement, risk management, corporate action processing, and much more. As a result, they require our system to be ultra-reliable and our data to be of the highest quality. Our product lines offer a variety of programmatic interfaces to a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including fixed income, CDS, currencies, equities, and futures & options. We interact closely with our business and sales teams and have many opportunities to design and develop innovative solutions to satisfy customer demands.

The Bloomberg Valuations (BVAL) product calculates pricing for over 2 million liquid and illiquid fixed income securities at several snapshots throughout the day. DL delivers this premium evaluated pricing data with related regulatory information to enterprise customers in order to meet requirements such as Net Asset Valuation calculations. We build solutions which calculate, validate, QC and deliver millions of data points in very short amount of time to fulfill client needs throughout the day. This rapidly growing product requires a highly efficient, scalable, and fault-tolerant architecture. To address the scalability needs of this product, we are working on a proof of concept using Hadoop. We are looking to dramatically increase our regulatory statistical offering by adding a suite of new products. These new offerings will allow our clients to evaluate their portfolio risks and help them meet the many new regulatory requirements that have been introduced and are currently being legislated.

In order to help us continue expanding our market share & reach, we are looking for a software developer to help us design and implement flexible, usable, and performant systems. We need a candidate who is detail oriented, has strong communication & problem solving skills, and has the desire to work in a close-knit team environment. Our work atmosphere is fast paced, spirited, and friendly. You will have the opportunity to work with a wide variety of different technologies - C++, Python, Perl, Java, Javascript, Hadoop - whatever it takes to get the job done.

item.title: Senior MAPS Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description: Bloomberg is looking for a senior developer with experience in Web Mapping to play a leading role in the design and implementation of a Web Mapping and Spatial Analytics product. item.title: Full Stack Java Web Developer at iSeeCars.com (Woburn, MA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Join our development team to create a smarter car search engine using big data to help customers find the best car deals around!  iSeeCars is founded by former TripAdvisor and SAP'ers, and we're growing at a tremendous speed.


Crunch through a large volume of data in the Cloud using Hadoop/EMR and make it accessible to millions of users in a friendly and innovative way. Build features that work seamlessly on desktop, mobile web and mobile app. You will work on all areas of the application and touch a wide range of technologies such as jQuery, bootstrap, Java, Hibernate, MySQL, Tomcat , Solr, Hadoop and much more. You will also have the opportunity to play a key role in bringing our rich feature set to an android application.


You’re an awesome full stack Java web developer who is passionate about working on all layers in the stack, everything from the Front End to the Back End. You like working on end user facing websites, mobile websites and the android platform.


You will be spending at least 80% of time in hands-on coding. If you are someone who likes to create a compelling user experience on web and mobile, and wants to work in a fast paced exciting startup trying to make a difference, then this is an ideal job for you.


**Will consider candidates within the US and Canada.

item.title: Senior Platform Engineer at Harry's (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role

As a Senior Platform Engineer at Harry’s, you’ll own, architect and expand key pieces of our app ranging from pick and pack systems to distribution optimization to global expansion.You’ll work across the stack with a focus on the back end, work in small product teams, and ship code every day. 

The Team

We chose to build an entirely custom e-commerce platform to power the business, with a focus on exceptional user experience, performance, reliability, and developer productivity. We strive to be lean, 

The Engineering Team at Harry's drives online experiences for customers and guides internal decision making. The team embraces and encourages a culture and build process that allows the things we build to be open-sourced, meaning our code and engineering products are of the highest quality - kind of like our razors.  You can learn more about the team and culture on the engineering blog.

Responsibilities: 


  • Own, architect and build core systems such as supply chain, as well as user facing features for our API layer.





  • Determine and strategize ways to operate more efficiently, like optimizing our inventory and shipping algorithms





  • Think about performance all the time, and proactively work to make our platform better





  • Communicate and work effectively with engineers, Product, and the business at-large. 





  • Mentor junior engineers, through direct pairing and mentoring, or setting a good example.

item.title: Junior Technical Project Manager at Xamarin (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Your Role:


Xamarin, created by developers, knows what developers want:  a modern programming language, powerful tools, an efficient and delightful workflow and the power to create the best user experiences. The Xamarin Platform allows developers to build native iOS, Android, Mac and Windows apps in C#. Together, we are on a mission to make it fast, easy and fun to build great mobile apps.


We have an opportunity available within the engineering team for a Junior Technical Project Manager supporting the Xamarin Platform. The role will assist with helping us to stay focused on our priorities and efficiently execute on them. As our developer community grows, the complexity and scope of our projects will continue to increase, and Project Management will optimize methods to help our growing teams work together to put out the highest quality developer tools.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Build strong working relationships with the Platform Engineering team and management to understand project needs and deliverables

  • Develop and manage end-to-end project plans and ensure on-time delivery while driving execution

  • Identify and provide potential resolutions to problems, project changes and resource constraints, escalating as necessary

  • Help to develop and implement new policies and processes for better engineering workflows that don’t inhibit the engineers

  • Communicate progress to all stakeholders, ensuring that team members are kept up to date with status of the project


What We’re Looking For:



  • Experience writing code or background in software development (C# / .NET preferred)

  • Project management experience is a bonus but exceptional attention to detail and analysis would be required

  • Demonstrated track record of clarifying requirements, defining project plans, tracking progress, and providing visibility with product or engineering team leads is helpful

  • A team-oriented, collaborative attitude with the ability to foster cooperation between project stakeholders

  • Ability to guide initiatives with shifting requirements and priorities in a fast-moving environment

  • A team-oriented and customer-centric mindset

  • Outstanding proactive communication skills - written, verbal, presentations, and more!

  • Bonus: Experience in software start-up environments

  • Bonus: Experience working on a distributed team

item.title: Modeling and Simulation Analyst at Stellar Science (Albuquerque, NM)
item.description:
Stellar Science is a growing Albuquerque-based scientific software development company seeking talented scientists that are interested in helping create and extend exciting scientific and engineering analysis applications. This is a new position at Stellar Science and we are looking for individuals that are interested in helping us define this role and mature our applications. Specifically, we are looking for individuals that are motivated, excited to learn new tools, and willing to help wherever they are needed.

We develop custom software products in domains that include computer vision and image processing, image simulation, high power microwave systems modeling and simulation, laser source generation and effects modeling, computational electromagnetics (CEM), space situational awareness (SSA), high performance computing (HPC), and computer aided design (CAD) tools, among others.

A Stellar Science Modeling and Simulation Analyst will be involved in all aspects of our application software life cycle, from marketing & business development to design, testing, documentation, and the customer interaction along the way. They will be working with management and the development teams to improve our applications and make our customers happy. We are looking for someone that has great verbal and written communication ability and stellar presentation skills. Someone that is eager to learn and excited to explore new domains.

Applicants may range from recent college graduates to experienced software engineers; the main requirements are that candidates be top-notch, responsible, self-motivated, honest, able to work well independently or in small teams, and be able to rapidly learn new tools, and techniques as needed to meet mission requirements.

Minimum Requirements:

B.S. in physics, math, engineering, or a related field
Confident, articulate, and professional speaking abilities
Exceptional computer skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience with software testing
Scientific analysis experience in one or more of the following domains:

  • Space Situational Awareness (SSA)
  • Image Simulation and Analysis
  • Computational Electromagnetics (CEM)
  • 3D CAD
  • Image-based Meshing
  • Directed Energy
  • Lasers
  • High Power Microwave (HPM)
  • High Performance Computing (HPC)
  • Modeling & Simulation

U.S. citizen willing to undergo background investigation and perform some work at Kirtland Air Force Base

Desired:

M.S. or Ph.D. in a scientific or engineering field with substantial scientific analysis experience

Stellar Science is a forward-thinking business that allows its employees to work at home on occasion when consistent with job requirements. Standard benefits include ten paid federal holidays (which may be floated as desired), three weeks vacation, a generous fully employer-funded SEP IRA, and fully employer-funded health insurance, as well as dental, disability, and life insurance.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin, in accordance with CFR 60-1.

item.title: Communication, News, And Realtime Applications And Services Developer (C++) at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
We develop key applications that the financial community relies on to interact with one another and to keep abreast of key news and market moving information. Our responsibilities include communication tools such as Bloomberg's proprietary Email and Instant Message products, Notes and Contact Management systems, News, Market Alerts and Monitoring applications. These are delivered across both desktop and mobile platforms. Our products are built to handle high volume, low latency and high availability. In addition, we build the core systems that form the foundation of applications built by other software groups within Bloomberg.

We have a deep understanding of our product areas and work closely with our business counterparts and UX design teams to deliver the experience desired by our customers. As the speed of change is rapid we need people who are agile and eager to learn and develop new skills. The ability to collaborate across multiple teams and learn a depth and breadth of technical and domain knowledge is critical.

We frequently work with open source software and encourage interaction with the wider technology community by contributing changes and taking part in related meet-ups and conferences.

Teams in Communication, News, and Realtime Applications and Services:

Bloomberg Chat

Bloomberg Chat is Bloomberg's instant messaging system. It is used by the entire Bloomberg community for real-time communication to exchange quotes, trade ideas, news and other financial information. The Bloomberg Chat team in London is responsible for ensuring the fast and efficient distribution of content through our data centers to the client application running on our customers' desktops.

Message and Collaboration

Internet Message - The Bloomberg Message system delivers over 300 million messages every day. The Internet Message system converts messages between email and Bloomberg's proprietary Message format. Software written by the team must be scalable, fault tolerant and secure. Our work also includes evolving and extending our solutions for detecting spam, malware and phishing.

Contact Management - Bloomberg's most popular functions are its communication tools (Message and Chat). Users of these systems need a fast, secure and reliable way to store their contact information. The Bloomberg contact management system contains data on over 50 million contacts, all of which can be queried in under a millisecond. In the last 12 months, we developed a brand new interface, which we continue to evolve. Our focus this year is our backend systems as we work on improving performance and scalability.

Notes - Notes is an exciting new product being developed to further improve the collaboration capabilities of the Bloomberg system. It will enable users to annotate and curate Bloomberg content for quick retrieval and organization, providing insightful ways to analyze user-generated content.

Mobile

The Mobile team has the charge to take Bloomberg's key financial and foundational applications and deliver them to all major mobile platforms. We are a mix of both client side iOS and Android specialists, and other backend developers focused on infrastructure who use their platform native skills mixed with C++ to deliver an immersive mobile experience. Developers are involved in full end to end development of native UI components and the required client and server infrastructure that connects devices to Bloomberg data services. Security and usability concerns are also a major focus for our team.

News Editing & Workflow

The News Editing and Workflow team is responsible for the tools used by the Bloomberg News organization for the timely release of accurate, market moving news. The team also develops the Bloomberg News Automation suite, which generates thousands of news stories per day with minimal latency, which is triggered by realtime Bloomberg market data and events.

News Search

The News Search team owns the search and alerting backend behind the news functionality across Bloomberg. This is one of the most widely used functions on the Bloomberg Terminal. It serves timely, accurate and market moving news to our customers by sifting through hundreds of millions of news stories. Our customers can search, analyze and set alerts for the news that matters to them in milliseconds. Developers work on scalable, low-latency solutions by making use of search and information retrieval technologies, and working with distributed systems running on dedicated farms of machines.

Realtime Applications

Alerts - The Alert product lets market participants monitor the markets. It exposes nearly every tick in the world, along with a broad range of non-pricing data from corporate actions to social media sentiment and even power station outages. The system is available 24/7 and is used by tens of thousands of traders and investors helping them respond quickly to changing market conditions. Alerts are a major strategic focus for the company and we are scaling our infrastructure and extending our feature set significantly.

Monitors - The Monitors team is responsible for providing industry-leading, comprehensive, fully custom cross-asset quote sheet applications. 200,000 of our clients rely on these applications every day. The team deploys Bloomberg's latest proprietary technologies and UI framework by making further UX improvements, while maintaining a strong focus on performance and reliability.

Trade Ideas - The Trade Ideas application allows users to exchange investment research and recommendations in order to demonstrate their skills. The Trade Ideas Platform comprises high-performance distributed multi-threaded services, real-time publishing, both SQL and NoSQL databases, with desktop, web and mobile clients.

item.title: Software Engineer at DC Energy (Tysons, VA)

This is a hands-on, technical role in a highly-collaborative team. Responsibilities will include development of software new and old across many aspects of our business. As your experience grows, you will contribute to more general design and architecture questions.

item.title: Software Engineer, Product Testing at Tableau Software (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
What you’ll be doing…


In this position, you will be a member of a team of dedicated software engineers focused on testing a suite of next-generation Visual Analytics and Collaboration products. You will help define the strategy for testing interfaces in a cross-platform manner. You will leverage open source tools and build new tools to help ship a high quality product that delights customers. In addition, you have a special fondness for things that are simple, elegant and effective.


Some of the things you’ll be doing include…



  • Writing code to create, improve and maintain new and existing frameworks

  • Analyzing source code to understand areas of risk and complexity to provide optimal test coverage

  • Helping Drive a Test Culture across the entire company

  • Other duties as assigned


Within Product Testing, there are different technical groups:



  • Client:  Tableau designs products for people who use software, not necessarily for people who buy software – the Client team in Product Testing is all about ensuring these products we build provide a delightful experience for our customers.  We understand our customers and how they use our products.  We build robust automation systems with Java and Python that precisely mimic product scenarios and validate the look and accuracy of the resulting visualizations.  We also use our in-development products every day to visualize data in the same way our customers do.  Our team is focused on our desktop client application for Windows and Mac, our browser rendered visualizations on all browsers and all platforms (Windows, mac, mobile) and also our native mobile apps on the iPad and Android tablets.

  • Mobile: The shift towards mobile devices and the increasing need to see and understand your data, are two of the hottest trends in the industry today, and the Mobile team at Tableau is at the confluence of the two. The Tableau Mobile team has been tasked with a single mission: to make the mobile experience the most delightful way for our customers to stay on top of their data. We build next-generation apps for iOS and Android for consumers and enterprises alike, and ensure quality through a variety of modern, innovative techniques, including white-box automation, data-driven pair-wise testing, and instrumentation tools.

  • Platform: As a member of one of our platform teams you’ll work on Tableau’s secret sauce. We are about connecting, querying, integrating and preparing data from nearly 50 different data sources. We are about calculations and statistical analytics. We are about first class test frameworks and more. Ideal candidates will be skilled in one or more programming language, for example Python, C++, C# or Java. Working knowledge of one or more database technology like SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle, DB2, Hadoop or Apache Spark is preferred. Our team verifies that Tableau’s platform is functionally correct, reliable, scalable and high performance for our Windows and Mac desktop as well as our server products. We employ modern testing methodologies to tame the permutation explosion beast and we have fun doing it.

  • Server: The Server Testing group at Tableau owns product quality for Corporate Enterprise Server and Cloud Hosted Services (Tableau Online and Tableau Public). We have a group of dedicated software engineers focused on quality covering overall end to end scenarios as well as functional, performance and scale-out testing of Frontend and Backend components. You will help define the strategy and for testing interfaces and implement tests in a cross-platform manner while leveraging open source tools and build new tools to help ship a high quality product that delights customers. We work closely with our developers and do our daily develop in Java.

  • Performance: Tableau is a product where smart meets speed. This means you can use Tableau to make sense of your big data and be creative. The Performance Test Engineer at Tableau measures and verifies the latencies of Tableau functionalities using different data sizes and sources; they also measure the Page Load Time and throughputs of the Tableau servers.  Our Performance Test engineers use cutting edge testing strategies, frameworks and tools to hold the product to a very high performance bar. Candidates for this group need to be familiar with object oriented languages and feel comfortable to use industry standard performance test frameworks such as JMeter.


Who you are…



  • Experienced. 1-5+ years of experience testing and profiling large-scale C++ systems and highly scalable Java and/or Ruby server systems that back dynamic, highly interactive web experiences. Experience testing on Windows platforms, with experience testing on multiple platforms including Linux. Strong knowledge of database concepts is a plus.

  • Highly Technical. You love writing things that “just work” – things that are robust, scalable and that perform well. Excellent understanding of languages such as C++, Java, Ruby, and Python as well as programming experience with Javascript and css/html. Strong knowledge of development and test tools, in particular Selenium, junit and java tools.

  • Passionate about Quality. A love of testing, tuning and analysis through a rigorous scientific approach.

  • Self-Motivated. You do good work and the drive to deliver is just a part of you.

  • Team Player. You enjoy collaborating with, learning from, and teaching others so we all can become better. You assume the good intent in others, and actively do your part to create a positive work environment.

  • Customer Focused. You want to learn about customers, their challenges & scenarios and you find satisfaction in shipping quality products that delight customers.

  • You have high standards, and your personal software practices ensure you deliver high quality no matter what.  You believe in constantly releasable quality, iterations, design for testability, and you build your own tools & techniques to achieve high quality and low cost of support.  You deliver better results through using quality practices every day, and you even have taught or influenced others to improve their practices.

  • Educated. Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent
