item.title: Director of Mobile Engineering at Work Market (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Work Market is the leading platform for freelance labor. Our freelance management platform is providing the biggest brands in the world and freelancing businesses, with a solution that allows both sides to manage an end-to-end contract engagement at scale. We are right in the middle of a rapidly growing freelance economy that will make up 50% of the workforce by 2020.



What We Do:


We enable clients with the ability to expand and contract their workforce based on market demands and allow them to stay relevant and efficient in a competitive marketplace. We provide access to on-demand subject matter experts that allow companies to be productive and efficient. We offer freelancers the ability to have a flexible work schedule and to be selective about their project engagements while also building their portfolio.



Our Team:


Our engineers build the freelance management (FMS) platform and workflows that allow our customer to be more efficient and effective in a competitive marketplace. We are customer driven, our engineers work closely with the Product team to help define and articulate a vision for the Work Market FMS platform. We focus on providing simple, elegant solutions to complex problems



Responsibilities: 




    Provide hands-on leadership to a growing team of mobile software developers.




    Co-develop mobile strategy and roadmap for Work Market’s native iOS and Android apps.  




    Build prototypes and mobile applications to meet the demands of our large iOS and Android audiences. 
    Scale and oversee development work through vendor and contractor services. 






    Travel to New York (HQ) and establish relationships and bridge communication gaps between technical and non-technical colleagues, teams, and senior managers. 




    Executive manager of the office.




Qualifications: 




    10+ years of software engineering experience 




    6+ years in management 




    Successful background leading mobile software development teams




    Experience in API development and integration




    Experience scaling and augmenting development teams through vendor and contractor services 




    Knowledge of mobile architecture best practices 




    Proven track record with iOS and Android 




    A deep understanding of the differences between user interaction on a phone and tablet 




    Excellent coding and testing skills in Objective C and Java 




    Exceptional written and verbal communication abilities Experience with HTML 5 and JavaScript a plus 



    A Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Mathematics

item.title: Senior Software Engineer / Architect at HBO Code Labs (New York, NY)
item.description:
At the largest and most respected streaming media firm in the world, we believe that digital technologies will create a new era of entertainment products. Out of our passion for technology and content, we have created Code Labs, a new software engineering group with offices in Seattle and New York City.


The fundamental goals of Code Labs are to accelerate our ability to innovate; to deliver compelling new consumer experiences; and to develop new types of interactive experiences that enhance our entertainment franchises.


Exploring this nexus of technology and entertainment requires a staff of highly motivated and technically flexible software professionals across a variety of disciplines: development, program management, test, and design. We are hiring people in all areas of product development to build a team that can create engaging, high-quality products and interactive experiences. We need expertise in devices-such as smart phones, tablets, game consoles, and PCs-as well as expertise in cloud computing and web services. Above all, we need a team that can take that expertise and accomplish things that have never been done before-because that's what we're doing.


Primary Responsibilities:


What you'll do: You will work with compelling consumer devices to expand our constellation of devices offering our video streaming applications. In addition, you will create new technologies to enhance and deliver our content portfolio to a new generation of digital media entertainment. You will work within a team of experienced and diverse software engineers and partner with designers and server-side teams to deliver entertainment experience to delight consumers.



Requirements:


What we're looking for: A highly skilled individual who has a proven track record and takes pride in bringing high-quality code quickly to market, enjoys learning and applying new technologies, and thrives in a dynamic engineering-oriented work environment.



Successful applicants must have:



  • BS or MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or other equivalent technical degree

  • At least 10 years industry experience

  • Expertise with one or more of C, C++, C#, Objective-C, Java or JavaScript/HTML5/CSS



Tools we like:



  • Multi-fluency with C, C++, Objective-C, Java, JavaScript, and HTML5/CSS

  • Experience with devices such as tablets, smart phones, and game consoles

  • OS: Windows, iOS, Android, MacOS, Linux



Questions?


You may already know if you're a fit, but perhaps you're worried about technology and experience requirements? Don't be - our client is looking for a smart, proven engineer; if you're the right candidate, they’re flexible and happy to teach. A strong engineer with experience solving problems at scale should have no problems excelling on our client’s team.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Time Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Job Category:


Technology/Engineering


Time Inc. is one of the largest branded media companies in the world. The company reaches more than 130 million people globally each month across multiple platforms, with influential brands like Time, People, Sports Illustrated, InStyle, Real Simple, Travel + Leisure, Food & Wine and Wallpaper. Time Inc. is home to celebrated events and franchises including the Fortune 500, Time 100, People's Most Beautiful, Sports Illustrated's Sportsman of the Year, Essence Festival in New Orleans and the Food & Wine Classic in Aspen.


The job:


The Senior Software Engineer at Time Inc. will be responsible for leading a team of developers responsible for building new and support existing Time Inc websites. Successful candidates will be strong engineers who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, have a consistent track record of delivery, and excellent software engineering skills. Our customers require creative engineering balanced with high quality and a customer focus. In addition, this person must be able to work across multiple facets of the project and juggle multiple responsibilities at the same time. The individual must have strong analytic capability and the ability to create innovative solutions. We are looking for a highly motivated individual who is looking to grow their career in a fast paced environment.


You will:



  • Work closely with project stakeholders including editorial, sales, marketing, and business development.

  • Own new project development and ongoing site maintenace.

  • Work with the following technologies PhP, Drupal 7, CSS, HTML, JS, Jquery, SASS, and other common front-end technologies.

item.title: Software Engineering Manager at Yext (New York, NY)
item.description:
We believe the most successful engineering orgs move quick and communicate efficiently.  To facilitate this, we keep our teams small at at 3-7 members, use Scrum methodology, and run two week sprints with daily stands up.  The first Monday of the sprint is planning, and the second Friday is demo day where teams show off what they've accomplished the past two weeks.


Our mission is to be a global software company that is constantly pushing the envelope.  Whether it's scaling our systems to handle another 100k locations, doing R&D on new products and features, or minimizing the time it takes information to go from our CMS to our publisher partners, our engineers work on challenging problems that make an impact.  The best way to learn is hands on, so we're going to have you pushing code from week one.  


Responsibilities



  • Lead full life-cycle software development

  • Drive the development process through design, implementation, and deployment

  • Work closely with the executive team to develop a software roadmap for future features and improvements

  • Mentor team members, encouraging career and personal growth

  • Ensure your team meets deadlines and launch dates through an effective sprint planning process and daily standups

  • Collaborate effectively across teams, including outside of engineering

item.title: .NET Engineer at The Nerdery (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Nerdery is seeking a .NET Software Engineer to work on a wide variety of projects as part of our team.


About the Software Engineering Team


At the Nerdery, our Software Engineering team believes strongly in quality workmanship, meaningful collaboration, and outstanding customer service. We pride ourselves on being able to partner with our clients to develop custom software to solve their business problems.


From startups to corporations, our team makes an impact on millions of users every day.


About the Position


As a .NET Software Engineer at The Nerdery, you'll have the opportunity to work on projects for a wide range of clients. We have opportunities to solve customer projects with a wide variety of frameworks and platforms such as ASP.NET MVC, Web Api, Umbraco, Sitecore, Entity Framework and many more. The position provides opportunities to expand your horizons to reach your personal development goals.


Most of our engineers contribute to a multitude of projects each year. You’ll never feel like you’re stuck working on a single project for the rest of your career.

item.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer at fromAtoB GmbH (Aachen, Deutschland)
item.description:
We have some exciting engineering challenges coming up and would love to welcome you to our tight-knit team of creative developers as Ruby on Rails Specialist.


YOU ARE A GOOD FIT FOR OUR TEAM, IF YOU


... get excited about good quality code and engineering quests


... have a roll up your sleeves and Rock ’n’ Roll attitude


… insist on outstanding quality


… are willing to produce simple solutions to complex problems


… love constant improvements, sharing your ideas and to work in an international team

item.title: VP Engineering at Shareroot (Berkeley, CA)
item.description:
You will be working closely with the CTO -- an industry veteran from the mobile advertising space with extensive full-stack experience. Your key contributions will have significant impact on influencing the early direction and success of the company, and some of your responsibilities will include...


• Working on a Django, AWS-deployed back-end, jQuery/HTML5/Backbone front-end, and internal sales and analytics tools.
• Managing a small team of engineers.

item.title: Looking for brilliant Engineers at Voovio (Alcobendas, Spain)
item.description:
We need world-class engineers to develop our Industrial Solution Platform based on our proprietary technology called Enhanced Reality (ER). The problem space includes everything from dealing in a browser with a huge set of 2D images transformed in 3D self-contained spaces to the development of faster and smarter ways for creating those spaces.


We are looking for talented and passionate engineers who love to code but are not intimidated by challenging problems. You should be interested in pushing the limits of our technology.


You will be responsible for modules of our products and you will need to help the team make tradeoffs between functionality, time and complexity. Having a keen product sense is very important; being able to understand the needs of our customers is also critical. Finally, decentralized decision making must be something you encourage and foster in our culture.

item.title: Know JavaScript? Join us in building a payment product using ReactJS! at Pangea (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
We’re an early stage startup seeking a engineer with a passion for building great user experiences. We’re in an exciting and rapidly evolving industry that requires constant innovation, evaluation, and iteration. We believe innovation is a result of collaboration across teams. As such, this position will require flexibility, regular coordination and effective communication with the creative, engineering, product, and marketing teams.


The right engineer has cutting-edge JavaScript skills and excellent interpersonal communication. Pangea is located in the River North neighborhood at State and Kinzie.

item.title: Software Developer at Gemvision (Lafayette, LA)
item.description:
Software Developer position working on all aspects of the development life cycle including: requirements, design, coding, testing, and deployment. Applicants should be able to work both independently and in a team environment. Ideal candidates are highly motivated, passionate about technology, eager to learn, and able to come up with innovative solutions to challenging problems. We are looking for developers of all levels.


Responsibilities include developing software, architecture, specifications, and technical interfaces. This position reports directly to the Software Development Manager. Must understand, and make use of, available software development tools and environments. Must maintain knowledge and skills for the technologies utilized within the department. Applicants need to comply with team development standards and procedures. Works with users/team to determine application requirements. Must be willing to communicate daily progress, interact with the team in direct discussion, and converse indirectly via supported messaging tools.

item.title: Sr. Software Developer at Ceridian Dayforce (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Summary: 


Reporting to the Development Manager, the Senior Developer is responsible for designing and implementing new development projects as well completing and augmenting the current solutions and services. They will collaborate with Technical Product Managers, Developers, Technical Writing and Quality Assurance throughout the development process to ensure the product is functionally complete and well-engineered. This is an excellent opportunity to join a rapidly growing innovator in a technically challenging and rewarding role. Through our training and mentoring program, you will develop deep technical expertise and gain valuable business and industry related experience.

item.title: Hackers wanted - Leidenschaftliche Programmierer / Entwickler (m/w) gesucht. at freiheit.com technologies gmbh (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Hackers wanted - Leidenschaftliche Programmierer / Entwickler (m/w) und Machine Learning Experten mit erstklassigem Abschluss in Informatik, Physik oder Mathematik gesucht.



  • Du hast eine erstklassige Abschlussnote in Informatik, Physik oder Mathematik.

  • Du kannst Dir nichts Besseres vorstellen, als Programme unter GNU/Linux zu schreiben.

  • Du „sprichst fließend“ Java, C++ oder Go, interessierst Dich aber auch für JavaScript, Machine Learning und für funktionale Sprachen wie Common Lisp, Clojure, Erlang oder Haskell.

  • Du löst gerne schwierige Probleme. Du möchtest in kleinen Teams mit intelligenten Menschen zusammenarbeiten.

  • Von der Konzeption über die Entwicklung, das Testing und die Auslieferung bist Du in alle Phasen des Software-Engineerings involviert. 

  • Du lernst gerne jeden Tag etwas Neues. Du bist ehrlich und hast Humor.

  • Du willst nicht irgendeinen Job, sondern Du willst mit Deinen Ideen und Deinem Können etwas bewegen!

  • Ach ja, gerne kannst Du auch Deine Abschlussarbeit bei uns schreiben.


Dazugehören? Schicke Deine vollständige Bewerbung an jobs@freiheit.com


Von der Konzeption über die Entwicklung, das Testing und die Auslieferung bist Du in alle Phasen des Software-Engineerings involviert.

item.title: QA Engineer at On-Site (Campbell, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer who can support a small team of engineers and develop automated tests that we can rely on to ensure our new code is safe to release.


Do you take joy in spotting what others miss? We are looking for someone who understands how frustrating it is when things don’t work right; who feels it is their duty to protect the world from bad code.


We want an engineer who understands how to build automated tests that are reliable and easy to maintain.



  • Support a team of engineers, acting as gatekeeper for their changes

  • Build and maintain automated test suites for multiple web based products

  • Identify areas of risk and develop appropriate test plans

  • Perform investigation of escalated issues

  • “Fight for the user”

item.title: PHP Engineer for Fast-growing SaaS Company in Fort Worth at Koddi (Fort Worth, TX)
item.description:
Koddi develops platforms that help digital advertisers market more intelligently and optimize advanced ad campaigns. We're expanding our engineering team to scale out the successful product set we have by integrating more deeply with current clients and expanding into related verticals.


Why work at Koddi?



  • You will solve problems that are hard, fun, and rewarding

  • You will work on a team that is smart, experienced, motivated, and ambitious

  • We have an engineer-friendly environment

  • You will get to move very quickly and deliver for clients

  • Your clients will be intelligent and industry leaders

  • You will develop relationships with premier partners (Google, TripAdvisor, etc)


This role - PHP Engineer / Developer - will work on our engineering team to maximize the performance and functionality of the current platform while contributing to new features and functionality.

item.title: Senior iOS Developer at Xero (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We’re looking for product-focused mobile engineers who are passionate builders and who also appreciate the customer experience. We’re looking for someone who is versed in iOS development, but also has a understanding of great UX. We are building the worlds greatest employee experiences and you can make a real difference to millions of employees worldwide. Who are you?



  • 7+ years of development experience, with at least 2 years as an iOS Engineer.




  • Experience shipping Objective-C iOS apps, ideally currently available on the App Store.




  • Personal projects that show an aptitude for engineering and strong customer experience.




  • Ability to work in areas outside of their usual comfort zone and get things done.




  • Communication skills for a highly collaborative software engineering and design process.




Your Skills:




  • Excellent verbal communication, analytical skill, critical thinking and problem solving skills




  • Knowledge and experience with agile methodologies




  • Ability to bring new ideas to the table and a passion for all things mobile






  • Ability to work with product owners and designers to ensure product usability.




If you’re passionate about building software that enables small businesses to use software more effectively, are involved in the development community, and love working with and developing the latest technologies, then we want to hear from you today!

Xero is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

item.title: Mobile Developer - iOS or Android at 500px Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
500px is an online community for sharing, discovering, buying and selling of high-quality photography. Millions of people from around the world use the 500px mobile apps to view inspiring photography, upload their own best photos, and interact with other photographers. Your job is to make the apps that deliver the best user experience for them.


You:



  • Learn fast

  • Write thoughtfully clean code

  • Are a world-class developer, or are actively working towards that

  • Published mobile apps (please provide links)


Ideally, you:



  • Love photography (please provide links)

  • Love contributing to open source (please provide links)


The Job:



  • Build beautiful apps that keep millions of users engaged everyday

  • Grow as part of a world-class mobile team

  • Innovate: smart camera, personalization, advanced image editing etc.


The Company:



  • The premier online photography community

  • High-growth startup

  • Well funded by some of the best investors

  • Strong partnerships with the biggest tech and media companies

  • Open and diverse company culture

  • Innovative engineering team with non-managerial career path

  • Awesome office in Toronto downtown core


The Process:



  1. Phone screening

  2. Meet the team at our office

  3. Coding exercise at our office

  4. Meet with the management team

  5. You are presented with an offer

item.title: Software Developer at VI Company (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
At VI Company you never stop learning, the projects and techniques are constantly changing. You enjoy discovering new techniques and you review your old work critically to see how you can improve it. It's no problem for you to explain why you chose a certain solution and you like to share your findings with colleagues and the clients.


As a software developer you work closely together with a front-end developer and designer in a project team. With your creativity and skills you create online solutions for financial markets. You are responsible for the processing of complex data, you develop web applications and connect these applications to external systems. For example, you collect quotes or you provide data for other parties.

item.title: Implementation Developer at Stevens Capital Management LP (Wayne, PA)
item.description:
Stevens Capital Management LP (“SCM”) is a registered investment adviser with more than sixty employees that manages a multi-billion dollar hedge fund that has been in business for 20+ years.


SCM specializes in the rigorous development and disciplined implementation of empirically based quantitative trading strategies. Our highly productive team works in a fast-paced collegial environment, utilizing extensive data sets, technology and the scientific method to devise and employ trading strategies throughout the world’s most liquid financial markets.


We’re looking for exceptional candidates for the following position:


Implementation Software Developer


We're seeking highly driven, production-oriented developers who possess strong technical skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced collaborative environment. 


Primary Responsibilities



  • Develop and support multi-threaded applications with a strong emphasis on high performance.

  • Optimize our trading strategy implementation and performance analysis platform using network and systems programming.

  • Create tools to process, store and analyze quote, order and financial data.

  • Work closely with our quantitative research analysts, engineers and other groups to provide software solutions.


Requirements



  • Professional-level C++ programming experience in a Linux environment.

  • A Computer Science or Mathematics degree.

  • Outstanding problem solving skills.

  • Knowledge of shell scripts and other languages including Perl, Bash or CSH is a plus.

  • Experience with relational databases including Sybase, SQL Server and Oracle is a plus.

  • Experience with GUI design is a plus.

item.title: Support engineer for SaaS cloud monitoring service at Server Density (London, UK)
item.description:
We're looking for a salaried full time support engineer with experience in devops and/or Python programming. You will be helping our customers make the most of our server monitoring and systems management service, Server Density - https://www.serverdensity.com


Support is an engineering position at Server Density, which means you will be expected to work on fixes directly to the product codebase. This is a great opportunity to develop your programming skills with the ability to progress and move into the full product engineering team over time if you wish.


This role will be based in our custom designed, London office with flexibility to work from home. Half our team work from around the UK and Europe using tools like Hipchat, Google+, Google Hangouts and Github to collaborate.


What will you be working on?



  • Support engineering - all our customers are developers or sysadmins so need expert technical advice when they contact us. This often involves troubleshooting edge cases and helping them manage their infrastructure, through Server Density. This will mean responding to customer queries via e-mail, live chat and on the phone, and consulting with their technical teams to help them use the product.


  • Problem triage - you'll be responsible for determining when there are problems with our product, figuring out where the bugs are and logging them for investigation by the right person, with the relevant information.


  • Fixing problems - you'll be expected to investigate and fix as many problems as you can yourself, and engage with our engineering and ops teams to get issues resolved as quickly as possible. This means you'll be able to work directly on the product code base to get right to the source of customer problems. This is an engineering role within the product engineering team, so you will be expected to work on programming problems!


  • Shaping the roadmap - as someone who will interact directly with our customers, you'll be able to help shape our roadmap based on their feedback and the problems you see.

item.title: Infrastructure Security Manager at Doctor Evidence (Santa Monica, CA) (allows remote)
item.description: Assess information security risks and develop solutions to safeguard information infrastructure

item.title: Backend Engineer at x.ai (New York, NY)
item.description:
• Build, evolve and scale out infrastructure to ingest, process and extract meaning out of free form text

  • Jump between architecture, implementation, infrastructure management, and firefighting

  • Design and build a system that enables seamless human-machine interactions

  • Solve various optimization and constraint problems related to coordinating people’s schedules and preferences

  • Integrate with various external APIs

  • Constantly improve our development processes and tools to reduce friction from idea to deployment

item.title: Client Facing C++ Developer at Continuum Analytics (New York, NY)
item.description: We are looking for accomplished scientists and engineers interested in a customer-facing software consultancy role that could lead to full time placement with a customer at the conclusion of a project.   The right candidate will also play a key role in providing user-requirements for our core technologies and products.  The successful candidate will have a strong technical background with 8+ years C/C++ development experience and 5+ years industry experience.

item.title: Front End Software Engineer at McLaren Applied Technologies (Woking, UK)
item.description:
Front end software engineers at McLaren Applied Technologies create innovative solutions using the latest open source technologies. We need smart engineers who are passionate about technology to join our team and help us provide timely insight into data for our customers. Your technical expertise will help us design, develop, test, deploy, and enhance software solutions that display and analyze data quickly and efficiently. You could be writing a web application with AngularJS or a desktop application with Electron.


Responsibilities:



  • Create efficient and reusable front-end solutions.

  • Develop small prototypes and spikes that reduce risk.

  • Actively contribute to agile ceremonies.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Bloomberg Mail Infrastructure at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
Bloomberg Mail is a cloud-based platform used for Internet email, bond announcements and pricing, financial research distribution and many other types of communication on the Bloomberg Terminal. Our users rely on Bloomberg Mail because of its real-time performance, massive scale, ironclad security, tight integration with financial data and applications on the Bloomberg Terminal, unique features like message retraction and "your message was read!" notification, machine learning-based message classification and, most importantly, singular access to the Bloomberg network of 350,000 financial professionals. We are looking for exceptional Senior Software Engineers who are interested in designing and building the next generation of this unparalleled product.

Our system is built on top of Open Source, commercial and proprietary technologies. This highly available, large-scale distributed system includes a comprehensive storage and search infrastructure, real-time email transport and delivery pipeline, real-time classification engine for user-based and machine learning-based tagging, APIs for integration with other applications and systems, as well as a feature-rich and powerful user-interface optimized for our specialized customers.

The Mail team is looking for C/C++ experts who are interested in working on high-performance infrastructure. A developer in this role will work in a highly distributed, multi-threaded environment on problems including indexing and retrieval of mail and files for both core databases and Search, APIs to that data for internal clients, and ensuring stability and scalability of a system that has increased its traffic 20% year over year for the last five years.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Palo Alto OR Seattle) at Coupang (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Coupang - Sr. Software Engineer - Palo Alto or Seattle


What if you could set the standard of how e-commerce can and should be done around the world?


Now you can at Coupang!



We are Korea’s largest online retailer and our goal is to create the next-generation e-commerce model. According to Nikesh Arora, we are “one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive Internet companies in the world.” In just 4 years, we already have over 25M devoted users and over $2.5B in annual revenue. And we are just getting started!



We just closed a whopping $1 BILLION round of funding, and we are about to undergo hypergrowth! We have offices in Seoul, Shanghai, Palo Alto, Seattle, and Ontario, CA. We are looking to double our amazing team in the U.S.!



If you want to work in a fun, challenging environment while changing how the world thinks about e-commerce, then we want to hear from you!



About the role:



You’ll get to work with the best in the industry, with many of our team members coming from Amazon, eBay, PayPal, Facebookand more! You’ll work in a collaborative and open environment where we consider ourselves a family (Check out our Family Day!). And our agile environment will enable you to rapidly innovate with the most cutting edge technologies.



What you’ll do:


You’ll be faced with unique challenges to scale we aim to grow to more than 55M+ users in Korea alone. You’ll also get to push the envelope of what’s possible with mobile commerce (currently over 75% of our sales are done on mobile)!



Some specific things you’ll work on:



  • Highly Scalable and Reliable services oriented architecture

  • Big Data Analytics supporting data collection, modeling, and optimization

  • Strategic domains such as mobile payments, pricing, search, personalization, and supply chain management.

  • Consumer driven web and native mobile interfaces and APIs.



(We are only able to consider candidates local to the U.S. at this time. Thank you for your interest!)

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Machine Learning, Performance Targeting at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Performance Targeting & Optimization team’s mission is to help our customers understand their audience better and to deliver relevant advertising across all mediums on the Internet. The team builds and operates realtime prediction and control systems that power all our advertising products at scale. This means getting up-close and personal with cutting edge statistical models and machine learning techniques. You’ll have the opportunity to leverage Quantcast’s massive computing power to build tens of thousands of machine learned models, and to use these models to make over 2 million advertising decisions per second.


We are looking for top-tier senior talent to lead our efforts in designing, implementing and operating large scale ML systems in a production environment. The successful applicant will have industry experience applying techniques like classification, clustering and control optimization to solve big data problems. You’ll work within a machine learning group that is obsessed with improving the state of the art in performance advertising. You’ll take full ownership of the development and operation of ML systems to run advertising campaigns at a global scale. You’ll also introduce new products aimed at providing a complete targeting solution for our advertisers.


The team also works closely with our scientific advisors, Stanford professors Jerome Friedman and Trevor Hastie. As leaders in the fields of data mining and statistics, both professors take an active interest in Quantcast and our ongoing work.


Responsibilities



  • Design, build and operate large scale machine learning systems and supporting infrastructure.

  • Develop techniques to efficiently extract meaning from petabytes of data.

  • Improve existing ad targeting products and introduce new end-to-end products to delight our customers.

  • Interface with Product & Business Operations teams to translate business requirements into robust and scalable solutions.

item.title: Software Developer - Front-end, Data Visualization at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 

We are looking for entry-level programmers that have some formal computer science training, but are just starting their careers. You should know javascript and some javascript libraries like jQuery, D3, etc, and have an interest in data visualization, data science, and internet technologies. Most importantly, you should be hungry to build big, important applications that matter, and looking for projects to flex your newly developed coding muscles on. 

Experience with a variety of different internet technologies would be a bonus, but not necessary - we view this very much as a learn-on-the-job type position and as a result are valuing smarts, motivation and desire-to-learn over experience. These positions will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to Exaptive's Boston and Vancouver locations. The position will have the opportunity to evolve into a role in which the person has an equity-stake in the company. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as a benefit, not a drawback. The startup environment is not for everyone, but for the person who is looking for that sort of life experience, the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 

Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 

If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation expenses.

item.title: Experienced Front-End Engineer at Geckoboard (London, UK)
item.description:
Geckoboard is a successful and growing 25-person B2B SaaS startup based in East London. Our elegant, real-time dashboards solve a difficult but valuable problem for thousands of paying subscribers, by taking the complexity out of connecting to their data and making that data simple for anyone to interpret at a glance. As a result, our customers unlock data they didn't know they had, connect people and join up projects, and make better decisions faster.


We are looking for a full-time senior front-end engineer who has built rich JavaScript clients. You’ll be opinionated, but contemplative. You won’t immediately reach for your favourite framework or library when approaching a problem. You'll be comfortable liaising with our product designer on design and implementation. You’ll relish the opportunity to continually improve an existing product through refactoring and the removal/addition of features.


Displaying complicated data to our customers so they can easily understand what’s going on and make actionable decisions is a big challenge. We're constantly tweaking and improving how we visualise data on Geckoboard, whether through adding more visualizations or updating what we have.


At Geckoboard you will:



  • Write clean, modular, test driven code

  • Implement visual design from prototypes

  • Test compatibility with various browsers

  • Pick the best library for the job

  • Care about web performance 


More than anything, we value candidates who are excited about picking up new skills and sharing what they’ve learned with the rest of the team - for example, none of us knew Go or React a short time ago, but now both are key parts of our stack. We love people with a keen attention to detail and the willingness to apply it in shaping all aspects of our product.

item.title: Software Developer: Casual Data-Driven Firm at TFS Capital (West Chester, PA)
item.description:
TFS Capital LLC is a boutique asset management firm in West Chester, PA. We are seeking a well-rounded software developer to join our development team. This developer will help maintain and expand our proprietary automated data-driven trading systems. As a key member of a small development team, you will be an integral part of all aspects of our mission-critical trading infrastructure. In addition to working with existing systems, you will be assisting with making and implementing design decisions for new and improved data and software architecture. The position is full-time in our West Chester, PA office.


Technology is at the heart of our business. At TFS, you and the rest of the technology team will work directly with traders, quants, and portfolio managers to solve interesting and challenging problems using technology. Your actions will directly impact the success of our business.


TFS Capital will not consider applicants who require H1-B Visa sponsorship for this position.


Key responsibilities



  • Work with the rest of the development team to expand and maintain the firm’s proprietary software systems

  • Work directly with the trading desk, analysis team, portfolio managers, and other business groups to support existing systems and implement new ideas

  • Onboard new, diverse, large datasets and create appropriate ETL processes


About the IT Team
We are a small team of developers and operations admins who work together to develop, maintain, and expand our in-house trading software. In addition to our code, we integrate and assist with development of code from other teams, including the traders and analysts. We work directly with traders and analysts daily, and most of the TFS team on a regular basis.


We’re primarily a Windows shop, but use Linux where it fits best. The bulk of our software is written in Java, but we also have a ton of Perl and MATLAB, and some Python and C#. We use Microsoft SQL Server for relational data storage.

item.title: Senior Level Back-End Web Developer at Moore & Scarry Advertising (Fort Myers, FL)
item.description:
Job Title:       Senior Level Back-End Web Developer


Job Status:     Full-time, On-site


Department:   Technology


Reports To:    General Manager of Digital Video


Job Description


Develop interactive web sites utilizing a strong fundamental knowledge of writing semantic, modular back end code using JavaScript, Python, and other data oriented programming languages or APIs.  Must understand and demonstrate the concepts of progressive enhancement, data analytics and future friendly code.   Must be familiar with application testing and debugging, have ample experience navigating MVC frameworks such as Angular, Django, Node, etc. Must have an understanding of data intensive applications, APIs, and utilize progressive iteration strategy as the fundamental work flow approach. A good understanding of responsive design/development.   Ability to work with front-end languages such as HTML (including HTML5), CSS3 are a major bonus. 


Required:


- Mastery of JavaScript, Python, and/or Javacscript with proven hands on experience


- Deep understanding and data intensive applications and their associated languages


- Experience with Node, Angular, Django, Ember, Backbone


- Expertise across multiple modern build systems with expertise spanning several systems of relevance


Experience defining technical project requirements


Experience designing/architecting complex, cross-functional solutions


- Skilled at bringing engaging user analytics to life using CSS transitions/animations, WebGL, Canvas, and JavaScript-driven animation


- Strong familiarity with CSS preprocessors (Sass, Less, Stylus, etc) and understands their benefits and limitations in producing efficient, maintainable code.


- Expert understanding of high-throughput back-end performance and creating data elements that make efficient use of resources for a large number of users


- Experience using Git


- Experience with back-end testing


Preferred:


- Experience defining, building and maintaining RESTful APIs (huge plus)


- Strong understanding of clean design and UX


- Familiarity with web analytic systems and concepts


Educational Requirements & Qualifications:


Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related degree, certification, or equivalent work experience. 


A minimum of 5-7 years of demonstrable experience with an active portfolio is required.  Advanced skill sets, and the ability to work independently with minimal oversight on complex technical project are a must.  The successful candidate will be well versed with standard terms and web protocols used in the domain. He/she must be able to design highly reliable back-end systems that span multiple technologies, and has used more than one web framework in a professional capacity and is well-versed with the idioms of those frameworks.


 Must have the ability to work well under pressure and thrive in a fast paced deadline driven environment.  Employee must be willing to increase skill set by utilizing employer paid training opportunities.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at SugarCRM (Cupertino, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Software Engineer to join the Intelligence Services team and revolutionize the CRM industry.  We are acquiring massive data points and applying cutting edge data science techniques to provide insights to our customers that will help facilitate a paradigm shift in how they interact with their CRM system.  You must be an exceptional developer with an entrepreneurial spirit and a get it done attitude to be successful in this role. There will many exciting and interesting challenges along the way including: exploring new technologies, tools, and knowledge in order to keep up with our ambition.  Communication and team work are a must. Let’s redefine CRM together.  


Responsibilities:



  • Architect and develop systems and services to acquire external data including email, calendar, contacts and CRM

  • Create services to analyze the volumes of acquired data by applying data science techniques and algorithms

  • Build architectures from ground up without losing sight of the details

  • Challenge, mentor, and learn from your peers
